description: Bus service between midtown and the three major metropoli tan area airports was sharply reduced yesterday as drivers for Carey Transportation Com pany stopped work to protest new winter schedules that laid off 42 out of a total of 245 drivers.

title: OffYear Election Draws High Interest in Jersey.
description: TRENTON, Nov. 1Political control of the State Legisla ture and the fate of the scandal ridden Hudson County Demo cratic organization will be de cided tomorrow in one of the most important offyear elec tions in recent state history.

title: Subversion in South Africa
description: The Very Rev. Gonville ffrenchBeytagh, Anglican Dean of Johannesburg, is a subversive in the eyes South Africa's racist Government because he says: believe the doctrine of apartheid is abhorrent to Chris tianity. He is a revolutionary in the sense that, although he rejects violence, he has come to believe violence is almost inevitable under South Africa's draconic system of repression for the country's non white majority.

title: Unified Lincoln Center Drive Brings $1.2Million
description: A total of $1,244,757 was raised from corporations for the arts at Lincoln Center in a 197071 drive that for the first time was carried out as a unified campaign rather than in separate efforts by the constituents.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y.Although I wholeheartedly agree with Dr. Albert SzentGyorgyi that science and govern ment should not be separated, I don't think that the deep crisis that afflicts both the East and the West will be solved by increasing the number of scientists in government.

title: Consumers' Buying Plans Posted Advance in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (Reu ters)Consumers reported ris ing purchasing expectations for new cars and household durable goods in October after expectations declined in July, the Commerce Department re ported today.

title: PRICE SPECIALs' FOUND ON DECLINE
description: Some of the savings that consumers might be realizing because of the President's price freeze are being offset to a certain extent by a decline in supermarket specials, a survey by The New York Times indicates.

title: U.S. Strength in Vietnam Is Lowest in Six Years
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 1 (AP)American troop strength in South Vietnam dropped below 200,000 to day for the first time in near ly six years.

title: Editorializing Brooklyn Florist Has His Problems
description: Life is not all bouquets in the flowershop business, an outspoken florist on a quaint old street In Brooklyn Heights has discovered.

title: BURNS ASKS LIMIT ON DIVIDEND RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 A key Government official said today that dividend increases during Phase Two of the eco nomic stabilization program should be equitably' related to Wage risee.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Col. Herbert Denied Leave To Appear on Cavett Show
description: Lieut. Col. Anthony Herbert of Fort McPherson, Ga., has been denied leave to appear on the Dick Cavett television show here tonight on Chan nel 7.

title: District Judge Bars Delay In Aleutian Nuclear Blast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1A Federal District Court judge refused today to halt the un derground nuclear explosion scheduled for this week on the island of Amchitka in the Aleutian chain.

title: New Directions in Foreign Aid
description: It is evident from reports emanating from yesterday's closeddoor meeting of the Foreign Relations Committee that members are having second thoughts on the Senate's rash vote to kill the foreign aid authorization bill. But it is equally apparent that there is nothing approaching agreement on the new directions foreign aid must take in order to muster adequate support in the Congress.

title: Alaskans Accept Cannikin But They Still Don't Like It
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 1  The Atomic Energy Commission's determination to go forward with the Cannikin bomb test at Amchitka Island later this week dismays Alaskans, even though many of them accept the de cision uncritically.

title: BUSINESS BUYING CALLED TOO SLOW
description: Businessmen are not buying enough materials to stimulate the economy, and this has be come a point of concern to some economists, who continue nonetheless to predict higher corporate profits for the fourth quarter.

title: Man In the News
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 1When a LatinAmer ican country was in danger of losing its vote some years ago for failing to pay its United Nations dues, Controller Bruce Robert Turner pulled a nickel from his pocket and saved the day.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION IS UP 0.8% IN WEEK
description: Production of steel for the week ended Oct. 30 rose by 0.8 per cent to 1,902,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yester day. This compared with 1,886, 000 tons in the preceding week.

title: POLICE STUDYING ROBBERY THEORY
description: The police are looking into the possibility that wealthy operagoers are being followed to their homes and hotels from Lincoln Center by thieves and gunmen anxious to relieve them of money and val uables.

title: Hijacker Searches Lead To 1,500 Other Arrests
description: An airport passenger screen ing system designed identify potential hijackers has resulted in the arrest of about 1,500 air travelers during the last year, most of them on charges unrelated to hijacking, Federal officials said yesterday.

title: Wings Bow to Leafs, 6 to 1, In Wilson's Debut as Coach
TV: A Night C.B.S. Knew It Would Lose
description: The mercurial nature of audience ratings was illus trated yesterday in the week ly Nielsen report that reflect ed the consequences of the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem's decision to devote an evening to public affairs.

title: Amex and Counter Prices Register Sharp Declines
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market went mostly in one direction yesterdaydown.

title: HelpWanted Ad Index Down for September
description: The index of helpwanted advertising dropped to 80 per cent of its 1967 average in September, 5 points below the levels of August, 1971, and September, 1970, the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: Education Group Favors. Extending School Board
description: The Public Education Asso ciation urged yesterday that the Legislature extend the term of the present interim Board of Education, now scheduled to go out of office on June 30, to allow more time to reach a final decision on how the city's school system should be governed.

title: India Takes Counteraction
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 1A De fense Ministry spokesman said today that Indian border forces had taken counteraction against Pakistani forces for the first time in their border con frontations.

title: Facsimile Mail Service Offers 4Hour Delivery
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)A facsimile system to provide fourhour mail serv ice between Washington and New York City was put into operation today. It electron ically transmits copies of letters, charts, grafts, blue prints and other printed matter.

title: PACKERS BATTLE LIONS TO 1414 TIE IN MUD AND RAIN
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 1 (UPI) The Green Bay Packers and De troit Lions, taking advantage of each others mistakes and play ing on a muddy field during a steady rain, battled to a 1414 tie tonight in a National Foot ball Conference Central Division game.

title: Smith, Gorman and Nastase Are Upset in Swedish Tennis
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 1 (UPI) Stan Smith, the United States Open champion, continued to have difficulty on European courts this autumn as he was upset by Sweden's Leif Johans son, 76, 75, in the third round of the $45,000 Stockholm open tennis tournament today. Tom Gorman of Seattle also was stopped, 16, 76, 75, by Pekka Sacilae of Finland.

title: Greece to Offer Baby Bonus
description: ATHENS, Nov. 1 (AP)Dep uty Premier Stylianos Patakos announced today that the Greek Government would soon start paying a bonus to any Greek family that produced more than two children. Greece's popula tion this year, is estimated at 8,736,000. In 1961, the count was 8,389,000.

title: City Hall Notes
description: A political leader not only brings rewards into his com munity, but tries to keep prob lems out. To some residents of some communities, new middle income, highrise housing means problems. City officials say that the most common objections are that these dwellings create con gestion, overtax local facilities and bring in blacks. Responding to the opposition of com munity organiza tions, Mayor Lind say's political op erative in Riverdale has opposed construction of an 18story mid dleincome housing project pro posed by the Association for MiddleIncome Housing. More over, he is in a position to do something about it.

title: 30 Picket to Protest H.D.A. Aide's Ouster
description: A group of 30 representa tives of an organization known as Fight Back staged a onehour demonstration yes terday outside the offices of the city's Housing and Devel opment Administration at 100 Gold Street to protest the dismissal of an H.D.A. em ploye and to demand more construction jobs for minor ity workers.

title: House Acts to Alter Farm Credit Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP) The House voted 13119 to night to revamp the nation's farm credit system.

title: POLICE IN JERSEY STUDY FIRE BOMBS
description: HOBOKEN, N. J.; Nov. 1  The police were searching to night for clues and motives in a rash of incendiary actions against the five chainoperated supermarkets here.

title: One Patient's Miracle Drug Sometimes Proves Another's Poison
description: SEATTLE  Thousands of Americans, Europeans and oth ers around the world are dis covering that one man's mir acle drug can be another man's posion.

title: GEORGE B. PALMER
description: ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 1 George B. Palmer, a former ex ecutive of the Mobil Oil Corpo ration, died of cancer yesterday at Orange Memorial Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 291 Elmwynd Drive.

title: ExTreasury Head Warns Japan on Trade
description: TOKYO, Nov. 1Robert An derson, who was Secretary of the Treasury in President Eisen hower's Administration, has warned Premier Eisaku Sato that Japan has more to lose than the United States in a pro tectionist trade war and there fore should accede to a pack age of economic demands from President Nixon.

title: FIXED PARITIES SEEN AS GROUP OF 10'S AIM
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Nov. 1 (Reuters)The members of the Group of 10, without ex ception, are aiming for restor ing fixed monetary parities with broader margins of fluctuation of up to 3 per cent, Karl Klasen, the president of the West Ger man Bundesbank, said today.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell sharply in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Bayrock Elects President
description: Robert Gallagher has been elected president of Bayrock Advisors, Inc., a subsidiary of Bache & Co., Inc.

title: Deaths Revenged, Cahill Says
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 1 (UPI) Joe Cahill, the leader of the I.R.A. Northern Ireland, said to night that he wanted to thank God that the deaths of two Catholic women had been avenged by fighting men.

title: AIDE OF MRS. ONASSIS DENIES BRIDAL PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI) A spokesman for Mrs. Jac queline Kennedy Onassis today described as ridiculous report that a marriage contract exists between her and Aristotle Onassis, the Greek shipping magnate, that specifies sep arate bedrooms and an outlay of $600,000 a year for her travel, pleasure, safety and children.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: I just couldn't live with the pressure of the fans boo ing, said Doug Barkley yes terday, the morning after he had suddenly quit as coach of the Detroit Red Wings. Barkley became the fourth coach to lose his job in the first three weeks of National Hockey League play. Barkley knows what pres sure is. He was one of the league's top de fensemen for four years before los ing an eye in 1966. Barkley, who took over at the end of last season, was on a one year, $35,000 contract that will now be fulfilled in some capacity, according to the Wings.

title: TWO POLICEMEN SLAIN IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 1Two plainclothes po licemen were killed by ma chinegun fire at a suburban shopping center today in a new wave of violence by the Irish Republican Army.

title: Comment by Burns Aids Advance of Bond Prices
description: Bond prices, gaining strength from news that Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Re serve Board, would like to see interest rates lowera good deal lower, advanced yester day, and the credit markets appeared to shake off the inde cision that characterized last week's trading.

title: Nader Unit Sues C.A.B. On Role in Airline Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The association of international air lines that sets faresalready beset by internal disputes about transAtlantic discounts and by the competition of cheap char ter flightswas challenged, anew by a law suit here today.

title: HANOI STILL INSISTS ON OUSTER OF THIEU
description: PARIS, Nov. 1 (AP)North Vietnam made it clear today that the removal of President Nguyen Van Thieu was still an essential part of the seven point Communist peace plan.

title: Bridge:Precision Team Captures Laurels in L. I. Regionals
description: Roosevelt Raceway ap pears to be a track for favorities, judging by the knockout team championship played there during the weekend in the Long Island regionals. The tournament committee had naturally given the top seeding at the start of the event to a quintet of national cham pions, and the Precision team, including Steve Alt man, Gene Neiger, Joel Stuart, Peter Weichsel, all of New York, and Tom Smith of Greenwich, justified this ranking.

title: Lower Minimum Age for Congress Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1Two Democratic members of Con gress proposed today that the age at which young people be come eligible for the Senate and House be lowered by three years, to parallel the drop in the voting age from 21 to 18.

title: To Honor U.S. Women Susan B. Anthony $2 Bill?
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The face of Susan B. Anthony on a $2 bill? It may yet happen.

title: McCracken Says Productivity Will Increase Sharply in 1972
description: DETROIT, Nov. 1  Paul W. McCracken, chairman of the President's Council of Econom ic Advisers, today predicted strong gains in the nation's productivity rate in the next year, perhaps 4 per cent.

title: Treigle Preaches Again in City Opera's Susannah
description: The New York City Opera hit the sawdust trail again Sunday night, with a revival of Carlisle Floyd's Susan nah, and there on the pulpit was Norman Treigle in the role of the Rev. Olin Mitch, as expert as ever at thumping a Bible or seducing a hill billy girl with a quick aria. Mr. Treigle portrayed the circuitriding preacher in the first New York City Opera performance 15 years ago, and many times subsequently.

title: Orioles Win in Japan, 20
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 1 (AP)Consecutive homers by Brooks Robinson and Dave Johnson in the fifth inning to day gave the Baltimore Orioles a 20 victory over a combined Japanese team of the Tokyo Yomiuri Giants and the Osaka Nankai Hawks.

title: CITY HEALTH UNIT LISTS VIOLATIONS
description: The names of 15 restaurants, delicatessens and grocery stores, where city health inspec tors have found serious viola tions of the Health Code, have been released by Health Serv ices Administrator Gordon Chase.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Tourism Campaign Praised
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 1 (UPI)Manuel A. Casiano, tourism director, said today that Puerto Rico's $1million publicity campaign, which will end next January, had been very successful and had un doubtedly prevented the clo sure of more luxury hotels on the island. Mr. Casiano said he did not know how much the commonwealth would spend next year, but he indicated that he would ask for a substantial increase in the appropriation.

title: INVESTMENTS IN U.S. BY FOREIGNERS UP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP) Foreign direct investments in this country increased a record $1.4billion in 1970 to a total of $13.2billion at the end of 1970, the Commerce De partment reported today.

title: Two Views of the Role of Science
description: LONDON  Identification of men with separate, competing and often warring groups (which we now call nations) is not the result of evil de sires and foolish policies of certain individuals or classesof power hungry kings, bloodthirsty militarists, selfish capitalists or fanatical followers of extremist creeds. It has been, rather, the result of evolutionary selection which proved advantageous for the human animals to hunt in packs, and to collect food in organized groups. Evolution thus selected, for preferential survival and propagation, societies able to secure the most effective co operation of its members in this type of collective activitiesincluding will ingness to die (and readiness to kill) on their behalf.

title: Socialite Falls to Her Death
description: Mrs. Barbara Shedd Wayland, 77 years old, jumped or fell to her death yesterday from her apartment on the seventh floor of 115 East 67th Street. Mrs. Wayland and her husband, Thomas C. Wayland, who died about two months ago, were listed in the 1970 New York Social Register.

title: West Virginia Mayor Quits Race, Citing Threats to Son
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 1 (AP)  Mayor William Bry ant of Sumtnersville announced today that he was withdrawing his name from possible consid eration for the 1972 Democrat ic gubernatorial nomination.

title: NIXON BACKERS FORM NEW HAMPSHIRE UNIT
description: CONCORD, N.H., Nov. 1 Formation of the New Hamp shire Committee for the Re election of the President was announced today.

title: EARNINGS AT INCO SLUMP IN QUARTER
description: TORONTO, Nov. 1Plunging sales and rising costs sliced profits of the International Company of Canada, Ltd., by almost 60 per cent during the summer and by almost 50 per cent during the first nine months of 1971.

title: Washington: For the Record Nov. 1, 1971
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: U.S. Delegate Is Hopeful of U.N. Pledge
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. lThe United States dele gate told the United Nations Development Program today that despite the Senate's rejec tion of the foreign aid bill, the delegation still hoped to get $100million from Congress for development work next year, compared with $86million this year.

title: Advertising:
description: Since he is the author of the book Creative Think ing, it would seem only natural that if he were looking for a job Charles S. Whiting would think creatively.

title: RorerAmchem Elects
description: RorerAmchem, Inc., an nounced yesterday that John W. Eckman, president, has been named to succeed Gerald F. Rorer as chief executive officer. Mr. Rorer will remain as chair man of the board.

title: New Hockey League Bars Reserve Clause
description: In a meeting charged with optimism, the fledgling World Hockey Association yesterday named 10 franchises that will begin play next year, and an nounced that the colorful W.H.A. puck will be dropped for the first time on Oct. 14 at Miami.

title: MURPHY SUSPENDS KNAPP WITNESSES
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy suspended two po licemen yesterday who had testified before the Knapp Com mission about their personal involvement in what they said were widespread systems of corruption within the Police Department.

title: Election Day
description: In this offyear election, when no national or statewide offices are at stake in New York City, it is nevertheless imperative in the interest of the quality of local govern ment that citizens exercise their right to vote. We recapitulate below our recommendations on issues and candidates in the metropolitan area. An asterisk indi cates in incumbent.

title: Commercial Solvents Elects
description: The Commercial Solvents announced yesterday that David P. Reynolds, executive vice president and general man ager of Reynolds Metals Com pany, has been elected a direc tor of the company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ukrainian Bishops Defy Vatican, Hold Synod
description: ROME, Nov. 1Josyf Cardi nal Slipyj, the exiled head of the Ukrainian Catholic Church, formally announced tonight that he and 15 bishops have convened here as a synod.

title: NudeSwimming Issue Leads to 3d Political Party in Woodstock
description: WOODSTOCK, N. Y., Nov. 1 A third party, amorphous in structure and vaguely uni fied in ideology by what one of its leaders called a com mitment to the movement, you know the greening of America, is making a race for Town Council seats in this Ulster County commu nity of 5,500.

title: GEORGE W. POLLEY
description: George W. Polley, vice presi dent and director of Roosevelt & Son, investment bankers, died Sunday at his home in Bay Shore, L. I., apparently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: BRAZIL GIVES AID TO WORKING POOR
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 1 There are holes in Brazil's cur rent economic boom  vast, blank areas where millions of people live on the edge of sub sistenceand the military Gov ernment has undertaken to fill them in its own conservative way.

title: 6 Caribbean States Publish Proposal to Unite by 1973
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, Nov. 1 (Reuters)New moves toward unity in the Caribbean got under way today with the publication by six Common wealth countries of a declara tion to band together in a new state by early 1973.

title: The Corrupted Society
description: Investigations and public hearings about the waywardness of policemen have taken place in the city often before. In fact they may, like sun spots, be said to be cyclical. They are, however, about as worthwhile as a hurricane, even though on occasion a few cops may wind up in jail because of them.

title: Albanian Party Congress On
description: VIENNA, Nov. 1 (AP)Enver Hoxha, leader of the Albanian Communist party, opened the party's 16th congress in Tirana today, the official Albanian press agency, A.T.A., reported.

title: Senate Sends Alaska Native Land Bill to Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Senate adopted today a bill to settle the land claims of Alaska's Eskimos, Indians and Aleuts but left a final resolution of the problem to a conference com mittee.

title: The Talk of Peekskill
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y.There is a story they tell along the riverfront here that, in the days more than a century ago when the docks were busy and the foundries were going full blast, a mysterious man would appear every morning to collect groups of willing workers. He would put bags over their heads, load them into a wagon and, following a cir cuitous route to throw off their sense of direction, take them up into the hills to mine silver. Eventually the man disappeared as mysteriously as he had come and over the years many have searched for that silver mine in the rocky foothills of the Hudson Highlands on which Peekskill is built.

title: Contributions to the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 1Following, as supplied by the United. Nations, is a table showing the total payments by each country to the United Nations for 1970, the latest year for which figures are available:

title: CASEY IS AGAINST RESEARCH CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 William J. Casey, the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, came out in flat opposition today to the idea of forcing brokers to charge their customers separately for secu rities research and to charge only those who actually use the research.

title: REV. CLARENCE WAGNER
description: WATERFORD, Conn., Nov. 1 The Rev. Clarence R. Wagner, retired priestincharge of St. John's Church in Niantic and former priestincharge of Bishop Seabury Church in Groton, died yesterday in his home. His age was 80.

title: Disputed Philadelphia Project: A Case Study in Housing for Poor
description: PHILADELPHIA'Knock on any door, Mrs. Mary Taylor shouted through a broken pane of Building H. They will tell you plenty about Fairmont Manor.

title: Advertising:
description: Mother Goose and many of her friends slipped into the marketplace last week when Bernard D. Kahn presented his Grim Fairy Tale at the annual meeting of the Asso ciation of National Adver tisers in Hot Springs, Va.

title: Israeli Congratulations Are Declined by Peking
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 1 (UPI) The Government of China refused to accept a cablegram from Israel's Foreign Minister, Abba Eban, congratulating it on its admission to the United Nations, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said today.

title: ADOLPH BANGSER
description: Adolph Bangser, a lawyer for 1965 to Katz, Robinson, Brog & Seymour, a law firm at 10 East 40th Street, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He lived at 345 East 56th Street and was 86 years old.

title: Recent Quakes Linked to Earth Wobbles
description: Since July 14 ten severe earthquakes have shaken the Solomon Islands. The sequence of quakes, the last of them on Oct. 25, has given new weight to a theory linking total quake activity to wobbles in the earth's spin.

title: FRANK S. SHAPIRO
description: BOSTON, Nov. 1Frank S. Shapiro, retired treasurer of the Consolidated National Shoe Corporation, Norwood, Mass., died today in Brookline (Mass.) Hospital. His age was 82.

title: DR. KARL HOHNER, 78, OF HARMONICA FIRM
description: Dr. Karl Hohner, senior di rector, a position equivalent to president, of H. Hohner, Inc., the German manufacturer of harmonicas and other musical instruments, died yesterday in Trossingen, Germany. His age was 78.

title: London Ground Crews Battle Airport Police
description: LONDON, Nov. 1 (AP)  More than 12,000 travelers were stranded at Heathrow Airport here today when ground crews staged a sud den walkout that virtually crippled the airport, battling with policemen, tossing bag gage into the air and storm ing an office.

title: 2 ON WELFARE SUING TO GET METHADONE
description: Two welfare clients who are heroin addicts filed suit in Federal Court in Brooklyn yes terday to compel the state's Medicaid program to pay for their methadone treatment by private physicians.

title: Penn Central Loss In September Cut From a Year Ago
description: The Penn Central Trans portation Company's trus tees reported yesterday that the railroad's net loss for September was $16,376,446 and amounted to $195,537, 607 in the first nine months this year.

title: Botany Industries Shows a Big Loss
description: Botany Industries, Inc., manu facturer and retailer of mens wear, ended its fiscal year on July 31 with a net loss of $23,531,000, one of the worst years in its history. In the previous fiscal year the loss was $2,733,000.

title: Stock Markets Open Today
description: Banks are closed today, Elec tion Day, but the New York Stock Exchange, the Amercan Exchange and other stock trading markets will be open. There will be no trading in Government bonds or in for eign exchange. While the Chi cako Board of Trade will be open, the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, the New York Cocoa. Exchange and the New York Cotton Exchange will be closed.

title: 3Deck Hawthorne Interchange Opened to Traffic
description: One of the metropolitan area's most congestionprone crossroads became a three decked interchange yesterday as Workmen completed the transformation of Hawthorne Circle.

title: GEORGE F. BAKER
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. George F. Baker, a formex member of the Better Homes and Gardens advertising staff, died here yesterday at his home, apparently of a heart attack. He was 59 years old.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of grain and soybean futures declined sharply on the Chicago Board of Trade yester day owing to a general liquida tion of contracts, mainly by brokerage houses.

title: OHIO STUDENT KILLED IN 2COLLEGE BATTLE
description: WILBERFORCE, Ohio, Nov. 1 (UPI)A student was shot to death and several others were injured early today when a fight broke out between stu dents of Wilberforce and Cen tral State Universities. Both in stitutions are predominantly black.

title: 71 Opera Festival in Wexford Is Highlighted by Early Mozart
description: WEXFORD, Ireland, Nov. 1 On the last night of the opera festival at Wexford the audi ence links arms and sings Auld Lang Syne. It is that sort of affair.

title: U.S. Expresses Regret To Chiang on U.N. Vote
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 1 The United States Ambassa dor, Walter P. McConaughy, called on President Chiang Kaishek on Friday to ex press the sincere and deep regret of the United States over Nationalist China's loss of it seat M the United Na tions and to pledge that the American defense commit ment and other ties to Tai wan were in no way affect ed by recent developments, it was announced today.

title: Trainmen Threaten Strike Against L.I.R. on Dec. 15
description: The United Transportation Union threatened yesterday to strike the Long Island Railroad on Dec. 15 if it did not have a new contract with the railroad by that day.

title: ISRAELIS PRESS U.S. FOR MORE PLANES
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 1Israel told the United States today that unless a continuing supply of Phantom warplanes was re sumed, she would not accept the American proposal for indi rect negotiations with Egypt toward an interim settlement.

title: Notes on People
description: Richard Zanuck sued his father, Darryl F. Zanuck, and other officers of 20th Cen turyFox for having dismised him last December from his post as the movie company's president.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Baird Puppets Give Wizard of Oz
description: The Bil Baird Theater on Barrow Street is one of the coziest, most comfortable little theaters in New York. The stage is raised so that viewing is easy no matter how small the child or how distant the seat. Mostly, Bil Baird presents new versions of children's classicsWin nie the Pooh, Peter and the Wolf (opening next month) and, beginning this past weekend, a return engage ment of The Wizard of Oz.

title: Radio: WBAI Assessing TV and Communications
description: The program is about tele vision, contending that the communications media, iron ically, have failed to commu nicate. Not so ironically it is available only on radio, specifically on the more ad venturous dialslot occupied by WBAIFM. The first in stallment was presented last night at 8 o'clock and will be repeated this afternoon at 2:30.

title: A Geisha Tells of Her Celebrated but FastDying Art
description: NIIGATA, Japan, Oct. 1 I was a bit sad when my daughter told me she wasn't going to become a geisha, Takakosan said. But in my heart I knew I didn't want her to follow in my foot steps.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Bristol  Myers Company announced yes terday that Richard L. Gelb, who has been president since 1967, was elected to the addi tional post of chief ex ecutive officer. Gavin K. MacBain, chairman, said This move is in recog nition of the outstand ing job Mr. Gelb has been doing as operating head of the company. Mr. Gelb, 47 years old, is a graduate of Yale University and the Har yard Business School. He joined Clairol in 1950, becoming its presi dent in 1959. In late 1960, he was made a director of BristolMyers and in 1962 elected a member of the executive committee. He became executive vice president in charge of operations in 1965. Mr. MacBain, presently chief executive offi car, will relinquish these duties effective Jan. 1, 1972.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Blake Deplores Verdict
description: GENEVA, Nov. 1The Rev. Dr. Eugene Carson Blake, gen eral secetary of the World Council of Churches, said to day that the sentencing of Dean f frenchBeytagh to five years years' imprisonment was a deep shock to Christians everywhere.

title: Stocks Hit Low for Year As Dow Tumbles 13.14
description: Stock prices broke sharply yesterday to wipe out the last vestiges of the faltering market advance of 1971.

title: NaderBacked Group Says Colt Deceived U.S. in Testing M16's
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 1A Con necticut organization affiliated with Ralph Nader, the con sumer advocate, charged today that Colt Industries Firearms Group here had deliberately circumvented Federal quality control requirements in the production of the M16 rifle.

title: U.S Waives Its Visa Rules to Facilitate Arrrival of Chinese Delegates to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 1The United States an nounced today that it had waived the visa requirements for the United Nations delegates from mainland China to facili tate their arrival in New York.

title: STATE BOND PLAN THE MAJOR ISSUE FOR VOTERS TODAY
description: The state's voters decide to day the fate of the $2.5billion transportation bond issue, the most controversial proposition to be on the ballot in recent years.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The guys are all excited, said Emlen Tunnell as he followed the Giants onto the Yankee Stadium turf on Sunday just before the game with the Minnesota Vikings. He tossed his observation in the direction of his boss, Alex Webster, the head coach.

title: 3 Women on Times Staff Among 5 to Get Awards
description: The Newspaper Women's Club of New York announced yesterday the selection of five metropolitanarea newswomen, including three staff members of The New York Times, as recipients of the club's 1971 Front Page Awards for excel lence in journalism.

title: Policy Against Park Fence, s Yields to Community Needs
description: In its efforts to open up the parks to the people, a major concern of the Lindsay administration was to remove fences.

title: Midonick Is Elected Surrogate In Manhattan, Beating Aarons
description: Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick, a Reform Demo crat running with Liberal party endorsement, yesterday defeat ed Surrogate Morris Aarons, a Republican backed by the Con servatives, for a full 14year term as Manhattan Surrogate.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: 6MONTH SUSPENSION SET FOR J. W. SPARKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission ordered today the suspension of the brokerdealer registration of J. W. Sparks & Co., New York, for six months beginning Nov. 8 on charges that the brokerage house had failed to make and keep accu rate records.

title: Heath Pledge on Europe Opens New Parliament
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (Reuters) Prime Minister Heath prom Led today that Britain from now on would be able to take a growing role in shaping the future of Europe.

title: 22 CUBANS LOSE BID TO STAY IN U.S.
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 2A Federal immigration official ruled today that the 22 Cubans Who landed here last week to attend an international sugar conference were excludable and deportable from the United States because they did not have visas.

title: DEMOCRATIC GAINS POSTED IN JERSEY
description: Democrats swept close to control of the New Jersey As sembly yesterday, with un counted paper and absentee ballots  and the unexpected election of a white militant in dependent in Newark  cloud ing the outcome early this morning.

title: Declines Again Top Gains On the Amex and Counter
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthecoun ter market gave it a good try yesterday but could not quite make it as declines again out numbered advances in both markets.

title: Topol, Film Tevye, Looks Back at Role
description: The world has become, in the seven years since Fid dler on the Roof first ap peared, richly populated with Tevyes, So far there have been Tevyes in at least 17 languages.

title: Election Day Sales, Like October's, Are Affected
description: Merchants' heavy, promo tional blasts on Election Day turned stores in the city and suburbs into major public meeting places yesterday.

title: Maine Bars Repeal Of State Income Tax
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 2 (AP)Maine voters refused today to repeal their two yearold state income tax.

title: 2d, David Rabe Play to Join Pavlo Hummel at Public Theater
description: When David Rabe's Sticks and Bones opens Sunday in the Anspacher Theatre at Joseph Papp's Public Theater, it will be the first time that Mr. Papp's house has con tained two plays by the same author. Mr. Rabe's first play, The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel, is still running strong in the Public's New man Theater.

title: CityState Talks on Fare Are Expected
description: The defeat of the $2.5billion transportation bond issue yes terday marks the beginning of a new round of citystate ne gotiations to determine, by Jan. 1, what fare increases, if any, will be put into effect.

title: China Names U.N. Delegates Due Soon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 2Peking today named Chiao Kuanhua, a longtime confidant of Premier Chou En lai and a Deputy Foreign Min ister, to head a nineman dele gation to the current General Assembly of the United Nations.

title: Filipino Gunman Is Captured After a Holdup in Manila
description: MANILA, Nov. 2  A gun man who held a 14yearold American girl hostage for al most 10 hours yesterday while he arranged his escape from the police was reported cap tured this afternoon in Botolan, Zambales Province, not far from United States' Subic naval base.

title: Pay Restored to 2 Patrolmen Who Spoke at Knapp, Hearings
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, modifying a deci sion he announced Monday, said yesterday that he was con tinuing the salaries of the two suspended patrolmen who testl fied before the Knapp commis. sion about their personal involvement in corruption.

title: U.S.Triumphs in Jump at Horse Show
description: The United States Equestrian Team, which dominated the National Horse Show by taking six championships in a row until dethroned by West Ger many last year, came roaring back last night to show that it still was a power in equine circles as the National opened an eightday run at Madison Square Garden.

title: Miss Goolagong Victor
description: ABERAVON, Wales, Nov. 2 (UPI) Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champion, moved to the third round of the third Dewar Cup indoor tennis tour nament today by beating Cor rine Molesworth of England, 63, 62.

title: SEA SAGA UPSETS 45 HOBEAU ENTRY IN 1MILE RACE
description: An Election Day crowd of 34,333 put its money where its mouth was yesterday at Aque duct, and the parimutuel vot ing turned out to be generally productive.

title: TAX AID FOR EXPORTS FAILS IN SENATE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  The Senate Finance Comtnittee rejected today the Nixon Ad ministration's plan to provide a tax incentive for increased exports. The action left open the possibility that the com mittee might approve a less costly version that has been passed by the House.

title: ROGER GUERILLOT
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 2 (Reuters) Roger Guerillot, the Central African Republic's Ambassador in Washington, died Sunday of a heart attack while vacationing here. He was 67 years old. Mr. Guerillot had come here to see his children after spending a vacation in France.

title: Republicans Win in All Major Contests in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Wednesday, Nov. 3Republicans continued to demonstrate their control of Nassau County by winning al most all the contests in yester day's elections.

title: Amchitka Test Delayed as Scientific Critics Insist Its Planned Weapons System Is Flawed
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 2The Atomic Energy Commission an nounced today that it could not hold its Cannikin nuclear test on Amchitka Island before Saturday because of delays in filling the 6,000foot hole in which the bomb is buried.

title: Port Agency to Award Contract Setting Job Goals for Minorities
description: The Port of New York Au thority said yesterday that it would award a contract for work at Newark Airport next week that would, for the first time, set specific goals for em ployment of members of minor ity groups on construction jobs.

title: SENATE APPROVES BILL TO CLEAN UP WATERWAYS BY '85
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Senate approved today, 86 to 0, a strict, farreaching water pol lution control bill designed to stop all pollution of the water ways by 1985.

title: Advertising:
description: The 64yearold C.I.T. Fi nancial Corporation tomor row embarks on its first cor porate advertising program.

title: Astronauts to Tour Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) The Apollo 15 astronauts VII make a twoweek goodwill tour of Europe, the State Department said today. Col. David R. Scott, Maj. Alfred M. Worden and Lieut. Col. James B. Irwin will make the trip at the request of President Nixon. The depart ment said the tour is to share United States knowledge in space W'th other nations and to promote peaceful cooperation in space exploration. The astro nauts will visit London Nov. 7, Stockholm Nov. 10, Munich Nov. 11, Milan Nov. 15 and Paris Nov. 18.

title: Absenteeism Reported High As Danbury School Reopens
description: DANBURY, Conn., Nov. 2 (UPI)Absenteeism was high and one arrest was made today at the reopened Danbury High School where classes were canceled yesterday after a fight in a hallway.

title: Market Place: Taking a Closer Look at Report
description: You've got to hand it to the University Computing Company. This Dallas con cern has found a way to show strong earnings gains on the bottom line each quar ter, although so far this year there has been no operating income.

title: An Old Pro Is Beaten in South Jersey
description: New Jersey Senator Frank S. (Hap) Farley of Atlantic Coun ty, defeated yesterday after 34 years in the legislature, was recognized as one of the state's ablest lawmakers and master politicians by friends and foes alike, and the numbers of both groups were legion.

title: FRENCH SOFTENING MONETARY STAND
description: PARIS, Nov. 2French offi cials are privately indicating some softening of their stand in the monetary crisis.

title: British Aide Sees Economy Expanding at a Faster Rate
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (Reuters) The Chancellor of the Ex chequer, Anthony Barber, said today that there were signs that the British economy was now expanding at the rate of at least 4 to 4 per centa rate twice as fast as the aver age for the last six years.

title: Keoigh Leads Manhattan To CrossCountry Title
description: Despite a muddy course and muggy 70degree weather, both the bane of longdistance run ners, Mike Keogh, a 20year old Manhattan College sopho more, put in a superb individ ual performance yesterday to win the 45th annual Metropoli tan Intercollegiate crosscoun try championship in 25 min utes 4.6 seconds.

title: Cazzie Scores 43
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 2 (UPI)  Cazzie Russell scored a career high 43 points tonight and powered the streaking Golden State Warriors to a 106.91 vic tory over the Baltimore Bullets. Russell, who came to the War riors in an off season swap with New York, connected on 20 of 33 shots

title: Jersey Joe Walcott Wins
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Nov. 2 (AP) Jersey Joe Walcott, a for mer world heavyweight boxing champion, was elected Camden County Sheriff today, defeating William Strang by about 8,000 of the 84,000 votes cast.

title: Dr. Raymond Bowman, 68, Dies; Directed Statistical Unit at U.N.
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 2 (AP) Dr. Raymond T. Bowman, di rector of the United Nations Asian Statistical Institute, died yesterday, officials of Presby terianUniversity Hospital said today. He was 68 years old.

title: Newsprint Price Rise Set
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 2 (Canad ian Press)International Paper Sales, Inc., told its Canadian customers today that its news print price would go up $8 a ton Nov. 15. This increase, orig inally announced to become ef fective Nov. 1, was temporarily deferred, the company said.

title: Peking's U.N. Backers Invited to the Opera;  1971 The Globe ?? Mall, Toronto
description: PEKING, Nov. 2  China will thank those nations that supported the seating of Pe king in the United Nations at a performance of a revolu ?? opera in the Great Hall of the People tomorrow night. The Acting Foreign Minister, Chi Pengfei, will be host, but Premier Chou En lai may attend

title: Young Voters Find Exercising Their LongSought Franchise Is an Anticlimax
description: Like, I was really looking forward to this day a few years ago, said the 19year old girl as she came out of the polling place on Barrow Street.

title: Rockland ReElects Meehan To District Attorney Post
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Nov. 2 District Attorney Robert R. Meehan of Suffern, a Demo crat, was reelected today, de feating Richard T. Monahan of West Nyack, a Republican, by a wide margin.

title: Kentucky Picks Governor in 4Way Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 2 Lieut. Gov. Wendell Ford, a Democrat, was elected Gover nor of Kentucky tonight fol lowing a campaign that he called a first, step In the dump Nixon movement.

title: Holography a LongTime Dream
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 2 Dr. Dennis Gabor, the 71 year old scientist who was awarded the Nobel Prize for Physics today came upon the idea of threedimensional imag ery that would bring him fame as he was waiting for a tennis court at Rugby, England, in 1947.

title: Alioto Is Reelected In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 2  Mayor Joseph L. Alioto swept aside two opponents and won an impressive victory tonight for a second fouryear term.

title: It's Wait Till Next Year On Plan for New Court
description: Despite the approval by the last two Legislatures of a plan to create a new appeals court for the state, the law makers kept the proposal off the ballot this year.

title: RANGERS FACING COAST PITFALLS
description: In an effort to overcome the time difference, California weather and soft ice, the Rangers will be doing things a bit differently when they open a threegame western swing to night at Los Angeles.

title: A Scandinavian Concern Is Sought by Booz, Allen
description: Booz, Allen & Hamilton, Inc., announced yesterday an agree ment to acquire the Scandinavi an consulting concern of T. BakJensen A/S, Copenhagen. T. BakJensen, founded 25 years ago, is engaged in mar keting and financial planning, production and inventory con trol and industrial engineering. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Slaying Spurs a Rise in Queens Housing Patrols
description: The city and Housing Au thority police increased their patrols in a moderateincome housing project in Far Rocka way, Queens, yesterday follow ing the death of an 80year old woman who was mugged near her building Monday morn ing and died that night.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISMany signs indicate that the political power and diplomatic policy of Premier Chou Enlai are on the rise in China and that the forthcoming visit of President Nikon is directly linked to this.

title: Australia Is Said to Plan to Aid In Training Cambodian Troops
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 Australia has agreed to provide instructors and facilities in South Vietnam for the training of several battalions of Cam bodian troops, informed sources said today.

title: PROFIT ADVANCES AT COLUMBIA GAS
description: The Columbia Gas System, Inc., reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net income for the nine months ended Sept. 30. Revenues were $681,832,000, against $606, 218,000 a year earlier. Net in come rose to $65,414,000, or $2.11 a share, from $64, 675,000, or $2.09 a share.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Jets Pick Up a Free Agent For Decimated Defense
description: Buddy Ryan, the Jets' de fensive line coach, looked at his 5foot6inch, 150pound visitor yesterday and asked, Are you here to play defen sive tackle?

title: Good News Bible Leads Paperbacks
description: Behold the fowls of the air may be more beautiful than, Look at the birds, fly ing around, but it appar ently lacks the ingredients of a best seller.

title: Englewood Picks Negro As Mayor in 3Way Race
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 2The Rev. Walter S. Tay lor, a 54yearold Methodist minister, was elected today as the first black Mayor of this city of 27,000.

title: REYNOLDS METALS SEEKS GREEK PLANT
description: ATHENS, Nov. 2 (Reuters) The Reynolds Metals Company submitted a proposal to the Greek Government for the establishment of a. $100million alumina plant in Greece, a spokesman for the Ministry; of National Economy said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Giants Dismiss Jansen
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. (UPI)Larry Jansen, San Fran cisco pitching coach since 1961, was released today by the Giants.

title: Handling Transport Bond Issue
description: If you're in the market for some slightly used TV commercials promoting the state transportation bond issue, today's the day to get your bid in.

title: Squires Win at the End
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 2 (AP)  The Virginia Squires scored a comeback victory over the Utah Stars tonight on a 20foot shot in the last 3 sec onds by Doug Moe, 122119.

title: Knicks' Reed to See Surgeon on Coast
description: Willis Reed will fly to Los Angeles later this week, but not necessarily to rejoin the Knicks. While the Knicks are in Los Angeles to meet the Lakers in the third game of their fourgame road trip, their captain arid chief hope for a playoff berth, will have his troublesome knee examined by Dr. Robert W. Kerlan.

title: Conservative Victories in Major Cities Reflect Continuing Racial Polarization
description: The continuing racial polari zation of many major American cities was reflected yesterday in the victories of conservative mayoral candidates in Cleve land and Philadelphiaa repe tition of the pattern set in 1967 and 1969.

title: School Bill in Jeopardy
description: If reason and logic were the guiding elements in Con gress, the Administration's bill to offer financial help for school desegregation should have gone through without difficulty. The purpose of the bill, which would make available $1.5 billion over a twoyear period, is to reduce problems that may arise in implementing desegregation. Entirely aside from the arguments over desegregation, the extra funds would be of great advantage to any district entitled to use them.

title: G.I. Smashes Way East
description: BAYREUTH, West Gemany, Nov. 2 (UPI)  An American soldier in a truck smashed through a border crossing bar rier into East Germany, an Army spokesman said today. He was identified as specialist 4 David Fields, 25 years old, of Madi son, Wis. Military policemen reported they believed he was drunk, the spokesman said.

title: U.N. Seeks to Cut Costs
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. (AP) To cut paper and labor costs, the United Nations has begun issuing reports addressed to both the General Assembly and the Security Council under the same heading. Such reports previously were issued under separate headings for each group.

title: New Haven Trains Delayed
description: A power failure in a genera tor stalled New Haven division trains between Cos Cob, Conn., and New Haven for up to 31 minutes during the evening rush hour yesterday, a spokes man for the Penn Central said. According to the spokesman, the failure occurred in the gen erator at Cos Cob beginning at 5:43 P.M. The problem, he said, was cleared up at 6:15 P.M.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon had to go no farther than his own fami ly to choose his special rep resentative for the inaugura tion of the President of Liberia. Secretary of State William P. Rogers gave the word:

title: BORLAUG CONDEMNS BANS ON PESTICIDES
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 2 (UPI) Dr. Norman E. Borlaug, a Nobel Prize winner, said today that he opposed legislation to ban the use of DDT, insecti cides, weed killers and chemi cal fertilizers.

title: Mayor White Handily Defeats Mrs. Hicks in Boston Election
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2  Mayor Kevin H. White, showing solid citywide support that cut across racial, ethnic and eco nomic lies, easily won a sec ond fouryear term in office tonight Mayor White, who lost his city's vote in a bid for the governorship a year ago, jumped to an early lead and was never seriously threatened by Representative Louise Day Hicks, his only opponent.

title: A Washington Group Helps in the Search for JobsBut Na Men Need Apply
description: WASHINGTON  Patty Cook, a '49 Smith College graduate and mother of five schoolage children, decided that the time was ripe for her to go back to work. But what could she work at with her liberal arts background?

title: Economic Analysis
description: What is to be the role of monetary policy in President Nixon's New Game Plan for stopping inflation and moving the economy back toward full employment? The one major omission in the President's New Economic Policy, which he has called the most comprehen sive economic program since the New Deal, has been a spelling out of the monetary policy he expects from the Federal Reserve Board. This omission may have been partly a matter of fencemend ing between the White House and the Federal Reserve. Only a few weeks before the Presi dent's switch of policy on Aug. 15, Chairman Arthur F. Burns had been in the White House doghouse because of his long and stubborn campaign for an incomes policy, which he finally won.

title: SATELLITES PUT UP AS PENTAGON LINK
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 2 (AP)Two communications satellites were thrust into earth orbit by an Air Force rocket tonight on a mission to link the Pentagon with America's farflung military installations.

title: DOLPHIN TRAINED TO FIGHT SHARKS
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 22Ex periments at a marine labora tory in Florida suggest that dolphins can be trained to at tack sharks that are threaten ing naval personnel engaged in salvage or rescue work at sea, according to the Office of Na val Research.

title: Canadian Reserves Rise
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2 (Canadian Press)  Canada's foreign exchange reserves exceeded $5billion for the first time at the end of October, the Finance Department reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JAPAN TV PARTS: DUMPING CHARGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) Treasury announced today it had opened a dumping investigation into imports from Japan of deflection yokes, com ponents used in television sets. Treasury said $1.25million worth of the yokes entered the country in the first half of this year.

title: PACERS CONQUER COUGARS, 137116
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 2 (AP)  The Indiana Pacers routed Carolina, 137116, in an Ameri can Basketball Association game tonight despite a 45point performance by a Cougar rookie, Jim McDaniels.

title: Mines Bureau Fills Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) The Interior Department an nounced today the appointment of John W. Crawford to direct Bureau of Mines Inspection ac tivities in coalmine health and safety. Mr. Crawford, 39 years old, was previously district man ager of the bureau's coal health and safety office in Norton, Va.

title: Danny Kaye Remembers
description: Danny Kaye, the entertain er, has this to say about the United Service Organizations:

title: Man Seized After Girl Finds Blade in Halloween Apple
description: A Queens man was arrested yesterday and charged with reckless endangerment after an 8yearold girl complained of finding a piece of broken razor blade in a trickortreat apple she got on Halloween.

title: A Scientist Saw What Others Suspected
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 2Gerhard Herzberg, the Canadian winner of the Nobel Prize for Chem istry, said today that he was very surprised and very hon ored and very happy at the award.

title: McGovern, in Visit to U.N., Hails Admission of Peking
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 2Senator George S. Mc Govern said here today that he had visited Secretary General Thant and had expressed satis faction with the widening of the membership as a result of Communist China's admission to the United Nations.

title: Klein Elected Suffolk Executive
description: BLUE POINT, L. I., Nov. 2 John V. N. Klein tonight was elected Suffolk's first Repub lican County Executive as Republicans swept most of the County Legislature and the major town offices.

title: U.S. Trust to Spur Purchases of Stocks
description: The United States Trust Com pany, one of the nation's largest trust institutions with close to $10billion in assets under its management, has decided to step up its purchases of com mon stocks in the current mar ket decline.

title: Bronx Grocer Shot to Death In Apartment by 2 Rbbers
description: A 33yearold grocer was shot and killed by two gunmen, who invaded his Bronx apart ment early yesterday and escaped with $700.

title: TAIWAN WITHDRAWS FUNDS FROM I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Nationalist Chinese Govern ment withdrew the entire $59.9million it had available on deposit at the International Monetary Fund before the vote expelling Taiwan from the United Nations, a Monetary Fund spokesman confirmed to night.

title: Priest Is Elected Mayor In an Upset in Plattsburgh
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., Nov. 2 The Rev. Roland St. Pierre, running as a RepublicanCon servative, decisively defeated the Democratic Mayor, Francis Steltzer, who was running for reelection in this traditionally Democratic city.

title: Jordan, a Reformer, Ends Jersey City Machine Rule
description: Dr. Paul Jordan, the reform candidate, was elected Mayor of Jersey City yesterday, breaking nearly half a century of political domination over City Hall by the scandal ridden, oldline Hudson Coun ty Democratic organization.

title: Stock Industry Is Warned To Cut Costs of Services
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  Three key members of Congress warned the securities industry today that if it did not take steps to make its services less costly to invest ors Congress would step in and do the job itself.

title: Rep. Koch Finds 27 Major Companies in Midtown Area Are Weighing a Move From City
description: Crime, inadequate mass transportation, the high cost of living and the high cost of do ing business are pushing some of the nation's leading com panies out of their headquar ters in Manhattan's prime mid town office district.

title: SENATE PX STUDY FINDS WIDE GUILT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  A Senate subcommittee, conclud ing a threeyear investigation of financial corruption in the military, filed a stern indict ment today of servicemen, Pen tagon administrators and big business.

title: 550 Students Can Vote But They're Not Counted
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Nov. 2 (UPI)An estimated total of 550 Pennsylvania State University students were per mitted to vote in a city elec tion here today by a state Supreme Court judge.

title: No Buyer for Condado Beach
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 2 (UPI)Puerto Rico's Tourist Development Company said to day it had not been able to find a buyer for the Condado Beach Hotel and will not open for the tourist season starting in December. The hotel is for sale for $5.7million.

title: Rockets Top Condors
description: DENVER, Nov. 2 (AP) Ralph Simpson scored a career high 42 points tonight as the Denver Rockets downed the Pittsburgh Condors, 133114.

title: Colonels Trounce Pros
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 2 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels, paced by the 39 points of Dan Issel, raced to a firstperiod lead and never trailed tonight in a 123 109 victory over the Memphis Pros.

title: G.O.P. VOTING JUDGE IS SLAIN IN KENTUCKY
description: MANCHESTER, Ky., Nov. 2 (AP)A Republican election judge was shot to death today in an altercation at the Goose Rock voting precinct south of here, and hours later murder warrants were Issued for two men.

title: G.O.P. Mayor Reelected in Indianapolis
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 2  Mayor Richard G. Lugar, archi tect of UNIGOV and a favored supporter of President Nixon on urban matters, swept to an easy victory tonight in his bid for a second term.

title: Addicts' Hospital In Lexington Sheds Its Image of Prison
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 2 (UPI)For 32 years, the United States Public Health Service ran a drugtreatment hospital here like a prison, with guards and iron bars. The fa cility had a recommitment rate of 90 per cent.

title: Feinstein, Hurok Aide, Named As Director of Kennedy Center
description: Martin Feinstein has been named to the new post of executive director of perform ing arts of the John F. Ken nedy Center in Washington.

title: STATE TRANSIT BOND ISSUE IS VOTED DOWN DESPITE ROCKEFELLERENLINDSAY CAMPAIGN
description: The $2.5billion transporta tion bond issue, was resound ingly rejected by the state vot ers yesterday.

title: 2 InSchool Concerts Set
description: The New York Philharmonic will play two identical hour long concerts at the High School of Music and Art on Nov. 5 in its first appearances in a school in the New York areas since 1958. Michael Til son Thomas will conduct and Evelyn Lear, soprano, will be soloist in a program including songs by Berg and excerpts of works by Handel, Mozart and Ruggles. The program will in itiate a new series of in school concerts funded by New York State Council on the Arts.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE WASTE LAND. By T. S. Eliot. A Facsimile of the Original Drafts Including the Anno tations of Ezra Pound. Edited and with an Introduction by Valerie Eliot. 149 pages. Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $22.50.

title: Nets Release Dove
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 2  The New York Nets re leased Sonny Dove today as the American Basketball Associa tion team cut its roster to 10 players.

title: Player Defeats Nicklaus
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Nov. (AP)Gary Player of South Africa defeated Jack Nicklaus of the United States, 7071, to day in an 18hole match. Nick laus lost an early lead on the second hole when his second shot hit a spectator on the head, deflecting the ball 25 yards into rough behind the green. The spectator was un injured, but Nicklaus took four strokes to complete the hole.

title: British Reserves Up in October To Highest Level Since the War
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (Reuters) Britain's official gold and cur rency reserves rose in October by $197million, to $5.21billion, the highest since World War II, it was announced here today.

title: Road to Civic Labor Peace
description: New Yorkers, weary of strike harassment by militant municipal unions, may soon get a badly needed arbitra tion shield against more such disruption of public serv ices. City Council leaders predict early passage of the bill proposed by Mayor Lindsay eighteen months ago for binding arbitration of municipal labor disputes not settled at the negotiating table.

title: Puerto Rican Leftist Disputes Badillo on Unity Conference
description: A Puerto Rican miltant, Gil berto Gerena Valentin, cham pion of local leftist causes since the days of the American La bor party, declared yesterday that a raucous unity con ference of 1,200 Spanish speaking activists in Arlington, Va., late last month was a success after all.

title: Nixon Nominates Judge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he planned to nominate Federal Distritc Judge Alfred T. Goodwin of Portland, Ore., to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Cir cuit.

title: Selective Service System Issues New Rules for Draft Classifications and Procedures
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  The Selective Service System announced tpclay the first ma jor overhaul of draft regula tions in four years.

title: Thant, Feeling Weak, Is Taken to a Hospital
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 2U Thant was taken to a Manhattan hospital to day after experiencing a dizzy spell and feeling weak, a United Nations spokesman said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: IRISH ROVERS DRAW A HEARTY RESPONSE
description: There's nothing as bright and gay and rhythmic as a set of Irish singers and instrumental ists, unless it's an audience that's turned on by them. Car negie Hall on Monday night had a bit of boththe Irish Rovers and an audience that came to respond, to whoop and to holler and to clap along with the songs.

title: Senate Panel Backs Mail Registration for Federal Elections
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  A bill designed to qualify as many as 45 million more voters in 1972 by simplifying registra tion procedures was approved today by the Senate Post Office Committee, 6 to 3.

title: Black Mayor in Kalamazoo
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Nov. 2 (AP)Kalamazoo voters elect ed their first black Mayor in a city election today that saw three student candidates fare poorly in this twocollege com munity. Gilbert H. Bradley Jr., 31 years old, topped a slate of 19 candidates for seven City Council seats and was auto matically awarded the post of Mayor.

title: Regan Is Victor Over Sedita In Erie County Executive Race
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 2Edward V. Regan, the RepublicanCon servative candidate, defeated Mayor Frank A. Sedita of Buf falo, the DemocratLiberal, in today's contest for Erie County Executive.

title: ARTHUR T. LEVINE
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 2 Arthur T. Levine, a vice presi dent of Bright Star Industries, Inc., a manufacturer of dry cell batteries and flashlights in Clifton, N. I., died in an auto mobile accident yesterday in Waltham, Mass. He was 45 years old and lived at 78 Brewster Road.

title: Football Polls WRITERS' RATINGS By The Associated Press
description: The top 20, with points fig ured on a 2018161412109 87654321 basis for first through 15th places (firsfplace votes in parentheses) and won lost records through games of last Saturday.

title: Bank of Japan Sees Drop In the Economy Continuing
description: TOKYO, Nov. 2 (AP)The Bank of Japan predicted today that the nation's economy is likely to decline further. It said a number of companies are expected to reduce capital spending.

title: PROF. DE SAUSSURES
description: GENEVA, Nov. 2 (AP)Prof. Raymond de Saussures, a psy chiatrist who was once an asso elate at the Psycholanalytical Clinit of Columbia University, has died at the age of 77.

title: New Publisher Is Chosen For Raleigh Newspaper
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 2 (UPI)Frank Daniels Jr. has been elected to succeed his father as president and pub lisher of the News and ob server Publishing Company.

title: Mikhail I. Romm, Film Director Who Won Soviet Prizes, Is Dead
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 2Mikhail I. Romm, a prominent Soviet film director, died, yesterday at the age of 70.

title: Mrs. Koussevitzky Shows Art
description: Mrs. Serge Koussevitzky, widow of the former con ductor of the Boston Sym phony Orchestra, who for years has devoted herself to helping other artists through the Koussevitzky Music Foun dation, is proving to be an artist in her own right these days at the Hammond Mu seum in northern West chester.

title: CANADIANS HOLD ATEST PROTESTS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2  Protests against the United States nu clear test on Amchitka Island are spreading across Canada.

title: Chicago Judge Approves Hearing on Panther Jury
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 2A judge has ruled that Barnabas Sears, the special prosecutor who led a grand jury investigation of a police raid on the Black Panther in 1969, must undergo a hearing on charges he improperly in fluenced the jury, which in dicted 14 law enforcement of ficials.

title: Merger News
description: Fairchild Industries, Inc., and Swearingen Aircraft, Inc., of San Antonio, Tex., a maker of turboprop commercial aircraft, announced yesterday an agree ment whereby a new subsidiary, 90 per cent owned by Fair child, would acquire the assets of Swearingen. Fairchild would provide working capital to the sub sidiary, not to ex ceed $3  million. The new subsidi ary, on its part, would pay Swearingen between $13.8million and $16.5million over a 10year period. The ex act amount would depend or the number of aircraft sold by the new company.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Jackie Stewart has walked out on the L&M Lola team in the CanAm series to join, if other pieces of a jigsaw puz zle can be put together, the GulfMcLaren team. For the McLaren crew, which has just won its fifth consecutive CanAm championship, sign ing the twotime world driving champion is a case of the rich getting richer. But it is bad news for the CanAm series, already plagued by a lack of compe titive racing.

title: CHARGER AERIALS THREAT TO GIANTS
description: Two injury reports and one statistic were of interest to New York Giants followers yesterday. The reports con cerned Charlie Evans the re cently discovered rookie full back, and Bob Tucker, the chessplaying tight end. The statistic involved Fran Tarken ton.

title: ROBERT PETERMAN, A NUTRITIONIST, 58
description: PATERSON, N. J., Nov. 2 Dr. Robert Peterman, a nutri tion specialist and researcher at HoffmanLaRoche, Inc., a pharmaceutical concern in Nut ley, died of a heart attack at St. Joseph's Hospital here Sunday. He was 58 years old and lived in Totowa.

title: Tanner Set To Direct Show Here
description: Tony Tanner, the British musical  comedy performer and director, has been en gaged to stage Nevertheless, They Laugh, a musical based on Leonid Andreyev's He Who Gets Slapped. It will be put on Broadway in January by the new produc ing team of Les Schecter and Barbara Schwei.

title: Elmer Brown of U.M.W. Dies; Yablonski Running Mate in '69
description: DELBARTON, W. Va., Ndy 2 Elmer Brown, a longtime coal miner and candidate for vice president of the United Mine Workers on the ticket headed by, the late Joseph A. Yablonski in 1969, collapsed an died on his farm here today. He was 54 years old.

title: The Amchitka Delusion
description: Sometime between Saturday morning and early next week at the bottom of a huge hole more than a mile below the surface of the barren Aleutian island of Amchitka, the United States will be setting off an explo sion of unimaginable power.

title: HANOI CHARGES U.S. HAS EXTENDED RAIDS
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Wed nesday, Nov. 3 (Agence France Press)The Foreign Ministry charged today that the United States Air Force had extended its bombings of North Vietnam to include the country's north ern province of Laichau, 160 miles northwest of Hanoi.

title: VOTERS HERE FILL 6 SEATS IN ALBANY
description: Voters in Queens picked four new Assemblymentwo Republicans and two Demo cratsand one new Demo cratic State Senator yesterday in barely contested, races to fill vacancies that will expire when the regular legislative elections are held next year.

title: New Building Activity Is off For First Time Since January
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 AP)  New construction activity declined slightly in September ?? a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $111.9billion, the com merce Department reported to day. It was the first downtown since January.

title: Cambodian Siege Broken
description: PRAKHAM, Cambodia, Nov. 2 (Reuters)A Cambodian arm ored column today broke through to this town 56 miles north of Pnompenh, lifting a weeklong siege by eight North Vietnamese and Vietcong bat talions.

title: Japan Defense Force Shows ProfileChanging Tank
description: GOTEMBA, JapanThe Japanese Ground SelfDefense Force has developed what is said to be the world's first tank that can change its sil houette, a type of tank many countries want and which was not expected to be de veloped before 1975.

title: Texas Abortion Law Upheld
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 2 (AP) The Texas Court of Criminal Appeals upheld today the con stitutionality of Texas's abor tion law. The court said that the abortion laws came within the state's duty to protect human life.

title: Bridge:Gowdy to Lead Canadians In World Team Olympiad.
description: Canada recently deter mined its representation in the 1972 World Team Olym piad. An Ontario foursome led by Bruce Gowdy and in cluding Duncan Phillips, Bill Crissey and Gerry Charney, won a decisive victory in a 108deal final playoff at St. Agatha, Que., on Oct. 25.

title: U.S. Navy Jet Reported to Strike Missile Site in North Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov 3 (AP)An American Navy jet that was bombing the enemy's supply trail in Laos was reported to have darted over neighboring North Vietnam, yesterday to at tack an antiaircraft battery that had fired two missiles at it

title: THOMAS B. DYETT, LEADING LAWYER
description: Thomas Ben Dyett, who mixed public service, politics and traditional casework in a 49year career as a lawyer, died here early yesterday morn ing. He was 85 years old, and had been at the High Ridge House sanitorlum in Riverdale for several weeks, apparently suffering the effects of a fall earlier in the year.

title: WILLIAM W, SULLIVAN
description: WAYNE, N. J., Nov. 2Wil liam W. Sullivan, former di rector of sales and distribution in Central and South America for the 20th CenturyFox Film Corporation, died Sunday in nursing home here. He was 75 years old.

title: Democrat Triumphs Easily In Baltimore Mayoral Race
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 2 (AP)  William D. Schaefer, the Demo cratic City Council President, posted a landslide victory today over Dr. Ross Z. Pierpont, a Re publican for Mayor of Baltimore.

title: Sketches of Members of the Delegation
description: Huang Hua

title: P.S.C. Examiner Urges an Increase in Interim Phone Rate Rise
description: A $49.4millionayear in crease in telephone rates, on top of the $190million a year interim rise allowed last July, was recommended yesterday by a state Public Service Com mission examiner.

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Be cause of a typographical error, Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, was erroneously listed in yester day's editions of The New York Times as having voted for an amendment to the foreign aid authorization bill that would have deleted $101.5million in contributions to certain United Nations programs. Mr. Ribicoff voted against the amendment, which was defeated 55 to 28.

title: Bank Merger Is Opposed;
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) The Justice Department moved today to halt the merger of five Atlanta area banks into two subsidiaries of the Citizens and Southern National Bank, the largest banking organiza tion in Georgia.

title: BRITON, CANADIAN WIN NOBEL PRIZES
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 2Prof. Dennis Gabor, a Hungarian born scientist, was named today the winner of the 1971 Nobel Prize for Physics for his work in threedimensional photogra phy. Prof. Gerhard Herzberg, a Germanborn Canadian, won the Nobel Prize for Chemistry for his research in the structure of the molecule.

title: Mystery Writer Is Elected A Selectman in Connecticut
description: GUILFORD, Conn., Nov. 2 Hillary Waugh, author of mys tery novels, was elected First Selectman of this town on the Republican ticket.

title: Yields Decline Slightly On Mortgage Interest
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 Mortgage interest yields fell slightly for the sixth consec utive time at the auction of the Federal National Mort gage Association, President Oakley Hunter disclosed today.

title: U.M.W. Trial Postponed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) United States District Judge William B. Bryant today grant ed a delay until Nov. 15 in the trial of a Government suit aimed at removing the United Mine Workers president, W. A. Boyle, and other top officers from office. The delay was granted because of the death of the union's principal attor ney, Walter Gillcrist.

title: CONGRESS FACING INQUIRY BY NADER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  Ralph Nader, the consumer ad vocate, announced today that he was organizing a 1,000 member team to investigate Congress.

title: Rehnquist's Statements Indicate He Would Be an Activist Pressing Conservative Views
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The writings of William H. Rehn quist, encased in two thick binders and lodged by him last, weekend with the Senate Ju diciary Committee, show that President Nixon's nominee to the Supreme Court is an un varying conservative who be lieves that Justices invariably write their own views into the Constitution.

title: ECONOMIC SURVEY FINDS LOSS IN CITY
description: Onefourth of the wages and salaries earned in New York City go to outoftowners, ac cording to a study by the Syra cuse University's Maxwell School of Citizenship and Pub lic Affairs.

title: Sports of The Times
description: One of the fringe benefits of attending the World Series for past or present members of the baseball fraternity is the matchless opportunity that the postgame gettogethers offer for cutting up touches and swapping lies with old friends. During the recent resurrection extrava ganza of the Pittsburgh Pirates, one such old friend en countered was Tommy Henrich, and this Yankee star of yesteryear is as delightful now as he always was.

title: ANTONIO F. PADIN
description: Antonio F. Padin, a partner in Padin Bros., an importer and a exporter of textiles, died of can cer on Monday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 393 West End Ave nue.

title: Democrats Gain Net of 10 Connecticut Communities
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 2The Democratic party registered a net gain in Connecticut of 10 towns and cities tonight in municipal elections across the state, according to unofficial returns.

title: REPUBLICAN WINS CLEVELAND RACE
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 2Ralph. J. Perk, who concentrated his campaign in white ethnic neigh borhoods, swept the Republican party into Cleveland's City Hall tonight, for the first time in 30 years, with a stunning vic tory in the mayoral election.

title: KENNEDY DECRIES BLUE CROSS DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Sen ator Edward M. Kennedy today accused the Blue Cross Associa tion of starting a clandestine lobbying campaign, paid for by the premiums of subscribers, aimed at assuring the group a place in any national health in surance program that might be passed by Congress.

title: News Analysis
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 2Under heavy diplomatic and military pressure, India seems to be toughening her policy toward Pakistan and toward what she considers a lack of understand ing by Western nationspartic ularly the United States.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: In the opinion of Joe Res tic of Harvard, the bestbal anced team in the Ivy League right now is Princeton.

title: REVLON REPORTS RECORD PROFITS
description: Operations of Revlon, Inc., in the three and nine months ended Sept. 30 resulted in rec ord sales and earnings, accord ing to the report yesterday by the maker of cosmetic, fra grance and ethical products.

title: JAMES F.CONVERY
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 2 James Francis Convery, a re tired funeral director, died yes terday at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived, here.

title: Police and U.N. Plan for Arrival of the Chinese
description: The Police Department said yesterday that it had started preparations for the security of the Chinese delegates to the United Nations, although their arrival would be treated as a routine event.

title: Rickles Calls for Unity On New Bond Approach
description: The city Commissioner who was called a damn fool and a nut by Mayor Lind say for opposing the trans portation bond issue, said yesterday that he hoped both supporters and opponents of the issue would now unite and work together for a new bond issue devoted solely to mass transportation.

title: Stans Will Visit Soviet for Talks on Wider Trade
