The economy is in deep trouble, with both inflation and unemployment running at unacceptable levels. The war is still on in Vietnam, and it is hard to remember a time when the nation's relations with Canada, Japan, Western Europe, Latin America and the underdeveloped countries of Asia and Africa were in such a state of anxiety and mistrust; but in the face of this general slippage, the President's political stock seems to be rising.

title: Black Expo Opens Here With Focus on Economics
description: With great aspirations and hundreds of schoolchildren pouring through its exhibition halls, the Southern Christian Leadership Conference's International Black Expo opened here yesterday.

title: Professor Joins Vote Protest
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Nov. 4 (AP)  James MacGregor Burns, professor of government, joined his Williams College students on the picket line today in a voter registration protest. He was one of 20 students, faculty members and townspeople who picketed the Williamstown municipal building to protest the town's refusal to register students to vote.

title: 60 Hurt in Italian Violence
description: CASTELLAMMARE DI STABIA, Italy, Nov. 4 (AP)  Sixty persons were injured, including 43 policemen, in a battle here yesterday between unemployed workers and the police. It was Italy's first major labor violence this fall.

title: TREVINO CARDS 65 FOR 3SHOT EDGE IN MEXICAN OPEN
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 4 (AP)Lee Trevino, playing almost flawless golf, carded a sevenunderpar 65 today and assumed a threestroke lead in the first round of the Mexican open.

title: With a Talented Sauce Chef, What If Truffles Are Few?
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: McAloon, Rodriguez Meet In Felt Forum Ring Tonight
description: Danny McAloon and Jose Rodriguez will meet in the featured 10round welterweight bout tonight at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. McAloon, the athletic director at the Browning School, has never been beaten. He has won 20 fights and fought four draws.

title: . . . and a Dividend Guideline
description: With Phase One of the Administration's antiinflation program slated to end next week, the architects Phase Two are searching for principles to guide the future distribution of income in ways that will promote price stability.

title: Senator Humphrey, In a Speech Here, Urges College Aid
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey called here yesterday for substantial Federal aid to the nation's financially troubled colleges and universities and direct Federal assistance to students as a matter of right and on the basis of need.

title: U.S. Says Hanoi Curtails P.O.W. Letters
description: PARIS, Nov. 4The United States accused North Vietnam today of cutting down vastly on the number of letters it has allowed American prisoners of war to send home.

title: Surrogate Midonick
description: The election of Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick to the Surrogate's Court is a double victory for reform. For this particular court, it means the voters recognized a need for change to prevent havens of patronage from continuing to thrive in the judicial system. For political leaders representing the vestiges of Tammany who opposed Judge Midonick and lost in the Democratic party primary, this defeat proves that combinations of independent voters in New York can win elections.

title: LINDSAY'S TV MAN HELPED BOND FOES
description: The television commercials against the transportation bond issue  which Mayor Lindsay said he was for  were drafted by the Mayor's former speech writer and staged by the Mayor's current television adviser.

title: The New Girl at Princeton: A Sculpture by Picasso
description: There is a new girl on campus who has caused Princeton University undergraduates to stop, gawk, ask a lot of questions and sometimes be late for class.

title: China in the United Nations
description: To the Editor: In the discussion of Taiwan's expulsion from the United Nations everyone seems to have forgotten the offshore islands Quemoy and Matsu, the former only a cannon's firing distance from Amoy harbor on the mainland and both controlled by Nationalist China.

title: Aid Plans Are Compared
description: WASHINGTON, Nova 4Following is a table comparing the amounts authorized for foreign aid programs under the two bills approved by the Senate Foreign Relations Coinmittee today with those sought by the Administration in its original request to Congress for this fiscal year:

title: McNamara Visiting Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4 (Reuters) Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank, arrived here today for a fiveday visit at the invitation of the Japanese Foreign Ministry. The former United States Secretary of Defense is to meet with Foreign Minister Takeo Fukuda and other Government, business and intellectual leaders.

title: ALLENDE TO SEEK ONE LEGISLATURE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 4President Salvador Allende Gossens announced tonight that he would send a bill to Congress next week proposing the creation of a onechamber People's Assembly to serve as the national legislature.

title: Interim Foreign Aid Bills Approved by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, in a move to break the impasse on foreign aid, approved two separate bills today, one for economic assistance and the other military. The measures would authorize a total of $2.3billion in aid, or $1.2billion less than the Administration had requested.

title: Powell Presented to Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. Opposition to the Supreme Court nomination of William H. Rehnquist appeared to dwindle today as the Senate Judiciary Committee finished questioning him.

title: Nine Named in Indictments In Municipal Loan Scandal
description: The indictment of nine persons on charges of conspiracy, extortion, grand larceny and the filing of fraudulent documents in the Municipal Loan Program was announced yesterday by District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: Attack Reported Repelled
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 4 The Pakistani radio asserted today that 148 Indian soldiers and their agents were killed and more than 200 wounded in three unsuccessful attempts to capture a border post at Akhipaba in the northern part of East Pakistan. Pakistan customarily refers to Bengali guerrillas as Indian agents.

title: Baseball Writers Reelect 3
description: Maury Allen of The New York Post was reelected chairman of the New York Chapter of the Baseball Writers Association of America yesterday. Joseph Durso of The New York Times was reelected vice chairman and Jack Lang of The Long Island Press secretarytreasurer, The writers, who held their fall meeting at Mr. Laff's restaurant, also announced their annual dinner and show would be held at the Americana on Jan. 30, 1972.

title: BANKS CUT RATES ON A BROAD FRONT
description: Interest rates declined across a broad front yesterday.

title: Scoring Is Routine for Wright
description: Steve Tannen, who unwittingly helped choreograph Elmo Wright's touchdown dance, may get a chance Sunday to see whether the Kansas City rookie has made any changes in his routine.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES CAMPAIGN BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 The House Rules Committee cleared today a mixed package of campaign finance legislation that is headed for complicated and uncertain future on the floor later this month.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Undefeated Dartmouth, sporting a 15game winning streak (six this season), will pit its defense against Columbia's offense tomorrow at Baker Field.

title: United Nations Notes
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4The Chinese delegation may be taking its time in getting here, but the tourists have already arrived in force.

title: China in the Unified Nations
description: To the Editor:

title: AirportBus Runs Resume As Carey Strike Ends Here
description: A threeday work stoppage by drivers for Carley Transportation, Inc., ended yesterday and the company announced that normal bus service between Midtown and the three major metropolitan airports had been resumed.

title: An Appraisal
description: Eloise wouldn't know the Plaza. According to Arthur D. Dooley, vice president and managing director, its Edwardian elegance is being projected into the world of today and tomorrow. They are making it a fun place. What they are actually doing is remodeling it downstairs.

title: Industrial Polluters Now Facing U.S. Criminal Action
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4In a stern new approach to pollution control, Federal prosecutors are trying to jail and fine the owners and executives of companies that discharge industrial waste into rivers and harbors.

title: Britain Informs E.F.T.A. She'll Quit Dec. 31, 1972
description: GENEVA, Nov. 4 (Reuters)Britain informed its eight partners in the European Free Trade Association today that it would leave the organization Dec. 31, 1972, the day before its scheduled entry into the European Common Market.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE OFF FROM '70 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Freight traffic on United States railroads last week, due largely to the coal strike, was considerably below the yearearlier volume. Intercity truck tonnage in the same period registered an increase.

title: Wallace Calls Legislature To Special Session Nov. 15
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 4 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace called the Alabama Legislature today into special session, beginning the night of Nov. 15, to appropriate funds to keep the state government running.

title: Goldberg Protests the Surrender of Ellsberg Paper
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yesterday that he was shocked and surprised by the decision of the Council on Foreign Relations, of which he is a member, to turn over to Federal authorities a paper delivered, at a Council seminar last year by Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

title: Senators Protest Amchitka ABlast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 Protests against the Amchitka nuclear test set for Saturday mounted here today, fanned by outbursts of Congressional criticism and appeals to President Nixon and the Supreme Court to halt the blast.

title: About Pro Football
description: The Giants and Jets, who have lost 10 of their 14 games this season, are underdogs again for Sunday's contests, with San Diego the visiting team in Yankee Stadium and Kansas City at Shea Stadium. On television, Pittsburgh plays Cleveland, Channel, 4 at 1 P.M., and San Francisco opposes Minnesota, Channel 2 at 4. Here is a preview of all the games, with wonlosttied records in parentheses. San Francisco opposes Minnesota, Channel 2 at 4. Here is a preview of all the games, with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: SCHIPPERS LEADS GINASTERA WORK
description: The Cincinnati Symphony appeared at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday night in the International Festival of Visiting Orchestras. It marked the first time the ensemble had appeared here under its new music director, Thomas Schippers, and it drew one of the largest audiences in the series. The program included excerpts from Handel's Royal Fireworks Music, Ginastera's Violin Concerto and Prokofiev's Fifth Symphony.

title: MEAT PRICES HELD CLOSE TO LIMITS
description: The Internal Revenue Service said yesterday that a special survey it took of retail meat prices in New York City during the last week showed negligible violations of the price freeze.

title: Case Supports Bill Seeking Income Source Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Senator Clifford P. Case is asking Congress to require top Federal officials  including Congressman and the President to disclose publicly their sources of income. He said the information could be used in suits to recover illgotten gains.

title: Trudeau's Foes Say in Commons He. Lets Friendship With U.S. Deteriorate
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 4  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, who has entertained Communist leaders of the Soviet Union and Yugoslavia in recent days, was accused in the House of Commons today of allowing continuing deterioration of Canada's friendship with the United States.

title: 160 Yeshiva U. Strikers Return to Maintenance Jobs
description: Maintenance workers at Yeshiva University returned to work yesterday after settlement of a 15day strike by members of Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Workers Union.

title: HOUSE PANEL ACTS TO LET PAY CO UP IN CURRENT PACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The House Banking and Currency Committee, in a sudden revolt against the Administration's proposed economic legislation, moved today to force major changes in the imminent Phase Two program. President Nixon attacked the committee's actions.

title: Police Inspector Accuses Hogan Of Failing to Prosecute Gambling
description: Police Inspector William T. Bonacum, the commander of four Harlem precincts, said last night that the office of Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan had a policy against prosecuting felony gambling cases.

title: After Fiddler, a Benefit Fete, and Another, and Another
description: Tevye, the tsourisridden Jewish dairyman of Czarist Russia whose woes have been celebrated in 17 languages on the stage, brought his troubles to the screen this week.

title: Police Here Report Rise in Homicides During September
description: Reported cases of murder and nonnegligent manslaughter increased here 70.9 per cent in September, with 147 cases compared with 86 in the same month of last year, the Police Department announced yesterday.

title: Bargaining on Phase Two ...
description: Behind all the bombast and legislative endruns in Washington over rules to govern Phase Two wage increases is the reality that for the first time the representatives of labor, industry and the public on President Nixon's Pay Board are down to hard bargaining.

title: Textile Distributors Group Plans 1973 Trade Show
description: The Textile Distributors Association, Inc., an organization made up of textile manufacturers and distributors, announced yesterday its intention to sponsor an international textile trade exposition in New York in 1973.

title: Bridge: Caribbean Players to Meet In Tournament at Barbados
description: For the last 13 years, the world championship for the Bermuda Bowl has included teams representing South America as well as North America. This state of affairs has been rather less than satisfactory for those countries in Central America and the Caribbean that would like to have some road, even a long and difficult one, by which they could reach the world title.

title: Cost Council Pact Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)  Dr. Marvin H. Kosters has been named assistant director for planning and analysis for the Cost of Living Council, it was announced today. Dr. Kosters will be responsible for general economic planning and wage, price and agricultural policy analysis for the council.

title: Books of The Times
description: RABBIT REDUX. By John Updike. 407 pages. Knopf. $7.95.

title: SALVATION ARMY RAISES $8,658,818
description: The Salvation Army in greater New York raised $8,658,818 during 1971, setting a world record for the organization.

title: G.I. Leaves East Germany
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Nov. 4 (AP)An American soldier who took an Army panel truck and drove into East Germany last Friday returned today, the Army reported.

title: FRAICIS'S PA1SE IS Fil FO KiNGS
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 4  Coach Emile Francis of the New York Rangers displayed commendable tact, and a feeling of charity, for a badlydefeated opponent last night after his hockey team had defeated the Los Angeles Kings, 71, at the Forum.

title: Cuba Cancels Airlift 2 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Cuba has told the United States that the airlift of refugees to Miami has been canceled today and tomorrow but can be expected to resume on Monday, according to the State Department. A spokesman for the department said that he believed there were not enough passengers ready for travel to justify the airlift today and tomorrow.

title: Bunk Robber Here Gets Bogus Money
description: A gunman who thought he had made off with a large haul from a Queens bank has learned by this time that much of his loot was bogus money.

title: Joan Miller and Dance Troupe Present an Ambitious Program
description: Joan Miller and her Chamber Arts/Dance Players presented an ambitious program Thursday night that ranged from Baroque, dance to a series of theater pieces on social problems.

title: 5 Unions Urge Publishers Be Exempted From Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) Five labor unions representing 35,000 employes of the publishing industry asked the Senate Banking Committee today to exempt newspaper, magazine and book publishers from wageprice controls.

title: Tobey Paintings Exhibited at Willard
description: The art of Mark Tobey has been an art of meditation, one that has not lent itself to facile analysts. It rarely reaches out in a pushy way and commands instant, spellbinding attention. Rather, the viewer must go to Mr. Tobey's art, be slowly absorbed into it, and contemplating its intricacies, establish an equation of mood and rationale with it. This kind of alliance between painting and viewer is engendered throught lowkey color schemes, complex pictorial structures of form and painstaking detail and labyrinthine spatial considerations.

title: N. CAROLINA STATE BEATS MIAMI, 137
description: MIAMI, Nov. 5 (UPI)Bruce Shaw connected on a 7yard touchdown pass to Mike Stultz tonight to give North Carolina State a 137 victory over heavy ily favored Miami of Florida.

title: Democrats in Florida Drop Proposal to Pledge Wallace
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 5 A proposed state Democratic party rule designed to keep Gov. George C. Wallace in the party fold should he enter Florida's Presidential preference primary has been killed.

title: Executive Changes
description: Eastern Air Lines announced yesterday that Charles J. Simons, executive vice presidentfinance and administration and chief financial officer, has been elected to the additional posts of president and chief executive officer of the company's three subsidiaries in Puerto Ricothe Dorado Beach Hotel Corporation, Dorado Beach Development, Inc., and Dorado Beach Estates, Inc.

title: JOHN HOSSENLOPP
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 5John Hossenlopp, who retired in 1955 as executive vice president, treasurer and a director of J. J. Little & Ives, New York publishing house, died last evening at a nursing home in Cedar Grove. He was 86 years old and lived at 242 Laurel Place.

title: YONKERS MANAGER OUSTS POLICE HEAD
description: YONKERS, Nov. 5Public Safety Commissioner Frank E. Vescio, a veteran of the police force for more than two decades, was dismissed tonight by City Manager Seymour Scher following a hastily called special meeting of the 13man City Council.

title: Allende Moves to Force A Showdown at the Polls
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5After a year of political sparring between Chile's leftwing Government and the nonMarxist Opposition, President Salvador Allende Gossens has decided to force a decisive confrontation at the polls.

title: 22 Cubans Leave After 10Day Stay Under Confinement
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 5 (AP) Twentytwo Cubans who spent 10 days in the United States without visas flew home today.

title: No Live TV Coverage Of Atom Blast Planned
description: The three major television networks said yesterday that they would not provide live coverage of the underground nuclear blast, scheduled for today on Amchitka Island, Alaska.

title: U.S. to Let Russians Buy 136Million in Feed Grain
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 The Nixon Administration announced arrangements today for the commercial sale of nearly $136million worth of corn and other livestock feed grains to the Soviet Union.

title: Police Launch Named For a Slain Patrolman
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday praised the late Patrolman Miguel Sirvent, the first Puerto Rican member of the force killed in the line of duty, at a ceremony in which a launch was named in the patrolman's honor.

title: A E.C. Can Halt Countdown If Supreme Court Delays Test
description: AMCHITKA ISLAND, Alaska, Nov. 5 (UPI)A 15minute countdown is necessary for the firing of the Cannikin nuclear test, but it can be stopped at any time.

title: Bride : Playing Doubled PartScore Can Be Tense for Both Sides
description: A doubled partscore contract in tournament play bears tiame resemblance to a suddendeath playoff in a tennis match: Both sides are aware that triumph and disaster are lurking around the corner.

title: GROUPS TO RESIST NEW TAX STATUS
description: Scores of service and benevolent organizations are preparing to appeal a decision by the city's Tax Commission that removed the taxexempt status on property they own here.

title: Lakers Beat Bullets, 110106
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 5 (UPI)Gail Goodrich got Los Angeles off to a fast start with 19 points in the first quarter tonight and Wilt Chamberlain added timely baskets and rebounds at the end to give the Lakers a 110105 triumph over the Baltimore Bullets.

title: An Unusual Combination
description: AUSTIN, Tex. (AP)A recent helpwanted ad in a local paper advertised for topless dancers with unusual qualifications. It said: Topless Dancers. Must have two years college. Prefer English major, languages, or humanities.

title: JUSTICES TO HEAR PLEA ONLY HOURS BEFORE ALUM TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Supreme Court today took the highly unusual step of agreeing to hear early tomorrow an appeal to delay an underground hydrogen bomb blast to be detonated only hours later in the Aleutian Islands.

title: REFEREE DEPRIVES RANIOS OF CROWN
description: MADRID, Nov. 5 (Reuters)A Nigerian referee, Samuel Odubote, was the center of an uproar tonight after he disqualified Mando Ramos of Los Angeles in the 11th round of his 15round lightweight title bout against Pedro Carrasco of Spain.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP IN SLOW TRADING
description: Stock prices staged a mild retreat yesterday, as a sharp decline in trading volume underscored the current caution of investors. It was a market that lacked selling pressure as well as lustre.

title: Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line
description: The Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line Company reported thirdquarter revenues of $104,273,000, up from $94,383,000 a year earlier.

title: More College Men Seeking Police Jobs in Big Cities
description: Police departments in major cities are reporting a recent upsurge in job applicants, particularly applicants with more education than was usual in the past.

title: Peking Drive Seems to Be Aimed Against Lin Piao
description: HONG KONG. Nov. 5Mounting evidence From China continues to indicate that Lin Piao, the Defense Minister and Mao Tsetung's deputy, is ht the heart of the mysterious developments within the Peking regime that observers have been trying to puzzle out for three months.

title: Scheel Urges New Forum for West European Unity
description: ROME, Nov. 5West Germany took a major initiative today to make Western Europe a cohesive political force.

title: Pinter's Old Times Delayed
description: An airport strike in London has caused a twoday delay in the New York previews of Harald Pinter's Old Times at the Billy Rose Theater from Tuesday to Thursday.

title: EUGENE F. MOOERS
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Nov. 5 Eugene F. Mooers, executive vice president of the Ocean Freighting and Brokerage Corporation, 80 Broad Street, New York, died of a heart attack today in North Shore Hospital. He was 50 years old and lived at 200 South Middle Neck Road.

title: BARBIERI OFFERS AN EXCITING JAZZ
description: A fresh, exciting and enlivening jazz wind is blowing at the Village Vanguard this week where Gato Barbieri is introducing a partially new quintet and is showing striking evidence of his own emergence as a vital and individualistic saxophonist.

title: Food Prices For August
description: Following is a list of average retail food prices for about 100 items prevailing in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area just before President Nixon announced the wage price freeze on Aug. 15.

title: Laird Said to Tell Saigon U.S. Is Speeding Pullout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5 (AP)Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird has told the South Vietnamese that the United States is speeding troop withdrawals to get thousands of G.I.'s home for Christmas, informed sources reported to. day.

title: U.S. Food Cost List for August A Partial Guide in Price Freeze
description: Consumers wondering how they can tell whether food prices have been raised illegally in spite of President Nixon's Aug. 15 wageprice freeze gained a partial solution to their problem yesterday.

title: Rhetoric That's Not So Innocent
description: As a teacher with high school and college experience, I should like to stress one aspect of urban crime that is deliberately ignoredbecause it is viewed as too delicate. Yet its honest examination is crucial, despite the predictable accusations of racism that follow any open discussion of what is too often whispered.

title: Anne of Green Gables Set For the City Center Dec. 21
description: Anne of Green Gables, the Canadian musical based on Lucy Maud Montgomery's popular children's book, will be presented for two weeks beginning Dec. 21 at the New York City Center of Music and Drama. The adaptation is by Donald Harron, Canadian actor, who appeared on Broadway in The Tenth Man. The music is by Norman Campbell and the lyrics by Mr. Harron and Mr. Campbell.

title: Upsets of Top Elevens Remote
description: Upsets sprinkled here and there today could cause havoc with plans for the showdown battles in the Southeastern Conference, Big Eight, Big Ten and Ivy League during the next three weeks.

title: Detroit and Singers Give Fine Reading Of Nevsky Work
description: Prokofiev's Alexander Nevsky was given a splendid performance at Carnegie Hall on Thursday night by the Detroit Symphony Orchestra with the assistance of Lili Chookasian, contralto, and choruses from Mount Holyoke College and Williams College.

title: Antiques
description: The China Institute has done It again by offering another superb small show: This time the subject early Chinese gold and silver.

title: Israelis Voice Satisfaction
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 5Israel's leaders expressed satisfaction today over an attempt by the four African leaders to arrange talks between Israel and Egypt. The African leaders ended three days of talks here today and proceeded to Cairo.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I should like to draw your attention to one point which I feel is important but neglected regarding the nuclear test at Amchitka Island.

title: Births
description: BROWNMr. and Mrs. Scott Brown announco the birth of their son, Scott Brown Jr. on Nov. 4, 1971.

title: Aleutians Site Is Prepared for Blast Today
description: AMCHITKA ISLAND, Alaska, Nov. 5The hole where Cannikin is buried was sealed off with gravel and topped with plastic plugs today, but foul weather tormented technicians hurrying to complete adjustments for the hydrogen bomb test set for 5 P.M. tomorrow, Eastern standard time.

title: Connally Says He Will Bring No Hard Line to Japan Talks
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 5 United States Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally said here today that he was not going to Japan with either a hard bargaining attitude or a package of proposals to resolve economic problems between the two countries.

title: U.S. Leads Jajan by Two
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 5 (AP)  The United States professional team led its Japanese counterpart by 2 strokes, 494496, after the first 18 holes of the Mikie Gold Cup golf tournament today.

title: Youth and Age on the Hill
description: The constitutional amendment to lower the age of eligibility for membership in the Senate and the House, introduced by Senator Bayh of Indiana and Representative Drinan of Massachusetts, fits the general pattern of easing the entry of young people into political activity and service. The change proposed by the two Democrats would make 27 instead of the current 30 years the minimum age for the Senate and 22 instead of 25 for the House.

title: Chinese Read About Protests
description: PEKING, Saturday, NOV. 6Millions read yesterday about angry protests in Canada against the United States Government's decision to go ahead with the Amchitka blast.

title: AntiMarxists in Madrid Destroy 24 Picasso Works
description: MADRID, Nov. 5 (AP)Seven antiMarxist youths raided an art exhibition honoring Pablo Picasso on Friday and destroyed 24 of his works of art valued at more than $100,000, the police reported.

title: Artists' Designs for Currency Include a $12 Bill
description: If Andy Warhol could design this country's currency, he'd make it easy to copy. Robert Rauschenberg would put a lot more fantasy into it. And Red Grooms would, give it a gaggy look, like play money.

title: Maxwell, on 133, Is 3 Shots Ahead
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 5 (AP)Billy Maxwell, taking advantage of shortened tees, carded a sevenunderpar 65 today and moved three strokes in front of Lee Trevino in the second round of the Mexican open golf tournament.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It is Nov. 25, Thanksgiving Day, in Norman Okla. Several minutes before the opening kickoff of the NebraskaOklahoma football game, the phone rings in the Oklahoma dressing room.

title: CONTINENT AL PHONE SHOWS PROFIT GAIN
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation reported yesterday a slight improvement in net income for the first nine months of 1971. The company, which is the nation's third largest independent (nonBell) telephone system, reported revenues and sales of $316,703,505 for the nine Months, up from $296,552,899 a year earlier.

title: Rock Festival Postponed
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 5 (UPI)  A huge international rock festival, whose promoters had predicted an attendance of 50,000 to 100,000 youths from Nov. 24 to 28, was postponed today until the Christmas holidays. Joel Magruder, one of the organizers, said it had been postponed because the organizers did not have time to make arrangements.

title: Canadian Protest Received
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 5The Canadian Government has been informed that President Nixon took into account a House of Commons protest motion be fore he decided to proceed with plans for the Amchitka nuclear test.

title: SAM JONES, PITCHER WHO WON 100 GAMES
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Nov. 5 (AP)Sam Jones, who was known as Sad Sam and won 100 games as a pitcher with a number of major league teams in the nineteenfifties and sixties, died in West Virginia University Hospital today of cancer. He was 45 years old. He had been a patient at the hospital for various periods since June 1.

title: Bucks Down Bulls, 104102
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (AP) Kareem Abdul Jabbar scored 10 points in a threeminute stretch early in the fourth quarter tonight to help the Milwaukee Bucks overtake the Chicago Bulls and defeat them, 104102.

title: A Voice From Exile
description: MONTREALThe Vietnam war is more than half way through its seventh year; it is an American institution now, which criminally lays waste to Indochina with an unmatched technological barbarism, smashes and alienates America's young both in uniform and out, and drives several hundred thousand young Americans underground and a hundred thousand more into exile.

title: Soviet Is Loosening MoldaviaRumania Ties
description: KISHINEV, U.S.S.R., Oct. 28 The chill in political relations between the Soviet Union and Rumania has led to, a reduction in the cultural relations between Rumania and Moldavia, the small Soviet republic with historical and linguistic ties to that neighboring country.

title: Books of The Times
description: MEET ME IN THE GREEN GLEN. By Robert Penn Warren. 376 pages. Random. $7.95.

title: Rites for Ann Pennington
description: A funeral service for Ann Pennington, the dancing star of the George White Scandals of the nineteentwenties, will be held at the Universal Funeral Chapel, 137 East 52d Street, on Monday at 1 P.M., with the Actors Fund as the sponsor. Miss Pennington died on Thursday at the age of 77. Interment will be in Kensico Cemetery, Valhalla, N. Y.

title: Taylor Stars in Overtime As Nets Top Pros, 129117
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 5Few gave Ollie Taylor much of a chance to make it with the New York. Nets when he joined them last season as a 12thround draft choice.

title: The World's Heritage in Trust
description: WASHINGTONHere are our ideas for a world heritage trustan exciting concept put forward by the President last,February. It is our hope that there will be the birth of a new concept of international stewardship for important land areas.

title: Ballet: After the Creation
description: City Center Joffrey Ballet's two major new creations, Kettentanz the beguiling and Mingus Dances, the puzzling, were on view at the City Center on Thursday night.

title: Bonnie Raitt, SingerGuitarist, Gives Interpretive Performance
description: Good interpretive performers haven't been very common in rock music lately. Joe Cocker, Helen Reddy and the late Janis Joplin are a few who come to mind. And now the name of singer  guitarist Bonnie Raitt can be added to that small list. Miss Raitt, the daughter of the Broadway singing star John Raitt, will be appearing at the Gaslight II through tomorrow.

title: The Talk of Conakry
description: CONAKRY, Guinea  A guidebook written 13 years ago for tourists in West Africa informed them that Conakry was an extremely pleasant stop, and added glowingly:

title: TRANSIT INSURGENTS LOSE PLEA TO STATE
description: The State Public Employment Relations Board has dismissed the representation potion of an insurgent group of rankandfile transit workers seeking to dispulace the Transport Workers Union as bargaintrig agent for 33,000 Transit Authority workers.

title: Mexican Elemental Sulphur Target of Dumping Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Treasury has begun an investigation to learn whether elemental sulphur from Mexico is being dumped on the United States market, it was announced today.

title: 20 in Primary Race for Governor in Louisiana Today
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 5Seventeen Democrats, two Republicans and one American party candidate are on the ballot for Governor in tomorrow's primary election.

title: Nixon Reorganizes Intelligence Work
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The White House announced today that President Nixon had ordered an overhaul of the Government's intelligence operations, assigning Richard Helms, director of the Central Intelligence Agency, a broader overall supervisory role.

title: Soviet Embassy Honors Peking's U.N. Delegate
description: PEKING, Nov. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)The head of China's first delegation to the United Nations, Chiao Kuanhua, was the guest of honor today at a Soviet Embassy reception.

title: New Surge of Emigration By Soviet Jews Reported
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5Jewish sources report that a new surge of emigration to Israel has been permitted in the last two weeks, raising to some 7,500 the number of Jews who have been allowed to leave the Soviet Union this year.

title: RATE OF JOBLESS DOWN IN OCTOBER TO 5.8% FROM 6%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The nation's unemployment rate edged downward in October as total employment continued a rise that began at midyear, the Labor Department reported today.

title: U.S. Steel Shutdown Hits Duluth Hard
description: DULUTH, Minn., Nov. 5 The Duluth Works of the United States Steel Corporation, this city's largest employer, announced the shutting down of its hot steel facilities here effective Nov. 13. More than 1,000 workers are reportedly affected by the shutdown, although many others were laid off previously when demand for products dropped off. When fully operational the plant employed 2,500 workers.

title: Better Personnel Records Vowed by Columbia Head
description: The president of Columbia University, criticizing Columbla's archaic ways of gathering its own personnel data, pledged yesterday that the university would do its level best to produce information demanded by the Federal Government on the school's job practices regarding women and members of minority groups.

title: Man Arrested in Bordello Wins Dismissal of Charges
description: An Ohio telephone executive, accused of patronizing an East Side house of prostitution linked to the Knapp Commission investigation into alleged police corruption, won a quiet dismissal of the charges against him, 10 days ago in Manhattan Criminal Court, it was learned yesterday.

title: Study Finds School Dropouts Do Not Appear to Suffer
description: A fouryear study of what happens to high school dropouts has led University of Michigan social scientists to a conclusion that challenges one of the basic assumptions of American education.

title: President at Key Biscayne For a Working Weekend
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., Nov. 5 (AP)President Nixon arrived today for his first weekend in Florida since early October.

title: Mrs. Rodenburg Wed To Thomas Boucher
description: RUMSON, N. J., Nov. 5 Mrs. Dorothea O. Rodenburg and Thomas O. Boucher, chairman of the board of the CibaGeigy Corporation, chemical concern in Summit, were married here this evening at the bridegroom's home by Robert Lawrence, Mayor of Shrewsbury.

title: Proposals by Kennedy
description: PARIS, Nov. 5 (UPI)The United States should improve its economy by cutting imports, stepping up exports and reducing American investments overseas, Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of. Massachusetts, said in an interview that appeared, today in Expansion, a French business magazine.

title: Pan Am Confirms Choice Of Seawell as President
description: Pan American World Airways confirmed yesterday that William T. Seawell, head of RollsRoyce's American subsidiary, has been picked to be the airline's new president and chief operating officer.

title: FOUNDATION GIVES $100,000 TO FORUM
description: The Rockefeller Foundation has made a grant of $100,000 to the Lincoln Center Repertory Company toward the cost of continuing and expanding its experimental activities at the Forum Theater.

title: BRITAIN TIGHTENS OBSCENITY CURB
description: LONDON, Nov. 5  If any single item in a British magazine or newspaper is found obscene from now on, its editors can be sent to prison.

title: BEAME TO OFFER TRANSIT PROGRAM
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beanie intends to disclose early next week what aides described yesterday as. a permanent plan to cope with the city's transportation problems.

title: REFORM HEAD SCORES JEWS ON RETREAT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5The head of the influential central body of American Reform Judaism sharply assailed American Jews and their organizations for a growing retreat from involvement in social issues and problems concerning the nation's welfare.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Brooklyn Man Found Slain
description: The body of a fatally shot man, identified by his fingerprints as Dominick DeAngelis, 46 years old, was found by the police early yesterday on 54th Street near Seventh Avenue in Brooklyn. His last known address, in 1963, was 2569 West 17th Street, Coney Island. According to the police, he had been arrested for robbery on numerous occasions in Westchester County and Brooklyn. He had been shot in the head three times.

title: OCCUPATIONAL TIE TO CANCER SOUGHT
description: How many of the myriad chemicals and particles to which modern man is continually exposed may cause or enhance the growth of human cancer? To try to answer this question, the American Cancer Society, Mount Sinai Medical Center and leading trade unions, are collaborating in an extensive study of workers who are occupationally exposed to suspected hazardous substances.

title: Screen: Tragic Diary
description: Let neither the title nor the cast credits mislead you. Morley Markson's The Tragic Diary of Zero, the Fool is not really populated by Zero, the Fool, or Isis, the Priestess, or the King of Pentacles. It is really populated by three young people who call each other Penelope, Gerald and Daniel (their own names), plus a few others, ali of whom individually try to relate to themselves and, collectively, to one another through the course of several personality games devised for them by their director.

title: House's Curbs on Busing Likely to Spur Bitter Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The emotional House votes last night and early this morning against the busing of schoolchildren for the purpose of racial integration were but the beginning of what promises to be a bitter and protracted Congressional battle on busing.

title: Jets Pick Tannen to Bar Chiefs' Bombs to Taylor
description: After a sixgame absence, Steve Tannen is expected to return to left cornerback for the New York Jets tomorrow with a specific assignment stop Otis Taylor, the National Football League's most explosive passreceiver this season.

title: Bonn Warns on 15% Surtax
description: BONN, Nov. 5 (Reuters)The West German Economics Ministry expressed regret at the decision of the United States Senate Finance Committee to give President Nixon authority to levy a 15 per cent import surcharge in certain situations.

title: SUBSIDIARY FORMED BY HAMILTON WATCH
description: The Hamilton Watch Company announced yesterdy the formation of a new subsidiary, partly owned by a Swiss watch concern, to take over Hamilton's present watch and clock business and reduce the comIpany's indebtedness.

title: Myrdal Will Take New Look at Negro
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 5Nearly 30 years after the publication of his now classic study of racism, Gunnar Myrdal has decided to take a new look at the plight of the black man in American society.

title: Laver Is Upset by Kodes In Stockholm Semifinals
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 5 (UPI)  Czechoslovakia's Jan Kodes upset topseeded Rod Laver'of Australia, 46, 64, 76, tonight to move into the semifinals of the $50,000 Stockholm open, tennis tournament.

title: 7 Are Convicted on Pornography Charges
description: Seven men, including twos brothers identified as members of the Colombo Mafia family, were convicted by a Federal Court jury in Brooklyn yesterday of conspiracy and illegal transportation of pornographic movies and other paraphernalia.

title: Badillo Labels Stein a Racist On Puerto Rican Welfare Study
description: Representative Herman Badillo and Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein had a vituperative confrontation yesterday over the Assemblyman's contention that Puerto Rico was exporting its surplus population to New York through its welfare policies.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 5American doctors are an articulate group. That much is shown by the reaction to two recent columns in this space, criticizing aspects of medicine in the United States. The doctors wrote, some in a defensive or abusive vein but many in constructive disagreement.

title: Brezhnev in Paris
description: The visit to France of Soviet Communist party leader Leonid Brezhnevhis first visit to a Western countrywill not go down in history as six days that shook the world; but as a further step in the long process winding down the cold war, it marks a useful advance.

title: Garelik Asks for Inquiry On Racial Census by City
description: City Council President Sanford D. Gerclik said yesterday that he had asked the Council's Committee on Civil Service and Labor to investigate an executive order by Mayor Lindsay calling for a racial and ethnic census of city employes.

title: Drawings by Nesbitt, a Retrospective
description: For many painters, the art of drawing functions as a kind of limbering up exercise. Visually, the artist draws in order to define his material for himself. Conceptually, he draws in order to explore its implications. Often the painting bears little resemblance to the drawings on which it is based, but the drawing process has nonetheless contributed an essential impetus.

title: Jersey City Official Indicted
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 5 (AP) John J. Sheedy, executive dierector of the Jersey. City Parking Authority, was Indicted today for allegedly accepting more than $12,000 in bribes in return for granting contracts to the Marcos Building Corporation. A 71count indictment handed up by a special Hudson County grand jury charged that Mr. Sheedy accepted the money between February, 1967, and February, 1970, in return for getting work from the parking authority for the building company.

title: GAMBINO IS GIVEN INDEFINITE STAY
description: The Immigration and Naturalization Service granted a stay of deportation to Carlo Gambino yesterday after learning from two United. States Public Health Service cardiologists that the reputed underworld boss was suffering from heart disease, congenital heart failure, severe chest pain, diabetes and arteriosclerosis.

title: ManInduced Methane Is Seen as Peril to Ozone Layer
description: Methane gas introduced into the air by expanding human activity, including cattle raising, may be gradually depleting the stratospheric ozone layer that protects life from searing ultraviolet rays, according to a report in the British journal Nature.

title: SYNOD ASKS STUDY OF WOMEN'S ROLE
description: ROME, Nov. 5The world Synod of Bishops approved in principle today the formation of a highlevel Vatican commission to determine whether women have been accorded their full rights in the Roman Catholic Church.

title: A Car Dealer Finds That His Business Teaches Caution
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5Joe McDonald thought a while about what it takes to be an auto dealer and concluded only half jokingly, You've got to be half nuts.

title: Foreign Aid Compromise
description: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee has hammered out with surprising speed a new bifurcated $2.3billion interim foreign aid proposal to replace the $2.9billion military and economic assistance package that perished in a storm of senatorial acrimony last week.

title: Merger News
description: The Slick Corporation, manufacturer of chemical and pollution control devices, won a round yesterday in its battle to take over control of Filtrol Corporation, a producer of petroleum cracking catalysts.

title: Lane Bryant Sales Up
description: Lane Bryant, Inc., a diversified retailing chain, reported yesterday a 4.1 per cent rise in its October sales to $19,827,943 from $19,035.680 in the yearago month. Sales in 39 weeks rose 8.9 per cent to $179,889,546 from $165,222,362.

title: F.T.C. TOLD CITY BLOCKS BUILDING
description: A Harlem businessman who says he has $15million and land on which he wants to build a highrise office building, complained to a Federal Trade Commission hearing yesterday that his project was blocked by the City Planning Commission.

title: PRICE CURBS BRING ANTITRUST WARNING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The head of the Justice Department's Antitrust Division warned businessmen today not to use information or acquaintanceships they develop during the current pricecontrol period as a basis for anticompetitive actions.

title: WhiteShirt Boom? Industry Hasn't Seen It
description: When some men's apparel manufacturers and retailers hear talk of a return to dress white shirts, they see redand blue, purple, green, stripes and patterns.

title: UKRAINIAN PRELATES END SYNOD IN ROME
description: ROME, Nov. 5The Ukrainian Catholic Church today ended the five day synod that it held here in defiance of the Vatican.

title: State Department Says New Senate Aid Proposals Would Cripple South Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The State Department said to ?? that the Senate Foreign ?? dons Committee's new foreign aid proposals could have a crippling effect on South Vietnam's economy and seriously impair Cambodia's ability to defend herself against North Vietnamese forces.

title: Rangers Win, 81, Lifting Skein to 10
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 5In high offensive gear for the second game in a row on a tour of the West Coast of the National Hockey League, the New York Rangers scored five goals in the first period to night and posted an impressive 81 triumph over the California Golden Seals at Oakland Coliseum Arena. The victory margin was one of the most decisive ever scored by the Rangers on the road in their 46year history. It extended New York's unbeaten streak to 10 games.

title: Market Place: Bank in Dispute On Realty Deal
description: If you have been to Manhattan lately, you may be aware that there are lots of new commercial buildings under construction and not enough people to fill them.

title: SHANKER PLEDGES AID TO STUDENTS
description: Albert Shanker, the president of the United Federation of Teachers, yesterday pledged the union's help to a student drive to obtain more school funds and restore budget cuts.

title: Cannikin
description: Unless the Supreme Court intervenes in these last few hours, the largest underground nuclear explosion ever detonated in the United States will be set offwith unknown and incalculable consequenceson the island of Amchitka in the Aleutians this afternoon. If anything goes wrongand no one involved in this wildly hazardous undertaking can predict, with certainty that nothing will go wrongtoday could well become known as another day of infamy to the peoples bordering the Northern Pacific, Asians and Americans alike.

title: 17 South Vietnamese Are Killed In an Ambush in Mekong Delta
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5 (AP)Heavy South Vietnamese casualties were reported today in an ambush in the Mekong Delta, with 25 per cent of a company of about 100 militiamen said to have been put out of action.

title: COLONELS DEFEAT PACERS BY 115110
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 5 (AP)  Kentucky's Dan Issel scored 39 points, 21 in the first period, to pace the Colonels to a 115110 American Basketball Association victory over the Indiana Pacers before 11,551 fans tonight.

title: PoliceInquiry. Data Seized in 3 Raids By Hogan's Office
description: Wiretaps of hundreds of private conversations between judges, politicians, prostitutes, policemen and others were seized early yesterday morning, along with cartons of other materials, by the unit in the office of Manhattan. District Attorney Frank S. Hogan that is investigating disclosures by the Knapp Commission.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TOOL MAKERS JOIN G.E. IN A PROGRAM
description: The General Electric Company, working closely with 29 machinetool makers, announced here yesterday a joint program aimed at eliminating foreign competition when the economy turns around.

title: New Issues Mixed In the Latest Week
description: The newissue market, where shares of companies are traded publicly for the first time, ended mixed last week in moderate trading.

title: Apprehensive Residents Mourn Woman Slain in Parhchester
description: The people in the 15story brick cooperativeapartment building on Pugsley Avenue in the Bronx are warm and friendly toward each other. They play mahjongg together, they hold holiday parties together and they have their own clubs.

title: Princess Anne Wins Poll
description: LONDON, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Princess Anne, 21 year  old daughter of Queen Elizabeth, was named today as Britain's sportswoman of the year in a poll of British sports writers. Competing only two months after an operation, she won the European threeday riding championship in September.

title: BERNARD AUMULLER, PHOTO MANAGER, 50
description: ALLENDALE, N. J., Nov. 5Bernard A. Aumuller of 3 Aokerson Road, photographic manager of Western Electric and a former news photographer for The Daily Mirror in New York City, died today at, his home after a long illness. His age was 50.

title: GRAIN PRICES RISE ON CHICAGO BOARD
description: Rumors that the Government may set up a grain reserve program and also relax restrictions on agricultural commodIty sales to Communist countries had a bullish effect on trading at the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Weekly Output Down a Bit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP) United States auto production slipped slightly this week, but auto makers planned to continue a fairly high rate of assembly, the trade journal Automative News reported yesterday.

title: Rights Leader Says Soviet Curbs His Phone and Mail
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 (UPI)Valery Chalidze, a physicist who was a founder of the unofficial Committee on Human Rights, complained today of interference with his mail and telephone calls.

title: 3 Armed Convicts Terrorize Vienna
description: VIENNA, Nov. 5  This serene capital, proud of its low crime rate, has been agitated for the last 24 hours by three armed convicts who escaped from a nearby penitentiary with a magistrate and a stenographer as hostages and then invaded Vienna.

title: Ford Buys Parts Depot
description: ALLEN PARK, Mich., Nov. 5 (AP)The Ford Motor Company has purchased a former Chrysler Corporation parts depot in this Detroit suburb. Ford officials said they would use the 110,000squarefoot structure to conduct safety and emission tests.

title: PHONE PACT TALKS ARE STALEMATED
description: Negotiators for the New York Telephone Company and the Communications Workers of America met for two and a half hours yesterday, but made no progress toward settlement of the statewide strike of 35,000 craftsmen, now in its 17th week.

title: Moscow Places Order For I.B.M. Computer
description: The IBM World Trade Corporation, a subsidiary of the International Business Machines Corporation, said yesterday that it had received an order from the Soviet Union for Its System 360 Model 50 computer that was displayed at a trade show in Leningrad last month.

title: ECONOMIC SLUMP WORRIES FRENCH
description: PARIS, Nov. 5The French are starting to worry about a sharp turn for the worse in their economic condition because of the recessionary forces they see gathering in the rest of the world.

title: Art: Les Halles Recalled in Sculpture
description: Guernica had its Picasso, and now Les Halles has its Raymond Mason. The Departuie of the Fruits and Vegetables from the Heart of Paris, February 28, 1969, at the Pierre Matisse Gallery, 41 East 57th Street, is a sculpture about 10 feet long and 4 feet deep showing crowds of venders and buyers leaving the great Paris market on its last day, a kind of cortege whose members bear mountains of produce instead of candles and flowers, against a background of the doomed buildings, the Church of St. Eustache and distant streets. The whole scene Is executed in the most expertly juggled relief perspective, and it should wring your heart if you used to love Les Halles, entertain you if you enjoy benign caricature, and stir you to admiration if you recognize the skill that has into its organization.

title: Vehicle Makers Fined
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Department of Transporation said today it had fined the International Harvester Corporation $15,000 and the Chrysler Corporation, $10000 for production of faulty lighting equipment. The action involved truck and car tail lamps that failed to meet performance or durability requirements of Federal motor vehicle standards.

title: Automation of Justice System Held Threat to Civil Liberties
description: Nearly 100 judges and lawyers were told here yesterday that automation in the criminal justice system posed such grave dangers to civil liberties that even the agencies that gather and computerize information about private citizens wanted laws and court rules setting limits on their work.

title: 350 SCHOLARS ASK BAN ON PAKISTAN AID
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 5 More than 350 scholars have signed a statement urging President Nixon to withdraw United States support from Pakistan until there is a peaceful settlement of the IndiaPakistan crisis.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Perhaps the most important future implication of the news that the American birth rate is dropping significantly is what might be called population peristalsis. In biology, peristalsis is what happens when a pig is eaten by a python. The bulge moves gradually along the length of the snake until it is fully digested. Lower birth rates, if they continue, would result in something exactly parallel. And population peristalsis, in turn, could cause continuing and considerable changes in American society for the next half century.

title: GUARD IS STABBED AFTER FORUM BOUT
description: One security guard was stabbed in the back after dozens of fans at the Felt Forum at Madison Square Garden last night, protesting a boxing decision, ripped seats, set them on fire and hurled bottles at ringside.

title: Foreign Chief's Slip on Okinawa Sends Tokyo's Diet Into Uproar
description: TOKYO, Nov. 5The Japanese Parliament began its debate over the return of Okinawa today with an uproar over a mixup in official papers.

title: Jenkins's Mounts Score Sweep
description: Rodney Jenkins doesn't look or ride like Genghis Khan. It's just beginning to seem that way to his rivals in the National Horse Show.

title: 421 SHOT SCORES IN AQUEDUCT RACE
description: Medley Woodhouse kept his family name in great prominence on the program at Aqueduct yesterday. He won only; one race, but that was big onebig, that is, as regards the mutuel return that his mount posted. It was $86.60.

title: Two Major Track Meets Are Abandoned for 1972
description: The overcrowded indoor track and field calendar finally took its toll yesterday of two major meets in New York and Boston. The New York Knights of Columbus meet, a fixture in the metropolitan area for 52 years, will not renew its traditional February date for 1972, officials said.

title: CHILD IS ORDERED GIVEN TO MOTHER
description: An 8 year old girl who has been living with foster parents since she was a year old has been ordered returned to her natural mother, who had turned the child over to welfare authorities to enter a hospital with a mental illness.

title: CHINESE TO LEAVE FOR U.N. TUESDAY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 5  China advised the United Nations today that her delegation to the General Assembly would leave Peking next Tuesday and arrive in New York on Wednesday or Thursday.

title: NEW PAY FORMULA SPURNED BY LABOR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Labor members of the Pay Board rejected a proposal by the management representatives for Phase Two wage increases today and appeared to be confident of getting a better deal in direct talks with the business members on the board tomorrow.

title: Braves Win in Overtime
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5 (AP) Randy Smith poured in 35 points tonight as the Buffalo Braves broke a 105105 tie in overtime and beat the Atlanta Hawks, 122117.

title: Music: Thomas's Way
description: Michael Tilson Thomas, the whiz kid from Boston, was at the helm of the New York Philharmonic on Thursday evening. It was something of a grabbag program that he directed. But at least the program was unusual, which of course is typical of Philharmonic programs these days.

title: OTC LIST DOWN; AMEX ALSO DROPS
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market ended the week in a bearish manner yesterday as the majority of stocks in both markets declined in slower trading.

title: Rise in Sales Fosters Plan to Hire 1,000 by End of Month
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5The General Motors Corporation, encouraged by the current sales, boom, announced today that it was raising its production schedules and would hire and recall about 1,000 workers in four plants by the end of November.

title: Tanzanian Says Joy at U.N. Wasnt to Shame U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 5Tanzania's chief delegate to the United Nations said today that he had respect and esteem for President Nixon and that his delegation's joyous reaction to the General Assembly vote on China Iast week had not been meant to shame the United States.

title: A Recount in Bridgeport Confirms Republican Mayor
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 5 A 19hour recount that ended at 4:20 A.M. today confirmed the election of Bridgeport's first Republican mayor since 1927.

title: HoustonIs It a Mecca for Oenophiles?
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 5Robert T. Sakowitz, executive vice president of the department store that bears his family name,, seems intent on persuading Houston to share his love far highpriced wines. So last night, J. M. Broadbent from London, a wine master who talks the way Texans expect Englishmen to talk, was here to auction off wines at one of the Sakowitz stores.

title: Travelers Corp. Earnings Rose 44.7% in Quarter
description: The Travelers Corporation, major insurance concern, reported yesterday that earnings rose 44.7 per cent in the first nine months of 1971, against those of the 1970 period.

title: G. HOWARD CONKLIN
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Nov. 5G. Howard Conklin, who had been a financial analyst on Wall Street for 40 years, died on Tuesday at the Sharp Hospital after a brief illness. He was 66 years old and had lived here for the last 10 months. Earlier he had been a resident of Shelton, Conn., for 20 years.

title: Firemen Seek Pact Showdown; To Act Thursday on City Offer
description: Rankandfile city firemen, reportedly angry that they are still without a contract although their old agreement with the city expired 10 months ago, have initiated a mo:ve to force a showdown in the dispute.

title: FRANK F. CASEY
description: PLANDOME, L. I., Nov. 5Frank F. Casey, a retired New York advertising executive, died today at his home after a brief illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 57 South Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5This week, as the Senate passed a bill to clean up the nation's streams, largely by limiting the discharge of industrial wastes and sewage, the country's biggest oil research company received a patent for a method of purifying waterways. Patent 3,617,546, granted to Dr. Norman N. Li, a research scientist, and two associates, is assigned to the Esso Research and Engineering Company, an affiliate of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: Senate Panel Adds DayCare Tax Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Senate Finance Committee added an amendment to the tax bill today that would permit tax deductions for certain individuals for the cost of day care for children and invalids, and even for the cost of housekeepers, maids and gardeners.

title: House Passes Bill Giving Coffee Pact Force of Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The House passed today a bill giving the force of law to provisions of an international coffee agreement designed to stabilize world supply and prices.

title: 3Goal Spree Helps Sabres Inflict 5.2 Loss on Flyers
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 5 (UPI)Gil Perreault, Dick Duff and Eddie Shack scored within a 1minute18second span of the third period tonight to give the Buffalo Sabres a 52 triumph over the Philadelphia Flyers in a National Hockey League game.

title: U.S. URGED TO END CURBS ON TRADE
description: GENEVA, Nov. 5 (UPI) European Free Trade Association (EFTA) ministers urged the United States today to remove trade restrictions before lasting damage is done and before agreement on a new monetary system.

title: A Transit Tax
description: The proposed $2.5billion transportation bond issue, which New York State voters rejected Tuesday, would have given the city and state breathing space to work out plans for subsidizing the city's mass transit system and maintaining its present 30cent fare structure. The system, already operating heavily in the red, confronts an even larger deficit under a new contract being negotiated with the Transport Workers Union for next year.

title: Augean City
description: It is hard sometimes to see the city as anything but an Augean stable, requiring a twentiethcentury Hercules to run a river through it. Pollution, decay, corruption seem omnipresent. Yet sometimes all that is needed for a cleanup is the firm determination of New Yorkers and their enterprises to man a battery of brooms and hoses, both real and figurative.

title: EL GRECO DISPUTE IS WON BY MUSEUM
description: A Federal judge ruled yesterday that the Metropolitan Museum of Art could exhibit an El Greco painting that has been stored for months in an ammunition vault here of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Barbara Taylor, '69 Debutante, Is Married to John D. Cochran
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Nov. 5Miss Barbara Jennings Taylor, daughter of Mr. and. Mrs. Henry Stillman Taylor of Centre. Island, Oyster Bay, was married here this afternoon to John Drayton Cochran, son of Drayton Cochran of Centre Island and Mrs. Winston H. Frost of New York. The Rev. Robert Gutheil of All Saints Lutheran Church in Brookville performed the ceremony at the home of Mrs. Henry C. Taylor, grandmother of the bride.

title: House Vote on Busing Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)Following is the 233124 House rollcall vote late last night approving an amendment prohibiting the Federal Government from using its own funds for busing of pupils to overcome segregation or requiring a state to use its funds:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 5 (AP)Jack Nicklaus posted a 10underpar 62 to take a 7stroke lead in the $28,000 Dunlop international golf tournament today with a total of 131.

title: City Rights Aide Scores Realty Men For Housing Policy
description: Eleanor Holmes Norton, chairman of the city Human Rights Commission, assailed the real estate industry here yesterday as the single most irresponsible industry in the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Witches And Their Craft
description: CORNWALL, England  The other day I met an author who had written a piece on modern witchcraft for aa Sunday color supplement. When I congratulated him on the article, he made a face. Don't. That witch Dput a spell on me, and it's only just worn off. He had made some mildly skeptical remarks about the love potions she sold; whereupon she wrote him a letter, warning him that she had put a spell on him. His girlfriend confirmed the story. He had terrible luck for monthsdreadful things kept happening to him.

title: Council Is Told '69 Inquiry Uncovered LoanProgram Flaws
description: An investigation of the Municipal Loan Program in 1969 uncovered all the problems that are the subject of various investigations begun this summer, resulting in nine indictments this week, a City Council Committee hearing was told yesterday.

title: William Oliver of Amstar Dies; Was Sugar Company Chairman
description: William F. Oliver, chairman of the Amstar Corporation, formerly the American Sugar Refining Company, died Thursday after a brief illness. His age was 57 and he resided at 370 United Nations Plaza.

title: Castro Greets Return
description: MIAMI, Nov. 5 (UPI)Premier Fidel Castro personally welcomed the 22 Cubans on their return to Havana today. The Cuban radio, monitored in Miami, broadcast special coverage of the arrival on a nationwide network.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Relations between New York's two United States Senators  Jacob K. Javits and James J. Buckleyand between their staffs appear to have cooled somewhat since the beginning of this year.

title: Lawyer Suspended Over Alleged Bribe On Liquor License
description: Myron Epstein, a Manhattan lawyer who allegedly sought in 1965 to bribe a State Liquor Authority investigator, was suspended yesterday from practicing law for 18 months.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Nov. 5 (AP)Jim McDaniels poured in 30 points tonight to pace the Carolina Cougars to a 109106 victory over the Floridians.

title: Notes on People
description: Philadelphia's Mayorelect, Frank L. Rizzo, the former Police Commissioner, announced his first cabinet appointment. For Fire Commissioner, he passed over 17 higherranking civil service firemen to appoint a 47yearold battalion fire chief who, has been with the department since 1949. The appointee, whose salary will jump from $15,000 to $27,000 a year is Joseph Rizzo, the Mayorelect's younger brother.

title: New S.E.C. Rules Impose Tighter Check on Stocks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Securities and Exchange Commission adopted rules today aimed at preventing a recurrence of the widespread losses of securities by brokers and inability to trace them that occurred in 1969 and 1970.

title: Observers. Being Sent
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today he would send observers to two parishes in Louisiana tomorrow to watch over the primary election.

title: Miss Goldberg Is Bride
description: Miss Randy Goldberg and Joseph P. Fried, a reporter with The New York Times, were married here yesterday at the Municipal Building. The couple's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Goldberg and Mr. and Mrs. Irving Fried. Both families reside in Brooklyn. The bride is a teacher in the school system here. Her husband is the author of the book Housing Crisis U.S.A. His previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: Japanese Voice Concern
description: TOKYO, Nov. 5 (UPI)The Japanese Government expressed grave, concern today over United States Senate Finance Committee's vote to give President Nixon authority to raise the present surtax on foreign imports to 15 per cent.

title: PAKISTANI OFFICIALS ON VISIT TO PEKING
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 5  Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, the former Foreign Minister, left. Rawalpindi today for Peking at the head of a delegation, of military commanders and diplomats for consultations with Chinese leaders, including Premier Chou Enlai.

title: CAIRO WELCOMES AFRICAN MISSION
description: CAIRO, Nov. 5A delegation of four African heads of state on a peacemaking mission flew to Cairo today from Israel and received a warm welcome from President Anwar elSadat.

title: NIXON INCREASES FUELOIL QUOTA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) President Nixon signed a proclamation today extending indefinitely the importation of No. 2 fuel oil into the Northleast, and increasing the quota by 5,000 barrels a day.

title: Suns Rout Cavaliers, 10787
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 5 (UPI)Clem Haskins scored 24 points, Dick Van Arsdale 23 and Lamar Green grabbed 22 rebounds tonight to pace the Phoenix Suns to a 10787 triumph over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Orioles, Unbeaten in Japa?? Play 10Inning 4.4 T??
description: NIGATA, Japan, Nov. 5 (A?? Don Buford cracked a thre?? run homer and Mery Rette?? mund hit a homer today, b?? the Baltimore Orioles had ?? settle for a 44, 10inning ?? with Tokyo's Yomiuri Giants??

title: CONVENTION SITE GRANTED $395,000
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Law Enforcement Assistance Administration granted $395,000 to Miami Beach today to train and equip security forces for the Democratic Convention next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Three More Major Banks Cut Prime Rates to 5%
description: The First National City Bank, the Irving Trust Company and the First National Bank of Boston  the three largest banks formally to adopt the concept of a floating prime rate yesterday reduced their minimum business lending charges by a quarter point, to 5 per cent, to be in effect for the week starting Monday.

title: Mrs. Gandhi, in Capital, Says India Seeks No War
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Prime Minister Indira Gandhi said here today that India has no desire to provoke war against Pakistan and has no territorial designs either on Pakistan or on what she called East Bengal.

title: Jews Join in Plea to Aid Day Schools
description: For the first time, leaders of the Reform, Conservative and Orthodox branches of American Judaism have joined in a declaration calling for Jewish community support of Jewish day schools.

title: Chrysler Recalls Number Of Cars to Check Defect
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation said today that it was notifying the owners of 52,729 earlyproduction 1972 models to return their cars to dealers for inspection and replacement, if necessary, of a possible defect in the transmission assembly.

title: 16 Black Colleges Get Grant Of $204,000 From U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Robert J. Brown, a White House special assistant, disclosed today a grant of $204,000 to 16 land grant colleges and Tuskegee Institute, all predominantly black. The money will be available during the current fiscal year and may be used by the schools to purchase $4million worth of surplus Government equipment.

title: ROY T. HURLEY, 75, AVIATION LEADER
description: Roy T. Hurley, who served as chairman and president of the CurtissWright Corporation in the 1950's, died last Sunday, in Santa Barbara, Calif., where he had lived in retirement since 1961. He was 75 years old.

title: Young Couple Spell Out Case Against Having Children
description: Anna and Arnold Silverman are under 30. Their first wedding anniversary will be next month, and they say they are never going to have children. But Mr. Silverman qualifies that: If we ever change our minds, we'll adopt.

title: Louisiana Land Lifts Profit
description: The Louisiana Land & Exploration Company, primarily a holder of oil and gas lands, reported yesterday for the first nine months this year net income of $45,147,209, or $1.25 a share, with gross income of $101,572,887. In the corresponding period last year the net income was $37,735,174, or $1.04 a share, with gross of $81,823,618.

title: ULSTER HOUSEWIFE AND SOLDIER KILLED
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, Nov. 6 (AP)A young housewife was shot dead in Londonderry early today and British soldiers battled snipers during a housetohouse search for terrorist gunmen.

title: HAVLICEK'S SHOT WINS FOR CELTICS
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)John Havlicek sank a 40foot field goal as the buzzer sounded to give the Boston Celtics a 103102 victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In regard to the luncheon meeting held by sixty millionaires at the 21 Club [hews story Oct. 27], I wish to state a few words from a grandmother:

title: Mori Paces Palmer Golf
description: KAWASAKI, Japan, Nov. 5 (AP) Kenji Mori of Japan carded a 3underpar 69 on his home course today and took a 1stroke lead over Arnold Palmer after the first day of competition for the trophy hearing the American's name.

title: Consolidated Natural Gas
description: The Consolidated Natural Gas Company reported, gains in operating revenues arid net income for the first nine months. The report placed revenues at $494,644,000, up from $429,254,000 a year, earlier. Net income rose to $48,005,000, or $2.54 a share, from $39,306,000, or $2.08 share, in the yearearlier period.

title: PENN'S MERRICK HARRIER WINNER
description: Dave Merrick, an 18yearold freshman from Mokena, Ill., shattered the fivemile course record and led the University of Pennsylvania to its first team championship in the 33d annual Heptagonal crosscountry championships yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Designers on Different Tacks Sail Same Course for Spring
description: They're as different as night and day, but still Pauline Trigere and Bonnie Cashin have some things in common.

title: SONICS CONQUER KNICKS, 101 TO 97
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 5 (AP)Seattle pulled back into a tie for first place in the National Basketball Association's Pacific Division tonight with a 10197 victory over the New York Knicks.

title: CITY'S CHILD CARE IS FOUND SUPPING
description: A regional Federal health official has declared that the traditional pattern of health service for New York City's children is no longer as effective as it should be, despite relative successfulness in the past.

title: In Bluebeard's Castle
description: It is fitting that a critic who has concerned himself with almost every branch of 20thcentury culture should pause in the middle of the journey to ask where it is going. George Steiner comes to the conclusion, not entirely novel, that classical humanism is at an end. But he consoles us with the prospect that the intellectual questioning characteristic of the European tradition is irrepressible. It will go on even if it means finding more truths that kill. The seventh door in Bluebeard's castle offers us, in the bankruptcy of hope, the dignity of daring. A shudder of ambiguous expectancy should run through us in the face of Steiner's sombre cultural perspective. One feels a truth in it. Yet by overstating his case the author deflates his intimations of apocalypse into sophisticated modern Schauerromantik.

title: DUKE TROUNCES W. VIRGINIA, 3116
description: DURHAM, N. C., Nov. 6 (UPI) Steve Jones and Ernie Jackson ran for two touchdowns each today as Duke trounced error  prone West Virginia, 3115.

title: Kalb Reelected Head Of Power Boat Group
description: Paul Kalb of Waukegan, Ill., has been reelected president, of the American Power Boat Association. He was unopposed in the mailballot voting.

title: Alfred Routs Hamilton, 320, To End Season Undefeated
description: CLINTON, N. Y., Nov. 6Alfred completed an undefeated football season today, inflicting Hamilton its seventh straight loss, 320.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Central Connecticut Stops American international, 147.
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. Central Connecticut repeatedly warded off American International scoring challenges in the second half today to hold on to a 147 victory.

title: ComputerRun Cars to Link Campuses
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Nov. 6  A computerguided rapid transit system, dubbed the people mover, is under construction to link the farflung campuses of West Virginia University and bring relief to this trafficsnarled hillside town.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: On the surface at least, there are two incongruities about Bob Rawls Dorsey, since 1965 president of the Gulf Oil Corporation. In an era of youthoriented, often brutal, management shifts, he has just been given the title of chief executive officer at the age of 59 from a retiring chairman six months his junior.

title: The Mystery Is, Why Did He Do That to Wilhelm Reich?:Wilhelm Reich
description: I HAVE never, in all my years of moviegoing, booed a film, no matter how bad, boring or insipid the film might have been. Sometimes the crime being committed in the name of cinema seemed outrageous enough to justify such a response, but I restrained myself.It is because I have a deeply rooted respect and love for filmmakers that booing has never been a part of my film vocabulary, that is, until I saw Dusan Makavejev's film, "WR-Mysteries of the Organism." Booing was plainly not the proper thing to do at the somewhat austere critic's screening at the Vivian Beaumont, especially since Makavejev was expected to appear momentarily for a press conference. But it was, it seemed to me, a proper response for a film that in the name of freedom, joy and the "avant garde," exploited, misinterpreted and maligned the very man's work that it professed to hold dear. Unfortunately, the deception of the film is masked so slyly and subtly that its insidiousness is not easily apparent. And it was this that outraged me.Before going further, a brief description of the film might be helpful.
