title: Mrs. Watkin Married To Forrest W. Phillips
description: Mrs. Ruth Davis Watkin of Brooklyn, widow of Walter W. Watkin, was married in Grace Episcopal Church here yesterday to Forrest W. Phillips, a widbwer, also of Brooklyn. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Benjamin Minifrie, the rector, assisted by the Rev. Gard L. Rowe of. the Flatbush Tompkins Congregational Church.

title: So, Connecticut Crushes Adeiphi Eleven, 45 to 12
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 6Gordon Taylor rushed for a schoolrecord 280 yards on 44 carries today as Southern Connecticut State College routed Ade1phi, 4512, before a home coming crowd of 2,700.

title: Preps
description: POTTSDOWN, Pa., Nov. 6The Hill School won its third game against three defeats and a tie by topping Peddie, 90, today.

title: Photography
description: A NEW portable strobe light with a full 200 watt second power supply has been announced by Berkey Technical, 2515 50th Street, Woodside, N.Y. 11377. Called the Ascorlight Candid 444, and priced at $320, the unit includes, in addition to the power supply, a fiveinch light, a rechargeable nickle cadmium battery and a charger. The power supply may be operated with either the battery, or with an accessory AC adapter, and the battery has resealable vented cells and a builtin circuitry the protects it against damage due to deep discharge or while charging.

title: Science
description: In short, the hologram reproduces in every detail, down to the fineness of a dust particle, the appearance of any scene that was photographed holographically. More than a mere magic trick, holography now finds spectacular work in computers, jet engine analysis, tire testing, machine shop work and microscopy, and there's more to come.

title: Preps
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 6 McBurney School scored with 1:15 to play today on a 42yard pass from Gene Healy to Kevin Franklin to defeat Englewood School, 2016, for its fourth victory in seven games.

title: Boston's ReElection of a Liberal Ran Counter to Mayoral Trend
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5In three of the four most important mayoral contests decided last Tuesdaythose in Philadelphia, Cleveland and San Franciscocandidates identified as stern guardians of law and order or as opponents of busing were successful.

title: Riders, Runners Try to Bridge a Compatibility Gap
description: Scholastic crosscountry runners who use Van Cortlandt Parkeon fall weekends have more than steep hills to contend with. Horses are disputing their right of way. Horseback riders, disturbed at the presence of the runnerswhich number almost 3,0000 on some Saturdaysthreaten the races, in general, and the athletes, in particular.

title: Canadians Edge Hawks, 21
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 6 (UPI)Guy Lapointe, a defenseman, scored the deciding goal on an arenalong, rush in the third period tonight as the Montreal Canadians defeated the Chicago Black Hawks, 21.

title: HAVLICEK GETS 32 AS CELTICS ROMP
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)John Havlicek and Art Williams combined for 59 points to spark the Boston Celtics to a 124109 National Basketball Association victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight.

title: Drive Across Mexico's Mountain Wall? No es Posible!
description: SOMEWHERE on Route 16, Mexico We have just crossed the state line between Sonora and Chihuahua,, high in the Sierra Madre range in northwestern Mexico, in spite of abundant advice that it could not be doneby automobile, that is. There was no one about to congratulate us on our feat, for few people live here, tourists are virtually unknown and travel is supposed to be impossible except by burro.

title: MT. HOLYOKE KEEPS ALLWOMEN STATUS
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., Nov. 6The trustees of Mount Holyoke College, which calls itself the country's oldest continuing institution of higher education for women, voted today not to open the school to men.

title: CHIEFS EXPECTED TO REST KEY MEN
description: Originally one of the American Conference's biggest games, the meeting of the Kansas City Chiefs and the New York Jets today at Shea Stadium has dissolved into an apparent mismatch. The Chiefs are 14point favorites.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONOne hour after leaving a White House session with President Nixon, who had asked his entire Cabinet to sit in, India's Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi, was telling a packed National Press Club lunch Friday about a reign of terror in East Pakistan.

title: Tobi Cohn Is Married
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 6 Miss Tobi Cohn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney D. Cohn of East Williston, was married here tonight to Joel Slutsky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Slutsky of Miami, Fla. Rabbi Eugene J. Lipsey formed the ceremony in Temple Judea.

title: Lighthouse By Eugenia Price. 342 pp. Philadelphia J. B. Lippincott Co. $6.95.
description: You've done it, James, Janie breathed. My dearest, you've built your lighthouse! And what a long, long road James has come, backward in time through two of the author's previous family sagas, to see his lifelong dream turn on. This is Eugenia Price's third novel about the Goulds of St. Simon's Island, Ga., but it's the earliest in point of time.

title: JOHN H. YOUNG, 55 AN AIDE OF HARYOU
description: John H. Young, director of public relations for Haryou, the antipoverty agency in Harlem, died yesterday of cancer in Harkness Pavilion, ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. His age was 55. He lived at 10 West 135th Street.

title: PLAN IS REVISED BY CITY COLLEGE
description: A revision of City College's building plan for a North Academic Center, smaller but more expensive than the one proposed originally, has been approved by a committee of the Board of Higher Education.

title: MISS CORTEZ SINGS LEAD IN CARMEN
description: Sympathy is in order for any singer who debuts in the Met's bizarre production of Carmen. Despite the distractions on stage, Viorica Cortez, a mezzo from Rumania, maneuvered her way through the title role Friday night with commendably smooth professionalism, although there was more promise than fulfillment in her performance.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: MAJOR BANKS reduced interest rates across a wide front, including home mortgages, personal loans and interest on savings Americans bought more than a million automobiles in October, setting a onemonth record for the industry. . . The T.C.C. told Boston & Maine trustees a plan of reorganization should be filed by the end of the year.

title: WISCONSIN WINS IN LAST 9 SECONDS
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 6 (AP) Alan Thompson scored from 3 yards out with 9 seconds left, after a 40yard pass from Neil Graff to Al Hannah, to rally Wisconsin to a 1410 Big Ten victory over Purdue today.

title: UNLIKELY SHERIFF ELECTED ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 6In this week's municipal election here it was the race for Mayor and a proposition that would have banned skyscraper building in this city that captured most of the attention.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR: The new transcontinental fare of $99 (T.W.A. and American Airlines) offered to wives and children accompanying businessmen on fourday trips was said in The Traveler's World column (Travel section, Sept. 19) to discriminate against unmarried businessmen and against those who work slower than the fourday wonders. True, but more serious discriminations are against nonbusinessmen and against businesswomen. A corollary of the sexist discrimination is that husbands of businesswomen are also victims. The limitation to businessmen also involves an invasion of privacy. Who is a businessman? How can this status be proved?

title: U.S Cuts Civilian Role, Too, in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 6Along with the American combat role in Vietnam, the United States advisory program, with its separate army of soldiers and civilians, is winding down.

title: Et AL.
description: The student protester who wrote The Strawberry Statement becomes witness in this paperback special to the National Veterans' Inquiry held in Washington in December, 1970. Kunen adds his own wry, personal commentary, notes, interpretations, feelings, introductory material and background to the Viet vets' testimony. As Kunen says, the inquiry turned up a series of little murders, no Mylais, merely napalming some villages, occasional torture. killing a P.O.W. here and there: in short, the fabric of the war is clear: these were not haphazard acts but the result of American policya policy implicitly dinned into every grunt from basic training on.

title: Blindness No Handicap to Queens Runner
description: In the early morning haze, the runner in white shirt and shorts glided along the streets, his head raised, his aims and legs pumping rhythmically. In his left hand he held a cane, which he sometimes extended, breaking his stride a bit. There was a minimum of traffic, few persons were about and the air was clean and cool.

title: Housewife Runs, Too
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I.  A growing number of people on Long Island are participating in marathon races on weekends.

title: Law Passed to Ban Killing Of Animals From Airplanes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  A Federal law against shooting bald eagles or any other birds, animals or fish from aircraft for sport has been passed by Congress and sent to President Nixon.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stamps
description: RARITIES will be the hallmark of ANPHILEX '71, the international stamp show opening on Nov. 26 and continuing to Dec. 1 at the WaldorfAstoria. Notable among single stamps will be the British Guiana 1c magenta of 1856, which fetched $280,000 at auction here in 1970. This stamp is the only one of its kind known, unique in any parlance.

title: F.D.A. Describes 1971 Toys As Safer Than Ever Before
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration, accused last year of dragging its feet on toy safety, said yesterday that Christmas toys will be safer this season and more sophisticated than ever before.

title: Gallardo and Maxwell Share Mexican Golf Lead at 205
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 6 (AP) Angel Gallardo of Spain carded a 7underpar 65 today and tied Billy Maxwell for the lead in the third round of the Mexican open golf tournament. Meanwhile, Lee Trevino lost ground with a 75.

title: Son to Mrs. Ivan Tiger
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Ivan Tiger of 221 West 82d Street and Shrub Oak, N. Y., on Oct. 27 In the Harkness Pavilion. The child has been named Robert Bradley.

title: New Quarterly Is Seeking to Link Philosopher's Skills to Politics
description: Plato studied the ideals and realities of politics in Athens, and the last word on the subject is spoken anew each month by about a dozen intellectuals who meet alternately in contemporary New York City and Cambridge, Mass.

title: NEY SALGADO GIVES KEYBOARD PROGRAM
description: Ney Salgado's keyboard command, while far from total, was entirely adequate to have made a success of his piano program at Carnegie Recital Hall on Thursday night. The Brazilian's tone, too, sounded rich in the small hall, and did not shatter or turn glassy when he leaned into the keys for fortissimos. His best moments came in two selections from Messiaen's Vingt regards sur l'enfant Jsus, when his sensitive blending of sonorities complemented the music's immobile nature.

title: Black Expo Here Hailed By Abernathy at Dinner
description: The Rev. Ralph David Abernathy, president of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, last night praised an exposition here by black businessmenas the total repudiation of the white man's idea that black men are only consumers, never, producers.

title: Judy Maccari, 13, Rides to Title
description: A 13yearold Floridian, Judy Maccari, is the National Horse Show saddleseat equitation champion for 1971.

title: A Revival Aheadfor Greenport?
description: GREENPORT, L. LIt all started with a closeddoor meeting by the Greenport Village Board to discuss a secret proposal concerning the development of a cargo port to revitalize the economy of this bucolic North Fork village.

title: Laura Mary Bishop to Be Bride of Jonathan Matson
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Nov. 6Miss Laura Mary Cuns ningham Bishop will be married here Jan, 15 in St. Mark's Episcopal Church to Jonathan Philip Matson.

title: Big Band Sound Coming Out of L. I.
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Among the wide range of Adult Education courses offered by the Massapequa schools  which include Astronomy from Your Backyard, Modern and Antique Clock Repairing, Dog Obedience, Macrame, MakeUp and Memory Training  is one called Big Band Sound.

title: Boston College Beats Syracuse In OffenseLarking Game, 103
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Nov. 6The parents of Syracuse students saw what college football was all about today as guests at Parents Week. Aid. They went away convinced that old movies on television were more exciting.

title: Movies
description: DO I have hard feelings toward my mother? Tuesday Weld opens her beautiful eyes wide, repeats the question and then flashes a radiant childwoman smile. I hate Mama!

title: The most famous modern poemwhat was left in and what was cut out
description: We have at last, in this new and luxurious book, the manuscript version of the most famous of modern poems, a version bound to raise whatever dust has settled over its celebrated lines. The poem appeared, with no notes, in October, 1922, in The Criterion; the notorious notes, by now almost canonically part of the poem, were added to fill out the manuscript for book publication in December. By the time of his death in 1965 Eliot was, principally on account of The Waste Land, a culture hero, attracting thousands to his lectures. His audiences were like lemmings: moving in obedience to obscure compulsions, they swarmed to hear him, filling halls to overflowing.

title: Pollution Dilution Issue In Blue Ridge Power Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Federal Government is nearining a decision on an issue that could have a farreaching effect on environmental policy. The issue is whether the clean waters of a rich, unspoiled and scenic river valley should be used to dilute industrial pollution hundreds of miles downstream rather than attempting to treat the pollution at the source.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Chaps Clip Cougars, 9792
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 6 (AP)The Dallas Chaparrals weathered a 14point last period by Jim McDaniels, who led all scorers with 30 points, to beat the Carolina Cougars, 97.92, tonight.

title: Art Notes
description: TIRED of Clairol commercials? Filled with lassitude by the Late, Late Show? Take a teletrip this week at the Finch College Museum of Art, and view some different talent on the boob tube: Dennis Oppenheim assaulting his face with an air hose, Kathy Dillon (directed by body sculptor Vito Acconcil) wrapping her self in rope, undergroundling Brigid Polk recalling a night on the town, poet Joanne Kyger having a fling with feedback.

title: Suffolk
description: Bayport emerged as Suffolk County's lone undefeated and untied team yesterday as it downed Wyandanch, 286, for its seventh victory. Central Islip had its perfect record blemished as Harborfields held the Musketeers to an 88 standoff.

title: Key West Ocean Powerboat Race Promoters Are Luring Sopwith
description: Promoters of Saturday's Hennessy Key West ocean powerboat race are doing their best to persuade Tommy Sopwith of Britain to compete in the 180mile event.

title: Television
description: WHEN it's not around we're kvetching. When it is around we're still kvetching. That's the way it is with the News Special.

title: ITALY IS BATTLING WATER POLLUTION
description: ROME, Nov. 6  Italy has embarked on a vigorous if belated offensive against the pollution of both internal and sea waters.

title: High Court, 4 to 3, Bars. Delay in Amchitka Blast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Confronted with the Government's warning that the international balance of deterrence against nuclear war could be upset by any delay of the hydrogen bomb test at Amchitka Island, the Supreme Court voted today, 4 to 3, not to postpone the blast.

title: Miss Parmele Plans Nuptials
description: SMOKE RISE, N. J., Nov. 6 The engagement of Miss Wendy Gray Parmele to Robert Mark Warburton has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Russell Bogert Parmele. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick R. Warburton Jr. of Fayson Lakes.

title: Kansas State Rallies, Tops Oklahoma State by 3523
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Nov. 6 (AP)A goalline stand midway in the third period today perked up Kansas State and the Wildcats on the passing of Dennis Morrison, scored a 3523 comeback victory over Oklahoma State.

title: MRS. GANDHI CALLS REFUGEES BURDEN
description: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India said, yesterday that the flow of refugees from East Pakistan had resulted in a terrific, burden on India and posed a real threat to our political stability and even our independence.

title: Lydell Mitchell Passes Lenny Moore's Old Career Rushing Mark at Penn State
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Nov. 6Lydell Mitchell continued to do his part in proving this is the year of the runner in college football when he ran for 209 yards, scored five touchdowns and set several of records as Penn State remained undefeated by trouncing Maryland, 6327, today.

title: Pop
description: I LOVE being called a pop musician now, you know. Its people music, as opposed to this is for folk people, and this is for jazz people, and what. Pop is for everybody. In the past you'd say, I don't need a number one, you know? Number one's not such a thing to be ashamed of; number one is the highest you can get, because it means you've pleased a lot of people.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Coney Fights Extension of a, Pollution Control Plant
description: Neighbors of the Coney Island Water pollution control plant in Brooklyn are circulating a petition against a proposed extension of the plant, which they complain has been polluting their air air with foul odors for years.

title: Preps
description: SIMSBURY, Conn., Nov. 6Mike Cady, the quarterback, picked up two touchdowns today to lead oncebeaten Westminster to a 2010 triumph over Berkshire. It was Westminster's fifth victory.

title: One Night the Dinosaurs Played Host to Chicago's Socially Elite
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6Social Note: Gorgosaurus, a flesheating dinosaur and Lambeosaurus, a vegetarian dinosaur, had the pleasure of attending the Jade Ball last night.

title: News of the Rialto
description: IS it possible that the Negro Ensemble Company is on its way to solidity and permanence in the otherwise shifting and generally volatile East Village theater scene? Douglas Turner Ward, playwright, actor and director, who has guided the artistic course of the company since its inception, in January, 1968, isn't saying yes and isn't saying no. But, in disclosing plans for the company's fifth season, he appeared happier, more relaxed and confident than in.some time.

title: Bridge
description: THE 4321 pointcount familiar to every beginner is used throughout the bridge world, and has hardly any rivals. It is commonly associated with the name of Milton Work, but was probably devised by a longforgotten auction bridge authority, Bryant McCampbell of St. Louis, Mo.

title: Operation Hire Backed
description: William H. Moore, chairman of the Bankers Trust Company, endorses U.S.O.'s new veterans' jobopportunity program: In response to the critical veterans un employment situation, U.S.O. has joined the Commerce and Industry Association of New York in supporting Operation Hirea truly efeffective program to assist returning servicemen and women in finding jobs in this area.

title: Et A1.
description: The West here is the Old Northwest: the present states of Ohio, Illinois, Indiana, etc.; this is mainly a military (and naval) account of the U.S. Government's attempts to keep the Indians under control for the benefit of white settlers. The grand climax is, of course, the War of 1812, when the enemy became the British as well as the Indians. Mr. Bird is an old band at this kind of historylargely narrative, little of it original, weak on interpretation; in a word, pleasant but dispensable.

title: New England Gets Increased U.S. Funds to Help Cut High Cancer Death Rate
description: HANOVER, N. H.Increased Federal money to fight cancer is beginning to trickle into New England, a region that currently leads the nation in the proportion of its citizens who die from the disease.

title: After Amchitka
description: The underground hydrogen bomb blast which regrettably the Supreme Court refused to postpone at the last minute yesterdaywas conducted at grave peril not only to the environment but, also in the broadest sense to world peace by giving another boost to the arms race. This latest and most dangerous in a persisting pattern of advance weapons testingby the Soviet Union as well as the United Stateslends urgency to Senator Muskie's recent challenge to President Nixon to move forward toward negotiations with the Russians on a comprehensive treaty banning all nuclear tests.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Dance
description: THE City Center Joffrey Ballet, while not perhaps offering that Climax promised by its overenthusiastic and overvulgar advertisers (if the Joffrey company persists in advertising itself as if it were either a brand of popcorn or a kind of sexual aid, it must not be surprised if some people believe it), has enjoyed a good and useful season at the City Center this fall. The Joffrey Ballet has become part of New York and one of the pleasanter parts at that.

title: Mideast Peace In Oil Drilling
description: TEL AVIVOn the Western Sinai Peninsula and offshore in the Gulf of Suez oil is being drilled for both by Egypt and Israel, with no regard to the hostilities between the two countries.

title: Art
description: COMING back on the plane from Cleveland after a trip that quite literally took hardly more time and was a lot pleasanter than a trip to Brooklyn on the subway, it occurred to me that one of those foundations that are always giving money to artists, frequently to so little effect, might do well to spread its funds across the country by paying' artists' way to exhibitions like Caravaggio and His Followers, an absolutely superb show at the Cleveland Museum of Art.

title: FRENCH POSITION OPPOSED IN E.E.C.
description: BRACCIANO, Italy, Nov. 6France found herself in disagreement with West Germany and Britain over EastWest talks on the security of Europe at a meeting here today of foreign ministers from the 10 states that would make up an enlarged European Economic Community.

title: Bargainers Uncertain
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6Bargainling is foundering in labor talks around the country as union and management negotiators find themselves locked in the confusion and uncertainties of the Nixon Administration's new economic policies.

title: Proposed Licensing of Boating Operators Comes Under Fire Once More
description: Boating officials and participants are expected to renew their opposition to operator licensing later this month in meetings at Tampa, Fla.

title: U.S. COMMUNICATIONS TO CHINA EXPANDED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Communication service between the United States and. China has been greatly expanded at the request of Peking, according to R.C.A. Global Communications, Inc.

title: GUARD'S CONDITION IN STABBING FAIR
description: The 67yearold security guard who was stabbed in the back following a disturbance at the Felt Forum boxing match on Friday night was listed yesterday as fair in the intensivecare unit at St. Clare's Hospital.

title: Et Al.
description: An anthology of speculations about the future of life on earth. Employing such thinkers as Buckminster Fuller and Herman Kahn, editor Kostelanetz has assembled a provocative set of essays on politics, knowledge, ecology, economics, planning, etc. The editor's introduction is breathless with the sheer whirl of ideas. Not for Luddites: technology is hotly embraced.

title: Shock Felt in Japan
description: TOKYO, Sunday, Nov. 7 (Reuters)A shock wave with a Richter scale magnitude of 7.0 reached Japan today, 6 minutes after the underground nuclear explosion in the Aleutians.

title: $100,000 Education Grant
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The New England Regional Commission said this week that it would give the Vermont Environmental Center $100,000 to continue its environmental education program. The center, in Ripton, Vt., provides laboratory environment training to New England teachers.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: PassaicHudson5
description: Bayonne's powerful football team rolled to a 4913 victory over Dickinson yesterday as Dave Annetta scored three touchdowns.

title: AFRICAN LEADERS SEE SADAT ON PEACE
description: CAIRO, Nov. 6Meeting with an African peacemaking mission, President Anwar elSadat declared today that Israel could never expect peace with the Arabs until Israeli troops had evacuated all Arab lands occupied in the 1967 war.

title: Miss Pingitore Wed To Henry Elliott Jr.
description: Miss Diane Pingitore, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Nicholas E. Pingitore of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Henry P. Elliott Jr., son of Mrs. Elliott of New York and Rumson, N. J., the late Mr. Elliott. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Thomas Nielson in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.

title: 3,000Student College In Huntington Sought
description: DIX HILLS, L. I.,  A Wooded lot adjacent to the Long Island Expressway in this Huntington community will be the site of the western Suffolk campus of Suffolk Community College if the County Legislature, the State University of New York and the owners of the property all agree.

title: Preps
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 6Moses Brown rolled to its sixth straight victory today with a 540 rout of Pomfret. Nine Moses Brown players scored 6 points apiece.

title: Janet Paley Engaged
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Nov. 6Dr. and Mrs. George E. Paley have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Janet Ruth Paley, to Donald Lee Sapir. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Isidore Sapir of Yonkers and Putnam Valley, N. Y.

title: Chattanooga Times Names Norman Bradley as Editor
description: CHATTANOOGA, Nov. 6The appointment of Norman Bradley as editor of The Chattanooga Times was announced today by the morning newspaper's publisher, Mrs. Ruth S. Golden,

title: The World
description: JAMBU, India  The wooden motor launch chugged slowly against the tide, pulling two country boats laden with sacks of rice for the scattered villagers of the lowlands southwest of Calcutta. The convoy passed by a ruined house, recognizable only by the twisted remains of the banana trees that had once formed a neat square around its mud walls and straw roof. The owner of the house sat nearly naked on the river bank, staring ahead not caring about the boats, nor about the food, nor about anything at all.

title: Bruins Vanquish Red Wings, 21, on 3dPeriod Goals by Bucyk and Esposito
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6 (AP) Johnny Bucyk snapped a scoreless deadlock at 4 minutes 29 seconds of the third period today with his seventh goal of the season and the Boston Bruins defeated the Detroit Red Wings, 21.

title: Fairfield Loses in Soccer
description: OLD WESTBURY, L.I., Nov, 6  A firstperiod goal by Jurgen Strifler sent New York Tech's soccer team on its way to a 30 victory over Fairfield today. The triumph was the sixth in a row for the Bears, who now have a 931 wonlosttied mark.

title: Braves Rout Bulls, 13099
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 6 (AP)Randy Smith left the bench to score 22 points and spark the Buffalo Braves to a 13099 victory over the Chicago Bulls tonight.

title: The Suburbs Have
description: A FEW years ago, socially conscious residents of the New York suburbs joined in a project that occupied several spring weekends: they chose blocks in the East Harlem and BedfordStuyvesant ghettos and traveled to them in teams, equipped with paint, brushes, buckets and mops, for cooperative cleanup, fixup sessions with the residents. This was a way for middleclass people to experience and, at the same time, try to help solve the neighborhood problems of the ghettos.

title: NADER GROUP SCORES. RECLAMATION UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) A Ralph Nader study group charged today that the United States Bureau of Reclamation had outlived its usefullness and should halt its senseless damming of the West.

title: Art
description: TWO artists displaced by history  George Grosz and Max Beckmannare the subjects of rewarding current exhibitions. The Richard Feigen Gallery, 27 East 79th Street, is showing a selection of Grosz' drawings and watercolors, dating from 1912 to 1920 when the artist was at the height, of his powers as a chronicler of the decadence of German society before and after World War I. The Serge Sabarsky Gallery, 987 Madison Avenue, has mounted a capsule retrospective of Beckmann's paintings, prints and drawings, ranging from an early impressionistic portrait of an old fisherman (1907) to the solid and handsome Three Women, painted in New York in 1950, the year of Beckmann's death.

title: SUITS SEEK TO BAR APOWER STATION
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 6 The Attorney General of Illinois, William J. Scott, has filed suit in Federal District Court in Washington to prevent the Atomic Energy Commission from granting even a partial operating permit for the $200million QuadCities nuclear generating station at Cordova, Ill.

title: Son for Ira Weissmans
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 6 A son was born to Mr. and Mrs, Ira Weissman Oct. 21 at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center in New York. Mrs. Weissman, a neurologist, is known as Dr. Myrna J. Schear. Her husband is, vice president of Imperia Foods. The child has been named Marlowe Schear.

title: Bourguiba Relents in His Fight To Curb Excesses of Ramadan
description: TUNISThe Government of Tunisia has stopped fighting Ramadan. Its campaign against the monthlong religious observance is what is believed to be the only effort in the Moslem world to do away with centuries of religious and social tradition in the interest of economic development.

title: China Expected to Champion Underdeveloped Lands at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6Peking has left no economic or political stone unturned this year in its effort to assert itself as the undisputed champion of the world's underdeveloped nations, an effort that probably will be enhanced by its entry in the United Nations.

title: More East Germans Flee to West Since Berlin Accord
description: BERLIN, Nov. 6What is in the agreement for us? the young East Berliner asked, shrugging his shoulders.

title: Innovation Must Go On
description: STAMFORD, Conn.When Homo sapiens appeared on the earth, more or less in his present shape, innovation began. Early Man was equipped with the same sort of brain that later could write the Principia Philosophies Naturatis and the Principle Mathematica, but the brain was almost empty. First had to come the greatest of all inventions: language; then tools, weapons and a primitive social organization suitable for agriculture and the domestication of animals. Then, much later, came writing and what we now call history.

title: OBSERVER
description: Secretary of State Rogers has ruled that persons who refuse to swear allegiance to the Constitution can no longer have passports. It would probably be excessive to say that this is the dumbest thing the Government has done all week, but the logic behind it is hard to grasp.

title: Curette Scores by Length At Calder and Pays $28.60
description: MIAMI, Nov. 6 (AP)Curette led from start to finish in scoring an upset victory today in the $10,000 added Ponce de Leon Handicap at Calder Race Course.

title: IWATA IS STOPPED BY MARCANO IN 4TH
description: CARACAS, Nov. 6 (UPI)Venezuela's Alfredo Marcano made the first defense of his World. Boxing Association junior lightweight title a successful one tonight with a fourthround technical knockout over Kenji Iwata of Japan.

title: CHARGENRS BRING 44 RECORD HERE
description: For the first time since their opening game the New York Giants take the field today with no clearcut basis for forecast. They face the San Diego Chargers, a team they have never played before in a National Football League game, and one as subject to inconsistency as the Giants themselves.

title: Mining the Land
description: Strip mining used to be a small part of the coal mine industry in this country. But economic pressures and the invention of improved machinery have produced such rapid expansion that last year twofifths of the nation's coal production came from strip mines. Huge machines several stories high have already clawed and gouged enough land to make a swath a mile wide from New York to San Francisco.

title: Photography
description: IF the letters in response to my column of Aug. 29 are any indication, that articlein which I enumerated my reservations about most contemporary color photography  touched a sore spot. A number of letters ardently pro and con color came in, and, white. I want to get to the significant portions of these responses, I'd first like to clear up a few misconceptions of my own attitude toward color which seem somehow to have crept into the argument.

title: PROGRAM OF SONG BY TESSA WILLIAMS
description: Tessa Williams, who had a flurry of Broadway and concert activity as a child prodigy but had not performed here in manyb years, made her official recital debut Friday night at Town Hall. The English born soprano, now a resident of Topeka, Kan., carries herself well on stage, displaying confidence in her manner and musicality in her singing.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FOURTH MUSQUACOOK LAKE, Me.Rain, which had been falling intermittently all day, streamed down from the dark skies and I retreated under a large spruce hoping it would abate.

title: Manhattan Harrier String Reaches 21
description: Mike Keogh and Tony Colon led Manhattan College to its 21st consecutive dual meet victory yesterday, at 1940 decision over Fordham University at Van Cortlandt Park.

title: CHANGES AT PAPER STIR SPECULATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 The Washington Post, the city's largest and most influential newspaper, has undergone a recent and rapid series of changes among key business and editorial executives.

title: Austria Pats Oft Deadline For Wartime Art Claims
description: VIENNA, Nov. 6The expiration date for claims to art treasures pillaged under the Nazi regime and still in the care of Austria has been extended for a year to Dec. 31, 1972. The total value of the art treasures is said to be quite substantial.

title: The Carter Burden qruestionCan a rich, handsome young member of the Jet Set from Dry Dock Country find happiness as a reform machine pol?
description: PRIMARY DAY, not many weeks ago, and it is raining in East Harlem. Five o'clock of a gray, damp Tuesday, and the polls, which are to be open today from 3 o'clock in the afternoon until 10 o'clock at night, have been open now for two hours. In the storefront election headquarters of Eugene F. Nardelli, a 37yearold lawyer who is running for the office of Democratic district leader in the 68th Assembly District, Part B, a cloud of gloom hangs heavily over the 20 or so campaign workers who are either slumped in folding chairs or pacing aimlessly about the long, narrow, lowceilinged room, once the home of an establishment known as Coppola's Pizzeria. Sighs. Frowns. Unhappy shakes of the head. Rain on Primary Day almost inevitably means a light turnout of voters, mainly of clubhouse regulars who'd manage to get to the polls even in the midst of a hurricane, and so the rainy weather favors the incumbent. And Nardelli's opponent, Frank. G. Rossetti, the 63yearold county leader of Manhattan's Democrats, is nothing if not an incumbenthe has been entrenched as the district leader of the 68th Assembly District, Part B, for 30 years. So, all in all, Nardelli's workersa more or less equal mixture of Puerto Ricans and Italianshave every right to be gloomy.

title: Rat Control Program Cuts Incidence of Bites Here
description: The city's campaign against rats was credited yesterday with contributing to a 30 pert cent reduction in reported rat bites in the first nine months this year as compared with a year ago.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Biggest Nuclear Blasts Are Listed by the A.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  The largest nuclear explosions, according to the Atomic Energy Commission, are the folowing:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Good Word: Unnecessary Roughness
description: The literature of nausea has come to professional football: the I Was a Vampire for the Chicago Bears school for one crowd, and I Was a Rich Owner's Plaything for the other. On the constitutional principle that anything we enjoy that much must be evil, we have begun gobbling up expos4s like health foodbook upon relentless book proving the essential rottenness of coaches, players, hotdog purveyors, and even us fans. It is a brandnew chapter in the history of meaningless outrage.

title: DELAWARE CRUSHES LEHIGH TEAM, 4922
description: NEWARK, Del., Nov. 6 (UPI) Gardy Kahoe ran for four touchdowns and Phil Armstrong added two as Delaware trounced Lehigh today, 4922.

title: Proposal for a U.N. University May Come to Vote in Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Oct. 30The idea of a United Nations University with a string of postgraduate research centers scattered around the globe has made substantial progress here in recent months and may come to a vote during the current General Assembly session.

title: Miss Laurie E. Mainthow Is Affianced
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 6 The engagement of Miss Laurie E. Mainthow to Simon Klebanow, son of Mrs. Barbara Halpern and Bernard Klebanow, both of New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Myron M. Mainthow of Scarsdale. Klebanow, both of New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Myron M. Mainthow of Scarsdale.

title: You've Read the PaperbackWill You Buy the Hardcover?
description: I was recently bookstorehopping one fine morning in San Francisco with a hip young Bay Area publisher out of the Whole Earth school, and we paused in the children's book department of one large store to note with pleasure that Harper & Row had had the wit to turn our favorite children's book in some years, Maurice Sendak's In the Night Kitchen into a coloring book ($1.95) My friend wondered aloud: What disturbs me is, where are the juvies for the children of longhairs'? An attractive matron within earshot who was picking through titles immediately turned on us and sharply replied, Speaking as one who wants her children to go the other way, I can tell you that there are too damn many of them!

title: Columbia Beats Dartmouth
description: Columbia upset Dartmouth, 3129, yesterday at Baker Field, in Dartmouth's first defeat of the season. Unbeaten and untied Cornell stopped Brown, 217, and took the Ivy League lead. Details in Section 5.

title: Slayer of Driver Who Killed His Son Awarded $125,000
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Nov. 6 (AP)On Sept. 3, 1969, Eugene Friedman's only child was hit by a truck and died. Eight months later, Friedman shot and killed the man who had been driving the truck.

title: BOYS HIGH VICTOR IN CROSSCOUNTRY
description: Boys High, better known as sprint power, captured the Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry title yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Preps
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 6The passing combination of Bob Stockman to Tom Haggerty accounted for all the winner's scoring today as St. Paul's defeated Lawrence, 86, for its third victory in six games.

title: Riverdale Tops Hackley
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 6 Riverdale collected 20 points in the second period today and went on to defeat Hackley, 328. Riverdale, still undefeated after seven games this season, was led by Marshall Hagen, who completed eight passes for 154 yards and two touchdowns and also passed for a 2point conversion. Hackley is now 52.

title: A memento for collector
description: Four years after Carson McCullers's death, her sister has brought together some of her miscellaneous writings: seven uncollected apprentice stories (plus the familiar Wunderkind, her first published story) and four later ones; some casual essays, written mostly for fashion magazines; a handful of poems; an outline of the novelinprogress that became The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter, along with two unclassifiable fictional fragments that look like beginnings of scrapped novels, written even earlier than that famous first book. It's sad to find that none of these shows Carson McCullers at anything like her best. The is memento for collectors.

title: 4 in Soviet Leave Embassy
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Four Armenian students who wanted to go to Britain left the British Embassy tonight after more than 32 hours. The fourtwo men and two women arrived at the Embassy at noon Friday to inquire about going to Britain, an Embassy official said, and then refused to leave.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Is America Falling Apart?
description: BRACCIANO, Italy.

title: Sara Aldrich Briggs is Affianced
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 6 Mr. and Mrs. John D. Briggs have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sara Aldrich Briggs, to Kirkland Hopkins Gibson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kirkland H. Gibson of Pojac Point, North Kingstown, R. I. The wedding is planned for June.

title: Nebraska Beats Iowa State, 370, as Rodgers Scores on 62Yard Punt Return
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Nov. 6 (UPI) No. 1 ranked Nebraska combined its strong defense with the running of Johnny Rodgers and the fieldgoal kicking of Rich Sanger to post a 370 victory over Big Eight rival, Iowa State, today.

title: Radio Station Helps in Rescuing Suicide Caller
description: At about 2:45 yesterday morning, a man telephoned Radio Unnamable, a WBAI talk and music show, and told its moderator, Bob. Fass, and the station's listeners, I'm going to commit suicide.

title: Thousands Join in War Protest
description: Thousands of men, women and children from the metropolitan area joined in a parade here yesterday to protest the war in Vietnam, the wage freeze, racism, what happened at Attica and what was going to happen at Amchitka.

title: Miss. Dana Crane Haussamen is Bride of Richard Paul. Rust
description: In the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More here yesterday morning, Miss Dana Crane Haussamen was married to Richard Paul Rust by the Rev. John Calhoun.

title: Kurt D. Moses, Soldier, Weds Miss Blettner
description: WINNETKA, Ill., Nov 6 Miss Elizabeth Mary Blettner was married in a chapel of the Winnetka Congregational Church this afternoon to Specialist 5 Kurt Davis Moses, who is serving with the Army in Munich, Germany.

title: Martha Robbins, Educator, Bride Of Roland Black
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 6  Miss Martha Robbins, principal of the Cathedral School of St. Mary here, was married today in the chapel of the school to Roland Newbury Black, a retired Bell Telephone executive, also of Garden City. The Rev. Dr. George T. Gruman, chaplain of the school, officiated. He was assisted by the Right Rev. Jonathan G. Sherman, Episcopal Bishop of Long Island, and the Rev. Richard B. Smith, minister of the Garden City Community Church.

title: How to Succeed In Undertaking: Go to School
description: The most important quality for a funeral director is charisma and that's something a school can't teach you, said Fred Skrocki, a recent graduate of American Academy McAllister Institute, a school for undertakers in New York.

title: Et Al.
description: In handbook form, arranged by topic, a concise discussion of the state of the law in various areas of civil liberties. Mr. Fraenkel, who has been active in the American Civil Liberties Union for 35 years, is admirably concise, occasionally skirting oversimplification. Nonetheless, a useful book for the citizenespecially in view of the fact that local lawenforcement agencies often ignore Supreme Courtordained niceties.

title: SENATOR SCORES U.S. COAL LEASES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Senator Gaylord Nelson said today that the Interior Department, in apparent violation of the law, had made little or no investigation of the environmental consequences of the largescale strip mining for coal that the Government is encouraging in states west of the Mississippi River.

title: Farmers Urged to Warn About MarijuanaGrowers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 6 (UPI) Farmers have been urged in the interests of lawenforcement and protecting their own pocketbooks to call the police if anyone tries to harvest wild marijuana or banned drug plants growing on their land.

title: MANY PRISONERS PRAISE LEESBURG
description: LEESBURG, N. J., Nov. 5Away from his pastelled cell and artfully barred picture window, a convict at the new showcase state prison here told of trouble in his relatively pleasing limbo.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Economic Aid Asked in Japan By McNamara and McCracken
description: TOKYO, Nov. 6  Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank, and Paul W. McCracken, chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers, were here to day Japan for economic help.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Notes on the Occasion of Having Line of Least Existence & Other Plays Remaindered at Marboro Book Shops
description: WHEN I was a kid, nobody I knew went to the theater. We were too poor. Our big thing was the movies. I saw all the Marx Brothers pictures because besides being great entertainment I was related to Chico: my father's cousin was married to him. Chico's mother, whom We called Tante, had once lived with my grandma, and they all considered it a kind of miracle that the boys had become Hollywood stars.

title: Darrel Mansell Jr., Teacher, Weds Miss Kathleen Linkous
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 6In St. Thomas Episcopal Church here this morning, Miss Kathleen Linkous, a member of the office staff at the Amos Tuck School of Business Administration at Dartmouth College, was married to Darrel Mansell Jr., associate professor of English at Dartmouth.

title: BQLI Mailbag
description: During the nineteenthirties and forties St. Michael's School in Brooklyn held its graduation exercises at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. This event occurred once a year in April. Along with the graduation, Grades 1 through 7 presented plays. Early in February, just as the monotony of the winter was showing its depressing effects, Madame Ballantine, an elocution teacher and former actress, descended upon the school to cast the plays  comedies, musicals, dramas and any combination her talented and magical mind could conjure up. There were parts for everyone, many of them created by Madame.

title: HELMS TOLD TO CUT GLOBAL EXPENSES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 President Nixon has given Richard Helms, his Director of Central Intelligence, new orders and new authority  to trim costs and improve the output of the nation's global intelligence system.

title: Our Gang (Starring Tricky and His Friends.) By Philip Roth. 201 pp. New York: Random House. $5.95.
description: Philip Roth has become as hard to classify as Norman Mailer. His first book, Goodbye, Columbus, fitfully brilliant collection of short stories on JewishAmerican themes, won the 1960 National Book Award. Was he the new Bellow? His next, Letting Go (1962), was a regression to conventional JewishAmerican fiction, turgid with angst and alienation. The new Malamud? Five years later he published When She Was Good, a psychological dissection of a sick (gentile) heroine in the context of a sick (gentile) society done with 19thcentury amplitude. It didn't work. Is a new Flaubert or Eliot (George) possible?

title: Article 11  No Title
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 6 (AP)Unbeaten Georgia hammered out its ninth football victory today, crushing Florida by 497.

title: Rep. Wydler Becomes Man to See in Capitol
description: WASHINGTONAccording to some of his friends in the House, Representative John W. Wydler, Republican of Nassau County, has had a new surge of popularity recently among his fellow Long Island Representatives.

title: Baseball? It Seems Like Only Yesterday.
description: Now that the baseball season is over, it's time forwell, baseball. And in 17 camps from Florida to Arizona, almost 500 players are turning into the final week of the twomonth autumn season that for 14 years has marked the sport's first harbinger of spring.

title: Price Rises Planned
description: Businessmen across the nation declared last week that President Nixon's economc stabilization program had been little more than a temporary holding action against inflation, and had failed to eliminate inflationary psychology.

title: Crack Ruler Defeats Laplander by a Neck and Survives Foul. Claim at Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 6Buck Ridge Stable's Crack Ruler, a multiple stakes winner through the years, survived a claim of foul and won the $24,650 Constellation Handicap today before a crowd of 15,335 at Laurel Race Course.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDTIOR:

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Nov. 6Despite a schoolrecord passing performance by Joe Bolton, Lutheran dropped a 3622 game to Xavier today. Bolton, a quarterback, completed 19 of 38 passes for a record 325 yards and two touchdowns.

title: The New Uniform Suits Cazzie Russell Just Fine
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 5 A few minutes after Cazzie Russell's jump shot with five seconds to play had given the Golden State Warriors a 9896 victory over the Seattle Supersonics here Thursday night, a friend of the former New York Knickerbocker asked him how his golf game was going?

title: LEBANON FIRER WITH AGITATORS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 6The Lebanese Government has decided to deal more firmly with what is known here as the political underground.

title: Army Defeats N.Y.U., 21, In Soccer on Nelson's Goal
description: Randy Nelson's second goal of the game gave Army a 21 soccer triumph over New York University yesterday at Ohio Field in the Bronx.

title: Nader Report Charges That Connecticut Commissioner Is Not Acting as Champion of the Consumedr'
description: Ralph Nader has called on Connecticut's Commissioner of Consumer Protection to start action now against major consumer complaints on file in her department.

title: PRINCETON MEETING BARS SOME SPONSORS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 6A group of faculty members and administrative officials of Princeton University were barred from a Puerto Rican studies conference here today, though they had helped to organize it. At least one of the officials said he was told that whites were not welcome.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: VIENNA  Aladdin recovered his magic power successfully by trading new lamps for old, but it has yet to be proved that one can emulate the formula in the realm of foreign policy. President Nixon is now engaged in the risky business of substituting new myths for old. Whether he achieves the same success as Aladdin remains for history to decide.

title: A New Black MagicAnd They Weave It Well
description: FLASH, as a register of Black American life, is style gone beyond, behavior and appearance taken past the perimeters of respectability, taken outsido. Brother glitters on the weekend, gliding from his car in the bar with the original Temptations fingerpopping in hip brain, Sister cursing out whichever social worker, defiantly asserting both her right and her will to live, spectacular clothes and freakish shoes to match or not match, knowing how to use the word fly as an admiring adjective . . . flashall flash.

title: Big Changes Due In L.I.R. Schedules
description: Long Island Railroad riders will have an entirely new train schedule sometime next year, a spokesman for the railroad said. He added, however, that any new schedule must be worked out with the various unions that have contracts with the railroad.

title: Malaysia Fencing In China Sympathizers to Keep Out Infiltrators
description: KOALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Malaysia has begun to fence in villages of Chinese Communist sympathizers in a fresh drive to prevent them from contacting some 1,200 guerrillas infiltrating south from sanctuaries in southern Thailand.

title: A monster was made to avoid a massacre
description: This book, as every good book must, touches on dangerous matters. Ritual murder, bigotry, priestly dealings with magic and demons, the abyss of orphanhood, disobedience to authorities, questions about Jewish guilt for Christ's death and Christian guilt for ghetto massacres, and, above all, man's urge to create servant monsters of a kind that have a Way of getting out of hand. These are the obdurate materials from which Sulamith IshKishor has shaped a moving story of a rabbi, a boy and a golem.

title: McGovern Names Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, announced today the appointment of John Reuther, 27 years old, son of Victor Reuther, a labor leader, as his Massachusetts campaign coordinator.

title: Jaimsie Triumphs by Neck In Sportsman's Park Mile
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6 (AP)3aimsie, ridden by Lonnie Ray, held off a stretch challenge by Nasoma's Baby today for a neck victory in the $22,050 Thomas D. Nash Memorial Handicap at Sportsman's Park.

title: Remember Those Old Post Covers?
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass.When The Saturday Evening Post reemerged recently as a quarterly magazine, the first issue featured a cover photograph of Norman, Rockwell, tha painter. Anyone looking at the photograph could not help recalling Rockwell's famous Post cover paintings of yesteryear (317 in all). Remember Willie Gillis and After the Prom? The originals of these and many others are now on view in the Old Corner House, a restored 18thcentury Georgian home on Main Street here. It is two blocks from the studio where Rockwell, though he will be 78 in February, still paints daily. The most popular Rockwells, such as The Golden Rule and Self Portrait, are on permanent display in the, Old Corner House; others are rotated regularly, with about 65 being shown at any one time.

title: Platform Tennis Show To Feature Stan Smith
description: Stan Smith the Army private who helped the United States keep the Davis Cup and who won the United States Open at Forest Hills last September, will try his racquet skills in a platform tennis exhibition at the Columbia Country Club, Chevy Chase, Md., next Sunday. The exhibition, which will start at 11:30 A.M., is part of a twoday platform tennis program.

title: Kick Boxing in Debut Tuesday at Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 6 (UPI)  A sport being introduced into the United States makes its debut Tuesday in this gambling resort.

title: L.I. Man and Daughter, 15, Missing on a Fishing Trip
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 6 (AP)A search was under way by the Coast Guard tonight for a Long Island man and his 15yearold daughter whose boat was discovered unoccupied and run aground near here, officials said.

title: UTILITYRATE LINK TO SERVICE URGED
description: Mayor Lindsay called yesten day for changing the standards for publicutility rates, which, he said, have up to now been based on profits rather than service.

title: Ford Creek Rinko Wins Spaniel Open Field Trial
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y., Nov. 6Ford Creek Rinko, a 5yearold owned by Dean Bedford of Fallston, Md., and handled by Larry MacQueen, won the English springer spaniel open allage stake at the 38th annual field trial of the Connecticut Spaniel Field Trial Association today at the Clay Hill Shooting Preserve.

title: Recordings
description: RAY CHARLES: A 25th Anniversary in Show Business Salute to Ray Charles (ABC Records). After 25 years as a magnificent pop singer and musician, Ray Charles, despite his popularity, and despite the respect with which he is viewed by his fellow professionals, still hasn't received the acknowledgement he deserves. Although their styles are in no way comparable, Charles is surely the most original Major male singer to arrive since Frank Sinatra. And the persistent versatility of his perfofmanceswhether he is growling his way through a talking blues like Understanding, finding a new image for Eleanor Rigby or cracking open an old chestnut like Swanee Riveris unmatched by any performer I know.

title: POST TROUNCES ITHACA BY 620
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Nov. 6What was billed as a battle between the two best quarterbacks in the East, Gary Wichard of C. W. Post and Doug Campbell of Ithaca College became a oneman show today as Post defeated the Ithaca Bombers, 620.

title: Rule Sought on Board Members Leaving Their School Districts
description: The Board of Education has asked the city's Corporation Counsel for a ruling on whether community school board members must resign if they move out of their districts.

title: Atlanta Will Vote Tuesday On Rapid Transit System
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 6A proposed rapid transit rail and busway system for this metropolitan, area of 1.5 million people will be voted on Tuesday in a fourcounty referendum.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: MadridPedro Carrasco, 134 pounds, Spain, won by disqualification from Armando Ramos, 134, United States, 12 rounds; Carrasco wins world title.

title: Conservationists Ask New Hearing on Con Ed Plan
description: Conservationists have applied for a new hearing in the United States Court of Appeals here on a major case focusing on the role that Federal courts can play to protect the nation's environment.

title: TEXAS PREVAILS OVER BAYLOR, 240
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 6 (AP)Eddie Phillips, the Texas quarterback, crippled nearly all season, guided the Longhorns to a 170 halftime lead today then watched from the sidelines as Texas defeated Baylor, 240.

title: Those Arabists In the State Department
description: THE Department of State's specialists on the Near East were almost without exception unfriendly to the idea of a Jewish state. ... Some thought the Arabs, on account of their number and because of the fact that they controlled such immense oil resources, should be appeased. . . . Some among them were also inclined to be antiSemitic . . .I wanted to make plain that the President of the United States, and not the State Department, is responsible for making foreign policy.

title: Groppi Is Reported Paying Extra 1967 Tax and Penalty
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 6 (AP)The Rev. James E. Groppi paid extra income taxes and penalties in 1967 after the Internal Revenue Service had advised him that he had understated his income, according to Attorney General Charles Black.

title: Northport Gym Team Unbeaten in Five Years
description: NORTHPORT, L. I. Thirty boys from Northport High School who prefer swinging on parallel bars and vaulting on sawhorses to the more conventional scholastic activities of tossing footballs and shooting baskets compete tomorrow against Walt Whitman High in their last meet of the year with high hopes of keeping an enviable record intact.

title: More at Stake Than a Queens Hill
description: When Charles Copas left for work early in the crisp fall morning, the little green hill still sloped down from the rear of his home. When he returned late that afternoon, most of the hill  and nearly all of the treeswere gone. A flash of raw earth, wide enough for a couple of trucks, had been bulldozed through what was once a knoll at the base of the hill.

title: Foreign Debt Mounts
description: Israel's overall foreign debt has risen nearly three times since the end of 1966 to $3.4billion.

title: Soviet Port Reflects Booth
description: ILYICHEVSK, U. S. S. R., Nov. 1The Soviet freighter Captain Plaushevsky, bound from Soviet Georgia for Japan with a load of ores and cotton, nosed through the fog and dropped anchor at Ilyichevsk, the fastestgrowing port on the Black Sea and now one of the Stiviet Union's main gateways to. Eurdps Africa and Asia.

title: Mrs. Nathalie Saxenmeyer Is Wed
description: MADISON, Conn., Nov. 6Mrs. Nathalie Compton Saxenmeyer, widow of John Paul Saxenmeyer, was married here at noon today to Kevin Michael Logan, son of Dr. and Mrs. William Joseph Logan of New Haven. The Rev. Frank Matera of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Margaret performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Douglass Mabee Compton, parents of the bride. Earlier in the day Father Matera celebrated a special mass for the couple in the church.

title: Philippine Army on Alert For Elections Tomorrow
description: MANILA, Nov. 6 (AP)One of the bloodiest Philippine lelection campaigns in history drew toward a close today with the army on the alert and Filipinos obsersving an unaccustomed prohibition on drinking. The bars closed on Friday for three days.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: LIBERAL POET WINS SOVIET STATE PRIZE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6Aleksandr T. Tvardovsky, Soviet poet and former editor of the literary journal Novy Mir, was among figures in the arts and sciences, awarded the State Prize for 1971 today.

title: Exultation and lament
description: A tirade on passion, loyalty, race, religion, ambition and death is what Eugene Sonny Joiner calls at least part of this account of how he came out of Mississippi and is preparing to go back. If we allow the widest range of ambiguities to the epithet, it can fairly be applied to the whole gargantuan medley of this splendid first novel.

title: Stars Shine in Overtime
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 6 (AP) Willie Wise hit two free throws with a minute to play tonight to give the Utah Stars a 108107 victory over the Indiana Pacers in overtime.

title: Alabama Beats L.S.U., 147, For Its 9th Straight Triumph
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 6 (AP)Jerry Davis ran 16 yards for a thirdperiod touchdown as Alabama remained unbeaten by trimming Louisiana State, 147, tonight.

title: Pakistan Charges Indians Use Tanks in Border Attack
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 6The Pakistani Government said that tanks were used today in an attack on an East Pakistani border outpost, the first such reported use of Indian tanks in the border clashes that have been the subject of Pakistani statements for weeks.

title: N. Hampshire, in 4th Period, Ties With Springfield, 2424
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 6  The University of New Hampshire scored 14 points in fourth quarter to tie Springfield College, 2424, today.

title: Rate increase for LILCO Ordered Held in Abeyance
description: ALBANY, Nov. 5Citing a need for further study, the Public Service Commission today ordered held in abeyance a utility rate increase that would have given the Long Island Lighting Company an additional $5,958,000 annually.

title: 15 Actors Star in a Videotape Experiment
description: A Police Department moviemaking program got off to a poor start in Queens because the starsallegedly drunken driversrefused at first to give permission to be photographed. By last week, however, 15 had taken part.

title: INDIANS FEARFUL IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Nov. 6The large Indian community in South Africa's Natal Province is apprehensive because of a recent crackdown by security police, and further repression is feared.

title: Music
description: So Bobby Fischer has done it again. The young genius of Ameriican chess has eaten up Tigran Petrosian of the Soviet Union. That now out of the way, he will play Boris Spassky for the world's championship in the spring. There must be a lot of dithering at the Moscow Chess Club. It was not so much that Bobby beat Petrosian; it was the way he did it. Petrosian, one of the great chess technicians in history, draws more and loses less than any grandmaster. The morning line on the FischerPetrosian match had Fischer only a slight favorite. The betting had only a onepoint spread, and the handicappers figured on a 65 finish in the 12game match (the first player to reach 6 points being declared the winner). But Bobby finished with a fourgame winning streak, and the final score was 6 2.

title: Albright Wins Pretzel Bowl
description: READING, Pa., Nov. 6 (UPI)  Albright downed Lebanon Valley, 167, today in the 21st annual Shrine Pretzel Bowl.

title: Colonel Herbert:
description: ATLANTAAfter two convoluted years, the case of Anthony B. Herbert seemed last week to have reduced itself to a simple question: Is he telling the truth?

title: A Tortephile on the Loose
description: VIENNAIf there is anything that this whippedcream baroque city on the Danube is, it's the pastry capital of the world. Oh, Vienna has its Boys Choir, Staatsoper, Philharmonic and Hofburg. But these musical and architectural delights scarcely compare with the wonders that await the tortephilic traveler.

title: Pay Board Fails to Act on a New Proposal on Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Business representatives came up with a new proposal today for wage increases during the economic stabilization program, but a meeting of the Pay Board broke up this afternoon without reaching any decision.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: L.I. Conservatives Hurt by CrossEndorsement Ban
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I. The Conservatives rejoiced a year ago that they were now a power to reckon with as their candidate, James L. Buckley, was elected United States Senator from New York, the first member of their party to win national office.

title: Even Ohio Comics Say They're From Brooklyn
description: The question of Brooklyn comedians is certainly not a serious one, yet it cries out for the sort of thing social scientists are always doing: defining the issue.

title: WILSON PICKETT SINGS AT BEACON
description: Wilson Pickett, a living definition of soul, made two rare uptown appearances Friday and Saturday nights at the Beacon Theater. Like James Brown and the late Jimi Hendrix, his singing can most accurately be described as an experience rather than a performance.

title: Reader's Report
description: This is the second volume of the series that began with God Is an Englishman. It demonstrates once again, as does the reincarnated Forsyte Saga, that There Will Always Be An England, and millions of people waiting to read about it.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: VIRGINIA SENATE GETS NEW FACES
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 6  The composition of Virginia's legislature, long dominated by Byrd organization conservatives, will be considerably different when it convenes Jan. 12.

title: Horace Mann 246 Victor
description: Oncebeaten Horace Mann won its fifth game by defeating Montclair Academy, 246, yesterday at Horace Mann Field. It was Montclair's second loss in seven games. Hubie Morgan, who got two touchdowns, brought his season scoring total to 62 points.

title: At home in a barn
description: When he saw the 125yearold barn hugging a hillside in Bridgehampton, artist Sidney Buchkes knew that he had found a studio and a home. The former dairy barn, complete with troughs and hay, had sheltered migrants who worked the nearby potato fields in recent years. The problem was turn the noble structure into a habitable house while preserving the feeling of space. The biggest decision facing designer Joseph Paul Durso and owner Buchkes was where to place the major living area. In the spectacular twoandahalf story loft? Or the lowerceilinged groundlevel floor? Building codes and heating requirements decided the question. The barn's beautifully bare bonesthe studs and rafterswould have to disappear under layers of insulation if the loft was to be heated. Rather than lose this sculptural quality they put the living area and kitchen downstairs, where radiantheating pipes embedded in the new concrete floor keep the old dairy barn dry and toasty on cold, damp winter nights.

title: Do We Care About Canada?
description: During a September press conference, President Nixon casually dropped an unfortunate remark that still reverberates in Canada. He had discovered that Japan is our biggest customer in the world and we are their biggest customer in the world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Police Plan Special Force To Curb Store Robberies
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 6 (Reuters)The San Francisco Police Department has announced that it is setting up a mom and pop robbery detail to help stop robberies of small familyowned grocery stores.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: If we are going to reorganize the transportation industry so adequate capital will be available, we must be prepared to make some fundamental changes. The problem of transportation calls for posing basic and bold questions.

title: Puppetry: An Inspiration for Convicts
description: (The following article was, written by Lou forok, No. 129606 at the Chillicothe Correctional Institute. He is serving a onetotenyear sentence for assault.)

title: Miss Jacqueline Nichols Bride of A. J. Thompson
description: POOLESVILLE, Md., Nov. 6St. Peter's Episcopal Church was the setting here today for the marriage of Miss Jacqueline Anne Nichols, daughter of Maj. Gen. Kenneth D. Nichols, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Nichols, to Anthony John Thompson, son of Mr. and Mrs. John William Thompson Jr. of Chevy Chase.

title: I Began to Think Of These Islands as TopSecret Outposts
description: GRAND TURK ISLAND, West Indies  Picture a small group of islands below the southern tip of the Bahamas. Call them the Turks and Caicos Islands, and color them quiet and peaceful. The Turks and Caicos are about 600 miles southsoutheast of Florida and still unspoiled by tourists, but this sublime situation may not last too long.

title: Mrs. Brous Has Child
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Noll. 6 A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Fredric Brous on Oct. 8 at the Morristown Memorial Hosptial. The child has been named Deborah Jane. Mrs. Brous is the former Miss Marcia Joan Gordon of Madison. Mr. Brous is the executive vice president of Sam Gordon's Appliance Supermarkets, a chain of 10 stores in New Jersey.

title: Chaplain Expects Better Police Force to Result From Corruption Inquiry
description: A Police Department chaplain predicted yesterday that a better police force and better poilcemen would, emerge from current department efforts to weed out corrupt policemen.

title: Southern Miss. Rolls Up 380 Victory Over V.M.I.
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss., Nov. 6 (AP)  Southern Mississippi scored its second straight victory over a Southern Conference team today, crushing Virginia Military Institute, 380, before a crowd of 12,400.

title: Fairleigh Dickinson Tops Livingston Eleven, 217
description: TEANECK, N. J., Nov. 6Nick Carrelle scored two touchdowns to lead Fairleigh Dickinson to a 217 victory over Livingston College in a club football game here today.

title: An average man aided by historical good fortune
description: We know now that ideologies, far from being eternal and immutable, are born, change and die. We know this without entirely accepting the fact: The function of ideologies is as much to reassure as to explain; should they cease to be absolute, we would feel abandoned to the chaos and fragility of our destiny.

title: C.A.B. Office Goes to the Aid of Consumers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. (AP)  For the 455th time this year, the grayhaired man on the telephone was outraged. In this instance an old couple had been cheated and the company responsible was hiding behind a technicality.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: MICHIGAN TEACHER APPEALS DISMISSAL
description: CHEBOYGEN, Mich., Nov. 6 Louie Church, a 26yeaold high school history and government teacher who was dismissed for falling to stand during the Pledge of Allegiance to the flag and the singing of The Star Spangled Banner, has appealed to the Michigan Teachers' Tenure Commission for reinstatement on the ground that his teacher's contract and constitutionally guaranteed freedom of speech have been violated.School Superintendent, who noticed Mr. Church's actions during the annual teachers' briefing the day before the schools opened. Mr. Towe said that be felt Mr. Church's action was a sign of disrespect that would be detrimental to the school and community.

title: Jersey Wireless Alarm System Eliminates Worry of Blackout
description: RIDGEFIELD PARK, N.J., Nov. 6This borough of 15,000 has installed a wireless combination fire, police and ambulance signal system that uses solar, batteries for power. The 60unit $85,000 installation was put into operation this week, after nearly a month of testing.

title: Barbara Yocum Wed
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 6 Miss Barbara Jenn Yocum, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward S. Yocum of Riverside, was married here this afternoon to Howard Preston Bahnsen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard M. Bahnsen of Merrick, L. I. The Rev. Merton Libby performed the ceremony in the First Congregational Church. He was assisted by the bridegroom's cousin, the Rev. Kenneth Heuermann.

title: Psychic Tightness Impairs a Concert By Jose Feliciano
description: There's nothing more difficult for a reviewer than a performer with an overabundance of gifts who somehow has trouble putting them all together. Jos Feliciano, in his Philharmonic Hall concert Friday night, was a case in point.

title: Bridgeport Clinches Title
description: GLASSBORO, N. J., Nov. 6 (AP)Vincent De Tore scored three touchdowns as the University of Bridgeport posted a 357 victory over Glassboro State and clinched the conference title today.

title: Purrington Paces Elis
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 6With a reconstructed backfield that introduced Rolliff Purrington at quarterback, Yale produced its highest pointtotal of the season today in a 2414 victory, over Penn.

title: Villanova Routs B. U.
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 6 (AP)Mike Siani grabbed four passes from Daryl Woodring for touchdowns today as Villanova trounced Boston University, 430.

title: CALIFORNIA BOWS TO WASHINGTON, 307
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 6 (AP)  Washington ran and passed for 291 yards in the first half and cruised to a 307 football victory over a Pacific rival, California, today.

title: BARELY EVEN TAKES GOLDEN ROD STAKES
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 6 (AP)Barely Even won the 28th running of the $49,530 Golden Rod Stakes at Churchill Downs today, finishing five lengths ahead of Applie Jackie on a sloppy track.

title: N. CAROLINA SINKS CLEMSON, 26 TO 13
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Nov. 6 (UPI)Ken Craven of North Carolina kicked four field goals today, breaking a school record and tying an Atlantic Coast Conference mark as the Tar Heels beat Clemson, 2613. The victory enabled North Carolina to take over undisputed first place in the conference.

title: Norwich Rallies to Defeat Worcester Tech by 2218
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Nov. 6Mark Conroy scored on runs of 70 and 10 yards and contributed a 38yard field goal to give Norwich a 2218 uphill victory over Worcester Tech today.

title: Music
description: WHAT does a small college with a limited budget do when it wants to Increase the amount of live music for its students? For some time this question had bothered Carleton Clay, an assistant professor at the State University College at Oneonta, N. Y. He considered it in relation to the graduate students at major music schools who spend months preparing a degree recital and then give it once or twice but only at their own schools. Last spring he wondered if such students would not also like to come and perform at Oneonta?

title: Japanese Dig In to Refurbish Cluttered Sapporo for Winter Olympic Games
description: SAPPORO, JapanThe center of town was noisy and littered with bulldozers, piles of rubble, steamshovels, bags of cement and other construction supplies.

title: Sports of The Times
description: As soon as Sid Gillman and his coaching staff had completed their first inspection of the JetDolphin movie of the previous Sunday, they knew immediately what game plan to give their San Diego Chargers for the joust with the Jets. Because Miami's twin bulldozers, Larry Csonka and Jim Kiick, had ripped apart the injuryriddled New Yorkers with a slashing ground attack, the Chargers also would pass sparingly and let their ballcarriers wreak havoc just as the Dolphins had done.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Movies
description: WILL Jerry Lewis ever cut out the clowning around? The answer to that question is yesand no. In his next movie, The Day the Clown Cried, Lewis will once again play a clown, but this time a clown who is put into a concentration camp by the Nazis. The veteran comic will direct and coproduce the film with Nat Wachsberger, and the screenplay, written by Joan O'Brien, is said to contain a meaty role for an actressthat of the clown's longstifferiog wife. And the actress being sought by Lewis is Jeanne Moreau, who is expected to say oui or non later this month, when Lewis goes to Paris to shoot circus scenes for the film.

title: RAPE CASE REVERSED BY ALABAMA COURT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov, 6  The Alabama Supreme Court has reversed the conviction of a Negro sentenced to death for rape of a white woman.

title: MICHIGAN POWER ROUTS IOWA, 637
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 6 (AP)Ed Shuttlesworth, a fullback, scored three touchdowns in the first half today and his teammates added four more in the third quarter as unbeaten Michigan crushed Iowa, 637, in their Big Ten football game. The victory was the Wolverines ninth of the season, the sixth in conference play.

title: The Professor's Daughter By Piers Paul Read. 276 pp. Philadelphia and New York: J. B. Lippincott Company. $6.95.
description: Piers Paul Read is a young English novelist of much talent and intelligencecool, wry, tough intelligencewhose subject thus far has been disillusionment in its various contemporary manifestations. In his fine 1969 novel, Monk Dawson, it is the disillusionment of a priest who flees the church in search of a more relevant life only to return, routed, to the sanctuary of the cloister. In The Professor's Daughter it is double disillusionment: of the young with their elders, and their elders with themselves.

title: The Wire Artists Of Rome's Spanish Steps
description: ROMEThe Spanish Steps, the elegant Roman stairway which for countless years provided the setting for art shows, azalea festivals and music programs, has been turned into a colorful outdoor bazaar by enterprising young wire artists. Trinkets as well as showy pieces of jewelry are handwrought and offered to tourists.

title: Catherine Moore, Style Editor, In Engaged to S. J. Tankoos Jr.
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Nov. 6 The engagement of Miss Catherine B. Moore, a fashion editor with Town & Country magazine to S. Joseph Tankoos Jr., a real estate investor with offices in New York and Toronto, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. C. Atwell Moore, Parents of the future bride. Her fianc, former owner of the Colony Hotel in Palm Beach, Fla., and Delmonico's Hotel in New York, is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Samuel J. Tankoos of Old Greenwich, Conn.

title: West German Idle at 0.8%
