title: Victory for Religious Freedom
description: Defeat in the House of the proposed constitutional amendment to permit nondenominational prayer in the public schools has averted a threat to the separation church and statebut by an uncomfortably narrow margin. The final vote240 for the amendment and 162 againstwas only 28 short of the required twothirds majority, admittedly only a first step in the process of amending the Constitution.

title: N.B.C. Shifting Four Shows In Move to Improve Ratings
description: Four major evening shows of the National Broadcasting Company were formaly shifted yesterday in an effort to improve the nework's weekly ratings.

title: Treasury Bills' Yields Fall at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: S.E.C. PLANS CURB ON TRADERS' CASH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it expected to put into effect next April 1 its longawaited rule restricting the uses that brokers may make of customers' cash and securities left in the broker's custody.

title: 175 Protest at White House Against Indochina Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8About 175 antiwar demonstrators lay on the sidewalk outside the White House this afternoon to protest continuing American bombing in Indochina.

title: PRESSURE GROWS FOR PRICE RISES
description: Evidence is accumulating that pentup pressure for price increases in industrial materials and commodities could rekindle inflation when President Nixon's price freeze thaws.

title: Canadian Riders Capture Nations Cup
description: The Canadian Equestrian Team, with a courageous performance, won the Nations Cup last night at the National Horse Show in Madison Square Garden. It was the first time since 1959 that a Maple Leaf delegation was able to win the prize, one of the most cherished in equestrian circles.

title: Pennsy Parent Calls Its Debt Plan Vital; Urges Vote in Favor
description: Management of the Penn Central Company, the holding company that owns the bankrupt railroad, has notified its own shareholders that if it cannot get their approval of a refinancing plan for a $55million debt of the holding company that falls due on No. 30, it might become a bankruptcy itself.

title: Theater: Yale Repertory Stages Ibsen's Last Play
description: NEW HAVEN  The Yale Repertory Theater has this season taken the bold step of Moving into rotating repertory with a series of modern and classic plays. Like almost everything else this company does under the artistic direction of Robert Brustein, the movie is a sensible one. But unfortunately it does not make this one sopromising company any better. It still needs more forceful directors and more accomplished actors.

title: MARSHALL MURPHY
description: WESTWOOD, N. J., Nov. 8Marshall Murphy, home furnishings marketing manager for Better Homes and Gardens magazine, died of cancer Saturday in Pascack Valley Hospital. He was 50 years old and lived in Montvale.

title: Bridge: Italian Blue Vegas to Pace, Aces in Las Vegas Contest
description: A question of absorbing interest will be answered next Month. Which is the world's strongest bridge team? Some would say the Italian Blue Team, which dominated world championship play for, More, than a decade until its retirement in 1969. Others would say the Dallasbased Aces, the world's only professional team, which has proved itself superior to allcomers in the last two years.

title: Price Set by Fanny May
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (Reutaers)The Federal National Mortgage Association said it would issue 12Month standby commitments on proposed construction at a price of 90.75 starting on Wednesday. Fanny May said all Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administration mortgages were eligible for the program except those on which a subsidy had been paid under, a Government National Mortgage Association special assistance program for unsubsidized housing.

title: 7th Manson Case Sentencing
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8 (Reuters)Steve Grogan, 20 years old, a member of the Charles H. Manson family, was sentenced to die in the gas chamber today for the murder of Donald Shea, a movie stunt man. Grogan was the seventh member of the Manson hippie family to receive the death sentence.

title: Correct but Relaxed Dealings With Chinese Urged by Bush
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8George Bush, the chief United States delegate here, told his aides today that the relations between the Americans and the Chinese Communists here should be correct and businesslike but as relaxed as possible.

title: Seed Money for Conservation
description: Credit the Ford Foundation with another novel and extremely useful contribution to the cause of a better environment. Municipal conservation commissionsin New York; New Jersey and the New England statescan now count on grants of up to $5,000 to help them Study projects and launch programs that for lack of such seed money would probably never see the light.

title: Building Unions to Stay Outside Pay Board Control
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov, 8The Pay Board will not control wages in the building industry during Phase Two of the Administration's new economic policy.

title: Executive Changes
description: The FMC Corporation announced that Robert H. Malott 45 years old, has been elected president and chief executive officer. Mr. Malott, now an executive vice president in charge of the companys machinery divisions, succeeds Jack M. Pope, who has requested that his own management responsibilities be reduced because of health reasons. The changes will be effective Jan. 1. During Mr. Malott's 19year association with. FMC he has served in such mangement po sitions, as bead of the organic chemical division, American Viscose division and executive vice president for corporate planning. He is a Member of the vice president in charge of film operation's for the board and executive committee. Mr. Pope, 58, has been a member of FMC's management for 20 years, and has served as president since 1966.

title: Chinese Group Arrives;
description: UNITED NATIONS; N. Y., Nov. 8A Sixman advance party for the Chinese delega tion to the United Nations ar rived today at Kennedy Airport aboard an Mr France Hoeing 707 jet airliner.

title: Janet Hall Married to Rep. Diggs
description: Miss Janet Elaine Hall, who is a Foreign Service Officer, was married in Christ Chapel at the Riverside Church Saturday to Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr., of Michigan. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Robert L. Polk.

title: Nobis Out for Season
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8 (UPI)Tommy Nobis, the Atlanta's Falcons' star linebacker out of action for a month with a knee injury, is lost for the remainder of the season, the National Football League club announced today. The Falcons announced that Nobis was placed on the injured reserve list after team doctors said his left knee was not strong enough for him to play anymore this season.

title: Advertising.
description: When Herb Tyson of Saturday Review Programs tried to reach his Washington office last week he was chagrined to discover that the telephone was out of order.

title: PAY BOARD, WITH LABOR OPPOSED, VOTES 5.5% TOP ON WAGE INCREASES;
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Pay Board overrode unanimous labor objections and voted 10 to 5 tonight to set a 5.5 per cent standard for wage increases during the Nixon Administration's economic stabilization program.

title: 17 Missing Off Japan
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, Nov. 9 (AP)A Japanese fishing boat capsized and sank in icy waters off northern Japan today and officials reported all 17 crewmen were missing.

title: Caution Stressed by Chou
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8. Premier Chou Enlair of China has told a Japanese editor that the Chinese delegation to the United Nations will take a very cautious approach.

title: Beame Offers Transit Plan, But Concedes Hope Is Dim
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday presented his latest plan to maintain the city's 30cent transit fare to a private meeting of the Mayor's task force trying to save the fare.

title: Giving Birth at Home: A Great Experience or Step Backward?
description: Mary Levine gave birth to a son the other, day. The baby, Eli, entered the world as his mother squatted on a bed in the family's apartment in the Bronx. His father, Eugene, cut the umbilical cord.

title: More Police Patrol In Times Sq. Area After Street Killing
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said last night that more Policemen were being shifted into the Times Square area and that police coverage there  would be made more visible. He acted after one driver for The New York Times was shot to death and another wounded Sunday night.

title: Construction Costs Up By 7.8% in 12 Months
description: Construction costs rose an average of 7.8 per cent nationwide in the 12 months ended Sept. 30, according to the F. W. Dodge Division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company.

title: Text of Board's Policies for Phase Two With Boldt's Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Following is the text of the policies issued tonight by the Pay Board to govern Phase Two of President Nixon's economic program, with a statement by George H. Boldt, the board's chairman:

title: Woman, 639 Dies in Apartment Robbery
description: A 63yearold, woman was found dead in her ransacked apartment in a Levier East Side housing project yesterday after she and her daughter had been tied up and beaten by two men posing as repairmen.

title: Walter Chalaire, Lawyer, Dies; ExHead of N. Y. U. Law Alumni
description: GREAT NECK, L. L, Nov. 7 Walter Chalaire, an international corporation and estate lawyer, died Friday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset. He was 76 years old and lived here at 2 Sussex Road.

title: 3 Federal Agencies Urge Congress to Promote Methadone From Investigatory to New Drug Status
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 Three Federal agencies asked Congress today to promote methadone, a synthetic opiate Increasingly prescribed by doctors as an alternative to heroin, from Investigatory to new drug status.

title: About Pro Basketball
description: Lack of consistency is hurting the Knicks as much as the loss of Willis Reed. In losing three of their last four games and falling below the .500 mark with a 67 wonlost record, 3% games behind the pacesetting Boston Celtics, the Knicks have shown an inability to maintam a lead and to get a concerted team effort for an entire game.

title: Frazier Sharp in Tough Prison Talk Show
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 8 Joe Frazier stepped into one of the toughest possible rings this morningthe maximum security prison hereand heard several black prisoners describe him as the great white hope.

title: MarcosBacked Candidates Trail in OffYear Vote
description: MANILA, Tuesday, Nov. 9 Opposition Liberals took a strong lead today over candidates backed by President Ferdinand E. Marcos as the votes were counted in yesterday's offyear elections.

title: MORE SOVIET ARMS ORDERED BY INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 8India has increased her orders of arms from the Soviet Union in the last few weeks in the light of the current border confront tation with Pakistan, and has also asked that the delivery of earlier orders be speeded.

title: SCHOOL PRAYERS BLOCKED BY HOUSE BY 28VOTE MARGIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 The House rejected today a proposed constitutional amendment to permit voluntery prayers or meditation in public schools.

title: Coach Quits P.S.A.L. Protest
description: Vinnie Gargano, Abraham incoln High's football coach, submitted his resignation yesterday and then joined about 100 students, parents and playera, in a vocal demonstration at the Public Schools Athletic League office at 300 West 43d Street.

title: 5 Ulster Robberies Staged; Explosion Damaged Shops
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 8 (UPI)Gunmen staged five robberies in Ulster today. The British army said that stolen moneyat least $4,750 from a post office in County Tyronealmost certainly would be used to buy weapons for the outlawed Irish Republican Army.

title: 4 AFRICAN LEADERS END TALKS IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, Nov. 8A delegation of four African presidents left Cairo today after three days of consultations with President Anwar elSadat and other officials on issues obstructing a settlement of the EgyptianIsraeli conflict.

title: City Health Chief Decries Nixon Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 Gordon Chase, the New York City Health Services Administrator, said today that the city might be better off with no healthinsurance plan than with the one proposed by President Nixon.

title: Johnson Announces Texas Symposium On U.S. Education
description: SAN MARCOS, Tex., Nov. 8 (AP)Former President Lyndon B. Johnson announced today a nationwide symposium on Jan. 24 and 25 to discuss the future of education in the United States.

title: Shippers Cleared Of Blame in Deaths Of 26 Wild Animals
description: A Federal judge ruled yesterday that fate, rather than any individual, was to blame for the death of 26 of 80 wild animals shipped here from East Africa aboard a freighter two years ago.

title: Birds Force Jet to Return
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8 (Reuters)A Pan American World Airways jumbo jet bound for London with 136 passengers and 15 crewmen was forced to return to Los Angeles International Airport today after an engine sucked in two birds, causing it to backfire.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mariluana Smokers Linked More to Than Heroin
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8 (UPI)Marijuana smokers frequently try psychedelic drugs suck as LSD and mescaline but rarely graduate to heroin use, two researchers reported today.

title: U.S. COURT OPENS REP. DOWDY TRIAL
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 8 The bribery, conspiracy and perjury trial of Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, began today with the screening of a jury panel in Federal District Court here.

title: PublicAffairs Officer Tries Detective Work
description: The Police Department's deputy commissioner for public affairs was credited yesterday with helping to break up a stolenoar ring that was said to have been stealing 35 late model cars a week and cutting them up for parts.

title: Col. John S. Dwinell, 69, Dies; Military Lawyer for 40 Years
description: Col. John S. Dwinell U.S.A., retired, a lawyer with the judge Advocate Genera's Corps and member of the military court that convicted Ilse Koch of murder at the Buchenwald concentration camp in Germany, died Sunday at the Veterans Administration Hospital on First Avenue, He was 69 years old and lived in Brooklyn.

title: City Opera Coq d'Or On Cable TV Tonight
description: The New York City Opera's performance of RimskyKorsakciv's Le Coq d'Or will be televised live at 8:15 tonight on, the cable television systems of Teleprompter Corporation and Sterling Manhattan Cable. The opera will be staged at the State Theater of the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts.

title: OBSERVER
description: As soon as the big Hbomb test was over Saturday and it had been estabfished that they earth was still here and reasonably sound, the Government issued statements emphasizing that the blast had gone splendidly, just as Federal scientists had always told us it would, and that peace had been the gainer.

title: Employe of a Jersey TNT Plant Thwarts a Bombing Attempt
ROCKEFELLER ORDERS ALBANY POLICE STUDY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 8Governor Rockefeller today ordered the State Commission of Investigation to begin a study of allegations of widespread corruption in this city's 240man police force.

title: Foe Attacks in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, Nov. 9 (AP)  The Cambodian high command reported yesterday that fighting bad broken out in an area northwest of the capital that had been one of the quiet regions of Cambodia.

title: Mariner Starts Taking Test Pictures of Mars
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 8 (AP)Mariner 9 beamed its two television eyes on Mars for the first time tonight and took a series of test photographs from 850,000 miles away in preparation for its orbit of the planet Saturday.

title: Pennsylvania Sues Union and Builders On Bias Charges
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 8 The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania filed suit In the United States District Court here, today charging Local 542, International Union of Operating. Engineers, and three contractors associations with discritnination against blacks.

title: Bail Bondsman Here Is Indicted On Charge of Fixing Drug Case
description: A Federal indictment charged here yesterday that a Manhattan bail bondsman successfully fixed a narcotics charge against an arrested suspect in exchange for $120,000.

title: TORTURE ALLEGED IN NORTH IRELAND
description: LONDON, Nov. 8Amnesty International, a respected private organization, published charges tonight that men detained in Northern Ireland had been subjected to savage beatings and torture.

title: Chinese Delegation Gets A City Packet of Advice
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8  An official of the New York City Commission to the United Nations presented the new Chinese delegation today with a portfolio of maps, transit guides, housing tips, city regulations and security precautions.

title: Court Backs Right Of Indigent Inmate To Law Libraries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) In another action strengthening the rights of indigent prisoners, the Supreme Court ruled today that California must provide such inmates with more legal help than just the current list of law books it has made available in its prisons.

title: SURGERY PATIENTS GIVEN OWN BLOOD
description: Patients who donate blood to themselves can undergo elective surgery with no risk of contracting hepatitis, a serious liver infection, and with greater chance of avoiding the potentially fatal dangers of receiving mismatched blood, according to a team of doctors in Denver.

title: DEBORAH AUGENBLICK
description: Mrs. Deborah Allen Augenblick, a lawyer active for many years in Bucks County, Pa., and the wife of Robert L. Augenblick, president of the Investment Company Institute, national association of the mutual fund industry, died Sunday of cancer in Memorial Hospital. She was 51 years old and lived, in New Hope, Pa.

title: Rams Feel Age Has Redskins Creeping
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 8The Los Angeles Rams, who were beaten by the Baltimore Colts here tonight, found themselves only 45 miles away from their old coach, George. Allen of the Washington Redskins. Moreover, the Rams will be practicing this week in Philadelphia, also a good listening post.

title: DR. HAROLD M. SMITH
description: Dr. Harold Morrison Smith, president and headmaster of Bordentown (N.J.) Military Institute from 1931 to 1968, died Sunday in Brunswick, Me. He was 83 years old and lived in Woolwich, Me.

title: CHRYSLER INCREASES PRICES ON 2 IMPORTS
description: The Chrysler Corporation announced yesterday that it had increased prices on its Dodge Colt and Plymouth Cricket models, effective immediately.

title: Dangerous School Surgery
description: The proposal by the Board of Regents to replace the city's Board of Eddcation and the office of chancellor with a commissioner appointed by, and responsible to, the Mayor represents, unnecessary and potentially dangerous surgery. Fir less drastic adjustments will suffice. The most useful aspect of the Mulls that, as the legislative hearings get underway today, it will spark serious. discussion of how best to move groin transitional to permanent school decentralization.

title: Furniture Swindle Of Puerto Ricans Laid to 2 in Bronx
description: A man and a woman accused of using a shipping concern to swindle individuals out of their furniture were Indicted yesterday by a Bronx grand jury.

title: City Opera Calls Fall Attendance Good
description: The New York City Opera's attendance held up surprisingly well this fall, its director said, in spite of the economic slump affecting most of the arts. Furthermore, the company will expand its activity by two weeks by appearing in May at the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington.

title: Judge Helfand, Retiring, Asks Legalized Gambling
description: Judge Julius Helfand, whose vigorous prosecution as an assistant district attorney in Brooklyn shattered the notorious Harry Gross bookmaking ring two decades ago, urged yesterday that all gambling be legalized to eliminate it as a source of police corruption.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 2:

title: R. V. COLEMAN, EDITOR OF BOOKS
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 8  R. V. Coleman, a retired editor for a publishing company who wrote on early American history, died Saturday at his home, 69 Roseville Road. He was 86 years old.

title: Proxmire Bill Would Ban Hormone Given to Cattle
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) Senator William Proxmire, Wisconsin Democrat, announced today that he was introducing legislation to ban a cancercausing hormone fed to cattle to make them gain weight faster. A House Government Operations subcommittee plans hearings on the same subject Thursday and Friday.

title: CONGRESS' STAND ON PAKISTAN CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 The State Department indicated today that Congressional pressure had been a, major factor in its decision to cancel licenses for the export of $3.6million in military equipment to Pakistan.

title: Con Edison Requests Rise For Steam Service Rates
description: Consolidated Edison asked the state's Public Service Commission yesterday for permission to increase the rates of its, 2,500 steam service customers by 2 per cent on Dec. 8, subject to limitations of the Government's price controls at that time.

title: Advertising:
description: Since 1952 National Media Analysis of Washington has been working for political candidates, promising to judge the public's temper by the newspapers it reads.

title: OSCAR LASDON, 62, FINANCE ADVISER
description: Oscar Lasdon, a financial consultant, senior editor of the Bankers Magazine and an associate editor of the Banicing Law Journal, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital of cardiac complications. He was 62 years old and lived on Cricklewood Lane, Harrison, N. Y.

title: Sports
description: Willis Reed watched the Knicks in Los Angeles and the New York team continued to miss their captain, losing to the Lakers, 10396, in a National Basketball Association game. Before the game Reed was examined by Dr. Robert W. Kerlan, the noted sports orthopedist, who concurred that the Knick star was suffering from tendonitis in the left knee, Reed will practice with the Knicks today and hopes to, play against the Royals tomorrow night in Cincinnati. He has missed four games and the Knicks have lost three.

title: Al NEW SYSTEM TIES CLERGYMEN TO JOBS
description: The Episcopal Church has begun using a newly developed dataprogramming system for matching clergymen with job openings. United Press International reports.

title: Costumes of EastSee Them While You Can
description: Over at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, there's an exhibition of fashion as an art form. Opening tomorrow at the American Museum of Natural History across Central Park is an exhibit called Costumes of the East. While esthetics enters in the viewpoint is anthropological.

title: Fulbright Threatens to Fight Extension on Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, served notice today that he would fight extension beyond next Monday of the continuing resolution that provides foreignaid spending authority, unless the committee's 83.3billion bill was acted on by that time.

title: Tokyo Plan on Yen Reported
description: TOKYO, Nov. 8The Japanese Government is prepared to increase the value of the yen a maximum of 12 per cent the United States Government removes its 10 per cent import surcharge, Japan's largest economic newspaper said today.

title: H. Boardman Spalding, 86, Dies; Sporting Goods Executive Here
description: H. Boardman Spalding, a former vice president, secretary, treasurer and director of A. G. Spalding & Bros., Inc., sporting goods, now a division of Questor Corporation, died Sunday at his home, 1050 Park Avenue. He was 86 years old.

title: International
description: Following is a summary of news that appeared late editions of The New York Times yesterday. Few copies of those editions were delivered, because drivers refused to move delivery trucks as a result of a shooting in front of The Times's building on West 43d Street. Obituaries and a drama review from the late editions are reprinted in their entirety, at their accustomed places.

title: 2 Plead Guilty in Bribery Case Involving Aide of Senator Fong
description: A Manhattan fundraiser and a; Queens interior decorator pleaded guilty yesterday to charges that they participated with an aide of Senator Hiram L. Fong of. Hawaii in a milliondollar conspiracy to quash a stockfraud case involving organized crime.

title: Howard C. Forbes Is Dead at 85; Prominent Real Estate Figure
description: Howard C. Forbes, president of the corporation bearing his name, real estate and insurance brokers, 111 West 57th Street, died yesterday in Laconia, N. H. He was 85 years old and lived at 171 West 57th Street and in Laconia.

title: Second Huge Oil Deposit In Alaska Held Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) A staff report by the Joint Economic Committee of Congress said today that a secret Interior Department assessment had indicated oil deposits, off the southern coast Of Alaska, possibly larger than the rich pool on the state's North Slope.

title: Book of The Times
description: LES GUERILLERES. By Monique Wittig. Translated from the French by David Le Vay. 144 pages. Viking. $4.95.

title: FOE OF REGIME WINS KEY CAMBODIAN JOB
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 8 (AP)Cambodia's new Constituent Assembly met for the first time today and elected leading critic of the Government as its president.

title: 27 Killed on Thai Highway
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 8 (UPI)A bus and a truck col Tided headon on the Americanbuilt Friendship Highway today, killing 27 persons and injuring 20 others, the police said.

title: RALPH JONES
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 8Ralph Jones, professor of speech at Ithaca College and director of the Ithaca Summer Speech Clinic, died here yesterday at the age of 68.

title: Johnson Is Doubtful For Sunday's Game With Damaged Knee
description: Ron Johnson, whose presence in the last two games has put an entirely different light on the New York Giants' season, is in questionable condition again. He suffered a strained ligament in his left knee during the fourth quarter of Sunday's 3517 victory over San Diego, and the Giants must be prepared to face Atlanta without him.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: Rod Gilbert, the leading scorer for the, leading club in the National Hockey League, wasn't smiling yesterday when he said: We got to finish first. The last two years we were up there. But this is the season. I don't think any of us will be satisfied with second place. Most of the Rangers said that it was too early, that it was a long season. But Jean Ratelle summed it up succinctly:

title: Illegal Status of Dominicans Shaping Their Lives in City
description: There is no land more beautiful

title: COMPUTER PACTS RENEWED BY OTB
description: The city's Offtrack Betting Corporation announced yesterday it had reached en agreement on new Contracts with the two computer companies now servicing betting offices.

title: Metropolitan
description: A Minimum fare of 35 cents was forecast by Mayor Lindsay, who endorsed a statewide surcharge on the state income tax to hold down even further increases in city transit fares. The Mayor said that the 30cent fare could no larger be maintained even with the surcharge, which he endorsed as part of a package to aid mass transit systems here and upstate. Mr. Lindsay expressed doubt that the Republicancontrolled Legislature would approve the package, which includes a city loan to the Transit Authority and a state loan or Federal grants.

title: BusinessFinancial
description: Uncertainty on the effect of Phase Two was expressed by Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company. He said that he was unsure whether the next part of President Nixon's new economic policy would reduce unemployment and restore consumer confidence. Speaking in Detroit, Mr. Ford also warned that although the 10 per cent import surcharge was a good negotiating wedge to bring about a needed currency reevaluation, it could cause a trade war with other nations if retained too long.

title: WOITACH PERFORMS ALLTROGAN CONCERT
description: Perhaps a dozen composers can withstand the scrutiny of an entire concert devoted to their keyboard music. Roland Trogan does not belong to this select group, a fact that pianist Richard Woitach demonstrated Sunday night in Tully Hall with depressing, clarity.

title: United States and World Law
description: The American role as world policeman has been a subject of debate since the largescale escalation of the Vietnam war. The issue has been whether it was the responsibility of the United States to oppose aggression everywhere and to take it upon itself to uphold the rule of Jaw in the world. Few challenged the theoretical desirability of upholding international law.

title: Msgr. Emil N. Komora, 72, Pastor of Church in Harlem
description: Msgr. Emil N. Komora, pastor of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Family, 405 West 125th Street, for 47 years, died in the church sanctuary yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 72 years old.

title: A Fresh Economic Drive To Aid Minorities Is Set
description: Capital Formation, Inc. a foundation designed to stimulate economic development of minority groups, announced last night a new program of partnership among communities, business, labor and government.

title: Indicted on Oct. 28, Chief Of U.S. Data Surrenders
description: Paul A. Costello, chief executive officer of the U.S. Data Corporation, a computer concern in Albany, has been arrested on charges of perjury land violation of New York State security law, in connection with the sale of more than $500,000 worth of his company's stock, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday.

title: Maazel and New Philharmonia Give a Dazzlingly Led Program
description: Since Herbert von Karajan can't be everywhere in the world at once, it is just as well that a few conductors who might pass for his artistic double should be trained to leap into the breach. Lorin Maazel's concert at the head of the New Philharmonia Orchestra of London on Sunday night at Carnegie Hall strongly indicated that he is ready for such work. The newly chosen musical director of the Cleveland Orchestra, who not many years ago conducted with a chilling, passionless precision, now seems to have discovered the German maestro's Secret of exciting an audience with an accumulation of virtuosic effects and elegantly mimed emotions.

title: DR. ARTHUR POST
description: Dr. Arthur Post, assistant professor of radiology at New York University Medical Center, died here Sunday. He was 60 years old and lived at 25 Central Park West.

title: Third Potline Is Closed At Alcoa Indiana Plant
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 8 (UPI) The Aluminum Company of America, Inc., has closed a third potline at its Warwick, Ind., plant because of the coal strike.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Representative Fred Schwengel, an Iowa Republican, would seem an unlikely leader of the forces in the Houser that wanted to reject a proposed constitutional amendment permitting prayer in public schools.

title: Business Bloc Explains Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP)Following is the text of a statement issued tonight by business members of the Pay Board in Connection with the announcement of Phase Two policy:

title: Corporation for Public Broadcasting Cuts Outlays
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting is cutting expenditures by about $2million because of uncertainty over future financing of noncommercial television and radio.

title: Metroliners Resume Speed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) The highspeed Metroliner trains between Washington and New York are again running at their regular speed of 100 miles an hour, Amtrak, the Government rail corporation, announced, today. It said that, the trains had been slowed down to 80 miles an hour after trouble developed in the traction motor of one car. Engineers have completed minor modifications to the cars to permit resumption of higher speeds, Amtrak said.

title: Breathe Deeply, It's Clean Air Week
description: It was only a coincidence that the first two days of Clean Air Week here, Sunday and yesterday, were two of the clearest days New Yorkers have experienced this year.

title: Nixon Said to Bar Big Cuts in Army And: Korea Force
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8A Pentagon budget proposal that would have withdrawn a United States division from South Korea and cut the American standing army to 11 divisionsthe fewest in more than 20 yearshas reportedly been rejected by president Nixon after determined opposition by State Department and White House officials.According to wellplaced Administration sources, the issue arose in the course of hammering out the defense budget that is to go to Congress early next year.

title: Nixon Back at Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight after a weekend in Florida.

title: 2 Promises Cast Changes
description: Bill Gerber and Lorna Luft have taken over two of the leading roles in Promises, romises. They succeed Gene Rupert and Jennie O'Hara. Miss Luft, who is the daughter of the late Judy Garland and Sid Luft, the producer, plays the role of Fran Kubelik, the confused girl friend of an ambitious minor executive. Mr. Gerber is seen as the young man who tries to rise on the corporate ladder.

title: Amchitka Cavern Cooling After Blast; Surf ace Depressed
description: AMCHITEA ISAND, Alaska, Nov. 8The last of hundreds of small aftershocks from Cannikin occurred at 6:54 A.M. today, Eastern standard dine, when the underground bomb cavity and rock chimney above it collapsed to form a small depression on the surface of the island as the gasses in the cavern cooled.

title: Carolina School Inquiry Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) The National Education Association announced today that it would conduct a sevenday inquiry into public school conditions in South Carolina beginning Thursday. The association said that the Inquiry was requested Oct. 28 by the South Carolina Education Association to look into school finance, educational deficiencies and other problems.

title: Other Days and Other Crimes
description: Whenever I read of a fresh outburst of racial violence in one of the city's schools, my mind goes back to an incident that took place in the nineteenforties during my eighth year of school in a working class neighborhood in Brooklyn.

title: STOCKS DECLINE IN SLOW TRADING
description: Stock prices slipped a bit yesterday in very slow trading. The market, as well as the domestic economy, began the final week of the wageprice freeze and it was the lingering uncertainty of what lied ahead in Phase Two that accounted mainly for the caution.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: REGINA! TO OPEN HERE IN JANUARY
description: Robert Bolt's latest play, Vivat! Vivat Regina! involvQueen Elizabeth I and Mary Queen of Scots, will be brought to Broadway in January by David Merrick and Arthur Cantor.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 0.8% DURING WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 6 rose by 0.8 per cent to 1,918,000 tons, the American Ilron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This compared with 1,902,000 tons in the preceding week. However, total output for the year to date was 105,120,000 tons, or 71 per cent lower than the 113,134,000 tons produced in the like period of 1970.

title: First Office Theater's Opening Near
description: The new American Place Theater  the first of four projected office buildingtheaters designed to revitalize the city's theater districtwill come to life next week.

title: Bhutto Back From Peking
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 8 Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, leader of the Pakistani delegation that conferred with Chinese leaders in Peking, returned to Rawalpindi today and reported to President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan on the talks. Mr. Bhutto told newsmen at the airport that the mission had been a complete success and had achieved tangible re sults.

title: Mobil Cites $804,000 Cost Of Meeting Pollution Law
description: The Mobile Oil Corporation said yesterday that it would cost $804,000 in the next six months if the company was required to comply with the city's airpollution code restrictions on gasoline lead content.

title: U.S. PLANES RAID THE NORTH AGAIN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 9 (AP)American planes staged retaliatory attacks on antiaircraft positions in North Vietnam yesterday for the second successive day, the United States command reported.

title: Redecorated Red Room Has Colorful Debut at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Mrs. Richard M. Nixon proudly showed the stunningly refurbished Red Room of the White House today. If anything, the room has picked up in drama since Jacqueline Kennedy's celebrated restoration a decade ago.

title: Stage: A Most Gifted Playwright at the Anspacher
description: David Rabe is a young playwright who is as talented as he Is lucky, or perhaps, just as lucky as he is talented. He already has the remarkable drama The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel playing at, the Newman Theater. Sunday night this was joined at the Public's Axispacher Theater by his new play, Sticks arid Bones, which is, also clearly the work o a Most gifted playwright.

title: Leadership and Psychotechnology
description: The present generation of human beings is required to develop psychological and social sciences with that degree of precision, predictability and moral control essential to the survival of man. The awesome advances in the physical and biological sciences have made psychotechnology imperative. Man can no longer afford the luxuries of a leisurely, trialanderror, triviadominated approach to the behavioral sciences. The behavioral sciences are now the critical sciences; they will determine the answer to the ultimate moral question of human survival.

title: NEW MALL PLAN DRAWS CRITICISM
description: A city plan to turn 15 blocks of Madison Avenue into a permanent pedestrian mall is drawing strong criticism even before it has been officially released.

title: CHARLOTTE CRAWFORD
description: Charlotte H. Crawford, who retired 16 years ago as chairman of the French department of Erasmus Hall High School, died Saturday in Leroy Hospital. She was 86 years old and lived at 114 Clinton Street, Brooklyn.

title: AMEX STOCKS OFF AS VOLUME EASES
description: It was really a blue Monday with most prices down and little activity.

title: ZIEGLER CONFIRMS WATER CODE VIEW
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 8  The Nixon Administration confirmed today that it was not satisfied with many of the provisions of the stringent water pollution control bill sponsored by Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and passed by the Senate last week.

title: PEOPLES GAS PROFIT ROSE A BIT IN YEAR
description: The Peoples Gas Company, Chicago, reported yesterday preliminary figures for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30 showing earnings slightly higher than a year ago and record sales and revenues.

title: Belgian Cabinet Quits After Election
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 8The coalition Cabinet led by Premier Gaston Eyskens resigned today in the wake of a strong upsurge of regionalist sentiment in the parliamentary election yesterday.

title: Jetliner TakeOffs Barred at Heathrow For Summer Nights
description: LONDON, Nov. 8The Government announced today that night takeoffs of jet airliners from London's Heathrow Airport would be banned from April through October, beginning next year.

title: Stamford Schools Tied Up
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 8A strike by public school teachers here went into its third day today, with only 125 of the 21,000 pupils and 57 teachers reporting to the schools.

title: Labor Leaders Are Critical of Ruling
description: The initial reactions of labor leaders to the new pay guidelines announced last night were critical, particularly with reference to the denial of retroactive pay increases.

title: O'DONNELL ISELIN, A COAL EXECUTIVE
description: O'Donnell Iselin, a New York sportsman and businessman, and a member of an old New York family, died here Saturday. He was 87 years old and lived at 104 East 71st Street.

title: DDT'S USE BACKED BY NOBEL WINNER
description: ROME, Nov. 8  Dr. Norman E. Borlaug, the father of agriculture's Green Revolution, attacked today what he said were, irresponsible environmentalists who seek to ban the use of DDT and other chemicals that would serve, to increase world food production.

title: U.S. REPORT SPURS DECLINE IN COTTON
description: The Agriculture Department yesterday estimated the country's 1971 cotton crop at 10,718,000 bales, an increase of 18,000 bales from its estimate a moth ago.

title: Nets Add Webster, ExStar At St. Peter's, to Roster
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 8 (AP)The New, York Nets of the American Basketball Association today signed Elnardo Webster, a 6foot5inch, 205pound former St. Peter's (N. J.) star.

title: Catalonian Foes of Franco Hold an Illegal Meeting
description: MADRID. Nov. 8Some 300 Catalonians, evading police vigilance and Spanish laws against unauthorized political assemblies, met secretly yesterday to draft a program of resistance to the Spanish regime.

title: RISE IN SALES TAX ASKED FOR NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 8A 1cent increase in the present 2centsonthedollar county sales tax was proposed today by Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso to help balance a record $420million budget he offered for 1972.

title: Lyntex Taking Acquisition Loss
description: Why would a company voluntarily surrender half of its business? The answer to that question, as some seasoned financial sources are prone to say, could lie in postacquisition indigestion.

title: Laird, Home, Hopeful on Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird returned today from his threeday visit to Saigon with an optimistic assessment of the Vietnamization program and a recommendation for President Nixon further withdrawals of soldiers from Vietnam.

title: 35 Explosions in 60 Years
description: ROXBURY TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov., 8 (AP)Hercules Manufacturing, A subsidiary of the Hercules Powder Company of Wilmington, Del., has been the scene of at least 35 explosions in its 60year, history.

title: TO THE VICTORS: $18,164 APIECE
description: Each member of the Pittsburgh Pirates will receive $18,164.58 for his role in beating the Baltimore Orioles, last month in the World Series.

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Now Down to 191,100
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 8 (AP)  The United States command announced today that American military strength in Vietnam dropped by 5,600 men last week to 191,100. The reduction was the biggest weekly cut in six months.

title: CHARGE REDUCED IN COLONEL'S CASE
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 8 The military judge in the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson dismissed tonight one of two counts of lying under oath to an Army panel investigating an alleged coverup of the slayings of civilians at Mylai, South Vietnam.

title: Woman Gets Aviation Post
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 8 (UPI)President Nixon named today Mrs. Betty Crites Dillon, pilot, as the first woman to serve ah United States Representative on the Council of the International Civil Aviation Organziation. She will succeed Charles Frederick Butler, who resigned Oct. 1, and upon Senate confirmation of her nomination will serve with the rank of minister at a salary of $36,000 a year. Mrs. Dillon, 48 years old, has been director of special services in the Peace Corps since 1970.

title: 6 Seized in Bet Raid After Appearance At Gambling Inquiry
description: Six men were arrested on gambling charges in a Brooklyn, tavern yesterday a few hours after they had all appeared before a grand jury investigating organized gambling in the borough.

title: Oil Leasing Plan Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, urged Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton today not to lease offshore oil drilling rights on the Northeastern coast. In New Jersey, tourism is our largest single industry, Senator Williams told Mr. Morton in a letter. One oil spill could ruin this industry and cause damage running into millions of dollars.

title: SHANKER PROPOSES MERGER OF UNIONS
description: Abert Shanker called on members of the rival New York State Teachers Association yesterday to merge with his newly formed United Teachers of New York State and set up one unified organization for all 300,000 teachers in the state.

title: Market Place: Playboy Bounds Into the Market
description: When Playboy Enterprises, Inc., bounded into the public marketplace last week with its first shares ever offered to the public, at $23.50 each, the market sagged quick like a bunny.

title: Income Falls at Grumman And United Aircraft Corp.
description: Earnings and sales of two major defense contractors, the United Aircraft Corporation and the Grumman Corporation, declined in the third quarter and first nine months of 1971.

title: Jets Must Devise New Miracle Defense Against Colts
description: Despite the success of the fourlinebacker defense in the 1310 upset of the Kansas City Chiefs, the Jots are unlikely to use it next Sunday against the Baltimore Colts at Shea Stadium.

title: 43d St.: Surrounded by Violence
description: Fortythird Street between Seventh and Eighth. Arvenues Connecti the tawdry, glamor of Times Square to the east with the seedy, almost oriental honkytonk of addicts and prostitutes to the west. Along the street pass wideeyed tourists and nodding Junkies, soldiers on furlough and weaving winos, businessmen and pimps.

title: EUGENE KLABER, 88, AN ARCHITECT, DIES
description: SELLERSVILLE, Pa., Nov. 7Eugene Henry Klaber, an architect and expert in city planning, died here yesterday in Grand View Hospital. He was 88 years old and had lived in Quakertown since 1950.

title: BARS MOST RAISES LOST IN FREEZE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Senate Finance Committee completed work on the tax bill today after first defeating moves to increase the tax reductions for individuals.

title: CINCINNATI G.O.P. LOSING CITY HALL
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 8  For the first time in 14 years the Republicans have lost control of City Hall. The Fusion ticket of Charterites and Democrats won six of the nine seats in the Council. The Republicans got three.

title: South Africa Hints TV Won't Come Until After '75
description: PRETORIA, South AfricaSouth Africa is the world's only industrial country without television, and the chances are that it will remain so for quite some time.

title: Theater: Coast Transvestite Troupe
description: The Cockettes were in town, and for days the air had been filled with flackery, trumpeting the cause of this transvestite troupe direct from San Francisco, On Sunday night the old Anderson Theder looked like a drag ball. All closets were open for the opening of Tinsel Tarts in a Hot Coma.

title: Women Demand Equal Voice in Reform Judaism
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8Women active in American Reform Judaism, charging that they were relegated to serving tea and cookies, demanded today an equal partnership in the, policymaking decisions of the Reform movement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: C.B.W.L. NET INCOME GAINED FOR QUARTER
description: C.B.W.L.Hayden, Stone, Inc., a major brokerage concern, reported yesterday that it had net income of $893,000 in its fiscal first quarter ended Sept 30, compared with a net loss of $63;000 in the comparable 1970 quarter.

title: COL. HERBERT GETS A LEAVE OF 30 DAYS
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8 (AP)Lieut. Col. Anthony B. Herbert, who has accused the Army of harassing and muzzling him because he charged fellow officers with covering up Vietnam atrocities, was granted a 30day leave today as he made plans to apply for retirement.

title: RIPON GROUP ASKS DELEGATES SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Republican party's formula for allocating delegates to its 1972 National Convention in San Diego was challenged today in United States District Count as unfair to the larger states.

title: Beaumont Troupe Fetes Benefactors
description: It takes, a clever host to mix Ethel. Merman, Mary Stuart, Queen, Elizabeth and Perle Mesta together in the same room, but Bernard Relin is at least, as clever as that, for his party, Sunday night for the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center had fabulous characters from two centuriesthe 16th and the 20thin it.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FOURTH MUSQUACOOK LAKE, Me.Three days of deer hunting out of the International Paper Company's lodge produced only one animal, a young buck taken, by Joe Widner of Northboro, Mass.

title: Vote in House on Prayer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8, (AP)Following is the 240to162 vote by which the House defeated today a proposed constitutional amendntent to allow voluntary prayer or meditation in Public schools. The resolution received a majority of the vote cast but fell 28 votes short of the twothirds required. The designation NV means the member did not vote.

title: Corporate Earnings Rose From 1970 Third Quarter
description: Through the economic smog overhanging the nation, one patch of blue is clearly visible corporate profits are up for the third consecutive quarter this year. A hefty fourthquarter advance over the strike influenced period of 1970 may put this year's profits at a nearrecord level.

title: Poor Nations End Lima Parley Divided on Strong Declaration
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 8More than 1,000 delegates representing developing countries ended today a twoweek conference in which black Africans took a leading role.

title: Times Square Slaying
description: The death by gunfire of one this newspaper's delivery drivers and the serious wounding of a second while performing their jobs on 43d Street form part of a continuing, grisly series of firearm crimes in New York City.

title: Japanese Ambassador Urges Economic Harmony
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 8 Japanese economic policies are seriously out of phase, as if we were working at cross purposes, the Japanese Ambassador to the United States said here today.

title: U.S. SCORES PLAN BY SIX ON TRADE
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 8A sharp dispute has arisen between the United States and the European Economic Community over the trading arrangements the enlarged bloc would make with the industrialized countries of Europe that do not intend to join.

title: CELTICS TURN BACK ROYALS, 120 TO 109
description: OMAHA, Neb., Nov. 8. AP)The Boston Celtics turned back a Cincinnati tally in the fourth quarter and defeated the Royals, 120109, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Jeweler Loses $100,000
description: A Brooklyn jeweler discovered yesterday that his safe had been broken into and robbed of more than $100,000 in cash, diamonds and other valuables some time over the weekend, the police reported. The police of the Parkville station said Arnold Jacques, ownor of a shop at 1646 Coney Island Avenue, in the Flatbush Section, discovered the theft when he opened for business at 9 A.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Red Book Lin Compiled, Is Hard to Get in Peking
description: PEKING, Nov. 8 (Reuters] The Chineselanguage version of the famed Little Red Book of quotations from Chairman Mao Tse Lung, whose editions were officially put at 740 million copies, has become virtually unobtainable here in the last week.

title: Tito Is Home From Tour
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 8 (AP)President Tito of Yugoslavia said today on return from a tour that took him to Washington, Ottawa and London that he now looks on the further development and prospects for peace in the world with more hope and enthusiasm. He flew in from London, where he had lunched with Queen Elizabeth.

title: Texan Buys Florida Paper
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Nov. 8 (AP)  The Clearwater Sun, Inc., has been purchased by James H. Hale and Associates, John E. Marsh and Mrs. Vera Zschach announced today. Mr. Hale, formerly of Laredo, Tex., where he was editor and publisher of The Laredo Times, assumed the duties of editor and publisher of The Sun.

title: Terrorism In Dacca
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 8Bombs exploded in various parts of Dacca today, and at least six persons were reported assassinated by Bengali guerrillas in the last 24 hours.

title: Southern Governors Meet, With Moderates in Control and Wallace Discussing Candidacy
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 8  The Southern Governors Conference opened today and for the first time it was under the complete and undisputed influence of recial moderates.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Those liberal Democrats who joined Southerners and most Republicans last week in prohibiting the use of emergency desegregation funds for busing programs were dead right, about one thing. Busing is a political scare, word and voting against it was the popular thing to do.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Structural Unity Favored For Financial Businesses
description: The Presidential Commission on Financial Structure and Regulation has decided to recommend the gradual unification, over a long period, of the nation's many types of competing financial businesses.

title: LINDSAY IS URGED TO CONTINUE LOANS
description: United Neighborhood Houses, a federation of the city's 34 settlement houses, appealed yesterday, to Mayer Lindsay to continue the Municipal Loan Program, despite disclosures of abuses in its administration.

title: Notes on People
description: Stopping off for a rest on the tropical island of Bali, Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally, en route to Manila and Tokyo for economic talks, got some special treatment at the Government owned Bali Beach. Hotel. The hotel's contaminated water was deemed tint fit for him to drink, and some Americaninspected and approved Water was substitutlad. The hope was that the pure water wouldn't aggravate the stomach ailment Mr. Connally had been suffering with for the last week. At the Bali airport, Mr. Connally was accosted by a group of American tourists who had been asked to vacate their rooms at the Bali. Beach to make way for his party. Thanks a lot, one man shouted. We came 18,000 miles to be thrown out of the hotel for you. Mr. Connaally apologized.

title: Filion's 5 Winners Raise Total to 426
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 8 (AP)Herve Filion, the nation's leading harness driver, Won five of the 11 races at Freehold Raceway today to increase victory total this year to 426.

title: An End to Cuba's Isolation
description: Fidel Castro's imminent arrival in Chile for his first visit to South America in more than eleven years unquestionably symbolizes the beginning of the end of the effort to isolate Cuba in the hemisphere, even though the host Government in this instance is a leftwing coalition led by a Socialist long friendly to Mr. Castro.

title: PENGUINS DEFEAT SAGGING BLUES, 41
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 9 (UPI)Rene Robert scored a goal and assisted on another tonight to lead the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 41 victory over the St. Louis Blues, who haven't won in their last six National Hockey League games.

title: Jury Studies Possible Blackmail Of Officials Linked to Brothel
description: A Manhattan grand jury is investigating the possibility that a number of prominent politicians, judges and other persons were subjected to a wide variety of crimes, including blackmail, extortion, bribery and the illegal use of wiretaps, through their connection with an East Side brothel.

title: Braves Defeat Blazers
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9 (UPI) Em Bryant scored 12 of his 13 points in the fourth period and added two key steals tonight to lead the Buffalo Braves to a 109100 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers In a National Basketball Association game.

title: Campbell Rites Tomorrow
description: A memorial service will be held at 2 P.M, tomorrow at Grace Church, Broadway and 10th Street, for John Franklin Campbell, 31yearold managing editor of the Foreign Policy magazine, who died Saturday of an obstruction in the throat. Former Undersecretary of State George Ball will deliver the eulogy.

title: Amalfitano Joins Giants
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 9 (AP)Joe Amalfitano resigned today as a coach of the Chicago Cubs to take a similar position with the San Francisco Giants.

title: Printer Gets New Heart
description: STANFORD, Calif., Nov. 9 (UPI)A printer from New Berlin, Wis., was in satisfactory Condition today after receiving a new heart in Stanford Medical Center's 37th transplant operation. Richard W. Mueller, 38 years old, received the heart in a fourhour operation performed yesterday by a surgical team headed by Dr. Norman Shumway.

title: 105 Antiwar Protesters Seized at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The police arrested 105 demonstrators today for blocking a White House driveway in the second day of a protest against continued American bombing in Indochina.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: Labor Foresees Problems
description: Labor leaders denounced the new pay standards yesterday and foresaw critical problems in their application to existing contracts and future bargaining.

title: MARCOS FOES HOLD LEAD IN SENATE VOTE
description: MANILA, Nov. 9 (AP)With unofficial returns in from more than 40 per cent of the country today, candidates from the opposition Liberal party were leading for seven of the eight senatorial seats at stake. President Ferdinand E. Marcos appeared to be in for a rebuff.

title: WESTMORELAND BIDS STATES ASSIST G.I.'S
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9  Gen. William C. Westmoreland, Army Chief of Staff, called today for the states to assist in the education and retraining of returning military veterans.

title: HIGH COURT TO RULE ON RAIL CAR RETURN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP)  The Supreme Court agreed today to hear an appeal by the Interstate Commerce Commission seeking to impose rules for the return of freight cars on all of the nation's railroads.

title: MOLD THEY, 76, PLANT AUTHORITY
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 9  Dr. Harold B. Tukey, internationally known horticulturist and former head of the horticulture department at Michigan State University, died of a stroke yesterday in Boca Raton, Fla., where he had intended to spend the winter. He was 75 years old and lived in Woodland.

title: CIVILIAN TESTIFIES IN COLONEL'S CASE
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 9I A Foreign Service officer who served in Vietnam testified today that, if there had been a massacre of civilians at Mylai 4, he would have expected to have been told about it by his sources in the field.

title: 16 Are Arrested in Jersey During 2County Drug Raids
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. (UPI)  State and local policemen arrested 16 youthful drug suspects in Ridgewood and in nine other municipalities in Bergen and Morris County this morning.

title: MRS. MAURICE WURTZEL
description: Mrs. Pauline Cohen Wurtzel, widow of Maurice Wurtzel, a realestate operator who was one of the builders of the McAlpin Hotel, died Sunday in Beth Israel Hospital after a long illness. She was 77 years old and had lived in Miami Beach since the death of her husband last Dec. 7.

title: Moynihan Finds U.N. With Head Lost in Cloud of Ideals
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9  Words may be weapons, said Daniel P. Moynihan, but at the United Nations they wound exceeding slow.

title: MRS. DOROTHY REID, TEACHERAUTHOR, 66
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., Nov. 9  Mrs. Dorothy Leader Reid, who retired a year ago as chairman of the Department of Foreign Languages at Hastings High School, died at her home yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. She was 66 years old and lived on Summit Drive.

title: Reorganization Sought
description: MIAMI, Nov. 9 (Reuters)The Ecological Science Corporation said today its Ecological Utilities, Inc., subsidiary filed a petition yesterday for an arrangement under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act with a United States District Court, Southern District of Florida.

title: Delegation Leaves Peking
description: PEKING, Nov. 9 (Reuters)China's delegation to the United Nations, headed by Chiao Kuanhua, a Deputy Foreign Minister, left Peking today.

title: David A. Grossman
description: Articulate, knowledgeable expert on city's fiscal mysteries . . . Deciphers and explains to City Council, Board of Estimate and the press intricacies of budgetary problems . . . As Budget Director will enunciate city's fiscal policies . . . And as guardian of the purse strings will supervise spending by various agencies . . . Came to Budget Bureau in 1966 after working as private planning consultant ... Served as director of community development in urban renewal administration . . . Received bachelor of architecture degree in 1951 and master of city planning degree in 1953 from Massachusetts Institute of Technology . . Born Boston, 1929.. Lives with wife and two children in Qeens.

title: Bonanzas Come First
description: Senator Eastland of Mississippi wants Congress to have a look at the workings of the country's environmental protection lawsnot because they lack effectiveness but because in his view they are entirely too effective. Everybody is in favor of protecting the environment, the Senator suggested not long ago, but this business of yelling ecology every time we get ready for a new project has got to stop.

title: 6 Killed in Captor Crash
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 10 (AP)  A United States helicopter flying to the aid of besieged South Vietnamese troops crashed today 17 miles east of Saigon, killing five Americans and one South Vietnamese.

title: G. & W. Cuts Its Debt
description: The shortterm debt of Gulf and Western Industries, Inc., in its fiscal year ended July 31 was reduced to $75million from $254million at the end of fiscal 1970, Charles G. Bluhdorn, chairman, disclosed yesterday in the company's annual report. In addition, the company had unused available bank lines of more than $185million.

title: The Lindsay Wishbone
description: Mayor Lindsay moved a considerable distance toward becoming a declared contender for the Democratic Presidential nomination yesterday. Out of the Republican party only two months, the Mayor feels confident enough of his chances to have taken Deputy Mayor Richard Aurelio out of city government and dispatched him on a fulltime exploratory mission to test national sentiment for a Lindsay Presidential bid. Edward Hamilton, the city's able Budget Director, replaces Mr. Aurelio in the Number Two job at City Hall. Along with these two shifts goes a comprehensive overhaul down the line.

title: CONNALLY, IN TOKYO, SETS NO GOAL ON YEN
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Nov. 10 (Reuters)Treasury Secretary John Connally had a twohour meeting with Japanese Finance Minister Mikio Mizuta today, but said later he had made no specific request for a revaluation of the yen.

title: YABLONSKI DEATHS DESRIBED TO JURY
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Nov. (UPI)Claude E. Vealey of Cleveland, who pleaded guilty of killing an insurgent mine union official, Joseph A. Yablonski, and his wife and daughter, testified today at the trial of Aubran Martin that the defendant fired bullets into each of the victims.

title: CAMBODIA AIRPORT SHELLED BY ENEMY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Wednesday, Nov. 10 (Reuters) Nineteen persons were killed and 14 were wounded early today in an enemy rocket attack on Pnompenh's International Airport, military spokesmen said.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor: In all the concern about saving the transit fare, no one seems to harbor any hostility toward the cause of the problemthe transit union.

title: SCHOOL TAX LOSES IN INDEPENDENCE
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Nov. 9 (UFI)Residents of this Kansas, City suburb, the home city of former President Harry S. Truman, rejected today a proposed school tax increase that would have reopened the city's 25 public schools.

title: Turn Toward Stability
description: The guidelines laid down by the Pay Board to prevent a new upsurge of the wageprice spiral after the freeze ends this Saturday represent a major contribution to the welfare of every American.

title: F.D.A. Warns on Hormone in Pregnancy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Food and Drug Administration proposed today labeling changes that would warn doctors not to prescribe the synthetic hormone diethylstilbesterol for pregnant women.

title: Sales Show Upturn
description: A business upturn for the restaurant industry was forecast yesterday by Leslie W. Scott, president of the National Restaurant Association, whose members represent 80 per cent of the dollar volume of the $46billion industry.

title: DR. VICTOR TOMBERG, RADIOLOGY EXPERT
description: Dr. Victor Tomberg, associate professor of radiology at the New York Medical College and director of the radiation re. search laboratory at the Bird S. Coler Hospital, died of heart attack Monday at Parkway Hospital in Forest dills, Queens. He was 69 years old and lived at 6636 Yellowstone Boulevard, Forest Hills.

title: BUCKS TRIUMPH OVER SUNS, 118 113
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 9 (AP)Jon McGlocklin scored 3 points in the last 22 seconds, 2 after a key steal by Bob Dandridge, to pull the Milwaukee Bucks to a 118113 victory over the Phoenix Suns tonight in the National Basketball Association.

title: Atlanta Plan Approved
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9 (UPI)A proposed $1.4billion rapid transit system won narrow approval in this city and its major suburban county tonight, although voters in two outlying counties chose to stay out of the system.

title: Muskie Bids Administration Explain, View on Water Bill
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 9Senator Edmund S. Muskie attacked the Nixon Administration today in connection with its criticism of his water pollution bill.

title: Stamford School Agreement
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 9The Board of Education and the Stamford Education Association reached a tentative contract agreement tonight to end a fourday teachers strike. The terms, reported to provide 5.5 per cent wage increase, veil be presented to the teachers for ratification at a meeting at 71 A.M. tomorrow and it is anticipated that classes will resume at the regular time.

title: Adams, Siegfried Traded To Hawks by Rockets
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9 (UPI)The Atlanta Hawks acquired Don Adams and Larry Siegfried today from the Houston Rockets by trading two reserves, John Vallely and Jim Davis.

title: U.S. ARGUES TO GATT AGAINST BLOC PLAN
description: GENEVA, Nov. 9The United States carried its objections to the preferential arrangements being concluded by the European Economic Community with six European nations today to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade.

title: DEVALUED DOLLAR IS URGED FOR U.S.
description: The United States must take steps to regain world confidence in its economic leadership, Franklin A. Cole, president of the Walter E. Heller International Corporation, asserted yesterday.

title: Continental Cement
description: Economic Analysis

title: U.S. Experts Find A Drive to Improve Diets in East Bloc
description: WARSAW, Nov. 9American agricultural experts, completing a tour of Eastern Europe, indicated today that a major effort is being made throughout the bloc to improve protein diets through increased meat and dairy production.

title: DAVID BAILLIE JR., TUNNEL ENGINEER
description: GUILFORD, Conn., Nov. 9David G. Baille Jr., a consulting engineer who had worked on the construction of several major New York City tunnels, died today in Watrous Memorial Convalescent Home, Madison, after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 276 State Street.

title: Court Backs Eviction of Relief Family From Hotel
description: A State Supreme Court justice here ruled yesterday that a city welfare client and her seven children could be removed from a hotel on 44th Street near Fifth Avenue, where her rent is $340.90 a week, to less costly housing elsewhere in the city.

title: Suburban Propane Earnings Up 10% for Fiscal Year
description: The Suburban Propane Gas Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday a 10 per cent gain in earnings for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30.

title: Telephone Service Best in Two Years Swidler Declares
description: Despite the fourmonth strike by telephone installers and technicians, telephone service in the state is better than it has been in the last two years, according to Joseph C. Swidler, chairman of the state's Public Service Commission.

title: 3 TERMINALS SHUT BY VISITING PICKETS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 9 (UPI) A handful of pickets from the strikebound Port of New York shut down three big terminals along the waterfront here today and halted work on seven ships.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: All Cornell has to do Saturday in Hanover, N. H., to win its first formal Ivy League football championship is to beat Dartmouth. But that may take some doing if Ed Marinaro, the nation's leading runner, is not physically sound. The Cornell star injured his back in the victory over Brown, but Coach Jack Musick said Marinaro would be ready for the oncebeaten Indians.

title: Medical Missionary in a New Role
description: It was 100 years ago today that Henry M. Stanley met a weary Scottish missionary physician and explorer at Ujiji on Lake Tanganyika in Africa and asked the smiling. graybearded man:

title: Mill's Decision on '72 May Be Months Away
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9. Representative Wilbur D. Mills is inching toward an open declaration of his Presidential candidacy in 1972, but he may not get there for several months yet.

title: 4 SCIENTISTS WIN LASKER AWARDS
description: Three pioneering geneticists and a researcher of high blood pressure disease were named yesterday as winners of the 1971 Albert Lasker Medical Research Awards, one of the most prestigious scientific honors in the United States.

title: Marjorie Hillis Roulston, Author Of Live Alone and Like It, Dies
description: Mrs. Marjorie Hillis Roulston, the author of the bestselling Live Alone and Like It, died at her home on Monday after a long illness. She was 82 years old and lived at 570 Park Avenue.

title: Caucus to Seek Equal Number Of Women Convention Delegates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The National Women's Political Caucus announced today the formation of a panel aimed insuring that women constitute at least half of the delegates to next year's Presidential nominating conventions.

title: N.B.C. Will Scrap 5 New TV Programs in January
description: The National Broadcasting Company became yesterday the first of the three major networks to announce its housecleaning plans for the new season, which begins in January. The network, which has been running a weak second to t'he Columbia Broadcasting System so far this season, is killing five of the series it introduced in September and bringing in two new shows and a weekly night of specials.

title: SWIFT DE LA PLAT A IS RULED BANKRUPT
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 9The Swift de la Plata meat packing company was declared bankrupt last night by a judge who rejected an agreement reached at a meeting of creditors held last month.

title: SAMUEL HERSHENSTEIN
description: Samuel Hershenstein, a law. year for 60 years, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 85 years, old and lived at the Park Royal Hotel, 23 West 73d Street.

title: 52 Missing in Plane Crash Off Italy
description: LEGHORN, Italy, Nov. 9Fortysix Italian paratroopers, five British crewmen and a British paratroop instructor were believed to have died when a British Royal Air Force transport plane crashed early this morning in the Ligurian Sea off this northern Italian port.

title: FUTURES PRICES FOR COTTON RISE
description: Cotton futures No. 2 maintained small gains near the close of trading on the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday. Trading was generally local in character, with commission houses active on both sides of the market.

title: States Ordered to Use Medicaid For Treating of Needy Children
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) After a delay of more than two years and complaints that it was stalling, the Health, Education and Welfare Department ordered all states today to begin providing routine medical examinations and treatIment of needy children within 90 days under the $6.2billion Medicaid program.

title: BUFFALO POLICEMEN CLEARED OF CHARGES
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9 (AP)Police Commissioner Frank Felicetta today dropped insubordination charges that had been filed against 275 policemen for refusing to appear in lineups during investigation of charges of police brutality.

title: LAKES SOLID COG IN GIANT DEFENSE
description: It was a rejuvenated band of. Giants that started tuning up yesterday at Yankee Stadium for Sunday's tussle with the Falcons in Atlanta. And, while they went through their paces with lots of hustle, the improved spirit of the players was most evident after the workout. The usual lockerroom buzz had a happy tone.

title: Health Aide Urges Federal Program for Conclusive Heart Disease Studies
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 9The director of the National Heart and Lung Institute proposed here today a $112million Federal research program to determine once and for all whether controlling high blood pressure, reducing the amount of fats and cholesterol in the blood and stopping cigarette smoking can lower the risk of early death from heart disease.

title: CONGRESS VOTES HEALTH TRAINING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Congress finished action today on two health manpower bills designed to promote the training of more doctors, dentists, nurses and other professionals.

title: RCA Sued by Marketime
description: The RCA Corporation confirmed reports yesterday that it had been shed for $110million in damages by the Marktime Corporation, which had leased computers from RCA. The suit, which was not described as a class action, claimed that RCA's decision to leave the mainframe computer business had diminished the value of equipment left in hands of customers. RCA had no comment but pointed out that the suit had been filed more than a week ago.

title: NEW YORK
description: Hizzoner, Mayor John Vliet Lindsay of New York, will be fifty on the 24th of this month, and as all old geezers know, this is a dicey and even dangerous age. It's not quite sensible, but at fifty you begin to feel you either have to get going or get out, and Mr. Lindsay is now somewhere in between. He is thinking about running for President of the United States, but is not yet running, and he is sending out his Deputy Mayor, Richard Aurelio, to look for groundswells.

title: Honeywell Plans a Layoff Of Some Research Workers
description: Honeywell, Inc., announced yesterday in Minneapolis that it planned to lay off 60 of the 225 workers at its corporate research center there.

title: Bridge:
description: American experts suffer from a permanent handicap in international play. They have relatively limited opportunity to compete outside their own borders, where languages, bidding styles, conditions of play and even the scoring may vary considerably from what they are used to.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: Transkei, a Showplace of Apartheid, Lags in Everything but Segregation
description: UMTATA, South Africa, Nov. 2The Transkei, the home of the agricultural Xhosa tribesmen, is the working model of a Government program to solve South Africa's race problems by complete geographical segregation. Right now, critics and backers agree, the prototype of apartheid engineering does not appear to work well.

title: BONDS OVERCOME EARLY WEAKNESS
description: The bond market, sparked by good sales receptions for two key new issues, bounced back from early weakness yesterday to finish roughly at Monday's closing levels. Shortterm interest rates held steady.

title: SOVIET SET TO PAY U.S. FISHING CLAIM
description: WESTPORT, Mass., Nov. 9The president of a New England lobster company said today that the head of the Russian fishing fleet had agreed to compenSate in cash for damage done to his fishing gear by Soviet fishing trawlers earlier this year.

title: Black America IS America
description: It is not really possible to talk about America without talking about black America, is it? Take a look around you; it's becoming increasingly clear that black America IS America, that black problems are not isolated but are the problems of the nationthat we, black and white, really are in the same boat.

title: Edward A. Morrison
description: Mayor's alter ego in Board of Estimate ... New York County chairman of Liberal. party. . . Protege of Alex Rose, head of Liberal party . . . Elevated from special mayoral assistant to executive assistant ... Will develop city's legislative strategy in Board of Estimate and City, Council ... His role has been to steer the Mayor's legislation through both bodies Worked closely with Mayor and Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio on various policy matters ... Joined administration in 1969 after serving as law secretary to State Supreme Court Justice George Starke . . . Now 38, graduated from Brooklyn College in 1954 and Columbia University Law School in 1957. . . Lives with wife and four sons in Manhattan

title: Jordan Takes Oath, Vows to End Fear in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 9Dr. Paul T. Jordan told the city's 4,100 employes today the dynasty of fear is ended as he took the oath of office as the youngest Mayor in the city's history.

title: Advertising:
description: The agency that was founded in early 1966 as Harvey & Carlson has been reformed as James Neal Haffvey, Inc.

title: Campaign Notes
description: COOS BAY, Ore., Nov. 9This is the season of the transcontinental Presidential endorsement hunt.

title: Norway and Market's Six in Deadlock
description: PARIS, Nov. 9The Common Market and the four nations that want to join it failed tonight to come to terms on the type of fisheries policy that could be observed in the enlarged trade bloc.

title: Police Note First Reduction in Years in Reported Robberies, Including Muggings, in Midtown Area
description: For the first time in years, there has been a reduction in reported robberies  including muggings  in the midtown area, Deputy Chief Inspector Jahn L. P. Keenan, commander of the police Third Division, said yesterday.

title: Legal Uncertainty Clouds Market for School Bonds
