description: The school bond market on Wall Street, which last year involved over $3.5billion in taxexempt bonds, is currently facing an uncertainty that is slowing or halting bidding in some instances and postponing several scheduled offerings.

title: Aid Request of Equity Project Turned Down by State Council
description: Artistic audience developer or showcase for the trade? The New York State Council on the Arts now classifies the Equity Library Theater as the latter and therefore, will not give it a grant this year.

title: 3 Chinese Visit U.N. to Prepare Way for Delegates
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9Three members of Peking's advance party visited United Nations Headquarters today to prepare the way for the new Chinese delegation. They were the first Chinese Communists to pay an official call here in 21 years.

title: WHITE HOUSE BARS TRADE PRESSURES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 The White House said today that President Nixon did not expect to use the authority to put new economic pressure on foreign governments that is contained in the Senate Finance Committee's version of the tax bill.

title: Food Challenge Seen
description: In meeting the continuing demands of consumers, food processors must make sure that the public keeps its most precious right'the right to choose'George W. Koch, president of the Grocery Manufacturers of America, warned here yesterday.

title: Stars, Colonels Win
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 9 (AP)The Utah Stars came out of a 6767 tie at the end of the third period tonight and scored a 9390 victory over the Memphis Pros in the second game of doubleheader. In the first game the Kentucky Colonels beat the Denver Rockets, 10696.

title: Pay Ruling is Studied
description: A number of companies across the country are studying the possibility of challenging inflationary second and thirdyear pay increases that are built into present labor contracts.

title: Final Approval Is Voted For Yonkers OTB Operation
description: YONKERS, Nov. 9 (UPI) The Yonkers City Council unanimously gave final approval tonight for the city to open an offtrack betting system.

title: TORRE IS NAMED MOST VALUABLE
description: Joe Torre of the St. Louis Cardinals was voted the most valuable player in the National League yesterday by a wide margin over Willie Stargell of the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Ranking Leaders in China Are Charged With Plotting
description: PEKING, Nov. 9 (Agence FrancePresse)  With the fate of Defense Minister Lin Piao and China's military chiefs still a mystery, a Chinese Communist party publication has accused ranking leaders of criminal plotting inside the party.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Phase Two stabilization machine is now working, exactly as President Nixon hoped it would: tightening the knot on future wage settlements and increasing the pressure on unions to acquiesce in the arrangement.

title: Cartier in Theater Post
description: Jacques Cartier has been appointed producing director of the Repertory Theater of New Orleans for the 1972 season. He succeeds June Havoc, who recently resigned as artistic director, a post she held for two years. The announcement was made by Mrs. Muriel Bultman Francis, theater board chairman.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: VIENNAToday marks a centennial of journalism's Golden Age, being the hundredth anniversary of the occasion when Henry Morton Stanley, correspondent of The New York Herald, discovered a longmissing white explorer on the banks of Lake Tanganyika at Ujiji and greeted him With the famous words: Doctor Livingstone, I presume.

title: Ribicoff Advocates Trade With Communist Nations
description: Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff urged here yesterday that the United States, despite its current preoccupation with the realignment of international exchange rates and trade barriers, move quickly to liberalize commercial dealings with the Soviet Union and other Communist nations.

title: Richard A. Brown
description: Ebullient . . . Sharp political trader . . . A Democrat, but has earned respect of all political parties . . . In last two years was city's Albany legislative representative . . Now will broaden political and policy responsibilities . Will coordinate work of city, Albany and Washington offices as director of Office of Intergovernmental Relations . . . . Received bachelor of arts degree at Hobart College in 1953 . . . Three years later, received a law degree from New York University law school . . . In 1961 was appointed assistant counsel to minority leader of Legislature . . . Spent nine years in Albany as counsel to Democratic legislative leaders . . . Was born in Brooklyn in 1932 and now lives in Forest Hills, Queens, with wife and three children.

title: STATE PICKS PANEL ON COLLEGE CRISIS
description: Governor Rockefeller and the state legialative leaders announced yesterday the formation of a new task force on the financing of higher education.

title: AURELIO QUITS TO ASSESS '72 PROSPECT FOR LINDSAY; HAMILTON DEPUTY MAYOR
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio resigned yesterday to set up a national network of Lindsay headquarters, ostensibly to assess the Mayor's Presidential prospects.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor: The defeat of the transportation bond issue will have a profound effect on the masstransportation situation in the New York metropolitan area. Therefore, every effort must be made. to aid mass transit, through city, county, state and Federal cooperation.

title: CIVIL SERVICE JOBS FOR ALIENS UPHELD
description: A state law that excludes aliens from Civil Service jobs was declared unconstitutional yesterday by a threejudge panel in Federal Court here.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Nov. 9 (UPI) Charlie Pasarell of Puerto Rico and Marty Riessen of Evanston, 11h, scored secondround victories in the World Championship Tennis event here today.

title: From Sikkim to 5th Ave: A Royal Visit
description: The King and Queen of Sikkim, in town to see old friends, were wined and dined at Bergdorf Goodman last night on behalf of their newest venture.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: Vikings Release Hilton
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 9 (AP)The Minnesota Vikings released John Hilton, a tight end, today and left the spot open temporarily for Sunday's National Football League game against the Green Bay Packers.

title: EDGAR J. FORIO
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9 (UPI)Edgar J. Forio, former senior vice president of the CocaCola Company, died yesterday at his retirement home at Fernandina Beach, Fla. He was 70 years old.

title: CAUTIOUS MARKET POSTS A THIN GAIN
description: Investors continued to tread gingerly along the canyons of Wall Street yesterday. Leading market averages showed only minute changes during a day when some issues came under noticeable pressure.

title: FILLOL EXTENDED TO DOWN DROBNY
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 9 (UPI)Jaime Filial of Chile had to thank his youth today for a 57, 62, 61 victory over Jaroslay Drobny of Britain in the second round of the Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament.

title: College Bowl MatchUps Are at Peak of Confusion
description: Television commitments, pressures from alumni, fans and the schools themselves and several super games have thrown the postseason college bowl picture into one of its most confusing positions in recent years.

title: Wurf Spurns Invitation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) A White House invitation to serve on the Committee on State and Local Government Cooperation has been rejected by Jerry Wurf, president of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes.

title: Shell Oil Says It Is Ready To Meet Gasoline Regulation
description: A Shell Oil Company official said yesterday that his compony had invested $1million in equipment to meet the city's new requirement lowering the content of lead in gasoline.

title: NEW SEEKERS SING AT THE MAISONETTE
description: Chances are that more people remember the song, Georgy Girl, which arrived with the film of the same naive five years ago, than the group that made the hit record of the song. The group was an Australian quartet called The Seekers, who had their burst of fame and then broke up in 1968.

title: TV: Channel 13 Is Scoring Points in Public Affairs
description: As discussion continues about the fate of publicaffairs programing on television, as public television is being notified about a cutbuck in funds from the Corpuration for Publie Broadcasting, the curious fact is that New York's Channel 13 is more active than ever these days. Overall operations may seem a bit chaotic at times, hut there is a master plan lurking in the background.

title: Dennison Uses Engineering Expertise to Sink Suffolk Bridge Plan
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. Nov. 9Suffolk County Executive H. Lee Dennison matched his engineering expertise with that of county construction officials today to beat back another attempt to reopen the 63yearold Shinnecock Canal bridge in Southampton.

title: 47 ARE ARRESTED IN WELFARE FRAUD
description: Fortyseven welfare clients were arrested yesterday on charges of stealing $145,000 from the Department of Social Services in the last few years.

title: Chinese Military Aide Is Promoted in Party Politburo
description: HONG KONG. Nov. 9Yeh Chienying, a 73yearold former Chinese Army marshal who has become increasingly active amid signs of a power struggle in Peking, has been promoted in the Communist party Politburo.

title: Tasting Proves Old Wine Is a Gamble
description: A rare 19thcentury bottle of red Bordeaux wine was cautiously uncorked in a Manhattan restaurant the other day and was pronounced . . . well, drinkable.

title: Questions and Answers on Policies Announced by the Pay Board
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Following are some questions compiled by The New York Times about the policies announced yesterday by the Pay Board and tentative answers obtained from various Pay Board sources, pending the establishment of specific rules of the board:

title: DOCK STRIKE DELAYS BLANKETS FOR INDIA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The International Longshoremen's Association was reported today to be holding up the loading of 657,000 blankets bound for East Pakistani refugees in India.

title: Globies' Tickets on Sale
description: Tickets go on sale today at 10 A.M. for the Harlem Globetrotters' two Sunday appearances at Madison Square GardenDec. 5 and Dec. 12. Each game will start at 1:05 P.M. Tickets, priced at $7, $6, $5, and 4, are available at the Garden box office and over 100 Ticketron outlets.

title: MARLBORO SEXTET EXCELS IN BRAHMS
description: The blend of youth and experience that gives the Music from Marlboro concerts their characteristic flavor proved its validity once again Monday night at Alice Tully Hall, most convincingly in the final piece on the program, the Brahms String Sextet in B flat (Op. 18).

title: JUDGE BACKS LAW CURBING SEX ADS
description: A State judge here yesterday upheld a new state law forbidding the public display of sexrelated material that would not necessarily be prohibited by strict United States Supreme Court definitions of obscenity.

title: Houston Gets School Plan
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)Dr. George Oser, president of the Houston school board, has recommended admitting 3yearolds to the public schools by 1973. He said that the plan, which would start next year with the admission of children aged 4, would cost $3million and could be financed by the Federal Government.

title: GENESCO REPORTS 13.1% RISE IN NET
description: Genesco, Inc., a leading apparel retailer and manufacturer, realized a 13.1 per cent increase in earnings for the quarter ended Oct. 31 on a sales gain of 9.5 percent, according to, a report issued yesterday froth the company's headquarters in Nashville.

title: Morocco Arrests A Former Minister In Corruption Drive
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 9The Moroccan Government announced the arrest of several prominent figures today including the leader of the Jewish community. The moves were part of an anticorruption campaign recently begun by King Hassan II.

title: BLAST PERIL SEEN IN POSTAL PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9A giant postal facility under construction in Jersey City had deadly methane, or swamp gas, in the marshy ground beneath it, a House Post Office subcommittee was told today.

title: Belgian Financial Group Invests 3.1Million in William D. Witter
description: William D. Witter, Inc., an Institutional brokerage concern, announced yesterday that Compagnie Lambert pour l'Industrie et la Finance, a Belgian financial holding company, had :made an investment of $3,155,000 in the firm.

title: Help to Returning G.l.'s
description: Robert W. Sarnoff says: For 30 years, the recreational and welfare programs of the U.S.O. have bright. ened the lives of our men and women in uniform at home and abroad. Now the U.S.O. is reaching out to help the returning veteran through the transition back to civilian life. No organization is better qualified for the task.

title: Housing Plans Shelved
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Senate Housing Committee today shelved until next year the Nixon Administration's major 1971 housing proposals. These include a revenuesharing plan for Federal housing aid and a consolidation of Government housing programs into a much smaller package.

title: U.N. Assembly Condemns Apartheid in 1092 Vote
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9The General Assembly voted, 109 to 2, today to condemn the policy of apartheid, or separation of the races, in South Africa and to seek means to boycott that country. Only Only Portgual ana South Africa voted against the resolution.

title: Mrs. Eisenhower on Trip
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 9 (UPI)Mrs. Dwight D. Eisenhower, discharged from Brooke Army Hospital in good condition last night, left San Antonio by train today for the Pacific Coast. The former First Lady will leave the train at Indio, Calif., and go to Palm Springs, a spokesman said. She will be 75 Sunday.

title: Head of Jewish Group Backs Youth
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9The newly elected chairman of the board of trustees of the Union of American, Hebrew Congregetions today called on the American Jewish community to avoid any rejection of youthful life styles.

title: Home to Make Another Rhodesia Effort
description: LONDON, Nov. 9Sir Alec DouglasHome, the Foreign Secretary, will fly to Rhodesia Sunday for one more effort to settle Britain's long dispute with the rebel white Government.

title: Reed Is Ready for Action, To Face Royals Tonight
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 9 Willis Reed worked out on a basketball court for the first time in almost two weeks today and said he was ready to play with the New York Knickerbockers tomorrow night against the Cincinnati Royals here.

title: Pakistanis Will Impose Collective Fines in East
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 9Pakistani authorities here have announced that collective fines will be imposed on entire communities in East Pakistan when guerrilla actions against the Government occur.

title: 6,000 in Bay State Face A 2d Night Without Heat
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., Nov. 9 (AP)  Residents in 6,000 homes in western Massachusetts bundled up for a second frigid night today after an act of vandalism deprived them of gas heat while temperatures plunged into the teens.

title: Rites Held for de Gaulle
description: PARIS, Nov. 9 (AP)President Pompidou and other key members of the French Government attended a memorial mass today for Gen. Charles de Gaulle in Notre Dame Cathedral. Today was the first anniversary of his death.

title: ROMNEY SAYS NADER EVADES LABOR CLASH
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Nov. (UPI)  Housing Secretary George Romney today accused Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, of evading a clash with the big labor unions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Even his farewell came with grace and dignity. A few days ago, Elgin Baylor of the Los Angeles Lakers retired from basketball because I do not want to prolong my career when I cannot maintain the standards I established for myself over the years. Thus ended the active role of one of the game's finest artists.

title: 2Hour44Minute Game Is Decided in 4 Seconds
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 9  The worn playing field of Memorial Stadium was no place last night for the weak, the indulgent or the uncommitted. In a bruising contest, 77 athletes struggled for 2 hours 44 minutes, but one play, which took four seconds, decided the game in favor of the Baltimore Colts over the Los Angeles Rams, 2417.

title: Notes on People
description: For a few hours yesterday, Senator George McGovern thought that Lieut. Col. Anthony Herbert, the muchdecorated soldier who is retiring from the Army in a dispute with his superiors ever alleged atrocities in Vietnam, was going to join his Presidential campaign staff.

title: Hockey Expands to Long Island, Atlanta
description: After two days of long, intense meetings, the National Hockey League yesterday granted franchises to a second New York area team and Atlanta.

title: Pan Am Board Meeting On Seawell Postponed
description: Pan American World Airways has postponed today's board meeting at which the directors planned to make a formal offer to William T. Seawell to be the airline's new president and chief operating officer.

title: Woman Awarded $204,243 For Injury in Auto Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) An $80 a week laundress was awarded a $204,243 judgement today against the Ford Motor Company and a local Ford dealer because of a crippling injury allegedly caused by faulty accelerator in her new Fairlane.

title: Credit Unions Gain Time
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 9 (UPI) The Senate Banking Committee today approved a Housepassed bill extending for two years the period in which Federally chartered credit unions could qualify for insurance for their depositors. The committee said about 1,300 of the existing 14,000 existing Federally chartered credit unions have failed to qualify.

title: Gillette Is Planning to Acquire Buxton, Inc., in $10Million Deal
description: Merger News

title: Center for Elderly Robbed a 3d Time Here, in 3 Weeks
description: We're just miserable, Frances King, director of the Sirovich Senior Center, said yesterdzy.

title: BUILDINGS AIDED THEN CONDEMNED
description: The Municipal Loan Program advanced half a million dollars for the renovation of six buildings that were later condemned by the city to clear sites for a school, a public housing project and urban renewal.

title: FOREIGN BANK UNITS GET U.S. GUIDELINES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (Reuters)  The Federal Reserve Board announced today the types of business activities in which foreign bank  holding companies operating in the United States may engage, under the. Bank Holding Company Act. Pleas for exemptions would be heard, the Reserve added.

title: Ken Aspromonte Picked to Manage Indians Next Year
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 9 (UPI)  After the second worse sea son in their history, the Cleveland Indians today named Ken Asprombnte, a former journeyman infielder from Brooklyn, as manager for 1972.

title: FINANCING SET UP FOR BRONX CENTER
description: A Federalcity agreement was announced yesterday to set up new controls and to clear financing of about $4million for the controveresial Hunts Point MultiService Center antipoverty program for the year started last, July 1.

title: THOMAS J. O'KANE
description: Thomas J. O'Kane, who retired as a detective from the Police Department in 1960 after 37 years on the force, died at his home on Tuesday evening. He was 70 years old and lived at 590 West 204th Street.

title: PAY BOARD AIDES HINT FLEXIBILITY ON 5.5% GUIDELINE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 Several members of the Pay Board indicated today that the 5.5 per cent guideline for wage increases announced last night would be applied very flexibly.

title: Rail Freight Rises Canceled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Interstate Commerce Commission said today that it had suspended railroad rate increases it had approved for after Phase ne of the wageprice freeze. The chairman, George Stafford, said that only, the Cost of Living Council could modify the ruling.

title: Market Place:
description: There can be little questionat least in Wall Street circlesthat the period of Super Growth is over for the Xerox Corporation.

title: Chou Bids Japan Accept Peking's Stand on Taiwan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 9Premier Chou Enlai of China has said that the Japanese Government, must show a clearcut attitude on the future of Taiwan if Tokyo wishes to establish diplomatic relations with Peking.

title: Defeat of Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor: A most significant but subtle fact about the voters' reaction to the transportation bond issue should not go unnoticed by the politicians. For once we were given the opportunity truly to voice our opinion about an issue, rather than, as in most elections, merely being forced to choose the least undesirable name from a list of generally unpopular candidates.

title: 0TC IS UP A BIT; AMEX PRICES EASE
description: Late selling erased many of the earlier gains on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market yesterday as the trading pace quickened.

title: 4Day Week Rejected By Nurses as Tiring
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 9 (AP)  Nurses in a surgical unit at the new Indiana University Hospital here have rejected the fourday week after a threemonth test.

title: Rahway Seeks College Men
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Nov. 9An ordinance requiring a minimum of 60 college credits for appointment to the City Police Department was introduced last night by the City Council, which is expected to approve it Dec. 8.

title: HOUSING PATROL ADDS 24 TO FORCE
description: The Housing Authority said yesterday that it was adding 24 policemen to the nineman force that patrols Baruch Houses, the Lower East tide project where a 63yearold woman died Monday after being beaten by intruders.

title: Greyhound Strike Voted
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 9 (AP)Members of the Amalgamated Transit Union Employes in 42 states have voted 8,463 to 405 in favor of a strike against Greyhound Bus Lines, William Rose, a Federal mediator said today. Mr. Rose said union officials did not set a date for a strike but added he had called union and company negotiators into session in an attempt to obtain a new contract.

title: Mine Talks Complicated By Pay Board's Decision
description: Negotiations between the United Mine Workers and the Bituminous Coal Operators Associatior continued yesterday in an effort to reach an agree ment to end the 40dayold strike by 80,000 soft coal miners.

title: Indian Attack Reported
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 9 The Pakistani radio said that two companies of regular Indian soldiers supported by armor and artillery attacked Pakistani positions south of Comilla in East Pakistan todaybut that they were stopped with heavy casualties. One Pakistani soldier was killed and two wounded, the radio said.

title: They May Be Commonplace Wares in China, but Here They're Certainly Rare
description: Shop Talk

title: City's New Deputy Mayor Edward Kalli Hamilton
description: Man In the News

title: DR. JAMES F. COLLINS
description: Dr. James F. Collins, former director of obstetrics and gynecology at Fordham and Westchester Square Hospitals in the Bronx and St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Manhattan, died of a brain tumor yesterday at Westchester Square Hospital, He was 73 years old and lived at 525 West 238th Street, the Bronx.

title: Mercenary Sentenced To 20 Years by Sudan
description: KHARTOUM, The Sudan, Nov. 9 (Reuters)  Rolf Steiner, a 41yearold West German mercenary, was sentenced to 20 years in prison today for his part in aiding the southern rebellion in the Sudan.

title: Financing Plan Unveiled By ExportImport Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 The ExportImport Bank disclosed today the details of its newly liberalized mediumterm discount loan plan for export financing by commercial banks.

title: Aurelio Will Stress Effort in 7 States With Early Contests
description: Richard R. Aurelio has selected seven states in which he plans to concentrate his initial efforts to assemble a campaign organization for Mayor Lindsay.

title: Chile, Reserves Low, Will Seek Renegotiation of Payments on Her $3Billion Foreign Debt
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 9President Salvador Allende Gossens announced today that Chile would ask her foreign creditors to renegotiate payment of debts totaling more than $3billion.

title: Ulster, Torn by Guerrilla War, Faces Major Political Change
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 9Torn by a new surge of urban guerrilla warfare, Northern Ireland is confronting the major social and political crisis of its 50year history.

title: Eleanor Holmes Norton
description: Tireless worker for human rights...Constitutional lawyer with national reputation ...As new executive mayoral assistant will head city's neighborhood programs... At 34 years of age, she also continues as city's Human Rights Commissioner... Graduated from Antioch College, 1960...Law degree from Yale University, 1964 ...Was a member of the American Civil Liberties Union staff...In 1968 defended George Wallace's right to use Shea Stadium for political rally...Also active in 1963 march on Washington ...published numerous articles on civil liberties... Taught at New Haven College and Pratt Institute... Lives in Manhattan.

title: U.S. Asserts Soviet Jews Are Not Living in Terror
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The State Department told Congress today that although Soviet Jews had to endure special hardships, their condition had not worsened in recent years and they were not living in a state of terror.

title: Senate Begin Debate on First Of 2 Interim Foreign Aid Bills
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  A new round of debate on foreign aid began in the Senate today as the first of two interim bills approved by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee last Thursday reached the floor.

title: Elizabeth Dubs Met's Bing Sir Rudolf
description: LONDON, Nov. 9Queen Elizabeth II touched a sword to the shoulder of the Metropolitan Opera's general manager today and invested him as Sir Rudolf Bing.

title: NIXON TELLS G.O.P. HIS MAJOR GOALS ARE NONPARTISAN
description: President Nixon, on the road in search of cash for a reelection campaign next year, swept into New York and on to Chicago last night to tell partisan audiences his goals of peace and prosperity were nonpolitical.

title: City Purchase Aide Under U.S. Inquiry
description: The office of United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. is investigating reports that Purchase Commissioner Marvin Gersten participated in an alleged payoff in a deal involving the purchase of equipment for the city.

title: Behind the New Wage Controls: Two Weeks of Tense and Tedious Deliberations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 More than once, the men had sat in the barren room and worked around the long conference table in their shirtsleeves because a heating malfunction had driven the temperatures so high.

title: ShoeMarket Shift Into Chains And Discounters Is Predicted
description: The new chairman of the American Footwear Industries Association predicted yesterday that shoe marketing and distribution patterns would change markedly within the next decade.

title: Iran Opens Military Trial Of U.S. Woman as a Spy
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 9 (AP) Mrs. Sharon La Bere, a 29yearold American nursing student from Oakland, Calif., went on trial before a military tribunal today on charges of espionage and antiGovernment activities. She could get two to 10 years in solitary confinement if convicted.

title: NIGH COURT REJECTS JERSEY RELIEF RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled today invalid a, 1970 New Jersey welfare regulation that was designed to limit assistance to families with outside income.

title: 3 Films Win Cine Awards
description: Rock  a  Bye  Baby, How Old Is Old? and Arthur Penn Directs Little Big Man have won Cine Golden Eagle Awards, it was announced by TimeLife films, which is releasing the short subjects. The awards are made by the Council of Nontheatrical Events of Washington, which selected the short subjects for showing at film festivals here and abroad next year. Lothar Wolff, of TimeLife, will accept the awards in Washington tomorrow as well as a Cine Golden Eagle for his condensed version of Martin Luther, originally made as a feature film in 1953.

title: Advertising:
description: The folks in the liquor industry are calling it the Oklahoma Land Run or the Alaska Gold Rush, and they say there hasn't been anything like it since Repeal.

title: Heykal Criticizes the U.S. On Peace Drive Monopoly
description: CAIRO, Nov. 9In further Egyptian criticism of United States diplomacy in the Middle East, the editor of the daily Al Abram, Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, declared today that Egypt must break a United States monopoly over peace efforts between Egypt and Israel.

title: Bay Expansion of La Guardia Airport Is Killed
description: The Port of New York Authority announced yesterday that it had dropped a plan to mild more hangers at La Guardia Airport for new, large fete by filling in 97 acres of Bowery Bay.

title: Mugging Imperils London Orchestra Flutist's Career
description: The first flutist of the New Philharmonia Orchestra of London said yesterday that his career might be altered as a result of mouth injuries sustained when he was robbed and beaten Saturday night in front of Lincoln Center.

title: Exacta Returns $1,662
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 9Laurel race course's largest exacta payoff occurred today when Gunnysdeb and Mitos Elpis returned $1,662 for $2 after finishing one, two in the fifth Lace. Two $10 tickets, two $5 tickets and 22 $2 tickets were sold on the winning 101 combination.

title: New Vermont Liquor Rule
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Nov. 9 (AP)Bars in Vermont may remain open until 2:30 o'clock most mornings as a result of new regulations adopted by the State Liquor Control Board.

title: Troy Calls Lindsay's Tenure Inefficient and Incompetent
description: Matthew J. Troy Jr., the Queens County Democratic leader, attacked Mayor Lindsay's administration yesterday as inefficient, extravagant and in some instances incompetent.

title: RIGHTS AIDES CAL REHNQUIST RACIST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.9  In a heated Senate Judiciary Committee hearing today, William H. Rehnquist, who has been nominated to the Supreme Court by President Nixon, was accused of racism and was said to have tried to prevent Negroes from voting in his home city of Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Buffalo Woman Kills Man, His 2 Sons and Herself
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9 (AP)A woman killed the man with whom she lived and his two sons today, held off policemen with sporadic gunfire for more than three hours and then shot herself dead, the police said.

title: TOCKS IS. SQUATTERS TO BE CLEARED OUT
description: The Army Corps of Engineers plans to go ahead very soon, within a few days with the bulldozing of houses occupied by squatters on the site of the proposed Tocks Island Dam and recreational area in the Delaware, River Valley.

title: That OldTime Isolation
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind.In a few hours of precipitate action on foreign aid, the Senate dealt another major blow to the development prospects of more than 100 developing countries. It followed President Nixon's equally unexpected action adversely affecting the poor countries.

title: The Social Life of Wolves
description: McKINLEY PARK, AlaskaWolves are perhaps the most social of all subhuman vertebrates. A pack of wolves is not a snarling aggregation of fighting beasts, each bent on fending only for itself, but a highly organized, welldisciplined group of related individuals or family units, all working together in a remarkably amiable, efficient manner.

title: Campaign for Research Facility at Lincoln Center Given Boost
description: A grant of $250,000 from the Peter C. Cornell Trust, a fund, bearing the name of Katharine Cornell's father, has added momentum to the drive to assure the immediate and longrange future of the Research Library of the Performing Arts.

title: Chaparrals Beat Nets, 9086, Holding Barry to 24 Points
description: DALLAS, Nov. 9 (AP)Steve Jones hit 10 consecutive shots and paced the Dallas Chaparrals to a defensemindded 9086 victory over the New York Nets in the American Basketball Association tonight.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Andrew P. Herr
description: Former management consultant . . . Before Budget Bureau appointment earlier this year was unpaid director of City Policy Planning Council . . . City's Board of Ethics found no conflict of interest in $212,000 management consultant contract awarded by city to his concern . . . Held he was not city employe and planning council title was without legal meaning . . . As first deputy budget director, he will also be a member of Mayor's labor policy committee . . . Founded A. P. Kerr and Associates, consultant concern . . . Reputation as expert in urban program analysis . . . Received master in business administration at Harvard Business School in 1964. . . Lecturer at New York University Graduate Schoo of Business.

title: U.S. Riders Regain Team Laurels at Horse Show
description: The United States served notice last night that it was back in the world equestrian picture, when it regained the international team championship and the American Horse Shows Association Challenge Trophy, as the Natonal Horse Show closed its eightday run at Madison Square Garden beforo a crowd of 9,000.

title: 28 Sets Record Low Here
description: At 3:35 AM. yesterday, the temperature here was 28 degrees, two degrees below the previous lowest temperature for a Nov. 9, in 1923. The National Weather Service forecast for today calls for cloudiness with a chance of snow flurries.

title: New Taxes Barred in Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. (UPI)The Ohio House of Representatives voted today 28 to 66 to reject a plan to levy $832million in new taxes, including a proposed increase in the state sales tax from 4 to 5 per cent.

title: Jets' Swinney No Longer Watcher of Games on TV
description: If Gerry Philbin's left knee, lets him return to active duty Sunday, Clovis Swinney probably will watch most of the Jets' game with the Baltimore Colts from the bench. That location, however, will give Swinney a closer view of the game than his television set.

title: B52's Attack Enemy
description: SAIGON, Nov. 9 (UPI)United States B52 bombers attacked enemy positions near Quangtri in the northeastern part of South Vietnam today for the first time in more than a year, military, spokesmen reported.

title: JAKARTA REPORTS PRISONER RELEASE
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov, 9 The Indonesian Government, appearing confident of political stability, says that it is speeding the release of thousands of political prisoners jailed without trial in 1965 when General Suharto assumed power following an abortive Communist coup.

title: STIFF PESTICIDE BILL APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) The House passed today an Administrationbacked bill that stiffens Federal regulation of 60,000 pesticide products ranging from weed killers to housewives' bathroom sprays.

title: N.A.M. Director Named
description: Edmund T. Pratt Jr., president of Pfizer, Inc., has been elected a director of the National Association of Manufacturers, it was announced yesterday.

title: Artists Vie for $250,000 in State Funds
description: Artists bearing works of sundry shapes and diverse sizes are trooping into the Brooklyn War Memorial this week, giving the place the look of a gallery that has been in a collision with a rummage sale.

title: Excerpts From Chou Text
description: TOKYO, Nov. 9Following are excerpts from the official record of an interview given by Premier Chou Entai of China to Moto Goto, managing editor of Asahi Shirnbun, in Peking on Oct. 28. The second of two installments of an English translation of the transcript appeared in The Asahi Evening News today.

title: Net Up by 17% at Norton Simon
description: Norton Simon, Inc., increased its net income by 17 per cent to a record total of $11,346,000, or 82 cents a share, in the first fiscal quarter ended Sept. 30, David J. Mahoney, chairman and president, told shareholders here yesterday.

title: Move Was Expected Here
description: Hankers with close ties to Latin America said last night that they had been expecting President Allende's announcement that Chile would have to renegotiate her foreign debt.

title: Agnew's Birthday
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 9 (UPI)The republican faithful sang Happy Birthday, Dear Spiro tonight and gave Vice President Agnew a red, white and blue right golf shoe and a birthday cake. It was Mr. Agnew's 53a birthday and the party was a gathering of 1,800 Republicans who paid $500 for dinner and speeches by Mr. Agnew ana President Nixon.

title: Education Board Is Favored Over. One Commissioner at Hearing
description: Strong support for a central Board of Education to oversee the city's decentralized school system, rather than the proposed appointment, of a Commissioner of Education, was voiced yesterday by many speakers at a public hearing conducted by a state legislative committee.

title: Slack Students Hold SitIn At University of Hartford
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 9Almost all of the 120 black students at the University of Hartford staged a sitin this afternoon at North House, the main administration building. They vowed to stay until a series of demands, mainly relating to increased financial aid for minority students, were met.

title: Nader Is Critical Of Plants' Secrecy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Ralph Nader told a Senate subcommittee today that, we know more about the C.I.A. than is known about the internal workings of G.M. [General Motors].

title: SHEPARD BIDS U.N. BACK ASTRONAUT AID
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 9Adm. Alan B. Shepard, speaking for a small band of explorers in outer space, called today for quick approval by governments of h United Nations treaty on rescue and aid to astronauts.

title: 5 Nations Limited The Upward Float Of Currency Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9At least five industrial countries apparently moderated the upward float of their currencies' exchange rates by buying dollars in the foreignexchange market in September, International Monetary Fund statistics indicated today.

title: Executive Changes
description: General Motors of Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday the election of of John D. Baker as president, chief executive officer, director and general manager. Mr. Baker, who has been manager of operations for the Fisher Body Division of the General Motors Corporation since late 1969, succeeds Roland S. Withers, who returns to the Detroit central office as vice president on special assignment reporting to the vice president in charge of the car and truck group. The changes are effective Dec. 1.

title: Art: Durand's Fresh View of Nature
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov. 9It might come as a surprise to followers of American art that the current Asher B. Durand exhibition at the Montclair Art Museum is the first comprehensive exhibition of importance of this famed artist. One of the leading painters of the Hudson River School and one of the consequential American landscape artists of the 19th century, Durand is known to us more through textbooks and lectures and through occasional peeks at his work in large thematic shows than through any widespread museum representation of his art.

title: Saigon Political Figure Is Slain; Mentioned as Possible Premier
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 10 (AP)A political figure who reportedly was being considered for premier of South Vietnam was assasinated at noon today at an intersection in Saigon.

title: Boy's Death on Penal Farm May End Arkansas's Jailing of Poor
description: LUXORA, Ark.  Nathan Smith Jr. had always been a troublemaker, so when he was buried in a Negro cemetery last August, some people said good riddance, a few asked if it wasn't a downright shame, and only his mother cried.

title: Warriors Roll On, 11599
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 9 (UPI)Cazzie Russell and Nate Thurmond, held to 6 points in the first half, combined for 21 points in a thirdperiod outburst tonight that carried the Golden State Warriors to a 11599 victory over the Houston Rockets. Russels topped the Warriors with 23 points. Clyde Leer collected 27 rebounds.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE NIGHT COUNTRY. Icy Loren Elseley, Illustrated by Leonard Everett Fisher. 240 pages. Scribners. $7,95.

title: Dance: Cubiculo, Host to New Talent
description: The Cubiculo is one of the smallest theaters in the Broadway areanot only one of the smallest but also one of the most active. It is to be found in a brownstone on West 51st Street and since its opening in December, 1968, it has played host to countless dance performances, as well as engaging in theater, film and poetry readings.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Union Charges 13 of 21 Stores Surveyed Here by a Watcher Were Not Making Price Lists Available
description: Thirteen out of 21 stores surveyed last week had neither ceiling price lists nor price information available, in violation of Federal price freeze regulations, the city's largest public employe union charged yesterday.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) The Supreme Court temporarily halted today a requirement that the Hughes Tool Company put up an extra $85million bond in connection with a 145million default judgement in favor of Trans World Airlines.

title: Defeatof Transportation Bond Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: Lakers Trounce Bulls
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 9 (AP) Four starters, led by Jim McMillian, accounted for 91 points tonight as the hotshooting Los Angeles Lakers scored a 122109 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

title: CONDORS SUBDUE PACERS, 133123
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 9 (UPI) George Thompson scored 33 points and John Brisker had 31 to pace the Pittsburgh Condors to a 133123 victory tonight over the Indiana Pacers.

title: ORIOLES SUFFER FIRST JAPAN LOSS
description: KYOTO, Japan, Nov. 9 (AP)  The Tokyo Yomiuri Giants, teaming with the Hankyu Braves, recorded 12 hits off four Baltimore hurlers today and whipped the American League champion Orioles, 82.

title: KINGS WILL FACE RANGERS TONIGHT
description: The clubs on the top and bottom of the National Hockey League  the Rangers and Los Angeles Kings  bring, in streaks fitting to their stations at Madison Square Garden tonight.

title: Narcotics Suspect Seized In Hotel Off Times Sq.
description: The police arrested a 27yearold man early this morning who they said was one of the major narcotics suppliers in the Times Square area.

title: A RECITAL DEBUT BY JOY BLACKETT
description: It is not often that a debuting singer has the kind of nearflawless vocalism that Joy Blackett exhibited in her recital Monday night in Town Hall. The mezzosoprano, a native of Bermuda, has studied at Oberlin College and the Juilliard School. She has appeared here as soloist in various concerts, but this was the first program she has had to herself. Her recital was the opening event in this season's Young Concert Artists Series, and it set a high standard for the concerts to come.

title: Right Race, Right Odds but Wrong Finish
description: The $11,000 feature at Aqueduct yesterday was called the Women's Republican Club, a fitting occasion for Brenda Felicetti to saddle the third horse of her budding career as a trainer.

title: SPERRY INTRODUCES NEW UNIVAC MODEL
description: The Sperry Rand Corporation introduced yesterday the Univac 9700, which it described as a new communicationsoriented mediumscale computer system. The line was described here, in Frankfurt and in Tokyo.

title: Philippine Prison Guards Kill 14 Convicts Attempting Escape
description: MANILA, Nov. 9 (AP)Fourteen convicts were shot to death last night in a mass escape attempt at the Philippine National Penitentiary.

title: Nixon Dinner Menu Includes Chuckles
description: It was, as Bob Hope told them, a gathering where a gravy stain was worth more than the black tie it soiled.

title: Demands Held Buried
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Representative Herman Badillo, Democrat of New York City, contended today that investigations of the prisoner rebellion at the State Correctional Facility at Attica in September were an attempt to keep public attention away from the demands made by the inmates.

title: Big Board Is Investigating Oct. 14 Trading in G.M.
description: The New York Stock Exchange is investigating recent trading in the shares of the General Motors Corporation and is considering disciplinary action against one or more member firms, including the specialist in the stock.

title: CITY HEALTH UNIT CITES 18 PLACES
description: The names of 18 restaurants and foodprocessing establishments with serious Health Code violations were announced yesterday by Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase.

title: Concession in Newton Trial
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 10 (UPI)  Patrolman Herbert Heanes, on the stand in the third trial of Huey P. Newton, admitted today that he did not see a gun in the Black Panther leader's hand the night his partner, Patrolman John Frey, was killed. Newton is charged with manslaughter in officer Frey's death. His first trial ended in conviction, but it was overturned on appeal, and a second trial last summer ended with a deadlocked jury.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Ampex Corporation announced the election of Arthur H. Hausman as president and chief executive officer succeeding William E. Roberts who continues as chairman. Mr. Hausman, 47 years old, has been chief operating officer and executive vice president of the company. Mr. Roberts's decision to resign was prompted by a recent heart attack.

title: Pakistan Reports Repulsing A Major Indian Offensive
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 10 A military communiqu said that Pakistani troops blunted major Indian offensive today in the Belonia bulge of Noakhali district of East Pakistan.

title: WASHINGTON POST NAMES PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Katharine Graham, president of the Washington Post Company, today announced the appointment of John S. Prescott Jr. as president of The Washington Post.

title: PELL W. FOSTER
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Nov. 10 Pell W. Foster Jr., retired vice president of the Foster Wheeler Corporation, designer and manufacturer of marinepower plants, died yesterday at ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center in New York. He was 77 years old and lived here at 171 Chestnut Street.

title: Hsinhua Correspondents Get Room in Secretariat
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 10United Nations officials today assigned a newly painted office on the fourth floor of the Secretariat building to the two correspondents for Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, who will arrive with the delegation tomorrow.

title: New Police Squad Created to Fight Crime in Streets
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday the creation of another special squad to combat street crime. Its members wilt be disguised as ordinaryand not so ordinarycitizens.

title: INDEPENDENCE, MO., TO REOPEN SCHOOLS
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Nov. 10, (AP)Schools will reopen in Independence on Monday despite the defeat of a property tax increase that officials had said was required to resume classes.

title: JOHN W. MAHONEY
description: John W. Mahoney, a night operator in the composing room of The New York Times at his retirement in 1962 after 35 years' service, died on Monday. He was 75 years old and lived at 29A Milton Avenue, Jersey City.

title: Central Louisiana Order
description: The Central Louisiana Electric Company has ordered a $10million power generation system to be designed and built by the Babcock & Wilcox Company. The new facility will be located near Boyce, La., and will generate 430,000 kilowatts of electricity. This is the second unit of Its kind ordered from Babcock & Wilcox.

title: Treasury Comments
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10A Treasury spokesman said today that the Treasury Department is exploring dates in early December for a meeting of the finance ministers and central bank governors of the Group of Ten nations.

title: U.N., U.S. and City Ready for Arrival of Chinese Today
Squires Triumph, 119116
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Nov. 10 (AP)Charlie Scott scored 35 points as the Virginia Squires defeated the Floridians, 119116, tonight.

title: Jersey Woman Dies at 10
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 10Mrs. Catherine M. Arnold, a longtime resident of this city, died yesterday at the New Jersey Eastern Star Home for the Aged in Somerville at the age of 104. She was reportedly the oldest member of the Order of the Eastern Star in the United States. Surviving are a daughter, two grandchildren and seven greatgrandchildren.

title: An Embittered Lurtsema Is Dropped by the Giants
description: Bob Lurfsema, the 6foot6inch, 250pound defensive end, was put on waivers yesterday by the New York Giants, and one of the bitter mementos he left near his Yankee Stadium locker was a letter from a fan.

title: The Survival of Roy Jenkins
description: Roy Jenkins has survived impressively a drive by leftwingers to depose him as deputy leader of Britain's Labor party in the House of Commons. In a threeman, firstround contest, the former Chancellor of the Exchequer received 140 votesmany more than anyone had predicted and only two short of the required majority. He seems assured of a decisive victory in a runoff next week against Michael Foot, intellectual leader of Labor's left wing.

title: Bonavena Hurts His Hand, Fight With Patterson Is Off
description: Floyd Patterson's 10  round heavyweight fight with Oscar. Bonavena at Madison Square Garden on Dec. 7 has been called off because of an injury to Bonavena's hand, the Garden said yesterday. There were no plans to reschedule it.

title: ANALYSIS ON JEWS INSOVIETDISPUTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10A 23yearold woman who emigrated to Israel from the Soviet Union 20 months ago told a House subcommittee today that while Russian Jews may not live in concentration camps, our spirit is in terror.

title: Mariner Taking Its First Detailed Photos of Mars
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 10Mariner 9 began taking its first detailed photographs of Mars today as the unmanned American spacecraft, continuing to perform flawlessly, moved closer to its planned rendezvous with the mysterious red planet on Saturday.

title: U.N. Given List of 1,000
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 10A list of names said to include those of more than 1,000 Soviet Jews who want to emigrate to Israel was presented today to Adam Malik of Indonesia, President of the General Assembly, by Yosef Tekoah, Israel's chief representative.

title: SENATE APPROVES FOREIGN AID BILL WITH BIG CUT, 6123
description: WASHINGTON, NOV. 10The Senate tonight passed strippeddown foreign aid bill that would authorize $1.14billion in economic and humanitarian assistance. The vote was 61 to 23.

title: PERSICO ON TRIAL ON USURY CHARGES
description: Carmine J. Persico went on trial yesterday in State Supreme Court here on 37 counts of extortion, coercion, criminal usury and conspiracy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Muzz Patrick Is Named
description: Madison Square Garden and the International Roller Derby League announced yesterday that Muzz Patrick, a Garden executive, had been named managing director of the Chiefs, Madison Square Garden's Roller Derby team.

title: Two Women Set Afire
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 10 (AP)Two young women are in critical condition today after setting each other on fire because, as one explained to the police, Dying is beautiful. Police Chief Walter Krasny said Anita Louise McQueen, 20 years old, of Livonia, and Raelle Weinstein, 26, of Skokie, Ill., apparently wrapped themselves in paper, sat crosslegged on the floor and set each other on fire.

title: Group of Ten Postponing Finance Ministers' Parley
description: PARIS, Nov. 10The major industrial powers of the West, hoping to avoid another check in their efforts to resolve the world monetary crisis, have postponed a meeting of their finance ministers that hid been planned for Nov. 2223 in Rome.

title: PROGRAM SET UP FOR ALCOHOLICS
description: Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase announced plans yesterday for the city's first comprehensive treatment system for alcoholics.

title: Soviet Trade Official Plans Talks With U.S. Companies
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 10 (AP)A deputy foreign trade minister, Vladimir S. Alkhimov, left for New York today for talks with American companies, Tass said.

title: A $70,000 Study of F.B.I. Commissioned by Group Backing Bureau
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The Friends of the F.B.I., an organization formed to combat criticism of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and its director, J. Edgar Hoover, announced today the start of an indepth, objective study of the bureau.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The spectacle of Senator Edward Kennedy defending the reputation of William Rehnquist against allegations by Joseph Rauh of the A.D.A. suggests the painful dilemma in which liberals and civil libertarians have been placed by Mr. Rehnquist's nomination to the Supreme Court.

title: Market Place:
description: You would have needed lot of fortitude to watch the action in Electronic Data Systems yesterday if you owned shares in Ross Perot's dataprocessing fiefdom.

title: Beame's Transit Fare Plan Is Praised by Rockefeller
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that the new Beame plan, which would tax business and real estate here to subsidize mass traristt, was the most forthright ap proach to the city's problem of trying to save the 30cent fare.

title: Bias in Capital Against Women is Laid to N.B.C
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The radio and television stations here owned and operated by the National Broadcasting Company were found today to have discriminated against women in promotions to managerial jobs, in salaries and in hiring for nonmanagerial jobs.

title: Studs on Snow Tires Stir Controversy Over Safety
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The advent of the winter driving season has generated controversy over the safety benefits of snow tires with metal studs for extra traction on ice.

title: Inca Says Cutbacks May Recur in 1972
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 10The International Nickel Company of. Canada, Ltd., may make further production cutbacks in 1972, but it is convinced its longterm estimate of market growth at 7 per cent annually is accurate, Henry S. Wingate, chairman, told the Montreal Society of Investment Analysts today.

title: Last Chance for Peace
description: The extraordinarily optimistic claims for the Vietnamization program made by Secretary of Defense Laird after a combat zone inspection tour have opened the way for a dramatic Presidential announcement next week. Whether soundly based or not, the Laird comments seem designed to provide a rationale permitting President Nixon to step up the present pace of troop reductions in Vietnam. Since even maintenance of the present pace would terminate the American ground presence before the end of next year, Mr. Nixon is in position now, if he is so disposed, to offer the Communists a terminal date for American military withdrawal.

title: Strickman Awarded Patent For His Cigarette Filter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 Robert L. Strickman, a New Jersey chemist, was granted a patent this week for the cigarette filter that caused considerable embarrassment to Columbia University four years ago.

title: Gimbels Will Put Stress On Its BetterTaste Items
description: Gimbel Brothers' 10 department stores in the metropolitan area are engaged in an aggressive tradingup program aimed at raising profit ratios and at achieving our more rightful share of the market, Paul. A. Salomone, the new president of Gimbels New York, said yesterday.

title: MRS. FRANK A. REED
description: MUTTONTOWN, L.I., Nov 10 Mrs. Edna Jackson Reed, widow of Frank A. Reed, a vice president of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died yesterday at her home. She was 83 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Snow a First in Century
description: A light snowfall dusted the metropolitan area starting at 2:34 A.M. yesterday. It marked the first time in 102 years of recorded weather observations that snow had fallen here on Nov. 10, the National Weather Service said. The flurries continued until after daybreak.

title: Plants Called Endangered, Along With Rare Animals
description: The rapid worldwide growth of industry, the spread of urbanization and increasing development of oncewild areas have caused a new type of lifeplantsto be listed by wildlife conservation experts as endangered species.

title: Chinese Diplomats Create Rosy Glow For Roosevelt Hotel's Fading Glory
description: It is hard in know v. hether it was a diplomatic faux pas on the part of the Romanians who made the reservation or a bit of exquisitely dry Chinese humor, but there are lush ironies in the fact that the first permanent diplomade mission established by Communist China in the

title: Critics Name Judith Crist
description: Judith Crist, movie critic for New York magazine and the Today television show, was named vice chairman of the New York Film Critics at a meeting of the group yesterday at the Columbia University Club. Miss Crist will serve with William Wolf, of Cue Magazine, who is chairman of the organization. The critics will vote on their annual awards for outstanding work In movies on Dec. 28.

title: Leone For a Brooklyn Sports Complex
description: Mayor Lindsay gave quick and enthusiastic support to a proposal for a sports complex in downtown Brooklyn that, would include a sixstory office building, a hotel, banquet facilities and a bus terminal.

title: MRS. GEORGE G. SHOR
description: COLD SPRING, N.Y., Nov. 10 Mrs. Dorothy Williston Shor died Monday evening of injuries received in an automobile accident near West Point. She was 80 years old and lived on Carmel Road.

title: Cerro Unit Halts Delivery
description: The Cerro Sales Corporation, metal marketing subsidiary, of the Cerro Corporation, declared yesterday a condition of force majeure, effective yesterday on all shipments of refined silver. The action, which will halt shipments, stemmed from a strike of about 13,000 mine and metallurgical workers which since Oct. 28 has closed down mining, smelting and refining operations of Cerro de Pasco Corporation, Cerro's subsidiary in Peru.

title: WALTER J. MURPHY
description: Walter J. Murphy, a floorman in the delivery room of The New York Times at his retirement last Feb. 1 after 22 years' service, died on Monday. He was 67 years old and lived at 215 West 70th Street.

title: Mansholt Calls for Inquiry Into Problem of Pesticides
description: ROME, Nov. 10Sicco L. Mansholt, vice president of the Common Market Commission, called today for a thorough study of the problems of pesticides, specifically DDT.

title: PNOMPENH ATTACKS KILL 25 AND HURT 30
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Thursday, Nov. 11 (AP)The toll in yesterday's enemy attacks on the Pnompenh airport and a nearby communications center was put today at 25 Cambodians killed and 30 wounded.

title: Screen: 2 Horror Films:Twin-Bill Highlighted by 'Crucible of Horror'
description: It's painful to watch Viveca Lindfors and Boris Karloff, in reportedly his last film, balancing garbage like "Cauldron of Blood" on yesterday's double-bill. Made in Spain, the picture is a clanky derivation of "House of Wax," whose anemic color even makes the Costa del Sol look dreary, which takes some doing.The one to see, without running, is the British "Crucible of Horror," which probes a seething family quartet with spider cunning, often brilliance. "Let's kill him," whimpers mother to daughter, after a quiet, opening breakfast scene with a sadistic father that will curl your hair. The two women set about it.Superbly directed by Viktors Ritelis and beautifully played by Yvonne Mitchell, Sharon Gurney and Michael Gough, the picture would have been a knockout if not for a last-reel sag, with the suspense stretched rather than developed. It is also an admirably bloodless film, but then so are two pivotal characters in the small cast.But for tight, merciless tension and venom, the movie is uncommonly effective and engrossing. Add the twist of a civilized, very British fadeout that is the most horrifying thing of all. Quite a picture. Quite.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
The Making of a Supreme Court Justice
description: The Supreme Court of the United States is now in the midst of one of the storms of criticism which have periodically assailed it. Bills have been introduced in Congress to limit the jurisdiction of the high court, to overrule some of its controversial nonconstitutional decisions, and to declare the sentiment of the Senate as to the necessity of judicial background on the part of a nominee to the Court. It has been urged that the advice of the Senate be sought by the President before any nomination to the Court is made.

title: The Theater:
description: The Theater of Latin America, a nonprofit organization that first brought us the rambunctious political musicals of Augusto Boal and Alexandro Jodorowsky's film El Topo. opened a new Chilean play Tuesday night, Americaliente by Jorge Diaz, at St. Clement's Church, 423 West 46th Street.

title: Kent Trial Date Set
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Nov. 10 (AP)Nov. 22 has been set as the new date for the trials of 23 persons indicted by a special state grand jury that investigated the disorders at Kent State University in 1970. A Portage County Common Pleas court judge, Edwin Jones, set the date.

title: Two Senators Call Plan on El Paso Gas Private Relief Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 The solid Western support for a bill to exempt the El Paso Natural Gas Company from the antitrust laws was broken today when California's Senators, Alan Cranston and John V. Tunney, announced their opposition.

title: Musical Postpones Opening
description: Wild and Wonderful, the musical by Bob Goodman, Bob Brotherton and Robert Miller, has postponed its Broadway opening at the Lyceum Theater from Nov. 18 to Nov. 30. Previews will begin Nov. 22.

title: CITY HALL CRITIC GETS STATE POST
description: Roger Starr, a housing expert who has been critical of the Lindsay administration's handling of the city's housing crisis, was named yesterday to head a task force on housing and community development by the chairman of the new state commission investigating the operations of the city's government.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On Foreign Aid Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate passed the foreign economic aid bill:

title: ChrisCraft Is Enjoined
description: A court in Wilmington, Del., yesterday ordered ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., to make available its shareholder lists to two dissident shareholders who are part of a group threatening a proxy fight for control of the company. The two dissidents are AndrewSchnell Jr., a Waukesha, Wis., businessman, and Jack Safer. The ChrisCraft annual meeting is scheduled for Dec. 8.

title: SENATE UNIT ENDS NOMINEE HEARINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 The Senate Judiciary Committee ended its hearings today on the nominations of Lewis F. Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court amid indications, that both nominees would win the approval of the committee and the full Senate.

title: Advertising:
description: About four years ago, Doyle Dane Bernbach, one of the small group of publicly held ad agencies, announced its intention of diversifying by acquiring undermarketed companies and adding the missing ingredient.

title: Four Children Die in Trailer
description: GALION, Ohio, Nov. 10 (UPI)  Four children, ranging in age from 15 months to eight years, died today when fire destroyeled their house trailer home. The victims were the children of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Smith, who escaped the fire without injury. The dead were identified as Andrew, 15 months; Charles, 5; Lillian May, 7, and Shelly Lynn, 8.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lakers Rout 76ers, 143103
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 10 (UPI)The Los Angeles Lakers handed the Philadelphia 76ers their second worst defeat in history tonight, 143103.

title: HAWKS DEFEATED BY BUCKS, 116110
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 10 (AP) Milwaukee's Kareem Jabbar lost a scoring duel with At lanta's Lou Hudson tonight, but the Bucks still registered a 116110 National Basketball Association victory over the Hawks.

title: JUMPING OF BAIL GALLED RAMPANT
description: Bail jumping and parole violating are so rampant in New York City, the State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime was told yesterday, that nearly 10 per cent of last year's cases in State Supreme Court here have had to go unprosecuted.

title: Castro Arrives in Santiago To Enthusiastic Welcome
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 10Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba arrived in Chile today on his first trip to Latin America in 11 years and received an enthusiastic welcome in the streets of this capital. Mr. Castro stepped off the white Soviet jet airliner that had brought him here nonstop from Havana and embraced his old friend and political admirer, President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile.

title: Phoenix Mayor Wins
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 10 (AP)Mayor John Driggs and six fellow Charter Government Candidates for the City Council piled up decisive victories in yesterday's election. Their election assured two more years of control of the city government by the nonpartisan group, which has picked municipal officials since 1949.

title: Questions and Answers On Pay Board Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Following are some questions compiled by The New York Times about the policies announced today by the Cost of Living Council and tentative, answers obtained from officials of the council and other sources:

title: DieHard Democrat on Shelter I. Squeaks Through a Loser Again
description: YAPHANK, L. I., Nov. 10Louis H. Price, the perennial Democratic candidate who frequently almost wins elections on Republicandominated Shelter Island, lost another today by his usual narrow margin.

title: DR. CHARLES VIRTUE, TAUGHT PHILOSOPHY
description: ORONO, Me., Nov. 10Dr. Charles Franklin Virtue, retired professor of philosophy at the University of Maine, died yesterday in the Eastern Maine General Hospital, Bangor. He was 70 years old.

title: ISRAEL OFFERING A NEW SUEZ PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10A new idea on how to break the deadlock in the American effort to negotiate an agreement between Israel and Egypt to reopen the Suez Canal is being quietly aired by Israeli representatives here: Reopen the clogged waterway without an agreement.

title: MANHATTAN COLLEGE TOEXPAND FACILITIES
description: Manhattan College has announced a $38million, 10year development program that includes the construction of a library and other facilities, the renovation of existing structures and increased endowments for academic purposes.

title: Fordham Asked to Disband Its Experimental College
description: Fordharn University's uptown Campus Council voted Tuesday evening to phase out Bensalem College the University's experimental school founded five years ago with an unstructured program.

title: Pacers Trounce Condors
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 10 (AP) The Indiana Pacers, led by Bob Netolicky's 30 points and George McGinnis's 27, routed the Pittsburgh Condors, 154125, in their American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Queens House Bought by Black Family Set on Fire
description: A house just purchased by a Negro family in an almost entirely white middleclass section of Queens was set on fire early yesterday morning while an elderly woman and two children were asleep there.

title: Chess:
description: The annual Soviet team championship tournament, held this year at RostovonDon, is of special interest to chess fans. The winner was a team of students, which triumphed on tie  breaking points over a team representing the Army. Actually, however, the categories by which the teams were designated were sufficiently vague so that all of the top players available took part one way or another, and nearly every team had a grandmaster on the first board.

title: 17 BUILDING UNIONS FAVORING PHASE 2
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 10The nation's building trade unions are taking a conciliatory approach toward the new Federal wage guidelines.

title: PRICES ON AMEX AND OTC TUMBLE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market registered sharp declines yesterday on moderate trading.

title: Bobbie E. Brown, Medal of Honor Winner, Is Dead
description: Bobbie E. Brown, who won the Medal of Honor in World War TI and held eight Purple Hearts and who was employed as a foreman in the custodial department at the United State Military Academy, died Monday at his Highland Falls, N. Y., home near West Point of a selfinflicted gunshot wound in the chest. He was 68 years old, and was said to have been in failing health.

title: Chinese Arrive in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 10 The main body of the new Chinese delegation to the United Nation arrived here today and !dipped into the city for a night's rest before proceeding to New York.

title: Stuttgart Export: Superior Playing From Piano Trio
description: No matter what you may read in your gazetteer, one of the chief exports of the German city of Stuttgart (pop. 628,000) is music. The latest evidence of the citizenry's production of that valuable commodity came to light Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, where the Stuttgart Piano Trio gave superior performances of works by Haydn, Ravel and Brahms.

title: Penguins Beat Canucks, 31
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 10 (UPI)  Bryan Hextall scored two goals, assisted on both times by Ken Schinkel, as the Pittsburg Penguins defeated the Vancouver Canucks, 31 tonight.

title: News of Dogs
description: American fanciers who like to combine a vacation with a chance to show their dogs, have been going to Puerto Rico and Bermuda in increasing numbers in recent years. A few have ventured farther to Trinidad. Now another Caribbean spot is wooing the exhibitor  the Dominican Republic. We have two allbreed shows a year, in February and October, said Dr. Mireya Scheker, veterinarian and president of the Asociacin Canina Dominicana, counterpart of the American Kennel Club. Dominican Republic. We have two allbreed shows a year, in February and October, said Dr. Mireya Scheker, veterinarian and president of the Asociacin Canina Dominicana, counterpart of the American Kennel Club.

title: Shop Talk
description: Not many New York stores have outoftown tryouts, but one that did and survived is The Pillowry, a kind of Near Eastern bazaar uponeflight at 929 Madison Avenue (between 73d and 74th Streets). Specializing in handloomed oriental rugs, pillows and a variety of accent pieces, The Pillowry made its debut Memorial Day weekend at Amagansett, L. I. Its success over the summer was sufficient to embolden Marge Lawrence and Valerie Justin, proprietors, to have a go at the big time. Currently the shop's collection includes rugs from Iran, the Caucasus and other Eastern Mediterranean cultures in traditional pileweaves and flatweave Nomadic Kelims.

title: Alioto Takes Stand in Civil Suit; Denies Impropriety in Split Fees
description: VANCOUVER, Wash., Nov. 10In a session marked by arm waving and story telling that had some jurors laughing loudly, Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco took the witness stand today and began to tell his side of the story.

title: Harris, Declaring I Am Broke, Withdraws From '72 Contention
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Senator Fred R. Harris of Oklahoma withdrew from the race for the Democratic nomination for President today, six weeks after he announced his candidacy.

title: Students Disrupt Inauguration Of the 17th President of Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 10Student demonstrators protesting a proposed state highway alignment today interrupted the inauguration of Dr. Edward J. Bloustein as the 17th president of Rutgers University.

title: Celtics Trounce Rockets
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Dave Cowens and John Havlicek scored all of their 57 points in the first three quarters tonight as the Boston Celtics built a 11474 lead and coasted to a 142103 victory over the Houston Rockets.

title: Conservationists' Attorney to Argue That Blue Ridge Power Plant Would Violate U.S. Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Edward Berlin, attorney for several conservation groups, said yesterday that he would oppose a license for the $350million Blue Ridge hydroelectric project on the ground that the Federal Power Commission had not met the requirements of the National Environmental Policy Act.

title: Bond Market Mixed
description: Interest rates skittered about yesterday, but mostly moved upward, as the various sectors of the credit market responded to their own conditions of supply and demand.

title: S.E.C. IS OPPOSED ON RESEARCH FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10A spokesman for small investors said today that both the New York Stock Exchange and the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission were using inconsistent arguments to defend the present system of paying for stock market research.

title: PAY BOARD WARNED BY PRINTERS' UNION
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Nov. 10The international Typographical Union has urged the five labor members of the Pay Board to resign if the board denies increases in wages and fringe benefits negotiated before and during the current wageprice freeze.

title: Bulls Top Bullets, 125106
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 10 (AP)Jerry Sloan got 22 points of his gamehigh 35 points in the first half tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 125106 victory over the Baltimore Bullets.

title: Retired Teachers Active
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon greeted some 400 members of the National Retired Teachers' Association at the White House today and said she had found one thing: None of them are really retired because they're all very active in their communities.

title: REACTIONS DIFFER TO NIXON'S POLICY
description: The Nixon Administration's New Economic Policy drew mixture of cheers and boos from three leading academic economists yesterday.

title: Colonels Rout Chaps, 11589
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 10 (AP)Using a balanced scoring attack, the Kentucky Colonels jumped ahead early and cruised to a 115.89 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals tonight.

title: Capacity Lag Seen for Paper Industry
description: The possibility of a growing squeeze between supply and demand in the paper industry over the next three years was indicated yesterday in a report that projected a substantial slowdown in the expansion of productive capacity in the industry.

title: Stabbing Perils Javelin Star's Olympic Dream
description: In pain each time he tried to talk, Bill Skinner sat in a Knoxville. Tenn., hospital bed yesterday and wondered what happened to The Great American Dream.

title: KENNETH R. WILLIAMS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 10  Kenneth Rhys Williams, founder and senior partner of Williams, Eisele & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, died Monday in Greenwich Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 182 Taconic Road.

title: Patrolman Is Indicted on Drug Charge
description: A patrolman who allegedly told his colleagues he would sell any cocaine they got and split the profits 5050, was indicted yesterday by a Manhattan grand jury on six counts, including bribery, criminal solicitation and possession of a dangerous drug.

title: Totalisator Company Sues For Share of OTB Handle
description: The American Totalisator Company, Inc., sued in State Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday to get its share of bets on races at Roosevelt and Yonkers Raceways whether placed at the tracks or through the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: F.T.C. Drafting Protection Against Franchiser Fraud
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The Federal Trade Commission moved today to protect prospective buyers of business franchises against fraud and misleading pieinthesky promises by franchisers. The commission published the draft of a regulation calling for the written disclosure of factual information to prospective buyers, itemized in a 27point list, about the franchiser and franchising operation.

title: Hardin Reported Likely To Quit Cabinet Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Clifford M. Hardin is expected to resign soon as Secretary of Agriculture.

title: The Theater:
description: The visiting German troupe, Szene '71, performed Franz Kafka's Der Prozess (The Trial) Tuesday night as the second and final show of its New York engagement at the Barbizon Plaza Theater.

title: SCRUTINY OF PROFITS BY U.S. HELD POSSIBLE
description: Profits as well as prices might be monitored by the Price Commission under Phase Two of the Administration's economic stabilization program, Clarence G. Adamy, president of the National Association of Food Chains, said here yesterday.

title: Ulster Women Tar 2 Girls for Dating British Soldiers
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 10  A 19yearold girl was tied to a lamppost and tarred and feathered in Londonderry last night while a group of 80 women shrieked: Soldier lover! Soldier lover!

title: In Bengali Guerrillas' Hamlet, Hope Is High, Arms Are Scarce
description: AT A GUERRILLA HAMLET, in East Pakistan, Nov. 6If you foreigners would send us the arms and ammunition we need, could throw out the Pakistan Army in seven days, the guerrilla officer said. As it is it will take a bit longer.

title: Jersey Police Chief Indicted On TicketFixing Charges
description: TRENTON, Nov. 10 (AP)The North Brunswick police chief, Carmine G. Canastra, was indicted by a state grand jury today on charges involving ticket fixing.

title: DAY CARE AID PLAN SET BY CONFEREES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Senate and House negotiators agreed tonight on a compromise plan of federally supported day care for the nation's children, ending a deadlock of almost a month.

title: 58,000 Phones Here Put Out of Service By a Short Circuit
description: Fiftyeight thousand telephones in midtown were put out of service for about nine hours yesterday by a fire at a New York Telephone Company building at 125 West 73d Street.

title: Hanoi Sets Limits for Holiday Parcels to P.O.W.'s
description: A committee on Vietnam prisoners announced yesterday that the North Vietnamese authorities had agreed to accept one 11pound package and one greetini, card for each American prisoner at Christmas.

title: Move Was Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The Federal Reserve Board, as widely expected, reduced its discount rate today from 5 to 4 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Wings Beat Stars, 21
