description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 13The streams of propaganda that are broadcast in both directions across the Taiwan Strait 24 hours a day have changed l'ttle in content since the United Nations General Assembly voted to transfer the China seat from Taipei to Peking.

title: Tass Is Critical
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13 (AP)The official press agency Tass said today that President Nixon's announcement that 45,000 more troops would be withdrawn from South Vietnam by Feb. 1 merely confirmed that the United States would continue its former course in Vietnam. The agency added that the speech of Nixon contained no suggestions on a political settlement of the Vietnam conflict.

title: Dartmouth Beats Cornell
description: Dartmouth defeated Cornell, 2414, yesterday to tie Cornell for the Ivy League lead. The Ivy season ends Saturday, with Dartmouth at Princeton and Cornell at Pennsylvania. Details in Section 5.

title: THE NIXONS OF THE O.P.A.
description: TO THE EDITOR: Milton Viorst's article, Nixon of the O.P.A. (Oct. 3), neglected to mention that Mrs. Nixon also worked at the O.P.A. while her husband was employed there. She was hired to replace me as Administrative Assistant to the Chief of the Service Trades Branch of the Retail Trade and Services Division of the Office of Price Administration.

title: Lyons Stars as L.S.U. Tops Mississippi State, 28 to 3
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 13 (AP)Paul Lyons, a quarterback slashed through the Mississippi State defense for two touchdowns tonight as he guided Louisiana State to a 283 victory in a Southeastern Conference game.

title: Course for Nov. 27 Rally Lauded By Seasoned and Novice Drivers
description: About Motor Sports

title: TRUE RISK CAPTURES SHOW HUNTER TITLE
description: READINGTON, N. J., Nov. 13 True Risk, a 5yearold bay mare, owned and ridden by Irene Johansen of Scotch Plains, N. J., captured the limitopen working hunter championship tonight at the Four Seasons Farm indoor horse show.

title: Fourie of So. Africa Beats Rouse of U.S. in 10Rounder
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 13, Reuters  Pierre Fourie, a former South African middleweight boxing champion making his first appearance as a light heavyweight, convinvincingly outpointed Roger Rouse of Anaconda, Mont., over 10 rounds tonight.

title: Tottenville Blanks Brandeis
description: Jim Campbell's running and Glenn Gelante's passing led Tottenville to a 210 P.S.A.L. Division 1 victory over Brandeis yesterday. Campbell scored a pair of touchdowns on short runs Gelante completed seven of 10 passes, one for a 13yard touchdown to Don Corsale. Tottenville finished 33 and Brandeis 24 in league play.

title: Penn State Soccer Victor
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Nov. 13Penn State, led by Rick Allen's two goals, scored a 51 soccer victory over Pittsburgh today and ended its season with a 72.1 wonlost tied record.

title: National Notes
description: Down on the Farm?

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Please let me know where to send my bucket of tears, shed after reading Large and Costly Coops Go Begging [Oct. 10]. PEARL GREENBERG

title: Preps
description: CONCORD, Mass., Nov. 13Tim McKenna starred for Middelsex today as he led a 2714 victory over St. George's in the 69th game between the schools McKenna rushed for three touchdowns and one conver sion.

title: Preps
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., Nov. 13 Deerfield routed Choate today, 210, in the 53d game between the schools. Choate leads the series, 2419, and there have been 10 ties, including the previous two renewals.

title: Photography
description: CAN contemporary art photography find success and happiness on Madison Avenue? In what must be described as a brave, bold move, New York's newest photography gallery, Light, raised this question when it opened last week at 1018 Madison Avenue, smack in the center of Manhattan's Saturday afternoon art trekking territory. The building at 1018 Madison is well known to Saturday trekkers, who take the elevator to the top floor and then work their way back down from gallery to gallery. Except for a bookstore on the second floor, the building is solid art from roof to sidewalk, and even the bookstore specializes in art. Now that photography has moved in, will art lovers look at it too?

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: The networks have Instituted a most annoying change this year, specifically with regard to movies. Not only do they run and rerun previews of the coming movies throughout the preceding week (even repeating the same preview twice during given show), but they go to the excruciating extreme of showing key scenes of the movie itself just prior to its actual showing. In a mystery or drama this completely ruins the suspense and gives away a good part of the plot.

title: World
description: BELFASTShortly before midnight last Tuesday, three masked women seized 19yearold Marta Doherty from her home in Londonderry's Roman Catholic quarter. They marched her to a small square beside the Bogside Inn pub and pushed her against a drain pipe.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MANILA, Nov 13, (Reuters) Robert S, McNamara, held more than three hours of informal talks today with President Marcos.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Rudolf Bing seems to evade the issue in discussing the Metropolitan Opera's repertoire under his leadership. Surely the point is not that so little modern opera has been given, but that so many interesting operas of the past have been ignored.

title: Job Export Charge Denied
description: Smarting from criticism primarily from organized labor  the nation's major foreign  trade organization sharply rejected last week assertions that foreign investments by United States companies hurt domestic production and crimped exports.

title: Preps
description: WILBRAHAM, Mass., Nov. 13 Steve Desmarais led WilbrahamMonson to a 3222 victory over Suffield today with his passing and running.

title: Miss Ann O'Donnell Married To Peter S. Prichard in Albany
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13Miss Ann Therese O'Donnell of New York and Peter S. Prichard of Westport, Conn., were married here this afternoon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James L. Lefebvre.

title: Even a Dog's Life Is No Cinch When Trying to Enter Military
description: Getting into military service is more difficult for dogs than for people. Slightly more than 60 per cent of all dogs offered for sale or donation to the miltary services are rejected, according to Maj. Roland C. Olson, who for three years was chief of veterinary services at the Military Working Dog Center at Lackland Air Force Base, near San Antonio. At the base, Olson was responsible for screening and examining more than 2,000 potential canine recruits a year.

title: Flanks Wins Key West Power Runby Minute Over Magoon
description: Roger Hanks of Midland, Tex., conquered rough seas and 14 other ocean speedboat drivers yesterday to capture the Hennessy Key West offshore race, the last one on the list of world championship events.

title: Vietnam Action Light
description: SAIGON, Nov. 13 (AP)Action remained at a low level in South Vietnam today with Saigon headquarters reporting 60 enemy soldiers killed in six small skirmishes across the country. Spokesmen said there were only light Government casualties in one of the engagements.

title: FLA. STATE BOWS TO GEORGIA TECH
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 13 (AP)Georgia Tech's pass defenders and blitzing linemen sttopped Florida State's passing quarterback, Gary Huff, today as the Yellow Jackets won their fourth straight game, 126.

title: WASHINGTON BOWS TO U.S.C. BY 1312
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 13 (UPI)Mike Rae kicked a 28yard field goal with 2 minutes 8 seconds left today to give Southern California a 1312 victory over Washington in a Pacific Eight game.

title: Nixon at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., NOV. 13 (UPI)  President Nixon spent a quiet day today at Camp David, working and relaxing. He and his wife and their daughter. Tricia, and soninlaw Edward Finch Cox came to the Maryland retreat last night.

title: V. P.
description: George Meths has a great opening for a political novel. The President stages a Red Alert, just so he can have a confidential chat with the Vice President in the executive bomb shelter! After this flamboyant beginning, it's back to reality and it's all downhill: riots, bombings, and the babel of bunco that have become a familiar part of our daily life.

title: Sargis Khoobiar to Wed Miss Ferretti
description: NUTLEY, N. J., Nov. 13Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Ferretti have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Andrea Vivian Ferretti, to Sargis Khoobiar of Clifton. He is a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Amijohn Khoobiar of Teheran, Iran. The wedding will take place next month.

title: COLORADO DRUBS OKLA. STATE, 406
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 13 (AP)Charlie Davis, a sophomore tailback, ran for 342 yards today to set a Big Eight singlegame rushing record and also became the top Colorado rusher for a season as the Buffaloes routed Oklahoma State, 406.

title: Elizabeth Slattery Is Married To Eric Alan Spahr, Reporter
description: The Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Elizabeth D. Slattery, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Louis R. Slattery of New York, to Eric Alan Spahr, son of Col. William J. Spahr, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Spahr of Alexandria, Va. The Rev. Dr. J. Burton Thomas, rector of the church, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Charles U. Quinn.

title: Et Al.
description: A timely study of Congress's and the President's decisionmaking powers in the area of foreign policy. Mr. Wilcox has worked for State and the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, sees postWorld War II trust between the two departments as having declined during the L.B.J. Administration. The cause was a crisis of confidence over the Dominican Republic intervention and, of course, because of doubts over Vietnam. He thinks there should be more consultation and interchange of information, but points out that situations differ: that in the Cubancrisis Congressional debate might have led to war, while in the Dominican intervention it might have led to a less precipitous policy. There is much good sense here, although the lack of historical perspective curtails the scope of the book.

title: New Montauk Route May Be Going Nowhere
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I. Ten years ago, there was just the Montauk Highway.

title: MARINER 9 PLACED IN ORBIT OF MARS
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 13An unmanned American spacecraft, the televisionequipped Mariner 9, rocketed tonight into an orbit of Mars.

title: Tennis in The Caribbean, Anyone?
description: GIVEN the degree to which tennis has whacked its way into the American consciousness in recent years (consider, for example, that today a woman professional has earned more than $100,000 a year in tournaments, and that indoor tennis emporiumssome so expensive it costs you about 30 cents a backhand to playare sprouting like wild mushrooms), it was only a matter of time before the game would start making its presence felt in the Caribbean. Until recently, the Caribbean had never been, on the whole, tennis player's paradise. I can remember a time, notes Fred Malina, owner of the Armonk Tennis Club in Westchester County and someone who has been combining travel and tennis for 20 years, when I'd check into a hotel in, say, Antigua, see an empty tennis court, but not for the life of me find another player. I used to spend more time looking for players I than did playing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WAKE FOREST TOPS DUKE ELEVEN, 237
description: WINSTONSALEM, N.C., Nov. 13 (AP)Ken Garrett scored on touchdown runs of 5 and 66 yards today as Wake Forest scored 23 points in the third quarter to defeat Duke, 237; in the Atlantic Coast Conference.

title: TOLEDO EXTENDS ITS STREAK TO 33
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 13 (AP)  Toledo rolled up a 430 victory over Marshall and extended its winning streak, the longest in the country, to 33 games today.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The White House says that the reason it had the F.B.I. investigate Daniel Schorr was not because it disliked the way he covered the Nixon Administration for C.B.S., but because it wanted to offer him a job.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 JAZZ GROUPS GIVE TOWN HALL CONCERT
description: Whether it was because of an audience that consisted of only a handful of people or an atrocious sound system that seemed to be imbedded with gravel, or the cold, bleak atmosphere of the hall, or a combination of the three, a jazz concert at Town Hall on Friday evening by two groups with excellent credentials turned out to be a distressingly somnolent affair.

title: preps
description: BELMONT, Mass., Nov. 13Chris Caldwell ran for four touchdowns today as Governor Dummer trounced Belmont Hill, 450. Governor Dummer completed its season with a 34 record. It was the seventh loss without victory for Belmont Hill.

title: PLANNING AHEAD
description: NO, I not going, Lisa said in her best terrible two playground voice. Her mother, Claudia, held a screaming, bleedingatthemouth Amy, who had just fallen taking one of her first steps.

title: Gardens
description: ATHOUGH the evanescent sakura or cherry blossom of spring is the national flower of Japan, the kiku or regal and endurable chrysanthemum of autumn has long symbolized Imperial Japan. The chrysanthemum, with 16ray flowers (or showy petals), is the Emperor's flower and has served as the crest of the Imperial Family for over a century. Actually, the identical chrysanthemum crest has existed as a familiar design in Japanese arts and crafts for over 800 years.

title: Pros Down Stars, 125116
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Utah, Nov. 13  The Memphis Pros, led by Charley Williams's 29 points and some key baskets by Gerald Govan and Wilbert Jones, defeated the Utah Stars, 125116, tonight.

title: Reader's Report
description: Nothing on the Arctic trawler Morning Rose is what it seems. The old tub has been chartered by Olympic Productions, a film company which presumably plans to make movie on a godforsaken island in the Barents Sea. Why then, does the company hair dresser die of poisoned horseradish on the voyage out? And how to explain a mortality rate as high as the St. Valentine's Day Massacre?

title: BARNARD PERFORMS HEART TRANSPLANT
description: CAPETOWN, Nov. 13 (UPI)Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard performed his eighth heart transplant operation today, inserting the heart of an unidentified dead person into a 62yearold man.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article on Staten Island development ('Housing Patterns on Staten Island Resist Change, Oct. 311 was interesting and accurate up to a point. The impression it gave, however, was that growth has been unbridled and that the island has taken on some of the unfortunate aspects of Queens and Brooklyn since the completion of the VerrazanoNarrows Bridge.

title: Letter to the Editor 15  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: When I read Richard Severn's article on the unpublished, unknown works of Cole Porter, my first thought was how pleased Mr. Porter would be if he could know of this interest. He would have been especially gratified that people in their 20's and 30's still find relevance in those wonderful lyrics.

title: Blues Beat Seals, 51
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 13 (AP)Gary Sabourin snapped a 12game scoring drought and Terry Crisp rifled home his fourth shorthand goal of the season in leading the St. Louis Blues to a 51 victory tonight over the California Seals.

title: Jersey Turnpike Foes Win Trial Date
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N.J., Nov. 13After nearly a year of protest meetings, petitions and doortodoor appeals for support, the residents of this Middlesex County communty who are opposed to the New Jersey Turnpike Authority's plan to widen the turnpike here have been assured of a day in court.Manor, are in the process of selling or moving their $35,000 to $60,000 homes to other sites.

title: C. M. White Will Marry Miss Melinda H. Saxton
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 13Dr. and Mrs. George A. Saxton Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Melinda Harley Saxton, to Christopher Minot White, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold T. White Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., and West Falmouth.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: Until I read John Canaday's article, I did not know who or what was responsible for the very pleasant outcroppings that has appeared on the sides of three blank building walls in our neighborhood, areas that would be dismal without them.

title: HATFIELD TRAILING IN POLL IN OREGON
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 13A poll being circulated privately here has raised serious political questions among potential candidates from both major parties for the United States Senate seat now held by Mark O. Hatfield, a Republican.

title: Dayton's Schools to Reopen as a New Tax Is Voted
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 13James McGee, Dayton's black Mayor, had declared last Thursday School Destiny Day and as the hands on the clock atop the Gem City Savings Building in downtown Dayton turned to noon, an elementary school pupil at a rally paraded past Gov. John J. Gilligan, a Democrat, and Representative Charles W. Whalen Jr., a Republican, and other dignitaries with a placard inscribed: I ain't learning much out of skool.

title: Maryellen Davis to Wed
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Nov. 13 Mr. and Mrs. Joseph E. Davis of Freeport have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Maryellen Davis, to Christopher Bent Lippincott, son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Reeves Lippincott of Woodstown, N. J. The wedding is planned for Dec. 26 in Queen of the Most Holy Rosary Roman Catholic Church in Roosevelt.

title: By Reuter
description: TORQUAY, England, Nov. 13 Bob Hewitt of South Africa and Evonne Goolagong of Australia won the singles finals today in the fourth Dewar Cup indoor tennis tournament.

title: Stamps
description: NEXT Friday morning the 23rd National Postage Stamp Show will unveil its wares in the Exposition Rotunda of Madison Square Garden Center. The showa 400frame exhibition by stamp collectorsincludes a bourse of more than 120 American, Canadian and European stamp dealers.

title: Cartoonist Depicts Underachievers of Society in His 10th Book
description: TENAFLY, N. J.I hope I live to make it an even dozen, said 70yearold George Price as he reviewed the proofs of his 10th collection of cartoons, The People Zoo (Windmill Books).Mainly Irish, some German.

title: Will Agnew Dump Himself?
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Demirel Investigation Voted
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 13 (AP)A joint session of the Turkish Parliament voted today to open an investigation into charges of graft and nepotism against former Premier Suleyman Demirel. Mr. Demirel told the Parliament Friday that he was prepared to face an investigation Friday that he was prepared to face an investigation to clear his name. The vote was 366105 in favor of an investigation.

title: China in the U.N.
description: Speculation about the effect of Peking's entry on the United Nations is of interest, but far more important to watch as the Chinese representatives take up their posts is the effect of U.N. membership on China.

title: Recordings
description: NO one who knows the four previously published and recorded violin concertos of Paganini would expect a newly unearthed one to challenge Beethoven, or even Mendelssohn. And the Violin Concerto No. 3 in E Major does not upset any expectations. Recently drawn out of hiding in Italy, where it was in the possession of Paganini descendants, No. 3 was given its modernrevival premiere last month in London by Henryk Szeryng. Now the first recording is at hand, on Philips (6500175). Though members of the Paganini family are known to have played separate movements from the E Major concerto at concerts in the Twenties, until now there seems to have been no complete performance since Paganini himself gave one in London, probably for the last times in 1883.

title: Miss Eichinger Engaged
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., Nov. 13Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Mathias Eichinger of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Eichinger, to Terry L. Haynes, son of Mrs. Kathleen Thayer of Harwich, Mass., and Richard Haynes of Warren, Ohio. The prospective bride and her fianc are graduates of Kent State University. A Dec. 4 wedding is planned.

title: LETTERS
description: ...I am just an ordinary small investor who uses his own judgement regarding the market and follow my own inclinations. I don't need Janeway to advise me nor am I interested in his opinions. The trouble with the market these days is that there are too many so called analysts and advisers who hurt the investor, rather than help him.

title: Red Wings, With Three Goals in Third Period, Triumph Over Flyers, 6 to 3
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 13 (AP) Three goals in the final period carried the Detroit Red Wings to a 63 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers in the National Hockey League today.

title: Willie Masters' Lonesome Wife
description: Reviewing a novella of so few pages affords the luxury (note the undertone, please) of reread as well as readthat reread without which, as Roland Barthes points out, no critical act is ever possible. But Barthes discusses narrative, and just what does this book narrate?

title: Student Editor Appeals Magazine Impounding
description: A 17yearold senior at John Dewey High School, whose short story for the literary magazine he coedits led the principal to impound the publication as obscene, is appealing the decision under the Board of Education's student bill of rights.

title: State Revises Diploma Form
description: New York State is discontinuing a label of Spanish language division on diplomas for persons passing a high schoolequivalency test in Spanish, and will issue a singletype diploma for all persons qualifying. The city had protested that the label could have an unfortunate prejudicial effect, especially in jobseeking.

title: Local
description: Mark Vodofsky, the Tilden quarterback, scored on a 1yard run with two minutes remaining to give Tilden a 1916 victory over Erasmus yesterday in a P.S.A.L. Brooklyn division game at Tilden.

title: Price Panel Bids Council Rescind Auto Exemption
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 The Price Commission demanded tonight that the Cost of Living Council rescind its decision exempting the auto industry from clearing price increases with the Government before they go into effect.

title: Preps
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Nov. 13 Taft School won its second game in seven today by defeating Hotchkiss, 286.

title: In San Basilio, the dead hand of the past
description: It begins gracefully: Occasionally in Italy, and always when it seems least likely, a foreigner is allowed beyond the portcullis of exquisite courtesy that protects the patrician family from intrusion. You cannot woo them. You either are or are not simpatica, an elusive quality, everything and nothing. I no longer try to explain my good fortune.... The promise of a fictional adventure is here and told elegantly: that medieval portcullis. With this word, the reader is almost halfway home in this carefully but inaccurately labeled novel about certain events in one of those selfcontained hill towns on the Italian horizon.

title: WALLACE TO OPEN SPECIAL SESSION
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 13Gov. George C. Wallace and the Alabama state Legislature will continue their war of nerves when Mr. Wallace addresses the opening of a special legislative session Monday night to meet the most serious financial crisis in the state's history.

title: Preps
description: MERIDAN, N. H., Nov. 13John Flynn and Bob Watts led a devastating running attack today that powered Vermont Academy to a 4118 victory over Kimball Union. Flynn led the attack for Vermont (52) with 240 yards rushing, including four long touchdown runs. Watts, a halfback from the Bronx, was almost as effective with 184 yards and two long scoring gallops.

title: Miss Young Wins at Inzell
description: INZELL, Germany, Nov. 13 (AP)Nineteenyearold Sheila Young of Detroit, won a 500meter women's sprint skating race today in 44.3 seconds on Inzell's fast artificial track. Arja Kantola of Finland was runnerup in 45 seconds.

title: Judo Competition Today
description: Judo competitors, ranging in age from 6 to 16, will compete in the junior rank Eastern judo championship tournament at the McBurney Y.M.C.A., 215 West 23d Street, today, starting at noon. The program is, open to the public.

title: In Queens, It's Usually 12 Eager Men
description: When William H. Mays, senior clerk in charge of jurors in Queens, was sorting through jury notices the other day, he found a handwritten note attached to a returned notice. It said:

title: Brother of Liberia's President Develops an Industrial Empire
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  Black Africa is full of spellbinding politicians, but it has relatively few big businessmen and even fewer entrepreneurs who have created new industriesand new wealth.

title: Navy Connects on Its Passes To Turn Back Syracuse, 1714
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 13 (AP)Bert Calland fell into the end zone with a 10yard pass fro Fred Stuvek in the fourth quarter to give Navy a 1714 victory over Syracuse today.

title: Central Conn. Triumphs
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 13 (AP)Ed Yizierski's 14yard scoring dash with six minutes remaining gave Central Connecticut a 1714 victory over Cortland State today.

title: Yeasty Spectagala Raises The Green
description: For three summers the highlight of the Point Lookout social season has been the Spectagala. The name the creation of a vacationing public relations mandoesn't mean anything, but the party itself has been a superdooper smash every year.

title: 501 SHOT SECOND
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 13In the equine equivalent of a palace power struggle, Riva Ridge secured his position as absolute monarch of racing's 2yearolds today by winning the $293,890 Garden State Stakes.

title: Art
description: YOU think you have problems? Think of the Metropolitan Museum. There it sits atop an accumulation of objects to an estimated number of 40u,000 to 500,000, obliged to serve the public by choosing the right ones for exhibition and arranging them to make sense. This must be done in a warren of galleries that has grown over the years in a plan that looks reasonable enoughit is all right anglesbut could not have been much better designed to frustrate any curator rash enough to commit himself to a logical installation.

title: Stillman and Newark
description: NEWARKThere is an uneasy alliance for progress in the nation's cities these days between the business establishment and the increasingly militant leadership in the black ghettos.

title: Canarsie 16, John Jay 0
description: Danny Morongiello threw his seventh touchdown pass of the season yesterday as Canarsie beat John Jay, 160, in a P.S.A.L. game at South Shore Field. It was the fifth victory for Canarsie, which has lose twice and tied once.

title: Manhattan to Lose Seats While Suffolk Gains in Redistricting of the Legislature
description: Manhattan will lose the most seats in the State Legislature and Suffolk County will gain the most under a new reapportionment plan Involving a major reshuffling of district lines.

title: Preps
description: EXETER, N. H., Nov. 13In one of the wildest games in the 93yearold history of America's oldest schoolboy football rivalry, Exeter overcame a 17point secondperiod deficit today to defeat Andover, 3020.

title: The Nation
description: In a rare burst of unanimity, the Senate last week passed, 80 to 0, a bill sponsored by Edmund S. Muskie of Maine that would set 1985 as the deadline for cleansing all the nation's navigable waterways.

title: Television
description: ASSORTED outtakes: Tonight at 9, public television's schedule of British Broadcasting Corporation drama switches from Thomas Hardy's Jude the Obscure to Dostoevsky's The Gambler. The prestigious Masterpiece Theater series is not, as you may have gathered, a barrel of laughs.

title: Sybil Connolly in Town on Her Fashion Pilgrimage
description: The Carrickmacross lace dresses were duly admired and so were the Irish tweeds, of course. But the women who were invited by Sybil Connolly, the Dublin designer, for tea and fashions the other afternoon were most ecstatic about her crushed and pleated evening dresses.

title: Richard M. Daley to Wed Miss Corbett
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 13Miss Margaret Ann Corbett, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick L. Corbett of Mount Lebanon, and Richard M. Daley, son of Mayor and Mrs. Richard J. Daley of Chi cago, are engaged to be married.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Et Al.
description: Mr. Ogburn, naturalistauthor, set out in a camperbus, on a 22day, 9,600mile tour across America. The purpose was a firsthand assessment of the land and what we are doing to it. Alternating ruminations, philosophizings, geological observations, descriptions of flora and fauna and details of the traveler's life, he has written quite a beautiful, flowing book. One might call him a Thoreau of the road, for his gaze is inward and on nature in a way that makes civilization almost alien.

title: Cambodians Abandon Rumlong
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 13 (AP)Cambodian soldiers abandoned Rumlong today after a 19day enemy siege, leaving behind more than 40 wounded, the high command announced.

title: The spark that ignited the holocaust
description: In The Prisoners of Quai Dong, Victor Kolpacoff's fine first novel, the action was confined to an American prison compound where a Vietcong captive is under interrogation. That was all: the airless room, the unbearable heat, the flayed prisoner, his captors. A few of the Americans suffered qualms, but this was no place for qualms; the prisoner, of course, was terminated with extreme prejudice. Yet his death was almost beside the point. One knew from its poisonous air that no one would leave that room morally alive. Kolpacoff's achievement lay in holding the action to circular interrogation while increasing the pressure one hairline at a time until the pressure exploded.

title: ALABAMA WINS FROM MIAMI, 313
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Nov. 13 (AP)Wilbur Jackson, subbing for the injured star, Johnny Musso, ran 67 yards for a touchdown today as Alabama walloped Miami, 313, to set the stage for the biggest Southeastern Conference game of the year in two weeks.

title: PAKISTANI MEETS PEKING DELEGATES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13Peking's chief delegate to the United Nations, Chiao Kuanhua, and his deputy, Huang Hua, today discussed the IndianPakistani dispute and United Nations matters for an hour and 30 minutes with Agha Shahi, the delegate of Pakistan.

title: Before You Buy, Test Drive The 1972 Timmerman
description: RED RUN, Pa.Here, in a Mennonite farm country barn, the site of the Caleb S. Zimmerman Carriage Works, you find yourself a fourhour drive from New York City and 75 years away. A coach works? In 1971? Must be run by some stooped, bearded oldster, too stubborn to bow to progress and retire to his front porch rocker.

title: Gov. Sargent Signs a Bill Easing Narcotics Laws That Pleases All Factions
description: BOSTON, Nov. 13Under a major recodification of Massachusetts drug laws, signed this week by Gov. Francis W. Sargent, it is no longer a crime to be present where marijuana is found. The legislation also reduces penalties for drug possession and allows the police to detain juveniles found in the presence of narcotics.

title: Television
description: AT a taping of his show not long ago, television's numberone variety hour comedy star was waiting to be discovered by the camera. A Godlike voice from the control room urged silence. A floor manager stood on the steps to the stage, ready to click his striped takeboard. But just then a stagehand rushed out to uncoil a tangled cable in front of Clerow (Flip) Wilson. Flip broke his pose and went to help him. That, he announced as he returned to his camera position, is what they really pay me for.

title: GETTYSBURG WINS FROM WAGNER, 2116
description: Lee Hayslip set up two touchdowns and scored another as Gettysburg College snapped Wagner College's fivegame winning streak, 2116, yesterday at Fischer Memorial Field.

title: An Heir to Be Given To Smokey the Bear
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)After nine years of waiting in vain for Smokey the sear to produce an heir, the Forest Service is about to give him one.

title: The World
description: MOSCOWStriding along the treelined streets of the Moldavian capital of Kishinev a few days ago, a Jewish chemist quietly described how his fervent desire to emigrate to Israel was frustrated by fear. If he applied for an exit visa, he said, he night lose his job, and there would be trouble for his wife and two small daughters.

title: The Underground Crash Pad Directory
description: WHEN I was in need of overnight lodgings on my way to the Adirondacks a few weeks ago, I took out my copy of the Travelers' Directory (What's that? Don't worry, you'll learn) and called Larrya total strangerat his health food store in a college town in upstate New York. He said, Come on over, and when I arrived he and his wife, Ronnie, greeted me with a tall glass of guava juice. We spent the afternoon and evening discussing everything from Buddhist chants to the quick buck while their 4monthold daughter gurgled in her crib. When night fell, they dragged a mattress into the store, locked the street door, pulled the curtain and bade me good night in a room full of organic delights. I slept between the papaya jelly and buckwheat groats for free.

title: U.S. Packing a Trunk, With Elephant Attached
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 13 (AP)Cincpachyderm will soon be on his way to a home in Los Angeles after two months of headaches for CINCPAC.

title: LETTERS
description: ... Mr. Janeway is a chronic bear, often not right, and also often takes credit where credit is not due. During the previous bear market when the D.J. reached 650, he predicted it would go to 500, whereas in fact it turned and rose to about 950....

title: PHONE COMPANY SUED IN HARTFORD
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 13 (UPI)A Hartford banker and his wife are suing the Southern New England Telephone Company for allegedly giving their unlisted phone number and address to a wouldbe robber who held them hostage in their home.

title: Mother Geese
description: Mother Goose does not come into our lives when we are young children just having learned to speak. She is there before, before language. We come to language through her, and to mystery and laughter and action. To poetry. She is only one of many ways, of course, and she has her equivalent in all cultures. But in the culture that comes through English, she is Mother Goose. Collingwood points out, in Principles of Art, that it would be different if our mother (or our grownup) pointed at our toe and said Toe!; but that's not how it is done; our toe is pointed at and somebody says, This little piggy went to market.

title: Beyond Okinawa
description: There is irony in the Senate's vote last week ratifying the treaty restoring Japanese sovereignty to Okinawa after 25 years of American rule. For while the United States thus moved to wipe away the last major irritating vestige of the JapaneseAmerican military conflict during World War II, the large majority in favor of ratification was due in part to Administration measures that are exacerbating a growing new rivalry between the two nations in the economic sphere.

title: Coast Trial Is Ordered
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13 (AP) A judge has ordered Mary Brunner, 27 years old, a Charles Manson clan member, to stand trial Dec. 13 for the 1969 slaying of Gary Hinman, a musician. Miss Brunner refused to enter a plea yesterday so Superior Court Judge Paul E. G. Breckenridge Jr. entered one of not guilty for her.

title: Colorado State Wins
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Nov. 13 (UPI)A 157yard running performance by Lawrence McCutcheon sparked Colorado State to a 3614 triumph over West Texas State today.

title: O.T.B. ACCUSES CORE IN AMMONIA INCIDENT
description: An OffTrack Betting Corporation official accused supporters of the Congress of Racial Equality yesterday of dumping bread soaked with ammonia into an O.T.B. neighborhood office in Harlem.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:William V. Shannon has written provocative article, A Question or Three for Nominee Rehnquist, in The Week in Review (Nov. 7). But the Achilles heel in nominee. Rehnquist's armor has somehow eluded the press as well as members of the Senate Judiciary Committeehis position on Presidential warmaking power.

title: F.D.A. Recalls Corn Meal It Believes Contaminated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration has announced the recall of 87 tons of corn meal mix allegedly containing aflatoxin, a cancercausing substance produced by mold.

title: Fort Hays Ties for First
description: EMPORIA, Han., Nov. 13 (AP)Teams from Fort Hays State and Emporia State tied for first place with 29 points each in a Missouri Valley Amateur Athletic Union crosscountry meet today. Dennis Nee of Emporia State, undefeated this season, was the individual winner in 25:31.8 over a fourmile course.

title: Foreign Notes
description: It was the week the Communist Chinese came to New York and the United Nations. And, for the time being at least, they presented a low profile.

title: St. John's Eleven Routs Cheyney State for 7th in Row
description: CHEYNEY, Pa., Nov. 13 St. John's rugged pass defense intercepted three times in the third quarter today to set up touchdowns and give the Redmen, the nation's No. 1 club football team, a 300 victory over Cheyney State's varsity.

title: About Pro Football
description: Monday night pro football set Its own television audience record when the Colts played the Vikings on Oct. 25. The ratings Indicated that the game was seen in 15,150,000 homes that night, which is the largest audience the National Football League has ever had for a regularThe last Super Bowl was seen in 23.9 million homes. season game. The only games with higher ratings have been championship and Super Bowl affairs. The last Super Bowl was seen in 23.9 million homes.

title: House Study Is Critical of U.S. Ambassador in Athens
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  A report prepared for a House Foreign Affairs subcommittee states that morale at the United States Embassy in Athens is very low and that the staff is distressed at the steady development of the military government.

title: Accord in Gary, Ind.
description: GARY, Ind., Nov. 13 (AP)Maintenance, custodial and food service workers agreed today to follow the lead of union teach ers and report to work Monday, although the school system is unable to meet a $1.6million twoweek payroll for its 3,647 employees.

title: Brown Rallies Irish in 2d Half To Top Stubborn Tulane, 217
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Nov. 13 (UPI)Clifford Brown, the sophomore quarterback, scored two touchdowns and passed for another in a secondhalf surge, today to rally Notre Dame to a 217 triumph over underdog Tulane.

title: Bonn's Negotiator Hopeful Of Berlin Accord in Weeks
description: BERLIN, Nov. 13Negotiators for East Germany and West Germany ended a marathon round of meetings on Berlin today with prospects for a settlement in the next few weeks.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 13The Israeli Foreign Ministry confirmed today that talks had begun in Paris with the French Government on the Mirage warplanes. A spokesman said that the talks were in initial stages, with no conclusions yet reached.

title: Tennis is nature spelled backwards
description: Imagine a baseball diamond on a perfect summer day. A cloudless blue sky arches over the even green spread of AstroTurf. An AllStar game is in progress; a fantastic, scoreless contest. Surprisingly, for such an extraordinary game, only two fans sit in the bleachers.

title: NETS WINI117113; BARRY MORES 40
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 13 (AP) Rick Barry poured in 40 points and the New York Nats snapped a fourgame losing streak tonight by holding off the Floridians, 117113, in an American Basketball Association contest.

title: GEORGIA SUBDUED
description: ATHENS, Ga., Nov. 13Au. burn won the confrontation of the unbeaten today, defeating Georgia, 3520, as Pat Sullivan threw four touchdown passes and was clearly the difference between the teams.

title: Henry Bregstein to Wed Miss Harrison
description: WOODMDRE, L. I. Nov. 13 Dr. and Mrs. Maxwell Harrison have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Holly Beth Harrison, to Henry Bregstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard B. Bregstein. The wedding Is planned for February.

title: 3d Market Dealers Cry Foul
description: Although most of Wall Street is trying to ignore it, an experiment of potentially great significance is being conducted these days in the overthecounter market.

title: LATINS AT U.N. ASK AN ECONOMIC PLAN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13A group of 21 LatinAmerican countries, led by Brazil, has proposed in the General Assembly that the industrialized countries accept the concept that political security cannot be achieved without economic stability.

title: BALTIMORE CLUB TOPS ON DEFENSE
description: When the American Conference's weakest offense collides with its strongest defense, the result should be obviously predictable. Not so, say the Jets, who meet the Baltimore Colts at Shea Stadium today.

title: Art
description: ALLAN D'ARCANGELO'S bestknown works  schematized depictions of roadsigns and highways were subtly atypical of their style and moment, Pop Art in the early sixties. And the reason for this seems, in retrospect, a key to both their strength and their weakness. As opposed to most other familiar Pop paintings, they carry, in their presentation of images, a kind of direct, almost ingenuous emotional conviction. To put it simply, D'Arcangelo gave the impression of really feeling for roadsigns and highways. The experience of his pictures, however highly stylized they became, referred to an experience of the real thing.

title: MINORU NOJIMA PERFORMS LISZT
description: Since this reviewer used up a lot of superlatives to describe Minoru Nojima's New York debut at Carnegie Hall 13 months ago, it Is difficult to find others to do justice to his recital at Hunter College Assembly Hall on Friday night. He appeared as the first performer in the new Piano Competition Laureate Series there. He qualified for the series as winner of the second prize the 1969 Van Cliburn International Piano Competion.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDTIOR:Truth is beauty, a line from an ode by John Keats's namesake, might be appropriate for him to keep in mind. A journalist has a responsibility to the public to report impartially the facts of both sides of a controversy. Having done this, he may draw his own conclusions. Mr. Keats has sadly forgotten to do this in his article on the British Museum (Travel section, Oct. 3) in which he refers to my discovery of what I believe to be a fragment of the Aphrodite of Knidos carved by Praxiteles in about 350 B.C. He did not bother to interview me or the reporter he mentions (who is, in fact, a member of the staff of The New York Times).

title: Stamp for Fermi Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)Two New York meinhers of the House of Representatives have introduced legislation calling for a commemorative stamp honoring Enrico Fermi, the nuclear physicist. Representatives Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, and Peter A. Peyser, Republican of Westchester, said Wednesday that the only other ItalianAmerican to be honored by a commemorative stamp was Christopher Columbus.

title: Art: Hofstra Rights a Historic Wrong
description: This is the art season of the American Indian. In Manhattan this week the Whitney Museum is opening vast exhibition of American Indian art and other exhibitions will be installed in New York galleries. There will be auction sales and symposia concerning Indian art.

title: Judo Competition Today
description: Judo competitors, ranging in age from 6 to 16, will compete in the junior rank Eastern judo championship tournament at the McBurney Y.M.C.A., 215 West 23d Street, today, starting at noon. The program is, open to the public.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The seeming contradiction in Israel's recent vote in the United Nations in favor of Peking and against Taiwan is illusory, as Israel's ultimate security is not endangered and her best interests have been served.

title: Trinity Posts 210 Victory Over Wesleyan in Finale
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 13Trinity College posted its first shutout victory since 1964 today with a 210 victory over Wesleyan.

title: 11 Area Locations Book AliMathis Television
description: The Muhammad AliBuster Mathis heavyweight bout in Houston will be shown on closed circuit television Wednesday at 11 locations in the New York area. The George Chuvalo  Cleveland Williams bout also will be screened.

title: WILLIAMS WINS, 3114, FOR LITTLE 3 CROWN
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Nov. 13Williams defeated Amherst, 3114, today to win the Little Three football title. The winners scored two touchdowns and a field goal in the second half to break a 1414 halftime tie.

title: Miss McInerney to Wed
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Nov. 13Mr. and Mrs. Timothy J. McInerney have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lauren Ann McInerney, to Michael J. Marsicano, a Nassau County policeman. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Dominick Marsicano, also of New Hyde Park. The future bride's father is executive vice president of the Long Island Builders Institute.

title: Chess
description: IN a way, it is much easier to write retrospectively of Bobby Fischer's 52 triumph over former world champion Tigran Petrosian than it was to write of his consecutive 60 victories against Soviet grandmaster Mark Taimanov, or his Danish semifinal opponent Bent Larsen. After the Taimanov match, everybody was simply astounded that one of the candidates to challenge the world champion could beat another so decisively. After he did the same to Larsen, however, it began to appear as if Fischer's opponents were like the poor knights in some fairytale who, arriving sometime before the hero, ride out to slay the dragon and are devoured instead.

title: Movies
description: IN TAKING OFF, Czech director Milos Forman took a seriocomic look at the misery of an American suburban couple whose teenage daughter has made a hasty exit to the East Village. Now Forman is set to make his second American movie and, once again, he will be zeroing in on a depressing domestic scene, though his point of view will, as usual, be on the satirical side.

title: Castro Sees Chilean Miners
description: ANTOFAGASTA, Chile (UPI) Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba visited bachelor workers' camps around the nitrate mines of Northern Chile's Atacama Desert today.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: DUHON, EVANS SET FOR STARTING JOGS
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 13  The New York Giants will try it again without Ron Johnson tomorrow in an assignment that would be tough enough with him, taking on the Atlanta Falcons in a National Football League game to be televised to New York by Channel 2 at 1 P.M.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Price Waterhouse & Co. should be the impossible dream of every advertising agency executive.

title: FORDHAM BEATS MANHATTAN, 287
description: Fordham University won the annual battle of the Bronx yesterday with a 287 victory over Manhattan College before a crowd of 10,437 at the Rose Hill campus.

title: 5 Lawmakers to Oppose Plans To Build in Tudor City Parks
description: Five East Side lawmakers said yesterday that they would fight to prevent the construction of highrise buildings on the two small parks in Tudor City, a private apartment complex.

title: Those Apprentice Kings and Queens Who MayOne DayAscend a Throne
description: In a few years, the late King Farouk of Egypt once mused, only five kings will be left in the worldthe King of England and the four in every deck of playing cards.

title: Penn's Soccer Team Routs Columbia, 70, for Title Tie
description: Penn's soccer team clinched a tie for the Ivy League title yesterday with a 70 victory over Columbia.

title: BIRTHRATE DROP WORRIES POLAND
description: WARSAW, Nov. 13Polish officials have begun an extensive press campaign to reverse a rapid decline in the nation's birth rate. They are calling for a change in familysubsidy programs and in birthcontrol practices, presumably including abortion regulations.

title: Willamette University Gets $1Million for Graduate Unit
description: SALEM, Ore., Nov. 13Willamette University, announced this week that it had received a $1million building grant from the Seeley G. Mudd Fund for the first graduate school combining business and public administration in the Pacific Northwest.

title: ELDERLY NEGROES PRESENT DEMANDS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13A group of 700 elderly Negroes gathered here this week in an effort to focus national attention on their problems.

title: INDIANA TRIUMPHS OVER IOWA, 14 TO 7
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Nov. 13 (UPI)Indiana scored two touchdowns in the second half one on an 80yard pass play, Ted McNulty to Alan Dickto down Iowa, 147, today and shove the Hawkeyes into the Big Ten cellar.

title: YOUNG AMERICANS END SOVIET VISIT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13A group of young American political leaders reviewed their impressions of a 13clay tour of the Soviet Union today.

title: Englewood Couple Injured As Cab Mounts Sidewalk
description: Two pedestrians were thrown through a plate glass window of an empty store on Madison Avenue yesterday afternoon after they were hit by a taxicab that had just collided with another cab and lurched onto the sidewalk out of control.

title: Lawrence Kumins Weds Helen J. Buhr
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 13 Miss Helen Janet Buhr and Lawrence Kumins were married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church bY the Rev. Bradford Hastings. A reception was given at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Carl Buhr of Putnam Hill.

title: Sports of The Times
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 13On the radio, the voice follows a CocaCola commercial.

title: Phase Two: Plotting Strategies
description: John W. Hanley, executive vice president of the Procter & Gamble Company in Cincinnati, paused for a moment as he dictated a memo to the company's managers explaining the approach that was being taken to the Government's newly announced pay and price guidelines.

title: That Terrible Twelve?
description: BEING a film critic, especially a daily film critic is like playing tennis with a dozen people on the other side of the net: you can hardly keep track of all the serves, much less return even two or three of them with any grace. You become so involved with the panic, the terror, the joy and the sheer physical effort of the moment that you tend to forget what the game is all about. Which is why nonfilmoriented criticismthat is, criticism written by critics sitting in the bleachers  can occasionally be so insightful. I think especially of work by people like Susan Sontag and the late Robert Warshow, who were fascinated by films, but who were not so committed to them that most of their livessocial as well as dreambecame extensions of their professional activities.

title: BigScale Agriculture
description: FRANKFORT, Ill.Our policy has been to say yes to everything, declares Wayne Heberer, who farms 1,800 acres near Belleville, Ill. That means taking on expansion by buying or leasing farms as soon as they become available. Starting with 183 acres just 10 years ago, he is typical of the captains of a new bigscale agriculture.

title: RUTGERS DEFEATS HOLY CROSS, 1413
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 13Rutgers intercepted five Holy Cross passes and knocked down a 2point conversion attempt today to defeat Holy Cross, 1413, and break sixgame losing streak.

title: Mississippi Victor, 4910, On 601Yard Ground Game
description: OXFORD, Miss., Nov. 13 (AP)  Mississippi shreaded Chattanooga's defense for 601 yards today and recorded a 4910 victory.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONThe withdrawal of Fred Harris from the Democratic Presidential competition further clears the field for the coming primaries. More importantly, since it is still a littered field, Mr. Harris' withdrawal suggests something about the sad state of American campaign finance, and the problem of a candidate who moves beyond the traditional range of issues and solutions.

title: Letter to the Editor 14  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: The article about Dr. Thomas Szasz and his ideas is an ideal illustration of what occurs when halftruths become dogmas and coincide with economic, other psychosocial vested interests and politically ripening, sometimes overripe, movements. When these interrelate and spiral, we frequently are overcome by doctrines which have many old and parted truths but also some potentially dangerous concomitants and no polemics can convince those economically and emotionally conditioned.

title: The Nation
description: The Big Sleep is over. After 90 days of frozen wages, prices and rents, Americans move this morning into Phase Two of President Nixon's attempt to stop the inflationary spiral a phase in which they will have to learn to live with governmental controls over pay checks, profit margins and most other aspects of economic activity.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: As a former college athlete, I read Jack Scott's article on drug usage among athletes with great sadness (It's Not How You Play the Game, But What Pill You Take, Oct. 17). I was saddened and angered for I know the factual basis of Mr. Scott's charges, and I cannot help but wonder what our society has done to such a potentially beautiful and fulfilling human activity as sport is and ought to be. Perhaps little can be done to alter the situation in professional athletics, but it's time educators took a stand on what is happening under our very own noses on highschool and college campuses throughout the country.

title: G. Lewis Jones Jr. Dies at 64; First U.S. Ambassador to Tunis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 13G. Lewis Jones Jr., a Foreign Service officer for 40 years, who was the first United States Ambassador to Tunisia, died today of cancer in Doctors Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived here and in Yarmouth Port, Mass.

title: CANADIAN JUMPER WINS AT TORONTO
description: TORONTO, Nov. 13 (Canadian Press)  Moffat Dunlop, riding Grand Nouvel triumphed in the Scurry Stakes and put Canada ahead in the team competition at the Royal Winter Fair horse show. Dunlap, a 30yearold rider from Newmarket, Ontario, leads in the individual competition with 23 points.

title: Sally Aldrich Sargeant Fiancee Of Comdr. George L. Michael 3d
description: WICKFORD, R. L, Nov. 13 Mrs. Joseph F. Sargeant of Wickforcl has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Sally Aldrich Sargeant, to Lieut. Comdr. George Lewis Michael 3d, Judge Advocate General's Corps., U.S.N.

title: Skating Champions Mark Anniversary In Garden Benefit
description: The United States Figure Skating Association and Madison Square Garden Productions will present Champions On Ice, celebrating the U. S. F. S. A.'s 50th anniversary, on Monday, Nov. 29, at 730 P.M., in Madison Square Garden. The association's proceeds will go to the U.S.F.S.A. memorial fund for development purposes.

title: 3 Americans Beaten
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 13 (Reuters)  Clark Graebner, Cliff Richey and Tom Gorman of the United States were defeated today in the $40,000 Clows 10man, roundrobin tennis tournament.

title: Preps
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 13 Three touchdowns by Paul Anastasi and 6 points from the kicking of Jose Violante enabled Worcester Academy to defeat Mount Hermon, 249, today and increase its season record to 43.

title: POVERTY GROWING FASTER IN SUBURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 Contrary to their popular image of picturewindow affluence, suburbs accounted for more than half of last year's increase in the poverty population, according to new Census Bureau data.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Hunt stories, when they are well written, are great fun. One man against nature: Can he survive by his wits, his reflexes, his conditioning, his sixth sense? In LOADED GUN by the French author Francis Ryck and translated by Norman Dale (Stein & Day, $4.95), there is one hell of a good hunt story, one that keeps mounting in excitement until a resolution that not all will find convincing.

title: ARKANSAS STOPS S.M.U. TEAM, 1813;Morton, After a Demotion, Sparks 4thPeriod Rally
description: DALLAS, Nov. 13 (UPI)Dickey Morton, demoted to the second team because of a penchant for tumbling, came off the bench in the fourth quarter today to steady Arkansas' stumbling offense and the head Razorbacks to an 1813 victory over Southern Methodist.

title: ULSTER HOTEL, PLANT AND PUB ARE BOMBED
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 13 (UPI)  Gunmen bombed a Belfast hotel, a pub and a Canadianowned newspaper plant today and battled British soldiers near the border with the Irish Republic.

title: Seton Hall Triumphs, 350
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 13Seton Hall University's club football team closed its best season in seven years today by defeating St. Peter's College, 350. The Pirates completed the season with a 62 wonlost record while the Peacocks, in their first season, lost their seventh straight. They failed to score a point this season.

title: Mrs. Lordi Married To John Livingston
description: Mrs. Georgette Meehan Lordi of New York, widow of Joseph J. Lordi, former president of the New York Athletic Club, was married here yesterday afternoon to John A. Livingston of Pelham Manor, N. Y.

title: After Long Silence, Soviet Press Tells Readers Influence of Peking's Military Hierarchy Is Declining
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13After a prolonged silence on the situation in China, the Soviet press told its readers today that Lin Piao, the former Defense Minister who had been designated as eventual successor to Chairman Mao Tsetung, and the military hierarchy were losing influence in Peking.

title: Preps
description: HIGHTSTOWN, N. J., Nov. 13Blair beat Peddie today, 276, to reduce the slim margin that separates these two teams after 68 games. Blair, which stopped a fourgame streak of losses to Peddie, has now won 30 games in the rivalry. Peddie has collected 33 victories and there have been 5 ties.

title: Sports of The Times
description: One day last April those two backfield buddies on the Baltimore Colts, Johnny Unitas and Tom Matte, were sharpening their muscles with a furious game of paddle tennis. Suddenly Unitas crumbled into heap on the court. He looked back at Matte, giving him that twisted smile.

title: WILDCATS UPSET OHIO STATE, 1410
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 13 (AP)Greg Strunk ran back a kickoff 93 yards and Randy Anderson scored from a yard out in the fourth period as Northwestern upset Ohio State, 1440, today and knocked the Buckeyes out of the Big 10 title picture.

title: Why Peru Seized TV
description: LIMAIf television viewers in the United States are puzzled by the thinking that goes into some of the programs they see, the answer is probably that the producers have given considerable thought to the lucrative secondary market for their shows in Latin America.

title: Mitchell Clips Mark As Penn State Wins
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Nov. 13Penn State had difficulty with North Carolina State's good defense for three quarters today and then cracked the Wolfpack with four quick touchdowns in the fourth period to beat the Southerners, 1353, and remain undefeated and bowl bound.

title: Unmistakably a WriterWhy, Then, Does His Play Stand Still?
description: OUR newer playwrightsare plainly obsessed with film. When the curtainurtain goes up these nights, whether it is on a deepcarpeted suburban living roora or an icecool chrome cabaret, the odds are that someone is going to trot out a movie screen sooner or later, snap it down on its tripod, and turn out the lights while the projector begins to whirif, indeed, screens and projectors aren't already firmly in place, as three of them are, high above the in Where Has Tommy Hower, Gone?

title: Clark Helps Beat 76ers
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 13 (UPI) Archie Clark scored 27 points and tied a career high with 11 assists tonight to spark the Baltimore Bullets to a 111105 victory over his old teammates, the Philadelphia 76ers. Clark, Jack Marin and newly acquired Dave Stallworth combined for 72 points.

title: The Dance: AvantGarde Variations
description: The City Center on Friday had a day busier even than usual. In the afternoon senior citizens were treated to the Jeffrey II Company in the main auditorium, while in the evening what perhaps might laughingly be calledyes you would have to be laughing  junior citizens were regaled with the Ann Halprin San Francisco Dance Theater Workshop.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: The script of Carnal Knowledge is full to bursting with all the words and phrases that most degrade women, yet the argument seems to be that, because the film ends with a sour result for a life devoted to sexual exploitation, one can condone extremes of language and attitude along the way. I suggest that hae a similar film been made purportedly exposing racism rather than sexism, in which the script contained epithets describing negritude with the same insensitivity that femaleness Is here dealt with, there would have been nightly riots in the cinemas.

title: The Strange Malady Called
description: ROBERT J. FISCHER, the scourge of international chess, the terror of four continents (only because he has not yet played in the global provinces), the man with the computer mind, the flawless intellect of chess, the machine, the crusher of egos who likes to watch them wriggle when impaled on the gang hooks of a profound combination, is a young giant of a man going on 29 who acts and talks like an adolescent and has the appetite of a growing boy (recent breakfast: extralarge orange juice, four eggs sunny side, toasted bagels, melon, milk, fruit salad). He is a growing boy famous enough to be invited to appear on the Dick Cavett and Mike Douglas shows, to be the subject of numerous indepth interviews, and who most likely will be the next chess champion of the world. Singlehanded, he has made the ancient game of chess glamorous enough to have the man in the street talking about it, and to evoke editorials and frontpage stories in The New York Times. Whoever heard of chess before Bobby Fischer came along?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dean Acheson's brilliant, concise farewell in The Times [Oct. 14] summed up the ills of our country and the rest of the world in a single wordMediocrity. For us, mediocrity at the White House, in the Governor's mansion in Albany and here in City Hall.

title: NAVY DRUG CENTER ON COAST IS VEXED
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 13A drug rehabilitation center at Miramar Naval Air Station, which has served as a laboratory for the Navy's no bust program of granting amnesty and treatment to narcotics users, is beset by troubles after four months of operation.

title: THOMAS COOK
description: Thomas Cook, president of the Ann Arbor (Mich.) Foundry Company and a member of the national board of the American ORT Federation, died Friday in Ann Arbor at the age of 84.

title: Canada Jet Crew Subdues Hijacker After 6 Hours
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 13 (AP)Crewmen of an Air Canada jetliner, hijacked six hours before, subdued the hijacker early today, knocking him out with a fire ax as he shouted, I'll blow you all up.

title: Army Defeats Pitt, 17 to 14, on 20Yard Field Goal With 31 Seconds to Play
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 13 Jim Barclay, a sophomore, kicked a 20yard field goal with 31 seconds left to give Army 1714 victory over Pittsburgh before 38,559 fans in Michie Stadium today.

title: Start of Phase Two
description: The fight against inflation turns a crucial corner today, with the economy corning out of the ice box into the even more agonizing challenge of comprehensive Federal regulation of wages, prices, profit margins, corporate dividends and rents.

title: A Foolish American IsmUtopianism
description: LET us suppose that we have provided the President of the United States with two imaginary speeches, both of which he is dutifully prepared to deliver. They deal, in a highly general way, with the goals of American foreign policy. The first speech goes somewhat as follows:

title: Heart Specialists Urge Drive on Rheumatic Fever
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 13Hundreds of doctors attending the meeting of the American Heart Association here are devoting today to discussion of one of the most common serious diseases of childhoodrheumatic fever, a disease they say should now be on the verge of extinction.

title: Kristin Repplier Bride of Student
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 13The St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Chapel at Yale University was the setting at noon today for the marriage of Miss Kristin Repplier, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Banning Repplier, to A. Lowrie Applegate Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Applegate of Sewickley, Pa. The Rev. Richard Russell performed the ceremony.

title: C.W. Post Routs Kings Point, 470, on Wichard's Passes
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Nov. 13What was expected to be close game between Long Island rivals turned out to be a rout as C. W. Post trounced the United States Merchant Marine Academy, 470, today before 3,200 shivering fans at Hickox Field.

title: David Millers Have Son
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 13A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. David Miller on Oct. 16 at the Alexandria Hospital. The child has been named Paul Edward. Mrs. Miller is the former Miss Judith Pepperman of New York. Mr. Miller is a lawyer with the National Labor Relations Board in Washington.

title: QUICK LEHIGH SCORES SINK BUCKNELL, 230
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Nov. 13Lehigh combined strong defense with a dominating offense to beat Bucknell, 230, today.

title: Our Oceans Are Dying
description: WASHINGTONThe sea is threatened. We are facing the destruction of the ocean by pollution and try other causes.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONOne of the persistent themes that has run through the long hearings here on the future organization and regulation of the securities markets is concern over what changes might affect the availability of securities research.

title: Laird Walks to Victory
description: LONDON, Nov. 13 (Reuters) Ron Laird, American Olympic walker, won the sevenmile road walk today in 50 minutes 22 seconds.

title: Critic of Jordan and Guerrillas Stirs West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 13 A blunt 87page book, circulating on the occupied West bank the Jordan River has provoked a storm of political controversy among Palestinian intellectuals, to the discomfort of the Israeli authorities, the Government of Jordan and the militant Palestinian guerrilla organizations.

title: 2 Thieves Escape Police After Chase and Shootout
description: The theft of $100 worth of cheese, milk and other dairy products from the East Side grocery yesterday resulted in gunfire, a police chase and an auto accident. The thieves got away.

title: Allentown Cars Damaged
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Nov. 13 (Reuters)  Pranksters broke into at least 10 cars, releasing hand brakes and rolling them around a fiveblock residential area in southeast Allentown. The police said that one car had rolled onto a lawn and turned over. Others smashed into trees, buildings and other parked cars. About 25 cars were damaged. No one was injured.

title: Container Port, Yes, but Where?
description: The sounds coming out of Brooklyn those days are reminiscent of the time not so long ago when school bots agreed on playing a game, but differed on whose backyard should be used for it.

title: Preps
description: KENT, Conn., Nov. 13 Scott Perry returned a bunt 70 yards and an Intercepted pass 101 yards for two touchdowns today as Kent clinched the Leif Erickson League championship by defeating Loomis, 3712.

title: CHAMBER SOCIETY PRESENTS RARITY
description: The Chamber Music society of Lincoln Center turned up a fine rarity in its concert in Tully Hall on Friday night. This was Moszkowski's Suite in G minor for two violins and piano. A detestable oldfashioned concoction, as sweet and elegantly put together as a piece of French pastry. Its melting tunes and bravura dashes are perfectly blended. Like any confection, it may be too saccharine for frequent consumption, but it is wonderful for occasional consumption.

title: S.I. Leaders Say North Shore Is Neglected in City Planning
description: More than 100 Staten Island commusity leaders and residents participated in a planning conference yesterday that characterized the north shore of the island as the most neglected and troubled part of the borough.

title: Ficker Will Sail in Match Races for Congressional Cup
High Cost of Dying Spurs an Increase in Cremation and Burial at Sea Among Southern Californians
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 13Mike Reed, a funeral director, flew his twoseater plane out over the Pacific into the lowering sun, said a brief prayer and scattered a trickle of ashes from a brown paper bag across the waves below.

title: Bilingual Programs Urged in Schools
description: An influx of Haitians, Kalians and Israelis into Brooklyn has led to a rocommendation by the vice president of the central Board of Edication that some schools in the borough offer bilingual programs for the recent arrivals and that all schools generally give proper recognition to this nation's cultural pluralism.

title: Green Leads Royals
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 13 (AP) Johnny Green scored 22 points and pulled down 12 rebounds tonight as the Cincinnati Royals remained in first place in the Central Division of the National Basketball Association by defeating the Golden State Warriors, 110101.

title: EGYPT BIDS U.N. DEBATE MIDEAST
description: CAIRO, Nov. 13Egypt disclosed plans today for a showdown debate in the United Nations General Assembly to demand that Israel give a commitment to withdraw from the occupied Sinai Peninsula or face an economic boycott and a ban on militaryequipment deliveries.

title: Literature for the Philatelist
description: THIRTYONE years ago the American Air Mail Society produced a onevolume catalogue of the airposts of the world. Subsequently, there have been successive editions of the catalogue, and with the just released Volume IV, the fourth edition of the A.A.M.S. compendium has been completed it has been a yearslong effort involving many people and countless hours of study, compilation and editing. The overall effort is most commendable and thorough in its presentation, a notable section being its chronological index of more than 15,000 items, compiled by Michael Codd, of every flight catalogued (save for Paris balloon posts, aerial propaganda leaflets and U.S. airmail stamps, which are covered in historic sections in various portions of the fourvolume compendium).

title: Rhodesia Bans Switchblades
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia (AP) A new Rhodesian law will make possession of a switchblade knife illegal starting in January, with a maximum penalty of a $560 fine or a year in prison, or both.

title: Hearings Set on Controversial Plan to Reorganize Brooklyn College School of General Studies
description: The fate of the School of General Studies of Brooklyn College will be discussed in open hearings tomorrow and Tuesday at Boylan Hall on campus in response to student concern over recommendations for the radical reorganization of the evening division.

title: Professors' Unions Are Growing
description: The unionization of professors, a movement that is beginning to realign economic, political and academic power on many campuses, has emerged as a leading and contentious issue in higher education.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: It may seem premature to start speculating about Phase Three of the President's wageprice program when Phase Two has barely begun. However, Phases One and Two are spoken of as temporary periods of sacrifice and restriction leading up to: What?

title: Henry Buch Redux
description: Updike's office is concealed in a kind of falsebottomed drawer in the heart of downtown Ipswich (Mass.), but the drowsy locals, for a mere 30 pieces of silver, can be conned into betraying its location. A stucklooking door is pulled open; an endless flight of stairs, lit by a team of dusty fireflies, is climbed. Within the sanctum, squalor reigns unchallenged. A lugubrious army  green metal desk rests in the center of a threadbare Oriental rug reticulate with mousepaths; the walls are camouflaged in the kind of cardboard walnut paneling used in newly graduated lawyers' offices or in those Los Angeles motels favored by the handheld cameramen and quicktongued directeurs of blue movies. On these sad walls hang pictures, mostly souvenirs of his childhood, artistic or otherwise. On the bookshelves, evidently stained by a leopard in the process of shedding his spots, rest repellent booksgarish schoolboy anthologies secreting some decaying Updikean morsel, seven feet of James Buchanan's bound works adumbrating the next novel, some daffodilyellow buildingtrade manual penumbrating Couples; and, most repellent of all, a jacketless row of the total oeuvre, spines naked as the chorus of Hair, revealing what only the most morbid have hitherto suspected, that since 1959 (The Poorhouse Fair, surely A. Knopf's connivance has been perpetuating a uniform edition of himself. Beclouding all, the stink of nickel cigarillos, which the shifty, tremulous, asthmatic author puffs to sting the muse's eyes into watering ever since at the SurgeonGeneral's behest, he excised cigarettes from his armory of crutches.

title: Somehow, though life remained meaningless, he survived.
description: By Hans Erich Nossack. 313 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $7.95.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Local, county and state economic development is a many  sided proposition, drawing on the skills, patience and resources of public and private hands. Public efforts, at the governor or state development director level, have become increasingly visible and professional in some areas.

title: Student Fiance Of Sarah Cole
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Nov. 13 Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Thomas M. Cole of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sarah Cole, to Stephen Strasser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Strasser of New York and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: DELAWARE CRUSHES BOSTON U., 54 TO 0
description: BOSTON, Nov. 13 (AP)Delaware, rated the top college division team in the nation, did nothing to diminish its standing today en route to a 540 trouncing of Boston University at Nickerson Field.

title: Autumn's Simplicities
description: By midNovember the season and the earth itself have begun to relax toward ease and simplicity that are hard to believe in the face of the predicaments and dilemmas into which man contrives himself. Now the earth seems to settle back into quiet contemplation, aware that fuss and worry and haste get no one anywhere.

title: Et Al.
description: Mrs. Murphy's fire in words and pictures. The book is lavishly illustrated from the great fund of contemporary pictures; curiously there are few of the fire itself, perhaps because, as the authors theorize, the photographic technique was so limited. Instead, there are many drawings from Harper's Weekly and other sources. The narration, keyed to the illustrations, tends to ramble, although it is fitfully quite interesting. (Ironically, a simultaneous fire in a Wisconsin lumber town, which cost many more lives, is virtually unknown today.)

title: W. and J. on Top
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Nov. 13 (AP)Dan Kasperik passed for two touchdowns and scored once, setting a Washington and Jefferson career offense record as he led the Presidents to a 2715 victory over Kenyon today. Kasperik's 183 yards gained in the air gave him 5,243 in total offense for four years.

title: Architecture
description: THE day the Lincoln Memorial collapsed there was no more smog than usual over Washington, although traffic had been heavy through the open trenches of the new freeway link cut through the grounds around the monument.

title: AIR FORCE VICTOR OVER TULSA, 177
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 13 (UPI) Steve Heil intercepted a fourthquarter Tulsa aerial and scampered 37 yards to score today as Air Force snapped a twogame losing streak and downed Tulsa( 17.7)

title: No. 23 for Westminster
description: BEAVER FALLS, Pa., Nov. 13 (AP)  Unbeaten Westminster stretched its winning streak to 23 games today by downing Geneva, 4213.

title: Interracial Bank Chartered on L. I.
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., The Vanguard National Bank, the first interracial banking venture on Long Island, has received its charter approval from the Controller of the Currency of the United States.

title: Public Complaints of Police Corruption Are Reported to Have Tripled in a Year
description: The number of public complaints about police corruption has increased threefold in the last year, according to the commander of the Police Department's anticorruption unit, who reported that the largest single category of complaints19 per centinvolves narcotics payoffs.

title: WORKERS DISPUTE METHANE DANGER
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 13That odor is pitch, said the hardhatted construction engineer.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONIt started as dim rumblings from scattered sections of the country, but within the last few months opposition to busing of children to achieve school integration has reached a fever pitch all over the United Stales. Just within recent days, there have been these developments:

title: Scallops on Ice Ordered
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Nov. 13 (AP)The food and drug division of the Massachusetts Department of Public Health has told shippers that scallops sent from this island to the mainland henceforth must be packed in ice.

title: Medicine
description: Dr. E. Hugh Luckey, Cornell's vice president for medical affairs, has a brother who practices internal medicine in northern Alabama. When Medicare came in, says Dr. Luckey, the number of patients his brother treated jumped from about 20 a day to 30 or 35.

title: If you don't know who Fala was, this was written for you
description: Herman Wouk has written a long, mildly interesting, moderately informative novel about the beginnings of World War II, from the signing of the SovietNazi act in August, 1939, to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The central figure is a Navy man, Victor Henry, usually called Pug, a shorebound commander when the novel opens, a fourstriper waiting for sea duty when it ends.
