He and his wife, Rhoda, have two sons, Warren and Byron, and a daughter, Madeleine. Warren has followed Pug to Annapolis and has chosen naval aviation. Byron has revoltedagainst the naval tradition and his fatheralthough, after the adoption of the draft in the fall of 1940, he enlists as a submariner. Madeleine leaves college, against Pug's wishes, to serve as the secretary of a popular broadcaster.

title: Orioles Held to 99 Tie By Japanese AllStars
description: FUKUOKA, Japan, Nov. 13 (AP)Frank Robinson, Ellie Hendricks and Mark Belanger hit home runs today, but the Orioles managed only a 9.9 10inning tie with a Japanese AllStar team.

title: Damage Is Put at Millions In Blaze at Con Ed Plant
description: A fire listed as possible arstin by the Westchester County and New York State Police caused millions of dollars of damage to electrical equipment at Consolidated Edison's new 873,000kilowatt nuclear power plant at Indian Point, 40 miles north of New York City.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: THERE is a curious lull in the middle of John Canaday's twopart attack on the art of Barnett Newman. In the Museum of Modern Art's exhibition, he writes, the pictures: look better than ever before, and I found myself responding to them as I had never thought could be possible. But I made the mistake of looking at them as the source of rapturous philosophizings now current, and the paintings themselves fell apart under this bombardment of nonsense.

title: Ralph Smith Weds Mary Hollowell
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Nov. 13Miss Mary Louise Hollowell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Pruden Hollowell of Chesapeake, was married here this afternoon to Ralph Lee Smith of New York, son of Mrs. Hugh Harold Smith of West Chester, Pa. and the late Mr. Smith. The Rev. Emory E. Byrum performed the ceremony in the Cradock Baptist Church.

title: Kaminska Plays New Role As a Teacher in Queens
description: Ida Kaminska has opened a twosemester engagement at Queens College and the first notices are favorable.

title: California Downs Oregon On Kemnitzer's Runs, 1710
description: EUGENE, Ore., Nov. 13 (UPI) California rallied behind a strong defense and the running of Steve Kemnitzer today to beat Oregon, 1710 in the rain.

title: Antinoise Group Quietly Opens Office
description: Project Quiet City opened its West Side communityaction storefront with hushed ceremonies yesterday to bring its noiseabatement, message down to street level.

title: Iraq, Seeking to End Isolation, Asks Arabs' Aid on Gulf Issue
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Nov. 13 (Reuters)Iraq is making a new attempt to break out of her isolation in the Arab world.

title: St. John's Still Alive
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., Nov. 13St. John The Baptist kept its hopes for, the Catholic Schools Football League championship alive today with a 200 romp over Maria Regina. St. John's which won its sixth game against a loss and a tie, will win the league championship if Chaminade loses tomorrow.

title: Cornell Wins in Soccer
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 13Victor Huerta scored three goals and Bob Rechtschaf tern two today in leading Cornell to a 71 soccer victory over Dartmouth today.

title: Et Al.
description: Dr. Shepard was coauthor of the reasonable, poppsych Games Analysts Play; he now follows with some junk: a confession that he had wanted to cure a lesbian patient by going to bed with her, a little rambling on the problems of patients sleeping with their doctors, andthe payoff10 firstperson accounts of the triumphs and tragedies of the practice, by the doctors who tried it. Shepard himself approves, with guidelines. This is not a reasoned, responsible book: the guidelines are immediately vitiated by the sexual relationship itself.

title: KNICKS CONOUER PISTONS, 127105
description: Willis Reed was back on the sidelines for an indefinite period, but the Knickes missed their 6footl0inch captain and center not a bit last night at Madison Square Garden as they reversed their recent form and crushed the Detroit Pistons, 127105, before a capacity crowd of 19,588.

title: DEMOCRATS PLEDGE ARKANSAS LOYALTY
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Nov. 13 The Democratic State Committee of Arkansas has adopted a loyalty oath designed to prevent supporters of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama from seeking delegate seats to the 1972 Democratic National Convention.

title: IVY LEAD SHARED
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 13Ed Marinaro put in a durable pitch for the Heisman Trophy today, but Dartmouth produced the final statistic that counted, a 2414 Ivy League football victory over previously unbeaten Cornell.

title: Humphrey Making Early Gains in California in Serious Bid for Presidential Nomination
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13Senator Hilbert H. Humphrey of Minnesota has begun in earnest his battle for a second Democratic Presidential nomination, with California as his first key theater of operations.

title: Motor Carrier Safety Code
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13.A revised edition of the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations, containing amendments through July 1, 1971, is available for 65 cents from the Superintendent of Documents, United States Government Printing Office. The publication includes all safety regulations applicable to motor carriers operating in interstate or foreign commerce. Amendments after July 1 are available from the Bureau of Motor Carrier Safety of the Federal Highway Administration.

title: Soccer Bid Is Accepted
description: FREDONIA, N. Y., Nov. 13 (AP)Fredonia State said today it had accepted a bid to participate in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics soccer tournament, which starts Tuesday.

title: Univac Analyst Plans to Marry Mary E. Dwyer
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 13The engagement of Miss Mary Ellen Dwyer to Francis Hopkinson Van Deventer Jr., son of Mrs. David S. Henkel of Greenwich and Fishers Island, N.Y., and Mr. Van Deventer of Greenwich, has been announced by the prospective bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Gregory K. Dwyer.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I AM writing to protest the unusual amount of commercials put on during Story Theater, on Channel 7 one evening recently. My children and I were so happy to watch this program when tit was first aired. It is imaginatiive, original and good fun. However, this experience has really upset us. The second story was cut offfor a comrnercialand then after about seven commercial spots (and I am not exaggerating, check it if you will) the third story was shown, already in progress.

title: Center Aids Disabled Students
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I.A pilot project at the State University Agricultural and Technical College to develop a twoyear college center for handicapped students appears to be succeeding.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Robert Stein is a Seventh Avenue apparel manufacturer who likes the business he is in. This, of course, could be said about most of the men on the streetto put up with all the difficulties inherent in the business they would have to like itbut in Mr. Stein's case, he took a business that was going downhill, turned it around and made it one of the leading style houses on the street.

title: Joan Kaiser Is Betrothed
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 13 Mrs. Hamilton Hampton Morris Jr. has announced the engagement and approaching marriage of her daughter, Miss Joan Marshall Kaiser, to Jeremy James Miles Hubball, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Miles Hubball of New York and Huntington, Conn. The wedding is planned for Dec. 18 in Boston.

title: State Fines 4 in Queens For Urging Panic Sales
description: Four Queens realestate men were ordered last week to pay fines or lose their licenses temporarily for allegedly violating a state order issued to curb blockbusting in the Laurelton area.

title: Westchester
description: Monsignor Farrell stretched its unbeaten football record to 28 games yesterday by defeating New Rochelle, 346, at City Park in New Rochelle. The Staten Island team, ranked No. I in New York City, scored its five touchdowns in the first half before sending reserves in through the second half.

title: 4 MORE TUNA BOATS SEIZED BY ECUADOR
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif. Nov. 13 (AP)Four more United States tuna boats and a Canadian trawler were seized by Ecuador today in a steppedup dispute over territorial fishing rights, the American Tunaboat Association said.

title: California StateFullerton Wins CrossCountry Title
description: WHEATON, Ill. Nov. 13 (AP) California State at Fulierton and North Dakota State dominated the National Collegiate Athletic Association College Division crosscountry meet today at Wheaton College.

title: Nyerere's Lodge Blacked Out
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Nov. 13 (Agence FrancePresse) Electricity at the state lodge in Arusha, in northern Tanzania, has been cut off because of bills outstanding since June, it was reported here today. The lodge is President Julius K. Nyerere's official residence when he goes to Arusha.

title: For This They Had To Come From Frisco?
description: ALL Bedlam and Parnassus were let loose on Second Avenue for the opening of Tinsel Tarts in a Hot Coma, starring those hypersuperstars from San Francisco, the Cockettes. The lobby of the Anderson Theater was ful' of capes of all shapes; earrings glinted behind sideburns; faces were painted in many patterns and a rainbow assortment of hues. One personage attired all over in glitzy gray, had painted his skin to match. Another youth, subtler perhaps, wore a tiny ?? gless heart on his left cheek One lad clutched a purple felt teddy bear; another had a white one. Drag queens of all persuasions abounded; one rouged fellow had even brought a whip. Photographers flashed away assiduously and, outside, a Hollywood  premiere  type spotlight pierced the Second Avenuesky.

title: Dave Jasen, a LecturerBroadcasterWriter, Leads Ragtime Revival on Long Island
description: Ragtime, which flourished during the first two decades of this century, is still vital today on Long Island, half a century later, wherever Dave Jasen happens to be.

title: An Indian Affair
description: Three years ago, a group of students at Dartmouth College, assembled by Howard Bad Hand, Dwayne Birdbear, Travis Kingsley and Rick Buckanaga, demanded that the athletic department stop entertaining fans at home football games by employing undergraduates, dressed as Indians, to do imitations of war dances along the sidelines and at midfield during halftime.

title: Briton Wins the Right to Publish Tale of World War II Espionage
description: LONDON, Nov. 13  The 1971 British Who's Who lists among Sir John Masterman's publications The XX System in the War of 1939 to 1945. It is a curious listing, for no such book has been published.

title: LEGISLATORS UPHOLD FISCAL YEAR SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)  A joint Congressional committee has rejected proposals that the Federal Government operate on a calendar year basis rather than on the JulyJune fiscal year system.

title: MRS. FLOERSHEIMER
description: Mrs. Adriana Musa Floersheimer of Middletown, N. J., wife of Albert Floersheimer Jr., corporate secretary of the Walter Reade Organization, a movie theater chain, died Friday of cancer in Sarasota, Fla. Her age was 51.

title: Possession of Dangerous Drugs Found a Postscript to Many Routine Arrests in MiddleClass Queens
description: From routine arraignment procedures in Queens weekend court yesterday emerged a vivid picture of the impact of narcotics on this middleclass borough and the close relationship between dangerous drugs and other crimes.

title: Travel Notes: An Irish Museum And Alaskan Conservation Woes
description: IN Dublin, at Sandycove on the south side of Dublin Bay, stands the Martello Tower, a James Joyce museum that contains manuscripts, first editions, letters and other memorabilia of the author. Unfortunately, the museum, opened in 1962 with the help of private and Government money, was closed this past September when the Irish Government refused to allocate funds for central heating and refurbishing. Thus a famous literary shrine, one in which the opening scenes of Ulysses are set and in which Joyce himself for a time lived, has been shuttered up, and its contents are being damaged by moisture. But harken, there are bright lights on the horizon. The tower is being restored and heated as the result of the individual efforts of a Dublin businessman who hopes to have the museum operating in a less damp atmosphere by January, 1972. No, the benefactor's name is not Dedalus.

title: Coal Miners Sign Pact, Ending Strike of 44 Days
description: Negotiators reached agreement here early today on a new agreement that will end the 44day strike by 100,000 soft coal miners.

title: Learning How to Die
description: FOR several months last year, Mrs. M., an elderly patient in a large metropolitan hospital, lay critically ill. As her condition worsened, the woman's fancily sought out a psychiatrist and asked him to visit the bedside, presumably to help her through the ordeal. When the psychiatrist arrived at the hospital, however, the old lady's son asked him, somewhat nervously, to tell the patient that her illness was psychosomatic and she would soon be well. We must lie to Mama, we must play the clown and cheer her up, the son said, adding that this was the only way to keep her from becoming depressed.

title: Coins
description: THE recent proposal to restore our $2 bill to general circulation was hailed by collectors of United States currency, who regard the move as a step toward the issuance of new and much more interesting paper monies in the near future. Representative Seymour Halpern, Republican of New York, introduced legislation to revive the $2 bill with a new design. It would carry the portrait of Susan B. Anthony, a pioneer of women's rights and fiery Suffragette leader of the eighteen hundreds.

title: STORM RECOVERY LAGS IN PAKISTAN
description: CHAR CHAPEL, Pakistan Nov. 13 (AP)Rustom Ali, a hardened kernel of a man about 5 feet tall, looked toward the Bay of Bengal a quarter of a mile away. The waters were lapping at the shore.

title: U.S. Negotiators Leave For Arms Talks in Vienna
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP) United States negotiators set off for Vienna today after President Nixon predicted a United StatesSoviet agreement to curb the arms race.

title: ISRAELI JUDGE BARS LANSKY OUSTER NOW
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 14A high court justice in Jerusalem today barred the expulsion of Meyer Lansky, a reputed leader of American crime, pending the adjudication of his application to become an Israeli.

title: 3 COLLEGE COACHES DIE IN PLANE CRASH
description: GAVIOTA, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)Three members of the California State at Fullerton football coaching staff and charter pilot were killed when their light plane crashed in mountainous terrain three miles east of here last night.

title: HAROLD JAEGER, 66, A JERSEY PUBLISHER
description: Harold H. Jaeger, president and publisher of Mercer Affiliated Publishers of Princeton, N.J., publishers of Pools and Gardens, a quarterly, died Thursday of a heart attack in Los Angeles, while on a business trip. He was 66 years old and lived at Nelson Ridge Road, Princeton.

title: ExCommuter Counts Sheep for a Living
description: ELVERSON, Pa.  What's a city slicker doing on a sheep farm 45 miles from the big town? Eric Flaxenburg explained that It was what he'd always wanted to do. Besides, he married a farmer's daughter.

title: Theater: Four Twigs Make a Nest
description: Theatergoers have known for years that Sada Thompson is a remarkable actress. Just how remarkable was demonstrated last night at the Broadhurst Theater, where she starred in four linked sketches by George Furth entitled Twigs. And I do mean starred. Miss Thompson takes this somewhat rickety vehicles and rides it to triumph. At the preview I saw she was given a standing ovation and deserved every, bit of it.

title: Advertising:
description: There may be a lot of gloom and doomers around but they're not among the publishers of the nation's major women's magazines.

title: Vanden Heuvel Wants 2 Closed Addict Centers Used as Jails
description: A recommendation that two closed narcotics rehabilitation residential centers be reopened to house prisoners who are now in overcrowded local jails was made yesterday by William J. vanden Heuvel, chairman of the city's Board of Correction.

title: Franco Granddaughter to Marry
description: MADRID, Nov. 14  The engagement of Generalissimo Francisco Franco's eldest granddaughter to a member of the Spanish royal family is expected to be announced before long.

title: Irish Rider Dies After Fall.
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 14 (AP)  Michael Teelin, Ireland's champion apprentice jockey, died in a hospital here today after being injured in a fall at Leopardstown Race Course.

title: 2 Friends Perform Spanish Works
description: Can a program devoted only to Spanish songs remain interesting through an entire evening? The answer is yes when the singer is Victoria de los Angeles and the pianist Alicia de Larrocha. Those two distinguished Spanish musicians appeared together for the first time on Saturday evening at Hunter College, and it was one of the great evenings.

title: But Some Analysts Feel a Resumption of Rate Decline Lies Ahead
description: A mountain of unsold inven1tory has suddenly loomed up ahead of the credit markets, clouding the prospect for further declines in interest rates.

title: Charles Rhetts, Lawyer, Dies; ExAmbassador to Liberia, 61
description: LONDON, Nov. 14  Charles Edward Rhetts, a Washington lawyer and a former United States Ambassador to Liberia, died here today after a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Layer Routs Ashe in Italian Net Final
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Nov. 14 (AP)  Rod Laver of Australia wound up the 1971 World Championship Tennis tour qualification round today by defeating Arthur Ashe of Gum Spring, Va., 63, 64, 64, to win the Italian international open tournament.

title: OnceIdle Consulate in Calcutta Is Heart of Bangla Desk Activity
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 7 Beyond a line of giant deodar trees and high, creepertopped walls, the house at 9 Circus Avenue, looks stately if a little forbidding.

title: Juilliard Group Gives Premiere Of Limon and Sokolov Dances
description: Three new works, two by Jose Limn and one by Anna Sokolow, and a performance of Martha Graham's Diversion of Angels made up the program Saturday night of the Juilliard Dance Ensemble. It was the company's first regular public presentation in the Juilliard Theater since the Juilliard School moved to its Lincoln Center location.

title: A Draft Foe Becomes Man Without Country
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 14  On a sunny spring day four years ago, as red and yellow tulips pushed through the snow along the streets of Toronto, Thomas Glenn Jolley laid the foundation for a quandare that now confronts him and the governments of the United States and Canada.

title: Community Board Spending $525,000 as It Wishes
description: Ever since Antonios Morfesis, a member of Manhattan Community Board 12, was mugged in the Municipal Building recently, he has been particularly concerned about crime.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I wish to call your attention to what I consider to have been a misinterpretation of my views on the subject of military assistance to Israel as contained in a news story appearing in The Times on Nov. 1. The article in question, written by Bernard Gwertzman, was based on remarks which I made in the course of the Face the Nation program on Oct. 31. Mr. Gwertzman is a fine reporter but in this particular instance his story, undoubtedly through inadvertence, conveyed a misleading impression of my position.

title: HARRELSON TURNS UP ON MUSIC SCORECARD
description: Bud Harrelson, the Mets' shortstop, made his professional debut as a country music singer this weekend. Backed by the Fred Warner trio, which includes a pedal steel guitar, and supported vocally and on guitar by Walt Conklin, an established country music performer, Mr. Harrelson appeared on Friday and Saturday evenings at Henry's, 6811 Fifth Avenue, Brooklyn, the metropolitan area's only country music club.

title: Emotional Triumph at Atlanta: Tarkenton 21, Van Brocklin 17
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 14Football, even among professionals, is an emotional game in which strongly held attitudes often clash as fiercely as the wellmuscled bodies on the field. In Atlanta Stadium today, the lastminute victory the Giants scored over Atlanta symbolized as directly as possible a triumph for Fran Tarkenton over Norm Van Brocklin.

title: U.S. Jews Are Assessed $550Million by Philanthropic Group
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14American Jewish communities were told today that they would have to raise $550million in philanthropic funds in 1972 to support a wide range of Jewish services in this country and to maintain humanitarian projects in Israel.

title: Gulf Dock Strike Looms
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 14 (UPI)Two major locals of the International Longshoremen's Association voted almost unanimously today to strike the port of Houston tomorrow.

title: Wilt Stars for Lakers
description: Inglewood, Calif., Nov. 14 (AP)Wilt Chamberlain's rebounding, assists and blocking of shots carried the Los Angeles Lakers to a 128115 triumph over the Boston Celtics tonight.

title: Elvira Calvo, W. E. Kock Jr. Married Here
description: Miss Elvira Beatriz Calvo Lafuente, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfonso D. Calvo of Buenos Aires, was married here yesterday morning to Winston Edward Kock Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Kock of Ann Arbor, Mich., and Governour's Harbor, Eleuthera, the Bahamas.

title: Nixon Agriculture Nominee To Quit Four Corporations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) Earl L. Butz, who has been nominated by President Nixon to be Secretary of Agriculture, said tonight that he had notified four corporations that he was resigning from their boards of directors.

title: PHASE 2 CONTROL OF RENT OPPOSED
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 14 The president of the National Association of Real Estate Boards said today that all controls on rents should he removed under President Nixon's Phase Two economic program and thereafter.

title: The Mississippi Election
description: News Analysis

title: The Dollar's Popularity in Eurobond Market Displaying Stamina
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 14  The rally on the longterm capital market in Europe is getting rave notices for stamina. More than $40million in Eurobond debt has been offered during the last few weeks as the dollar has come back into fashion and other Eurocurrencies have virtually disappeared from sight.

title: 5,000 ON DELAWARE REJOIN DOCK STRIKE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14 (AP) About 5,000 longshoremen walked off the job in ports along the Delaware River today, rejoining 20,000 striking longshoremen on the East and Gulf Coasts.

title: THIEU, IN ADDRESS TO NATION, ORDERS ECONOMIC REFORM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 15  President Nguyen Van Thieu today outlined his Government's long awaited economic reform program, which will include devaluation of the piaster and a modernization of the country's fiscal and commercial system.

title: McCafferty Provides Sideline Drama
description: That was a strange football game played yesterday before a record Shea Stadium crowd of 63,947; seven fumbles, two blocked placekicks in the fourth quarter and eight penalties, including one uncontested slap to the head.

title: Laotian Police Burn Drugs
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 14 (AP)  Laotian policemen burned more than 200 pounds of opium and heroin today in a public ceremony in the national stadium.

title: CHARLES W. RICE JR.
description: RYE, N. Y., Nov. 14Charles W. Rice Jr., advertising and public relations manager of the American Cyanamid Company's fibers division, died yesterday of a heart ailment in the United Hospital in Port Chester. He was 61 years old and lived at 31 Stuyvesant Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW COPTIC POPE CROWNED IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, Nov. 14A former Egyptian Army officer who became a desert hermit and slept on stones was crowned today as the 117th successor to Saint Mark as patriarch of the Coptic Orthodox Church and Pope of Alexandria.

title: MRS. NILES TRAMMELL
description: MIAMI, Nov. 14 (UPI)Mrs. Cleo Murphy Trammell, wife of Niles Trammell, former president of the National Broadcasting Company, died in the Miami Heart Institute this morning after a brief illness. Her age was 70.

title: Red. Smith
description: Sports of The Times

title: TWO ARE PUSHED FOR THANT'S POST
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 14The supporters of Max Jakobson of Finland and Kurt Waldheim of Austria, who are considered the two leading contenders for the job of secretary general, are making new efforts to promote their candidates.

title: Dolphins Win, 2421, to Keep Slim Lead
description: Bob Griese, who spent Saturday night in a Miami hospital suffering from a gastrointestinal attack, seemed nearly perfect in health yesterday afternoon in the Orange Bowl.

title: PHASE TWO BEGINS; KEY DECISIONS DUE ON PAY AND PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The nation entered a new stage of President Nixon's economic programPhase Two  today with several crucial wage and price issues still unsettled.

title: Colts Beat Jets Before 63,947
description: The New York Jets, fired again by a ruggedly relentless defense, were deprived of their second straight upset yesterday, done in by two calls that went the other way and two placekicks that went the other way, too  when they were blocked by Baltimore defenders.

title: Harvey Lichtenstein Weds Miss Holbrook
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N. Y., Nov. 14Miss Phyllis Holbrook and Harvey Lichtenstein, director of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. John Holbrook of Bedford Hills and Hobe Sound Fla. The Rev. Arthur Hargate of St. Matthew's Episcopal Church here, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: City Housing Chief Challenges State Aide's Figures on Starts
description: The city's housing chief assailed his state counterpart yesterday for attributing a recent spurt in private housing construction to the new vacancy decontrol law.

title: CITY TO BUY ONLY RECYCLED PAPER
description: Paper manufacturers selling everything from official forms to toilet paper to the city will soon be required to use large amounts of recycled paper in their products, Purchase Commissioner Marvin Gersten said yesterday.

title: Board to Get Coal Pact
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14 (UPI)  A new contract increasing wages to $50 a day by 1973 evoked guarded approval today among the country's 80,000 soft coal miners.

title: PRAISE RECORDED BY SOVIET SHOPS
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14An apparently widespread practice of double bookkeeping in Soviet retail stores was brought to light here today.

title: A Federal Agency's Magazine Is Forced to Roll Back Its Price
description: The Federal Government has caught a national magazine trying to raise its subscription price 27 per cent and has forced it to roll back the price.

title: Chaminade Downs Holy Trinity, 287, For Divisional Title
description: Chaminade clinched the Long Island Division Catholic Schools Football League championship yesterday by defeating Holy Trinity, 287, at Hicksville, L.I. It was the sixth victory for the unbeaten, but twicetied, Flyers.

title: Blyth & Co. Assails Big Board
description: Blyth & Co., Inc. a venerable member of the Wall Street investment banking fraternity, has decided to play the money game a bit less politely.

title: Picking Winners Poses Puzzling Task for Orange and Sugar Bowl Selectors
description: A crystal ball and lots of luck is just what the Orange and Sugar Bowl selection committees want today as each of these puzzled groups meets in an attempt to pick the winners of the OklahomaNebraska game, Thanksgiving Day, and the AlabamaAuburn game, Nov. 27.

title: London: A Dance Haven at The Place
description: Arts Abroad

title: Fund Raising Explained: Campaign Ends, Bills Linger
description: City Hall Notes

title: Dorati Leads the National In Appalachia of Delius
description: Frederick Delius is enjoying a recent upturn. Only a short time ago Lorin Maazel and the Philharmonia Orchestra presented Delius's Paris, and yesterday afternoon in Philharmonic Hall the largescale Appalachia was heard.

title: Bronx Bottleneck Soon to Be Broken
description: A Christmas dividend is coming up for the 200,000 drivers who daily beep, creep, cuss and fuss their way through the maze of roads at kamikaze circle in the Bronx where the complex Bruckner Interchange is under construction.

title: Ghostly Phase Two Architects
description: The two principal authors of the philosophy on which the Pay Board rests its hopes of holding the wage line in Phase Two of President Nixon's antiinflation effort hold no membership on the board. In fact, they are not even alive. But if the Pay Board can keep its 5.5 per cent guidepost from being splintered by the massive challenges that will beat down on it in the next few weeks, the precepts formulated nearly a quarter century ago by the board's ghostly mentors may help achieve a permanent reorientation of collective bargaining toward reason and away from force.

title: Laborer, 18, Held in Death Of 2MonthOld Daughter
description: An 18yearold laborer was arrested last night on a charge of criminal negligencehomicide in connection with the death of his twomonthold daughter, who was dead on arrival at the emergency room of Greenpoint Hospital early yesterday.

title: Storm Grows in Caribbean
description: MIAMI, Nov. 14 (AP)Forecasters today said that the chances of tropical storm Laura becoming a hurricane were fairly high. The drenching storm in the Caribbean was given a name when its sustained winds reached the 45mileanhour level as it moved northwesterly toward Cuba. The storm tonight was near Lat. 17.7 degrees N., Long. 83.6 degrees W., or about 350 miles southwest of Havana.

title: BARRY HITS 41 POINTS AS NETS WIN, 130125
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14Rick Barry, who scored 40 points against the Floridians in Miami last night, registered 41 tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 130125 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors in an American Basketball Association game.

title: MRS. FRANK HANKINS
description: Mrs. Anna Keeling Hankins, widow of Dr. Frank H. Hankins, professor emeritus of sociology at Smith College, died yesterday in a nursing home in Stamford, Conn. She was 95 years old and lived here and in Redding, Conn.

title: B52'S RAID IN LAOS, CAMBODIA, VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 14 (Reuters)United States B52 bombers struck suspected enemy troop concentrations in Laos, Cambodia and Vietnam today. A United States spokesman said that no assessment report of the damage was immediately available.

title: A Period of Major Change Is in Store for Cable TV
description: News Analysis

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New A.H.A. President
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)Dr. J. Willis Hurst of Atlanta's Emory University School of Medicine will take office as president of the American Heart Association Tuesday. Dr. Paul N. Yu of the University of Rochester Medical Center will become the association's presidentelect.

title: Yale versus Those Mushy Vegetables
description: NEW HAVENThe stern, sober faces of former deans and famous alumni of Yale University still look down from the oakpaneled walls in Commons on hundreds of student diners.

title: P.S.C. to Rule on Con Ed Rate Increase
description: The state Public Service Commission hopes to act this week on its first rateincrease problem under Phase Two of President Nixon's wageprice control  a hitherto blocked Consolidated Edison gasrate increase here amounting to 12 per cent in terms of past revenues.

title: Chinese Delegates Watch Coolly From Their Hotel as Peking Flag Is Burned
description: Several hundred shouting, singing demonstrators burned a Chinese Communist flag yesterday and broke repeatedly, through police barriers across East 45th Street from the Roosevelt Hotel, where the delegation from Peking was preparing for its appearance at the United Nations today.

title: JABBAR GETS 46 IN BUCKS' VICTORY
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 14 (AP)  Kareem Jabbar scored 46 points, 18 in the fourth quarter, to spark the Milwaukee Bucks to a 125114 National Basketball Association victory over the Philadelphia 76ers tonight.

title: New Jewelry Castsa Backward Glance
description: Shop Talk

title: Mariner Sends Back Blurry Pictures
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 14Mariner 9 began its reconnaissance of Mars today with the return of the first television pictures taken from an orbit of the mysterious planet.

title: BASIC Organizes a Group To Work on Depository Plan
description: The Banking and Securities Industry Committee (BASIC) announced yesterday that it had organized an implementation group to work full time on developing a comprehensive securities depository system to help solve paperwork problems in Wall Street.

title: Doctors to Implant in Patients Device to Avert Heart Attacks
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 14Researchers from Baltimore are about to test on humans an implantable electronic device to detect and automatically correct derangements in heart rhythm that cause most sudden deaths from heart attacks.

title: MORE TOP AIDES SHIFTED AT F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 J. Edgar Hoover has appointed a new assistant to direct the investigative operations of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and has demoted the man who for the last year has headed the bureau's sensitive Domestic Intelligence Division.

title: Pakistan Says Six Captives Admit Indian Troop Role
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 14 The Pakistani radio asserted that six Indian soldiers who were captured in action yesterday near Dharmadaha in the Kushtia district of East Pakistan admitted today that regular Indian troops had been involved in attacks on East Pakistan's borders.

title: Vote Is 99.85%
description: BERLIN, Nov. 14 (Reuters)The candidates in the election today received 99.85 per cent of the valid votes cast, according to official provisional results.

title: 12 Million Balloting As East Germany Elects Legislators
description: BERLIN, Nov. 14Some 12 million East Germans cast ballots today to elect a new Volkskammer (Chamber of the People) and 15 district assemblies.

title: Spaniards Snap and Tap at Library Benefit
description: It's that time of year, when ethnic society, homesick for its native accents, gets together to whoop it up. A couple of weeks ago, the Scots threw themselves a ball and bagpipes screeched through the Plaza Hotel.

title: ChinaRwanda Ties
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 14 (Reuters)China and Rwanda established diplomatic relations at the ambassadorial level on Friday, the official press agency Hsinhua said today. The agreement was signed in Kigali, capital of Rwanda.

title: GREYHOUND UNION DELAYS WALKOUT
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 14 (UPI)A strike of Greyhound bus lines in 39 states was averted today when negotiators for the company the Amalgamated Transit Union agreed to continue their contract talks here, delaying a threatened walkout until Friday.

title: Corrupters of Youth
description: Reduction of the voting age to eighteen was a rational response to the frustrations of many young people who desired to help reform this country but who lacked legitimate voice. Such frustrations contributed to the creation of a large supporting force for the excesses an irresponsible fringe. Episodes of disruption and violence by young people, particularly students, were regularly followed by stern adult admonitions to youth work within the system.

title: China Said to Review Jailed American's Case
description: HONG KONG, Monday, Nov. 15 (AP)Authorities in China are reviewing the case of John Downey, an American serving a life sentence in Peking on charges of espionage, his mother said here after a twoweek visit in China.

title: 25% PRICE GUIDE DIMS STEEL HOPES
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14Steel producers were dismayed by last week's announcement of a 2.5 per cent guideline for price increases.

title: ROBERT C. JARVIS
description: BLOOMSBURY, N. J., Nov. 14 Robert C. Jarvis, a stage director and former musical comedy actor, died yesterday in the Teaneck Nursing Home. He was 79 years old.

title: 93 IN PEACE CORPS FACING DISMISSAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14A total of 93 of the Peace Corps' most senior and experienced administrators will be dismissed over the next several months as a result of a strict new interpretation by the director, Joseph H. Blatchford, of a regu lation known as the fiveyear rule.

title: Stokowski Excels in Wagner Concert
description: Leopold Stokowski, who by his own admission will be 90 in a few months, continues his spellbinding while the rest of us complain about our falling hair and rising blood pressure. The ageless Klingsor of the orchestra wove his magic once again yesterday afternoon, leading the American Symphony Orchestra in a magnificently theatrical Wagner program at Carnegie Hall. Vitality, style, sonority, atmosphere  name it, and this concert had it.

title: The Court Appointments
description: In recent years, the Senate has been loath to argue about the judicial philosophy of Supreme Court nominees. It has generally assumed in the absence of damaging evidence to the contrary that any nominee who is intellectually qualified, honest and experienced in some branch of the legal profession will cultivate the detachment and perspective which the task of judging requires. But inasmuch as President Nixon has to a far greater degree than normal politicized the process of selection and has so insistently proclaimed his determination to remake the Court in his own image, the Senate needs to recall that its traditional deference to Presidential nominations is an institutional courtesy rather than a constitutional command.

title: Southern Publishers Meet
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 14 (UPI)The 68th convention of the Southern Newspaper Publishers Association opened today. The meeting will run through Wednesday.

title: Jets Lose, Giants Win
description: The Jets lost, 1413, to the Baltimore Colts before a record crowd of 63,947 yesterday at Shea Stadium, The Giants scored in the last 31 seconds in Atlanta to defeat the Falcons, 2117. Details on Page 57.

title: BRITISH PLANNING BIGGER NATO FORCE
description: LONDON, Nov. 14  Britain has begun a defense program aimed at strengthening North Atlantic alliance forces.

title: DISCONTENT FOUND HIGH ON CAMPUSES
description: A report on the campus turmoil of May, 1970, warned yesterday that similar widespread student protests and disruption of education could easily occur again.

title: FRANCE CHECKING NARCOTICS REPORT
description: PARIS, Nov. 14The French Government acknowledged tonight that it was investigating the possibility that an unnamed official in the counterespionage service might be involved in the illicit narcotics traffic between France and the United States.

title: Building Unions Urged to Spur Outputl
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 14 The typical building tradesman shows up to work at 8:30 A.M., half an hour late. By 9 he's ready to decide what he wants to do, and at 10 he knocks off for a coffee break. At 11 it's time for a beer. Then there's lunch. On a typical day he puts in three hours' work.

title: SOVIET BY SEEK U.S. EXPORT CREDIT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14Soviet trade officials are expected to approach Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans later this month for American export credits to help finance American participation in a major truck factory here.

title: RANGERS TRIUMPH OVER CANUCKS, 61, EXTENDING STRING
description: Without a flawnot even while fightingthe Rangers made the willing but overmatched Vancouver Canucks their sixth straight victims last night with a 61 trouncing at Madison Square Garden.

title: CHIEFS WIN, 137; DAWSON IS SHARP
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 14Len Dawson, the Kansas City quarterback, had the aching elbow of his passing arm soaking in a galvanized bucket again today after the Chiefs had beaten the Cleveland Browns, 137, in one of the less memorable contests of the season.

title: 50 in Japan Are Hurt In Okinawa Protests
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14 (AP) Radical students went on a rampage of protests in Tokyo today against plans for a continued American military presence on Okinawa after the island's reversion to Japanese administrative control next year.

title: EIRIK GARONNE, 83, FRENCH DIPLOMAT
description: PARIS, Nov. 1 (AP)Eirik Labonne, a retired French ambassador, died here Friday. He was 83 years old.

title: Leafs Tie Flyers, 33
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14 (UPI)Norm Ullman's second goal late in the second period gave the Toronto Maple Leafs a 33 tie with the Philadelphia Flyers tonight.

title: Advertising:
description: Among the more interesting agency growth stories of this year has been what is happening at Rosenfeld, Sirowitz & Lawson, now billing at the rate of about $22million.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: CAPE TOWN, Nov. 14 (AP) Lindsay Rich, 61 years old, who received a transplanted heart yesterday, was reported making satisfactory progress today in Groote Schuur Hospital.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HOVHANESS SATURN HEARD IN PREMIERE
description: Alan Hovhaness has not been loafing during his 60 years. At a concert of his music given at Carnegie Recital Hall Saturday night, the work given its premiere was Opus 243. It is called Saturn, and it is a cycle of 12 pieces for clarinet, soprano and piano.

title: Rutgers President to Seek a Rapprochement With Legislature
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 14Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the new president of Rutgers, the State University, will drive to Trenton tomorrow to address an extraordinary, joint session of the New Jersey Legislature and shake rather than bite the hand that feeds the school.

title: Eisenhower's Widow Is 75
description: INDIAN WELLS, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)Mrs. Dwight D. Eisenhower quietly observed her 75th birthday today at the home of friends at the Eldorado Country Club.

title: Giants Win in Final Minute, 2117;
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 14  For sheer hard work and soulsatisfying result, the New York Giants will rarely surpass the 2117 victory they scored today over the Atlanta Falcons on Fran Tarkenton's touchdown with 31 seconds to play.

title: Welfare I: A Political Response
description: The expansion of the relief rolls has triggered an explosion of theories as to why it happened. We find none of them very convincing, for none account for the most striking characteristic of the relief risenamely, its extraordinary precipitousness.

title: Bridge: Scottish Writer Shows How To Employ Inferences of Play
description: Since his first book appeared here in 1967, a Scot named Hugh Kelsey has established himself as one of the world's great bridge writers. In his fourth book, Improve Your Bridge, published recently by Hart at $4.95, Kelsey is his usual incisive self. He crowds more sound advice into 191 pages than many pundits would do in double the space.

title: Carousel, Anyone? A 1928 Heirloom Offered for $80,000
description: Irving Rosenthal has the Christmas present for the man who has everything. Preferably a man in search of high camp or deep nostalgia.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Neuberger Sees Market Low by Yearend
description: Roy R. Neuberger, 68 years old, is the senior partner and founder of Neuberger & Berman, a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange. Mr. Neuberger, also a prominent art collector, began his stockmarket career in 1929 and over the years has developed his own successful approach to the art of investing. The other day he talked with Vartanig G. Vartan of The New York Times staff. Excerpts from their conversation follow:

title: MANY TRAINS LATE ON AMTRAK LINES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The National Railroad Passenger Corporation is no longer making a secret of the embarrassing record of lateness of its Amtrak trains.

title: Argonauts Triumph, 238
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, Nov. 14 (UPI)The Toronto Argonauts combined tough defense, a big play by Joe Theismann and some errant fieldgoal kicking by Hamilton's Tommy Joe Coffey today to score a 238 victory over the TigerCats.

title: Woman,65, Mugged In Baruch Houses On Lower East Side
description: A woman resident of the Baruch Houses, where the death of another woman in a robbery attempt last week led to steppedup police patrols, was mugged in a hallway of the Lower East Side housing project yesterday.

title: Canada Seeks Assurances U.S. Surtax Is Temporary
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 14  The unease that has afflicted Canadian life and politics since President Nixon's disturbing economic program was inaugurated three months ago, was aroused anew last week by the first snow of the year and the publication of a mixed report on inflation and unemployment.

title: Christmas Deadline Friday For Some Mail for Military
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI)The first deadline is next Friday for those who want to take advantage of bargain postal rates for mailing Christmas presents to servicemen overseas.

title: In U.S. 5 Years, Lonely Vietnamese General Awaits Call Home
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 In South Vietnam he lived in an elegant French colonial villa, commanded thousands of troops and administered the five northern provinces as a personal fief.

title: Now, if Muskie Were a '72 Candidate...
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie, who said that he was not a candidate for President but told what he would do if he were, came to New York yesterday to talk about making government work better and wound up discussing Vietnam, Social Security, politics, Ireland and Mayor Lindsay.

title: PLANS REVEALED BY MRS. CHISHOLM
description: ALBANY, Nov. 14  Representative Shirley Chisholm told a women's political conference here today that she would carry her campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination to primary contests in North Carolina and Florida as well as several other states.

title: TAXIUNION GROUP POTESTS BALLOT
description: A group of dissidents in the New York City Taxi Drivers Union charged yesterday that supporters of Harry Van Arsdale Jr., the union's president, had conducted a dishonest election.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Would it not be a timely masterstroke in world diplomacy if the vital yet troublesome Suez and Panama Canals could revert to the peoples of the earth through United Nations trusteeship? The U.N. might thereby more effectively than heretoforebuffer tensions, deter naval war, promote commerce and earn desperately needed revenue.

title: Bishop Raymond Hillinger Of Chicago Archdiocese
description: GLENVIEW, Ill., Nov. 14 (AP) The Most Rev. Raymond P. Hillinger, auxiliary bishop of Chicago and vicar general of the Chicago Archdiocese, died here yesterday at the age of 67.

title: Program of Songs By Seals & Crofts Expands Its Range
description: It has taken them a while, but Jim Seals and Dash Crofts Seals & Croftsare finally hitting their stride.

title: EMPIRE STATE OIL STUDYING 2 OFFERS
description: The Empire State Oil Company, whose stock is 55 per cent owned by Husky Oil, Ltd., announced over the weekend proposed offers from American Petrofina, Inc., and the Tesoro Petroleum Corporation for the purchase of Empire's assets.

title: Jerilyn Ross Wed To Gerald Kaplan
description: Miss Jerilyn Ross was married yesterday afternoon to Gerald W. Kaplan. Rabbi Ezra Gellman performed the ceremony at Temple Shaare Zion in Brooklyn.

title: Manager Prefers Not to Own Restaurant
description: Small Business

title: Kosygin's Assailant Elected
description: TORONTO, Nov. 14 (Canadian Press)Geza Matrai, a 27yearold Hungarian immigrant, charged with assaulting Premier Ale?? N. Nasygin of the Soviett Uninn during his visit here last month, was elected secretar gmerill at the Hungarian ?? of Canada ?? an hail.

title: Lucas Shoulders FullTime Role As Knicks' Temporary Center
description: If Jerry Lucas is the Lucas of old....

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: To speak of New York as Fun City and of its future progress is sheer nonsense as long as this city is dominated by fear.

title: Paolano Wins in Wrestling
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., Nov. 15 (AP)The first Colgate open wrestling championships yesterday produced only one pin in the championship matches, as Vince Paolano of the New York Athletic Club won the heavyweight title by pinning Doug Smith of West Dryden at 5:18 of the match.

title: National Forests: Timber Men vs. Conservationists
description: The custodians of the national forests are coming under increasingly intense crosspressures from rival blocs in the struggle over the future of the vast woodland preserves.

title: Books of The Times
description: Revenge of the Lawn: Stories 19621970, by Richard Brautigan, 174 pages, Simon & senator, $5,95.

title: Hawks Beat Seals, 41
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14 (UPI)The Chicago Black Hawks burned the rookie netminder, Jilles Meloche, for four secondperiod goals tonight to gain a 41 victory over the California Golden Seals and run their season record at home to seven victories without a loss.

title: Petty Takes Richmond Race And Clinches NASCAR Title
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 14 (UPI)Richard Petty, the top moneywinner on the NASCAR Grand National circuit, outraced Bobby Allison today and won the Capital City 500 at the Virginia State Fairgrounds.

title: Castro Is Impressed on Visit to Copper Mine in Chile
description: CHUQUICAMATA, Chile, Nov. 14Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba today toured the world's largest openpit copper mine, nationalized in July, and said it was one of the most impressive things I've seen in my life.

title: Muskie Ahead of Kennedy In a Survey, 50% to 39
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 14 (AP)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine now leads Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts as the choice of Democratic voters for the 1972 Presidential nomination, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Suns Gain 3d Place
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 14 (AP)The Phoenix Suns moved into third place in the Midwest Division tonight with a 119105 triumph over the Cleveland Cavaliers. Phoenix took the lead in the second quarter and was never headed.

title: Western Europe in Search of a Policy
description: This is excerpted from The Economist of London.

title: A Big Dust Storm on Mars Is a Puzzle
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 14  Mars has greeted its first longterni visitor with perhaps the most dramatic and perplexing planetary display ever observed from earth.

title: Lady Fleming Is Deported From Greece to England
description: ATHENS, Nov. 14  Lady Fleming, who was convicted in September of having taken part in an unsuccessful plot to free the wouldbe assassin of the Premier, was stripped of her Greek citizenship and forced to board a Londonbound plane at Athens airport today.

title: BOMBERS ON TOP IN ROLLER DERBY
description: The 14,003 fans who visited Madison Square Garden yesterday afternoon for the Roller Derby game between the Chiefs and the San Francisco Bay Bombers saw all they expected to see except a happy ending for the hometown Chiefs. The Bombers scored suddendeath triumph, 3938.

title: Critical Test for Phase Two
description: The credibility of Phase Two wageprice controls has been put to the test at the very outset by the inflationary strike settlement in coal and by the Cost of Living Council's inexplicable upset of a brand new price rule.

title: Recipe for a Happy Crowd: Mix 1 Simon and 1 Nichols
description: Neil (Doc) Simon and Mike Nichols are together again with The Prisoner of Second Avenue. Testifying to the fruitfulness of the collaboration, there are long lines outside the Eugene O'Neill Theater (Neil Simon, prop.), and loud laughter inside.

title: Health Insurance Protection Act Found Deficient by Civic Group
description: The Citizens Committee for Children of New York charged yesterday that the state's new Health Insurance Consumer Protection Act, adopted this year to promote public understanding of insurance policies, may become another hoax on consumers.

title: KIDNEY FAILURE KILLS HEART PUMP PATIENT
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14 (UPI)Haskell Shanks, who received a permanently implanted mechanical heart pump Aug. 11, died today at Sinai Hospital of complications stemming from kidney failure, the hospital announced.

title: Learning to Love the Police
description: LONDONWe need the police today, more than ever before because our moral values are being eroded by change and the conflicts between economic, generational and racial groups have come to the surface. Men not only fail to regulate themselves and each other; they are often angry and violent. This leaves public order to the police. It is their primary task and only they have the powers to maintain it.

title: Pound'slAct Opera On Francois Villon Has U. S. Premiere
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 14Le Testament, the opera by Ezra Pound, the poet, was presented here last night in its premiere American performance and its first performance anywhere in the original form as orchestrated by Pound and George Antheil.

title: Chileans Meet Brezhnev
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14 (Reuters) The Soviet Communist party chief, Leonid I. Brezhnev, today received a delegation of Chilean Communists for talks on matters of mutual interest and on widening links between the Communist parties of the two countries, Tass, the Soviet press agency reported.

title: Nicklaus and U.S. Are Big Victors in World Cup
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 14Jack Nicklaus and Lee Trevino, rivals on the pro tour, completed a golfing partnership today by winning the World Cup tourney by 12 strokes.

title: Mexico Hopes for Exports to Red China
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 14Struggling with a $1billion trade deficit, Mexico is now looking to China as a potentially important market for its exports.

title: She Plans Political Campaign
description: LONDON, Nov. 14Lady Fleming said at a news conference shortly after arriving at London's Heathrow Airport that she would start a vigorous political campaign against the Greek Government.

title: Canadiens and Sabres Tie
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 14 (UFI)Marc Tardif banged in a 15footer after a faceoff with 1:53 left tonight to give the Montreal Canadiens a 22 tie with the Buffalo Sabres.

title: Guardsmen Begin Community Projects
description: It's a perfect marriage, the National Guard company commander said. The city doesn't have the money to fix up the park, and my engineers need as much practical experience as possible.

title: Saturday Review Will Expand By Starting Four Monthlies
description: Four months after coming under new ownership, the Saturday Review has taken steps to expand its operations by starting four monthlies, a book club and a book publishing enterprise bearing its own imprint.

title: Costikyan Finds Retirement Still Puts Him on Firing Line
description: The Talk of New York

title: U.S. STEEL ACCUSED BY POLLUTION BOARD
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14  The Allegheny County Air Pollution Appeals Board has accused the United States Steel Corporation of corporate irresponsibility in refusing to meet air and water pollution standards at its Clairton, Pa., coke works, near here.

title: Orr Scores 3 Goals, Esposito 2 As Bruins Trounce Kings, 112
description: BOSTON, Nov. 15 (UPT) Phil Esposito scored two goals within 49 seconds in the first period tonight and Bobby Orr scored three to lead the Boston Bruins to a 112 rout of the Los Angeles Kings.

title: Chrome Imports Sought
description: Stainless steel and other specialty steel manufacturers in the United States welcomed last week's Congressional action that appeared to pave the way for the eventual resumption of chrome ore imports from Rhodesia.

title: U.S. AND CHINA SET 2TIER CONTACTS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14A system of shuttle dipldmacy for quiet contacts between visiting White House officials and Chinese diplomats at the United Nations on matters directly involving Washington and Peking has been set up here in recent days.

title: Vacancies on Local School Boards Persist
description: Residents of some of New York City's decentralized school districts are finding that it can be more difficult to fill a vacancy on their community school boards than it was to elect the boards in the first place.

title: DEFICIT REPORTED BY OCCIDENTAL OIL
description: Sharply lower earnings for the third quarter and first nine months this year were reported over the weekend by the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, as indicated in a preliminary estimate last month.

title: Cocaine Is Reemerging as a Major Problem, While Marijuana Remains Popular
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Cocaine Lil, whose ballad hasn't been heard much during the last 40 years, seems to be making a comeback.

title: Britain's Peerless Negotiator
description: Man in the News

title: Study of Hartford Food Prices Finds Compliance With Freeze
description: A general pattern of voluntary compliance with the price freeze by the largest chain supermarkets around Hartford is shown in an analysis by The New York Times of 3,638 retail food prices for meat, dairy products and for freezeexempt fruits and vegetables.

title: John Lavalle, Portrait Painter And Landscape Artist, Dead
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Nov. 14 John Lavalle, portrait painter and landscape artist of New York and Southampton, died yesterday in Southampton Hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: S. I. Ferry Mishap Hurts 20
description: Twenty persons suffered minor injuries yesterday when a Staten Island ferryboat slammed into a slip piling while docking at the St. George terminal, the police reported. The 20, who were among about 1,000 aboard The Cornelius Koiff, were taken to two Staten Island hospitals

title: Article 1  No Title
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 14 (AP)Three Pakistani jet fighters violated Indian air space today over the northern state of Kashmir, United News of India reported.

title: Chess: U.S.S.R.'s Alla Kushnir Wins Women's Candidates' Match
description: Alla Kushnir won the recently concluded women's candidates' match against Maria Satulovska by the score of 5 to 4. Miss Kushnir will now play compatriot Nona Alexandria in the finals of the candidates' series for the right to challenge the reigning women's world champion, Nona Gaprindishvili, also a Russian, for the title.

title: Light on Mars
description: Anyone who looks at Mars only with the naked eye sees merely a bright red dot. When telescopes began to be turned on Mars some three centuries ago, that red gleam was expanded into a miniature sphere with strange light and dark markings as well as whitecapped polar areas. But even the most powerful earthbased telescopes cannot reveal any really significant detail the Martian surface. Hence it is not surprising that less than a decade ago there were still some who argued that canals existed on Mars and these implied the presence at one time of intelligent beings on that planet. Mars, it was widely believed, is very similar to earth.

title: Israel Shaken by Scandal At Oil Fields in the Sinai
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 14A major economic scandal has lifted the shroud of secrecy from the story of oil and mineral exploitation in the Sinai Peninsula during the last four and a half years of Israeli occupation.

title: Personal Finance: Cash Flow Plan
description: There was a time when the words cash flow were mostly used by stock market analysts in describing the financial position of companies. First National City Bank thinks the cash flow approach can help individuals as well.

title: Gains by Oman Reported in Drive Against Rebels
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 14Ground and air forces of Sultan Qabus bin Said of Oman have reportedly scored victories in the offensive they have been conducting since early this month against the Marxist rebels in the rocky southern desert of Dhofar, but there have, been heavy casualties on both sides.

title: JOHN NALLEY, EXPERT ON SOUTHEAST ASIA
description: John A. Nalley, an expert on Southeast Asia with the State Department, who formerly headed the Indonesia section of the Voice of America, died Saturday apparently of an abdominal infection. He was 54 years old and lived here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Voice of America Will Aim A Program at Soviet Jews
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Apparently in response to Congressional pressure, the Voice of America has decided to broadcast a special program twice a week aimed specifically at the three million Jews in the Soviet Union.

title: Strike in Catholic Schools Is Voted by Teachers Here
description: The Federation of Catholic Teachers voted yesterday to strike the 329 parochial schools in the Archdiocese of New York next Monday unless the deadlocked negotiations on a new contract were resolved.

title: Laird Says South Vietnam Can Handle Any Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today he would do whatever is needed and necessary to protect diminished United States forces in South Vietnam in case of another enemy offensive. But he said he believed the South Vietnamese could handle any such assault.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDONThe problem now troubling American liberals in the nomination of William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court was foreseen years ago by Judge Learned Hand. In his Holmes Lectures at Harvard ho said:

title: Union Pacific Railroad Co. Shows Decline in Earnings
Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) The Pentagon today acknowledged existence of the Rand Corporation report, but said that there was only one copy and that it was at United States headquarters in Saigon. A spokesman said the report's author had not been commissioned by the Defense Department but acted on his own in preparing the study. Officials refused to comment further.

title: Welfare II: Let the Rolls Rise
description: Monstrous, outrageous, and consuming; the cause of the urban fiscal crisis; destroyer of the virtues of work and family lifethese are the charges launched daily against the welfare system by reformers going forth to do battle. The charges are familiar ones. Since the inception of public relief three centuries ago, the system has always been branded monstrous whenever a large number of destitute families got aid. Moreover, these charges, and the reforms they presaged, have always boded ill for the poor.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these short term securities.

title: More Drama Than Impact Seen in Antidrug Work
description: Dramatic material worthy of The French Connection, the fastpaced cienmatic tale of the cracking of a heroinsmuggling ring, has been the stuff of real news in the last few days.

title: 2 Negroes From Phoenix, Ariz., Say Rehnquist Harassed Blacks at Polls in 1964
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  Two Phoenix, Ariz., men have charged in sworn affidavits that William H. Rehnquist, one of President Nixon's Supreme Court nominees, harassed Negro voters at a predominantly black Phoenix precinct In 1964.

title: Kretchmer Shifts Back to Incinerators
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Protection Administrator, said yesterday that as a result of a sixday visit to Japan he had switched back to relying on incinerators as means of handling the city's garbage problem.

title: TRIAL OF PERSICO CLOSED TO PUBLIC
description: Supreme Court Justice George, Postel, in a highly unusual action, barred the press and the public yesterday from the remainder of a trial of extortion. coercion, criminal usury and conspiracy charges against Carmine J. Persico in an alleged loanshark operation. The trial, was in its fifth day.

title: Rutgers Head Tells Legislature Of Need for Rise in State Funds
description: TRENTON, Nov. 15  Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the newly Inaugurated 17th president of Rutgers, the state university, told a joint session of the New Jersey Legislature today it would have to increase appropriations if the university was to meet the sttae's educational needs.

title: Butler Aviation Sees Conflict Of Interest in Proxy Battle
description: Butler Aviation International, Inc., told its stockholders yesterday that a monumental conflict of interest is involved in a proxy battle for control of the company started by its former president and chairman, Paul S. Dopp.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: A Blast From Past
description: EAST CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 15 Dick Brennan, an antiquegun enthusiast, has the distinction of having enjoyed his shortest hunting season in New Hampshire. It lasted 15 minutes.

title: THOMAS O'CONNELL, EXPOLICE CAPTAIN
description: Capt. Thomas J. O'Connell, who retired from the Police Department in 1968 after a career of 32 years, died Saturday night at his home, 1495 Shore Drive, the Bronx. He was 65 years old.

title: Guerrilla Killed, Israel Says
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 15  Israeli military headquarters said today that an Arab guerrilla it had sought was shot and killed today in a hospital in Gaza after he had shot and wounded an Israeli policeman searching for him in the hospital,

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON POVERTY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) SenateHouse conferees reached final agreement today on a $6billion bill extending the antipoverty program two more years and containing a broad new childcare provision.

title: ItalianAmerican Satellite
description: MALINDI, Kenya, Nov. 15 (AP)  Italian and Amerioan scientists launched a satellite off the coast of Kenya today, to probe the earth's magnetosphere. The 114pound satellite, atop the United States Scout rocket, was lofted frim the Italian Government's launching platform in Formosa bay off Malindi.

title: Rail Mergers Cited
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) The Supreme Court acted today to protect railroad workers swept up in mergers by giving the Interstate Commerce Commission broad authority to look after them.

title: U.S.L.T.A. Will Offer Plan On Ending Tennis Dispute
description: Faced wtih increasing pressure from both sides of the net, top officials of the United States Lawn Tennis Association huddled here yesterday to seek a formula that would preserve open tennis for next year.

title: Bridge: Tournament Newcomer Tops Experts in Charity Contest
description: A player competing in his first tournament topped a field containing a galaxy of international stars in a major charity event played Saturday in Chicago. Fifty two players competed in an individual championship, a rarely played contest, and the Foundation for Hearing and Speech Rehabilitation benefited to the extent of some $20,000.

title: Politics Is Headache to the Maharani, but She Accepts the Pain
description: When she first stood for Parliament, rich, highborn Gayatri Devi, the Maharani of Jaipur, dutifully campaigned in the rank bazaars and dusty villages, allowed herself to be pelted with marigolds, although they made her sneeze, and grimly submitted to such ritualistic welcomes as having her mouth stuffed with sweetmeats seven times in succession.

title: Indians Open Reno Conference; UrbanReservation Rift at Issue
description: RENO, Nov. 15The National Congress of American Indians opened its 28th annual convention today hoping to heal a critical rift between reservation Indians and urban Indians and exhibiting a mild disillusionment over the Great White Father in Washington.

title: Barney Greenwald All the Way
description: Books of The Times

title: ABRAHAM M. DAVIS, LAWYER, DIES AT 88
description: Abraham M. Davis, a founding partner of the law firm of Davis, Gilbert, Levine & Schwartz, died Saturday in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 88 years old and lived at 365 West End Avenue.

title: John Lamont, Former Editor At Rinehart, Is Dead at 66
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L. I., Nov. 15John S. Lamont, who retired 15 years ago as executive editor of Rinehart & Co., book publishers, died today in Eastern Long Island Hospital in Greenport. He was 66 years old and lived here.

title: PANTHEON TO ISSUE 2 SARTRE VOLUMES
description: The first two volumes of JeanPaul Sartre's The Family Idiot: Gustave Flaubert From 1821 to 1857 will be published in translation here by Pantheon Books, Andr Schiffrin, its managing director, announced yesyesterday.

title: DANE, AD MAN, FETED BY LIBERTIES UNION
description: About 700 persons attended the 1971 dinner of the New York Civil Liberties Union last night in the Pierre Hotel to pay tribute to Maxwell Dane, an advertising executive, for many years of service with the organization. Mr. Dane has just retired as senior officer of Doyle Dane Bernbach.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC DECLINE
description: Prices again went mostly downward yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market in slower trading.

title: CHARGERS VICTORS AS TIME RUNS OUT
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 15 (AP) Dennis Partee kicked a 45yard field goal as time ran out and the San Diego Chargers beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 2017, tonight in a nationally televised game.

title: Black Miners Flock to South Africa
description: EVANDER South Africa, Nov. 10  Don't believe what you read and hear about us overseas, the mining official told a group of foreign visitors.

title: Soviet Bids Pakistan Revive India Ties
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 15 The Soviet Union today backed up reported shipments of arms to India with an appeal to Pakistan to seek the restoration of goodneighborly relations with India in the interest of international security.

title: Fund for Neediest Received A Record $ 1Million in 197071
description: The final accounting of the 197071 appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund showed yesterday that a total of $1,055,877.91 was received from 14,988 donors.

title: Screams of Killer Whales Used to Save Porpoises
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 15  If an experiment that begins tomorrow evening is successful, the taperecorded screams of killer whales may save some species of porpoise from extinction.

title: Nixon's Choice for Agriculture Secretary Charges That the Opposition to His Nomination Is Political
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Dr. Earl L. Butz of Purdue Univer sity, President Nixon's choice as the new Secretary of Agricul ture said today that he was prepared to defend his record against charges that he favored big business over farmers.

title: SUIT AIMS TO VOID MAIN STATE BILLS
description: Charging that Governor Rockefeller was unconstitutionally acting as a oneman Legislature, the New York Civil Liberties Union brought a suit yesterday in State Supreme Court here that seeks to nullify most of the major bills passed during the 1971 Legislature.

title: 9 Per Cent G.N.P. Rise Is Forecast for Next Year
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 15 (UPI) The United States gross national product probably will rise 9 per cent next year to $1.14trillion, Murray L. Weldenbaum, a former Assistant Secretary of the Treasury, predicted tonight.

title: U. S. Aide Cites Dangers of Payments Gap
description: A senior State Department official warned here yesterday that forces of protectionism in this country would become irresistible if the United States continued to have large payments deficits.

title: City (High) Life
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  All the family was gathered around the blazing fireplace celebrating the end of Phase One (alias The Freeze) and dreaming of the new consumption we would all enjoy now that Phase Two was upon us and the freeze had given way to devil take the hindmost.

title: Theater:
description: BUFFALO  The Studio Arena Theater, an exceptionally pleasant theater, incidentally, has built itself a reputation for producing new American plays. It was here, for instance, that Edward Albee's experimental BoxMaoBox started, and now the theater is giving a new play by Lawrence Roman called Buying Out.

title: Phase Two: Who Needs What?
description: While there are substantial differences of opinion as to whether medical care and general health services in America are as good as, or better than they are elsewhere in the world, there is general agreement that financing such care grows increasingly difficult for more and more millions of Americans.

title: ForeignFund Curb Opposed in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 15At last half of the premiers of Canada's 10 provinces vigorously oppose the proposal advanced this weekend that the Federal Government take steps to limit foreign investment in Canadian development.

title: Parley on Turtle Killing Set
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., Nov. 15 (UPI)Dr. Warren Thomas, director of the Gladys Porter Zoo, said today that he would meet with Interior Department officials Nov. 30 to discuss the slaughter of harmless sea turtles by the thousands for the hide off their flippers.

title: U.S. DENIES REPORT ON CHINA RELATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The White House denied today that it would conduct quiet shuttle diplomacy with Chinese diplomats at the United Nations on matters directly involving Washington and Peking.

title: U.N. Unit Asks Rigid Curb On Arms for South Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 15A General Assembly committee voted 87 to 1 today for a more rigid embargo on shipment of arms to South Africa.

title: CONCERTS TO AID LIBRARY ON ARTS
description: The Research Library of the Performing Arts of the New York Public Library at Lincoln Center announced yesterday a series of five Nine O'Clock Crisis Concerts to raise funds to keep its arts research collections from closing after Jan. 1, 1972.

title: Daughter of Gunbow Sold For $107,000 at Keeneland
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 15 (UPI)  A total of 127 head brought $1,395,600 today at the opening session of the 28th annual Keeneland fall breeding stock sale.

title: The Right to Open Trial A Legacy of English Law
description: The right to a public trial started in England centuries ago, a reaction, some say, to the terrors of the Star Chamber, and it came to the colonies as part of the common law. It was written into the Bill of Rights, and thereafter into the constitutions or statute books of nearly every American state.

title: REP. ALBERT HITS TRADE SURCHARGE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 15 Calling the Administration's new economic policy heavy handed, Carl Albert, the Speaker of the House, declared today that the surcharge on imports may blow up in our faces and set off a trade war.

title: Prices Here Lack Apparent Pattern As Phase 2 Begins
description: A New York Times survey of supermarkets and other stores in the metropolitan area showed prices moving up and down yesterday, as they have throughout the freeze  with little discernible pattern.

title: A George Crumb Work Bows, And No Tone Is Left Unturned
description: George Crumb writes personal, strange and yet deeply affecting music. Consider his Black Angels, for amplified or, as he puts it, electricstring quartet. Dated 1970 and subtitled Thirteen Images from the Dark Land, the grim but poetic work was given its first New York performance Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall by the Bowling Green String Quartet.

title: Transcript of Court Proceeding in Which Press Was Barred
Gershwin Years A Nostalgic Trip To 40 Years Ago
description: Fortyone years and one month, to the day, after Girl Crazy opened at the Alvin Theater on Oct. 14, 1930, Ethel Merman and Ginger Rogers were on a New York stage again, singing some of the songs they sang at that openingBut Not For Me, Embraceable You and I Got Rhythm. And Benny Goodman, who played in Red Nichols's pit band then, was leading his current sextet through George Gershwin tunes from other Broadway musicals.

title: U.S. Indicts French Agent As Leader in Heroin Plot
description: NEWARK, Nov. 15 A Federal grand jury here today indicted a top French counterespionage official and a man described as one of his former aides on charges of conspiringto smuggle S12million in heroin into this country in a Volkswagen camper.

title: Conditions of Soviet Jews
description: Richard T. Davies, Deputy Assistant Secretary for European Affairs, may have intended with his testimony to a House Foreign Affairs subcommittee [news story Nov. 10] to take the sharp edges off Jewish protests in order to facilitate President Nixon's forthcoming discussions in Moscow. If so, I am confident that President Nixon would not approve of such tactics, knowing from my own experience that his interventions for Soviet Jews go back at least to Mr. Kosygin's visit to the U.S. in 1959, at which time I was secretary of the Presidents' Conference of Major Jewish Organizations and had contact with the Vice President's office on this subject.

title: Morales Defeats Blassie
description: Pedro Morales defeated Fred Blassie last night in a wrestling exhibition at Madison Square Garden before 22,089 fans. Terry Terranova, the referee, stopped the match at 8:22. Vic Rivera and Indian Jay Strongbow beat Tarzan Tyler and Duke Graham in a tagteam match.

title: Division Leads at Stake In 3 Games Next Sunday
description: First place will be at stake in three money games for pro football on Sunday, with a second placenot far from firstinvolved in a fourth. In Washington, the Dallas Cowboys, with two straight victories behind them and a new resolve, take on the sagging, injured Redskins, wholead them by half a game in the Eastern Division of the National Conference. In Baltimore, theColts meet the Dolphins, whom they trail by half game for the Eastern Division lead in the American Conference. This is the first of two MiamiBaltimore confrontations and the Colt players feel they must win both to take the division title.

title: Wesley W. Stout Is Dead at 82; Edited Saturday Evening Post
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 15 (AP)  Wesley Winans Stout, a former editor of The Saturday Evening Post, died here yesterday at the age of 82.

title: Louisiana Man Freed In Extradition Here
description: A 35yearold man sentenced to 50 years in prison in Louisiana for selling $5 worth of marijuana in 1967 will be freed from the Queens House of Detention today or tomorrow, according to a spokesman for Governor Rockefeller.

title: A Witness at Bribery Trial Testifies of Plan to Share $100,000
description: A witness testified yesterday that an admitted briber had indicated that $100,000 for the quashing of stockfraud indictments would he paid to Senator Hiram L. Fong and members of the Justice Department.

title: Nov. 110 Car. Sales Above 1970 bat Off From October Rise
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15 (UPI) Auto sales, spurred to a record endofOctober pace by the price freeze and the promised repeal of the Federal excise tax, slacked off in the first 10 days of November but were up. from the comparable 1970 period, sales figures showed today.

title: IN THE NATION
