description: President Nixon is looking strong Politically these days, with Phase Two of his new economic policy in effect and with a faster rate of withdrawal from Vietnam winning headlines. That seems to put him on top of two of the three big issuesMr. Nixon's personality is the otherwith which the Democrats might defeat him next year.

title: Saigon Asking Support for Reforms
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 15The South Vietnamese Government began an intense effort this evening to enlist public support and to offset the expected public outcry against a rise in prices expected as a result of economic reforms announced early today.

title: PENNSY TO SELL 6 REALTY UNITS
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company announced yesterday their intention to sell six of 24 major realty parcels the railroad owns in the Grand Central Terminal area for a total of $59,548,462. Each of the sales is subject to approval of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia.

title: Now or Never
description: It is hard to remember a bill which has come to the floor under more complicated parliamentary circumstances than the campaign finance reform bill, now scheduled for House action tomorrow. Yet if a new law on this subject is to become effective in the 1972 political strugglealready in its beginning stagethen a responsible decision by the House is imperative.

title: Leadership at the Exchange
description: In announcing that he would not seek reappointment as president of the New York Stock Exchange, Robert W. Haack has forced Wall Street to decide whether it wants to set its own house in order or whether it wants the job to be doneif it can be donefrom the outside.

title: Rand Chief Quitting
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Nov. 15 Henry S. Rowen resigned as president of the Rand Corporation today, and well  informed sources, said his departure had been caused partly by Pentagon dissatisfaction with Rand's role in the release of the Pentagon papers.

title: Disguised Policemen Become Part of Street Scene in Garment District
description: Fifteen men and one woman slunk, stumbled, hobbled and shuffled out of the 14th Precinct station at 357 West 35th Street yesterday morning and disappeared into the crowds of the garment district.

title: ISRAEL ENDS A CURB IN LAVON SPY AFFAIR
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 15The Israeli press has finally won lifting of the ban on the personal strories of intelligence agents who participated in a mysterious sabotage mission inside Egypt in 1954.

title: Big U.S. Troop Cuts Seen In Vietnam by End of June
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  Nixon Administration sources said today that Gen. Creighton W. Abrams had been directed to plan on a tentative force reduction of 130,000 to 155,000 men in Vietnam by next June 30. That would mean that the American force would be down to 30,000 to 55,000 men by midsummer.

title: SANDRA WASHINGTON EXCELS IN CANTATA
description: Opening a program with Bach's florid Jauchzet Gott takes a good deal of nerve, but Sandra Washington met the challenge unflinchingly in Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night. The six accompanying instrumentalists came to grief here and there, but Miss Washington's silvery soprano and precisely articulated coloratura never faltered.

title: Drawing Class at Tombs Eases PentUp Emotions
description: He was not so much a model prisoner, as a prisoner model, the thin man with one foot on the stage, one foot on a chair and his chin cupped in a large hand.

title: Film: 'Magic of the Kite' for Children
description: "The Magic of the Kite," second in a series of children's movies being presented by the Xerox Corporation, is good for youngsters up to about 11 years of age. The film was shown at matinees at neighborhood theaters over the weekend in Brooklyn, Queens, Nassau and Suffolk Counties and will shift to New Jersey theaters Saturday and Sunday, then come to Manhattan and the Bronx on Nov. 27 and 28.This is a genuinely diverting offering for the small fry, with some built-in surprises. For one thing, it is a rare co-production of Paris and Peking moviemakers, intermingling locales and young performers of both countries. Thanks to some excellent English dubbing, the French youngsters sound like real, apple-pie children down the block, which gives the picture a cozy, American stamp. A pretty Peking girl serves as an English interpreter in the Chinese sequences.With exquisite timing, the film has arrived on the heels of the United Nations team from Peking. But with all due respect, it would be hard to find more disarming goodwill ambassadors than the Chinese youngsters who initiate the other children to Peking sights and customs in the last half of the picture. And of course this film is in color, sauced by a sprightly musical score.In the first half of the movie, the Montmartre youngsters find a derelict Oriental kite, set aloft by a Peking boy with a friendly message and address. A dream transports one boy and his little sister abroad in quest of the sender.Wisely and smoothly pitched to the level of young audiences, with no icky-poo cuteness, the story ends with nice plea for international harmony, as exemplified by childhood playmates. Chief credit should go to Roger pigaut, that fine French actor, who plloted the project as director and co-screen-writer from his original story. All that matters is that young audiences are sure to like the movie. And it should make faraway Peking seem closer to everybody.

title: More Americans Withdrawn
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 15 (UPI) The United States command announced today that 2,800 more Americans were withdrawn from South Vietnam last week, reducing the authorized troop strength to 188,300 as of last Thursday. This is the lowest level since December, 1965, when there were 184,300 United States servicemen in the country.

title: MOVE TO EASE SALE OF BULLETS DELAYED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 Sponsors of a bill to relax regulation of certain gun ammunition abruptly abandoned plans for a House vote today.

title: Van Arsdale Is Winner In Taxi Union Election
description: Harry Van Arsdale Jr., was reelected head of the TaxiDrivers Union Local 3036 in voting last week, officials of the United States Department of Labor said last night.

title: An American Wine Rarer Than Most French Ones
description: What may well be one of the most unusual wines produced in this country in many years; is coming on the local market this week in extremely small quantities, So small, in fact, that the local distributors, 21 Brands, Inc., say they fear they make more enemies than friends when they parcel out their allotment.

title: Jerome Kessler, Lawyer And Bar Official in Jersey
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 15Jerome L. Kessler, a Newark lawyer and past president of the criminal law section of the New Jersey Bar Association, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 60 White Oak Drive. He was 55 years old.

title: Tentative Accord Reported At Greyhound Bus Lines
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 15 (AP)  Sources reported today that tentative agreement had been reached on salaries and pensions in negotiations between Greyhound Bus Lines and the Amalgamated Transit Union.

title: NIXON INTERVENES TO BLOCK AID HALT
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 15  President Nixon intervened personally with Congressional leaders today in an effort to rescue the foreign aid program in the five of the scheduled expiration of spending authority at midnight. Senate action was promised later in the week.

title: Canadian Seeks to Join Suit on Alaska Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15A member of the Canadian Parliament and the Canadian Wildlife Federation petitioned the United States District Court here to be allowed to intervene in suit aimed at halting construction of the transAlaska oil pipeline.

title: Remarks Greeting Chinese
description: The United States joins in welcoming to the United Nations the representatives of the People's Republic of China, Vice Foreign Minister Chiao, Ambassadur Huang and their colleagues.

title: THICK DUST SHOWN IN STORM ON MARS
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 15 Preliminary data from the Marsorbiting Mariner 9 provided scientists today with evidence that the planet's thin, stormwhipped atmosphere is apparently thick with dust of fairly coarsegrained, sandlike particles.

title: U.N. Rebuke for the U.S.
description: A United Nations General Assembly committee has voted overwhelmingly to censure actions in the United States Congress that would violate the sanctions imposed by the Security Council against the white racist regime in Rhodesia. Only the dimension of the vote93 to 2 with 12 abstentionswas a surprise. It was one of the most crushing defeats suffered by the United States the 26year history of the United Nations.

title: Text of Policy Statement by Chinese Delegate Before General Assembly of U.N.
Filion Gets 9 Winners Lifting '71 Total to 447
description: YONKERS, Nov. 15Herve Filion, the 31yearold driver from Angers, Que., had his best day in 18 years of driving today with nine winners. He had five winners at Freehold, N. J. in the afternoon and added four tonight at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Avco Sets Sales of Unit
description: The consummation of the sale by Avco Corporation of its Bay State Abrasives Division to Dresser Industries, Inc. was announced yesterday.

title: POLITICS RACKING CHILE UNIVERSITY
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 15 A political fight on national party lines is tearing apart the University of Chile, this country's principal institution of higher learning.

title: Dayton School Reopened
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 15 (AP) Schools here reopened today after a oneweek shutdown. Voters last Friday approved a new tax designed to ease the financial crisis that closed the schools.

title: Mets to Spend More Nights at Home
description: Joe Torre, the National League's most valuable player, and the rest of the St. Louis Cardinals will open a 1972 Shea Stadium schedule of 79 dates on April 11, the New York Mets announced yesterday.

title: Knicks' Lucas Faces Test Against Suns' Duo Tonight
description: At last resigned to the loss of Willis Reed for an indefinite period, the Knicks will attempt to maintain the momentum of their last outing, a 127105 rout of the Detroit Pistons, tonight at Madison Square Garden against the Phoenix Suns.

title: GIANTS JOHNSON LOST FOR SEASON WITH AILING KNEE
description: After their dramatic upset of the Falcons in Atlanta on Fran Tarkenton's ad lib twoyard touchdown dash with 31 seconds to play, the Giants received news yesterday that brought them brusquely back to earth.

title: Why Zurich for the Auction?
description: No one at Sotheby's or ParkeBernet wanted to talk about the floating dollar, but the season's most important jewel auction is being held in Zurich and the bidding's being held in Swiss francs.

title: Lazar Plans to Act On Gypsy Taxicabs
description: Taxi Commissioner Michael J. Lazar said yesterday he would attempt to remove 4,400 gypsy taxicabs from the city's streets, but he made it clear he did not consider the bulk of the city's nonmedallioned drivers to be gypsies.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation has announced executive changes affecting its Far East operations: W. W. Finley Jr. has been named president of the Gulf Oil CompanyAsia, a new division that absorbs Gulf Oil CompanyEast Asia and Gulf Oil CompanySouth Asia. Mr. Finley, formerly vice president and coordinator of refining operations of the Gulf Oil Corporation, will continue to have headquarters in Pittsburgh.

title: Phone Strike Thwarts Union's Plans to Move
description: If the telephone installers here were not on strike, one of the tenants of 224 West 49th Street could move to roomier quarters at 1 Park Avenue, as had been planned sice last July. But the tenant will not move until telephones can be installed.

title: Sears Increases Earnings by 18.1 % For Third Quarter
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., the nation's largest generalmerchandise retailer, continued its strong performance of the second quarter with a thirdquarter earnings gain of 18.1 per cent on a sales increase of 8.2 per cent.

title: NATHAN EDELMAN, EXPERT ON FRENCH
description: Dr. Nathan Edelman, a Columbia University specialist in 17thcentury French literature, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 560 Riverside Drive.

title: MRS. YI YUN HUANG
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Nov. 15 Mrs. Yi Yun Huang, widow of Gen. Huang Fu, onetime Foreign Minister of the Chiang Kaishek Government and Mayor of Shanghai, died today at her home, 23 Allen Road. Her age was 77.

title: Maine Resort Hotels Burn
description: OLD ORCHARD BEACH, Me., Nov. 15 (UPI)A fire leveled two fourstory resort hotels and damaged two others today. Damage was estimated at $250,000. The hotels were undergoing remodeling in preparation for next summer and were unoccupied.

title: Advertising:
description: An awful lot of Americans feel that the goods they are buying today are inferior to what they were buying decade ago, according to Lifecommissioned study by Lou Harris.

title: CORPORATE BONDS ADVANCE IN YIELD
description: Corporate and tax  exempt bond yields were increased yesterday, while rates on Treasury securities  helped by Federal Reserve actionwere pushed down a little.

title: Jason Robards Takes His First Role in a Musical
description: Jason Robards, who has distingished himself as a stage and film actor for more than a decade, will play his first Broadway musical role this season.

title: LEE SEITZER
description: GREAT NECK, L.I, Nov. 15Lee Seitzer, president of the Ashford Manufacturing Company of New York, homefurnishing textiles, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 51 years old and lived here.

title: MAXWELL LASKEY
description: Maxwell Laskey, treasurercontroller of LeeJeffreys, Inc., 555 Madison Avenue, radio and television advertising, died Sunday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He lived at 8302 Cornish Avenue, Elmhurst, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I would like to supplement the story in your edition of Nov. 10 on my testimony the previous day before Representative Rosenthal's subcommittee on Europe on Denial of Rights to Soviet Jews. It seems to me that the following salient points from my statement would give your readers a fuller comprehension of what I said.

title: LIPPER WILL STOP ACTING AS BROKER
description: The Arthur Lipper Corporation, a wellknown institutional investment house, has decided to leave the brokerage business because of what it calls the bleak future prospects of the securities industry.

title: JAPAN STILL TORN OVER CHINA TRADE
description: TOKYO. Nov. 15A delegation of Japanese businessmen began discussions today with authorities in Peking in an intensifying effort to build the foundation for a longterm expansion of Japanese exports to China.

title: Bess Myerson Plans TV Show
description: Bess Myerson, who quit television to become the city's Consumer Affairs Commissioner, will return to TV with a syndicated fivedayaweek program, What Every Woman Wants to Know. She will retain her city post.

title: Sloop Wins Race to Mexico
description: LA PAZ, Mexico, Nov. 15 (AP)Aquarius, an Ericson 35 sloop piloted by a Lung Beach Yacht Club skipper, has captured the fourth biennial Long BeachtoLa Paz yacht race, with an eightday sprint. The small boat was clocked in 1 hour 4R minutes 14 seconds of her ninth day, but because she, had no handicap she was deHared the winner on corrected time.

title: 9 Red Lands Form Group On Space Communications
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 15 (UPI)Nine Communist nations established an international space communications organization called Intersputnik today and said nonCommunist countries could join it.

title: Key Farm Aide May Quit; Heads Consumer Service
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) Dr. Clayton Yeutter, administrator of the Department of Agriculture's Consumer and Marketing Service, is expected to announce his resignation soon, sources said today.

title: Finding Said to Bolster Evidence Tying Virus to Cervical Cancer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15A virus identified as herpes type 2 has been isolated from cells grown artificially from a specimen of human cervical cancer, scientists reported today.

title: Dabney of Boys Takes Run
description: Bill Dabney of Boys High captured the Public Schools Athletic League's first individual crosscountry title at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx yesterday. He was clocked in 13 minutes 25.5 seconds in a driving rain on the muddy, 2mile course.

title: Seven in the Bronx Seized as Suspects In $1Million Thefts
description: Armed with shotguns, 10 members of the Bronx District Attorney's squad seized seven men yesterday who were deI scribed by District Attorney Burton B. Roberts as suspects in the robbery of $1  million from about 100 supermarkets.

title: 3 Charged With Stealing $1.5Million in Securities
description: Three men were arrested in the Wall Street area yesterday and charged in connection with the theft of $1.5million worth of securities.

title: N.B.C. Asks F.C.C. Establish Statistical Licensing Standards
description: The National Broadcasting Company has expressed fear that the stability of radio and television is threatened by challenges from citizen groups and has proposed reluctantly that the Federal Government adopt a quantitative standard in renewing licenses to use the air.

title: CHINA ASSERTS U.N. MUST END CONTROL BY SUPERPOWERS
Filipino Envoy's Arrest Decried
description: MANILA, Nov. 15Foreign Secretary Carlos P. Romulo said today that the arrest of the Filipino diplomat Domingo S. Canieso in New York last week as a heroin smuggler was another blot, a stain on our foreign service.

title: 200 Years of Indian Art on Display at Whitney
description: The art of the American Indian, as manifested in a great variety of functional, ceremonial and religious objects, will go on display today at the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: Testing Transit Theories
description: New York City's mass transit system hurtles toward financial disaster as farebox revenues fall farther and farther behind operating costs. Union negotiators are pressing for pay increases far in excess of Federal guideposts. Even with a noninflationary settlement, prolonged neglect and accumulated deficits now require an estimated $440 million more in revenues over the next two years than the present thirtycent fare will generate. So, in the aftermath of a defeated transportation bond issue that would have eased the crisis, everyone is asking: What do we do?

title: Federal Court Backs Democrats; F. C. C. Reversed on G .O. P. Reply
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia reversed today the Federal Communications Commission's decision that the Republican party should have fre television time to reply to a Democratic telecast that itself had been a response to President Nixon.

title: NEW RULES ALTER ILLINOIS PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The Illinois Democratic Presidential primary, largely meaningless in recent years because of the power of Mayor Richard J. Daley of Chicago, may take on some significance next year.

title: Graebner Victor in Tennis; Santana Topples Gonzales
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 15 (AP)  Clark Graebner advanced today In the $40,000 Clows international roundrobin tennis tournament, but Pancho Gonzales lost.

title: Tarkenton Makes a Phantom Han doff
description: Here are a few statistics that you may be willing have rattle around in the distant recesses of your mind.

title: N. E. T. and Channel 13 Get Grants for Production
description: National Educational Television and Channel 13 here were the recipients yesterday of substantial grants for the production and presentation of special programs, helping to offset recent financial cutbacks by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: Gretchen Green, Who Devoted Life to Serving Humanity, Dies
description: Gretchen Green, who spent her life in service to the people of many countries, died Sunday in St. Joseph's Manor, Trumbull, Conn. She had lived at 131 East 66th Street.

title: NEW UNIT IS OPENED BY BLOOMINGDALE'S
description: Bloomingdale's opened yesterday the second store of a new chain of home furnishings specialty stores. The 27,000squarefoot unit is at 696 White Plains Road in Scarsdale, N. Y. The building was formerly occupied by A. DePinna,

title: Peking's Long March to U.N. Hailed
description: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 15  With the muted militance of a poem by Mao Tsetung, one of Peking's supporters today acclaimed the long diplomatic march that ended as sixChinese in Mao tunics quietly took their seats In the General Assembly's Great Hall.

title: Vornado Sales Decline
description: Vornado, Inc., which operates the Two Guys discount department stores and other retail units, reported yesterday that sales in the four weeks ended Oct. 31 fell to $61,487,000 from the yearearlier $65.984,000.

title: Oslo Plans Ties With Hanoi
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 15 (UPI) The Norwegian Storting (Parliament) approved a Government proposal today to establish diplomatic relations with North Vietnam. A Foreign Ministry spokesman said Norway would contact the North Vietnamese authorities for formal recognition and establishment of diplomatic relations.

title: Transportation Aide Sworn
description: Mayor Lindsay swore in Manuel Carballo, his special transportation adviser, as the first deputy administrator of the Transportation Administration in a brief ceremony yesterday at the superagency's headquarters, 40 Worth Street. Mr. Carballo 30 years old, succeeds John De Roos, now counsel to the Transit Authority, in the $37,500 post.

title: Home and Smith Open Talks in Rhodesia
U.S. Equestrian Team Wins International Relay Stakes
description: TORONTO, Oct. 15  The United States Equestrian Team's combination of Carol Hofmann, riding Salem, and Frank Chapot, on Good Twist, captured the international relay stakes tonight at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: RUDOLPH J. EPHRUSSI
description: Rudolph J. Ephrussi, regional director for Latin America for Cyanamid International since 1964, died Sunday in New York Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived in Kinnelon, N. J.

title: JOHNSON WARNS OF ISOLATIONISM
description: Former President Lyndon B. Johnson, making his first public statement here since leaving the White House, warned yesterday that if the United States slipped into isolationism, we are going to find out that we are the ones who are isolated.

title: Senate Votes Tax Credit To Parents of Collegians
Letters to the Editor
description: President Nixon's statement that profits make jobs is a succinct summary of the trickledown theory, but the theory is upside down.

title: U.S. GUIDE EASED ON DIVIDEND LIMIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov,. 15 The Government's Committee on Interest and Dividends issued refinerrients today in its general guideline permitting dividend increases next year of no more than 4 per cent.

title: STOCKS RETREAT IN SLOW TRADING
description: The stock market greeted Phase Two of President Nixon's economic program yesterday by wobbling to another 1971 low. The initial phase had expired over the weekend.

title: Hooker Chemical Plan Set
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Nov. 15 (AP)The Hooker Chemical Corporation announced plans today for a multimilliondollar modernization program at its plant here. Raymond W. VerHove, vice president and gen&eral manager of the concern's industrial and chemical division, outlined the plans to city and industrial leaders. He gave no specific cost figures.

title: RANGERS OBTAIN CARR FROM BLUES
description: When Jack Egers returned from the hospital yesterday, where his wife had just given birth to a girl, he learned he was no longer a Ranger.

title: A SUDDEN ILLNESS STRIKES MULLIGAN
description: Hugh Mulligan, the bookmaker who is a major figure in a grand jury investigation of police corruption here, suffered an apparent heart attack yesterday, minutes before he was scheduled to be sentenced to four years in prison.

title: Housing Starts Seen High for' 72
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 15 Housing experts in the government and private sector agreed today that production of shelter for American families next year would continue the surprising showing of 1971.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Irish Girl Who Was Tarred Weds Her British Soldier
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Nov. 15 (UPI)A Roman Catholic girl who was tarred and had her head shorn because she had dated a British soldier married him today behind a shield of military secrecy.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: Hal Laycoe, his bitterness barely concealed behind kindly face and spectacles, lashed out yesterday at the structure of the National Hockey League that since 1967 has produced eight new teamshardly any of them competitive. The weak ones include the Vancouver Canucks, the club Laycoe coaches. They tell me, Be patient. Laycoe said. They tell us, We were losers for 10 years before we got moving. But should you be patient if you've paid $6million for a club? Or should the 15,000 fans who come to all of our home games be patient?

title: Kettle River Wins On Opening Card At Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 15  The New York influence was felt at Liberty Bell race track today when a crowd of 9,750 wagered $1,151,418. Both figures set openingday records for a fall meeting.

title: Theater:
description: Kumquats, billed as the world's first erotic puppet show, is the funniest thing we have seen in a long time. And one of the cleverest.

title: The Fournier Case: A Familiar Ring
description: PARIS. Nov. 15The French counterespionage service was overhauled in 1966 precisely to avoid a repetition of the kind of scandal that has now broken in the United States.

title: Con Ed Surveying Fire Damage at a Nuclear Plant
description: Eleven days after a mysterious fire destroyed part of the electrical control system at The Consolidated Edison Company's new nuclear power plant at Indian Point, near Peekskill, workmen and inspectors yesterday were still scrubbing soot frdm the blackened walls and picking among the charred wires and dismantled components, trying to determine the extent of the damage.

title: J. F. Kennedy's Use of Force
description: Letters to the Editor

title: 2 SINGERS SHARE A RECITAL DEBUT
description: Brenda Monk, a New Yorktrained Soprano, and David Katz, a tenor who came here several years ago from his native London, shared a New York debut Sunday afternoon at Carnegie ReCital Hall.

title: French Wary of Evidence
description: PARIS, Nov. 15The United States Embassy put polite pressure on the French Government today to cooperate in the prosecution of the New Jersey heroinsmuggling case,

title: Court Backs Air Force's Ouster Of an Unwed Pregnant Officer
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 15 (UPI)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled today that Capt. Susan Struck, the first Air Force officer in history to give birth while on active duty, can be discharged because of a compelling public interest in not having pregnant female soldiers in the military establishment.

title: STEEL OUTPUT RISES 2.5% DURING WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Saturday dropped by 2.5 per cent to 1,871,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This Compared with 1,918,000 tons in the preceding week. Total output for the year to date was 106,991,000 tons, down 7.4 per cent from the 115;517,000 tons produced in the like period of 1970.

title: Nabisco Picketed Over Monster Toys
description: Last Friday when Farish Alston Jenkins, 56, senior vice president at Nabisco, Inc., was told his company was going to be picketed because of some toys manufactured by a subsidiary, he said somewhat jokingly he'd like to put Jacqueline Michot Ceballos in a cage.

title: AUSTRIAN PRESIDENT WELCOMED BY ITALY
description: ROME, Nov. 15President Franz Jonas arrived here today for the first visit to Italy by an Austrian head of state since 1875.

title: A Science Educator Horton Guyford Stever
description: In announcing yesterday that Dr. H. Guyford Stever, the president of CarnegieMellon University, had been nominated as director of the National Science Foundation, the White House linked two names only vaguely familiar to the general public. The foundation, set up with the avowed purpose of supporting scientific research and higher education in science, has dispursed almost $5billion in research grants in the last 21 years. The 55yearold guidedmissile expert nominated for the $42,500ayear post of foundation director has been president of CarnegieMellonformerly known as the Carnegie Institute of Technologyfor six and a half years, after more than 20 years on the faculty of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

title: PAINT CURB IS URGED IN FEDERAL HOUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) The Government proposed today a ban on the use of paint containing more than 1 per cent lead on residential structures constructed or rehabilitated with Federal funds.

title: 3 Agencies Studying Computer Contract Awarded by O.T.B.,
description: Three government agencies are investigating possible wrongdoing in the awarding of a multimillion  dollar contract by the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation to the Computer Sciences Corporation.

title: Slaying Victim Identified
description: A young man who was found stabbed to death in Central Park near West 73d Street Saturday night was identified yesterday by his brother as Joseph Delterzo, 23 years old, of 9402 57th Avenue, Elmhurst, Queens. Detectives investigating the case said the man was employed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., stockbrokers.

title: Fraud in Welfare Program Is Laid to Laxity by City
description: The slate's Welfare Inspector General yesterday sharply criticized the city administration of the welfare program and said that frauds were made easier here by laxity and permissiveness on the part of Social Services Department personnel.

title: Market Place : Gulf & Western Adopts Candor
Two Exactas Pay More Than $600 at Aqueduct as Long Shots Dominate Card
description: It's that time again at Aqueduct, a time of year when chronic losers inherit the entry box and almost anything can happen.

title: U.S. Pledges Effort to Keep Taiwan in U.N. Agencies
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  The United States Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, U. Alexis Johnson, assured Chinese Nationalist leaders today that the United States would do as much as possible to keep Taiwan represented in United Nations specialized agencies.

title: House Backs Pension Rise For Veterans or Widows
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) The House passed unanimously today two bills to increase pensions for veterans or their widows by more than $1billion over the next five years. Parents and children would also benefit.

title: House Votes to Honor Hero
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) The House approved a bill today to name the Veterans Administration Hospital in San Antonio after the late war hero and actor, Audie L. Murphy. Audie Murphy is remembered by most all Americans as the hero of World War II, said the report from the Veterans Affairs Committee, headed by Representative Olin E, Teague, Democrat of Texas.

title: Jackson Hints at Move
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI)Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington announced today that he would hold news conference Friday morning to discuss his political planspresumably his intention to seek the Democratic Presidential nomination. Senator Jackson, who is expected to disclose plans to enter the Florida Presidential primary, is scheduled to speak in Tallahassee just hours after he meets with reporters Friday morning on Capitol Hill.

title: Iraq Takes a Step Toward A Permanent Constitution
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  President Ahmed Hassan Bakr announced a new national charter today to pave the way for a permanent constitution and a national assembly and to free the country's economy, especially its oil sector, from foreign control.

title: Storm Hits Cuban Isle
description: MIAMI, Nov. 15 (AP)Galeforce winds from the tropical storm Laura battered Cuba's Isle of Pines today as the lateseason Caribbean storm threatened to become a hurricane bound for Florida We're not predicting now that it will hit south Florida after it passes Cuba's western tip, but there's a possibility it will do so, said Arnold Sugg, deputy director of the National Hurricane Center here.

title: ISRAEL ORTHODOXY PROTESTED IN U.S.
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N.Y., Nov. 15The head of the organization of the congregations of American Conservative Judaism today assailed the complete domination of Orthodoxy in Israel over all religious matters, particularly those relating to marriage, divorce and conversion.

title: Mrs. Richards Wed to A. D. Walker Jr.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 15  Mrs. Madeleine Bittel Richards of Geneva and A. David Walker Jr. of Greenwich were married here this afternoon in the Round Hill Community Church by the Rev. Dr. Jesse E. Thomas.

title: 2 Transit Unions Ask M.T.A. For 30% Raise and 4Day Week
description: Two unions representing 37,500 subway and bus employes began negotiations yesterday with the Transit Authority on new contracts to supplant those that expire Dec. 31, with Federal wage and price guidelines emerging as key factors in the talks.

title: ROBERT W. VOGEL, 57, SPARKPLUG OFFICIAL
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 15 Robert W. Vogel, vice president and treasurer of the Champion Sparkplug Company, died yesterday in Toledo Hospital of a heart attack. He was 57 years old.

title: Lorin Hollander Recital Is Graced With Insights
description: After an outdoor summer in New Yorkhis last appearances here were in the park with the Philharmonic, and on the streets of Queens and East Harlem in solo performancesLorin Hollander moved indoors for a recital at Hunter College Sunday afternoon. The pianist's program was attractively balanced  Schubert's Opus Posthumous Sonata in B and Prokofiev's Seventh in the same key bracketing shorter pieces by Albeniz, Ravel and Satie. Through it all, Mr. Hollander was ever the sensitive, deeply committed artist.

title: Anglicans Will Ordain First 2 Women Priests
description: LONDON, Nov. 15 (AP) Two women in Hong Kong will become the first women priests in the Anglican Church, an official announcement said today.

title: NO PLANES SOON, U.S. TELLS ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The United States has reportedly indicated to Israel, indirectly but unmistakably, that it is not going to grant her request for new supplies of jet warplanes in the foreseeable future.

title: Spare the Aged
description: Letters to the Editor

title: JEROME V. LEARY
description: Jerome V. Leary, who retired as an assistant vice president of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company in 1967, died Saturday at his home in West Caldwell, N.J. His age was 69.

title: MOST COAL MINERS REMAIN OFF JOBS
description: LOUISVILLE. Ky., Nov. 15 About 75 per cent of the nation's 100,000 softcoal miners did not report today on the first day of work since the signing of a new contract last Saturday night.

title: Medina Says He Lied to Colonel About Mylai Toll
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 15  Former Capt. Ernest L. Medina, the commander of the American troops that killed South Vietnamese civilians at Mylai 4 in 1968, admitted today that he had lied to Col. Oran K. Henderson about the number of villagers killed in the combat assault. Mr. Medina, who resigned from the Army last month, three weeks after his acquittal on charges of murder and manslaughter arising from the Mylai incident, also testified that he had not been completely candid in previous statements made under oath to Army investigators. In a quiet voice, Mr. Medina agreed with Maj. Carroll J. Tichenor, the military prosecutor, that, because of his falsehoods, he had completely disgraced and dishonored the uniform he once wore. Mr. Medina, who is now a helicopter company executive in Menominee, Mich., appeared as a defense witness at Colonel Henderson's courtmartial. The colonel is being tried on charges that he covered up reports of the Mylai incident and that he later lied in an appearance before an Army board of inquiry.

title: A.B.A. Teams Face Demise, Senate Told
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The Kentucky Colonels, one of the most successful American Basketball Association teams, may go out of existence next season unless the league is permitted to merge with the National Basketball Association, a principal owner of the team predicted today.

title: U.S. IS SAID TO QUASH STUDY ON VIETCONG
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Nov. 15 (AP)The news magazine Der Spiegel says the Pentagon has suppressed a study by the Rand Corporation that concluded that high ideological motivation was behind Vietcong battlefield successes.

title: BISHOPS SEE PERIL IN COURT DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  The American Bishops of the Roman Catholic Church declared today that the right of parents to educate their children in nonpublic schools was threatened by a recent Supreme Court decision denying Government assistance for teachers salaries in parochial schools.

title: Heisman Ceremony At HalfTime Seen As a Sellout, to TV
description: Raymond Tierney, a former president of the Downtown Athletic Club, complained yesterday that his club has sold out to television.

title: MAJOR COMPANIES MUST CLEAR RISES IN PRICES FOR '71
description: WASNINGTON, Nov. 15 The automobile industry and Culler major businesses lost today the right to raise prices during the remaining seven weeks of this year without the Governmnt's prior approval.

title: 10 in Black Caucus Visit Bases in Study Of Charges of Bias
description: Ten members of the Congressional Black Caucus visited 10 military bases across the country yesterday, looking into charges of racial. discriminaton in the armed forces.

title: McGraw Backs Survey After Chase Unit Critique
description: Chase Econometric Associates, an economic consulting arm of the Chase Manhattan Corporation, questioned yesterday the accuracy of the McGrawHill capitalspending survey, which is widely followed as an indicator of future business plans to acquire new plant and equipment.

title: 2 COPTERS COLLIDE, KILLING 4 AMERICANS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 16 (AP)The United States command reported yesterday that two American helicopters had collided about 70 miles northwest of here, killing the four crewmen aboard one and injuring the four on the other.

title: BROKER GROUP BACKS A CENTRAL MARKET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (Reuters) Alger B. Chapman Jr., a spokesman for the Association of Stock Exchange Firms, said today that a poll of members favored a network of independent, diverse, brokerdealers, with a quality sales force.

title: Jets Are Eloquently Silent On 2 Controversial Plays
description: Fined in the past for their outspoken comment, the Jets maintained official silence yesterday after viewing films of two controversial plays that affected the outcome of their game with the Baltimore Colts.

title: Ending the Spoils System
description: Nearly a century after the passage of the first state civil service law in 1883, the spoils system is still flourishing in many parts of the country. Political patronage continues to dominate the allocation of hundreds of thousands of public jobs at every level, with the holders expected to contribute money as well as campaign effort to support the party in power.

title: C. & O. Omits Dividend
description: The Chesapeake & Ohio Railway, which laid off 1,800 employes during the sevenweek coal strike that was settled on Sunday, yesterday omitted its dividend for the fourth quarter.

title: SALES TAX URGED FOR WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 15 Westchester County Executive Edwin G. Michaelian urged enactment today of a 2 or 3 per cent county sales tax to balance a proposed $220million budget that he said would otherwise require a 25 per cent increase in the county property tax rate for 1972.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Asks Calm In a Hawkish Parliament
MABEL E. PALMER
description: Mabel E. Palmer, a lawyer who retired five years ago as an associate of Stickles, Hayden, Kennedy, Hort & Van Steenburgh, 36 West 44th Street, died Saturday in French Hospital. She was 84 years old and lived at 81 Irving Place.

title: Aliens in U.S. Must Report Addresses During January
description: Aliens in the United States must report their current addresses to the Immigration and Naturalization Service during January.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today Nov. 16, 1971
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Boeing Account Going To 2Agency Venture
description: When the Boeing Company in Seattle got down to the line for deciding which of six competing ad agencies to select from, they apparently had a warm feeling for both Cole & Weber, a local agency, and for Doyle Dane Bernbach.

title: Rules for Phase Two Available in Pamphlet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15A copy of the first specific regulations for Phase Two of the Administration's economic stabilization program is available from the Government Printing Office for 20 cents.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES FINALLY IN RALLY
description: Prices of soybean futures declined for part of the session, under heavy selling pressure on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, but closed irregularly, breaking a price decline that began six days ago.

title: Candidate Escapes Shots
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 15 (AP) At least eight shots were fired into the home of a Republican Assembly candidate, Bill Brophy, early today, narrowly missing him, the authorities said.

title: Wheeler Captures I.C.4A Run
description: Bob Wheeler is still undecided between the 800 and 1,500 meter runs as his Olympic event for next summer's United States track and field trials.

title: Morris Gordon, Photographer, Western Electric Official, Dead
description: Morris Gordon, a leader in photography as a cameraman, a codirector of the annual University of Miami Conference for Visual Communications and past president of the board of judges of World Press Photo in The Hague, died Saturday night of a heart attack in University Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 25 East 83d Street.

title: Copyright Bill Is Passed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) The House voted 300 to 49 today to extend the renewal term of expiring copyrights until Dec. 31, 1972. The resolution, already passed by the Senate, was sent to President Nixon.

title: CANCER RESEARCH IS VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  The House passed today, by a vote of 350 to 5. a major cancer research bill that differs sharply from one passed earlier by the Senate with backing from the White House.

title: Teachers to Discuss Merger
description: The leaders of the two rival unions that represent teachers in the state said yesterday they would begin talks Saturday about merging into one statewide group. The announcement was made jointly in Albany by Albert Shanker, president of the 85,000member United Teachers of New York State, and Thomas Y. Hobart, newly elected president of the 105,000member New York State Teachers Association.

title: PAYMENTS DEFICIT AT RECORD LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  The deficit in the United States balance of international payments, measured by two of the four definitions now used, increased to a record level in the third quarter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Rules Lead to Widespread Confusion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  Unanswered questions and unclarified regulations about wage and price controls created widespread confusion today, the first business day of Phase Two of President Nixon's economic stabilization program.

title: Panel Terms Attica Still Tense, With Danger of Harassment Continuing
description: A state panel established to protect inmates rights in the aftermath of the September uprising at the Attica Correctional Facility said yesterday that the situation at the prison was still tense and that the danger of harassment of inmates continues.

title: Attica Leaders Charge Conditions Are Worse Since Rioting.
description: ATTICA, N. Y., Nov. 16  Two of the inmates of the Attica Correctional Facility who emerged as leaders of the 1,200man prisoner revolt two months ago said today that an appearance by Governor Rockefeller at the prison during the tense negotiating period would have saved lives.

title: Native Alaskans Rights
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Antiaircraft Battery in the North Is Attacked by U.S. Jet Fighter
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 17 (AP)An American fighterbomber attacked an antiaircraft battery yesterday 70 miles inside North Vietnam and reported that it had damaged at least one enemy gun, the United States command announced.

title: Hijacker Found Not Guilty By Judge on Insanity Basis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) A 51yearold Phoenix, Ariz., man was found not guilty by reason of insanity today of charges that he kidnapped and wounded an airline pilot and stole $100,000 from Trans World Airlines in a hijacking in 1970.

title: High Court Strength
description: WASHINGTONThe Supreme Court will continue to have powerful supporters and popular acceptance as long as it steadfastly maintains its determination to decide cases, on principle and refuses to temper its application of constitutional guarantees with fears for its own political wellbeing.

title: History for Sale
description: With the nation's bicentennial less than five years off, it is astonishing that the United States has yet to protect the environs of one of its historic treasures, Mount Vernon. There was a brief uproar last month when the Soviet Government sought to purchase the estate adjoining Mount Vernon as a recreation center for its Washington embassy employes, a proposal that became moot when the owner withdrew the property from the market.

title: CHINA SAID TO TELL OF LIN'S DOWNFALL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The United States intelligence community, is receiving a growing volume of reports on special meetings throughout mainland China in which leading Communist party, groups are said to be advised by top party delegates that Lin Mao no longer holds power.

title: PULPIT FREEDOM IS WON BY RABBIS
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., Nov. 16  After an animated twohour debate delegates from congregations of Conservative American Judaism strengthened today the role of the rabbis, giving them complete freedom of the pulpit and the sole right to determine who shall be guest speakers at worship services.

title: Flyers, Sabres Trade Wings
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov 16 (AP)The Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League traded a right wing, Larry Mickey, to the Buffalo Sabres today for a left wing, Larry Keenan, and recalled a right wing, Lew Merrison, from their Richmond club in the American League.

title: CONNALLY WARNS ON COAL PAY PACT
description: John B. Connally, President Nixon's chief spokesman on economic policy, said last night that if the Pay Board approved the 39 per cent increase in wages and other benefits agreed to in the softcoal industry last week, Phase Two of the Administration's new economic policy would be hurt.

title: British Commission Denies Brutality in Ulster Prisons
description: LONDON, Nov. 16An official British commission found evidence today of mistreatment of political prisoners in Northern Ireland but rejected allegations of widespread brutality.

title: Yields on TaxExempt Bonds Are Up
description: Yields on highestquality taxexempt state bonds moved up yesterday to their highest levels since early September.

title: OTB Will Start Taking Wagers Today On Colonial Cup Race
description: All Offtrack Betting Corporation branches will accept bets on Saturday's Colonial Cup International Steeplechase starting at 8 A.M. today. The $100,000 event at Camden, S. C., will be televised live on WORTV (Channel 9) from 2:30 P.M. to 3 P.M. Betting windows will close at 2:25 P.M. Saturday.

title: Franklin Mint Sets Split
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 16 (Reuters) The Franklin Mint, Inc., said today its directors have authorized a threefortwo stock split to be distributed Jan. 5 to shareholders of record Dec. 15 in the form of one additional share for each two held.

title: MRS. JOSEPH LOVE
description: Mrs. Minerva Rosetsky Love, widow of Joseph Love, board chairman and president of Joseph Love, Inc., children's wear manufacturers, died yesterday at her home, 15 Central Park West. She was 70 years old.

title: Avnet Issue Is Modified
description: A modified registration statement has been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission under which only 700,000 shares of Avnet, Inc., stock will be offered by stockholders. The company portion of the original offering has been withdrawn. Kuhn, Loeb & Co., heading the syndicate, stated last night that the date for the reduced number of shares to he offered would be announced soon.

title: Hornblower's Sales Force To Get Commission Charge
description: Hornblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes announced yesterday that it would implement a new compensation scale for its registered representatives to reflect the new commission structure approved for the New York Stock Exchange by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Warriors Defeat Pistons
description: DETROIT, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Golden State Warriors erased an 11point deficit with a sensational 73 per cent shooting average in the third quarter tonight to defeat the Detroit Pistons, 122101.

title: Factory Output Advances Only 0.2%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Industrial production and housing starts showed modest gains in October, Government reports disclosed today.

title: Geller Backs Big Board Trust Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  Representative Emanuel Celler, chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, vowed today to fight any attempt to eliminate or diminish the applicability of the antitrust laws to the New York Stock Exchange. Legislation granting antitrust immunity to the exchange has been proposed by, among others, William McChesney Martin Jr., the former chairman of the Federal Reserve Board.

title: BLUEGRASS FRAMES DARCO STRING FETE
description: The second Darco String Band Festival, a modest affair compared to most music festivals these days, brought four string groups to the Washington Square Methodist Church, l34 West Fourth Street on Monday evening along with an enthusiastic audience that overflowed the seating capacity. The festival, organized by Izzy Young of the Folklore Center, is sponsored by a manufacturer of guitar strings.

title: City May Pay for High School Student Activities
description: Highschool student activities, which up to now have been financed largely by the youngsters themselves, may be getting financial help from the city.

title: Globetrotters Strike And Game Is Canceled
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Nov. 16 (AP)  The scheduled game between the Harlem Globetrotters and the Boston Shamrocks was canceled tonight after a majority of the Globetrotters refused to play because of a dispute with club management.

title: Porsche to Compete in CanAm Series
description: The Roger PenskeMark Donohue team will compete in the 1972 CanadianAmerican Challenge Series in a newmodel Porsche, the PorscheAudi Division of Volkswagen of America announced yesterday.

title: Coal Mine Motorman Killed
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 16  The Consolidation Coal Company's No. 9 mine here, which exploded in 1969 with the loss of 78 miner, claimed another victim today when Benny B. Tippner, a 55yearold motorman, apparently was thrown from his locomotive and was crushed to death beneath it.

title: A Theatrical Quartet: Sada Thompson
description: There are four strikingly different women in George Purth's comedy, Twigs, and they have one striking thing in common: They are all Sada Thompson.

title: EFFICIENCY IS URGED ON EQUITY CAPITAL
description: Greater efficiency in allocating scarce equity capital was urged upon the securities industry yesterday by Roger F. Murray, the S. Sloan Colt professor of banking and finance at Columbia University.

title: MARKET PERKS UP IN SHARP REBOUND
description: The stock market finally shook off its lethargy yesterday afternoon and staged a sharp rally that sent glamours and blue chips aloft on higher volume.

title: Laos Posts Reported Lost
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 16 (Reuters)A Defense Ministry spokesman said today that North Vietnamese troops had forced Laotian soldiers to abandon two positions near the southern town of Muong Phalane just west of the Ho Chi Minh Trail. Muong Phalane is on Route 9 due west of the northernmost part of South Vietnam.

title: Screen: Italian Feature:Trintignant Is Hero of 'One Night at Dinner'
description: "One Night at Dinner" is an immensely boring Italian movie with the sort of Pirandellian pretentions that I thought had been exhausted at least 30 years ago. Michele (Jean-Louis Trintignant) is a playwright in search of three characters: Nina (Florinda Bolkan), his wife; Max (Tony Musante), his best friend, who is in love with Michele but the lover to Nina, and Ric (Lino Capolicchio), Max's boyfriend, who falls in love with Nina, who is of course, in love with Michele."I must understand why my characters do what they do," says Michele. For what seems like most of the time we see them doing what they do through his imagination, which exhibits all of the disciplines of a bad movie in which the dcor and costumes are more vivid than the people, in which the camera always anticipates movements and gestures, and in which the music must communicate all passion.The movie is based on a play by Guiseppe Patroni Griffi, who also directed the film. It is possible (although I doubt it) that its pretenses might be effective on the stage, where the entire work would be seen as a proscenium masquerade within its own milieu. On film, however, these conceits, which are humorless, are as grotesque as stage make-up seen in broad daylight.

title: GOVERNOR TO PUSH NOFAULT INSURANCE
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that legislative approval of a nofault automobile insurance system in the state would be a top priority of his 1972 program.

title: Fonda in Saroyan Play
description: Henry Fonda will star in The Time of Your Life, which the Plumstead Playhouse will present at the Eisenhower Theater of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington on Jan. 12. Edwin Sherin will direct the revival of William Saroyan's play. Martha Scott and Alfred de Liagre Jr. are producers for Plumstead.

title: Market Place: Small Trader's Apathy Viewed
description: In case you haven't noticed, the powers at the august New York Stock Exchange aren't really worried about what's happening to the small investor in the current discussions over commission rates.

title: Noe Named N.Y.R.A. Race Secretary
description: Kenny Noe Jr. has accepted the post of racing secretary and handicapper for the New York Racing Association, it was announced yesterday by Alfred G. Vanderbilt, chairman of the board of the organization. Noe will assume the post that had been held by Tommy Trotter for the last 11 years.

title: Fournier Declines Comment
description: PARIS, Nov. 16 (UPI)Leaving the judge's chambers, Colonel Fournier refused to comment on the accusations against him.

title: Threat to Chile's Democracy
description: President Salvador Allende has now moved to carry out the plank in the program of his Popular Unity coalition that carries the greatest threat for democracy Chile. He has submitted a proposal to replace the present twochamber National Congress with a People's Assembly. He indicates that if the Congress, controlled by opposition parties, refuses to abolish itself he will resort to a plebiscite on his unicameral scheme.

title: COUSINS LEAVING SATURDAY REVIEW
description: Norman Cousins resigned yesterday as editor of the Saturday Review following a disagreement with its new owners on their plans to transform the cultural weekly review into a more topical and specialized publication and to expand Its book publishing program and other consumer activities.

title: Union Carbide to Idle 450
description: The Union Carbide Corporation said yesterday that it planned to lay off 450, employes throughout the company in the next few months. This would bring total personnel cuts here and in Puerto Rico this year to 2,800.

title: U.S. Woman Is Sentenced By Iran to 3Year Term
description: TEHERAN, Nov. 16 (UPI) Miss Sharon La Bere, of Oakland, Calif., who admitted participating in antiIranian demonstrations in the United States, was sentenced to three years in prison Sunday on a charge of having acted against the nation's security.

title: CANADA CONFIRMS A CONTROLS POLICY
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 16Mitchell Sharp, actingPrime Minister, confirmed today the general accuracy of a published report stating the Government had adopted the principle of controlling foreign investment in Canada. But he insisted there had been no final decision.

title: Hirohito Says Constitution Confined His Role in War
Volpe and Hartke in Clash Over Aid to Rail Industry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16.Transportation Secretary John A. Volpe and Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, broadened their personal feud today to include a fundamental dispute over relief for the nation's financially troubled railroad industry.

title: JournalistLaw Panel Advises Broad Protection for Newsmen
description: Warning that the nation cannot afford to let freedom of the press erode, a panel of journalists and law officials called yesterday for broad legal shields to protect newsmen and news agencies from governmental efforts to secure their confidential information.

title: STRIP MINE CURB GAINING SUPPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16A spokesman for the Nixon Administration told a Senate Committee today that surface or strip mining activity that pernianently impaired the environment should be prohibited by Federal law.

title: Labor and Controls
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 16  When the next series of acting awards are given it may be necessary to create a special category for those dealing with the new pay and price control boards.

title: It's Black Tie and Ceremonial Dress at the Whitney's Party for Indian Art Exhibition
description: There have been times in American history when it wasn't chic to be an American Indian, but this certainly isn't one of them. The Whitney Museum's party the other night is a case in point.

title: Martian Haze Subsides
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov, 16 The haze, presumably from dust storm that has frustrated photographic observation of Mars from orbit, ever since the arrival there of Mariner 9 last Saturday appears to have sub. sided somewhat over the frostpatched South Pole area.

title: Tackling Money Crisis French Insist U.S. Remove 10% Surtax As a Prelude to Currency Bargaining
description: PARIS, Nov. 16A high French official tells the story of an American who ordered an apple pie in a restaurant but, when the waitress brought it, changed his mind. I want peach pie instead, he said. The American ate the peach pie and started to leave. The waitress stopped him. You forgot to pay for the peach pie, she said. Why should I? asked the American. I gave you an apple pie for it. But you didn't pay for the apple pie, said the waitress. Well, I didn't eat it, either, said the American.

title: Filtrol and Slick Ending Lawsuits
description: The Filtrol Corporation and the Slick Corporation announced yesterday that they had agreed to stop the litigation that has held up Slick's efforts to take over Filtrol.

title: Bulls Down Sonics, 9587
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 16 (UPI)Six of eight Chicago Bulls players scored in double figures tonight, led by Bob Love with 23 points, in a 9587 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: GIANTS REPORT: KOTITE TO PLAY, EVANS OUT A WEEK
description: Now that the Xray reports are in, Charlie Evans and Dick Kotite feel a lot better about the injuries they suffered in the New York Giants' inspired victory at Atlanta Sunday.

title: 61 Foes of Indochina War Arrested at White House
description: Special to The New York Times

title: QUARRY FLATTENS BRITISH CHAMPION
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 16 (AP)Jerry Quarry knocked out Jack Bodell, the British and European heavyweight champion, in the first round of scheduled 10round bout tonight.

title: TV: Some Network Specials Do Not Always Turn Out to Be So
description: What, precisely, is a special?

title: On the Existential Rack
description: If anybody has the right to say These are the times that try men's souls, it is not the book reviewer, but the drama critic. To be sure, I sometimes think I'm getting more than my share of the casualties of our exacerbated age. After a run of particularly bad books, I feel like an interne on the night shift of an emergency ward. Who can sew them all up, give mouthtomouth resuscitation to each one who is failing? Who can cure the human condition?

title: Policeman in Harlem Hurt As He Aids 2 Colleagues
description: A policeman who responded to a call for assistance from two plainclothes men who were being menaced by a crowd in Harlem after they had arrested two narcotics suspects, was injured last night when someone in the crowd broke a bottle over his head.

title: Anger in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 16The Government was disturbed by Chinese demands in the United Nations yesterday for a nullification of United Nations resolutions that branded North Korea and China as aggressors in the Korean war and provided for the defense I of South Korea.

title: Blasts Damage Apartments
description: Two explosions on the first and fifth floors of a sixstory, building at 1355 Shakespeare Avenue in the Bronx yesterday damaged several of the apartments. One elderly resident was slightly injured.

title: PAY BOARD GETS NEW WAGE PLEA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Labor members of the Pay Board made a new attempt today to win approval for the recovery of scheduled wage increases lost during the 90day freeze of Phase One of the economic program. However, the majority postponed any action on the request.

title: Miami Mayor Reelected
description: MIAMI, Nov. 16 (AP)David T. Kennedy was easily reelected Mayor of Miami tonight and promptly urged Senator Hubert H. Humphrey to run again for the Presidency.

title: A Touch of Home
description: The U.S.O. has become a tradition of service to our young men and women in uniform  providing an atmosphere of friendship and warmth in strange lands, entertainment for isolated outposts  that touch of home to let our boys know we at home haven't forgotten them, Arthur Goldberg says.

title: I.L.O. CHINA SEAT GIVEN TO PEKING
description: GENEVA, Nov. 16The International Labor Organization, a United Nations agency, recognized Peking tonight as the representative Government of China.

title: U.S. Said to Join Attack
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 16 (AP)American helicopter gunships from South Vietnam reportedly attacked North Vietnamese positions less than 10 miles southwest of here today in an attempt to dislodge the enemy from an outpost village.

title: Hughes, Coach of Oilers, Is Waiting for Ax to Fall
description: Ed Hughes, coach of the Houston Oilers, was waiting yesterday for the other shoe to drop. The man who owns the team, Kenneth Stanley (Bud) Adams Jr., was expected to drop it at any time by ousting the 44yearold Hughes, a former New York Giants defensive back who was hired as head coach last January. The first shoe hit the floor on Monday when Adams, a wealthy oilman traveling in San Francisco, telephoned the general manager, John Breen, and had him discharge the offensive line coach, Ernie Zwahlen. Even in pro football, where coaches are dismissed all the time, it is unorthodox for an owner to drop a member of the coaching staff in midseason.

title: Democrats Accepting Lindsay, But Leaders Doubt He'll Win
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  Mayor Lindsay's expected candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination seems to have cleared its first hurdle.

title: JUSTICES TO WEIGH ARMY SPYING ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The Supreme Court has agreed to consider if citizens can go to court to block Army intelligence agents from conducting surveillance of civilian political activities.

title: Better U.S. Ambulance Service Sought
description: A 22yearold motorist was speeding along a highway 30 miles southeast of Atlanta last month when he lost control of his car and it overturned. The physician who examined him later discovered that the youth was paralyzed below the waist, and the doctor blamed the ambulance attendants who had brought the youth to the hospital for causing the paralysis.

title: MRS. ROBERT FURLOTTE
description: SANDS POINT, L.I., Nov. 16 Mrs. Dorothy Ohlandt Furlotte. wife of Robert Furlotte, director of the Old Taylor marketing group of National Distillers Products Company, died here yesterday. She lived here at 28 Cornwell's Beach Road.

title: 2 AIDES DENY ROLE IN O.T.B. CONTRACT
description: Two officials of City Investing Company denied yesterday any official role in the contract, now under investigation, between the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation and Computer Sciences Corporation.

title: Chaplain Testifies That He Dismissed Reports on Mylai
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 16 An Army chaplain testified today at the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson that he had received complaints from another chaplain about indiscriminate shooting at Mylai 4, but had dismissed them as the words of a man who was always crying wolf.

title: PRICES INCREASE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market finished higher yesterday after an afternoon rally erased most of the earlier losses.

title: Protectionist Policy? Connally Says No
description: Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally pledged last night that the United States would not adopt a protectionist international economic policy.

title: U.N. Vote Cautions U.S. on Rhodesia
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Nov. 16One hundred and six countries  including mainland China, voting for the first time in the United Nationscautioned the United States today that chrome imports from Rhodesia would be a breach of Washington's international treaty obligations.

title: WESLEYAN LOOKS TO ARTS CENTER
description: A preview of the Wesleyan University Center for the Arts, scheduled to be completed by early 1973, was given here Monday evening by Kevin Roche, architect of the structure.

title: Gouverneur Hospital to Open in '72 , Protesters Told
description: Dr. Joseph T. English, president of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation, promised a group of more than 100 Chinese yesterday that a new hospital would open next summer on the Lower East Side even though the corporation had a, $30million budget deficit.

title: O.E.O. Health Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI)  Dr. E. Leon Cooper, 36 years old, will head the Office of Economic Opportunity health affairs program, the antipoverty agency director, Phillip V. Sanchez announced today. Dr. Cooper will succeed Dr. Carl Smith, who has held the post on an acting basis since the resignation earlier this year of Dr. Carl Bryant.

title: Jersey Firemen Win Raise
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov. 16The Elizabeth City Council, meeting in caucus with representatives of the city's Firemen's Union last night, agreed on $700 acrosstheboard pay increases, virtually eliminating the possibility of a city wide job action threatened by the firemen.

title: Mortgage Loans Over the 6% Rate Voided in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) A Federal appeals court here, in a decision that could cost local mortgage bankers hundreds of millions of dollars, has voided all their loans with interest rates exceeding 6 per cent.

title: The Forgotten Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16On the surface, the political atmosphere here seems flat and dull, but under the surface there is quite a lot of exciting activity, which could be important and even decisive in the voting next November.

title: PAINE OUTLINES PUBLIC OFFERING
description: Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., a leading brokerage house, disclosed plans yesterday to go public with an offering of 1 million common shares at a maximum price of $30 each.

title: Bucks Win 9th Straight
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 16 (AP)  The Milwaukee Bucks built a 19point lead in the first half and then cruised to their ninth straight victory tonight, 125105, over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: Edward Kent, Lawyer, 57, Dies; Former Vice Dean at Columbia
description: LEONIA, N. J., Nov. 16Edward F. Kent, a retired Army officer who was vice dean of the Columbia Law School before entering private practice in New Jersey, died Sunday apparently of a heart attack at his home, 372 Park Avenue. He was 57 years old.

title: Pros Top Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 16 (AP) Johnny Neumann scored 32, points to lead the Memphis Pros, to a 119109 victory over the Floridians tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: ExJersey Official Indicted On Two Counts of Perjury
description: NEWARK, Nov. 16 (UPI) A Federal grand jury accused Robert J. Burkhardt, former New Jersey Secretary of State, today of lying about his outside income while in office.

title: 2 Killed Helping a Dog
description: CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 16 (UPI)  A veterinary hospital assistant from New York state and a Twin Oaks, Pa., man were killed late yesterday when a car hit them on Route 322 as they were attempting to help a pet dog that had been hit by another car. The police identified the victims as Dawn Granger, 21 years old, a Fanda, N.Y., woman studying at the University of Pennsylvania, and James J. Henry, 29.

title: Namath's Date of Return Still in Doubt
description: Joe Namath, the forgotten man of pro football, worked out lightly in Shea Stadium yesterday but the New York Jets were not optimistic that he was ready to rejoin the firing line.

title: FUGITIVE'S ORDEAL ENDS IN FREEDOM
description: The hearing in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday took 90 seconds and closed when Judge Thomas Dickens declared: The charges against this man are dismissed and he is free.

title: Gunter Grass Critical of Israeli Rightists
C.B.S. and A. B. C. List Changes For TV Beginning in January
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System and the American Broadcasting Company announced yesterday their plans for a second season, beginning in January.

title: Charlie Dale of Comedy Team Of Smith and Dale Dies at 90
description: Charlie Dale, the deadpan partner in the vaudeville team of Smith and Dale, died of natural causes yesterday morning at a nursing home in Teaneck, N.J. He was 90 years old.

title: U.S. ASSAILS CHINA AS INTEMPERATE IN SPEECH AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16The United States denounced China today as having used intemperate language and empty cannons of rhetoric in the speech yesterday that marked Peking's entry into the United Nations.

title: ROBERTS WARNS AGAINST BRIBERY
description: Flanked by 15 policemen who made recent bribery arrests and their supervisors, Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts issued a stern warning yesterday to corrupters of Bronx policemen.

title: MRS. WILLIAM O'SHEA, LEADER IN CHARITIES
description: Mrs. Edwina Shanley O'Shea, former president of The Gothams, and widow of William J. O'Shea, lawyer and former member of the Board of Education, died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hospital.. She lived at 115 East 67th Street. Mrs. O'Shea was a graduate of the Convent of the Sacred Heart here and of the Georgetown Visitation School. Active in benefit work for the New York Foundling Hospital, she was president of The Gothams, a charitable organization for this purpose, from 1954 to 1961.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Rail Signalmen Win46% Raise, Far in Excess of the Guideline
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen reached a tentative contract agreement with the railroads today with a wage settlement providing a 46 per cent increase over 42 months.

title: FANIA MARINOFF ACTRESS, 81, DEAD
description: Mrs. Fania Marinoff Van Vechten, retired actress and the widow of Carl Van Vechten, the critic, author and portrait photographer, died yesterday at the Englewood Hospital in Englewood, N. J. She was 81 years old and in recent months had been living at the Dunroven Nursing Home in Cresskill, N. J.

title: G.O.P. in Vermont Picks Farmer, 42, In House Primary
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Nov. 16 Richard W. Mallary, a 42yearold Fairlee dairy farmer, won the Republican nomination for Vermont's lone seat in the House of Representatives today in a special primary.

title: ALI BIG FAVORITE TO DEFEAT MATHIS
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 16  In a test of Muhammad Ali's true appeal, the former heavyweight champion will be on display against big Buster Mathis tomorrow night in a scheduled 12round bout.

title: Troubled Haaren High Tries the Winischool
description: Five years ago, Hollywood moviemakers used Haaren High School as the setting for Up the Down Staircase, a tragicomic work that created a grim image of the typical bigcity high school: huge, chaotic, a bureaucratic maze, an educational wasteland inhabited by bored, demoralized students and defeated teachers.

title: Best Yonkers String, 4 in Row, Held by Oldest Horse There, 13
description: YONKERS, Nov. 16  Air New Zealand, a pacing gelding from Down Under, enjoys two distinctions. At 13, he is the oldest horse in competition at Yonkers Raceway and, having captured the last four starts, has the longest winning streak on the grounds.

title: French Strike Protests What Steel Mills Call Progress
description: HAYANGE, France, Nov. 16Along the polluted streams of the Fensch and the Orne and beside the Belgian and Luxembourg borders to the north, a score of mill towns fell silent today, their shafts shrouded in fog. In Hayange dishes on the shelves in the company houses stopped rattling as the vibration of giant presses gave way to chants of De Wendel: Gravedigger! and Pompidou resign!

title: South Vietnamese Wounded Jam Military Hospitals
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 16In the largest South Vietnamese military hospital, which is considered the best, there are 1,800 beds for nearly 4,000 patients, so some men must sleep on verandas and others on the floor. The continuing casualties among South Vietnamese troops are the reason for the overcrowding at Cong Hoa Hospital, which is in a Saigon suburb.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Pakistan Reports Clashes
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 16 The state radio said today that Pakistani troops had foiled five attempts by Indian troops and Pakistani insurgents to infiltrate into Pakistan in the Chittagong, Noakhali, Comilla, Rangpur and Jessore districts of East Pakistan.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Said to Set Terms For Visits by Observer Teams
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 16 Prime Minister Indira Gandhi was reported to have told members of her ruling Congress party today that India would not object to the visit of any observer team either from the United States or the United Nations, provided it investigated the depth of the problem created by the East Pakistani crisis.

title: Experts Call Life on Waterless Planet Possible
description: Two Columbia University scientists have reported synthesizing without the use of water a halfdozen of the amino acids that form building blocks of life's proteins.

title: Persico Trial Continues Behind Closed Doors
description: The Supreme Court extortionconspiracy trial of Carmine J. Persico continued yesterday behind locked doors at 100 Centre Street.

title: Meeting of the Group of Ten Is Reset for Nov.30Dec. 1
description: PARIS, Nov. 16The next meeting of the Group of Ten finance ministers, which could be decisive in the resolution or evolutionof the world monetary crisis, has been tentatively set for Rome on Nov. 30 and Dec. 1, official European sources said today.

title: Ulster Gives No Response
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 16The Government of Northern Ireland made no official comment today on the Compton report, but privately some officials regarded it as vindication of Prime Minister Brian Faulkner's recent insistence that there had been no brutality.

title: Mr. Nixon's Vietnam Strategy
description: President Nixon's developing Vietnam strategy increases the risk of indefinite American involvement an unending Indochina war. While the President added nothing fundamentally to the old policy mix by his announcement of a withdrawal target of 45,000 troops over the next two months, his press conference remarks last week tended to confirm earlier fears about where he is heading.

title: Taiwan Was Never in U.N.
description: Letters to the Editor

title: I.L.A. and Management Meet Again In an Effort to Resolve Pier Dispute
description: Representatives of the International Longshoremen's Association and shipping management from six North Atlantic ports are scheduled to meet in Miami Beach today in what will be their first gathering since last Aug. 18.

title: Saigon's Food Prices Rise 50% After Devaluation
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 16 The talk on Saigon's streets and in its markets today was of the city's sharply rising prices and the Government's sharp devaluation of the piaster, which has caused a jump of nearly 50 per cent in the price of some foods.

title: Texts Issued by Cost of Living Council, Pay Board and Price Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Following are the texts of questions and answers issued today by the Cost of Living Council, the Pay Board and the Price Commission as official statements of policy:

title: Mexico Cuts Taipei Tie; Peking Recognition Seen
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 16Mexico announced tonight that it had broken diplomatic relations with the Taiwan Government of Generalissimo Chiang Kaishek.

title: Real Estate Editors Elect
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 16Glenn Fowler, real estate editor of The New York Times, today was elected vice president and presidentelect of the National Association of Real Estate Editors. Mr. Fowler will serve as vice president during 1972 and will automatically become president for 1973. Dick Turpin, real estate editor of The Los Angeles Times, becomes president for 1972.

title: A JERSEY JEWELER IS SLAIN IN HOLDUP
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Nov. 16 One of four gunmen was shot to death this morning and the owner of a jewelry store was mortally wounded in a holdup of his store on the main street here.

title: At 6, He Was a PurseSnatcher . . . And at 18, a Convicted Killer
description: When George Torres Santiago was 3 years old, his father abandoned him, his mother and another child. At 5, he stole candy. A year later, an older boy taught him how to snatch women's purses.

title: EXTENSION OF AID SNAGGED IN HOUSE
