description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The Senate voted unanimously today to extend the foreign aid program until Dec. 1 but the measure ran into a temporary roadblock when leaders sought to push it through the House of Representatives.

title: Retroactive Pay Increases
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Rights Panel A gain Assails Efforts by U.S Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The United States Commission on Civil Rights accused the Nixon Administration today of failing to enforce adequately civil rights laws andregulations. For the third time in a year, the investigatory and advisory body used strong language to criticize the Administration's enforcement effort.

title: Camaraderie on the Last Day of Peace
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 16 The closer they come to blows, the more warmly everybody loves everybody else. Theoretically, this was the last day of peace between Cassius Muhammad All Clay, the former heavyweight champion of the world, and Buster Mathis, the former heavyweight fighter, and still nobody had a harsh word for anybody. An insidious spirit of camaraderie infected even the rival trainers. Protocol dictates that when hostilities draw near, the men who preside in the gladiators corners must bickerover the rules, trade deadly insults and hint broadly that the other will try to slip a horseshoe into his man's glove. Yet when Angelo Dundee and Joe Fariello got together with Max Swindosky, an inspector for the Texas State Bureau of Labor Statistics that's the Southwestern equivalent of a boxing commission not a voice was raised in dispute.

title: City Moving Toward Tests To Cut Pollution by Cars
description: The door was opened yesterday for the city to begin experiments in the use of compressed or liquid natural gas or liquefied petroleum gas in motor vehicles to cut exhaust emission pollutants.

title: Corona Case Witness Dies
description: MARYSVILLE, Calif., Nov. 16 (UPI)A key witness in the case against Juan Corona, who is accused of killing 25 itinerant farm workers and burying their bodies along the Feather River, died today of injuries suffered in a barroom brawl. The victim was Roy Belong, 53 years old, a laborer.

title: Admiral's Elephant Starts Air Journey to a Coast Zoo
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 16 (AP)The admiral's elephant finally started on its way to Los Angeles today.

title: BIAS IS CHARGED ON G.I.'S IN ICELAND
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Representative Ronald V. Dellums of California charged today that an agreement between the United States and the Government of Iceland, through the Kennedy, Johnson and Nixon Administrations, limited the number of black troops assigned to American bases in that North Atlantic island nation.

title: Realtors Demand Exemptions for Rents
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 16 Spokesmen for landlords across the country made known today their demands for Phase Two of President Nixon's economic program. They argued that since property owners were unprotected from rising taxes and utility bills they were entitled to significant exemptions from rigid controls on the rents they were permitted to charge.

title: Spurring the Exodus
description: Letters to the Editor

title: More Work for More Money?
description: It takes a large pair of blinders to accept the city's contention that its new sanitation union contract fits inside the antiinflationary guideposts established by the Pay Board.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 9.

title: SOVIET AIDE URGES FAVORED U.S. TRADE
description: A Vice Minister of Foreign Trade of the Soviet Union, who met Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans in the United States last week and plans to see him again during the Secretary's forthcoming Russian trip, said here yesterday that we would like to receive mostfavorednation treatment from the United States as we have with most other countries.

title: Futures Trading Is Approved In Feeder Cattle at Chicago
description: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange announced yesterday that its proposed futures contract in feeder cattleimmature beef cattlehad been approved by the Commodity Exchange Authority.

title: TradeShow Expert Pays a Visit
description: Roger Dickson, a Yorkshireman and specialist in European trade fairs, arrived in the States Sunday for his sixth visit of 1971 and one that will take him to seven cities search of clients.

title: East Pakistan Town After Raid by Army: Fire and Destruction
description: SHEKHARNAGAR, Pakistan, Nov. 6 A task force of Pakistani troops visited this East Pakistani town of 8,000 on Oct. 27 and destroyed it.

title: Vigil for the Dead of Vietnam
BALM OF RANGERS GOES TO CANUCKS IN FIVEMAN DEAL
description: In a move designed to obtain emergency strength at defense, the Rangers traded Dave Balon, their leading goalscorer the last two seasons, to the Vancouver Canucks for Gary Doak yesterday.

title: McGovern Sets Fund Plea Over Television Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Senator George McGovern will appeal on television around the country this week for funds in support of his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: It's Taken 20 Years, but the Dome as a Home Is Catching On
description: Long hailed for its lightness, grace, strength and economy, the geodesic dome is, thanks in part to a Colorado commune, finally making it as housing.

title: 6 Illegal Aliens Found On Job in U.S. Building
description: The cafeteria in the Federal office building at 26 Federal Plaza has been raided by the Federal Immigration and Naturalization Service because it was employing illegal aliens. Six persons, including the chef, were detained, the service said yesterday.

title: U.S. Priest Slain in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 16 The Rev. William Evans, a Roman Catholic priest from Pittsfield, Mass., in charge of the Comilla National Church in East Pakistan, was shot to death by unknown assailants last Saturday, according to press reports today. He was slain while traveling by road from Dacca, the East Pakistani capital, to Buxnagar for Sunday services, the reports said.

title: High Court Secrets
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court's internal operations have been kept secret from the public at large. No serious challenge to this procedure has ever been mounted.

title: A Man of the Highest Personal Integrity
description: WASHINGTONLiberal opponents of Supreme Court nominee William H. Rehnquist will never find a more difficult target.

title: MEETING ADJOURNED BY TELEPROMPTER
description: The Teleprompter Corporation has adjourned its annual meeting until Nov. 30 from Nov. 24.

title: Profits Rise at Kresge, Lerner Stores and Edison
description: Higher consumer spending enabled three retail chains to increase sales and earnings in the latest quarter. Two set records, according to the reports issued yesterday by the S. S. Kresge Company and the Lerner Stores Corporation. Edison Brothers Stores, Inc., posted substantial gains.

title: JOCKEY SEARCHED AFTER BIG PAYOFF
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 16 (AP) Jon Kunitake, a Hawaiianborn jockey, was searched and questioned today by the stewards at Sportsman Park shortly after his mount won the second race to complete a $644.40 daily double.

title: SENATE APPROVES MORE TAX RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The Senate voted today to put into effect this year an additional $825million in tax relief for lowincome families.

title: Mills Fears U.S. Loses Leverage on Surcharge
description: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, expressed concern here yesterday that the United States had not been able to take advantage of the 10 per cent import surcharge to obtain quick realignments of major foreign currencies.

title: City Detective of Movie Fame Accused of Withholding Drugs
description: Edward Egan, the New York detective whose adventures are portrayed in the fastpaced film The French Connection, has been charged by the Police Department with failing to turn in small amounts of drugs and related equipment in 22 separate cases.

title: A MUSICAL GOAL: TO GO NOWHERE
description: Time moves on, and in its fullness brings us to the time of no movement. For centuries, composers worked to make their music move ahead, or seem to move ahead, employing crafty devices of key modulation, tempo shifts, leading tones and other illusions to suggest progress toward some destination. Now, as the fashion wheel spins, composers such as James Drew give us music that tries to go nowhere. Mr. Drew's work entitled almost stationary (1971), given its premiere at Town hall Monday night by the Philharmonia Trio, succeeded in that, at least,

title: ECONOMIC OFFICIAL QUITS POST IN BONN
description: BONN, Nov. 16  Philip Rosenthal, a prominent industrialist turned Social Democrat politician, resigned as State Secretary in the Economics Ministry today over what he charged was footdragging by the Government on legislation increasing worker benefits.

title: Craft Made Ready for Trip to Jupiter
description: REDONDO BEACH, Calif., Nov. 16As Mariner 9 continued to orbit the fourth planet, Mars, the finishing touches were being placed here on a spacecraft that should embark early next year on the first journey to the vicinity of the fifth and largest planet, Jupiter.

title: Secret Trial
description: In barring press and public from the extortion trial Carmine J. Persico. State Supreme Court Justice George Pastel takes the position that the accused is entitled waive his right to a public trial as guaranteed under the Sixth Amendment. The court thus accepts the defense counsel's claim that his client, by waiving this right, is actually insuring his right to a fair trial guaranteed by the same amendment.

title: SANITATION UNION WINS $1,710 RAISE IN 27MONTH PACT
description: The city and the sanitationmen's union reached agreement yesterday on a new 27month contract that city officials said would give the workers an aggregate pay increase of $1,710 each, or 15 per cent, and would assure more efficient and effective sanitation service.

title: Court Upholds Jersey Meadows Act
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Nov. 16  The legislation setting up the New Jersey Sports Authority and paving the way for relocation of the New York Football Giants In the Hackensack Meadowlands Stadium was de clared constitutional today by Superior Court Judge Morris Pashman.

title: 2 College Presidents on the Firing Line
description: University presidents are having their ups and downs.

title: Black Women Take Roles as Directors
description: In theatrical and film direction, where women of any race have been rare, at least five black women have emerged here as significant new voices in the shaping of black consciousness.

title: Gallery of Art Portfolios?
description: For the jobhunting, agency creative type a portfolio of previous work is a must and he's often asked to leave it behind for creative directors to look atat their leisure.

title: Braves Top Royals, 10298
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 16 (AP)The Buffalo Braves wiped out a 14point deficit in the second half and beat the Cincinnati Royals, 10298, tonight.

title: SCHOOL DECLINE REPORTED ON L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 16 Nassau and Suffolk County public schools have experienced an alarming decline in the quality of education in the last five years, a report by a task force of Assembly Democrats asserts.

title: Blues Ship Out Arbour
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 16 (UPI)The St. Louis Blues sent a defenseman, John Arbour, to the Denver farm club today to make room for Bill Plager, who started the season with the Blues, was sent to Denver and then recalled under emergency conditions when his brother, Bob, was injured.

title: Japanese Teams Combine To Trounce Orioles, 9 to 1
description: NAGOYA, Japan, Nov. 16 (AP)  The Yomiuri Giants teamed with the Nagoya Chunichi Dragon today to defeat the Baltimore Orioles, 91, behind the fourhit pitching of Mitsuo Inaba and Hisatoshi Ito.

title: Mujib Feeble, Bengali Aide Says Here
Midget Autos at Garden
description: Racing of T.Q. () midget automobiles will make its debut at Madison Square Garden on Friday at 8 P.M. A total of 34 of the tiny automobiles will be involved in the seven championship races, with 14 of them competing in the final and featured race of 25 laps.

title: Yorty Enters Race; Eyes 2 Primaries
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 16 Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles announced today that he would seek the Democratic Presidential nomination and enter the New Hampshire primary, the nation's first, on March 7.

title: Stage: Caught in the Sway of a SeaChanged Pinter
description: The past then is another country, a landscape vague with memories, forgotten like Freud, seachanged with the deep realization of present realities. I am talking about Harold Pinter's new play, Old Times, which opened last night at the Billy Rose Theater, and is the finest play yet of a master dramatist and lends its luster to a New York season that so far needs all the luster it can acquire. But by the standards of any season, past, present or future, this is a marvelous play, beautiful, meaningful and lyric. A joyous, wonderful play, that people will talk about as long as we have a theater.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Ford Motor Company of Canada Ltd., announced that Roy Bennett, 43yearold president, was elected to the additional post of chief executive officer. Mr. Bennett succeeds Karl Scott who is retiring as chairman and chief executive officer but who will remain as a director. The Ford Motor Company subsidiary also elected William L. Hawkins as a director and vice president. He will be general manager of the sales division.

title: REPUBLIC STEEL CUTS PAYOUT 15C
description: The Administration's economic stabilization program was cited yesterday for at least two reductions in dividends. Directors of the Republic Steel Corporation reduced the quarterly dividend to 25 cents a share from previous payments of 40 cents. The dividend will be payable Dec. 20 to holders of record Nov. 26.

title: Unyielding Editor Norman Cousins
description: It's the kind of wrench that goes up your spine and right to your soul. With those words, 56yearold Norman Cousins tried yesterday to describe how he felt about resigning as editor of the Saturday Review. When he joined the magazine in 1940, its circulation was 20,000. Now, he said, it is 660.000. At the time we began, he noted, there was something of an unwritten law that no magazine of ideas could have a circulation of more than 30,000. I think that was a lot like the fourminute mile, and when we cracked through the umbrella, we saw a lot of sky up there.

title: Fournier Queried by Judge
description: PARIS, Nov. I6Paul Fournier, the French counterespionage agent who was indicted in New Jersey yesterday on charges of heroin trafficking, was questioned for five hours here this morning by an examining magistrate.

title: Pan Am Elects President; Halaby Is Still Chairman
description: Pan American World Airways, beset by slumping finances and internal squabbles, announced yesterday the election of William T. Seawell, a onetime Air Force general, to be its new president and chief operating officer.

title: Abel, Red Spy, Dies; Freed in 1962 Swap
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16  Col. Rudolf Abel, whose name became almost a synonym for master spy after the disclosure of his nine years of successful undercover operation in the United States, died yesterday of lung cancer at the age of 68.

title: MRS. HUBERT A. KENNY
description: NEW MILFORD, Conn., Nov. 16Mrs. Ellsworth Newcomb Kenny, widow of Hubert A. Kenny, with whom she wrote educational books for children, died here yesterday in a nursing home. She was 71 years old and lived in Washington, Conn.

title: Volume Goes Up and Up at Pink Floyd's Concert
description: Pink Floyd posed an interesting question at its Carnegie Hall concert Monday night: Is pain a viable form of musical enjoyment? No, I'm not being entirely facetious. By the end of the program, my hearing mechanism felt as though it had been assaulted by sounds just this side of the decibel output of an atomic bomb. And yet, surprisingly, there were times when the loudness itselfpain and allacted as a quite effective element in the music's dramatic contrasts.

title: Out of the Swamp?
description: LONDONThe probability is that real peace negotiations and direct secret contacts between the United States and Communist sides in the Vietnam war will start some time this winter. Such is the clear inference to be drawn from President Nixon's outline of the American position last Friday.

title: Kleindienst, at Bribery Trial, Says He Rejected Campaign Offer of $100,000
description: The Federal Deputy Attorney General, Richard G. Kleindienst, testified at a bribery trial yesterday that he had been offered up to $100,000 as a campaign contribution for President Nixon if he would help a defendant who had been indicted in New York.

title: Lakers Rout Cavaliers
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 16 (AP) Jerry West and Gail Goodrich sparked the Los Angles Lakers to a 10890 triumph over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.

title: INDIAN FUND GIVEN $1.2MILLION GRANT
description: The Ford Foundation announced yesterday its largest single grant to American Indians, a $1.2million grant to the Native American Rights Fund, for the litigation of a number of issues affecting American Indians.

title: BULLETS CONQUER ROCKETS, 110107
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 16 (UPI) Phil Chenier sank one of two free throws with 11 seconds left to break a 107107 tie and lead the Baltimore Bullets to a 110107 National Basketball Association victory over the Houston Rockets tonight.

title: The 600,000 Coupons They Collected May Help to Save Lives
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N.J.  It took a group of women here only six months to decide that they didn't want their new organization, formed largely for social purposes, to spend its time playing cards or engaging in other frivolous pursuits.

title: ELINA MOONEY ADDS MYSTERY TO DANCE
description: Elina Mooney engineers machinesmooth dances and then injects little movement oddities into them that ruffle their surface calm in interesting ways. Monday evening at the Cubiculo, she offered the first of two different programs of her work.

title: CONTROLS LINKED TO COOPERATION
description: Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said yesterday that, with the total cooperation of the American people, the country could get back to a free economy, with no controls, by the end of 1972.

title: U.SCANADA BOARD FOR ENERGY URGED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 16Senator Henry M. Jackson called today for the establishment of a broad North American energy policy that would coordinate the development of fuel sources in the United States and Canada. He suggested a joint twonation energy board.

title: Fioravanti Dell Agnese Is Dead; ExManager of Waldorf Towers
description: Fioravanti Dell Agnese, who brought a touch of preWorld War I courtliness to the Waldorf Towers, which he managed from 1945 to 1965, died Monday night in St. Clare's Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in Rowayton, Conn.

title: CONSULATE CITED IN NARCOTICS PLOT
description: NEWARK, Nov. 16A former French counterespionage agent pleaded guilty today to smuggling $12million worth of heroin into the United States. According to a statement produced by the prosecution, he had a contact in the French Consulate in New York City.

title: PORTUGAL MOVING TO HALT SUBVERSION
description: LISBON, Nov. 16The Portuguese Government, concerned by increasing acts of political sabotage, has asked Parliament to consider the state of subversion in the country.

title: A G.A.O. Statement On Poultry Plants Cites Uncleanliness
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The General Accounting, Office issued today its third report in two years asserting that many if not most of the nation's poultry processing plants are unsanitary.

title: Senator Kennedy Hints Opposition to Rehnquist
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy charged yesterday that William H. Rehnquist, one of President Nixon's nominees for the Supreme Court, had been the prime defender of the Administration's most backward constitutional positions.

title: Congress Gets Nixon Bid For New Eximbank Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 President Nixon sent Congress today a technical appropriations proposal that would permit the ExportImport Bank to begin its longdelayed program of discount loans for shortterm export credits issued by banks.

title: Brazil Acts to Assure Uruguay, Nervous if Leftists Win Election
description: SANT ANA DO LIVRAMENTO, Brazil, Nov. 12Little. Uruguay has gone into the final two weeks of a strong leftist drive in her presidential election campaign, with occasional nervous glances north across the border at huge, Brazil, whose military Government is uncompromisingly hostile to the Marxist left.

title: Rockets Beat Pacers, 110108
description: DENVER, Nov. 16 (AP)Julius Keye sank two free throws with 10 seconds remaining to clinch a 111108 victory for the Denver Rockets tonight and knock the Indiana Pacers out of first place in the A.B.A. West.

title: Romney Promises Review of Housing Opposed in Queens
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  George W. Romney, Secretary, of Housing and Urban Development, promised today an immediate and thorough review of plans approved yesterday by the department for an 840unit lowincome housing development in Forest Hills, a Middle  income section of Queens.

title: Paris Fire Sets Off Blasts
description: PARIS, Nov. 16 (AP) Dynamite blasts were heard across Paris tonight as fire swept a former German blockhouse under demolition just off the ChampsElyses. Blazing remains of straw bales that had been set up to contain demolition blasts started fires in 10 nearby buildings. The police evacuated their occupants and no injuries were reported,

title: Princeton Viewed as Too Good For Dartmouth to Take Lightly
description: Darmouth's upset victory over unbeaten Cornell put the Hanover Indians right back Into the Ivy League championship race, but Jake Crouthamel can be forgiven for some apprehension.

title: Westinghouse to Construct Plants for Utilities in Spain
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said today it had received contracts valued at more than $300million to provide nuclear power plants to utilities in Spain.

title: G.M. to Notify Corvair Owners of Possible Defects
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The General Motors Corporation has agreed to notify owners of 786,000 Chevrolet Corvairs of possible health and safety hazards in the heating systems of their cars.

title: Working Sessions of Arms Talks Get Off to Constructive Start
description: VIENNA, Nov. 16  The sixth round of United StatesSoviet talks on strategic missiles got off to an optimistic start today at the 93d working session since the talks began in Helsinki two years ago.

title: Rhodesian Exiles Reject Reported British Terms
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Nov. 16 A group of Black Rhodesian political exiles asserted today that Britain was willing to postpone majority, or black, rule in Rhodesia for 30 years.

title: Bridge: Tournaments at Rubber Play Being Promoted by the Aces
description: Duplicate players are gregarious, happy with the hustlebustle of tournament play. Rubber bridge players, by and large, prefer the privacy of home or club. For this reason past attemps to organize tournaments for rubber bridge players have met with limited success.

title: China, in a Mistake, Supports South Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16  The Chinese delegation's newness to United Nations procedures was demonstrated this afternoon in the special political committee during a hand vote on a draft resolution for the dissemination of information on South Africa's policies.

title: COURT FREES MAN JAILED 2 YEARS
description: A man who has served more than two and a half years of a 15year sentence for attempted murder and attempted robbery was ordered freed yesterday, and all charges against him dropped.

title: WHITE HOUSE WEIGHS REVISION IN PENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) The White House is considering a proposed revision in the Social Security accounting system that would benefit taxpayers as well as pensioners in 1972.

title: Cerro's Peru Strike Ends
description: The Cerro Corporation announced yesterday that 13,000 workers at mining and metallurgical operations of its Peruvian supbsidiary, the Cerro de Pasco Corporation, had returned to work, ending a strike that began Oct. 28. Production was being restored at all six Cerro de Pasco mining operations, while smelting and refining facilities were expected to return to full production within a few days.

title: Notes on People
description: Vice President Agnew, in Los Angeles, rhetorically ridiculed some Democratic presidential hopefuls, char acterizing them as inept foot ball players.

title: Two Accused of Attempt To Self Two Children
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 17 (AP)A Boy Scout master and a companion, charged with trying to sell an Oklahoma City woman's two stnall chil dren for $7,000 and a used car, were held without bond today in the Duval County jail.

title: Stars Defeat Pacers
description: STALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 17 (AP)Two free throws by Zelmo Beaty with seven seconds remaining gave the Utah Stars a 113111 victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight.

title: LINDSAY LINKS ART TO FATE OF CITIES
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 17 Mayor Lindsay linked tonight the future of art with the fate of the cities in a speech to a glittering, blacktie dinner that dedicated the expansion of the New Orleans Museum of Arts.

title: J. Howard Edmondson Dead; Governor of Oklahoma at 33
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 17 (AP)J. Howard Edmondson, who at the age of 33 became the youngest Governor in Okla homa's history and the young est in the country, died today of a heart attack at his home in Edmond. He was 46 years old.

title: ATHENS SPOKESMAN DENIES PERSECUTION
description: ATHENS, Nov. 17The mili taryhacked government reject ed today allegations that Greeks were being persecuted for their political beliefs and described conditions in Greek jails as far better than in most other countries.

title: Books of The Times
description: SIGMUND FREUD. By Richard Wollhaim 292 pages. Viking. Hardcover, $7.50; paper, $3.25.

title: USLIFE Corp. Reports Climb in Quarterly Profit
description: The USLIFE Corporation reported yesterday that third quarter net income rose to $6 million, or 71 cents a share, from $4.8million, or 57 cents a share a year ago.

title: Lefkowitz Seeks to Halt CoOp Apartment Sales at Sutton Place
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz moved in State Supreme Court yesterday to en join the owners of a 20story Sutton Place apartment house from trying to make their 172 tenants buy their apartments at a total cost of more than $6 million more than the assessed valuation.

title: Chamber Series in Capital
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, which is a resident performing organiza tion at Alice Tully Hall, will play three concerts this season at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington. The series, to be gin Dec. 11, is regarded as a pilot program exploring pos sible permanent affiliation of the Chamber Music Society with Kennedy Center as well as with Lincoln Center.

title: Old Times Ushers in New Pinter Era
description: Old Timess is the now Pinter. Not just his latest play, but the first fulllength example of Harold Pinter in a new period. As always, Pinter himself is unwilling to label, analyze, or make judgments about his work, saying, I leave that to others who seem to be only too happy to do so. But on the occasion of the open ing of Old Times, he agreed to a rare interview.

title: Dominican Aides Allegedly Linked To Car Theft Ring
description: Two men, arrested yesterday following their indictment by a Bronx grand jury, were de scribed in court by District At torney Burton B. Roberts as members of a huge car theft ring linked to officials of the Dominican Republic.

title: Thai Parliament Is Ended; Leaders Seize Full Power
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Thurs day, Nov. 18A group of mili tary and other leaders headed by Premier Thanom Kittika chorn seized full powers yester day to deal with the dangers that have been threatening Thailand.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TUNIS, Tunisia, Nov, 17 (AP) President Habib Bourguiba said today that a federation between Israel and her Arab neighbors was the only posi tive solution to the Middle East conflict. The Tunisian leader stressed in an interview that 20 or 30 years might elapse before an ArabIsraeli federa tion became practicable.

title: U.S. AIDE DEPLORES CLASSACTION SUITS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (AP)  The Solicitor General, urged the Supreme Court today to curtail suits by individuals and groups against actions taken by executive and legisla tive branches of government.

title: MORTON ASKS. SHIFT ON MINERAL LEASING
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 17 (AP)  Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton has pro posed two new laws to tighten mining and mineral leasing practices on Federal land so as to bring the Government more income and the states a share in the profit.

title: Leafs Down Kings, 51
description: TORONTO, Nov. 17 (UPI) Ron Ellis scored two second period goals and assisted on a thirdperiod goal by Paul Hen derson to pace the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 51 victory over the Los Angeles Kings tonight.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: NEWARK BOYS SHOW EXUBERANCE IN SONG
description: Although the Newark Boys Chorus has been singing hither and yon around the country, on radio and on television since 1966, Tuesday night marked the group's first formal recital across the river in New York and Town Hall was nearly full for the occasion.

title: PINDER DEFEATS VASQUEZ IN BOUT
description: Davey Vasquez of New York spent the better part of 12 rounds trying to escape from a human buzzsaw named En rique Pinder of Panama last night in Madison Square Gar den.

title: Advertising:
description: Television broadcasters should require that paid polit ical messages be at least five minutes in length, the head of a major ad agency said yesterday.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: Wembley, England  Jerry Quarry, 203 pounds, Bellflower, Calif., knocked out Jack Bodell, 204, Britain, 1 round.

title: Bayh to Query Alleged Membership of Rehnquist in RightWing Organization
description: A spokesman for Senator Birch Bayh, Democrat of Indi ana, said in Washington yester day that Mr. Bayh Intended to raise before the Senate Judi ciary Committee questions about William H. Rehnquist's alleged membership in Arizonans for America, a rightwing organi zation that was based in Phoe nix.

title: Bond Rates Rise;
description: New corporate and taxex empt bonds, carrying yields well above those of early No vember, succeeded in attracting investors in the credit markets yesterday.

title: New Rules on Draft Are Held Invidious By War Objectors
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17 Proposed new draft rules affect ing conscientious objectors were denounced here today by the Central Committee for Con scientious Objectors.

title: Music: Rossini Mass
description: There is probably nothing in music quite like Rossini's Petite messe solennelle. Writ ten in 1863, some 30 years after he had stopped compos ing works of any dimension, it combines touches of his old operatic style with an awareness of the new ideas developing in music during the 19th century. And, as Rossini originally conceived it, the scoring is odd. It calls for a tiny chorus, four vocal soloists, two pianos and har monium.

title: Military Race Relations Held Explosive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Congressional Black Cau cus's ad hoc hearings into rac ism in the military heard warnings today from Congress men, Army officers and a for mer Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense that race relations in the armed services were ex plosive.

title: School Issues Backed
description: New York State's chief fiscal officer yesterday forcefully de fended taxexempt school bonds  a type of financing that recently has run into dif ficulty.

title: Garbage and Grand Jury Figure in Howard Hughes Controversy
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 17  Howard Hughes, is gone from here but the battle lingers on, with a Miami grand jury sift ing testimony and Hughes de tectives sifting the garbage of a man who has sued the mys terious billionaire.

title: Romney Backs Temporary Rent Curb
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 17  Property owners were chided today by George Romney, Sec retary of Housing and Urban Development, for objecting to continued rent control under Phase Two of President Nixon's economic recovery program.

title: RhodesiaTrade Ban Seen Ineffective
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 17Despite the total British ban on trade with Rhodesia, $3million paper mill that was in England until recently is now operating here. It was moved first to a third country, then to Rhodesia.

title: 60 U.S. ART WORKS BRING $1MILLION
description: A sale of 60 contemporary American art works that brought few real surprises but spread relief In the New York and West Coast art worlds racked up slightly less than $1 million last evening at Parke Bernet Galleries, 980 Madison Avenue.

title: Stage: Richard Farina
description: There are those shows that you see and you ask, how? Richard Farina: Long Time Coming and a Long Time Crone, which last night opened at the Fortune Thea ter, is the kind of show that prompts the rather more un charitable question of why?

title: Bruins, Seals Swap Centers
description: BOSTON, Nov. 17 (AP)The Boston Bruins traded today a center, Ivan Boldirev, to the California Golden Seals for a center, Chris Oddliefson, and a player to be named later.

title: Prices on Amex and OTC Off As Pace of Trading Slackens
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthecount er market tried hard to register their second consecutive ad vance yesterday but just fell short as the trading pace slack ened.

title: Eastern College Football
description: Ed Marinero of Cornell, Lydell Mitchell of Penn State and Hank Bjorklund of Princeton make a good trio of running backs for an East ern allstar team. For those who prefer to use two run ners and a flankerback in stead of three runnrs, there is Mike Siani of Villanova, one of the best flankers in the nation. The se four players have established enough records to keep any statistician happy for days.

title: Carson Takes Stand to Deny Any Bribing in StockFraud Case
description: Robert T. Carson testified in his own defense yesterday that he neither asked for any money nor tried to quash any indict ments while serving as the administrative aide to Senator Hiram L. Fong of Hawaii.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Nov. 5 news story concerning Columbia University being warned by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare brings to mind important questions that universities are going to have to face in the near future.

title: MRS. ZIMMERMANN
description: AMITYVILLE, L. L, Nov. 17 Mrs. Frances Short Zimmer mann, a real estate broker who had resided here for 50 years, died of cancer yesterday at her home, 55 Bayview Avenue. She was 64 years old.

title: Airline Heads Near Accord on Atlantic Issues
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 17The presidents of 24 airlines neared agreement today on two issues that have threatened to bring North Atlantic airfare war in February.

title: Sanctuary for the Sea
description: The mighty oceans are in danger. As Jacques Cousteau observed in testimony before a Senate subcommittee, chemical pollution and reckless exploitation disrupt what are actually innumerable delicate balances between life and death in the world's oceans.

title: Native Women of Alaska Unite in Fight to Uplift Their People
description: ANCHORAGEBack about five years, when she left her village of Barrow and went to work in faroff Wash ington, D. C., as a 22yearold receptionist for Ernest Gruening, then one of Alaska's Senators, Brenda Itta quickly became known as that Eskimo girl.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and the Ameri can Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of listed companies. The reports include the follow ing:

title: United Nations Notes
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17City policemen safe guarding the Soviet mission from attack want to be help ful, but the Russians them selves say there are limits to what they will accept.

title: I.C.C., Responding to Nader, Puts Smokers in Rear of Bus
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI)  The Interstate Com merce Commission, answering a petition from Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, ordered today special sections reserved for smokers in the rear of all 23,000 interstate buses.

title: CONCERT OFFERS PLEASING CHANGE
description: A welcome and refreshing change from runofthemill symphonic programs was brought to Philharmonic Hall Tuesday night by Eugene Or mandy and the Philadelphia Orchestra.

title: Accord on Cable TV Is Faulted For Allegedly Neglecting Public
description: The Center for Policy Re search has voiced regret that the accord reached last week between broadcasters and cable television operators did not in corporate specific provisions for public use of cable facilities.

title: Aid for Nonpublic Schools Held Limited
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17Dr. Sidney P. Marland Jr., the Com missioner of Education, said today that he knew of no legal means to allocate public funds directly to nonpublic schools or to the parents of children who attend them.

title: Coup in Thailand
description: Thailand's reversion to absolute rule under its long time Premier, Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn, reflects the mounting pressure of changing American policies on one of this country's closest allies in Asia.

title: Richey Overcomes Hoad In S. Africa, 64, 36, 64
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Nov. 17 (Reuters)Ag gressive play by top seeded Cliff Richey gave him a 64, 36, 63 victory over Lew Hoad, the Australian who lives in Spain, in the $40,000 Clows roundrobin tennis tournament today.

title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY JUDY JOHNSON, FROM ALLAdvt.
description: HAPPY BIRTHDAY JUDY JOHNSON, FROM ALLAdvt.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 17 (UPI) An air pollution alert has been issued for Tennessee east of the Cumberland Plateau.

title: Market Place: Critic Inspects Sanitas Figure
description: If you were a potential in vestor in the Sanitas Service Corporation, which is listed on the American Stock Ex change and which plans to offer 800,000 common shares to the public in midDecem ber, you would find a wealth of detail in the red herring, or preliminary prospectus, is sued on Nov. 4.

title: Negro Bar Group Protests
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  The National Bar Association, an organization of Negro lawyers, announced its opposition today to the nomination of Wil liam H. Rehnquist to the Su preme Court.

title: News of Dogs
description: Anthony Stamm a Mich igan state Senator serving his second fouryear term, is chairman of the powerful State Affairs Committee. He is also a powerful figure in the dogShow world, for he is one of the top judges in America and his Anstamm Kennels have dominated the Scottie breed in the Middle West for a decade. In politics and with dogs, he believes in the positive approach.

title: PANEL BACKS BILL ON DRUG CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  A compromise bill creating a spe cial White House action office on drug abuse was reported out of the Senate Committee on Government Operations today.

title: 2 in Congress Say States Hold Up Anticrime Grants
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) Two Democratic Representa tives charged today that state red tape was keeping millions in Federal crimefighting funds from the big cities. They also accused Attorney General John N. Mitchell of trying to fool Americans into thinking that the crime rate is falling.

title: MRS. ROBERT SLAUSON
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 17 Mrs. Dorothy Wheeler Osborn Slauson, widow of Robert Royer Slauson, long an account executive with Dominick & Dominick, Inc., the brokerage house in New York, died last night at her home here after a brief illness. She was 67 years old.

title: Sayers in Hospital Again
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17 (AP) Gale Sayers, injuryjinxed Chi cago Bear star, was hospital ized today with a skin boil on his left knee. A team doctor said Sayers would undergo sev eral days of rest and observa tion.

title: F.T.C. Calls Zerex Ad Accurate, Drops Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Federal Trade Commission acknowledged today that it had made a mistake in charging the manufacturer of Zerex anti freeze with false advertising.

title: ChristianMoslem Cooperation. For Peace Is Urged by Vatican
description: ROME, Nov. 17The Vatican urged Christians and Moslems today to increase their coop eration to help avoid bloodshed and suffering on the Indian sub continent and in the Middle East.

title: DEMOISELLE WON BY DRESDEN DOLL
description: Gene St. Leon, an apprentice, picked up a mount in the $36, 000 Demoiselle Stakes at Aqueduct yesterday, then pro ceeded to pick up the jockey's share of the $21,600 that went to the winner.

title: Rockets Finally Win
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17 (AP)The Houston Rockets snapped their eightgame los ing streak tonight by rallying to defeat the Philadelphia 76ers, 118112.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Even the nonvoting kibitzers in the Baseball Writers Association usually succumb to temptation and prepare in advance to secondguess the duly appointed committees of 24 in elections for the most valuable player in each league. The only time they refrain is when their choices are so obvious as to preclude debate.

title: Firearms Chief Appointed
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the appointment of Daniel Greer, a 31yearold lawyer, as director of the Firearms Control Board. Mr. Greer, who has been with the Lindsay administration since its start in 1966, will have charge of licensing and regu lating the sale, disposition, ownership and possession of of rifles, shotguns and am munition.

title: City Aide Named To Succeed Lacot In Lincoln Hospital
description: Julio Cesar Galarce, a 42 yearold Puerto Rican, was chosen yesterday to be execu tive director of Lincoln Hospi tal, the dilapidated municipal institution founded in 1839 that serves 350,000 impoverished residents of the South Bronx.

title: India Charges Intrusion
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 17In dian troops today repulsed Pak istani soldiers trying to enter Indian territory at Boyra in West Bengal, the Indian news agency, Press Trust of India, reported, quoting official sources. The Pakistanis suffered heavy casualties, the report said.

title: Forrester Pierce, 77, Dies: Physical Education Aide
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Nov. 17For rester W. Pierce, retired direc tor of physical education at the Lawrence High School, Law rence, L. I., died yesterday at Holy Cross Hospital in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., where he had been living. He was 77 years old.

title: California Has Chance To Play in Rose Bowl
description: The University of California, currently carrying an asterisk at the bottom of the Pacific Eight Conference football stand ing, could wind up as the league's Rose Bowl representa tive on New Year's Day.

title: CANUCKS BEATEN BY HAWKS, 3 TO 0
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17 (UPI) Tony Esposito recorded his third shutout of the season to night, stopping 18 shots by the Vancouver Canucks in a 30 triumph for the Chicago Black Hawks in the National Hockey League.

title: Thant on Mend
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17Secretary General Thant, who entered LeRoy Hospital Nov. 2 for treatment of a duodenal ulcer, has been advised by his doctors to re main there at least until the end of next week. A spokes man said that Mr. Thant was not in pain but that the ulcer had not yet healed completely.

title: New Lockheed Borrowing Of $25Million Permitted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reuters)  The Emergency. Loan Guarantee Board an nounced today its approval, of, a request by the Lockheed Air craft Corporation for permis sion to borrow an additional $25million.

title: Mayor Gives Terms of Lifted Freeze in Controversial Municipal Loan Plan
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the freeze on payments to borrowers from the Municipal Loan Program would be lifted, and he set forth the conditions the bor rowers would have to meet. The payments were halted last July pending an investigation of allegations of fraud and cor ruption in the program, which was set up nine years ago to provide lowcost, longterm loans for rehabilitation of slum buildings.

title: Zeno, Giants Rookie End, Breaks Arm in Practice
description: Coleman Zeno, the New York Giants rookie split end from Grambling with so much talent and so much promise, broke his left arm during practice at Yankee Stadium yesterday and will miss the rest of the season.

title: Nixon Chooses Official
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reuters)President Nixon to day announced his intention ter nominate Edgar R. Fiedler as Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for Economic Policy, succeeding Murray L. Weiden baum.

title: China's Delegates to U.N. Are Listed, With Job Titles
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17A list of the mem bers of Peking's delegation to the United Nations became available today, providing the names of the members and their job designations. It has not been disclosed what the specific duties of each member are in every case, but Kao Liang, for example, who is listed merely as a secretary, has been acting as coordinator and press officer for the delegation and was the head of the advance team that came here before the full delegation arrived.

title: A Student Who Blends Liberal Arts With the Art of Cooking
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.We forget that food comes mostly from the earth, from natural life, and that it should be eaten in natural places, restaurants true to themselves and true to their customers, not extracted from some entrepreneur's mind or plastiform mold.

title: NIXON WILL DEFER ACTION ON CHROME
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 President Nixon signed legisla tion today that would effec tively terminate the ban on the importation of Rhodesian chrome as of Jan. 1.

title: N.B.C. Head Awarded Medal
description: Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Com pany, has been named the re cipient of the 1972 Gold Medal of the International Radio and Television Society.

title: Tropical Storm Devastates Parts of 2 Cuban Provinces
description: MIAMI, Nov. 17 (UPI) Tropical storm Laura devastat ed parts of two provinces of Cuba, killed at least one per son, destroyed more than 20 homes and seriously damaged the tobacco crop, the Havana radio reported tonight.

title: Pollution Is High In a Broad Area; U.S Aides to Act
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 17 (UPI)Air pollution soared to twice the Federal alert level for the second consecutive day today and Federal officials said they would take legal action to curtail emissions from 23 local industrial plants.

title: Thanat Counsels Calm
description: BANGKOK, Nov. 17 (UPI) Foreign Minister Thanat, who was attending a dinner at the foreign correspondents club to night when the takeover was announced, said he doubted that China policy had had any thing to do with the coup.

title: AGENCY APPROVES HARLEM PROJECT
description: As a catalyst for economic resurgence of 125th Street, the City Planning Commission ap proved a zoning change yester day to permit construction of a 14story commercial and of fice building near Lenox Ave nue.

title: Beaunit Is Licensed For BanLon Name In Making Carpets
description: BanLon, the trademark that has helped to sell about $5bil lion worth of apparel since it was started some 18 years ago, is moving into a new industry for the first time.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS 32 ON 25 HIJACKINGS
description: NEWARK, Nov. 17 (AP)A Federal grand jury indicted 32 men here today on kidnapping and robbery charges related to more than 25 truck hijackings involving about $1million worth of merchandise.

title: IN THE NATION
description: A clash between New York City and Federal housing officials, on the one hand, and some aroused residents of Queens on the other, has achieved the remarkable feat of bringing Conserva tive Senator James Buckley and liberal Democratic Representative Ben Rosen thal into tacit alliance on behalf of the residents.

title: Two Suspects Are Arrested in Killing Of Woman in Lower East Side Project
description: Two men were arrested yes terday in the slaying on Nov. 8 of a 63yearold housewife and the beating of her 38 yearold daughter in the Baruch Houses on the Lower East Side.

title: Gladys Cooper, British Actress, Dies
description: LONDON, Nov. 17Gladys Cooper, the actress who charmed three generations of theatergoers, died in her sleep today at the age of 82.

title: MURPHY TO EXPAND AUXILIARY PROGRAM
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yester day plans to reorganize and expand the department's auxil iary police program, in which nearly 3,100 unpaid civilian volunteers work parttime aid ing the police.

title: CONTINENTAL PLANS NO FAULT COVERAGE
description: The Continental Insurance Companies said yesterday that they would seek permission to offer a nofault automobile insurance program in more than 40 states where there is no legislation requiring nofault coverage.

title: SELFREGULATION IN STOCKS BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Securities and Exchange Commission told Congress to day that it did not need new statutory powers with which to regulate the securities industry but only the budget and per sonnel to use fully the powers it already has.

title: Key Labor Leaders Back Continued Pay Board Role
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 17A large majority of the A.F.L.C.I.O. Executive Council indicated today its support for a continuing labor presence on the Pay Board. George Meany, president of the Amer ican Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganizations, hinted during meeting of the council this morning that he planned to remain on the board for now at least, even though he ob jected to many of its poli cies and decisions, federation sources reported.

title: OFFICERS SHIFTED IN INDIAN BUREAU
description: RENO, Nov. 17  Another shakeup in the Interior Depart ment's Bureau of Indian Af fairs, which has been torn by strife between young activist Indians and oldline officials, most of them white, was an nounced here today by, Indian Commissioner Louis Rooks Bruce Jr.

title: Fire Ruins College Facilities
description: WESTERVILLE, Ohio, Nov. 17 (UPI)Fire last night de stroyed an observatory, plane tarium and science laboratory housed on the top floor of McFadden Hall at Ottenbein College in this. Columbus sub urb.

title: Stallworth Helps Bullets
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 17 (AP) Jack Mann and Dave Stall worth sank 9 points each in the third period tonight to pace the Baltimore Bullets over the poor shooting Cincinnati Roy als, 113103.

title: Mother and Son Rescue 7 in Blaze
description: A 16yearold boy and his mother yesterday passed seven of the boy's brothers and sisters through a rear window of a burning build ing. Their efforts were cred ited with saving the children from death or serious injury in a fire that was alleged to have been set by their es tranged father, the fire mar shal's office said.

title: CANADA SELECTS HEAD OF KEY PANEL
description: TORONTO, Nov. 17After a long, difficult search, the Gov ernment has recruited H. An thony Hampson, a 41yearold Montreal financier and econo mist, to be chairman of a new body designed to strengthen Canadianowned industry and to ward off additional foreign ownership and control.

title: Horton Undergoes Surgery
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17 (AP) Willie Horton, Detroit Tiger outfielder, underwent surgery today for removal of hemor roids.

title: FIREMEN INMATE RULEBOOK TACTIC TO GET NEW PACT
description: The city's firefighters began using new pressure tactics yes terday in an effort to force the Lindsay administration to grant them a new contract. The old contract expired Dec. 31, 1970.

title: Maoist Modesty at the U.N.
description: We should always be modest, Chairman Mao Tse tung has said. In our international relations, we Chinese people should get rid of greatpower chauvinism reso lutely, thoroughly, and completely.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: There is a certain irony in the plight of financially troubled Columbia Uni versity as the Department of Health, Education and Welfare threatens to deprive it of all present and future Federal contract funds. (News story, Nov. 5). At issue is Columbia's failure to comply with the regulations by which H.E.W. is attempting to enforce compliance with the Executive order prohibiting discrimination in employ ment.

title: COMMISSION LETS AMERICAN MOTORS RAISE PRICES 2.5%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  The American Motors Corpora tion won from the Price Com mission today an immediate 2.5 per cent price increase on its 1972 models. Two other car manufacturers appealed for 2 per cent and 5.9 per cent ad vances.

title: A Senate Aide Investigating Mafia Is Beaten and Robbed
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. Nov. 17 (AP)Unidentified assail ants clubbed a Senate commit tee investigator who was in quiring into Mafia operations and stole secret papers from his hotel room last night, the police reported.

title: Dr. Harry Charipper, 71, Dies; Led N.Y.U. Biology Department
description: Dr. Harry A. Charipper, who retired in 1965 as head of New York University's biology de partment, died yesterday in Peninsuala General Hospital Center, Edgemere, Queens, after suffering a stroke. He was 71 years old and lived at 236 Beach 149th Street, Rockaway Beach, Queens.

title: Gas Main Break Kills Six
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 17 (AP) Six men were killed and at least six others were overcome by fumes today when a gas main ruptured in a pit beneath a street intersection. A spokes man at Allegheny General Hospital said six men, em ployes of the Equitable Gas Company, were dead on arrival at the hospital. The dead were identified as Albert Zeleny, William Letzkus, Donald De vine, Raymond Grundler, Mon roe Coleman and Charles J., Patassi.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Nov. 8 account of the new re port by state officials on the effec tiveness of the recently enacted Jaw requiring certain categories of welfare recipients to report to state employ ment centers to receive their checks and to accept jobs or training offered them contains a more important revela tion than the fact that, in September, jobs were found for 6 per cent of these employable relief clients.

title: U.S. ACTS TO EASE MEATPACKER BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today the Government would move to amend a 50yearold con sent decree that prohibits the nation's largest meat packers from dealing in a broad range of other food products.

title: BLUE IS SELECTED AS MOST VALUABLE
description: Vida Blue, the lefthanded pitcher of the Oakland Ath letics, was voted the American League's mostvaluable player yesterday.

title: American Skaters Dominate Speed Races in Germany
description: INZELL, Germany, Nov. 17 (AP)Americans dominated the men's and women's 500meter speed skating races today on mzell's artificial rink.

title: Personal Finance
description: Harassed by creditors? Worried that they will tell your employer about your heavy debts, thus causing you to lose face or even your job? Help is on the way, according to Richard A. Givens, regional director here for the Federal Trade Commission.

title: A.M.C. Posts Profit for Year;
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17  The American Motors Corporation reported today earnings of $10.2million, or 40 cents a share, for the 1971 fiscal year, in contrast to a loss of $56, million in the 1970 period.

title: Fleet and Gypsy Cab Men Assail Lazar's Proposals
description: Spokesmen for both the me dallion taxi industry and the socalled gypsycab drivers yes terday sharply criticized Taxi Commissioner Michael Lazar's latest plans, announced Mon day, for regulating the non medallion cabs.

title: Mississippi Trial Delayed
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 17 (AP)  A judge delayed today the trials of nine members of the black separatist Republic of New Africa until January at the request of defense at torneys. Seven members are charged with murder and four other counts growing out of the shooting death of a Jackson police officer Aug. 18. Two others are charged with pos sessing stolen property.

title: Muskie Assails Nixon on Pollution Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  Senator Edmund S. Muskie charged today that the White House was trying to gut the water pollution control bill passed unanimously by the Senate.

title: IRAQI LEADER URGES WAR AGAINST ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 17 President Ahmed Hassan al Bakr of Iraq tonight called for a war of popular liberation by the Arab nations against Israel as the only way to recover oc cupied Arab territory and rights in Palestine.

title: Montgomery Ward Stores To Offer Hertz Services
description: The Hertz Corporation and Montgomery Ward & Co. an flounced yesterday an agree ment to provide Hertz car and truck rental services at selected Montgomery Ward retail stores.

title: Connally Lifts Hopes in Monetary Crisis
description: PARIS, Nov. 17So uncer tain are general economic pros pects that international au thorities have refused to peer beyond the first half of 1972 in making what is usually a set of annual forecasts prepared at this time of year.

title: VICTORY FORECAST FOR CAMPAIGN BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Senator Russell B. Long pre dicted tonight that the Senate would approve tomorrow a new plan for financing Presidential campaigns with Federal tax revenue, with as many as 55 affirmative votes.

title: MAYOR QUESTIONS ACTION BY ROMNEY
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that Secretary George W. Rom ney's promise to review plans for a controversial lowincome housing development in Forest Hills, Queens, raised the ques tion whether political con siderations would be allowed to overrule a professional evaluation.

title: City Block: On 85th St., a Car Is Merely Endured
description: Not many people on West 85th Street between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue admit liking the automobile, and even those who own one talk about it with a kind of melancholy resignation, as if it were something to be endured.

title: Rise in Personal Income For October Was Slight
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Personal income rose by the unusually small amount of $800million in October, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: CURFEW IS ORDERED BY ARMY IN DACCA
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 17 A daylight curfew was imposed on Dacca at 5:30 o'clock this morning. There were uncon firmed reports of fighting be tween soldiers and guerrillas in some of the city's suburbs, but no shooting could be heard from the Intercontinental Hotel, where reporters and others were confined.

title: Crew 70% Black Erects Newark Building
description: NEWARK, Nov. 17A con struction force made up of 70 per cent black labor has com pleted a $3.5million electronic switching office for the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company.

title: Big Exacta at Bay Meadows
description: SAN MATEO. Calif. (UPI)A $2,640.50 exacta, the largest of the season, resulted today from the onetwo finishes of Ali Hemp and Misty's Flash in the ninth race at Bay Meadows. Ali Hemp paid $15.60 for $2 to win while Misty's Flash, a 44to1 shot, returned $59 to place.

title: Colonels Gain First Place
description: LOUISVILLE, Nov. 17 (AP) The Kentucky Colonels moved into first place in the Eastern Division of the American Bas ketball Association with a 117 112 victory over the Virginia Squires tonight.

title: Colonial Cup Race Fails To Stir OTB Customers
description: Slapped on the rump by $16,000 worth of newspaper ad vertising, the Offtrack Betting Corporation's tweedy Colonial Cup Special came out of the starting gate here yesterday.

title: Starts Off to Soviet to Seek Substantial Rise in Trade
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans left with a 10man delegation today to seek a sub stantial increase in trade with the Soviet Union.

title: Man in the News
description: Thanom Kittikachorn, who heads the group of military and other leaders who seized power in Thailand yesterday, has been Premier of his coun try since 1963, when he an nounced that his aim was to do good, do good, do good. At the time, there were few who thought that the mild, conciliatory mili tary man could do well enough. He was appoint ed Premier to suc ceed Sarit Than arat, who had seized power five years before. Field Mar shal Sarit had been the model of an Asian strongman, and Thanom, his deputy, seemed unlikely to fit the mold of power.

title: White and Black in Rhodesia Say It's My Country
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 17She was a cultivated woman about 50 years old, very English in appearance and manner. When the talk turned to the black Africans place in the future of Rho desia, emotion came into her voice.

title: Homosexuality Linked to Hormone Level
description: Researchers at the Masters and Johnson sex research in stitute in St. Louis have found that young men who are pre dominantly or exclusively homosexual generally have lower levels of the male sex hormone testosterone in their blood than do young hetero sexual men.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The proposed fare increase will not affect some of the present riders on the MadisonFifth Avenue buses. These riders, in fact, have been riding free for some time. They are not popular with their fellow riders, some of whom have been known to react vehemently to the freeloading riders, who like it best near the windows.

title: 2 Britons Win Record Pool
description: LONDON, Nov. 17 (AP)A garage mechanic and a factory worker shared a world record footballpool prize of over $1.25million, today. Michael Turton, the garage mechanic, lives near Rugby. John Heald lives in Mexborough, Yorkshire.

title: Saban Quits Job as Coach Of Sagging Bronco Team
description: DENVER, Nov. 17 (AP) Lou Saban, who once trans formed the Buffalo Bills from losers to champions in three years but couldn't produce a winning season in four years with Denver, stepped down as head coach of the Broncos to day.

title: GEORGE SCHNEIDER
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 17George Schneider, former vice chair man of the Celanese Corpora tion, died today in Twelve Oaks Hospital after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived here since 1968.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I love walnuts. So it disturbs me to read of the willful destruction of the black walnut [news story Nov. 11]. The monetary gain on the sale of these trees can never surpass the pleasure millions of people derive from eating its fruit. Today the wal nut lover laments. Will it be the cherry lover tomorrow or the chest nut enthusiast the day after?

title: CHAPOT WINS FOR U.S. IN SHOW AT TORONTO
description: TORONTO, Nov. 18Frank Chapot rode Good Twist to vic tory in the faultandout event and sent the United States equestrian team into the lead tonight at the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: Trotters Stay on Strike
description: LONDON, Ontario, Nov. 17 (Canadian Press)The Harlem Globetrotters did not appear for their scheduled basketball exhibition tonight, apparently continuing a strike that began last night in Port Huron, Mich. Members of the team have com plained of substandard living conditions on tour.

title: Reporters Suing to Reopen Persico Trial
description: As the extortionconspiracy trial of Carmine J. Persico con tinued in secrecy yesterday, with even the glass in the courtroom doors covered over, with blotters, a committee of more than 100 local reporters announced it would file suit seeking to reopen the proceed ings to the public.

title: 2,137Acre Tract at Brookhaven Is Transferred to State by U.S.
description: UPTON, L. I., Nov. 17A Federal gift of 2,137 acres of the Brookhaven National Labo ratory was presented to Gov ernor Rockefeller here today by Mrs. Julie Nixon Eisenhower, as protesters quietly urged that the site be used for lowincome housing.

title: Butz Says He'll Speak for All Farmers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  Dr. Earl L. Butz, who has been nominated for Secretary of Agriculture, said at a Senate hearing today he would be a vigorous spokesman for all farmers in an effort to pre serve family farms and solve economic and social problems besetting rural American.

title: Cooperate or Perish
description: The recent proposal, by the Board of Regents to estab lish a council of the state's public and private colleges and universities is an attempt to bring reason to the chaotic higher education scene. Whether such an or ganization wi,11 turn into more than just another deposi tory for studies and surveys depends on the good faith and flexibility of institutions which have in the past been more prone to, suspicious coexistence than o cooper ation.

title: Kennedy Noncampaign: Some Read a No as Yes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Three powerful Democrats, all identified with the Kennedy family in the past, talked by phone this week: John J. Gilli gan, the Governor of Ohio, Sen ator John V. Tunney of Cali fornia, and Robert Moretti, the Speaker of the California As sembly.

title: Avnet Holders Hear Plans For Financing Are Shelved
description: Avnet, Inc., has no present financing plans, after post poning a planned equity offer ing indefinitely, Simon Sheib, president, told yesterday's an nual meting here. The com pany announced late Tuesday that it was withdrawing an offering of 500,000 shares, and that certain stockholders were reducing their secondary offer ing to about 700,000 shares from 800,000.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Whether or not the United Nations General Assembly acted wisely in ac cording the right to represent all Chinese people to the Peking Govern ment, the apparent shock in the Government of the United States seems peculiar. Surely our Government had ample opportunity to prepare a formal response for the foreseeable possibility that the General Assembly would vote the way it did.

title: Cougars Beat Rockets
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Nov. 17 (AP)Jim McDaniels, a rookie, scored 27 points and Ted McLain came off the bench to tally 19 tonight as they paced the Carolina Cougars to a 113 101 American Basketball Asso ciation victory over the Denver Rockets.

title: STOCKS REGISTER MODEST ADVANCE
description: The stock market's sharp technical rally of Tuesday afternoon faded yesterday, but several leading market aver ages still managed to post gains.

title: Mineral Water Bowl Set
description: EXCELSIOR SPRINGS, Mo., Nov. 17 (AP)Missouri Valley College of Marshall, Mo., and Bethany College of Newton Kan, will meet Dec. 4 in the Mineral Water Bowl football) game, it was announced today.

title: Heads Publishers Group
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 17 (AP)Frank Aycock Jr., 62 years old, who started his news paper career as a copyboy and reached the top as president of The Memphis CommercialAp peal and PressScimitar, became head of the 14state Southern Newspaper Publishers Associa tion today.

title: GEORGE H. HEALEY, CORNELL PROFESSOR
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Nov. 17Dr. George H. Healey, a professor of English at Cornell and cu rator of the university's collec tion of rare books since its in ception in 1957, died yesterday. He was 63 years old.

title: Scabies Outbreak Continues
description: MEXICO, Me., Nov. 17 Classes for 1,450 students in this western Maine community will be suspended until next Monday because of an outbreak of scabies. School Superintend ent Fred Allen said today that 32 per cent of the pupils were absent when classes opened again yesterday after having been closed last Thursday and Friday. This prompted him to close the schools again.

title: BORLAUG REBUKED BY AUDUBON CHIEF
description: Dr. Elvis J. Stahr, president of the National Audubon So ciety, said last night he de plores the ignorance of Dr. Norman E. Borlaug, winner of the 1970 Nobel Peace Prize, regarding the ecological ef fects of chlorinated hydrocar bonslonglasting pesticides.

title: Advertising:
description: For the first time in Its 91year history, the Eastman Kodak Company has a true corporate symbol. Over the next few years, it will begin to appear on everything as sociated with the worldwide company.

title: Gallup Poll Reports Nixon's Popularity Registers a Decline
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The latest Gallup Poll stated today that 49 per cent of Amer ican adults approve of the way President Nixon is handling his job, a 5 per cent decline since the poll released last month.

title: PROCESSOR OF FOODS INCREASES DIVIDEND
description: The Consolidated Foods Cor poration raised its quarterly dividend yesterday from 30 cents to 30.55 cents a share. The company said this would be a 4 per cent increase over the rate paid in the fiscal year ended July 3.

title: The Guileless Prosecutor
description: Few Government officials, one must hope, are as insensible to the offer of a bribe as Deputy Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst, Number Two man in the Department of Justice.

title: NIXON WILL IGNORE CALL BY CONGRESS FOR VIETNAM CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 President Nixon, in a rebuke to Congressional doves, an nounced today that he would disregard an amendment set ting forth the policy that United States troops should be with drawn promptly from Indo china, subject only to the re lease of American prisoners of war.

title: Pop SweatersFashion With a Sense of Humor
description: Just when it seemed as if pop might be a dying art, up comes a crop of pop fashionsthis time in sweater form.

title: CELTICS DEFEAT SUNS, 140 TO 121
description: BOSTON, Nov. 17 (AP)The Boston Celtics avenged a fight filled loss at Phoenix by trounc ing the Suns, 140121, tonight as John Havlicek scored 32 points and Jo Jo White con tributed 28 in a National Bas ketball Association game.

title: U.S. Mission at U.N. Declines to Clarify Bush's Criticism of Chinese Speech
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17On the ground that United States relations with China are a delicate matter, the United States mission to the United Nations refused to day to clarify its contention that Peking had been guilty of improper political conduct here.

title: TeenAger Wins in Florida
description: OCALA, Fla., Nov. 17 (AP) David Passman became Flor ida's first elected teenage city official yesterday, easily de feating a 45yearold incumbent in a City Council runoff. Mr. Passman, a 19yearold student at Central Florida Junior Col lege, said he believed he had won the election because I'm a conservative. He takes office Jan. 14.

title: A HARPSICHORDIST PLAYS WITH DASH
description: Strange as it might seem to anyone who walks about New York and is all but deafened by its violent, unrelenting noise, America is in the grip of a harpsichord revival. The up heaval begun by Wanda Lan dowska 30 years ago continues to send out waves of interest in the modestvoiced instrument. There is a new wave of young harpsichordists, too, and Elaine Comparone, who performed at Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night, is one of its more attrac tive peaks.

title: DEVELOPING NATIONS ASK TRADE PRIVILEGE
description: GENEVA, Nov. 17A bid by 16 developing countries for a special dispensation from ac cepted rules of fair trade that would favor the expansion of their trade with each other was taken under consideration to day by the agency that over sect the world's commerce.

title: May Department Stores Reports a Sharp Increase in Profits
description: The May Department Stores Company increased profits by 19.2 per cent in the third quar ter and 44.7 per cent for the nine months ended Oct. 30, re flecting sales gains of 10.1 per cent and 9.8 per cent, respec tively, over year earlier peri ods, it was reported from St. Louis headquarters yesterday.

title: DON PINTO PLAYS ROCK AT EL ME
description: A new 29piece jazzrock band called, incredible as it may seem, The Brownie's Revenge, made its debut this week at, unlikely as it may seem, an Israeli cafe, El Avram on Sheridan Square.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: 62YearOld Captures His First Buck
description: BIG INDIAN, N.Y., Nov. 17 Don't be surprised if Long Island Rail Road trains are even later than usual this week. A dozen conductors from that Dashing Com muter line have descended on this popular deer hunting retreat and seem in no hurry to leave.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets in the morning after adjournment of General Com mittee and at 3 P.M. to dis cuss world disarmament con ference.

title: SOLON C. KELLEY 3D; LED WILDMAN & SONS
description: Solon C. Kelley 3d, president of Frederick Wildman & Sons, Ltd., wine importers, died Tues day night at University Hospital after a long illness. He was 50 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue and Colebrook, Conn.

title: Team Fell Apart
description: DENVER, Nov. 17 (UPI) Gerald Phipps, owner of the Denver Broncos, said at the news conference today regard ing Saban's move:

title: Woman Slashed in Attack In Daylight in Central Park
description: A 37yearold woman re quired 120 stitches on her face and head yesterday after she resisted a man who attempted to rape her in Central Park in daylight, the police said.

title: Ecological Science Corp. Accused in Suit by S.E.C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission added another law suit yesterday to trie growing burden of litigation against the Ecological Science Corporation, a Floridabased company with interests in water and sewerage systems and pollution control.

title: OMBUDSMAN URGED FOR STATE INMATES
description: Two members of the Goldman panel, which observed the treatment of prisoners in the aftermath of the September uprising at the Attica Correc tional Facility, said yesterday that a permanent independent body was needed to safeguard state inmates Tights.

title: It All Adds Up
description: WASHINGTONThe phrase politi cizing the Bureau of Labor Statistics has been used recently in editorials, news columns, TV shows, speeches in the Congress and at cocktail parties. Is politics really at work in the bureau? Or is political calumny at work? The question is of vital concern to the public and to policymakers, as well as to the staff of the bureau.

title: KENT STATE PETITION IS SENT TO MITCHELL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17A petition to President Nixon from 10,380 Kent State Univer sity students, calling for a Fed eral grand jury investigation of the shooting of four students in May, 1970, has been re ferred for consideration to the Justice Department, the White House said today.

title: Jenkins Retains Deputy Leadership in Laborite Vote
description: LONDON, Nov. 17Roy Jen kins narrowly survived a strong challenge from angry leftwing ers today to win reelection as deputy leader of Britain's Labor party.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Within a few days of each other, two stories of the aging appeared in The Times: One about the death of an elder ly woman on 85th Street, the other about the problems of old people in Parkchester. These tragedies occur daily everywhere.

title: Opening at City Ballet
description: The New York City Ballet opened up shop again at the State Theater Tuesday night for what will be its longest winter seasonthrough Feb. 20.

title: Leslie Salt Plans To Sell Most Assets; Talks With 2 Buyers
description: The Leslie Salt Company, the largest producer and distributor, of salt on the West Coast, an nounced yesterday that it was, negotiating to sell most of its assets to the California and Hawaiian Sugar Company and to Mobile Oil Estates, Ltd., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Mobil Oil Corporation.

title: Wyszynski Home; Sees Vatican Envoy To Warsaw Talks
description: WARSAW, Nov: 17Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the Polish primate, returned from Rome today to confer with a Vatican envoy who is meeting here with Polish Communist offi cials over normalization of relations.

title: London Pledges to Press Hunt for I.P.A. in Ulster
description: LONDON, Nov. 17Declaring that a battle is joined, the British Government promised today to press the hunt for members of the underground Irish Republican Army in Northern Ireland.

title: Grayson Finds Problems On Regulation of Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 C. Jackson Grayson Jr. chair man of the Price Commission, concedes that the new price controls have opened a num ber of difficult questions, in cluding how companies can nica sure their productivity and how consumers can tell if they are being cheated.

title: HOUSE MAY REVIVE ORIGINAL AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Leaders of the House of Repre sentatives took a rarely used procedural shortcut today in an effort to speed a solution of the foreign aid impasse. A House vote on their action was scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Few Surprises in Pulitzer Collection
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 17The idea of exhibiting private collections in public institutions, though not with out hazards, is generally a happy one. Unlike the more formal exhibitions that mu seums customarily organize, the showing of a private col lection is usually free of extraneous didactic motives. We are invited to look at particular objects instead of works of art arranged in a unifying historical or esthetic pattern.

title: CONSULAR SUSPECT CLAIMS IMMUNITY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 17A mid dlelevel official at the French Consulate in New York City who was identified as a con tact in a $12million heroin smuggling conspiracy has re fused to appear before a Fed eral grand jury here, an au thoritative Government source reported tonight.

title: 16 Seized in Capital Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The police arrested 16 antiwar dem onstrators today for blocking a White House driveway in a continuing protest against American bombing in Indo china. The demonstrators had a permit to lie on the sidewalk outside the White House. While more than 10 demonstrators lay on the sidewalk, 16 others moved to the driveway and were arrested, Bail was set at $50.

title: U.S. Jets Attack in the North For the 77th Time This Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 18 (AP)Four American supersonic fighter bombers destroyed one antiair craft artillery gun and damaged another yesterday in the 77th raid inside North Vietnam this year, the United States com mand said today.

title: Nixon Backs More Welfare Aid to States
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The Nixon Administration commit ted itself today to support legis lation providing Federal funds to reimburse states for more of the recent increases in their welfare costs.

title: Battle Near Pnompenh
