description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 17 (AP)Cambodian troops at tacked an enemy position to day near the western outskirts of Pnompenh, only 10 miles from the heart of the capital.

title: Correction Board Suing State To Ease Jail Crowding Here
description: The city's Board of Correc tion announced yesterday that it was suing in Federal court to force the state government and judiciary to act to relieve overcrowding in city jails.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Military. President Nixon announced the appointment of Col. Brent Scowcroft of the Air Force to be military assistant to the President. Colonel Scowcroft, 46 years old, currently assigned to the Joint Chiefs of Staff as special assistant to the direc tor of the joint staff, will re place Brig. Gen J. D. Hughes, effe live Feb. 1, 1972. Gen eral Hughes will then become vice commander, 12th Air Force, Tactical Air Com mand, at Bergstrom Air Force Base, Austin, Tex.

title: I.R.A. Threatens Reprisals
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 17 (AP)The Irish Repub lican Army today threatened ruthless reprisals against British intelligence men whom it accused of torturing guerrilla suspects.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES RISE MODERATELY
description: Prices of soybean futures and grain futures rose moderately on the Chicago Board of Trade lyesterday.

title: ISRAELIS REBUFF U.N. ON JERUSALEM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 17Israel has advised Secretary General Thant in ef fect that she will not permit the United Nations to check on housing and population poli cies in the Arab sector of Jeru salem as requested by the Se curity Council nearly two months ago.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation an nounced yesterday in Pittsburgh that William R. Roesch, president and chief operating officer, has been elected to the additional posts of chairman and chief executive officer, effective Jan. 1, 1972. He will succeed William J. Stephens, who is retiring from active service on Dec. 31 after reaching the mandatory retirement age of 65. Mr. Stephens will continue as a director. Jones & Laughlin is 81 per cent owned by LingTemco Vought.

title: Ford Seeking Vietnam Deal
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17 (UPI) The Ford Motor Company con firmed today that it had sub mitted a proposal to the South Vietnamese Government that would, if approved, make Ford the first major automobile com pany to establish assembly op erations in that country.

title: OpenEntry Dropouts Double Others at City U.
description: The percentage of day fresh men who dropped out of the City University's senior colleges in 197071, the first year of open admissions, was more than twice as high among open ad missions freshmen  29.6 per cent  as it was for their class mates.

title: KNAPP HEARINGS TO RESUME ON AIR
description: The Knapp Commigsion hear ings into alleged police corrup tion, scheduled to resume here Dec. 13, will be carried live and on tape on Channel 13 and live on radio stations WNYC and WRVR.

title: Republican Wins on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 17 (Reu ters)Bill Brophy, a Repub lican, scored an upset victory today in a California Assembly district election marked by gun fire and eggthrowing. Mr. Brophy, 36 years old, target of a shooting attempt on the eve of the election, won 47 per cent of votes cast against 42 per cent for the heavily favoted Democrat, Richard Alatorre.

title: CONDORS SUBDUE NETS, 122 T0 121
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 17The New York Nets, who have been dealing with heroics during much of the American Basketball Assciation season, lost a game tonight to the heroics of John Brisker.

title: Maravich's 18 Not Enough
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 17 (AP) The Seattle Supersonics spoiled the season debut of Atlanta's Pete Maravich tonight, defeat ing the Hawks, 112104.

title: SANFORD C. BERNSTEIN & Co., Inc. Total Rosponsiblitty Investing See page 72.Advt.
description: SANFORD C. BERNSTEIN & Co., Inc. Total Rosponsiblitty Investing See page 72.Advt.

title: U.S. Sees No Peril
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 United States officials expressed confidence today that the changes in Thailand would not jeopardize American interests there.

title: Chess:
description: When a chess club sets about to organize an interna tional tournament, the invita tion committee faces the same problem as a shopper in a supermarket: how to get the best value for the money. The principle is simplethe big ger the prize fund, the better the players attracted to com pete.

title: Head Slaps Irk Ewbank: It's Boxing, Not Football
description: The openhanded slap to the side of the head has become an increasingly popular weap on in a defensive lineman's repertory in pro football. John Little, the Jets blossoming de fensive tackle, says it's nerve racking and effective. Weeb Ewbank, his coach, says it's boxing and it should be out lawed.

title: Judge Dismisses School District Suit Over StaffCut Rule
description: A suit by Community School Board 3 to overturn the city Board of Education's rule for reducing staffs to meet budget cuts was dismissed yesterday in Manhattan State Supreme Court.

title: Notre Dame Is Reported To Be Opposed to Bowl
description: The Notre Dame football team has decided not to play in a postseason bowl game this year and the announcement will be made today, The Associated Press Reported last night.

title: A Symbol Way to Solve Subways
description: With perfect aplomb, an thropologists undertake the most intrepid voyages of dis covery to the most primitive regions of the planet. But have the 4,000 anthropolo gists in New York for the 70th annual meeting of the American Anthropological Association ever tried the New York subway?

title: Spain's Plan Stresses Social and Economic Goals
description: MADRID, Nov. 17  By 1980, Spaniards have been told, they will have double their present income, three times as many automobiles, six times as many television sets, more schools and universities, cleaner air and rivers and less unemployment.

title: European Cautions U.S. Against Prolonging Surcharge
description: The Earl of Cromer, Britain's Ambassador to the United States, assured American busi nessmen here yesterday that the enlarged Common Market would offer prospects for a vast expansion of trade between Europe and North America.

title: 2 Flee Florida Prison In a Makeshift Tank
description: RAIFORD, Fla., Nov. 17 (AP)Two inmates at the Raiford State Prison rammed their way to freedom in a makeshift tank they had fashioned in the prison fur niture shop, officials said today.

title: Continental Mortgage Sees Dip
description: The fastgrowing real estate investment trust field may be heading for a dramatic slow down in earnings, a leading figure in the industry said yes terday.

title: Boy Wounded in Attack
description: BELFAST, Nov. 17 (UPI) A gunman fired 20 shots from a submachine gun at British soldiers tearing down Roman Catholic barricades in London derry today, seriously wound ing a 14yearold boy, army officials said.

title: Bridge: Winter Bid Is Explained In New Guide by Bill Root
description: A player who wants a compact guide to modern bidding cannot do better than use a booklet by Bill Root of New York, who looks down on his fellowexperts from a height of 6 feet 8 inches New Contract Bridge Outlines On Standard Bidding, a completely re vised version of the notes originally compiled for his vast army of students, was published last week by Crown at $1.

title: Winner Didn't Have Heart to Hurt Him
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 17Softly and mercifully, Muhammad Ali registered four knockdowns of Buster Mathis, two in each of the last two rounds, during a unanimous 12round decision for the former heavyweight champion at the Astrodome to night.

title: William Culbertson Dead at 65; Headed Moody Bible Institute
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17William) Culbertson, chancellor of the Moody Bible Institute here, died last night at the Swedish Cov count Hospital. He would have been 66 years old tomorrow. He had had two operations for cancer m the last seven years.

title: GRIEVANCES RISE IN THE FIREHOUSES
description: Firemen in some Brooklyn and Harlem firehouses demand ed and received permission to lie down and rest for a couple of hours yesterday after re turning from fires.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17Political abuse in America is in a sad decline. Here, to cite a case fresh out of the mailbag, is a letter from an angry man in the Bronx who is delighted that the Hbomb went off in Alaska recently and especially pleased, he says, to see that the explosion was not stopped by the ecoradlibpinko set.

title: Mathis Was Hit by a Buss and Then by Ali
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 17The tone of the evening was struck early when nine kilted bagpipers and three drum mers in tartan miniskirts heralded the arrival of Joe Bugner in the ring. It was natural that the master showmen who had decided the world was ready for a fight show featuring Muham mad Ali and Buster Mathis would bring on Texas High landers making martial Scot tish music to greet a former champion of the British Em pire. Joe Bugner is Hun garian.

title: U.S. Rebuffed on Secrecy In Pentagon Papers Inquiry
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 17 (AP) A Federal judge ruled today that Anthony Russo, who re fused to testify in secret be fore a grand jury in the Penta gon Papers case, did not have to testify unless the Govern ment agreed to furnish him a transcript of his testimony.

title: French Inquiry at Standstill
description: PARIS, Nov 17French judi cial authorities let it he known tonight that cooperation with the United States Attorney's office in New Jersey, which seeks to prosecute a French counterespionage agent as a narcotics smuggler, was at a standstill.

title: 9 FOOD PLACES CITED AS VIOLATING CODE
description: The names of nine restau rants and foodprocessing es tablishments that failed to cor rect serious health code viola tions in the required time were made public yesterday by the Health Services Administra tion.

title: Salesgirl, 19, Wins $1Million
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 17 (AP) Patricia Adorno a 19year old salesgirl in a clothing store, won $1million in the New Jersey lottery today. I can't believe it, it's impos sible, the 19yearold Ocean Township winner cried when her name was announced at drawing at the auditorium of Jersey City State College.

title: Phase 2 Brings Variety Here But Adds Up to Confusion
description: If you shop on Columbus Avenue Between 67th and 68th Streets, you might con clude that Phase Two means higher prices, lower prices or the same pricesdepend ing on which of three busi nesses you visited.

title: News Analysis
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 17  At any other time in the past, the military clashes now occurring between India and Pakistan on their borderssome of battal ion size would immediately have begun a fullscale war such as the two countries have fought twice before. But so far both sides have held back  India be cause she believes that her objective of a friendly, inde pendent East Pak istan might be ac complished by military activity short of war, and Pakistan ap parently because Indian forces are superior and because a total war would weaken Pakistan far more than the Indiansupported Bengali independence struggle in East Pakistan has.

title: The Institution of Lying
description: WASHINGTONPresident Johnson's memoirs contain extensive information drawn from classified documentsin cluding some of those contained in the Pentagon Papers.

title: Golar Acts to Bolster Security in City Projects
description: Simeon Golar, chairman of the city's Housing Authority, announced yesterday new meas ures to improve security in the city's 188 public housing proj ects.

title: RABBI LEVIN, 76, BEAD IN MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17 Rabbi Yehuda Leib Levin, chief rabbi of Moscow's Central Syna gogue, died today at the age of 76.

title: Cardinal Krol of Philadelphia Is Elected President of the Roman Catholic Bishops of United States
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Roman Catholic Bishops of the United States today elected John Cardinal Krol of Philadel phia to succeed John Cardinal Dearden of Detroit as their president. He will head the Na tional Conference of Catholic Bishops, which is a canonical body, and the United States Catholic Conference, the church action agency.

title: 15 Vietnamese Senators Assail Thieu Economic Plan
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Nov. 18 (UPI)A group of op position Senators attacked President Nguyen Van Thieu's new economic plan today and said the South Vietnamese econ omy was collapsing.

title: Miklos Sperling Dies at 72; Indianapolis Industrialist
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 18 (AP)  Miklos M. Sperling, a former piano salesman who be came a millionaire industrialist here, died last night in Miami Beach, Fla. He was 72 years old.

title: CONGRESS EXTENDS, MD UNTIL DEC. 8
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Congress agreed today to ex tend spending authority for the foreign aid program to Dec. 8 to give time for an agreement on a regular authorization bill by both legislative branches.

title: Senate Bars Rule Change Accounting Unit Favored
description: The United States Senate, in a little noticed action, has ve toed an attempt by the ac counting profession to tighten the rules governing the finan cial reporting of the proposed 7 per cent job development tax credit.

title: State Rejects Plan to Televise Races From Monticello for Offtrack Betting
description: A plan to televise harness races from Monticello Raceway into the metropolitan area from Dec. 15 to Jan. 8 and take offtrack wagers on them was rejected yesterday by the New York State Harness Racing Commission.

title: Full BritainRhodesia Talks on Today
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 18British and Rhodesian ne gotiators will meet in their first full session tomorrow after a week of exploration in smaller groups.

title: Amex and OTC Stocks Tumble as Trading Rises
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market fell sharply yesterday in steppedup trad ing, with the real estate in vestment trusts the biggest losers.

title: Man in the News
description: WASFIINGTON, Nov. 18 John Cardinal Krol of Phil adelphia was characteristical ly succinct after his election yesterday as president of the National Conference of Cath olic Bishops. Asked what his major efforts would be in the new role, he said. To carry on programs set out by the Bishops. An im pish smile accom panied the reply, but the Cardinal did not elaborate. Actually, a presi dent is expected to propose goals and projects for the Roman Catholic Church in this country, as well as co ordinate such work of the conference as its fund for selfhelp projects among the poor. Even his liberal de tractors credit the Cardinal with imposing credentials for the task.

title: XEROX TO SEEK RISE IN PRICES NEXT YEAR
description: The Xerox Corporation in tends to apply for an appro priate price increase next year. Archie R. McCarden, ex ecutive vice president, told se curity analysts in Chicago yes terday.

title: Carl E. Petersen, 96, Dies; Won Medal of Honor in 1900
description: AVENEL, N. J., Nov. 18Carl E. Petersen, a holder of the Medal of Honor for action in China during the Boxer Rebel lion of 1900, died yesterday at the John F. Kennedy Commun ity Hospital in Edison. He was 96 years old and lived at 427 Hyatt Street.

title: Midwest Farmers Skeptical on Nomination of Butz
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18Many Midwestern farmers, buried un der a pricedepressing surplus of corn and afraid that their operating costs will rise again next spring, are openly skep tical that Earl L. Butz. Presi dent Nixon's new choice for Secretary of Agriculture, will be able to help them.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In regard to public school prayer both the Supreme Court and the Con gress put the cart before the horse.

title: TaxExempt Yields Rise;
description: A highquality state bond is sue Was marketed yesterday with the highest yields in three months, and it sold quickly to investors.

title: FUND SALES ROSE DURING OCTOBER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Sales of mutual funds rose sharply in October and re demptions declined to put the fund industry back into a net sales position for the month, the Investment Company Insti tute reported today.

title: Agnew Chides the U.N. For Its Welcome to China
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18 (UPI) Vice President Agnew last night digressed from a pre pared speech on behavioral science to criticize the hearty reception given the Communist Chinese delega tion by the United Nations.

title: Chinese. Atom Test, First in Year, Held
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 China today set off her first nuclear bomb test in over a year, the Atomic Energy Com mission announced here.

title: C.B.S. Aide Scores as Failure F.C.C. Rule on Prime Time TV
description: Richard W. Jencks, vice pres ident of the Columbia Broad casting System, said yesterday that this year's new rule re turning prime network time to individual stations had been a total failure.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On Campaign Funding
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP)Following is the 4946 rollcall vote by which the Senate today defeated a mo tion to strike from a tax bill a provision for financing Presidential campaigns from public funds:

title: FEDERATED CHAD HAS RECORD NET
description: Federated Department Stores, Inc., which includes Bloom ingdale's in its nationwide chain of 188 stores, reported yesterday a 17.4 per cent in crease in profit on a 12.7 per cent sales rise, both setting records for the fiscal quarter ended Oct. 30. Ninemonth profit increased 19.4 per cent on a sales rise of 11.6 per cent.

title: Ark Ack to Be Retired To Stud in Kentucky
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Nov. 18 (AP)Ack Ack, a leading candidate for horseofthe year honors in thoroughbred racing, has been retired and will head for stud shortly at the Claiborne Farm in Ken tucky.

title: Angry Crowd in. Forest Hills Protests Housing Project
description: Hundreds of residents of the Forest Hills section of Queens vowed last night at an emotion al rally to destroy Mayor Lind say's political future because he, supports a lowincome housing project for the middleclass neighborhood.

title: Seals Beat Sabres, 75
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 18 (UPI) Joe Johnston banged in his own rebound with 1:32 left in the game and Craig Patrick added a goal with 53 seconds left as the California Golden Seals snapped a fourgame losing streak with a 75 triumph over the Buffalo Sabres tonight.

title: KISSINGER AIDE QUITS, 14TH TO GO IN 2 YEARS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 K. Wayne Smith, a senior policy planner on Henry A. Kissinger's National Security Council staff, is resigning effective tomorrow.

title: Books of The Times
description: JENNIE: The Life of Lady Randolph Churchill. Vol. Two: The Dramatic Years, 18951921. By Ralph G. Martin. 498 pages. Prentice Hall. $8.95.

title: Albers Show Is Marked by Vibrancy
description: The Josef Albers retrospec tive opening today at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is not very largenot very large for an 83yearold art ist who has been a major name since the nineteen thirtiesbut it is compre hensive all the same. Mr. Al bers's career could in fact have been summarized even more succinctly, if necessary. His line of development has been so undeviating and his final achievement so super ficially repetitious (the im portant word there is super ficially) that it would be possible to summarize his ca reer in half a dozen exam ples of his work without serious omissions.

title: RENDERERS FINED FOR FIXING PRICES
description: Eleven fat rendering compa nies and the same number of executives were fined a total of $338,500 in United States, District Court here yesterday for a pricefixing conspiracy.

title: $1Billion Exports For Soviet Factory Licensed by U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The Commerce Department to day approved the licensing of a half a billion dollars worth of heavy equipment for possi ble sale by United States com panies to the Soviet Union for construction of a truck factory.

title: Deliberate Timing Seen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 18  Diplomats at the United Nations, including dele gates from countries with close relations with Peking, said to day that they believed China had deliberately timed her latest nuclear explosion with the General Assembly's disarm ament debate as a symbolic political gesture.

title: HARPSICHORD ADDS TO FLUTE RECITAL
description: The first of a series of three concerts to be given at Car negie Recital Hall this season by Sylvia Marlowe and guest artists was presented on Wednesday. The subject of the evening was Bach, and Paula Robison, the flutist, joined Miss Marlowe in the performance of three sonatas for flute and, harpsichord.

title: ;ISE, 49 TO 46, BACKS FUND PLAN FOR 72 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Democratic Senators beat back today a united Republican at tempt to scuttle their new plan for financing the 1972 Presiden tial campaign with Federal funds.

title: U. S. CITES GROWTH AT PARIS MEETING
description: PARIS, Nov. 18  Senior American economic officials told their counterparts from other developed countries to day of prospects for higher growth and lower inflation in the United States, and stressed that a strong economy was the single most important con tribution the United States could make to establishing in ternational monetary order.

title: VOTE IS PUT OFF ON COURT CHOICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  The Senate Judiciary Commit tee today put off until Tues day a vote on President Nix on's nominations of William H. Rehnquist and Lewis F. Powell Jr. to the Supreme Court.

title: Lawless Highways
description: The ruling of a Federal judge in California can go far to curb the arrogance of roadbuilders given to forcing their concrete attentions on unreceptive communities. Halting work on the $100million Foothill Freeway, east of San Francisco Bay, Judge Robert F. Peckham found that highway officials had blandly ignored three different laws, with all of which they will have to comply before being allowed to proceed.

title: Poles Said to Curb German Exodus
description: WARSAW, Nov. 18Poland has sharply curtailed the flow of ethnic Germans to West Germany recently, according to informed sources here.

title: CATHOLIC BISHOPS PICK AIDE TO KROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The Most Rev. Leo C. Byrne, Coadjutor Archbishop of St. Paul and Mnneapolis, was elected vice president today by the Roman Catholic Bishops of the United States.

title: Garden Will Vibrate Tonight To Hum of the Midget Autos
description: Automobile racing in Madi son Square Garden, a vague plan when the $50million building was opened in 1968 will become a noisy reality tonight. Cars, known as three quarter midgets, will race in seven events.

title: For the Weekend: Oyster Fry, a Custard Dessert
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an aster isk are followed by a recipe.

title: Justice Frederick Backer Dies; Lost 1971 Bid for Surrogate
description: State Supreme Court Justice Frederick Backer, who ran un successfully for the Democratic nomination for Manhattan sur rogate last September, died yesterday of pneumonia at Mount Sinai Hospital here. He was 62 years old.

title: ISSAC BRAWER
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 18Isaac Braver, former owner of the Ellen Tracy Company, manufacturers of blouses and knit suits, died at his home here Tuesday. He was 65 years old and until a year ago had made his residence in New York City and Paterson, N. J.

title: Stepfather Seeks to Regain Children Reported For Sael
description: ANDERSON, Ind., Nov. 18 (AP)James E. Davis, a sales man here, said today that he was trying to raise money to reunite his family, including two stepchildren reportedly of fered for sale in Jacksonville, Fla., for $7,000 and a used car.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor In your Nov. 15 editorial, you chose to label William H. Rehnquist a rad ical rightist and opposed his Supreme Court nomination on that basis, al though you recognize he is a capable lawyer of impressive academic and in tellectual attainment.

title: U.S. Increasing Air Support of Cambodian Forces
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 18 (AP)Official Ameri can sources reported today that with the military situation in Cambodia becoming critical, United States warplanes have stepped up their support of Cambodian soldiers.

title: BACHE 3MONTH NET ADVANCES SHARPLY
description: Bache & Co., Inc., one of the nation's largest brokerage con cerns, reported yesterday that it had net income of $1,540,975, or 28 cents a share, in the three months ended Oct. 31, up from a profit of $879,738, or 18 cents a share, in the comparable period last year.

title: Study Detects No Peril in Enzyme Detergents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18A new report from the National, Research Council finds no evi dence of major health hazard from enzyme detergents, but recommends more study of the effects of all enzymes intro duced artificially into the en yironment.

title: LABOR RESTRICTS ITS COOPERATION WITH PAY BOARD
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 18 The A.F.L.C.I.O. directed its representatives on the Pay Board today to refuse to vote on most matters before the board until labor's demands were met and to support mem ber unions that defy decisions of the board.

title: Cannett Buys Florida Paper
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., Nov. 18 (AP)  The Gannett Co., Inc., with headquarters in Rochester, N. Y., said today that it had purchased The Fort Myers NewsPress for $14.6million The NewsPress, with a morn ing and Sunday circulation of 45,000. became the 52d daily newspaper of the group and the sixth in Florida.

title: AGNEW UPBRAIDS MILLS, M'CLOSKEY
description: FRENCH LICK, Ind., Nov. 18 Vice President Agnew was the center of attention, as he has been at many such confer ences, when the Republican Governors assembled today for their midwinter meeting at this 140yearold Indiana resort.

title: CITY AIDES SUPPORT MORE LEGAL GAMING
description: Top city officials and Deputy Police Commissioner gave strong support yesterday for the expansion of legalized gambling throughout New York at a State Gambling Commis sion hearing at 270 Broadway.

title: SOL FURST, 77, DIES; HEADED CIRCLE WIRE
description: Sol Furst, a founder and for mer president and chairman of the Circle Wire and Cable Cor poration, and a philanthropist, died of a heart attack Wednes day in his home, 7020 108th Street, Forest Hills, Queens. His age was 77.

title: A Film About Animals
description: Some animal movies are about animals. Other animal movies are about people who love animals and who, as the story usually goes, must protect their loveand their animalsfrom the incursions of a generally adult and always unfeeling outside world.Only the second kind of animal movie really matters. And that is the kind to which Edward Mann's "Who Says I Can't Ride a Rainbow!" belongs  despite its featuring horses, ponies, monkeys, goats, cats, dogs, bunnies, chickens and enough Ken-L Ration to stock a year of pet-food commercials.The proprietor of this animal farm, Barney Morowitz (Jack Klugman, playing a role based on real life), faces eviction from his West Village vacant lot because the real estate company to which he owes back rent wants to put up an expensive high-rise in his place. Barney is without worldly wisdom, his primary passion being to get kids to love animals. In this he is so successful that when the eviction finally comes, three of the kids make off with their favorite pony so as to keep it from being sold for glue.Actually they have nothing to fear. But the adventures of the three kids (one black, one Puerto Rican, and one upper-middle-class whitethus representing New York's major ethnic minorities) in hiding the pony make up the bulk of the moviewhich nevertheless seems more interested in following a sweet and hopeless relationship that develops between Barney and his volunteer stable-girl, Mary Lee (Norma French).Neither the relationship, nor the kids, nor even the animals gets handsome enough treatment to redeem "Who Says I Can't Ride a Rainbow!" from general mediocrity. The film is never mawkish or silly about its animals, but it is too lax and sometimes technically too inept to develop the interesting insights it seems to have about its people. Just once, during an argument between Barney and Mary Lee, there is a sustained, schmaltzy, rather lovely livelinessand the movie seems to take on the emotional urgency of music and to be trembling on the edge of song.I can imagine its being taken all the way into musical comedy by Norma French, who does sing, and acts with great warmth, and displays a kind of strong-featured beauty I associate more with the theater than with movies. Jack Klugman is also strong-featured (though no beauty), and his Barney is perhaps a tougher, more complex, and more detailed characterization than the film can profitably handle."Who Says I Can't Ride a Rainbow!" opened yesterday at the Guild Theater.

title: ExLegislator Sentenced
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 18 (AP)  Norman J. Jacques, 28yearold former state legisla: for from Pawtucket, was sen tenced to two years in prison today for refusing to submit to military induction.

title: 5 REPORTERS FILE PERSICO CASE SUIT
description: Charging that State Supreme Court Justice George Postel had abused his discretion and violated their constitu tional rights when he barred the public from the trial of Carmine J. Periso, five local reporters filed a lawsuit in the Appellate Division here yester day seeking to reopen the proceedings to the public.

title: Aides Deny Knowing of Any IcelandU.S. Pact Limiting Black G.I.'s
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 18 American and Icelandic au thorities today denied knowl edge of any agreement limiting the number of blacks assigned to the Iceland Defense Force here.

title: S.E.C. Sues Vantage Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reuter)The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a complaint in the United States District Court here today seek ing a restraining order and a preliminary and permanent in junction against Vantage Ten Ninety Fund, Inc., and its presi dent, J. T. Houk. The complaint alleged that the defendants, through use of a proxy state ment and financial statements containing false and misleading information, were attempting to obtain shareholder approval for a reorganization that was not fair and equitable for all share olders.

title: Paris Peace Talks, Still at an Impasse, Are Briefest So Far
description: PARIS, Nov. 18William J. Porter, the chief American ne gotiator at the Vietnam peace talks, maintained his tough of fensive of the last few weeks by saying almost nothing today.

title: Stars Down Penguins
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 18 (AP)Charlie Burns faked a breakaway pass and rammed in the tiebreaking goal at 13:42 of the third period, tonight and Torn Reid contributed three assists to power the Minnesota North Stars to a 43 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: SOLDIER IN BELFAST IS SLAIN BY SNIPER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 18A sniper, firing from the window of a house over looking a bus depot that is now used by the British Army, shot to death one British soldier this afternoon and seriously wound ed another.

title: Signs of Cross Awe Bronx Slum Area
description: For the last several days hundreds of people have gathered at a decrepit build ing in the heart of the South Bronx slums, on Trinity Ave nue, to stare up at a small bathroom window and see the miraclea cross.

title: DR. THOMAS CAMP, ENGINEER, WAS 76
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18  Dr. Thomas R. Camp, an interna tional consulting engineer and founder of Camp, Dresser & McKee, environmental engin eers, died here on Monday. His age was 76.

title: CHRISCRAFT GROUP NAMES BOARD SLATE
description: The Independent Stockhold ers Committee of ChrisCraft Industries announced a slate of nine candidates for directors of the company yesterday, to oppose the management slate.

title: Canadian Exchange Official Suspends Himself in Inquiry
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 18 (UPI) The chairman of the Cana dian Stock Exchange was under suspension today at his own suggestion while his bro kerage house undergoes an investigation.

title: Canadians Tie Blues, 22
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 18 (UPI) Marc Tardif scored his 14th goal of the season with less than two minutes to play to night to enable the Montreal Canadiens to gain a 22 tie with the St. Louis Blues.

title: Dr. Frederic B. Kopel, 37, Dies in a Fall at Hospital
description: Dr. Frederic B. Kopel, a 37 yearold pediatrician at Mount Sinai Hospital, died yesterday morning in a fall from an upper floor of the hospital at Fifth Avenue and 100th Street, the police reported. The Medical Examiner's Office listed his death as a suicide.

title: The Grandmother Of Women's Lib
description: Miriam Oberndorf, at 73, lives alone and runs her own home, complete with patio and atrium, in a retirement com munity in Laguna Hills, Calif. At 70, she took up horseback riding (for the exercise) but has since given it up because, she said, I don't have time now. I play contract bridge about five times a week. And last June she started a new career, as a distributor for a line of ecological products. (My grand daughters got me interested in ecology.)

title: Puerto Ricans Here Celebrate the Discovery of Their of Homeland by Columbus
description: During Columbus's second voyage to the New World, 478 years ago, he discovered a small island that he named St. John the Baptist.

title: Notes on People
description: Dr. Margaret Mead, the an thropologist, was chosen in Paris as this year's winner of the Kalinga Prize, awarded by UNESCO for particular merit in the popularization of science. The prize, which carries a stipend of $2,400, is named for an ancient In dian empire renowned for its peaceful policies more than 2,000 years ago. Previous recipients include Sir Julian Huxley, the biologist; Konrad Lorenz, the zoologist, and Bertrand Russell, the philos opher.

title: ATOM UNITS OPEN INSPECTION TALKS
description: VIENNA, Nov. 18The Inter national Atomic Energy Agency has opened negotiations on ar rangements for inspecting the nonmilitary nuclear installa tions of West Germany, Italy Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg.

title: Trustee Indicates Pennsy May Need More Federal Help
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Jervis Langdon Jr., one of the four trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central, indicated today in a letter to Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, that the railroad might need as much as $500million in addi tional Government help over the next few years.

title: NEW SOVIET ARMS REPORTED IN EGYPT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  The Soviet Union has supplied Egypt with a number of me dium bombers equipped with airtoground missiles during the last two weeks, State De partment officials said today.

title: NATHALIE E. WINSER, DEACONESS 63 YEARS
description: MONTCLAIR, N., J., Nov. 18 Nathalie E. Winser, a retired deaconess of the Episcopal Church who served parishes in this area for 63 years, died yes terday in the Montcalm Nursing Home. Her age was 94.

title: Changing Scene: Pack Of Chewing Gum Grows
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18The fivestick pack of chewing gum is becoming further unstuck from the American scene.

title: Memphis State in Bowl Berth
description: PASADENA Calif., Nov. 18 (AP)Memphis State, champ ion of the Missouri Valley Con ference, will meet the Pacific Coast Athletic Association foot ball representative in the Dec. 18 Pasadena Bowl, officials an nounced today. Memphis State will play San Jose State, Long Beach State or Fresno State.

title: Puerto Rican Plant Set
description: The Upjohn Company an nounced yesterday that it would build a major pharma ceutical complex at a cost of $30million near Arecibo, Puerto Rico, about 50 miles west of San Juan. In making the an nouncement to securities ana lysts here, Ray T. Parfet Jr., chairman, also said the com pany expected a nonrecurring gain of about 7 cents a share in the fourth quarter from the sale of its Asgrow seeddivision headquarters in Connecticut.

title: Layer and Ashe Move On
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 18 (AP) Rod Laver of Australia scored a straightset victory over Bob Lutz, and Arthur Ashe of Gum Springs, Va., defeated Cliff Drysdale in quarterfinal match es of the $100,000 World Cham pionship Tennis tournament to night.

title: Aiken Demands Kennedy Prove Charge of Sorry Butz Record
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Senator George D. Aiken called on Senator Edward M. Ken nedy today to prove unsub stantiated charges against President Nixon's nominee for Secretary of Agriculture, Earl L. Butz.

title: Some Ethnic Germans Prefer to Stay Behind
description: MIKOLAJKI, Poland, Nov. 11Two months ago Oskar Pogorzalski left his 80acre farm in this Pomeranian vil lage to begin a new life with his wife and four children in West Germany. The decision was not an easy one.

title: Bridge: Players in the Fall Nationals Face SitetoSite Shuttling
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 18 Thousands of bridge players are converging on this city tonight, and a few may de velop schizophrenic symp toms before the Fall National Championships of the Amer ican Contract Bridge League conclude in ten days time.

title: Carson Scored and Praised as jury Gets Bribe Case
description: Robert T. Carson was both denounced as a corrupt con spirator and defended as an honest official in the summa tions yesterday at his Federal Court trial here on charges that he took part in a bribery scheme while he was an aide to Senator Hiram L. Fong of Hawail.

title: Wadkins and Hooper Share Azalea Golf Lead With 64's
description: WILMINGTON, N. C., Nov. 18 (UPI)  Lanny Wadkins, a former United States Amateur champion, and Herb Hooper of Richmond, blistered the Cape Fear Country Club course to day with sevenunderpar 64's and shared the firstround lead in the $35,000 Azalea open golf tournament.

title: NEW KENYA FINDS EXPLAINED HERE
description: Richard Leakey, the son of Louis and Mary Leakey, the archeologists noted for their work in Africa, reported yes terday several new finds he had made in diggings in Kenya. The finds, he said, could force scientists to modify some of their interpretations of the evo lution of man.

title: DETECTIVE SEIZED ON DRUG CHARGE
description: A firstgrade detective was suspended from the Police De partment yesterday after he and a friend were arrested near Kennedy International Air port on charges of possessing two barrels of crude marijuna, valued at $65,000.

title: Study Finds A Shortage Of Dentists
description: The state suffers from a declining ratio of dentists to population that could be come worse as people in creasingly rely on insurance policies to pay for fillings, extractions, false teeth and other dental needs, accord ing to a study made for the Board of Regents.

title: $1Million Left in Will
description: An estate of more than $1 million was left by Mrs. Jessie Woolworth Donahue, who died Nov. 1 at the age of 82, accord ing to a will filed for probate yesterday in Manhattan Surro gate Court. The widow of James P. Donahue and last surviving daughter of Frank W. Woolworth, founder of the variety store chain, Mrs. Donahue left $100,000 in cash and a life income on a trust fund of $1million to her son, Woolworth Donahue, of Palm Beach. Fla.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Rejects Thant Proposal
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 18 (AP) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has turned down U Thant's pro posal that he help relieve ten sions between India and Paki stan. She urged him to con centrate instead on ending the civil war in East Pakistan.

title: Organized Servicemen A broad Intensify Drive Against Racism
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The founder of a confedera tion of groups of militant black soldiers in Germany said today that organized servicemen, blacks and whites, had moved from a positron of conciliation to revolutionary, defensive and violent stands because of con tinued racism in the armed services.

title: FILION SPECTATOR, BUT NOT FOR LONG
description: YONKERS, Nov. 18  Herve Filion, thrown from the sulky when General Dayan went off stride shortly after the start of the seventh race at Yonkers Raceway last night, returned to the course tonight, but as spectator.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While I have been a beneficiary, along with 2.7 million other Federal employes, of substantial pay raises in the past two years, I beg to differ with your Nov. 8 editorial Equity for Federal Employes which approved of efforts in the Congress to mandate yet another increase in Federal wages and salaries.

title: Justice Blackmun Sells Stocks; Reenters 3 Cases Before Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  Supreme Court Justice Harry A. Blackmun has sold stocks that caused him to disqualify him self from three pending Su preme Court cases because of potential conflicts of interest.

title: DRURY CHARGES TICKET COERCION
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, charged yester day that city officials were coercing sanitation police men to sell tickets to a fund raising dinner for Mayor Lind say.

title: Nixon vs. Congress on Vietnam
description: President Nixon has set himself against a majority Congress and the nation with his curt rejection of Congressional declaration that it is the policy of the United States to withdraw all of its military forces from Indochina at the earliest practicable date  subject to the release of all American prisoners of war.

title: BRIBE IS OFFERED TO AIDE OF HOGAN
description: A detective who is a key figure in a highly sensitive branch of the Manhattan Dis trict Attorney's office was of fered a $15,000ayear retainer to pass on secret information about the office's activities, Dis trict Attorney Frank S. Hogan asserted yesterday.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE OFF FROM 70 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Freight traffic on United States railroads last week were con siderably below the yearearlier volume. Intercity truck tonnage last week increased.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his Nov. 8 OpEd page article, Jacques Monod, 1965 Nobel Prize winner in biology, writes that man is a product of pure chance.

title: At French Consulate, Little but Gossip
description: There appeared to be only one topic for small talk among employes at the French Con sulate here yesterday: the mys tery man in their midst, identi fied as a contact in a $12 million heroin smuggling con spiracy.

title: RECORD PURSE SET FOR WOMEN'S GOLF
description: Women professional golfers have hit a high in tournament prize money. A new event with the richest purse ever, the $110,000 Dinah ShoreColgate Winners Circle championship, will be played at the Mission Hills Country Club, Palm Springs, Calif., April 1416.

title: Ecuador Breaks Taiwan Ties
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Nov. 18 (AP)Ecuador has broken dip lomatic relations with Nation alist China, the second Latin American country to cut its ties with Taiwan this week. Mexico announced its break in relations Tuesday.

title: Advertising:
description: Gillette's two  faced blade entry, TRAC II, which it an nounced Sept. 1, will find a, little competitor in the inar ketplace called Super II come January.

title: Reykjavik Denies Accord
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 18  Iceland's mission made public today a statement from the Government in Rey kjavik denying that there had been any agreement with the United States Government to limit the number of black Amer ican servicemen in Iceland.

title: Sports of The Times
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 18Leaving his motel for the Astro dome, Buster Mathis called at the apartment where his 18monthold son had been stowed for the duration. The babysitter didn't know him and refused to let him in it simply wasn't Buster's night.

title: Merger News
description: The board of directors of the Kendall Company voted yesterday not to recommend to stockholders the acquisition proposals of Textron, Inc., and the ColgatePalmolive Com pany.

title: Breeding Stock Sale Ends With $9.8Million Record
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 18 (AP)Keeneland concluded the greatest sale of thoroughbred breeding stock in its history to day with total money paid over four days of sales of $9.8mil lion.

title: PINCAY REGISTERS AQUEDUCT TRIPLE
description: Laffit Pincay, the Panaman ian jockey who tops the list of riders on the New York Racing Association circuit, won three races at Aqueduct yes terday before a crowd of 21, 203. His most significant tri umph occurred in the feature event, in which he steered Neil Heliman's Mr. Paul B. to a two length success.

title: SATURDAY REVIEW GETS A NEW EDITOR
description: The Saturday Review, in the midst of drastic changes, could retain the familiar N.C. sig nature in its editorial page, if it wished. But the initials would stand for Nicolas Charney, who appointed himself yesterday to succeed Norman Cousins as the magazine's new editor.

title: Minority Bank Planned
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP) Clarence Farmer, chairman, of the Philadelphia Commis sion on Human Relations, has announced that a minority operated bank would be founded here next spring. The proposed Urban Community Bank will bel the only one in the state man aged and controlled by minor ity individuals.

title: 425,000 Shares Offered Of A. G. Edwards at $12
description: An initial public offering of 425,000 shares of A. G. Ed wards & Sons, Inc., a St. Louis based brokerage firm, was made yesterday at $12 a share.

title: Pay Panelist Advises Industry to Bargain
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 18  The leading business member of the Pay Board warned today that the panel would not nec essarily bail out companies that negotiate inflationary labor con tracts.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Paris Couture Comes to Locust Valley
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I. All a woman who lives in the posh Oyster Bay area of Long Island has to do to acquire en original French couture gown these days is to hop over to the railroad station. There, in the plaza across the street, next to the decorating shops, restaurants and cloth ing stores, she'll find a salon that's right out of Paris. She'll be greeted by a French directrice and fitted by the chief of a Paris atelier. Her measurements will be sent to the headquarters of Jacques Esterel on the Faubourg SaintHonord in Paris, and in 10 days she can return to pick up her dress.

title: Blast Destroys Warehouse
description: BAY ST. LOUIS, Miss, Nov. 18 (AP)A Shell Oil Company warehouse holding 40,000 gal lons of fuel exploded today as elementary schoolchildren walked to class 25 yards away. One man was injured, but all 226 children escaped. Alvin Genin, owner of the plant, said the explosion had occurred when a truck driver was un loading gasoline from his tank truck and the engine idled up and ignited the gasoline. A series of muffled explosions followed. The warehouse was destroyed.

title: Other Murphy Innovations
description: The establishment yesterday of an Organized Crime Control Bureau was the latest in a series of major de partmental changes made by Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy during his tenure. Among other significant changes initiated by Commisioner Murphy are the follow ing:

title: DEFENSE BUDGET CUT $33BILLION BY SENATE GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  The Senate Appropriations Committee cut $3.3billion from the defense budget today but refused to impose mandatory Vietnam troop withdrawals upon the Administration.

title: About Pro Football
description: First place in three of pro football's six divisions will be at stake on Sunday in games at Miami, Washington and Los Angeles. The Rams 49ers contest will be tele cast here following the Giants game at Pittsburgh, the starting times on Chan nel 2 being 1 and 4 P.M. The Jets, playing at Buffalo, to be seen here on Channel 4, have a TV conflict with the Giants, starting at 1 o'clock. Here is a preview of all games with wonlosttied records in pa rentheses.

title: Durocher Rehired to Pilot Cubs
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18 (UPI) Leo Durocher, fiery man ager of the Chicago Cubs in the National League, has signed to continue to man age the club in 1972, the Cubs announced tonight.

title: U.S. Transfers Agent
description: PARIS, Nov. 18John Cusack, the chief American narcotics agent in Europe, who has been embroiled in controversy with his French colleagues, is being transferred to another post at a time when controversy be tween France and the United States over narcotics traf ficking is hotter than ever.

title: Everett Fraser, Law Dean, Was Representative's Father
description: LINCOLN, Mass., Nov. 18 (AP)Everett Fraser, father of Representative Donald M. Fraser, Democrat of Minnesota, died yesterday at his home here. He was 92 years old.

title: Group of 10 Talks Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally today called top finance officers of the major nonCommunist countries to a Nov. 30Dec. 1 meeting in Rome to discuss the interna tional monetary impasse.

title: The Price Is Right And So's the Food
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmos phere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: PRICE CHIEF SAYS PROFITS CAN RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  The chairman of the Price Com mission told Congress today that a business could achieve higher profit margins than were allowed by the new price reg ulations if it succeeded in cut ting costs, provided only that it did not raise prices.

title: Dr. Frederic Sharpless; A Physician Since 1903
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 18Dr. Frederic Sharpless, a general practitioner for many years, died at a nursing home here on Tuesday. He was 91 years old and had lived in Haverford and Rosemont.

title: The Talk of New York
description: Explaining what happened that May night from the wit ness stand yesterday, An drew Rivera said he didn't discover the paper hag stuffed with $50 and $100 bills in the well of his con vertible until he got home from his job as a cargo and luggage handler at Kennedy International Air port. He had gone upstairs to have his dinner in his parents apart ment in a two family home at 816 Elton Avenue in the Bronx, he tes tified, only to discover that his mother had done no cooking that night. So he went downstairs to fetch a lunch he had taken to work but not eaten there and then, he said, he found the bag.

title: Newspaper Is Halted By Policemen's Wives
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Policemen's wives blocked publication of early Friday editions of The Phila delphia Inquirer tonight when pressmen walked out in sym pathy with the women's demonstration against newspaper series on alleged police corruption.

title: LEHMAN PAVILION BACKED BY COURT
description: The complaint of two groups that sought to block the con struction in Central Park of an $8million addition to the Met ropolitan Museum of Art was dismissed yesterday by the Court of Appeals.

title: Mills to Scan Depreciation Rules
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 18 Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said today that he planned to reexamine the tax treatment of depreciation on commercial properties with a view toward relaxing the strict guidelines imposed by the present Federal income tax law.

title: Market Place: Keeping Track Of Short Sales
description: Let's suppose for a minute that the stock exchanges re quired that every short sale recorded on the tickertape be preceded by a tiny s. Go ing a step further, every time a short sale was covered the trade would be preceded by an sc.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LONDON  A decade ago, when Edward Heath was a rising British politicianstatesman, and the late Sean Lemass was Prime Minister of Eire, the two men shared a single dream.

title: TWO HEALTH BILLS SIGNED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  President Nixon signed into law today two health man power bills designed to en courage and help finance the training of more doctors, den tists, nurses and other profes sionals.

title: News Analysis
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 18 (AP) Two United States tuna fishing boats were captured by an Ecuadorian patrol boat today, the American Tunaboat Associ ation said. A spokesman identi fied the boatsthe 14th and 15th seized the last 10 days as the Ecuador and the Wiley V.A.

title: Joblessness Up in Britain
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (AP)  Britain's worst unemployment slump since the Depression of the nineteenthirties intensified this month, the Government an nounced today. Unemployment reached 970,022 earlier this month, the Government said,

title: Court Curbs 23 Companies In Alabama Pollution Peril
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 18A Federal judge ordered 23 companies in this area to halt production today after air pollution climbed to about twice the level at which a danger alert would be given. The order was the first injunction against polluters made under the emergency provisions of the Clean Air Act of 1970.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: No one will disagree with Marie Syrkin's condemnation of the provoca tive rhetoric of Leroi Jones and other black rniiltants and separatists (Op Ed Nov. 6). The question her article leaves unanswered for me, is what those engaged in the struggle to pro mote equality for blacks should have done when the opportunists moved into the ground won for them by the nonviolent black and white leaders.

title: Namath Weighs Facing Bills Sunday After Practicing With Jets Offense
description: Joe Namath's left knee it used to be the good one  supported him yesterday in his first workout with the Jets offensive squad since he tore its ligaments 3 months ago.

title: WOMEN'S EQUALITY IS PRESSED BY CITY
description: The city's suppliers were warned yesterday that failure, to adhere to new municipal) guidelines designed to end dis crimination by business against women would mean Cancella tion of contracts, withholding of payments or disqualification from bidding on work for the city.

title: Commodity Price Index Off, 0.6 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials fell to 105.5 from 106.1 last week.

title: S.E.C. Shift Is Hinted on Earnings Forecasts
description: William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, indicated yester day that the S.E.C. was leaning toward an important policy change involving the public fore casting of corporate financial performance.

title: Finland Increases Duties On All Imported Products
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 18 (AP)  Finland today raised customs duties on imported goods from all countries out side the European Free Trade Area and the Soviet Union by 2 to 5 per cent. About onethird of Finnish imports are affected.

title: REALTY TRUSTS SPLIT ON OUTLOOK
description: The real estate investment trust industry, which has grown to a $6billion giant in the last 10 years, was shak en yesterday by a broad sell off in trust shares.

title: LINCOLN WALSH, 68, OF ELECTRONIC FIRM
description: MILLINGTON, N. J., Nov. 18 Lincoln Walsh, head of an electronic engineering company bearing his name, who designed audio systems, transformers and radio receivers, died Wednes day in Morristown. He was 68 years old and lived here.

title: PAY BOARD DELAYS MINE PACT RULING
description: PAY BOARD DELAYS MINE PACT RULING

title: Glory Time Has Arrived for the Chicago Symphony
description: There is a time for pen ance and a time for glory, and for the Chicago Sym phony Orchestra glory time has arrived. After many decades of enforced modesty when the orchestra rarely left home, the Chicago recent ly has been getting out to let the world know what it has been missing. Its first Euro pean tour was completed this summer with immense suc cess, and Wednesday night the orchestra for the first time in its history opened its own series of concerts at Carnegie Hall.

title: jobs for Veterans
description: James B. Oates, national chairman of Jobs for Vet erans, had the following to say about the United Serv ice Organiza tions: For the last 30 years, the U.S.O. has meant a hospitable break from the duties of military lifea free cup of coffee or a friendly smileto millions of servicemen stationed all over the world.

title: Open Higher but Close Near Level of Previous Day
description: With the start of a strike at Anaconda's Raritan copper re finery at Perth Amboy, N.J., the copper futures market here opened  cent a pound higher yesterday, but later backed down and closed at about Wednesday's levels.

title: Marshal Cites Internal Unrest
description: BANGKOK, Nov. 18 (UPI)L Marshal Thanom told Govern ment officials today that the coup had been necessary be cause of the confused world situation and also because of internal unrest.

title: 2 LANDLORDS FINED FOR HARASSMENT
description: The owners of two buildings in the Gramercy Park section were fined $12,000 yesterday on a charge of harassment of the tenants.

title: 531697 Wins in Jersey
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 18 (AP)sThe winning number in this week's New Jersey lot tery is 531697. Holders of tickets with all six numbers in the correct order will win $50, 000; with the last five num bers $4,000; the last four $400; and the last three $40. Holders of tickets with the last two digits matching those of the winning number become eligible for a millionaire's drawing to be held later this year.

title: Grievances Rise as More Firemen in Contract Dispute Call In 111
description: Increasing numbers of fire fighters reported sick and the number of grievances increased yesterday as the city's firemen pressed for a new contract.

title: Labor Unit's Statement
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 18Following is the text of a statement by the Executive Council of the American Fed eration of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, including three recommenda tions for action by organized labor during President Nix on's economic program. The recommendations were ap proved by the labor federa tion's convention here today.

title: XAVIERA HOLLANDER FACES DEPORTATION
description: The alleged madam of an ex pensive East Side brothel has been arrested by Immigration and Naturalization authorities for having remained in the United States illegally after her visa expired.

title: Rise of Total U.S. Output In Quarter Tops Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The nation's total output of goods and services  the gross national product  rose a lit tle more in the third quarter than previously estimated the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: Watching Andrei Voznesensky Read
description: Voznesensky has a curious look like a wood animal, one that often lives not far from marshes, near places where the deer sink in up to their knees. Waiting to read while the translation is being spoken, he sits with a blank expressionless facelike a pool unstirred by windthe hair falling over the pale forehead is little like birch branches swaying over the water.

title: 2 Officers Testify Agents Didn't Tell Of Mylai 4 Killings
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 18 Two intelligence officers who served in the Americal Division testified today that their South Vietnamese agents and inform ants had never made any men tion of civilians killed by Amer ican soldiers at Mylai 4.

title: PISTONS WIN, 128126, TO END LOSS STREAK
description: DETROIT, Nov. 18 (AP)A basket by Curtis Rowe and a free throw by Howard Komives in the final 40 seconds en abled Detroit to defeat the Phoenix Suns, 128126, tonight and snap a threegame Pistons losing streak in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Canadian Added to Candidate List for Thant Job
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 18Maurice F. Strong, the leading United Nations of ficial in environmental affairs, is being seriously discussed here as a possible candidate to succeed Secretary General Thant, who is to retire Dec. 31.

title: Fire Hazard
description: The quality of the air was bad. Mayor Lindsay was out of town. Firemen were conducting a work slowdown. All in all, yesterday in New York City was pretty much like any other.

title: THREAT TO U.N. AID IN PAKISTAN SEEN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 18The head of the United Nations relief operation in East Pakistan warned today that active opposition from any quarter would compel the aid program to cease.

title: AirPollution Advisories Issued Along East Coast
description: A stagnant air mass that hung persistently over most of the Eastern Seaboard from the Canadian border south to Ala bama yesterday brought ad visories of potential airpollu tion dangers to half a dozen areas, including metropolitan New York.

title: Athas of Giants Is Kept on Run By Split End Job
description: On his second day of work ing out in earnest at split end, Pete Athas, the New York Giants converted de fensive back, found out that switching to offense was little more than just the other side of the coin.

title: Nixon Arrives in Florida
description: HOMESTEAD, Fia., Nov. 18 (AP)President Nixon arrived at Homestead Air Force Base tonight for a weekend stay at his Key Biscayne home and a speech to the A.F.L.C.I.O. con vention.

title: Ivy League Roundup
description: Princeton plays host to Dartmouth's defending Ivy League champions tomorrow in Palmer Stadium and two talented sons of Dartmouth alumni could wreck the Indians title hopes.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Angler Hooked
description: SPRINGFIELD, Vt., Nov. 18 Benny Birsky, one of this community's foremost an glers, was prospecting re cently along the west bank of the Connecticut River when he came to a dead stop. He spied something on the ground that baffled him, so he took out his glasses for a closer look.

title: Wednesday Fights
description: New York (Madison Square Garden)  Enrique Pinder, 118 pounds, Panama, outpointed Dave Vasquez, 118 New York, 12 rounds.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. to discuss world disarmament confer ence.

title: Artist Makes Exhibition of Himself at Metropolitan
description: The bright red banner hanging over the entrance to the Metropolitan Museum of Art proclaims a current ex hibition of European paint ing.

title: Auburn's Sullivan: Hero In the Huck Finn Mold
description: Pat Sullivan is willing to wait for longdistance tele phone calls from the Atlanta Falcons or Philadelphia Eagles after the professional football draft next January.

title: Kodak and Others Raising Dividends
description: Directors of the Eastman Kodak Company and several other smaller concerns voted yesterday to increase their cash dividends, but all were around the 4 per cent rise al lowed under Phase Two of the Federal guidelines for divi dends.

title: TV: Pummeling and Shaking Turkey, It's Ebullient French Chef
description: Giggles. Grunts. Breathless ness. Groans. Clatter. More giggles. And the viewer has been whisked through still another session or the The French Chef. The chef, of course, is a very tall, hand some woman named Julia Child and she is decidedly nonFrench.

title: Nixon to Name Judges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he would nominate Robert L. Kunzig, now head of the General Services Adminis tration, to be an associate judge of the United States Court of Claims. He also said that he would nominate Thomas A. Flannery, the United States At torney for the District of Co lumbia, to be a Federal district judge here.

title: Troop Cutback in Europe Is Voted by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The Senate Appropriations Committee overrode Nixon Ad ministration objections today and approved an amendment that would compel the with drawal of 60,000 United States troops from Europe by next June 15.

title: JOHN A. HEIMBRUCH
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 18 John A. Heimbruch, vice pres ident, purchasing, for General Instrument Corporation, died Tuesday at Overlook Hospital after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 50 Cambridge Drive, Short Hills.

title: India Will Name a Senior Diplomat as Ambassador to Peking and Expects China to Take Similar Action
description: NEW DELIIL, Nov. 18The Indian Government has de cided to nominate a senior ca reer diplomat as Ambassador to Peking on the understanding that China will reciprocate the gesture almost immediately, in formed sources said today.

title: Lubovitch Dancers in 2 Premieres
description: Lar Lubovitch designed the foam rubber seating arrange ments for the public as well as the choreography in his latest concert. His company, the Lar Lubovitch Dance Company, opened Wednes day night for a run through Monday night at Stage City, a studiolike affair at 66 East Fourth Street. The audience sits on an inclined plank with foam padding. Seat cushions are available.

title: Mansfield Offers a Pacific Peace Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Senator Mike Mansfield, the Senate Majority Leader, pro posed tonight that the United States, the Soviet Union, China and Japan assume a collective responsibility to maintain peace in the Pacific.

title: NEW UNIT TO FIGHT ORGANIZED CRIME
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday set up a 1,200man Organized Crime Control Bureau aimed at ending the department's fragmented attack against gambling and narcotics, two of the most lucrative activities of organized crime.

title: Advising and Consenting
description: WASHINGTONThe twentieth cen tury has witnessed an unfortunate shift in the balance of power in the Federal Government. For the most part, power has flowed down Pennsyl vania Avenue from the Capitol to the White House. In recent years, the Congress has attempted to reassert many of its constitutional powers. And one of the most important is the power to advise and consent to nomi nations of Supreme Court justices.

title: Executive Changes
description: American Brands, Inc., yesterday elected William Hausberg as president and chief executive officer effective Dec. 1. Mr. Hausberg, formerly executive vice president, replaces Franklin G. Meeker who is retiring.

title: PENTAGON SEARCHES NEWS ROOM DESKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) The Defense Department ac knowledged today that its se curity agents had again con ducted nighttime searches of desks in the Pentagon press room but said that it was a mistake and would not be re peated.

title: Consular Official Queried On Heroin Smuggling Plot
description: NEWARK, Nov. 18  United States officials delivered a series of questions to an un identified official in the French Consulate in New York City today, asking him what he knew about an alleged inter national criminal conspiracy that had smuggled $12million in heroin into this country.

title: 24 Airlines Support Cut in Atlantic Fare
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 18The chief executives of the 24 major airlines serving the North At lantic reached tentative agree ment here tonight on lower air fares for certain passengers, apparently avoiding a fare war next February.

title: Advertising:
description: The United States Govern ment might he finished with its census taking for this decade, but Compusamp will never stopat least as long as sampling is an important marketing tool.

title: DR. HANS BRINITZER
description: Dr. Hans F. Brinitzer, a diplo mate of the American Board of Otolaryngology, died Tuesday at Roosevelt Hospital after a long illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 11 Riverside Drive.

title: REV. JAMES H. ENNIS
description: The Rev. James H. Ennis, pastor emeritus of St. An drew's Roman Catholic Church in Sag Harbor, L.I., died Wednesday at his home in Brooklyn, 78 Prospect Park West. He was 71 years old.

title: Joint Subsidiary Formed By Big Board and Amex
description: The New York Stock Ex change and the American Stock Exchange announced plans yes terday for a farreaching con solidation of their communica tions, clearing and automation facilities into a new, jointly owned subsidiary corporation.

title: It's $150 Moose Antlers and Fun at Museum's Auction
description: The American Museum of Natural History, in a mood to make a little money in these recessed times, un loaded with sonic success some rather special rummage at an auction the other night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The growing crisis in world trade and payments calls for a significant shift in United States policy if a breakdown of the international eco nomic order is to be avoided.

title: CITY LOAN INQUIRY MAY CALL LINDSAY
description: The possibility was raised yesterday that Mayor Lindsay might be called to appear be fore a City Council committee to answer questions about the Municipal Loan Program scan dal.

title: NOW ALI, FRAZIER TRY THE UNKNOWN
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 18While sneering at Joe Frazier's planned title defense against Terry Daniels in New Orleans on Jan. 15, Muhammad All confirmed today a 12round bout Dec. 18 with Jurgen Blin of Germany, another unranked heavyweight with equally un impressive credentials.

title: Tornado Hits Two States
description: TEXARKANA, Tex., Nov. 18 (AP)  An apparent tornado whirled across northeast Texas and southwest Arkansas early today, causing property dam age but no reported injuries. The heaviest damage was con fined to a line stretching from Atlanta, Tex., to eight miles southsoutheast of Texarkana, Ark.

title: 62 Are Dead in Hungary In an Influenza Epidemic
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 18 (UPI) Sixtytwo persons in Hungary have died in an influenza epi demic that is spreading west ward, Health Ministry sources said today.

title: Walter G. Legge, 79, Dies; Maker of Floor Polishes
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 18 Walter G. Legge, holder of patents for the control of static electricity and founder and chairman of a company bearing his name in New York City that makes antislip floor polishes and cleaners, died in Communi ty Hospital here today. He was 79 years old.

title: Thanom Sets Up NineMan Junta to Rule Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 18 (Reuters)  Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn today an nounced the formation of a nineman junta headed by him self to direct the affairs of state following the abolition of the Constitution, Parliament and Cabinet yesterday.

title: Young Jewish Escapee Charges Syria With Terror
description: A 17yearold Jewish boy said at a news conference here yesterday that although he managed to escape from Damascus four months ago the 5,000 Jews in Syria live under constant terror, with frequent arrests and torture.

title: Warriors Sharp Shooting Tops Trail Blazers, 115105
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 18 (UPI)The Golden State War riors hit on 59 per cent of their floor shots in the first half to night and coasted to a 115105 National Basketball Association victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: U.S. Swim Team in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Nov. 18 (AP)  An eightmember United States swimming team, including Mark Spitz, world recordholder, ar rived in Tokyo tonight to com pete against Japan's best swim mers in the Tokyo international swimming meet Saturday and Sunday, Besides Spitz, the oth er team members are Rick Colella, Charles Campbell, Peder Dahlberg, Sue Atwood, Claudia Clevenger, Ellie Dan iels and Jenny Bath.

title: The Fortresses of the Maginot Line Fall to the Highest Bidders
description: HESTROFF, France, Nov. 18A longhaired women's hair stylist in bellbottomed suede trousers bought the squat and ugly fortress of Hestroff today, as the French Government put fortifications of the Maginot Line on sale at public auction.

title: Millionaires Drop Lobbying Group; Publicity Is Cited
description: An attempt to organize 60 millionaires into a lobbying group for governmental and political reforms has failed largely because of the million aires aversion to publicity.

title: Kremlin Psychiatry
description: An interesting psychiatric diagnosis is in the news these days: incipient schizophrenia accompanied by para noid delusions of reforming society. One can well imagine a psychiatrist working for the secret police of Czar Nicholas H pronouncing this verdict on Lenin, or a psy chiatric henchman of Stalin declaring a similar judgment on Khrushchev had the latter ever had the temerity reveal his inmost thoughts before Stalin's death.

title: Screen: Othon Arrives
description: Othon, which opened yes terday at the St. Marks Cine ma, was shown at the eighth New York Film Festival. The following are excerpts from Roger Greenspun's review, Which appeared on Sept. 14, 1970, in The New York Times:

title: WALTER MOLLER, 51, FRANKFURT MAYOR
description: BONN, Nov. 18  Walter Moller, Mayor of Frankfurt and a leader among the militant left  wingers in Chancellor Willy Brandt's Social Demo cratic party in West Germany, died Tuesday night of a heart attack in Wiesbaden. He was 51 years old.

title: 2 City Residents Win $100,000 in Lottery
description: Two residents of the city won $100,000 each yesterday in the state lottery.

title: Toward Justice in Alaska
description: Under the usual dexterous management of Senator Jackson of Washington, chairman of the Interior Com mittee, the Alaskan native land claims bill has passed the Senate and been sent to conference. In its Senate version, the bill is not entirely satisfactory to Alaskan natives or to disinterested conservationists, but it is decidedly preferable to the Houseapproved measure.

title: Advertising:
description: The recently created Na tional Advertising Review Board had its first meeting yesterday at the Plaza and most of the 50 members were on hand.

title: Raise for Gold Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reuter)A Senator and Congressman today introduced legislation to raise the price of gold by up to 10 per cent, thus devaluing the dollar.

title: Pressure Is Reported on NASA To Make Heavy Cuts in Budget
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 18 The National Aeronautics and Space Administration is under stood to be under heavy pres sure from the Nixon Adminis tration to cut its next budget so sharply that it might have to cancel the remaining two Apollo moon landings.

title: CASADESUS PLAYS IN ELEGANT FORM
description: One of the comforts in sometimes comfortless world is the durability of music's best performers. Robert Casadesus is 72 years old now, hard as it is to believe, and his pianistic style has not changed a whit since he first came here in 1935. He was a soloist in the Musics Aeterna Orchestra's con cert in Tully Hall Wednesday night, and it was a pleasure to hear once again the elegance of his phrasing, the perfectly matched tones in passagework, the clarity he gives to a mu sical form.

title: Theater: People Are Living There
description: Perhaps unjustly I think of South Africa as a blindly fascinating wasteland of the spirit, an emptiness of the soul, where people exist by eating rather than hoping. Perhaps I think of South Africa unjustly.

title: News Analysis
description: ROME, Nov. 18Pope Paul VI today received the Foreign Minister of the Sudan, Mansour Khalid, in an audience in the Vatican that was interpreted as a sign of improving relations between the Roman Catholic Church and the Khartoum Gov ernment.

title: FLORIDA'S GOVERNOR CALLS BUSING VITAL
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 18 (UPI)Gov. Reubin Askew told the Florida P.T.A. Congress today that busing to achieve racial balance in schools was the only way to prevent Amer ica from becoming a socially apartheid country.

title: News Analysis
description: When the Nationai Advisory Commission on Civil Disorders warned after the 1967 riots that Our nation is moving toward two societies, one black, one whiteseparate and unequal, it urged that government try to break up the slums by build ing subsidized housing for low income families in middleincome neighbor hoods. To date, housing programs serving low  in come groups have been concentrated in the ghettos, the commission wrote. We believe that fed erally aided low and moderate income housing programs must be reoriented so that the major thrust is in nonghetto areas  If this is not done, those programs will continue to con centrate the most impoverished and dependent segments of the population into the centralcity ghettos where there is already a critical gap between the needs of the population and the public resources to deal with them. This can only continue to compound the conditions of failure and hopelessness which lead to crime, civil disorder and social disorganization.

title: Reserve Revises Figures
description: The Federal Reserve an nounced yesterday annual re visions of money supply data showing that money growth was somewhat lower than previously reported during the second quarter but was higher by the same percentage amount for the third quarter.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In August The Times gave consider able attention to the Study of Na tional Health Insurance Proposals prepared by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare. This report, purportedly objective, concluded that health expenditures will rise from $67 billion in fiscal 1970 to $105 billion by fiscal 1974, that the Nixon Administration's proposal for national health insurance would be among the least inflationary and the Kennedy proposal would be among the most inflationary.

title: MRS. WILLIAM BONNER
description: Mrs. May Newman Bonner, wife of William A. Bonner, a retired partner in the Chubb Corporation, insurance under writers, died Wednesday in New York Hospital. She was 75 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: Lindsay and Daley Hold a Private Talk in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18Mayor Lindsay talked what he called good oldfashioned politics with Mayor Richard J. Daley today in a 42minute meeting in Mr. Daley's office at City Hall.

title: STOCKS PLUMMET IN REALTY TRUSTS
description: Real estate investment trusts, one of the stock market's favorite winning groups in recent months, broke sharply in price yesterday to dominate a jittery session in Wall Street.

title: A NEW DRUG USED TO COMBAT HEROIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 A promising lead toward de veloping a nonaddictive, long lasting antagonist to heroin was reported today to the House Select Committee on Crime by Dr. John Adams, cochairman of the Pharmaceutical Manufactur ers Association's scientific task force on drug dependence.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG SCORES IN 3 SETS
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (AP)  Evonne Goolagong of Australia, the Wimbledon champion, scored a 67, 62, 61 victory over Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., today in the quarter finals of the Dewar Cup tennis championships.

title: The Screen
description: It's like living in a fab ulous motel, says a happy senior citizen of Sun City, Ariz., a retirement commu nity so suspicious of real life that it bans dogs, children and lawns composed of con ventional grass. Instead, Sun City places each model home in the center of a plot of ground that's been acid dyed to attain a perfect, ab solute green.

title: Flyers Down Kings, 20
