The uterine lining is as ready to receive the egg as plowed land is ready to receive seeds of grain, and the um bilical cord is always stiff, like a garden hose filled with water.

title: U. N. GROUP CALLS FOR FARM REFORM
description: ROME, Nov. 20A United Nations group that has studied land reform throughout the world has warned that in creased productivity alone has not improved the lot of rural workers but on the contrary, frequently makes it worse.

title: PENN STATE WINS, WILL GO TO BOWL
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 20Penn State's undefeated football team crushed Pittsburgh today, 5518, and then accepted a bid to play in the postseason Cot ton Bowl at Dallas against the Southwest Conference cham pion.

title: TITLE BOUT ENDS WITH NO VERDICT
description: MARACAIBO, Venezuela, Nov. 20 (AP)Erbito Salavar ria's defense of his World Box ing Council flyweight title against Betulio Gonzales of Venezuela ended without a de cision tonight after the cham pion was accused of drinking sugared water during the 15 round bout.

title: Elderly Cling to Rooms in N.Y.U. Dorms, Once Hotels
description: Mrs. Ninita Reis can afford to live anywhere in the world. The widow of a presi dent of the Minnesota Steel Corporation and once an actress, she is accustomed to fine food, expensive clothing and lavish surroundings. And she is not one to scrimp.

title: Miss Deborah Jane Wise Is Bride
description: Miss Deborah Jane Wise was married last evening to Peter N. Sheridan, who is with the New York law firm of Mendes & Mount. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman per formed the ceremony at the home of Mrs. Herbert H. Leh man, the bride's grandmother.

title: SAIGON PREPARES CAMBODIA DRIVE
description: SAIGON; South Vietnam, Nov. 20South Vietnamese military, sources reported today that a 10;000man force was poised at the Cainbotlian border for a new attack on Communist base areas northeast Of Pnompenh which has been under increased pressure from the enemy for nearly two weeks.

title: Lowery Warns That an Abnormally High Number of Injuries Reported by Firemen Poses Great Risk to City
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery warned yesterday that the abnormally high number of injuries that fire fighters were continuing to report on their return from fires posed great risk to the city.

title: For Thanksgiving, Put Flowers in the Menu
description: A HOUSEWIFE planning Thanksgiving dinner shouldn't forget flow ers. When Mrs. Leona Woodring Smith says this, she does not mean flow ers merely for the table cen terpiece, but for cooking and eating. Mrs. Smith, petite, auburnhaired and mother of a collegeage daughter, is an authority on the use of flow ers in cooking and a nation wide garden club lecturer.

title: Okada Knocked Out
description: SEQUL, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Chang KyuCbul of Korea won the Korean junior feather weight boxing crown tonight with a technical knockout over the defending champion, Koichi Okada of Japan, at 2:37 of the fifth round.

title: The Nation
description: Atop his custommade vehicle for national economic recovery, President Nixon last week continued to express high hopes for his Phase Two Ameri can Dream Machine as it completed its first seven days of operation. The same chinup attitude was shown by some of his fellowdreamers: Treasury Sec retary John Connally, Cost of Living Council Director Donald Rumsfeld, Pay Board Chairman George H. Boidt, Price Commission Chairman C. Jackson Grayson. Others, like labor leaders Leonard Woodcock and George Meany, had strong reservations. Meanwhile the American public, besieged by con flicting views and confusing economic reports, worried on.

title: Defoliant Leaving Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 20, (Rueters)More than a million gallons of herbicide Orange, a defoliant once sprayed over jungles in Vietnam, will be taken back to the United States for destruction, an American military spokes man said today.

title: The World
description: OTTAWAInformation Canada, the Government's font of facts about this country, received a letter recently from an Ohio school girl. She explained that each member of her class had been assigned to write an essay about one of the states of the Union. The one chosen for me was Canada, the girl wrote. Please send me some in formation..

title: Mets Keep Coaching Staff
description: The contracts of all four coaches of the New York Mets have been renewed, General Manager Bob Scheffing an nounced yesterday. They are Yogi Berra, first base; Rube Walker, pitching; Eddie Yost, third, and Joe Pignatano, bull pen.

title: Were You There, Ada Louise?
description: THE recently opened Kennedy Arts Center, like Lincoln Center, re ceived a mixed critical reception. Nevertheless the buildings are ob viously here to stay and, in tirne, may even come to be admired. The Center's defenders point out that past critics of architecture have often been cool to works which later gained great esteem. Along these lines, we offer some com ments that may or may not have been printed after the first showing of some now famous landmarks.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: My husband and I did Much of our sightseeing by taxi during a week in London, and without exception every driv er was courteous, opened the door at the end of the trip and thanked us for the tip. On one ride, when we wanted to, go out of the city limits, the driver showed us his manual so we would know the charge in advance. Con trast this with our arrival at Kennedy Airport. The first driver mumbled, Another one for Queens. The other said, You got luggage, too.

title: AFTER THE COUNTERCULTURE (CONT.)
description: To THE EDITOR: Yes, David and Elena, of the re cent article, What This Country Needs Is a Good Counter Counter culture Culture (by David French), there is a good counter countercul ture culture. It doesn't even lie beyond, as you put it. Apparently, you haven't noticed but it's been around you all this time.

title: NIXON VETO SEEN ON DAYCARE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  White House sources say that a compromise child care plan now pending in Congress faces an almost certain veto by President Nixon.

title: Bill Stern, Sports Announcer Known For His Anecdotes, Dies
description: Bill Stern, whose loquacious style and flamboyant anecdotes made him one of the nation's Most, and controversial sportscasters, died on Friday afternoon after suffering a heart attack at his home in Rye, N. Y. He was 64 years old and lived on Highland Ridge Lane in the Westchester community.

title: L.S.U.Tops Notre Dame, 288, and Accepts Sun Bowl Bid to Play Iowa State
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 20 (AP)Bert Jones threw two touchdown passes and scored once tonight as Louisiana State defeated Notre Dame, 288. The Tigers immediately accepted bid to play Iowa State in the Sun Bowl Dec. 18 in El Paso, Tex.

title: GIEREK SUGGESTS CANDOR ON ISSUES
description: WARSAW, Nov. 20There's an old saying, Edward Gierek told some editors recently, that you don't talk about matches in the home of a man who has experienced a fire, but then, he asked, how do you avoid another fire?

title: Mike Quarry's Title Upheld
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20 (AP)The referee's decision awarding the North American light  heavy  weight boxing championship to Mike Quarry of Anaheim, Calif., has been upheld by the California Ath letic Commission. Quarry won a technical decision over Jimmy Dupree Oct. 29 when the referee, John Thomas, ruled that Quarry had been accidentally butted. The fight was stopped in the fifth round.

title: NIXONMAYAN TAX BILLIO BAR 72'CAMPAIGNAID
description: WASHINGTON; Nov. 20 President Nixon is considering a veto of the tax bill if it in cludes a Democratic plan for public financing of the 1972 Presidential campaign.

title: Let Us All Praise Our Friend the Lichen
description: That standard denunciation of the suburban demiEden as a fraud is so weary by now that it won't even ig nite a boring cocktail party in Manhasset; yes, yes, we all know that Long Island has the same problems as the city. But did we all know that it still has lichen, and that the city doesn't?

title: Dr. Ralph Herz Jr. Weds Mrs. Lampert
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Williams Lampert of Zurich, Switzer land, was married here yes terday afternoon to Dr. Ralph Herz Jr. in the chapel of the Unitarian Church of All Souls. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring.

title: POET READS HERE FOR BENGALI RELIEF
description: Andrei Vozesensky, the Bus shin poet, recited four poems that ranged in mood from angry despair to playful satire last night at an evening of verse and song held to raise relief money for the Bengalis in East Pakistan.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Heading the Northeast Di vision's contingent of drivers for the clubracing festival at Road Atlanta next weekend are a couple of highly respected wheelerdealers. They are Bob Sharp of Wil ton, Conn., and Fred Steven son of Sodom Corners, Conn. They have wheeled their rac ing cars with such skill that each has won two Sports Car Club of America division cham pionships and each driver is a dealer. Sharp sells Datsuns and Stevenson is the Eastern distributor for Lotus.

title: Navy Loses Top Back
description: ANNAPOLIS, Nov. 20 (AP) Navy's top running back, Dan Howard, wil miss the Army game next Saturday because of torn ligaments of the left knee, the middie coach, Rick Forsano, said today. Howard was in jured in a punting drill at prac tice yesterday and underwent surgery today.

title: French TeenA gers Earn A's On Slopes, Not in Classrooms
description: PARIS, Nov. 20It's ri diculous to expect me to beat the French, an American skier once cemplained. We don't start off even.

title: Brooklyn College Gets Music Of Black Classical Composers
description: After a century of ob scurity, four major black classical composers have gained their deserved critical recognition through the ef forts of a music professor at Brooklyn College.

title: Editorial Cartoon 6  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 6  No Title

title: Stans and Kosygin Explore Ways to Increase Trade
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20Secre tary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans arrived in Moscow today and met with Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin to explore ways of spurring the growth of Soviet American trade, which has been lagging far behind Mos cow's exchanges with other Western industrial nations.

title: Black Caucus Calls National Political Convention
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Congressional Black Caucus called tonight for a national black political convention to be held in April or May of 1972.

title: Showbiz, hucksters, and the tube
description: Virtually every intelligent and independent observer has concluded that American tele vision is a national scandal of criminal proportions. Many are implicated beyond network of ficials and station ownersin cluding elected and appointed officials, like F.C.C. Commis sioners. As is so often the case with social calamities, how ever, the epidemic is easier to criticize than to diagnose ac curately and treat effectively.

title: POPPYBAN COST TO U.S. DISCLOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  The United States has agreed to give Turkey $35million to compensate Turkish peasants who refrain from growing opi um poppies after 1972 and to compensate the Turkish Gov ernment for loss of revenue from legal opium exports.

title: The game as seen from the gridiron and the grandstand
description: Sports books usually don't make much money unless they produce big ripples in high places (Ball Four), or mind lessly flail in all directions (They Call It a Game), or step inside the brain of a fam ous personality (Run to Day light, Instant Replay) or simply get a superpromotional push by their publishers (Paper Lion).

title: Truck Stops Transformed Into MillionDollar Complexes
description: MESQUITE, Tex.  It is 3:45 A.M., and the jukebox is pounding out something from Nashville  Charley Pride singing A Place for the Lonesome.

title: Children's Books In Brief
description: Caveat emptor. Now why should a volume that looks so classy disap point so? Because it is sad, static and encrusted with silly non sequi turs like in (Continued on Page 10)

title: Horizon Clubs Admit Boys
description: The Horizon Clubs, a unit of the National Council of Camp Fire Girls, has opened its na tionwide membership to boys of high school age.  The coun cil also announced that it was opening Camp Fire leadership ranks to males.

title: ARKANSAS DOWNS TEXAS TECH, 150
description: FAYETTEViLLE, Ark Nov. 20 (AP)Walter Nelson and Mike Saint, second teamers most of the season, combined their talents today to give bowl bound Arkansas a 15;0 victory over Texas Tech in the regular season finale for both teams.

title: The Prisoner Merely Complains
description: WHY did I feel such an enormous relief when, toward the end of the first half of Neil Simon's new comedy, The Prisoner of Second Avenue, Peter Falk went out onto the balcony of his high rise apartment to shout fresh curses at the neighbors above him only to be suddenly, shatteringly inundated by a bucketful of water hurled from the unfriendly heavens?

title: French Secret Service Scandal Spreads in Wake of Drug Case
description: PARIS, Nov. 20A narcotics case in New Jersey was lead ing today to a spreading scan dal in the French secret serv ice.

title: FLA. STATE ROMPS OYER TULSA, 4510
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 20 (AP)Gary Huff, Florida State's quarterback, threw four touch down, passes  including a 61 yarder to Barry Smithto lead a 4510 victory over Tulsa to night.

title: Monty had the Wellington touch
description: Was Montgomery the most overrated general of World War II? Or was he the best British general since Welling ton? Ronald Lewin, after weighing the claims of Haig, Wavell, Alexander and Slim (but not Wolseley, Roberts,Kitchener or Audhinleck) comes perhaps a little reluc tantly to the conclusion that he was the latter. Wavell did what Montgomery never could have done; Slim led his army to victory in a manner far beyond Montgomery's grasp. Nonetheless Montgomery is the British general whom one must, writes Lewin, regard as the best since Wellington be cause it is as difficult to imagine Slim as it is to imag ine Wavell in command of the British and American troops who went ashore in Normandy on Operation Over lord in 1944.

title: The World
description: The writer of the following dispatch returned last week from a trip be hind guerrilla lines in East Pakistan.

title: G.M. Mundy Weds Diana Vietor
description: Miss Diana Victor, and Gardner Mahlon Mundy of New York and Glen Cove, L. I., were married here Yes terday afternoon In Trinity Episcopal Church by the rec tor, the Rev. Dr. John Vernon Butler.

title: Children's Books In Brief
description: On the premise that it is more than just a nutty form of acquisitive ness, George Sullivan tells the auto graph collector how to specialize, cope with rebuffs, keep records. How to restore and preserve paper, how to erase with crustless bread, how to send for free help from the Department of Archives and what organizations to join. How to tell original signatures from facsimiles or proxies, and how to be an eloquent correspondent. Further, how to spend

title: Trinity Ties for Title
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 20 (UPI)Mike Curry, passed for two touchdowns and an for another to lead Trinity to a 2811 victory over Arkansas State and a Southland Confer ence cochampionship with Louisiana Tech today.

title: Hospital Complex Is Formed by Merger
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I. The largest voluntary hospi tal in Nassau and Queens Counties will be established here with the announced merger last week of the Long Island Jewish Medical Cen ter and Hillside Hospital.

title: The Theater: Scoundrel
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The Guthrie Theater is simply having a great season, I would like to pick it up and bring it home with me to New York. There are those times when things, for some reason more obscure than most people would admit, go inhumanly right for a theater. Those inhuman things are going right for the Guthrie Theater right now.

title: The World
description: TOKYO  For 45 years Emperor Hirohito has lived quietly behind the great gray walls of the Imperial Palace in the center of Tokyo as a ceremon ial figurehead, performing Shinto re ligious rituals, affixing his seal to documents, and adjusting to the au thority of Government Ministers. Rare ly has the Japanese press been given more than a glimpse of his wife, and the foreign press never.

title: City Port Aide Named
description: The appointment of Frank J. Pannizzo as first deputy com missioner of ports and termi nals has been announced by Mayor Lindsay. Mr. Pannizzo had previously served as assist ant commissioner and deputy general counsel of the Economic Development Administration. He joined city government in 1967 as assistant counsel to the Department of Marine and Aviation.

title: HOUSING CURB DUE ON JERSEY SHORE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20  Tne State Department of Enviren mental Protection will have the right to veto housing develop ment plans along the New Jer sey Shore beginning Jan. 15.

title: Theater in Washington, D.C.,
description: THE best new American play of the past three or four seasons has never been seen in New York. It was written by someone named Michael Weller, who was born in New York in 1942 and who now lives in London. It is currently on view, in an ex cellent production, at Wash ington's Arena Stage. It is called Moonchildren.

title: Westchester
description: MOUNT HERMON, Mass., Nov. 20Deerfield, using the passes of Brandy Trotter, rallied to defeat Mount Hermon, 2215, today in the 30th game between the schools. Deerfield took the lead in the series, 14 13. There have been three ties.

title: Art
description: R UFINO TAMAYO is not Only the dean of Mexi can painters (Siquei ros and his followers will please rorm a line on the left and we will argue the point some other time) but is also the only painter of any country who has managed to harmonize the Innovations of the School of Paris with the traditions  more spiritual than formal  of an ancient Culture. The arts of Africa, Melanesia, pre Hispanic America and a dozen ancient Near Eastern civilizations have served as reference libraries for 20thcentury European painters and sculp tors, but the saddest art of Modern times has come from Africa, Melanesia, Latin America and other countries where modernized forms have been borrowed back in an effort to develop a national school. A large Tamayo mural, not too successful and badly installed in the main entrance hall of the United Nations secretariat building a couple of weeks ago, and an exhibition of paintings of 197071 that is now hanging at the Penis Galleries, show how difficult the hybridiza tion has been for one man and how beautifully he has achieved it at last.

title: Blues Rally to Win, 42
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 20 (AP) The St. Louis Blues, trailing 20, early in the second period, rallied for four straight goals to defeat the Pittsburgh Pen guins, 42, tonight.

title: Pistons Win, 10596
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 20 (AP) The Detroit Pistons, led by Jim my Walker's 35 points, pulled away from Buffalo in the clos ing minutes and beat the Braves, 10596, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Dickson to Join Cards
description: ST. Louis, Nov. 20 (AP) Paul Dickson, acquired from the Minnesota Vikings on waivers last week, will join the St. Louis Cardinals for their game with the Philadel phia Eagles tomorrow. The de fensive tackle earlier had said he was retiring.

title: LindsayTroy Feud Hurts Both Sides
description: I didn't pick this fight. It's beyond me why they did it.Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr.

title: Abrams Aids McGovern Drive In Florida's Important Primary
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 20  Bronx Borough President Rob ert Abrams campaigned in this crucial primary state this Week end for Senator George Mc Govern.

title: TARKENTON SHORT OF TOP RECEIVERS
description: Although both teams have identical 45 season wonlost records, a victory would mean different things to the New York Giants and the Steelers, who clash in Pittsburgh today at 1 P.M. in a game that will be shown on Channel 2 and broadcast over WNEW radio here.

title: National Notes
description: There were new efforts last week to throw roadblocks in William H. Rehnquist's path toward the Supreme Court. But it seemed likely that the Assistant Attorney General would be able to surmount them all. On Tues day, if all goes as expected, the Sen ate Judiciary Committee will approve President Nixon's nominations of Mr. Rehnquist and Virginia lawyer Lewis F. Powell and send them on to the run senate. The vote for Mr. Powell is expected to be unanimous, but five liberal Democrats may cast dissenting votes on Mr. Rehnquist.

title: The World
description: UNITED NATIONSThey came un obtrusively, quietly. There could have been a choreographer's planning be hind their movements as they spread out from their first contacts with the Albanians to the other delegates who had cosponsored their admissionthen to the Scandinavians, whose countries have had diplomatic relations with them for many years, The only dele gations they studiously avoided were those of the big powers.

title: The Decline and Decline of New York
description: FOR some years I have been say ing, primarily to outoftown audiences, that New York differs only in size from other major Ameri can cities. Seeking now to compre hend the oppressive foreboding that many New Yorkers feel, I must add that while New York resembles other major American cities in its social and physical problems and promises, it differs from them because it con tains a cosmopolis, Manhattan, for merly the entire city of New York and still a world city. What oppresses New Yorkers today is a double sense of diminution: first, that the mundane problems of life in their city become daily more difficult; and, second, that the unique element in New York that compensated for its hardshipsthe pride of cosmopolitan citizenship is wasting away. Manhattan  the cosmopolisthe world cityhas be gun to lose its quality. Partly, the loss results from a specific decline in Manhattan's position relative to other cities and to suburbs. Partly, it re sults from what I believe are prac tical misunderstandings of the great ideals of liberty, individuality and egalitarianism. Partly, too, it results from the universal fading of those values which Manhattan embodies, the cosmopolitan values.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe message from Congress was clear: Bring the troops home. But the White House did not seem to be listening.

title: Reader's Report
description: The title role in this wildlife novel is taken by Uncle Abe Took, herbalist and hex doctor among the Pennsylvania Dutch. Except for Grip, his pet raven, Dracula, a captive owl, and Wasser, his bloodhound, the old man is bereft of companyun til his greatnephew Billy comes to live with him. The two get on famously, although they do not always see eye to eye about the furred and feathered folk who share the countryside. Bill is long on humanitarian feel ings; Abe, despite his occult gifts, inclines toward practical ity. A pack of marauding dogs, halfcoyote, gives Mr. Mannix the pretext for exploring these differences of temperament and to display his considerable fund of outdoor lore.

title: A GARLAND OF SUBTITLES
description: A sequence from My Night at Maud's. JeanLouis Trintignant (top two rows), as a devout Roman Catholic engineer, goes onand onabout Jansenism, a 17thcentury heresy, while Frangoise Fabian, as Maud, and Antoine Vitez, a Marxist philosophy professor, listen. Distribu tors feared American audiences would be put off by the endless talk and subtitles. They were wrong.

title: Some at Columbia Alarmed at Disposal Of Old Newspapers
description: Columbia University's But ler Library has been throwing away hundreds of bound volumes of old and possibly valuable newspapers, and ele ments of the university com munity have become alarmed.

title: Aide to Senator Fong Convicted Of Bribery Scheme and Perjury
description: Robert T. Carson was con victed yesterday of participat ing in a bribery scheme to quash stockfraud indictments while working for Senator Hi ram I Fong as an administra tive assistant in Washington.

title: Wary Optimism Retailers Mood At Season Start
description: Some weeks after Phase One of the Nixon economic program went into effect, Sol W. Cantor, chairman of In terstate Stores, Inc., a major complex of discount, and de partment stores, dashed off an enthusiastic letter to his 170 store managers.

title: Photography
description: THE illiterates of the future will be ignor ant of the use of ca mera and pen alike. That was MoholyNagy's prophecy in 1932, and what is startling about it is not only its accuracy but our persistent unwillingness to take heed of its implications despite four more decades of accumulated evidence dem onstrating inarguably that photography is the most pro found and energizing innova tion in communication since the printing press.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Clever, those Democrats in the Sen ate. Tying their campaign subsidy plan to President Nixon's tax reduc tion bill makes it about as vetoproof as anything can be. Unfortunately, the subsidy plan itself is not much better than it was five years ago, when another Dentocratic Senate re jected it.

title: Miss Halina H. Tappin Wed to Peter Hapworth
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20Miss Halina Huntington Tappin and Peter Hapworth were married here this afternoon at St. Clement's Archdiocesan Eucharistic Shrine (Roman Catholic). The Revs. Oliver Nickerson and William Van Etten Casey, brother of the bride's stepfather, performed the ceremony and concele brated the nuptial mass.

title: Reader's Report
description: Well, noI wouldn't believe love. I wouldn't even believe infatuation. I might just accept a verdict of early climacteric. First off, Miss McCormack's representation of loveas con veyed through her narratorpro tagonistis as deeply passion ate as a head cold. Sophie, a professor's wife of 39, meets Gabriel, a Ph.D. candidate of 25, at a draftresister's center in Cambridge, Mass., where they are volunteers. Sophie is white, Gabriel is black, and guess who's not coming to dinner.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Viennese women do not have Titian  like propor tions, as stated in the article on the coffeehouses of Vien na (Travel section, Nov. 7), any more than, say, the wom en of London or Paris. In fact, most of them are surprisingly trim. My diet pre vented me from indulging in the pastries Alden Whitman speaks of, but I spent an awful lot of time (watching) in the Konditoreien during my month's visit last summer and I rarely saw anyone ask for anything mit Schlag (whipped cream)  except Americans, who took it in their iced coffee.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I question That Spanish was the only tongue of the writer's driver in the Yuca tan. The native language there is Mayan, and Spanish is the second language. Lan guage is only one of many areas (others are diet and dress) in which the Yucatan population differs from other Mexicans.

title: Expansion Hits P.S.A.L. With 32 Varsities in 73
description: Public Schools Athletic League football will continue to grow in New York City next season with the addition of four varsity teamsSusan B. Wagner, Julia Rich man, George Washington and South Shore.

title: GRIN RIGHTIST QUITS PARTY HELM
description: BONN, Nov. 20Adolf von Madden, the magnetic and con troversial leader of West Ger many's, rightw ing radicals, the National Democrats, quit the chairmanship of his party to day.

title: These Diagnosticians Check On the Health of a House
description: As requested, we in spected the above onefami ly, twostory masonry and wood structure. Taking into consideration its age, it is in POOR CONDITION due to shifting of the foundation, deficiency in the electrical, evidence of dampness in the structure, needed roofing maintenance plus some other items mentioned in the fol lowing report.

title: The aftermaths of sex
description: A friend of mine tells a story about a time when he was caught in the moonlight, dressed only in a pajama top, on the roof of an enormous apartment complex. He was between women. That is to say, he had just left one and was on his way to see another. In the awful moment when he was caught, the thought occurred to him that he did not even want what he was going after. Most men can identify to some extent with his predicament.

title: Sheflings Reported on Border
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 20 (UPI) The official AllIndia reported that Pakistani troops shelled Tour area's along the border in India's Tripura territory today, wounding two civilians.

title: Patricia O'Toole Wed
description: Miss Patricia A. O'Toole of New York and James G. Vazzana of Rochester, both graduates of the New York Law School, were married here yesterday afternoon in the Ronan Catholic Church of the Epiphany by Msgr. William J. Farricker, assisted by the Rev. William Kennedy. The bride is the daughter of Thomas E. O'Toole, a clerk in the Queens County Civil Court, and the late Mrs. O'Toole. Mr. and Mrs. James A. Vazzana of Rochester are the parents of the bridegroom.

title: U.S.C DEADLOCKED BY MANS, 7 TO 7
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20The Bruins of the University of Cali fornia, Los Angeles combined a bristling defense with one quick offensive surge to tie the fa vored Trojans of Southern Cali fornia, 77, today in the season's finale for the traditional rivals.

title: Miss Mary Gale Gillespie Wed To Robert E. Hart in Stamford
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 20Miss Mary Gale Gillespie and Robert Edward Hart were married here this after noon in the First Presbyte rian Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev Donald Fisher Campbell. He was assisted by the Rev. Dr. Eugene Carson Blake, head of the World Council of Church es and greatuncle of the bride, and the Rev. Edward J. Scull, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: JURY WILL WEIGH. 5 COAST MURDERS
description: REDWOOD, CITY, Calif., Nov. 20Testimony ended this week in the trial of an auto mechanic charged with killing a prominent eye surgeon and four other persons in what was described at the trial as a bi zarre war against capitalists, materialists and polluters.

title: Anticrime Ideas Flow in Brooklyn
description: The suggestions included Federal funds for voluntary auxiliary police patrols, estab lishing storefront narcotics centers to dispense free heroin injections, putting more policemen on foot pa trol, legalizing gambling and providing travel expenses for any prison inmate who wants to live in a foreign country.

title: Young Democrats to Back Drive for Vietnam Pullout
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., Nov. 20 (AP)Delegates to the Nation al Young Democrats conven tion here pledged tonight to support only those Presidential candidates who were commit ted to immediate and complete withdrawal of American forces from Southeast Asia.

title: AfterDeath Freezing Stirs Town on L.I.
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I. Gillian Cummings was so up set at her father's sudden death last year and revolted at the thought of burial that she kept him preserved above ground, sheathed in plastic wrap and frozen in liquid nitrogbn.

title: Miss Muller Excels As Choreographer In W estbeth Dances
description: It is no secret that Jennifer Muller is an extraordinarily gifted dancer whose presence enhances any work she ap pears in but she is less fre quently thought of as a chore ographer. After Friday eve ning's Video Exchange concert at Westbeth, her reputation will also have to include that pleasurable information. In it she presented three works that show a sensitivity for dramatic confrontations and a fluid sense of movement invention.

title: Inkslinger Victor by Neck In $100,000 Colonial Cup
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Nov. 20 Against a background of old wealth and new hope, Inkslinger charged to a dramatic victory today in the second running of the $100,000 Colonial Cup Stee plechase.

title: The Nation
description: MIAMI BEACH.If George wanted to smile, everybody, would have smiled, a delegate said of the A.F.L. C.I.O. convention here last week. But George Meany, president of the labor federation, had solid reasons  both personal and of a bargaining nature to frown.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Your article on Play boy's Investment Guide by Michael Laurence (Nov. 14) states that he writes: While many brokerage firms went out of business in the mid 1970 downturn, not a single commodity speculator lost so much as a cent through brokerage failure.

title: So. Mississippi Subdues Virginia Tech Team, 178
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Nov. 20 (UPI)  Rick Donegan drove Southern Mississippi to two touchdowns and a field goal to day as the visitors defeated Vir ginia Tech, 178.

title: Congress vs. Sports
description: So far during 1971, at least 18 bills have been introduced in Congress to deal with some antitrust aspect of professional sports. When duplications and consolidations are worked out, five issues will remain to be considered:

title: Under the freeway, in the Hotel of Lost Light
description: Galway Kinnell's title for his new book of poems suggests its preoccupation: the world of terror raging beneath the sill of daylight consciousness. It is the world of Eliot's Rhapsody on a Windy Night, where de structive reality invades the naked psyche. The Book of Nightmares is a sequence of 10 poems, each in seven sec tions, that takes us on an ex tended inward journey toward the state of the speaker's soul at a specified moment

title: Cornell Shares Ivy Title
description: Cornell and Dartmouth won yesterday and tied for the Ivy League football cham pionship. Cornell routed Penn sylvania, 4113, as Ed Mari naro ran for 230 yards and five touchdowns. Dartmouth defeated Princeton, 337. De tails in Section 5.

title: 3d Vienna Convict Is Caught
description: VIENNA, Nov. 20 (UPI)The police today arrested the.third of three escaped convicts who broke out of jail and held 13 hostages in a flight earlier this month. Adolf Schandl, 35 years old, as he forced his sway into an apartment in Vienna and Threatened a woman with a knife.

title: I.R.S. Officials WellEquipped To Answer Questions on Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Say you own a hardware store. Can you raise prices and in crease profits on hammers and take a loss on screw drivers?

title: Johnson and Bernan Lead Azalea Golf by Stroke
description: WILMINGTON, N. C. Nov 20 (AP) George Johnson of Atlanta registered a sixunder par 65 and Deane Beman had a 67 today and moved into a tie for the lead in the $35,000 Azalea open golf tournament after three rounds.

title: Mary Holderness to Wed
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., NOv. 20 Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Stilwell Holderness have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Holderness, to Robert W. Hunt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert S. Hunt.

title: REHNQUIST DENIES ARIZONA CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 William H. Rehnquist, one of President Nixon's nominees to the Supreme Court, denied to day accusations that he had challenged the qualifications of Negro voters and had be longed to a rightWing group in his home city of Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Foes and Backers Of Abortion Laws March in 3 Cities
description: The repeal of abortion laws was roundly denounced and stanchly supported yesterday in separate marches in New York, San Francisco and Wash ington that attracted thousands of women and a smattering of men.

title: Cowboys Activate Clark, Hill
description: DALLAS, Nov. 20 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys sent their Aus trian placekicker, Toni Fritsch, to the taxi squad today and activated Mike Clark, a kicker, for the National Football League game with the Wash ington Redskins tomorrow. The Cowboys also activated the running back, Calvin Hill, and sent Margene Adkins, a wide receiver, to the taxi squad.

title: Is Sex After Death Fun? Yes!
description: JEANNE and Alan Abel's Is There Sex After Death? is a survey of contemporary American sex prac tices, as well as of some of the small businesses that have come to flourish in America's sexual revolution, Conducted by Dr. Harrison Rogers, Plump, polite, serious man who brings to his assignment much of the same delicicy that the late Robert Benehley displayed in en earlier, esseritially more sophisticated era. Dr. Rogers (Mr. Abel) is the chief of the Bureau of Sexelogical Research, located, according to the film, in Grant's Tomb, and so busy these days that the bureau is adding what it calls its Dolly Madison wing.

title: WALL STREET
description: Many Wall Street analysts and economists said last week that their forecasts of corporate earnings for 1972 had not been changed sig nificantly by the price and profit guidelines issued Nov. 11. by the Federal Price Commission.

title: 500,000 in Peking Greet North Vietnam's Premier
description: PEKING, Nov. 2 (Reuters)A toplevel North Vietnamese dele gation, headed by Premier Pham Van Dong, arrived in Peking to day to a tumultuous welcome by more than 500,000 people.

title: Richmond Upset of W. & M. Gains Tangerine Bowl Bid
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Nov. 20 (UPI)Ken Nichols, a junior from Englewood, N. J., dashed 10 yards on a broken pass play late in the fourth quarter today to lead Richmond to a 2119 upset over William and Mary.

title: Rock Salt Bane of Dog in Winter
description: Before the cold weather really sets in it is well to give a little thought to the needs of a dog during the winter months.

title: Westchester
description: White Plains, maintaining its perfect season record through eight games; routed Kingston 30.0, at Ryan Memorial Stadium in. Port Chester,: yesterday to win the Class AA pairing of the first New York, State Section 1 bovirl games.

title: Greenbelt or Garbage Belt Issue Stirs Village
description: CENTEREACH, L. I. It was the very model of a mod ern day community.

title: Horse Show News
description: Five more members of the American Horse Shows As sociation have been found guilty of violating its drug rules, bringing the total to 10 persons who have been penal ized.

title: Local
description: Dan Morogiello, Canarsie quarterback, completed 14 of 27 passes for 140 yards yester day as he led the Brooklyn team to a 206 triumph ov,er New Dorp at Staten Island.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Ray W. Macdonald really enjoys selling. He's been a salesman ever since he was graduated from the Univer sity of Chicago's School of Business Administration back in 1935. Even though he has been president of the Bur roughs Corporation since Jan uary, 1966, he is still a sales man at heart.

title: TOLEDO WINS, 416; STRING GOES TO 34
description: TOLEDO, Ohici, Nov. 20 (AP) Joe Schwartz, a junior full back, scored a MidAmerican Conference record of five touchdowns tonight, leading Toledo to a 416 triumph over Kent State and prolonging the Rockets winning streak to 34 the nation's longest.

title: Bonnie Steinberg Wed
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. I, Nov. 20Miss Bonnie Stein berg was married here this evening to Henry S. Engle bardt, a vice president of Pierre Cardin Men's Clothing Company, a division of In tercontinental. Men's Apparel. Rabbi Saul Teplitz performed the ceremony at the Seawane Country Club. Mr. and Mrs. Meyer Steinberg of Hewlett Bay Park are the parents of the bride. Her husband is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles P. Englebardt of Cedarhurst and Hallandale, Fla.

title: Miss Moriarty Fiancee of Patrick Egan
description: Miss Margaret Julia Mo riarty and Patrick Owen Egan plan to be married here Dec. 11 in the Roman Cath olic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I'VE been hoping to see some discussion of what is to me a startling new practice in filling mail orders.

title: MALE CHAUVINIST HOMOSEXUAL
description: To THE EDITOR: I am outraged by the male chau vinist homosexual, quoted by Merle Miller in his article, What It Means to Be a Homosexual (Continued) (Oct. 10), whose wife has a very Victorian view of sex; it is performed more as a duty than anything else. It strikes me that he has been fortu nate to have even that, considering he has been cheating on her for 20 years. His implied criticism is fur ther outrage in view of the fact that for him  the thrills, excitements and beauties of sex have always come from men. That must be pretty tough for a woman to respond to!

title: Hopes for BritishRhodesian Acccord Seen Dimming
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 20  There were pessimistic signs tonight in the British Rho desian talks.

title: SlushPublic and Private
description: In what seems like a suddenly improvised move, Senate Democrats have come up with a simple and legitimate way to finance Presidential campaigns without subjecting a nominee to the indignity of begging his way. Actually the idea that a taxpayer be allowed to earmark part his Federal tax for this purpose is far from new. Com parable plans date back a halfcentury or more; one was Cenacted in 1966 only to be repealed in 1967, and the current effort, tacked on to the Administration's tax reduction bill, has been quietly under discussion since tmidsummer.

title: MUSKIE CAMPAIGN STILL LACKS SPARK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Senator Edmund S. Muskie's campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination has moved him into so command ing a lead over his competitors that, in an ordinary year, he would be considered a winner already.

title: 46% Raise for Signalmen
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 20 (AP) The 42month contract tenta tively agreed upon by the rail road signalmen's union carries a 46 per cent wage increase over the life of the contract, Charles J. Chamberlain the union's president said today.

title: Senate Confirms Blatchford
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Senate confirmed today without opposition the nomina tion of Joseph H. Blatchford as director of Action, a new Fed eral agency that includes the Peace Corps and its domestic counterpart, Volunteers in Serv ice to America.

title: COAST OFFICER OUT OVER ROLE IN RIOT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20  Sheriff's Capt. Joel B. Honey, field commander of police forces during the rioting last year at Isla Vista, was dis charged this week on charges of incompetence.

title: WASHINGTON TOPS WASH. STATE, 2820
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 20 (AP) Sonny Sixkiller of Washington ran 32 yards for the opening touchdown and passed 38 and 33 yards to Tom Scott to set up two more scores as the Huskies beat Washington State, 2820, today in the final foot ball game of the season for the two schools.

title: IOWA STATE POUNDS OKLA. STATE BY 540
description: AMES, Iowa, Nov. 20 (AP) A fourtouchdown performance by George Amundson powered Iowa State to a 540 victory over Oklahoma State Saturday, and into the school's first post season bowl game.

title: Manhattan School Resurrects L'Arlesienne for Bizet Score
description: There are probably few mu ic listenerseven casual ones in the Western world who have not heard at least part, of one of the two L'Arlesi enne Suites at some time or another  on the radio, on re cordings, via Muzak or, per haps, even at a concert. They may not, know the name of the music or that Bizet com posed it, but they would rec ognize some of its tunes by their familiarity.

title: ALABAMA'S CRISIS ON FUNDING ENDED
description: MONTGOMERY Ala., Nov. 20The Alabama Legislature has ended a special session after appropriating $1.3 billion for state agencies and the pub lic schools.

title: SALT's Challenge
description: The SovietAmerican Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT), now entering their third year, have resumed Vienna amid continued hopes of ultimate success but renewed predictions of further delay. President Nixon has acknowledged that a firststage agreement by year end, the goal set in his May 20 summit accord with the Kremlin, is now highly improbable. It may still be unfinished business, he has said, when he gets Moscow in May of next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Everyone seems to agree that this country is in trouble. Our air aid water are polluted, our soil is eroded, our cities are in decay, crime is ram pant, and public education and health are on the decline. Something must be done, but it all costs too much money, we are told.

title: The Smithsonian: Jefferson's Bitches and Moon Rock, Too
description: WASHINGTON  There is more than one way to celebrate Thanksgiving. The favorite method, of course, is to sit down to the traditional family dinner of turkey and trimmings, but for those who are more serious about getting to the roots of this country during the holiday weekend, or who want a stimulating change, a visit to the Smithsonian Insti tution's Museum of History and Tech nology can he a feast, too. Mind you, there is only one object in the museum that is guaranteed to have made it across the Atlantic on the Mayflower (a mirror that belonged to Edward Wins low), but there are plenty of other homey reminders of our early days broadaxes and powderhorns, bean pots and tin lanterns, a dovetailed log cabin, a sleeping room circa 1685, a whole timber house from Ipswich, Mass., to name but a few.

title: Dolphin Fans Set Back By College TV Rules
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 20 (AP)Florida A. and M.'s athletic director, Jake Gai ther, said today that the MiamiBaltimore pro football game Dec. 11 could not be televised back to Miami. He added that he had no say about it.

title: Leonard Bernstein's MassTwo Views
description: T HE key to Leonard Bernstein's Mass is a lovely melody that makes its first appearance shortly after the work begins. It is called A Simple Song and is sung by the Celebrant; later it serves as a rallying melody, Lauda, Lauda, Laude  for the final moments of Mass, in a section Bernstein calls Pax; Com munion.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS, 350 GAINS BOWL BERTH
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 20  St. John's University clinched a berth in the Metro politan Club Bowl today by blanking previously undefeated New York Tech, 350, at Tech Stadium before a crowd of 2,450.

title: Green Ideas
description: To the Editor: Paul Zweig, appraising John Hollander's book of poems The Night Mirror, says that Hollander makes sideswipes at the real world, but in the end it eludes him. The worst poem in the book is a three liner about Noam Chomsky:

title: Connecticut
description: Stamford defeated New Ca naan, 2013, before 7,382 fans yesterday in the sixth annual Fairfield County Conference EastWest football champion ship playoff in Boyle Stadium in Stamford.

title: Knicks Beat Ballets At Garden, 125114
description: If the 19,588 fans came to Madison Square Garden last night to see which team had got the better of the Earl Mon roeforDave Stallworth trade, they were disappointed. If they came to see whether the New York Knicks could put it all to gether the way they have in the past, they must have been delighted.

title: A midwife For Composers
description: A UTHORS have publishers, painters and sculptors have galleries, composers have music publishers. Authors also have agents, who do a great many things for them, such as negotiating fees and the residuals from paperback editions and film and TV rights. The process is often carried on before a book is written.

title: It's Time to Shoot Bears
description: HARRISBURG, Nov. 20 (AP) Hunters have a twoday black bear season in Pennsyl vania beginning Monday. There was no black bear season in 1970 because of a shortage of the species.

title: Manhattan Shirt's Growth Plan
description: Almost six years ago, Rob ert L. Leeds Jr. became chairman and chief executive officer of the Manhattan Shirt Company. The con cern, which had more than a century of history behind it, made men's and women's shirts and had annual sales of $56million.

title: Dance
description: I T has been a mixed pe riod for New York dance. The Joffrey Ballet has ended its season and the New York City Ballet has started its own winter sea son at the New York State Theater. Incidentally, is it just my imagination or are we having more performances or rather even more per formances of The Nut cracker nowadays than we used to? There is not much of novelty announced for the City Ballet apart from a re vision of a ballet by John Clifford andsome of the most welcome news of the dance season to datea re vival of Jerome Robbins's great comic ballet The Con cert.

title: Local
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Nov. 20Iona Prep won the City Division championship of the Metropolitan Catholic Schools Football League today by rally ing to defeat St. Francis, 8.7, at Memorial Field.

title: STUDY ALLAYS FEAR ON SESAME STREET
description: Frequent preschool viewers of Sesame Street have a better attitude later toward school and their peers, according to an in dependent evaluation of that television show for youngsters.

title: German Shepherd Best in Show In Morristown Field of 1,380
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Nov. 20 Ch. Lakeside's Gilligan's Island, a German shepherd, scored his 23d bestinshow award in a field of 1,380 dogs tonight at the Sussex Hills Ken nel Club's 10th allbreed event in the National Guard Armory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A news item carried in the Nov, Times cites Supreme Court nominee William H. Rehnquist's activities challenging voters in heavily Demo ogle areas during elections. Civil rights spokesmen allege that this amounted to harassment and intimida tion of voters of minority groups.

title: A Study in Contrasts: Buddhist Serenity, Hindu Excitement
description: O F all the several thousand temple, sites in India, I can't think of any two more important to see than. Sanchi, with its majestic Bud dhist shrine called the Great Stupa, and Konarak, with its magnificent Hindu Temple of the Sun. And even though they are separated by more than half the distance of the subcontinent at its widest, they are worth the effort it takes' to visit them.

title: Headliners
description: Norman Cousins took over as editor of The Saturday Review in 1940. the time, the magazine's circulation was 20,000; now it is 660,000. Mr. Cousins's editorial voice became an influential one, and he projected the Saturday Review into significant channels of national public affairs. Last July, a financial group acquired the magazine from the McCall Book Publishing Company and later announced it planned several big changes in the operation. Last week, Mr. Cousins resigned as editor, conceding that he was in philosophical and profes sional disagreement with the new owners. After being in charge for so long, a colleague said, Mr. Cousins found it hard to adjust to a. situation where no longer had full authority.

title: Movies
description: MOST of the genres that American moviemakers have relied on over the yearsthe western; the musical, the situation comedy, the war movie, the family soap operaseem thoroughly ex hausted by mix; the truth is that the great majority these genre movies have always been undistinguished, utterly conventional and banal, the cultists inflated claims for them notwithstanding. Of the classic American genres, only the thriller seems to me to have ever had any real vitality. Westerns have done little more than perpetuate the most extravagantly sentimental fantasies and myths about America, but the urban crime movie has persistently offered up some of the more sobering truths.

title: 98 Speedboats Prepared to Do Battle in World Championship Race
description: The fastest field of speed boats in history is expected for the outboard world cham pionship at Lake Havasu City, Ariz., next Saturday and Sun day. There are 98 drivers en tered in the $60,000 event which will be run for four hours each day on the Cold rado River.

title: T.G.U. IS VICTOR OVER RICE 2019
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Nov. 20 (UPI)Berl Simmons kicked a 41yard field goal with 21 sec onds remaining to earn a 2019 victory over the Rice Owls.

title: Nixon Military Aide Named Vice Chief of 12th Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) President Nixon's top military aide has been assigned as vice commander of the 12th Air Force and will be succeeded at the White House by an Air Force colonel who is now an aide to the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Faces at the Races
description: Boys High and Power Memo rial, recent citywide cross country champions, captured distance relay events yesterday in nearrecord clockings.

title: Confusion Is Rampant on Effect Of Phase Two on Rent Situation
description: A major policy statement by the Price Commission on rent increases, published quietly in a questionrandanswer format, has caused massive confusion here among tenants, landlords, city rent officials and the In ternal Revenue Service.

title: Percy Uris, Builder, Dies at 72; Headed $350Million Company
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 20 Percy Uris, chairman of the board of the Uris Buildings Corporation of New York and long a trustee of Columbia University, died today in his sleep at his home. He was 72 years old and also lived in the Waldorf Towers in New York and in Jericho, L.T.

title: SOVIET SAID TO LEAD IN ADVANCED ARMS
description: LONDON, Nov. 20 (AP)The Soviet Union now is ahead of the West in the development of highly sophisticated weapons, an authoritative British refer ence book said this week.

title: Letter From Nebraska
description: Nebraska. Where once upon a long time ago the dinosaurs and the dawn horses grazed. And later the Ogallala and the Sioux met to hold council on the bluffs, and buffalo were killed for their meat by such folk as Buffalo Bill. And Mark Twain said of the Platte River that it was a mile wide and an inch deep, which is true most of the time. And Virgil Thom son must have meant Nebraska when he wrote The Plough That Broke the. Plains. Willa Cather was raised and educated here, and she left, never to return. Mari Sandoz was raised and educated here and made her home in Boston. Wright Morris was raised and educated here, and he left. Karl Shapiro came here to teach and write, and he left, never to return. And I'm leaving, too.

title: Jaikyl Captures Garrison Handicap at Liberty Bell for Third Year in Row
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20  Marshua's Dancer's hopes for recognition as sprint horse of the year received a setback at Liberty Bell Race Track today when Holly Crest Farm's Jaikyl won the $22,225 Garrison Handi cap for the third time.

title: Enduring Beast at the Brooklyn
description: Miriam Beerman of Brook lyn was a portrait painter until she found out that her sitters were becoming un bearably bestial in expres sion. She then looked for more humanity in beasts and found it, she says. She calls her current exhibition of The Enduring Beast at the Brooklyn Museum the most human and the most gentle of all her paintings.

title: Art
description: T HE air of confidence generated by abstract painting throughout the decade of the six ties seems to be a thing of the past. What has replaced it is a mood of doubt and irresolution. That the ave nues of abstraction should have led to so many dead ends is one of the surprises of the current season. This isn't to say that abstraction itself is dead or dyingI don't think that is the casebut it does seem to bc experiencing dif ficulties.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Is there and should there bea sense of urgency in the United States Government about reaching agreement with other countries aimed at ending the present, un familiar world monetary un certainty and at removing the United States import sur charge?

title: The Last Word: Notes on Drubnik
description: (Written after noting that among the more recent winners of the Nobel Prize for Literature have been Giorgos Seferis, Salvatore Quasimodo, Miguel Asturias, Hallidor K. Laxness, Alexis Leger and Yasunari Kawabata.)

title: L. I. Honeymoon Cottage Just a Newlywed's Dream
description: Escalating costs of land, labor and material are helping to sound the death knell for lowpriced, one family housing on Long Island, ac cording to the area's builders.

title: Black Pupils Show Gains From Busing in Evanston
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Nov. 20 Complete racial integration of Evanston's elementary schools, some of it accomplished by the busing of black children, has in the last three years produced a slight gain in black achieve ment without affecting the higher levels that white pupils in this Chicago suburb have achieved.

title: And Every Day You Take Another Bite
description: Women have a basic under standing of pro football's nu ances that their husbands, with all their jargon and pseudo expertise, will never have, Larry Merchant tells us in  And Every Day You Take Another Bite. Bookmak ers who handle football action actually keep the game honest, is another of his iconoclasms. Vince Lombardi was not merely a superimage of God and the family and My Country Right or Wrong. He was an intelli gent, shrewd psychologist with a flexible outlook. Merchant, who writes those entertaining columns every day in The New York Post, here chops away at some of pro football's cherished axioms. What keeps his book from being just a string of pro nouncements is the quality of the writing (never too heavy, never too dogmatic) and the basic soundness of his knowl edge of football.

title: Television
description: T HERE are several things about Geraldo Rivera to distinguish him from your average run  of  the  mill television newsman. He has a mustache and longish hair. He dresses in a style that might be dubbed supercool swinging. He's a bit of a ham and unabashedly sentimental, even going so far as to cry on camera. And he insists that he's got the crappiest voice on television.

title: Local
description: New Utrecht's strong defense stymied Lafayette yesterday as the Utes defeated the Frenchies, 2614, at Lafayette. New Utrecht finished its season with five victories in eight decisions. Lafayette lost its fourth game in eight with one tie.

title: Susan Lynn Pollack Is Fiancee Of Dr.Alan Sandman, Osteopath
description: ELKINS PARK, Pa., Nov. 20The engagement of Miss Susan Lynn Pollack of New York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles C. Pollack of Elkins Park, to Dr. Alan Richard Sandman, who is serving an interneship at Le Roy Hospital in New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents.

title: $41 CHANCE TAKES TROT AT YONKERS
description: YONKERS, Nov. 20With Cathy Lee, the recent con queror of Fresh Yankee, Marlu Pride and other top trotters, scratched from the onemile event, tonight's $15,000 fea tured event at Yonkers Race way became a wideopen affair. A virtual walkover had been expected if Cathy Lee raced.

title: National Midget Regatta Is Scheduled in Florida Today
description: The first national champion ship regatta of the Midget Ocean Racing Club will start in the Gulf stream off Key Biscayne, Fla., today with 48 of the country's top ocean racing craft under 30 feet in length entered.

title: Police Say Murdered Girl Was Passed by 100 on Road
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 20. (UPI) At least 100 people must have seen a 10yearold girl plead for help along a busy freeway shortly before she was raped and strangled, but none called authorities, Monroe County sherff's deputies said today.

title: Jackson State Wins, 177
description: ITTA BENA, Miss., Nov. 20 (AP)  Jackson State College scored a 177 football victory over Mississippi Valley State College today.

title: The Site Of the Most Shocking Single Event Of Our Time
description: DALLASWhenever I approach this city from the west and reach the point where the Dallas Fort Worth Turnpike spills into the Stemmons Freeway, my eyes automatically fasten on a sevenstory red brick warehouse with a clock adver tising Hertz rental cars on top. It is a building ordinary that its near replica can be found alongside the railroad yard of any major city. This one has scarcely changed at all over the half century during which it served as a warehouse first for groceries, then farm machinery and later school books.

title: Chesmans Have Child
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Nov. 20A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Michael R. Chesman on Oct. 18 at Georgetown University Hos pital in Washington.

title: A PRONIXON BOOK DROPPED BY CLUB
description: When word got around last spring that Allen Drury was writing a generally favorable book about President Nixon and his staff, the Conservative Book Club eagerly acquired the rights to make the book its main se lection for November.

title: New Jersey Blocked Kick Ends DePaul String at 18 With a 76 Upset
description: St. Mary's of Rutherford up set DePaul, 76, with a sur prisingly, strong defense yester day that ended an 18game win ning streak for the school from Wayne.

title: India Approaches War Footing As Frontier Fighting Intensifies
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 20 India is approaching a war footing as the battles with Pakistani troops along the East Pakistan border become bigger, more frequent and more intense.

title: So. Connect'Out Wins Finale
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 20 (AP)Southern Connecticut scored the first time it had pos session and went on to defeat Central Connecticut, 3815, in a traditional seasonending football game today. The Owls scored on the opening kickoff when Walt Shelton ran 87 yards for a touchdown.

title: KITTIWAKE FIRST ON LAUREL GRASS
description: LAUREL, Mich. Nov. 20 Kittiwake, the oddson favorite, and Society Column, a light ly regarded 4yearold, shared honors today in the Chrysan themum Handicap at Laurel Race Course. Each won a divi sion of the 11/16mile race on the grast for fillies and mares.

title: Castro, on Tour of Chile, Urging Revolutionary Unity
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 20 Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba has worn many hatsliterally during his extended tour of Chile, but his consistent mes sage to workers, students, peas ants and military officers has been a call for revolutionary unity.

title: Polar Bears Airlifted Out, Return Because They Love the Dump
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 20Last month, 24 polar bears were flown out of the town of Churchill, Manitoba, at a cost of about $400 each in a much publicized rescue operation.

title: Teamster Leader Invites Nixon and Vows Respect
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 20 (AP)  The confrontation be tween President; Nixon and George Meany yesterday has produced an invitation to Mr. Nixon from the teamster's un ion, which promises that he will be afforded the sincerest respect and courtesies.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: I used to be one of those million little guys who traded in the stock market. Last November I liquidated my portfolio and withdrew about $10,000. I am happy I did.

title: Books:
description: THE DIRECTOR: HIS MONEY AND HIS JOB. Ed ited by Eric Foster and George Bull. 397 pages. McGrawHill. $13.00

title: A Champ looks at a Champ
description: Just five years ago, when Muhammad All was at the peak of his powers, Jose Torres reigned below him as light heavyweight champion of the world. Torres, a skilled boxer with a good punch, was in cluded on the dwindling list of possible challengers to the heavyweight champion, who was cleaning out his own divi sion like a man in a terrible hurry. The two never met. Tor res lost his title and retired. Ali went on to his now im mortal remark, I ain't got no quarrels with them Viet Congs, and, ever a master of confounding footwork, stood his ground while around him a roomful of draftees took that single dreadful step into the United States Army.

title: News of the Rialto
description: WHETHER or not it would be profitable for someone to pur sue a doctorate explaining why English writers turn up more frequently with mystery plays than do our own, this department knoweth not. What it does know is that, unusual as it is, there's a fully homebred example of the species on its way. It's called Night Watch by Lucille Fletcher (note to doctorate students: why is it that women show up as mystery writers so often?) and it should be along some time in February.

title: Patrons of Race Tracks Are Covering More Territory Than Are the Horses
description: The thoroughbred racing fan at the track is the only sports spectator who gets more exercise than the ath letes on view.

title: Heard's 68 for 205 Leads By Stroke in New Zealand
description: CHRISTCHURCH, New Zea land, Nov. 20 (AP)Jerry Heard clung to a onestroke lead in the Christchurch Gar den City golf tournament to day by shooting a fiveunder par 68 for a threeround total of 205 at the Russley course.

title: U.S. PUBLICATIONS IN BUDGET PINCH
description: The Business Service Office of the Department of Commerce at 26 Federal Plaza, just north of City Hall, won't, be able to service business quite so ef fectively after Dec. 31.

title: Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: To the Editor: When Skinner was asked about Attica on William F. Bucldey's television show (Fir ing Line), he responded by de scribing one of his hobbyhorses  an experiment in behavior modifications at a reform school, in which recalcitrant kids were conditioned to learn by imme diate rewards of Cokes, etc.

title: Like Everything Else, The Crowd Was Inflated
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 20 (AP)  The official Na tional Collegiate Athletic Association record crowd announced at Michigan Stadium today during the Wolverines 107 football victory over Ohio State was 104,016.

title: New Instrument Detects Knee Cartilage Damage
description: TORONTO, Nov. 20 (Cana dian Press)An arthroscope, a new surgical tool invent ed in Japan and developed by doctors at Toronto Gen eral Hospital, is being used to help speed the return to action of Injured football players.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Everyone seems to agree that price ceilings on individual goods and serv ices would not be, effective for long against persistent pressures of exces sive aggregate demand. In the wake of such a development, the inevitable ad justment in the new compensation formula for annual increments to wages could lag behind prices long enough and far enough to hurt.

title: The World
description: CALCUTTAIt is difficult to tell who is starting what in each incident, but some kind of war is heating up on the border between India and East Pakistan.

title: Standard Area Designation Still Being Sought for LI.
description: WASHINGTON  Elmira and Poughkeepsie, N. Y., made it. So did Long Branch Asbury Park and New BrunswickPerth AmboySay reville, N. J.

title: Kerr on Sada Thompson In Twigs
description: I N George Furth's Twigs, Sada Thompson does not simply give a stun ning performance. She gives four of them.

title: CRANE KEEPS LEAD IN PHOENIX BRIDGE
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 20 The world's top ranked master point holder, Barry Crane of Los Angeles, held a cemmand ing lead into the final session of the mixed pair champion ships here tonight, with Kerri Davis of Los Angeles. He to taled 510 points, more than 40 ahead of his nearest rivals in the field of 168 pairs.

title: Reader's Report
description: This novel by a Philadelphia lawyer, the author of Ritten house Square, sets a fasci nating stage. The bright young partner in an old law firm takes time off from intensive tomcatting to prevent a take over bid for the firm's most important client. Mr. Solms sen's eye for Main Line activi ty has 2020 vision and his ear

title: CONDORS TRIUMPH OVER PROS 113103
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Nov. 20 (AP)The Pittsburgh Condors snapped the Memphis Pros threegame winning streak, 113 130, today in an American Bas ketball Association game.

title: Thrift: What Future?
description: In the decades ahead, how is the nation to finance its massive unmet needs for housing?

title: Hudson Expressway Plan Is Dead, Rockefeller Says
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 20 Governor Rockefeller, con ceding defeat in a sixyear bat tle with citizens groups, home owners and environmentalists, declared today that the con troversial Hudson River Ex pressway he had hoped to build near here was now a dead is sue.

title: The look is Deauville
description: You think you've seen that anchor sweater somewhere before? You're right! Except that this second time around, you can also have sailboats or sailor boys or any number of nautical em blems on that sweater. And this time they're all at prices that won't break anybody's piggy bank. Teamed with sailor pants and floppy hats, the look is Deauville in the twenties. And that's not bad. After all, the best possible revenge for not being rich is looking as if you were.

title: G.O.P. Leaders in Election Drive Report Administration Plans to Ask Hoover to Retire This Winter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20  Republican leaders involved in the effort to reelect President Nixon are saying that the Ad ministration plans to ask J. Edgar Hoover, the 76yearold director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, to retire this Winter.

title: High for the Game
description: Once you get by the high schoollevel philosophizing and curiously naive political tone sort of a cross between old Utopianism and embryoid Marx ismyou can have fun reading Chip Oliver's High for the Game. You can punch his arguments full of holes: Ben nies and steroids are bad; mescaline and LSD are good; pro football is bad, so he quit; then he wanted it again, so he tried a comebackthis was after he'd done the book. But he had the good sense to get Los Angeles's Ron Rapoport, a quality writer, to ghost the book for him, and there's a lot of funny stuff in it. I broke up at Oliver's description of his wedding:

title: Morocco Closes 3 Newspapers And 2 Are Started in Shakeup
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco, Nov. 20 (Reuters)Morocco's three largest newspapers have been suppressed, a fourth has closed voluntarily and two new papers have been started in a major shakeup of this coun try's daily press.

title: A structure beautifully designed to bring out the worst in a saint
description: These days the abundant capacity of radio and television to bore is fully matched by much of the dis cussion concerning the two media. Apologists drone on with their argu ment that the stations are giving the people what they want, which is not particularly accurate and in any event avoids the nub of the prob lem. Many critics pound away at the broadcasting executives as mon sters of greed, which some are and some are not, and keep seeing visions of a nation transformed if only the box in the living room were under control of themselves.

title: WOLVERINES CO 72 YARDS AT END
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 20 Stunned by an 85yard punt return and stymied by an aroused Ohio State defense, un beaten Michigan scored a touch down with 2 minutes 7 seconds to play on a 21yard run by Billy Taylor today for a thrill ing 10.7 victory over the Buckeyes.

title: 40 Big Corporations Ask Permission to Raise Prices
description: More than 40 large corporations asked the Administra tion's Price Commission for permission to raise prices last week, and at the same time retailers across the country hurriedly prepared price lists to post in their stores so they too could increase prices.

title: MINNESOTA WINS ON LATE AERIAL
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Craig Curry threw a 12yard touchdown pass to Mel Anderson with nine seconds left to earn an inspired Minne sota football team a 23.21 vic tory over its traditional rival, Wisconsin, today.

title: Orlick Heads Officers ReElected by P.O.A.
description: PALM BEACH SHORES, Fla., Nov. 20, (AP)Warren Orlick of Orchard Lake, Mich., was re elected to a second term as president of the Professional Golfers Association of America at the 55th annual meeting of that body, which ended yes terday.

title: Palm Peter, $3.40, Wins Dancers Pace at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 20 (AP)Palm Peter won the $10,000 Dancers Pace at Free hold Raceway today, paying $3.40, $2.80 and $2.20 for $2 across the board. Owned and driven by Edward P. Sabatini of Freehold, Palm Peter stepped the mile in 2:02 4/5.

title: AGED ARE CALLED LOW U.S. PRIORITY
description: A special Congressional sub committee, meeting in a cold auditorium at Lehman College in the Bronx, was told that the aged were too far down on the list of the nation's ptibrities.

title: Adams State Wins Title In N.A.I.A. CrossCountry
description: LIBERTY, Mo, Nov. 20 (DPI) Adams State College of Ala mosa, Colo, won the annual National Association of Inter collegiate Athletics crosscoun try team title today, scoring 196 points.

title: MarkoLove Team Wins South African Auto Race
description: CAPETOWN, Nov. 20 (AP) an Austrian, Helmut Marko, and a Rhodesian, John Love, sharing a Lola T212, won the threehour endurance race today at the Killarney Circuit.

title: ALASKA AIDE SCORES ATOMTEST FINDINGS
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 20 Alaska's Fish and Game Com missioner, Wallace H. Noeren berg, disputed today the Atomic Energy Commission's assess ment of environmental damage from the fivemegaton nuclear test Nov. 6 in the national wild life refuge on Amchitka in the Aleutian Islands.

title: Men's Tailor Who Can Do, Skirts, Also
description: A couple of months ago on one of his regular trips to his shirt factory in Italy, Roland Meledandri decided to have some styles for women made up. He brought them home to his wife who suggested a few changes. The armholes should be higher, the sleeves narrower, she said. A skirt that he had made to go with the shirts should be cut on the bias so it moves instead of being a stiff Aline.

title: Miss Greenwood Wed
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 20  Miss Patricia Ann Greenwood, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernest J. Green wood, was married here this afternoon to George Inglis, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Inglis of Montreal. The Rev. Dana Forrest Kennedy per formed the Episcopal cere mony at the home of the bride's parents. The bride is a graduate of Douglass Col lege Mr. Inglis is a graduate of Carleton University in Ottawa.

title: Chess
description: W ITH the imminence of the world championship chess match, the Sicilian Defense Boris Spassky versus Lev Polugayevsky, for which the world champion Spassky received the bestplayedgame acco lade is a cardinal example of this singular deployment.

title: Newyork
description: Like the grating screech of subway wheels or the roar of jackhammers in the street, the cry of municipal work ers for more dough has long since become a part of New York City's soundscape. But in recent months, new voicefaint but steadyhas been heard above the babble: the voice of City Hall demanding some return on the taxpayers everincreasing invest ment.

title: Local
description: Steve Lane, Tottenville's tail back, ran for three touchdowns as he led the host Staten Is landers to a 360 victory over nonwinning Stuyvesant yester day. Tottenville won its fourth game in eight starts.

title: Foster to Risk His Crown Against Kelly Next Month
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Okla., Nov. 20 (AP)Either Oklahoma City or Tulsa will be the site of a light heavyweight cham pionship fight between Bob Foster and Brian Kelly of Cush ing, Okla., the challenger, Pat O'Grady, a promoter, said to day. The bout will be held next month.

title: Vanderbilt Field Goal Tops Tampa in 4th Quarter, 10.7
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 20 (UPI) Taylor Stokes's first field goal of the season, a 40yarder with 12 minutes left in the game, gave Vanderbilt a 107 victory over Tampa today.

title: Mrs. Trinkle Has Son
description: A son was born Nov. 9 at the LyingIn Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Peter B. Trinkle of New York. Mrs. Trinkle is the former Miss Benita Bryant of Palm Beach, Fla. Her husband is a senior planning adviser for the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey). The child has been named Peter Dixon.

title: No Quiet Exit for Dennison
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I.Like a cavalier fencing his way backward to safety, H. Lee Dennison is thrusting forth rolled map of unpopular, farreaching highway and bridge proposals as he retires after 12 years as Suffolk's first County Executive.

title: Nassau South
description: Berner dropped West Hemp stead from the ranks of the undefeated yesterday, 246, in a playoff game that earned Berner the South Shore cham pionship and the right to meet Farmingdale for the Nassau County title.

title: The World
description: SALISBURY  The old wing of Meikles Hotel in downtown Salisbury is a low, sprawling building with a galvanized roof, frontier style. In one corner is the Stanley Bar, used by whites. In another is the Msasa Bar, jammed with Africans. In the middle is a lounge where people of both races drink or have tea.

title: OREGON STATE WINS ON LATE SCORE, 3029
description: EUGENE, Ore., Nov. 22 (AP) Billy Carlquistd ran 6 yards for the winning touchdown with a minute 40 Seconds re maining teday as Oregon State beat Oregon, 8029, for the eighth straight time in a Pa cific8 game.

title: MRS. BENNO ELKAN
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 20 Mrs. Madelon Deschers El kan, widow of Benno Elkan, founder and board chairman of the International Minerals and Metals Corporation, died Thursday. She was 78 years old.

title: Hitchcock First in Gallant Fox
description: Hitchcock did the same thing yesterday at Aqueduct that he did a year ago, minus one day. Sigmund Sommer's German bred campaigner, under a well planned ride by Ron Turcotte, won the $57,800 Gallant Fox Handicap, beating his nearest rival in the field of 11 by 1 lengths.

title: Norwalk Bank Robbed
description: NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 20 Four men held tip the Fairfield County National Bank here last night. The police and bank of ficials declined to comment on the amount of money the rob bery netted but it was unof ficially put, at nearly $30,0B0. Five employes and eight ells tomers were in the, bank.

title: Westchester Opens a Phobia Clinic
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 20 How do you feel? the ther apist asked. Kind of shook up, replied Mr. M. as, with a grin and an obvious effort to look casual, about it, he pushed the button marked 2 and watched the door close in front of him.

title: Miss Anne Meredith Gaither And J. Willis Rivinus Married
description: DEDHAM, Mass., Nov. 20 Miss Anne Meredith Gaither and J. Willis Martin Rivinus of New York and New Hope, Pa., were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Ru dolph Roell in St. Paul's Epis copal Church, assisted by the Rev. Louis D. Bourgeois of St. Susanna's Roman Catho lic church.

title: Dole Charges Nixon Critics Seek to Break President
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (UPI) Senator Robert Dole of Kansas, the Republican National Com mittee Chairman, says that critics of President Nixon are interested in opposition for the sake of opposition to break the President.

title: St. Louis Stays Unbeaten
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (AP)  Unbeaten St. Louis University, national collegiate soccer cham pion, ended its season today by downing the University of Chi cago, for its 13th victory.

title: PLAN TO WOO BACK BENGALIS WEIGHED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Of ficials at the Agency for Inter national Development are weighing a multimilliondollar program to try to persuade East Pakistani refugees in India to go back voluntarily to East Pakistan in return for housing and other material benefits.

title: 200 Negroes Held For Second Parade in Alabama Town
