title: Flipflop at Tarrytown
description: Governor Rockefeller won the commendation of environmentalists at a weekend workshop in Tarrytown what seems to us too low a price. In a single speech the Governor managed to renounce a highway project already virtually killed by judicial action and at the same time to ridicule the tough and laudable bill with which Senator Muskie of Maine has proposed to clean up the country's waterways.

title: EXTRA NUTCRACKER SET BY CITY BALLET
description: The New York City ballet will give an extra performance in a special version of The Nutcracker on Dec. 9 at 8 P.M. at the State Theater. The scheduled run of 37 performances of the ballet will begin the next day.

title: A Home Designed for Their Animals, Too
description: From the chocolatetoned, carpeted conversation pen that stretches wall to wall in the living room to the fur cov erlet on the master bed, the 14room apartment of Harry and Marion Zelenko represents the last word in design sophistication.

title: Added Homework Brings School Strike Home to Students Here
description: For many of the 458 students at St. Agnes High School, yesterday's strike by Catholic lay teachers meant more free periods, less supervision, more homework and a good long workout in the gymnasium.

title: Suits Here Seek to Reopen Persico Trial to Public
description: Newspapers radioTV networks, journalists groups and individual reporters charged in court papers filed here yesterday that State Supreme Court Justice George Postel had violated the United States Constitution and New York law when he barred the public from the trial of Carmine J. Persico.

title: Webster Strong Finish Plan Gets Test in Giants Final Games
description: Aside from regrets the thought appropriate to New York Giant fans yesterday in the wake of Sunday's 1713 loss at Pittsburgh was: What can the remaining four games prove?

title: P.S.C. LETS CON ED RAISE GAS RATES
description: The State Public Service Commission yesterday authorized increases in gas rates averaging 12 to 12.5 per cent to take effect at 12:01 A.M. today for 1.3million customers of the Consolidated Edison Company in Manhattan, the Bronx and parts of Queens.

title: South Africa's Views
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 22Prime Minister John Vorster said here today that South Africa was not prepared to twist Rhodesia's arm for a settlement with Britain.

title: STAR ENVOY FIRST ON AQUEDUCT TURF
description: Star Envoy once more demonstrated that he can go all the way in a turf race as he took the 1 1/16mile grass event at Aqueduct yesterday. The 3yearold colt owned by Lloyd Miller hooked up with Sigmund Sommer's Big Shot II in the test for older horses and scored by two lengths.

title: STATE DEPARTMENT CLARIFIES GUIDELINE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The State Department said today that guidelines recently established for channeling dissenting opoinions of junior Foreign Service Officers were designed to insure, that such dissents reached policymaking officials.

title: UPSTATE AREAS GET UP TO FOOT OF SNOW
description: A storm from Canada swept across New York State yesterday, bringing up to a foot of snow in some sections upstate and periodic flurries in the metropolitan area. The flurries were on the southern fringes of the storm that dumped heavy snowfalls on many communities in Western New York.

title: Loeb, Rhoades Promotes Two as It Drops Michel
description: Wall Street's annual yearend round of toplevel executive changes began yesterday with announcements from Loeb, Rhoades & Co., Eastman Dillion, Union Securities & Co. and E. F. Hutton & Co.

title: LITERATURE MEDAL WON BY E. B. WHITE
description: E. B. White, author and an essayist for The New Yorker since 1925, was named yesterday the winner of the 1971 National Medal for Literature. The award presented by the National Book Committee, consists of $5,000 and a bronze medal. It is conferred on a living American writer for the excellence of his or her total contribution to the world of letters.

title: 2 Florida Men Convicted In Theft of Securities Here
description: A Federal Court jury here convicted two Florida men yesterday of conspiring to transport about $4million worth of securities stolen from a downtown Manhattan brokerage firm.

title: NewStyle Chamberlain Gives Streaking Lathers a New Look
description: A new Wilt Chamberlain is dominating the National Basketball Association. He is Chamberlain the super rebounder and shot blocker, and he's doing wonders for the Los Angeles Lakers who have an 11game winning streak and a 173 wonlost record.

title: Genesco Weighs Japanese Tie
description: Genesco, Inc., the country's largest apparel producer and retailer, and C. Itoh & Co., a Japanese trading concern that is also the world's largest textile company, are currently exploring mutual activities that may lead to the establishment of a new, jointly owned textile company in the United States.

title: Scribner Backs Transfer of 2 Ocean Hill Principals
description: School Chancellor Harvey B, Scribner has ruled that the community school board in Ocean HillBrownsville, Brooklyn, was within its rights in reassigning two principals.

title: Quadruplets in Morocco
description: SAFI, Morocco, Nov. 22 (AP) The Moroccan news agency reported today that a woman about 30 years old gave birth to quadruplet boys in a bus in this province 120 miles south of Casablanca.

title: CONTEMPT RULING UPSET IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22  The New Jersey Supreme Court today reversed a criminal contempt conviction of Joseph Matzner, a newspaper publisher who was convicted because of an editorial that appeared in Wayne Today, a weekly publication he owns.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: I'd sooner, except the penalties kill a man than a hawk, wrote Robinson Jeffers in his poem Hurt Hawks. Taken out of context his observation seems foolish and strident but it does dramatize the admiration and love many have for our birds of prey.

title: Gillman Resigns as Chargers'
description: SAN DIEGO Nov. 22 (UPI)Sid Gillman, who had been with the San Diego Chargers since, their inception, resigned today as head coach and executive vice president.

title: Clash at Forest Hills
description: The angry protest by residents of Forest Hills against the construction of lowincome housing in their midst demands more sympathetic understanding on the part city officials than it has received; but at the same time it does not invalidate the basic rationale of this bitterly controversial project.

title: U.N. Votes to. Study Youth Problems
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 22A recent United Nations report that said juvenile delinquency was increasing in both developed and underdeveloped countries led today to a unanimously adopted resolution committing the General Assembly to deal with the serious problems facing much of the world's youth.

title: U.S. HALTS EFFORT FOR INTERIM PACT TO OPEN THE SUEZ
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22State Department officials said today that the United States, faced with objections from both Israel and Egypt, had halted at least for the time being its efforts to promote an interim agreement in the Middle East.

title: THANT SAYS ISRAEL BARS STUDY IN CITY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 22Secretary General Thant told the Security Council in a written report today that lack of cooperation of israel had prevented him from carrying out the Council's request that he check on Israeli housing and population policies in Jerusalem.

title: Court, for First Time, Overrules A State Law That Favors Men
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Supreme Court unanimously struck down today an Idaho statute that gave men preference over women in administering deceased persons estates. It marked the first time the Court had invalidated a state law on grounds of sex discrimination.

title: Bridge: New York Stars Lead Way Into Life Master Finals
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 22 Two young New York experts led the field of 60 pairs into the final session of the life master men's pair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nations here tonight. Peter Weichsel, a member of the team that won the Spingold knockout teams earlier this year, and Alan Sontag totaled 557 match points at the end of the first final session, putting them more than a board ahead of their nearest rivals.

title: Leader of Labor Declares Nixon Sought Incident
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 22 George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., accused President Nixon today of deliberately trying to provoke an incident at the federation's convention last week so that he could contend that he had been mistreated by labor and thereby gain political advantage.

title: Rhodesia Talks Hang in the Balance
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 22  The BritishRhodesian talks hung in the balance tonight as Ian D. Smith, Prime Minister in the white minority Government, met with his Cabinet.

title: Auto Workers in West Germany Strike
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Nov. 22West Germany's automobile workers struck at six plants near here today, plunging the country into one of its most serious industrial disputes since World War II.

title: China to Aid Guyana.
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 22 (Reuters)China is to set up a textile factory in Guyana and assist the Government in establishing a largescale cotton industry, Prime Minister Forbes Burnham announced yesterday.

title: EDIE SEDGWICKI WARHOL STAR, 28
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 22Mrs. Edith Sedgwick Post, who as Edie Sedgwick was heralded as the superstar of the 1965 and 1966 underground movies of the pop artist Andy Warhol, died at her home here on Nov. 16. She was 28 years old.

title: City Housing Aide Is Named Chief of Municipal Loan Program
description: A 43yearold lawyer who once served as a volunteer legal counsel to Jesse Gray, the Harlem Rent Strike leader, was appointed yesterday to take over the scandalridden Municipal Loan Program.

title: Stage: Peasant Woe and Earthy Faith
description: When an Israeli musical comes to Manhattan under the patronage of the Premier of Israel Mrs. Golda Meir you would need to be some kind of an Arabsome kind of a brave Arabto object Yet Only Fools Are Sad, which opened last night at the Edison Theater is endearing and happya gentle celebration of the joy and pain of being a man.

title: Advertising:
description: The Olivetti Corporation of America, which has been a twoagency advertiser, is about to become a oneagency advertiser and that one agency will be Lois, Holland, Callaway.

title: RELIEF WORKERS REJECT PROGRAM
description: The city's welfare caseworkers will refuse to implement the state's proposed Incentives for Independence demonstration project, due to start Jan. 1 in Bay Ridge and in Rockland and Franklin Counties if it receives expected Federal approval, their union president announced yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As the original author of legislation finally enacted in 1968 putting four national holidays on a Monday, I am sorry to see The Times changing its mind on the desirability of this shift (editorial Oct. 26) especially for what are such flimsy reasons.

title: COPPER COMPANIES FOLLOW PRICE CUT
description: Copper prices yesterday continued the downward trend set in motion late Friday afternoon by the Phelps Dodge Corporation. In general, the cuts announced yesterday matched Phelps Dodge's move on Friday when it reduced the price of whole plate cathode by 2 cents to 49.875 cents a pound.

title: Seaborg Is Named Professor
description: BERKELEY, Calif. Nov. 22 (AP)Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg, chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission from 1961. until last summer, was named university professor of chemistry today by Charles J. Hitch, president of the University of California. He will probably teach a freshman chemistry course in the winter term.

title: U.S. Breeder Reactors Found Gaining
description: Despite a serious lag in American development of breedertype nuclear power plants, leaders of the effort believe this country will come close to catching up when this technology becomes a major source of electric energy some 15 years hence.

title: James M. Power, ExPresident of Board of Elections, 86, Dies
description: James M. Power, who retired last December from the Board of Elections after having stepped down from its presidency earlier in 1970, died of a heart attack Friday at the East Rockaway station of the Long Island Rail Road. He was 86 years old and lived at 20 Oswego Street, Long Beach, L. I.

title: COPPER FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of copper futures fell to new lifeofcontract lows here yesterday, across all contracts.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced yesterday the promotions of Richard W. Armstrong and David M. McConney to vice presidents, in the financial controls group.

title: Heath's Father Gets Guard In Reported I.R.A. Threat
description: BROADSTAIRS, England (UPI)Prime Minister Heath's 82yearold father was under police guard at his home in Broadstairs, Kent, tonight because of what was said to be a threat by the Irish Republican Army.

title: CARLTON J. STEPHENSON
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., Nov. 22Carlton Jervis Stephenson, retired senior agent of the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce in New York and a former president of the Canadian Society of New York, died here Saturday. His age was 87.

title: BUTZ BACKED, 86, BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Senate Agriculture Committee approved today by a twovote margin President Nixon's choice of Dr. Earl L. Butz to be Secretary of Agriculture.

title: YANKS SAY MAYOR WILL SEEK FUNS
description: The New York Yankees said yesterday that Mayor Lindsay had reaffirmed his total dedication to keeping the team in the city and would ask the Board of Estimate for the initial funds during the next two weeks.

title: MacKenzie, at Piano, Displays Improbable Facility and Flash
description: Arthur MacKenzie plays the piano with such nonchalance and improbable facility that he sometimes finds it difficult to play the music. There is more substance, certainly, to Schumann's FantasiestilcIce than his performance at Alice Tully Hall disclosed Sunday night. Mr. MacKenzie consistently made speed and flash the object, while finding it hard to bring larger ideas into focus.

title: TV: An Informative N.B.C. News Series on China
description: As fulllength documentaries get scarcer, alternatives demand more attention. One is the minidocumentary series: short segments on a single subject that are inserted into the various evening editions of the news, eventually adding up to a more or less fulllength documentary.

title: Notes on People
description: Nils A Boo former Governor of South Dakota, was inducted in. New York as chief judge of the United States CustOms Court. Accepting the $40,000ayear post, to which he was named by President Nixon Judge Boe quoted the Old Testament: Do justly and love mercy and walk humbly with thy God.

title: Lady Brooke, Ranee of Sarawak Until Its '46 Secession, Is Dead
description: Lady Brooke, the last Ranee of Sarawak, died on Nov. 11 in Barbados, the West Indies. She was 86 years old.

title: Black Caucus Members Find Response a Challenge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The challenge has been thrown to us and we must deliver, Representative Charles B. Rangel said. Whether we can or cannot deliver, black people think we can and they expect us to.

title: Enemy Losses Put at 36
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 23 (AP)By nightfall of the first day of the new drive into Cambodia, South Vietnamese field commanders reported that 36 North Vietnamese soldiers had been killed in small scattered clashes north of Route 7, about 90 miles northwest of Saigon. No South Vietnamese casualties were reported.

title: Dr. Dwayne Orton Dead at 68; Education Director for I.B.M.
description: Dr. Dwayne Orton, a specialist in executive education who served as the director of education and educational consultant for the International Business Machines Corporation, died here yesterday at the age of 68. He lived at 25 Sutton Place South,

title: Bus Drivers Avert a Strike
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 22 (AP)  ?us drivers and mechanics) voted 423 to 71 to accept a new contract with the Connecticut Company, averting a strike set fur tomorrow. The result was released today after locals in Hartford, Stamford and New Haven had voted. The contract will last until Sept. 30, 1972. Its provisions, including wage and benefit increases, are retroactive to Nov, 15, the end of the national wageprice freeze,

title: Westchester to Sell 25 Campus Acres
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 22 The Westchester County Board of Legislators voted today to sell 25 acres of countyowned land on the future campus of New York Medical College to the New York State Urban Development Corporation for the construction of 375 apartments.

title: Morton Urges Indian Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)  Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton told Senate Interior subcommittee today that he supported legislation to establish an Indian Trust Counsel Authority whose sole duty would be the active advocacy of the natural resource trust rights and interests of Indians.

title: Literary Dispute Arises Over Sylvia Plath's Death
description: LONDON, Nov. 22  A bitter literary dispute has broken out over the publication of a book dealing with the, suicide of Sylvia Plath the 31yearold American poet in London in 1963.

title: President Will Dedicate Eisenhower Medical Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) President Nixon will dedicate on Saturday a 140bed hospital that forms the core of the planned Eisenhower Medical Center between Palm Springs and Palm Desert, Calif., the White House announced today.

title: Williams Lists Net Worth
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) United States Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, reported today that his net financial worth was $160,545.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended No. 16.

title: City's Small Parks Joyless in Neglect
description: Angry and frustrated over what they call longstanding city neglect of their neighborhood parks, some Brooklyn residents and their Assemblyman led parks officials yesterday on a depressing tour of burnedout comfort stations, shattered fountains and wading pools, torn fences, missing swings, broken benches and weedgrown asphalt play lots.

title: ATOMIC ARMS BAN ON OKINAWA ASKED
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22 (AP)Premier Eisaku Sato's governing LiberalDemocratic party and two moderate opposition parties adopted a resolution today calling for a ban on nuclear weapons on Okinawa.

title: India Restricts Flights
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, Nov. 23 (UPI)India has restricted flights near her borders with Pakistan. A Government order announced late last night banned all flights within nine miles of the East and West Pakistan borders without the specific permission of the Director General of Aviation. Officials said the rule was aimed at easier identification of aircraft over border areas.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION OFF 0.3% FOR WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 30 slipped by 0.3 per cent to 1,866,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This compared with 1,871,000 tons in the preceding week. Total output for the year to date was put at 108,857,000 tons.

title: U. S. Agrees to Cede 2 Islets to Honduras
description: SAN PEDRO SULA, Honduras, Nov. 22 (AP)Robert H. Finch, on a special LatinAmerican mission for President Nixon, signed a treaty here today that would cede the tiny Swan Islands to Honduras.

title: BUSINESS WARNED ON RAISING PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Government, under widespread criticism for allowing a wage increase of at least 15 per cent for coal miners, appeared prepared today to take a tougher stand on price advances generally.

title: MoneySupply Rein Was Voted Aug. 24
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters) The Federal Reserve Open Market Committee voted unanimously at its Aug. 24 meeting to tighten further the money supply and bank credit.

title: C. W. POST TO PLAY DELAWARE DEC. 11
description: C. W. Post and Delaware the two most explosive small college football teams in the nation, accepted bids yesterday to meet in the fourth annual Boardwalk Bowl game at Atlantic City's Convention Hall, Dec. 11.

title: WAGES INCREASED AT END OF FREEZE
description: A large number of companies across the country have increased the wages and salaries of their employes since the Nixon Administration's. wageprice freeze ended at midnight Nov. 13.

title: Screen: Peter Brook's King Lear
description: Having missed the King Lear that was staged here seven years ago by Peter Brook with the Royal Shakes peare Company I'm unable to compare it with Mr. Brook's film version which also stars Paul Scofield and Irene Worth and opened yesterday at the Paris Theater.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent letter by Sgt. Harold H. Melnick of the Sergeants Benevolent Association impugns the Knapp Commission and characterizes its hearings as a charade that projects a stereotype image of a corrupt officer as representative of the personnel of the Police Department, but at no point does he contest the commission's carefully corroborated findings that a system of widespread police corrup, tion does, in fact, exist.

title: AMEX AND OTC DECLINE SHARPLY
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market took a beating yesterday as both lists declined sharply in moderate trading.

title: Aroma of Scotch After Crash Lures Jersey Motorists
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov. 22Motorists by the score offered their help to clear up a traffic mishap at Exit 13 of the New Jersey Turnpike today but were waved on their way by two state troopers.

title: Prefontaine, Oregon Run Victors
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 22 (AP)Steve Prefontaine of the University of Oregon outdistanced a field of 302 runners in nearfreezing weather today and led his team to the National Collegiate crosscountry championship.

title: Don't Rip, Tear or Mutilate
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.A little more than three years ago I tore up my draft card and gave its remains to a cop. In September, 1971, I got out of prison after doing 95 days of an indefinite threemonth to fiveyear sentence. The rest of the five years has been suspended while I do a year's probation. Partly because the possible sentence was so long, a lot of newspapers carried the story, usually presenting it as an unnecessary harshness on the part of the court or as an unusual miscarriage of justice. To help dramatize the situation, all the newspapers quoted me as saying I had used a foolish tactic.

title: RULES TO PROTECT WETLANDS ISSUED
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22The New Jersey Environmental Protection Department today released proposed regulations banning the use of persistent pesticides the dumping of garbage or the driving of vehicles on the state's coastal wetlands.

title: PENN STATE WINS LAMBERT TROPHY
description: Penn State's undefeated football team which accepted bid to the Cotton Bowl last Saturday was named yesterday as winner of the Lambert Trophy for the outstanding performance of the season by major college team in the East."

title: Senate RollCall on Campaign Aid
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 22 (UPI)Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate approved today a plan to allow each taxpayer to earmark $1 of his Federal income taxes, beginning next year, to finance Presidential election campaigns:

title: KinneyTVC Terms Shift
description: Kinney Services, Inc. and the TeleVision Communications Corporation announced yesterday adjusted terms of the previously announced agreement whereby Kinney would acquire TVC. The changed terms call for Kinney to acquire the cable television and recording studio operations of TVC for 1,210,500 shares of Kinney common stock worth approximately $32,683,500, basedon Kinney's closing price of 27 yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: REP RYAN BACKS KHEEL FARE PLAN
description: Representative William F. Ryan, Democrat of Manhattan, asserted yesterday that there is no reason whatsoever why the 30cent transit fare has to be increased,

title: President's Treatment at Convention Decried
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally sharply attacked George Meany today in connection with the treatment of President Nixon last Friday at the convention in Bal Harbour, Fla., of the A.F.L.C.I.O.

title: Retail Sales Advance
description: While sales of nine retail merchandise chains showed moderate increases in the fiscal quarter ended with October, profits of three of them declined from last year, according to their reports issued yesterday. These included Montgomery Ward & Co., Inc., the Allied Stores Corporation and the W. T. Grant Company.

title: Santa Fe Sets $63Million For Rolling Stock in '72
description: The Atchison, Topeka And Santa Fe Railway announced yeSterday that it will spend about $63million for rolling stock as part of its 1972 capital outlay program.

title: Water Research Bill Passed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) The Senate passed today a bill increasing to $250,000 the annual Federal aid allotment available to each state for the operation of water resources research centers. The present allowance is $100,000. The bill was sennt to the White House.

title: DAVID MEYER
description: David Meyer, for many years director of the Archives of the Jewish Labor Bund in New York and former chairman of the Pocketbook and Novelty Workers Union, died here Sunday. He was 83 years old and lived at 413 Grand Street.

title: AirFare Bill Gains in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  The Senate Commerce Committee approved today a bill giving the Civil Aeronautics Board the authority to suspend  subject to Presidential vetointernational air fares involving the United States.

title: U.S. AUTHORIZES CITIES TO RAISE CONTROLLED RENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Rentcontrolled private apartments in New York and other cities were removed by the Government today from Federal regulation during Phase Two of the economic stabilization program.

title: Joint Chiefs Are Believed Victors in Fight to Retain Role as Key Military Advisers in Crises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Joint Chiefs of Staff have apparently won a struggle to maintain their role as principal military advisers to the President and the Secretary of Defense in crisis situations.

title: Cambodians Lose Contact
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 22 (AP)The Cambodian military command reported today that it had lost contact with two companies of soldiers that had come under attack on Route 5, about 70 miles north of Pnompenh. A spokesman said the fate of the two units was not known.

title: KOREANS DOMINATE JERSEYANS CONCERT
description: John Hyun, conductor of the Bergen Philharmonic, was born and trained in Korea, so he made a Korean festival out of his community orchestra's first trip across the Hudson. After Mozart's Marriage of Figaro, Overture, his Town Hall program Saturday night stayed either with pieces by. Korean composers, or standard repertory items featuring Korean soloists.

title: Lack of Rain Plagues Duck Hunting Capital
description: STUTTGART, Ark., Nov. 21 Farmers pray endlessly for rain, of course, but their pleas are unusually urgent here this month.

title: General Says He Knew of No Atrocities When He Told Henderson to Act on Mylai
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 22 A retired officer who had been censured by the Army for his role in the Mylai 4 incident said today that he had no knowledge of atrocities carried out by American troops when he ordered Col. Oran K. Henderson to investigate the attack.

title: AntiArmy F.T.A.Show
description: F.T.A. means, among other things, Free the Army, and that is exactly what The F.T.A. Show is attempting to do as it tours Army towns playing in offduty coffee houses and the outskirts of military basesto free the Army from such traditions as war and U.S.O. shows.

title: PIANO RECITAL GIVEN BY LUCY ISHKANIAN
description: Lucy Ishkanian played the piano powerfully and at times quite well in her first New York recital yesterday afternoon at Philharmonic Hall A native New Yorker of Armenian descent Miss Ishkanian studied for 15 years at the Juilliard School and competed in the 1962 Tchaikovsky competition in Moscow She was not therefore a debutante in the usual sense, and her performances often reflected her experience.

title: Troop Tour No 21 for Hope
description: Bob Hope will make his 21st holiday trip to American servicemen around the world at Christmas time. He will visit Hawaii, Okinawa, South Vietnam, Italy, Spain and Guantanamo, Cuba. The National Broadcasting Company said yesterday that filmed highlights of the tour would be shown on Jan. 17.

title: Puerto Rican Heads the City U. Board
description: Luis Quero Chiesa, a 60yearold Puerto Rican who never went to college, last night was elected chairman of the Board of Higher Education, the governing body of the 20unit City University of New York.

title: India, Pakistan and U.N.
description: The time has come for the United Nations Security Council to take up on an urgent basis the threat allout war along the IndianPakistani border. Only the United Nations has the possibility of acting effectively to defuse this situation for which Pakistan bears by far the heavier responsibility, but which clearly now constitutes a threat to international peace and security.

title: AEROSPACE DECLINE DETAILED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 22 (AP) A new study by the Aerospace Industries Association detailed today the sharp drop in United States aerospace economic activity over the last three years.

title: TRADING SLUGGISH 111 BOND MARKETS
description: Interest rates were pushed downward in the corporate bond market yesterday, and investors failed to buy many of the new issues offered, Yields were raised in the taxexempt bond market, but the increase there didn't seem to help much either.

title: Senate RollCall on the Tax Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)Following is the roll call vole by which the Senate approved.. today:. an enlarged version of President Nixon's tax reduction bill:

title: City's Buildings Process: How It Works
description: A city agency that needs new building is required to prepare an initial project program and budget estimate for the City Planning Commission 10 months before the capital budget is certified by the Mayor and 15 months before the agency can expect construction to begin. Actual time elapsed before construction starts is usually two to three years.

title: ROMNEY AFFIRMS FOREST HILLS SITE
description: Final approval of the controversial lowincome housing project planned for middleclass Forest Hills, Queens, was reaffirmed last night by George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Syntex Earnings Soar
description: Reflecting increased sales, the net income of the Syntex Corporation in the three months ended Oct. 31 rose 69.6 per cent from the yearearlier period, according to the report issued yesterday.

title: Filion Ties Mark, Driving 6 Victors
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 22 (AP)Herve Filion became the fourth harness racing driver in history to win six races on a single program. He did it during today's 11race card at Freehold Raceway.

title: $10,000 Holdup in Harlem
description: Two gunmen held up a Harlem supermarket yesterday and took $10,000 from the store and $280 from six customers. The thugs entered the Finast Supermarket at 262 West 145th Street shortly after the store opened at 8 A.M. and forced the manager to open a safe containing the $10,000. Then, the police reported the gunmen made six customers give up a total of $280.

title: Lortie Gets 20Year Term In Kidnapping of Laporte
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 22 (AP)Bernard Lortie, 20 years old, was sentenced today to 20 years in prison for the kidnapping of the Quebec Labor Minister, Pierre Laporte on Oct. 10, 1970.

title: WORK CALL DEFIED BY 16,000 MINERS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 22As many as 16,000 softcoal miners stayed away from work in West Virginia and western Pennsylvania today despite calls from United Mine Workers officials for them to return and no discernible industrywide movement for them to stay out.

title: 4 LEADING ACTORS SIGN FOR 2 PLAYS
description: Four prominent actors have been signed to appear on Broadway this season.

title: SAIGON FORCE PUT AT 5,000 IN DRIVE
description: TAYNINH, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 23  Military sources reported yesterday that at least 5,000 troops are involved in new South Vietnamese drive into eastern Cambodia.

title: Pakistan Says India Has Made Dents Along Border
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 22 Pakistan charged tonight that India had launched an allout military offensive without declaration of war.

title: New Taxes and State Aid Cuts Are Predicted by Rockefeller
description: Governor Rockefeller said here yesterday that an anticipated budget deficit of $770million for the current state fiscal year would have to be resolved by a combination of new taxes and cuts in state aid and services.

title: Calcutta Hears the Bengalis Forces Aim for Jessore
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 22A major offensive by Bengali insurgents, aided by Indian troops, is apparently under way against the Pakistani Army on the western side of East Pakistan, according to reports reaching Calcutta.

title: CONNALLY VOICES MONEY OPTIMISM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Secretary of the Treasury, John B. Connally, said today he was very hopeful that real progress can be made in the upcoming week in resolving the world monetary uncertainty.

title: Bill Cutting Income Taxes 40Billion Voted in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Senate passed a sweeping tax bill tonight by a vote of 64 to 30.

title: Lee, Punter and No. 3 Passer, Becomes Vikings Top General
description: Bob Leel Who's he?

title: Reagan Supports Agnew
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 22 (AP)  Gov. Ronald Reagan said today that if necessary he would go to President Nixon to ask him to keep Spiro Agnew on the 1972 Republican ticket. I think Tcd Agnew has been a great Vice President, and I think Ted Agnew should be on the ticket, the Republican Governor told a news conference.

title: Bangkok Sets Military Trials
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 22 (AP)Thailand's ruling National Executive Council decreed today that all violators of the nation's antiCommunist laws would be tried by military courts, which can order the death penalty. The order applies to all such offenses committed after or before the martiallaw decree imposed Wednesday night by Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn.

title: NAM 70% SURE HE'LL FACE 49ERS
description: Joe Namath says he's 70 per cent certain he'll be ready to play against San Francisco Sunday which means that Bob Davis can be 70 per cent certain he's on his way back to the bench Davis however isn't conceding anything until it happens.

title: GUITAR OF WILLIAMS ATTRACTS THE YOUNG
description: Virtuoso guitarists, it seems, never lack for audiences, and John Williams, the 30yearold Australianborn star of the instrument, filled Tully Hall on Saturday night with an attentive and enthusiastic public consisting chiefly of young people.

title: Tax Agency Begins a Drive On Major Drug Traffickers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 The Internal Revenue Service has begun an effort to tray major drug traffickers by investigating their income taxes.

title: Italian Newsstands Closed, Trucks Halted by Strikes
description: ROME, Nov. 22 (AP)Strikes throughout Italy today shut newsstands, clogged frontier truck traffic and slowed farm work.

title: Urban Coalition in Newark Says It Is Facing Extinction
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22 The Greater Newark Urban Coalition, born in hope out of the Wreckage and anguish of the devastating midsummer 1967 riots here, says it is threatened with extinction because contributions have virtually dried up.

title: DE PEYER EXCELS IN CHAMBER GROUP
description: The liquid tones of Gervase de Peyer's clarinet were featured in the Tully Hall concert given by Lincoln Center's Chamber Music Society Sunday afternoon. A thoughtful artist and a tidy technician in most respects, Mr. De Peyer fulfilled his assignments in the ensemble admirably, and all four works unfolded with the smooth rapport characteristic of chamber music playing at its best.

title: Rightist Writer Wins Goncourt Prize
description: PARIS, Nov. 22France's top literary award the annual Goncourt Prize today was given to Jacques Laurent a controversial rightwing figure, for Les Mises, a novel combining comments on the novel and the commentator's diary with a meditation on it all.

title: SCHWEITZER PAY DENIED BY COURT
description: ALBANY, Nov. 22The Court on the Judiciary refused today to reinstate the salary of State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer, pending its resolution of the charges of misconduct lodged against him last September.

title: RICHNESS OF GAMBAS INFUSES A CONCERT
description: Contemporary music for viola da gamba is a pretty sparse commodity, but the Baroque Trio of the Schola Cantorum Basiliensis (August Wenzinger and Hannelore Mueller, gambas, Robert Conant, harpsichord) offered three specially commissioned examples Sunday night at the New York Cultural Center.

title: FIRST PENNSYLVANIA NAMES EXECUTIVES
description: The First Pennsylvania Corporation (which owns the First Pennsylvania Banking and Trust Company, Philadelphia's largest bank) announced yesterday that its president and chief executive officer, John R. Bunting, would become chairman of both concerns Jan. 1.

title: N.Y.U. Names 2 Trustees
description: William R. Salomon, managing partner of Salomon Brothers, the investment banking firm, and J. S. Seidman, a founding partner of Seidman & Seidman, certified public accountants, Were elected yesterday to the New York University board of trustees.

title: Swan Islands Visited by Columbus, Pirates and Birds
description: SWAN ISLANDS, Honduras They were discovered by Columbus in 1509, infested by pirates 200 years later, prized by guano hunters, cultivated by the United Fruit Company, ravaged by hurricane, claimed by a sea captain from Mobile and a farmer from Massachusetts and by others now forgotten, not to mention at least three countries.

title: Firemen Continue to Report Sick But Medical Leaves Are Fewer
description: Firemen continued to report sick yesterday when they were injured or did not feel well after fighting fires. But Fire Department officials reported that the total on medical leave was reduced from 466 to 379 during the day when some firemen recovered and were found fit to return to duty.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have a very high appreciation of Dr. J. Bronowski both as a scientist and a national philosopher. I was therefore deeply disturbed by some of his recent OpEd comments.

title: One Killed as Ulster Terrorists Blow Up a Hotel and a Tavern
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 22 (AP)Terrorists struck twice in Northern Ireland tonight, blowing up a hotel and blasting a public house. One man was killed and nine persons were wounded in the tavern explosion.

title: Church Joins Pilot Project To Assist Women Prisoners
description: The United Church of Christ yesterday joined the Department of Justice, a black sorority and a black consulting company in a 19month pilot program to rehabilitate women prisoners.

title: Army and Navy Agree: Pause Doesn't Refresh
description: Tom Cahill and Rick Forzano, the Army and Navy football coaches, agreed on one thing yesterday: they would prefer to play the service classic the week after their nexttolast game instead of having the traditional two weeks off before the meeting. For years Army and Navy have taken a 14 day pause to fully prepare for the annual game, which will be held for the 72d time Saturday at Philadelphia's John F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium. This has become a builtin part of each academy's season.

title: Directory of Scientists Will Now List Women
description: The standard, manyvolumed directory of scientists, which has been known for generations as American Men of Science, has bowed to the feminist movement. Henceforth, the directory will be known as American Men and Women of Science.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent column Tom Wicker deplored passage of legislation prohibiting use of Federal funds for busing programs. He charged the House members variously with demagoguery, abandonment of leadership and failure to act as they should.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (AP)The Earl of Arran demanded in the House of Lords today that the 50,000 Irish citizens who come to work or settle in Britain every year be forced to apply for work permits.

title: Most Controlled Rents in City to Rise
description: The vast majority of tenants in New York's 1.3 million rentcontrolled apartments will face tent increases in January as result of the Price Commission ruling yesterday exempting local rent control from Phase Two guidelines.

title: Leader in School Strike
description: Two years ago, when he was picked as the first president of the newly formed union of Catholic lay teachers in the Archdiocese of New York, Barry F. Ryan was an articulate but uncertain leader. He was more patient than militant, and less persuasive than dedicated to raising the status of lay teachers from their longtime image as parish mothers to that of respected, wellpaid professionals.

title: State Unemployment Rate Drops to 5.5% From 5.7%
description: ALBANY, Nov. 22 (AP) The state's jobless rate dropped slightly last month to 5,5 per cent from 5.7 per cent. as the job market improved across the state, the State Labor Department reported today. A year ago in October, the rate was 4.5 per cent.

title: Eyskens to Form Cabinet
description: BRUSSELS. Nov. 22  King Baudouin today asked the outgoing Belgian Premier, Gaston Eyskens, to form a new government. Mr. Eyskens is expected to have no difficulty in continuing the coalition of Social Christians and Socialists. Parliamentary elections were held this month.

title: SENATE APPROVES FEDERAL TAX AID FOR CAMPAIGNING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A revolutionary new political plan under which the full cost of Presidential campaigns could be financed from Federal funds instead of private contributions was approved tonight by the Senate.

title: ROBERT SCHWARTZ, OIL MAN 40 YEARS
description: HEWLETT BAY PARK, L.I., Nov. 22Robert B. Schwartz, a founder and former vice president of Paragon Oil Company, now a division of Texaco, Inc., died yesterday at his home here. He was 73 years old.

title: Vratislav Trcka Dies at 81; A Former Czech Diplomat
description: Vratislav Trcka, a former Czechoslovak diplomat, died yesterday here. He was 81 years old and lived in the Andrew Freedman Home, the Bronx.

title: Joseph C. Wilson
description: As much as any other businessman in this turbulent era, Joseph C. Wilson helped expand the concept of corporate balance sheet to include social costs and civic responsibilities. Chairman of the board of Xerox, he was an intensely compassionate civic leader deeply interested in such areas of public policy as welfare and health care.

title: U.S. Urges People to Prepare For Hazards of Winter Storms
description: The official start of winter may be a month away, but the realities of winter  with its many hazards to life and limb  have already begun for millions of Americans.

title: Nixon Signs Aid Measure
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) President Nixon signed legislation today providing funds to continue the foreign aid program through Dec. 8.

title: F.T.C. Says Stated Interest Must Be Yearly Percentage
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (U.P.I.)The Federal Trade Commission ruled today that stores and lenders must state their interest rates by annual percentage only. It said other terms were confusing to consumers.

title: Advertising:
description: Edward N. Ney begins his second year today as the boss of bosses of Young & Rubicam, the world's third largest ad agency.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The unease about the confirmation of William Rehnquist as Supreme Court justice felt by Tom Wicker, Anthony Lewis and others stems from three sources. The first is that Mr. Rehnquist's attitude toward civil rights, civil liberties and executive power is flatly out of keeping with the consensus of the country, the Senate and current constitutional law.

title: LEFKOWITZ DENIES TENANTS CHARGE
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that there was absolutely no basis for statements made Sunday about his office by residents of Schwab House who oppose an offering to make the building a cooperative.

title: African Leaders Meet Sadat
description: CAIRO, Nov. 22President Sadat consulted in his home tonight with two African Presidents representing a committee of the Organization of African Unity. The committee was set up last summer to seek peace between Egypt and Israel.

title: 8 EUROPEAN NATIONS URGEDTOFIGHTDRUGS
description: ATHENS, Nov. 22A United Nations mission on narcotics control urged eight Eastern and Western European nations today to join forces in cracking down on drug smugglers moving narcotics from the Middle East to Western Europe and America.

title: Soviet Leaders Start Week of Meetings
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 22 The policymaking Central Committee of the Soviet Communist party opened a week of intensive political activity to. day by approving the new fiveyear plan for 197175. It is to be presented Wednesday to the Supreme Soviet for final ratification.

title: FALCONS DEFEAT PACKERS BY 2821
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 22 (UPI) Bob Berry starting for the first time in five games completed 16 of 21 passes tonight to lead Atlanta to a 28.21 victory over Green Bay, the first time the Falcons have beaten the Packers in six tries.

title: CITY ACCELERATES DAYCARE SERVICE
description: The number of children in the city's Day Care Center Program has nearly doubledfrom 8,000 to 15,700in the last 16 months, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday.

title: DETAILS DISCLOSED ON FRIGIDAIRE PACT
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 22 Frigidaire officials disclosed details today of an agreement with Local 801 of the International Union of Electrical Workers that calls for appliance workers to forgo scheduled wage riese for the next two years.

title: DEBUT IS A TRIUMPH FOR STEINERIUS DUO
description: Musicians make New York debuts under all sorts of auspices, but Saturday afternoon must have been the first time that a violin and piano duo made its debut here in a Town Hall concert sponsored in part by the Alabama State Council on the Arts and Humanities and the Tuscaloosa Chamber of Commerce.

title: Nureyev Assumes Leading Male Role In London Figures
description: LONDON, Nov. 22Rudolf Nureyev had at Covent Garden Saturday night what was in many ways his most demanding assignment to date in modern ballet when he took over the leading male role in Glenn Tetley's Field Figures with the Royal Ballet.

title: New Hockey Association Awards Two Franchises
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (UPI) Hamilton of Ontario and New England have been awarded franchises in the new World Hockey Association the W.H.A. president Gary Davidson, announced today,

title: DOW SLUMPS 7.52 TO LOW FOR YEAR
description: The stock market, enveloped in gloom and skepticism, crunched to a 1971 low yesterday as measured by the DowJones industrial average.

title: Rehnquist Role in Arizona Debated as Vote Nears
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov, 22The debate over whether William H. Rehnquist was ever a member of Arizonans for America continued here today, a day before the Senate Judiciary Committee is scheduled to vote on the nominations of Mr. Rehnquist and Lewis P. Powell Jr. to the Supreme Court.

title: 2 EXECUTIVES HURT IN CRASH OF PLANE
description: EAST GREENWICH, R.I., Nov. 22 (AP)Five persons, including the chairman and chief executive officer of the Prudential Insurance Company in Newark, were hospitalized today after a plane crash that killed the wife of another Prudential executive.

title: 3 TV NETWORKS EVEN IN NIELSEN REPORT
description: The three television networks finished in a virtual deadbeat in the Nielsen report on prime time hours issued yesterday. Only fourtenths of a percentage pointsome researchers believed only twotenthsseparated the American Broadcasting Company, Columbia Broadcasting System and National Broadcasting Company.

title: 12 Divisions Reported in Attack
description: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 22A Pakistani delegation spokesman said today that 12 Indian divisions were involved in a fourpronged attack on Pakistani forces last night.

title: Advertising:
description: Twelve of the top 25 agencies expect to end the year up in billings end profits, they've reported to the American Association of Advertising Agencies. Five more expect to be even in billings and eight down, while eight expect to be up in profits and five down.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose in Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Yields on United States. Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Books of The Times
description: I was both startled and aggrieved to find myself bored by a number of these stories. Like almost every other critic"with the notable exception of Edmund Wilson  I had always regarded Kafka as the uncanny voice of our age. He stirred us as no other writer ever had; he was our grandest nightmare, In the late forties and early fifties, every quarterly published several articles on Kafka and many devoted entire issues to him, When The Great Wall of China was out of print, I tried unsuccessfully to buy it at any price. People just wouldn't part with it.

title: Seal Goalie's Night to Forget
description: Safely away from Madison Square Garden yesterday seated in the jet that was taking the California Golden Seals back to Oakland, Gilles Meloche relaxed at last.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Whether or not the Democrats in Congress can ram through their plan to have the Federal Government pay for their general election campaign next year, their party and its supporters are facing a complex, perhaps unresolvable problem in the preconvention primary campaigns. There are just too many Democratic Presidential candidates competing for the Demo cratic dollar.

title: Ghana Demands Urban Austerity to Improve Rural Life
description: ACCRA, GhanaThe Government is attempting one of the most difficult feats in politics: to sell austerity.

title: 2 Freed in Saigon Amnesty Are Home but Uneasy
description: HOALOI, South Vietnam, Nov. 11Two of the many men missing from this village have come home, but neither dares believe that he will be left alone to lead the quiet life he wants.

title: Market Place: Teleprompter: Fight Widens
description: Judging from a letter delivered by hand to the American Stock Exchange late yesterday, Teleprompter dissidents believe they have a. fair chance of unseating the company's board of directors if discretionary proxies can be neutralized.

title: Arthur Daley
description: If they had ever given the situation serious study, the followers of the Los Angeles Rams would hardly have reached the glum conclusion that they were trapped on a oneway street. George Allen, the coach they admired, had ducked out from under the California smog and gone to Washington to coach the Redskins. Then he made such ruthless talent raids on the team he had just left that he gathered to him nine of his old Rams. This gave the Redskins so hybrid a look that some cynics were calling them the Ramskins. These were anxious days in the area of the Los Angeles Coliseum. The Rams had a new coach, and by way of adding to the apprehension he was a college coach without any professional background. His name was Tommy Prothro and he had gained a glittering reputation for himself in campus circles But he still was an unknown among the pros who eat strangers alive.

title: No Confirmation in U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22United States officials said today that they knew of no evidence to support Pakistani broadcasts charging Indian troops had entered East Pakistan.

title: B'NAI B'RITH SEES EXTREMISM PERIL
description: GROSSINGERS, N.Y., Nov. 22Opposition to Israel and to the United States support for the Jewish state is replacing Vietnam as a key issue of left and rightwing extremists, according to an analysis by the AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith.

title: U.S. AIDE ATTACKS TRADE BARRIERS
description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (AP)Assailing what he termed artificial trade barriers, a special envoy. of President Nixon said tonight that they were erected by the European Common Market and other economic groups for selfish ends. He called for cooperation in building a new world commerce system.

title: Patent Issued to Armco
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23, (Reuters)The United States Patent Office issued a patent to the Armco Steel Corporation for a method of making a corrosionresistant steel sandwich with conventional steelmaking facilities, Armco said. The new process involves putting thick outer layers of carbon or alloy steels around thin inner core of corrosionresistant stainless steel at the ingot stage of production.

title: 2 Judges in Boston Deny Taking Bribe In Swindling Case
Industry Challenges Raise Due Commercial Printers
description: The commercial printing industry in the metropolitan area has challenged pay and benefit increases due employes under existing contracts on the ground that they exceed the guidelines set down by the Pay Board, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Bridge: Life Master Men's Pairs Title  Won by Weichsel and Sontag
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 23Two young New York experts scored an overwhelming victory In the life master men's pair championship here last night. Peter Weichsel, a Spingold knockout team winner earlier this year, and Alan Sontag, a recent recruit to that team, won the title by a margin of 78 match points, or almost three full boards.

title: 2 STATIONS IN PACTS ON MINORITY HIRING
description: Two broadcasting stationsone a television outlet in Los Angeles and the other a radio facility in Albuquerque, N. M,have reached agreement with minority audiences to avoid challenges to renewal of their licenses.

title: Operator's Nod Controls Aquatic TV Robot
description: An aquatic robot, its television camera controlled by head motions of a distant operator, has demonstrated dramatically what can be done by matching human imageprocessing abilities with such system.

title: CITY COLLEGE GIFT APPROVED BY BOARD
description: The Board of Higher Education has approved the proposal to create a Center for the Performing Arts at City College.

title: Thanksgiving for Turkeys
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (UPI)Two turkeys at the Philadelphia Zoo will be the guests at a special Thankgiving dinner tomorrow. The turkeys will be fed a meal that will include acorns, whole kernel corn, pumpkin seeds, sliced apples, peanuts, greens and zoo cake, a diet supplement for zoo animals. The meal will be fed to them by zoo keepers on a turkey platter, with a tablecloth and candles.

title: SOONERS MILDREN PREDICTS VICTORY
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 23The country and western music stations cry Today's Teardrops are Tomorrow's Rainbows. Jack Mildren says, no sweat, Oklahoma's rainbow will, be a victory over Nebraska here Thursday in their battle, of unbeaten college football polders.

title: Cairo Aide Gives View
description: CAIRO, Nov. 23The Egyptian Government's chief spokesman, Tahsin Bashir, said tonight peace could be saved in the Middle East if Israel gave evidence of intention to implement the United Nations Security Council resolution of Nov. 22, 1967, which called, among other things, for Israel to withdraw from occupied Arab territories.Mr. Bashir emphasized that declarations by President Amwar elSadat over the weekend about the necessity, of war to recover occupied Arab lands did not represent the rejection of a peaceful solution.

title: FUTURES PRICES FOR COTTON RISE
description: Trading of cotton futures No. 2 was very active here yesterday and prices rose as much as the daily limit of $10 bale until profit taking and trade hedging intervened, Closing prices on the New York Cotton Exchange were $4.30 bale higher to 15 cents lower.

title: 28,459 Vehicles Recalled By Ford to Repair Belts
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23 (UFOThe Ford Motor Company said today that it was asking 28,459 owners of certain 1972 Fords, Thunderbirds, Pintos and pickup trucks to return the vehicles to dealers for replacement of seat and shoulder belt anchor bolts.

title: TV: C.B.S.Views an American Family's Discontent
description: Tomorrow night at 10, near the close of another Thanksgiving Day, the Columbia Broadcasting System's news department will offer a portrait of one American family with, seemingly, every reason in the world to give thanks. Every reason except onewhat the program finds to be a pronounced shudder of discontent.

title: SIDNEY B. EPSTEIN
description: BAYONNE, N. T., Nov. 23Sidney B. Epstein, founder and president of the Bayonne Plumbing Company, died today. He was 81 years old and lived at 850 Avenue C.

title: Chaps Outlast Rockets
description: DALLAS, Nov. 23 (AP)The Dallas Chaps connected on four free throws in the last 32 seconds tonight to beat the Denver Rockets, 104101, in an American Basketball Association game.

title: AngloFrench Romance
description: LONDON, Nov. 23Every great political and economic event can be regarded in two waysas a unique turningpoint or as the repetition of an historital pattern. Here on this island, strewn with the monuments of the past, people tend to see Britain's approaching entry into the European Common Market as a reenactment of history.

title: Stars Win, 21, From Canucks
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 23 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars, behind the brilliant netminding of Cesare Maniago, edged the Vancouver Canucks, 21, tonight to move into first place in the National Hockey League's West Division.

title: Marya Mannes, Critic, Views Herself
description: I may he crusty outside, but inside I'm just a bowl of jelly, Marya Mannes was saying the other day in commenting on the difference between her reputation and what she perceives as her reality.

title: DR. JACOB PRIMAN
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 23  Dr. Jacob Priman, professor emeritus of anatomy at the University of Pittsburgh school of medicine, died yesterday in PresbyterianUniversity Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: Congress's Adviser on Tax Law Laurence Neal. Woodworth
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Several years ago, a brand new member of the staff of the Joint Committee on Internal Revenue Taxation sat listening to testimony at a Congressional hearing. The new staff man agreed with what the witness was saying and, unconsciously, began nodding?his head in affirmation. Suddenly he felt in his ribs what he later described as the sharpest elbowjab ever administered. Along with the jab, he received a whispered order from his new boss: Stop nodding. You work for the joint committee now.

title: SENATE, BY 81.44, VOTES 500 MILLION FOR ISRAELI ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Senate voted overwhelmingly today in favor of provid1 ing $500million in military credits for Israel, earmarking half the sum to cover the purchase of F4 Phantom jet fighters.

title: Connally and Ossola Discuss Rome Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Rinaldo Ossola, deputy governor of the Bank of Italy and chairman of the deputies of the Group of 10 finance ministers, conferred today with Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally.

title: Chicago Lawyer Will Get Key Tax Post in Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A Chicago lawyer who was one of the main authors of the new Illinois income tax law will be named soon as Deputy Assistant Secretary of theTreasury for Tax Policy  a key policymaking post.

title: Major Provisions of Tax Bill, With Details on the Differences in Two Versions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Foitowtng is a summary of the major provisions of the tax bin with details on the differences between the House and Senate versions. These differences will be resolved in a SenateHouse conference coinmittee.

title: McGovern Raises $500,000
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPDSenator George McGovern of South Dakota reported today that his initial plea for contributions to his Presidential campaign had raised more than half a million dollars.

title: Cavaliers Repulse Bullets
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 23 (UPI) The Cleveland Cavaliers, paced by John Johnson's 25 points and Austin Carr's 22, withstood a Baltimore rally in the final four minutes and gained a 104102 victory over the Bullets tonight. It, was Cleveland's second straight triumph over Baltimore.

title: Advertising:
description: John E. O'Toole, president of Foote, Cone & Belding, reports that he hasn't received a single negative letter as result of his recent talk in which he called on the nation's TV industry to put fiveminute minimum on paid political campaign messages.

title: BIGBUSINESS FARMS LINKED TO SECRECY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A Senate panel was told today that corporate secrecy was help ing big business gain increasing control of farming.

title: Namath Starts Mental Preparation for Jet Return
description: For the first time since he was injured Aug. 7, Joe Namath began the countdown to a football game yesterday as the New York Jets prepared for the arrival of the San Francisco 49ers.

title: UNION CHIEFS SEE NEW MEANY ROLE
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Nov. 23Delegates to the justcompleted labor convention scattered across the country today, convinced that their president, George Meany, has emerged in recent weeks as the most energetic, effective political opponent to the Republican Administration of President Nixon.

title: RAILROADS'NET GAINS FROM 1970 LEVEL
description: Operating income of American railroads for the 12 months to Sept. 30 amounted to 2.53 per cent of investment in property used in transporation service, the Association of American Railroads reported yesterday. In the 12 months to Sept. 30, 1970, the rate of return was 1,75 per cent.

title: MEETING POSTPONED ON TELEPROMPTER
description: A Federal court judge yesterday ordered a further delay in the postponed annual meeting of the Teleprompter Corporation, the nation's largest cable. television operator, which is faced with a proxy battle led by Jack Kent Cooke, a California sports promoter.

title: Kinney Services, Inc.
description: Kinney Services, Inc., engaged in entertainment, publishing and distributing busi nesses, has record earnings in the fiscal year ended Sept. 30, the report disclosed yesterday. Net income totaled $41,133,000, equal to $2.19 a common share, including extraordinary gains of $800,000, or 4 cents share.

title: Colonel Denies He Knew of Excessive Mylai Killing
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 23 Col. Oran K. Henderson took the witness stand in his own defense today and told a military jury that at no time in his inquiry into the Mylai 4 assault had he known that there had been excessive killing of civilians by American troops.

title: Credit Market: A Utility Paces Corporate Sales
description: The corporate bond market perked up yesterday as investors enthusiastically purchased a new issue of doubleA utility bonds priced to yield 7.54 per cent, the same. return they shunned on Monday for a comparable new offering.

title: Coast Guard Vehicle Sinks
description: CHEBOYGAN, Mich., Nov. 23 (AP)  All seven crewmen aboard the Coast Guard's experimental Air Cushion Vehicle were rescued today when the craft sank in the Straits of Mackinac about two miles northwest of Cheboygan. A Coast Guard public information officer said a large wave apparently knocked out the electrical system.

title: City Outlines $149Million Plan to Fight Drug Abuse
description: The city's Addiction Services Agency disclosed a $149million oneyear plan yesterday for programs to combat drug abuse.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Ford Motor Company's North American Automotive operations announced that William L. Weber was named general manager of the newly formed division and John A. Manooglan was named general manager of the not transmission division.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How naive can editorials in The Times be? In Morality and Price Controls (Nov. 8) you Justify wage and price controls as a way to restrain and guide monopolistic and collusive wage and price setting.

title: E. WIGHT BAKKE, YALE ECONOMIST
description: WOODBRIDGE, Conn., Nov. 23 (AP)E. ,Wight Bakke, an conomics professor at Yale University who was prominent in labormanagement relations, died yesterday at his home. He was 68 years old.

title: Campaign Fund Plan Is Called a Help to Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Senate passage last night of the Democratic plan for Federal financing of the 1972 Presidential campaign has injected powerful new issue into the election drive.

title: A Lighter Ussery Guides Autobiography to Victory at Aqueduct
description: Just before the start of yesterday's featured race at Aqueduct, Bobby Ussery's weight was announced at 115 pounds. It was the lightest the seasoned jockey had been since riding at 114 pounds in Florida last winter.

title: RED PARTIES CONFER IN ROME ON MARKET
description: ROME, Nov. 23An international Communist conference opened today for the declared purpose of reappraising the European Economic Community, or Common Market, and seeking ways to influence its further development.

title: It Takes Money to Run a U.N.
description: The crisis of our loyalty to the United Nations is still ahead of us. These prophetic words were spoken by the late Adlai Stevenson in 1962. There has never been a shortage of Cassandras predicting that the United Nations would end with a bang. There now exists a real danger that it may end in a whimper. A very vocal group of Senators and Congressmen are determined to reduce American contributions to an already virtually insolvent United Nations.

title: Castro Back in Santiago
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 23 (AP)Fidel Castro returned today to this capital city after a tour of nearly two weeks through the provinces, and scheduled an audience with Raul Cardinal Silva Henrfquez.

title: Saigon Millionaires: A Handful, but They Are Powerful
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 23  They make barbed wire and wash G.1. fatigues. They raise fighting cocks and sit on tigerskin rugs. They own banks and hold high Government office. They are South Vietnam's most powerful and persuasive minority  its two dozen or so millionaires.

title: Reports to U.S. Tell Of Border Crossing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23United States officials said today that information available to the highest levels of the Government indicated that Indian regular forces had crossed into East Pakistan and were either spearheading or closely collaborating with Bengali guerrillas in fighting the Pakistani Army there.

title: RIVERA, WABCTV GET BROADCAST AWARD
description: Winners of the third annual Alfred I. duPontColumbia University awards in broadcast journalism were announced yesterday, and they Included one local citation.

title: $28.1Billion Deficit Seen By Congressional Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI) The Federal Government will run up a deficit of $28.1billion this fiscal year, the fourthlargest in history, a Congressional committee estimated today.

title: 76ers Lose 6th Straight
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 23 (UPI)Dennis Layton, a rookie, scared a career high of 27 points tonight to lead the Phoenix Suns past the Philadelphia 76trs, 128107. Layton also was credited with seven assists in his first starting assignment.

title: Colonial Cup Barn Locked After Bookmakers Depart
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Nov. 23 (UPI)  J.P. Strom, chief of the State Law Enforcement Division, said today he would send agents to future horse races in Camden to enforce the state's gambling regulations.

title: Books of The Times
description: Jim Harrison is a poetthe author of three collections of verse, Plain Song, Locations, and Outlyer"and his first novel, Wolf: A False Memoir, is a poet's novel. Let it be clear at once that this does not mean it will prove inaccessible to readers who look for the meaning of novels in their action; it is only that in this case the action is as simple as a clothesline a young drifter named Swanson spends a week camping in the Upper Peninsula of Michiganand the meaning lies in the past incidents and the present observations that are pinned to the line like so many scrubbed rags hung out to dry in the fresh light of memory. I'm not certain what precisely it all adds up to; it probably doesn't matter. I can only say that the effect of the whole is touching and slightly fear

title: INSKO PROSPERS ON ICY WEATHER
description: YONKERS, Nov. 23  A 26degree cold snap and a 10mileanhour wind had no apparent effect on about 100 pacers and trotters training on the main track at Yonkers Raceway early this morning.

title: West Point Hardly the Place for Navy Man This Week
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 23 Lieut. Comdr. David Yonkers, a 32yearold naval career officer, is having problems at the Military Academy, where he is on a year's assignment as exchange officer from the Naval Academy.

title: Antitrust Chief Rules Out Investigation of Big Board
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)The Nixon Administration's antitrust chief today rejected a proposal that the Justice Department investigate the New York Stock Exchange; pointing out that the Securities and Exchange Commission is studying the whole securities industry.

title: MAYOR IS ACCUSED IN HOUSING DELAY
description: A group of citizens pushing for a housing development in the Riverdale section of the Bronx sent a telegram to Mayor Lindsay yesterday, charging that his administration was not willing to do for them what it had done for Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Britain Raises Public Spending to Cut Unemployment
description: LONDON, Nov. 23Responding to fierce political charges of economic bungling, the British Government announced today an accelerated program of public spending to alleviate high unemployment.

title: Forest Hills Plan May Be Reduced
description: Top city officials have discussed the possibility of scaling down the lowincome housing project scheduled to be built in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: The Kent State Trial
description: The trial by the State of Ohio of 25 defendants, most of them students, for offenses allegedly committed during the 1970 disorders at Kent State University faces some hard questions about evenhanded justice. The indictments are based on a special grand jury report which a Federal judge has since found of such questionable objectivity that he ordered it destroyed. Meanwhile, Attorney General Mitchell has decided against Federal prosecution of any National Guard men for what he himself has called an unnecessary, unwarranted and inexcusable resort to gunfire that killed four students.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD REJECTS HOUSING FOR LINDENWOOD
description: The Board of Estimate rejected a zoning change yesterday that would have permitted the construction of a lowincome housing project in the largely white middleclass sec tion of Lindenwood, Queens.

title: Israelis Weigh Threats
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 23 Foreign Minister Abba Eban tried to calm an anxious Parliament today as many politicians and ordinary Israelis began to believe that the President of Egypt might turn his threats of war into reality.

title: The Fishing War Resumes
description: Seizure by Ecuador of sixteen American tuna boats so far this month signals the early resumption and possible escalation of an annual fishing war off the South American coast that the United States appears to be losing.

title: International Nickel Cuts Copper Prices
description: Copperprice cuts went into a third round yesterday as the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., said that it planned to reduce the price of copper sold in Canada by 2.5 cents a pound to 50.25 cents, effective immediately. The company does not sell copper in the United States market.

title: Effect of TV on Moviegoing Is Examined
description: Graphic evidence of the effect of television's growth on motion picture attendance has been made available by the Motion Picture Association of America.

title: CITY OFFERS PUN TO HELP ELDERLY
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city would submit to the state and Federal governments a $28million program to increase services to the elderly.

title: Strike Cats Off Milk In New York Area
description: Milk distribution was halted in New York City, Long Island and Westchester County yesterday as more than 3,600 plant and delivery workers walked off their jobs at 13 dairy plants.

title: NoRaise Pact Splits Frigidaire Union
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 23They shouldn't have let the old guys vote, shouted the husky blond worker in the hallway of his union headquarters.

title: Walt Disney Productions
description: BURBANK, Calif., Nov. 23 (UPI)  Walt Disney Productions today reported a 22 per cent rise in profits for fiscal 1971 on a five per cent rise in gross revenues.

title: PARISH TEACHERS REMAIN ON STRIKE
description: The Catholic lay teachers union and the Archdiocese of New York made conflicting statements yesterday on the success of the teachers strike as a state mediator initiated discussions in an attempt to resume bargaining.

title: Pentagon Rights Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) The Pentagon announced today the appointment of Army Capt. Curtis R. Smothers as the military director of equal opportunity. Captain Smothers, a 28yearold black legal officer, succeeds L. Howard Bennett who has resigned.

title: Saigon Plans Troop Airlift To Chup Plantation Today
description: KREK, Cambodia, Nov. 23South Vietnamese field commanders said today that several thousand paratroops would be lifted by helicopter tomorrow from this advance headquarters to attack longestablished North Vietnamese troop concentrations and supply depots in the Chup rubber plantation.

title: Governor and 11 County Heads Urge U. S. to Assume Relief Costs
description: Governor Rockefeller and the Executives of 11 of the state's biggest counties urged Congress yesterday to grant them relief from their recurring fiscal crises by providing for full Federal assumption of the costs of welfare.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities, The President had a morning meeting with the Senate Republican leader, Hugh Scott, and the Senate Republican whip, Robert F. Griffin. Later in the day the President had separate meetings with Treasury Secretary John B. Connally and Interior Secretary Rogers C. B, Morton. The President sent a letter to Senator John C. Stennis, chairman of the Armed Services Committee, urging Senate rejection of a troop cut in Europe. The President also submitted to Congress the first annual report on implementation of the Federal Coal Mine Health and Safety Act of 1969. The President drove out to the Washington Redskins football field at Dulles International Airport to watch the team practice.

title: Church's Dollar Drain
description: What some people don't realize when they talk about the financial crisis in Catholic education is that it is the same financial crisis as exists in public education, Msgr. Joseph T. O'Keefe, secretary of education for the Archdiocese of New York, said in an interview this week. Less than an hour later, the chancery on Madison Avenue, seat of the archdiocese, was being picketed by almost 300 Catholic lay teachers demanding higher salaries.

title: 2 UTAH DEMOCRATS TO SUPPORT MUSKIE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) Utah's two top Democrats, Gov. Calvin L. Rampton and Senator Frank E. Moss, endorsed Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine for President today, saying he had the best chance of leading the Democratic party to victory in the 1972 election.

title: Gimbel Brothers
description: Gimbel Brothers, Inc., had record sales in the three and nine months ended Oct. 31, but earnings continued to lag behind those of last year's periods, according to yesterday's report.

title: S.I. Nan Kidnapped And Tortured by 4; 3 Suspects Seized
description: A Staten Island man was kidnapped and tortured yesterday, the police said, by four members of an organizedcrime syndicate looking for a hijacked shipment of smuggled cigarettes.

title: Navy Musters Out Its Ropemakers, of Poetic Fame
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23For 134 years, the ropemakers of the Boston Naval Shipyard have spun a web of hemp, manila, cotton and nylon that held the United States Navy together.

title: JEWS CALL RARICK A COSTLY RACIST
description: GROSSINGERS, N. Y., Nov. 23  The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith charged today that Representative John R. Rarick, Democrat of Louisiana, had cost American taxpayers tens of thousands of dollars through repeated insertions of blatant white racism and a stark brand of antiSemitism in The Congressional Record.

title: Schapiro Gives Views
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Morris A. Schapiro, president of the brokerage firm bearing his name, today urged the S.E.C. to end fixed minimum commissions and establish free and competitive markets.

title: SUFFOLK REJECTS. AIRPORT GROWTH
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Nov. 23 The Suffolk County Legislature today reaffirmed a resolution to prevent the expansion of the Suffolk County airport into a jetport or terminal for major airlines.

title: Deceit Charge Halts Sale of Cadman Towers Coops
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz ordered a halt in sales of apartments in a cityaided MitchellLama project in Brooklyn Heights yesterday,, pending an investigation of complaints by purchasers that they had been deceived.

title: Three Former Rangers Here With Blues Tonight
description: The Rangers begin the second quarter of their National Hockey League campaign tonight against the St. Louis Blues, who have at least three reasons for attempting an upset  Jack Egers, Andre Dupont and Mike Murphy.

title: Knicks Win 4th in Row, Beating Royals, 125110
description: The New York Knicks, apparently, struggling only a couple of weeks ago, rolled over the Cincinnati Royals, 125110, at Madison Square Garden last night for their fourth straight victory.

title: Nixon to Ask Federal Purchase of Big Cypress Swamp in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 President Nixon announced today that he would soon send to Congress a bill authorizing Federal acquisition of 547,000 acres in the Big Cypress Swamp in southern Florida that are now privately owned.

title: Murtaugh Steps Down As Manager of Pirates
