description: Jews and Puerto Ricans, blacks and whites, children, teenagers and old people, all got together earlier this week to participate in a Thanksgiving dinner at the Henry Street Settlement. The preholiday event (it took place on Tuesday) was designed to bring together some of the disparate ethnic, religious and racial groups who are served by the settlement house and who live in sometimes uneasy proximity on the Lower East Side.

title: U.S. SAID TO WEIGH APPEAL TO YAHYA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 President Nixon was reported today to be contemplating a personal appeal to President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan of Pakistan to release Sheik Mujibur Rahman from prison and to seek by personal negotiations a peaceful solution to the crisis in East Pakistan.

title: Thanksgiving, the Reality
description: Thanksgiving is one of the few national holidays that still have a genuine air about them. It is also the oldest American festival. Not counting the Virginia declaration of 1619 (see OpEd), this is the 350th anniversary of the traditional feast day that began at Plymouth in 1621, attended by a handful of exhausted Pilgrims who had survived a year in the wilderness and by some ninety Wampanaag Indians who had helped them survive.

title: Nicklaus, Trevino Top Golf Field
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 24  On this island off the South Carolina coast, bordered by the Atlantic Ocean, Jack Nicklaus will begin a twoweek bid to replace Lee Trevino as professional golf's top moneywinner of the year.

title: Toby Armour Lends Choreographer Skill To Cubiculo Dances
description: Toby Armour's regular yearly visits from Boston assure us of her continued special performing skill. Her company's concert at the Cubiculo Tuesday evening reinforces the opinion that there are few dancers who can choreograph pieces for themselves that move so unhurriedly and yet purposefully at their own deliberate pace.

title: Moran Shoots 66 to Lead Sea Pines Golf by 2 Shots
Bridge: Easterners Lead in Semifinals Of Blue Ribbon Pair Title Play.
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 24An East Coast pair clung to the lead they had established last night in the blue ribbon pair championship of the American contract bridge league's fall Nationals. Robert Lipsitz of Alexandria, Va., and Marvin Rosenblatt of Bristol, Conn., totaled 435 points at the end of the first semifinal session.

title: REED, AS STARTER, IS HELPING GIANTS
description: While almost everybody else will be enjoying a turkey dinner today, Henry Reed, the Giants rookie defensive end, will be having ham.

title: AllAmerican Musicians Tune Up Here
description: The bright tunes of George M. Cohan and the stirring marches of John Philip Sousa reverberated through the Lower Plaza at Rockefeller Center yesterday as 101 highschool musicians played for a lunchtime audience.

title: Gandhi's Heirs
description: War is wrong, an unmitigated evil, the late Mahatma Gandhi once said. No cause, however just, can warrant the indiscriminate slaughter that is going on....

title: MANSFIELD WARNS ON A TAX BILL VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Mike Mansfield, the Senate Democratic leader, said today that Congress might refuse to pass a new tax bill if President Nixon vetoed the cur rent one because of its rider providing for taxpayer support of Presidential candidates.

title: NUCLEAR PLANTS TO BE COMPLETED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24The Atomic Energy Commission announced rulings today allowing construction work to continue at four nuclear power plants while surveys of the probable environmental effects are being completed.

title: Yorkville's Housing Turnabout
description: The light was fading behind the brocade curtains in the Board of Estimate chamber Tuesday evening when the old woman made her way to the rostrum to speak on the Ruppert Brewery project.

title: Smith, Richey and Froehling Win at Net
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 24 (AP)Stan Smith of the United States advanced to the second round of the South American open tennis tournament today by defeating Ricardo Aubone of Argentina, 62, 60, 61.

title: Patrick McDonald of A.P. Dies; Planned Newsphoto Coverage
description: Patrick J. McDonald, a newsphoto executive of The Associated Press, who planned the pictorial coverage of many of the. nation's biggest political, scientific and sports events, died Tuesday evening of heart attack at his home. He was 54 years old and lived at 9005 188th Street, Hollis, Queens.

title: Ford Sponsors $500Million Development for Detroit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 24  Henry Ford 2d unveiled a plan today to build a $500million complex of buildings aimed at revitalizing downtown Detroit.

title: KNICKS WIN, 11494, THEIR 5TH IN ROW Bullets Bow as Fans Boo Monroe in First Game in Baltimore as Opponent
EXTENSION OF STRIKE PUT OFF IN GERMANY
description: BONN, Nov. 24In the face of an industrywide lockout that will close metalworking plants in the southwestern industrial belt of West Germany tomorrow night, the metalworkers union decided today to delay extension of its strike.

title: JETS GIVE SNELL REST OF 1971 OFF
description: Matt Snell, the valuable Jet running back who suffered two severe injuries within 11 months, is finished for the present and a question mark for the future.

title: 1,000 ATTEND RITES FOR JOSEPH WILSON
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 24 (AP)More than 1,000 persons attended the funeral today of Joseph C. Wilson, board chairman of the Xerox Corporation, who died Monday in Governor Rockefeller's apartment after suffering a heart attack.

title: T. Montgomery Gregory Dead; Retired Educator in Jersey, 84
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24T. Montgomery Gregory, a retired New Jersey educator and former professor of English and drama at Howard University, died Sunday at Sibley Memorial Hospital. He was 84 years old.

title: UNIONISTS IN CLASH WITH BRITISH POLICE
description: LONDON, Nov. 24Fist fights and window smashing erupted tonight outside Parliament as hundreds of angry trade unionists clashed with the police.

title: Rites for Robert B. Schwartz, Oil Executive, Are Held on L.I.
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., Nov. 24 A funeral service was held here yesterday for Robert B. Schwartz, a retired oil executive and philanthropist, who died Sunday at his home in Hewlett Bay Park. His age was 73.

title: Ohio Rests Case for First of 25 Indicted in Kent State Disorders
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Nov. 24After calling only five witnesses, the state suddenly rested its case today against the first of 25 persons indicted in the 1970 campus disorders that resulted in the killing of four Kent State University students by the Ohio National Guard.

title: Notes on People
description: Mayor Lindsay celebrated his 50th birthday yesterday, shaking hands with the policemen who guard his office, at an afterwork party with staff members, at an offtherecord meeting with City Hall reporters and at a familyonly dinner at Gracie Mansion.

title: Books of The Times
description: I've read and enjoyed a number of Mr. Stewart's suspense novelspublished under the pseudonym of Michael Innesbut never found them suspenseful. Though they had many other virtueserudite irony, fine sense of place, richly idiosyncratic characters, acute observationthey were almost static enough to mock their genre. The temptation was not to turn the page, but to linger over its unhurried felicities. In one of them whose title I forget something about a horse, I believe  the reader is treated to a couple of pages of outrageously funny doubletalk, culled from God knows what arcane argot of English antiquity or regional usage. Now, having just discovered that Mr. Stewart writes serious novels under his own name, I hastened to read Avery's Mission and found what I suppose I should have expected from this accomplished ironist: that this serious novel seethes with suspense. It was all I could do to keep from skipping to the end to satisfy my curiosity.

title: NIXON IS HOPEFUL ON MONEY TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that President Nixon expects definite progress to be made at the meeting in Rome next week of the Group of 10 leading industrial nations, which will be tackling the problem of world monetary uncertainty.

title: Students and Police Clash at Campuses In Rome and Milan
description: ROME, Nov. 24Students and the police clashed violently here and in Milan and about half of Italy's highschool teachers stayed away from classes today, further disrupting a strained education system.

title: Phase 2 Described As Lacking Appeal To Equity Market
description: Phase Two of President Nixon's new economic program has not yet offered the ingredients essential to a good environment for the equity market, Henry Kaufman, partner and econo mist of Salomon Brothers, said yesterday.

title: Man With Narcotics Record is Slain on 43d Street
description: A 30yearold man who had a record of narcotics arrests was fatally stabbed early yesterday on the sidewalk outside the Strand Hotel at 206 West 43d Street.

title: Background of the Conflict on the Indian Subcontinent
description: Historical: For centuries, the Indian subcontinent has been torn by bloody clashes between Moslems and Hindus. When independence was granted from Britain in 1947, the Moslem League headed by Mohammed Ali Jinnah won demand for a separate state to give Moslems protection from predominantly Hindu. India. Because the Moslems were concentrated in two distinct regionS, Pakistan was created in two parts, East and West, separated by 1,000 miles of Indian territory.

title: FigureSkating Stars Join Champions on Ice
description: John Misha Petkevich, the American amateur champion, and Mrs. Sonya Klopfer Dunfield, the 1946 world profes sional titleholder, were among the figureskating stars who took part in a tuneful dress rehearsal at Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: Mrs. Duff Married To Prof. John Ely
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 24 Mrs. Nancy Halliday Duff of La Jolla, Calif a former Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of California, was married here this afternoon to John Hart Ely of New Haven, professor at the Yale Law School. The Rev. William Sloane Coffin Jr., a Presbyterian minister and Yale University chaplain, performed the ceremony in the chapel of Yale's Branford College.

title: Leaders of Arab Armies Told Only Course Is War
description: CAIRO, Nov. 24Maj. Gen. Saad Hussein alShazli, Egypt's specialist in commando And airborne warfare, declared to the chiefs of staff of 11 other Arab countries at a fourhour meeting here today that all efforts for a peaceful settlement with Israel had failed.

title: SENATE BACKS CURB ON OCEAN DUMPING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Warned by a Commerce Committee report that the world can no longer consider the oceans the universal sewer of mankind, the Senate voted 73 to 0 today to curb the dumping of waste materials in waters beyond the territorial jurisdiction of the United States.

title: APARTMENTS GIVE EMPLOYES RAISES
description: Owners of 2,000 Bronx apartment buildings agreed yesterday to give their service employes a $12aweek increase, thereby averting a strike.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As the floor manager of the constitutional amendment to provide equal rights for men and women, which was recently passed by the House, I feel a special responsibility to express my disagreement with the editorial that appeared in The Times last month on the day that the House began its debate on the proposal.

title: 6 Guards Hurt in Outbreak At State Prison in Rahway
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Nov. 24 (AP) Six guards were injured, none seriously, in a disturbance tonight at Rahway State Prison.

title: Mediator Reports Significant Progress in Contract Negotiations Between Two Firemen Unions and the City
description: Significant progress was reported yesterday in the contract negotiations between the city and its firemen.

title: Priesthood Document Due
description: ROME, Nov. 24Pope Paul VI announced in his weekly general audience today that the Vatican would soon issue document on the priesthood.

title: A Shabby Bellevue Remains Glittering Seat of Learning
description: Despite chronic underfinancing, peeling paint, brokendown elevators and shortages of nurses and nonprofessionals, there continues at Bellevue the unmistakable air of intellectual excitement that has traditionally marked it as a great teaching hospital.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon announced that he will confer with French President Pompidou in the Azores Dec. 1314. He ordered a board of inquiry to reexamine the Atlantic and Gulf Coast dock strikes and report to him tomorrow, the initial step in the likely request for an 80day injunction under the TaftHartley Act. He met with Mayorelect Peter B. Wilson of San Diego. He met with Treasury Secretary John B. Connally, John D. Ehrlichman, his domestic affairs aide, and the Office of Management and Budget Director, George Shultz. He conferred with the Federal Reserve Board chairman, Arthur F. Burns, and Mr. Connally. He also met with Secretary of State William P. Rogers. In the evening he left for San Clemente, Calif.

title: White House Says President Won't Withdraw Nomination of Butz
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 President Nixon has no intention of withdrawing the nomination of Dr. Earl L. Butz to be Secretary of Agriculture, the White House press secretary said today.

title: IN THE NATION
description: NANTUCKET, Nov. 24Here in the country of the early settlers is a good place to think about Thanksgiving Day. In fact, many a holidaygoer headed for Cape Cod or the islands pass through Plymouth, where they originated the custom.

title: Poseidon Missile Launched
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla. Nov. 24 (AP)The nuclear submarine Sam Rayburn successfully launched a multiwarhead Poseidon missile today while cruising submerged in the Atlantic Ocean 30 miles off Cape Kennedy. The missile burst to the surface, ignited and streaked toward the se atoD toward a target 2,000 miles today.

title: Politics and Scholarship
description: In 1839 Lord Macaulay reviewed Gladstone's The State in Its Relations With the Church. In that book, Gladstone, then still a Tory, contended that Government should propagate religious truth. Macaulay's review argued for the liberal position that Government ought to be neutral on religious questions because it was illsuited to decide them. Churches and other institutions could much better promote society's spiritual interests, and Government would do well to respect that division of labor.

title: Insurer to Be Liquidated
description: The New York State Insurance Department said yesterday it had been granted a court order permitting it to liquidate the Knickerbocker Insurance Company, based at 116 John Street. The Insurance Department said the company was insolvent by a margin of $1,458,286 on Oct. 30, 1970. Efforts to rehabilitate the concern had been Unsuccessful, the court petition said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the advent of the 1972 Presidential election, it would be gratifying if someone would take the initiative to reform the Electoral College system of Presidential selection. Many substitutes have been postulated in the past; however, none have reached fruition. Presidents since Woodrow Wilson have spoken of reform, yet it must be difficult and unrewarding to change system that has served your purposes.

title: Hijacker Collects Ransom of $200,000; Parachutes From Jet and Disappears
description: RENO, Nov. 25Authorities in four Western states were searching a 500mile corridor of mountains and river valleys tonight for a hijacker who parachuted from a jet airliner with $200,000 in ransom money.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: If you can afford to spend $100 for your waterfowling friend or spouse, Classic Shorebird Decoys would make a splendid Christmas gift.

title: Freund Urges Congress To Define Bill of Rights
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.In an extensive review of the Supreme Court, Prof. Paul A. Freund of the Harvard Law School has urged Congress to help define the guarantees of the Bill of Rights.

title: Storms Kill 90 Javanese
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 25 (UPI)At least 90 fishermen were killed in tropical storms off the Udjung Kulon game reserve in West Java late last month, according to reports published here today.

title: Jackson State Wins, 3529
description: JACKSON, Miss. Nov. 25, (AP)  Sylvester Collins tossed four touchdown passes today to pace Jackson State College to a 3529 victory over Alcorn A. and M. in a Southwestern Athletic Conference game.

title: Markets in U.S. Closed
description: All United States securities and commodities markets were closed yesterday in observance of Thanksgiving Day, Canadian and overseas markets were open as usual.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25The connection between sports and politics in America is getting to be frontpage news these days. President Nixon was out at the Washington Redskins football practice the other day, and the Governors of Oklahoma and Nebraska were leading the cheers at the big Thanksgiving Day game in Norman, Okla., between the first two college teams in the country.

title: One Hurt as Blast Rocks A du Pont Plant in Linden
description: LINDEN, N. J., Nov. 25An explosion rocked a processing plant of the E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co tonight, seriously injuring one employe and shaking houses and buildings for miles around.

title: Famine Seen Averted For East Pakistanis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)What once loomed as possible widespread famine in East Pakistan has been averted, at least for the time being, thanks to a good harvest and to emergency international aid.

title: Oil Companies Agree to Pay Beach Owners for Oil Slick
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25 (AP) Four major oil companies have agreed to pay $4.5million to property owners whose beaches were fouled by oil from the oil platform blowout off Santa Barbara in January, 1969.

title: Kennedy Center Asks Added Federal Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)Because no funds have been forthcoming from private sources, the John F.

title: Radioactive Rain in Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 (UPI)Radioactive rain has fallen in western and southern Japan since the latest nuclear test in China, Japanese health officers said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: An observer and writer about the dance for decades and author of The Dance Has Many Faces, Walter Sorell offers what he feels is his last word about the art form he loves best. My last will for the dancer, my testament for the dance, he calls it. It's a freeform exercise. It is composed of memoirs and profiles (sketches of Isadora Duncan, Pavlova, Ruth St. Denis, Mary Wigman and others), discussions of such tangential matters as titles, program notes, workshops, a few words on painters, not necessarily scenic designers, fascinated by dancers, and comments on the interaction of dance and literature in the last three centuries. Half the book is given over to those who have written about and sometimes participated as makers in the dance in England, France and Germany.

title: CAMBODIA ACTION IS LIGHT THUS FAR
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 25 (AP)  Thousands of South Vietnamese troops maneuvered in eastern Cambodia without opposition today, with action in their fourday drive limited to strikes by B52's and a few small raids by reconnaissance elements of company strength.

title: Lakers Post No. 12
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 25 (AP)Jerry West's scoring and Wilt Chamberlain's defensive work paced the Los Angeles Lakers to their 12th straight victory tonight, a 139115 decision over the Seattle SuperSonics that set a Laker record.

title: Aquitaine Executive Resigns
description: The Aquitaine Company of Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday that Ronald. J. White had resigned as, senior vice, president of the company to become president of Pembina Pipe Line, Ltd.

title: Broadway Season: The Show Goes On
description: Theater people are traditionally pessimistic optimists that is if they are not optimistic pessimists. It is said that a man once walked past Sardi's with a banner saying: The end of the world is coming. A producer and his preSs agent were emerging from the restaurant, and the producer said: The way things are now, even that would close in Philadelphia. Don't worry, replied his companion,."I was in Philadelphia last week and I think it did.

title: Soviet Will Expand Its Pipeline For Feeding Natural Gas Grid
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25  The Soviet Union announced today an ambitious program of expansion of its natural gas industry that may ultimately have a significant impact on the growth of SovietAmerican trade.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nancy Edgar Bride Of George T. Smith
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 25Miss Nancy Jarvis Edgar, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. C. Soutter Edgar, was married here this noon to George Thomas Smith, son of Mrs. George A. Smith and the late Mr. Smith. The Rev. Harold Bassage performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: British Steel Shows Loss
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)Britain's stateowned steel industry announced today losses totaling $52million. The losses were for the six months to Oct. 2 and compared with profits of $30million in the first half of 1970. The British Steel Corporation blamed a drop in home demand, strikes, increases in wage and fuel bills and government price controls.

title: Clarkson anti St LawrenceAdvance in Hockey Tourney
description: CANTON, N. Y., Nov. 25Clarkson, led by Jerry Kemp with three goals and two assists, defeated Colgate, 93, in the first game of the North Country Thanksgiving hockey festival tonight.

title: MRS. HERBERT FRIEDMAN
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 25 Mrs. Elsie Seidenberg Friedman, former volunteer social worker with Lillian D. Wald at the Henry Street Settlement in New York and later with Jane Adams in Hull House here, died yesterday at the age of 92. She was the widow of Herbert Friedman, a lawyer.

title: Thanksgiving, 1971: A Day of Contrasts for Americans
description: Donald Duck couldn't come. Neither could Snoopy. Or Linus the Lionhearted. Or even Smokey the Bear.

title: Some Indians Expecting Yahya Will React, by Declaring War
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 25There were few clear elements today in the murky situation surrounding the crisis on the Indian subcontinent, where a major Indiansupported offensive by Bengali insurgents against the Pakistani Army has been under way in East Pakistan since last weekend.

title: Barnard Feminism Turns More Active
description: Feminism is hardly new to Barnard College, which was home to more than a few suffragettes way back when. But in recent years undergraduates, alumnae and members of the faculty have undergone considerable soulsearching about the woman's place in the world in general and the academic community in particular.

title: Advertising:
description: The advertising committee of the Florida Citrus Commission has released the list of agency finalists who will pitch for the $8million to $9million orange account on Dec. 6 and 7. They are all big boys.

title: Lawyer Here Was Acquitted In Union Pension Fund Case
description: Some editions of Wednesday's New York Times carried a United Press International dispatch from Chicago on the sentencing of Joseph DePaola, former president of the Journeyman Barbers Union, to a year in Federal prison. DePaola pleaded guilty last month to accepting about $65,000 in kickbacks for approving loans from the union's pension fund.

title: Wallace K. Graves, Official Of International Paper Co.
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 25Wallace K. Graves, a vice president of the International Paper Company from 1960 until his retirement in 1965, died today in Lakeville. He was 71 years old and lived at 19 Stephen Mather Road.

title: Volpe Wins Italian Award
description: ROME, Nov. 25 (UPI)Italy's Center for the Development of Air Transport said yesterday that it had awarded its annual Leonardo da Vinci Prize for 1971 to John a Volpe, the United States Secretary of Transportation. The prize and some lesser awards will be given to the winners of their representatives in a ceremony at the Rome City Hall Dec. 3.

title: Getting Mr. Big
description: Continuing the reorganization of New York City's Police Department, Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced the other day the formation of a new unit fight organized crime. This new unit combines the separate units already trying to enforce gambling and narcotics laws; it will also mount a major effort against the increasing number of thefts at the city's airports and on its docks as well as the spreading hijacking of goods transitall believed the work of organized crime.

title: Meany Hospitalized for Chest Pain
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25George Meany, the 77yearold president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, was taken to a hospital here with chest pains early this morning after his return from a labor convention in Miami.

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS OFF BY 40,000 UNITS
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25 (AP) Domestic auto production fell by 40,000 units this week as the industry closed its plants for the Thanksgiving holiday.

title: Yahya Renews Warning
description: TAXILA, Pakistan, Nov. 25 President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan inaugurated a Chinesebuilt heavymachinery plant here today with a renewed warning of the danger of full war between Pakistan and India.

title: 76ers Win on Layup
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 25 (AP)Fred Foster's driving layup with three seconds to play gave the Philadelphia 76ers 112111 victory over the Golden State Warriors tonight.

title: FREDERICK E. GORMAN
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 25 (AP)Frederick Eric Gorman, an actor and former secretary Of the Abbey Theater here, died in Dublin hospital today. He was 89 years old.

title: Prison Halfway Houses Meet Rising Opposition
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25Tony Davis, serving the last two months of an armed robbery sentence in a former convent that has been converted into a halfway house here, is slowly getting his life together again.

title: 15 Debutantes Presented At Gotham Ball at Plaza
description: Fifteen Gotham Ball debutantes who had tradition down to a T yesterdayThanksgiving and turkeyattended the 22d annual ball at the Plaza's Grand Ballroom, where shortly before midnight they were presented to Terence Cardinal Cooke. The event is a yearly benefit for the New York Foundling Hospital.

title: Wilson Resists Party Pressure, Backs Conservatives on Ulster
description: LONDON, Nov. 25Harold Wilson, the former Prime Minister, under heavy pressure to end the Labor party's bipartisan policy over Northern Ireland, today strongly supported the Conservative Government's program there.

title: NAN FAIRBROTHER, FRITISH WRITER, 56
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)Nan Fairbrother, a British writer, died yesterday.

title: Island Volcano Kills Man
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, Nov. 25 (UPI)Teneguia Volcano has claimed its first life since it erupted Oct. 26, the police said today. A 37yearold fisherman died yesterday from poisonous fumes seeping from cracks in the volcano's slopes.

title: Transplant Patient Dies
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Nov. 25 (AP)Lindsay Rich, 62 years old, who underwent heart transplant operation per formed by Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard 12 days ago, died today in Groote Schuur Hospital. Mr. Rich, a former Capetown hotelier, received the heart of a British immigrant, Robert Nixon, 26, who died of injuries suffered in a car accident. He was Dr. Barnard's eighth heart transplant patient; two are still living.

title: MRS. AUDREY EMERY, DUKE DMITRI WIDOW
description: Mrs. Audrey Emery died yesterday in a West Palm Beach, Fla., hospital after a brief illness. She was 67 years old.

title: DR. JESSE STITT, VILLAGE PASTOR
description: The Rev. Dr. Jesse W. Stitt, pastor emeritus of the Village Presbyterian Church, 139 West 13th Street, and a leader in the interfaith movement, died Tuesday at his home, 35 East Ninth Street. He was 67 years old.

title: No Comment In Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) The State Department declined tonight to comment on the Al Ahram report.

title: Master Charge Volume Up Despite Cardholder Drop
description: The Interbank Card Association, which licenses Master Charge, reported yesterday that dollar volumeretail sales and cash advances involving the cardrose to $1.31billion in the third quarter, or 21.4 per cent higher than in the 1970 period.

title: Soviet Demand Reported
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 25 (AP)  The Soviet Union has delivered a note demanding that the Pakistani Government come to political terms with Bengali insurgents battling for the independence of East Pakistan, informed sources said today.

title: Laborite M.P.'s Critical
description: LONDON, Nov. 25Sir Alec DouglasHome, the Foreign Secretary, outlined the complex proposals for a settlement with Rhodesia to a crowded and attentive House of Commons today, defending the terms as fair and honorable and the only realistic alternative to outright apartheid.

title: The Housing Tangle
description: Why us? This question underlies the protests that come from Forest Bills and Lindenwoodwhite, middleclass communities Strongly opposed to the construction of lowincome housing projects in their midst.

title: 7 GET $466,000 IN UTILITY CASES
description: TRENTON, Nov. 25  The seven lawyers on a team named by Gov. William T. Cahill to represent the public interest in rateincrease applications by public utilities have shared fees totaling $466,000 over the last 18 months.

title: Chinese Concern Reported
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 25 (AP) Premier Chou Enlai of China has expressed concern over military provocation by India against Pakistan, the Yugoslav press agency, Tanyug, reported from Peking today.

title: Sadat Said to Warn Nixon
description: CAIRO, Friday, Nov. 26 (UPI) The semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram said today that President Anwar elSadat of Egypt had sent a message to President Nixon warning that any American surfacetosurface missiles sent to Israel would be a very serious escalation of the Middle East conflict and something which Cairo cannot permit.

title: Rahway Prison Has Lengthy History of Grievances
description: Only a few weeks ago the warden of the maximumsecurity facility known as the Rahway Prison Farm complained that overcrowding made it impossible to achieve the administration's proclaimed goal of rehabilitation for the 1,143 inmates.

title: Notes on People
description: Thanksgiving at the Western White House in. San Clemente, Calif., started early, and in the President's office. At 6:45 A.M. Mr. Nixon was telephoning greetings of the day to Cabinet members, Congressional leaders and Governors Reagan of California and Rockefeller of New York. Later, he sat before, two television.sets to watch.the NebraskaOklahome and Dallas CowboysLos Angeles Rams; football games. For dinner, at 6 P.M., there was turlxey sweet potatoes with marshmallows, green beans amandine and pumpkin pie. At the table were the President, Mrs. Nixon, Rose Mary Woods, the President's personal secretary, and Dr. Walter Tkach, his physician.Luigi Longo, the ailing, 71yearold leader of the Italian Communist party, went to the hill town of Genzanoknown as Little Stalingrad because of Communist strength and militancy there to marry his longtime companion, Brune Conti. The marriage at Town Hall came just a year after Italy's divorce law went into effect. Mr. Longo was recently divorced from former Senator Teresa Noce, with whom he had not lived since 1948.

title: Arkansas in Liberty Bowl
description: Texas sealed a Dec. 20 Liberty Bowl berth for Arkansas yesterday by winning the Southwest Conference title. Arkansas accepted the hid last week, but was not out of the running for a spot in the Cotton Bowl, which goes to the conference champion. Arkansas will meet Tennessee.

title: Experts Assert Vitamin E Has No Value in Treating Common Ills
description: A leading medical publication has reported that vitamin E has no established value in preventing or treating any common human disorder.

title: WESTFIELD STOPS PLAINFIELD, 126
description: Union and Westfield, two of New Jersey's best teams, completed unbeaten seasons yesterday.

title: G.I.'s Feel It's Their Last Thanksgiving in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 25American servicemen in South Vietnam celebrated Thanksgiving quietly today, with 241,000 pounds of turkey, 4,500 cans of cranberry sauce and the feeling that this would be their last Thanksgiving in Vietnam.

title: FULL INTEGRATION BY BUSING URGED
description: A busing program involving 215,000 pupils, or 27 per cent of the city's 1.1 million public school children, has been proposed for the complete racial integration of the school system.

title: 19 I.R.A. Suspects Seized
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 25 (AP)British troops kept up the pressure on the Irish Republican Army today by seizing 19 suspects in a predawn raid on Belfast's Ballymurphy district. Ballymurphy, a new housing development on Belfast's western outskirts, is stronghold of the militant provisional wing of the I.R.A.

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the. Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SPAIN SHUTS DOWN INDEPENDENT PAPER
description: MADRID, Nov. 25  The newspaper Madrid, whose relatively independent line over the last five years has earned it numerous fines and several suspensions, was closed by the Government today.

title: Canada Protests to Peking
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 25 (Canadian Press)Canada protested to China today against a Chinese nuclear test last Thursday. The protest was lodged by Canada's Ambassador in Peking, Ralph Collins, the External Affairs Department said. The protest is in keeping with Canada's opposition to nuclear tests by any country.

title: E.E.C. Proposal on Wheat
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 25  In a gesture to meet United States criticism of its allegedly protectionist common farm policy, the E.F.C. is proposing that as of next year the sixnation unit should store surplus production of wheat.

title: Turkey and Pumpkin Pie On Menu in Rome, Too
description: ROME, Nov. 25 Rocco Santangeli, who worked as a tailor in the Bronx for 40 years and who now lives with his wife on Social Security checks, is prepared to eat turkey for a week.

title: Soviet Delaying Reply to NATO on Brosio Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 State Department officials said today that the effort by the North Atlantic alliance to begin an early dialogue with the Soviet Union ?? mutual troop withdrawal in Europe had apparently run into Kremlin procrastination.

title: VERDI'S LA FORZA RETURNS TO MET
description: There is, ancient rumor has it, a plot buried somewhere in the long and confused affair known as La Forza del Destino, but the Metropolitan Opera has never exhumed it and nobody much seems to care. Possibly nobody should. If you can arrange to have the dramatically muddled work sung as magnificently as the Metropolitan did Wednesday night, when the Verdi standard returned to the repertory after a fourseason absence, La Forza makes its own kind of good sense.

title: Strengthening the War on Cancer
description: By the overwhelming vote of 350 to 5, the House Representatives has approved a bill that will increase the level of cancer research funding while retaining the National Cancer Institute as a component part the National Institutes of Health. This intelligent decision contrasts sharply with last summer's equally lopsided Senate vote to make the National Cancer Institute an autonomous body largely separated from the rest of the Government's biological research effort.

title: 1 OF 4 OVER 65 PUT AT POVERTY LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) One of every four Americans over the age of 65 lives in poverty, and the trend will accelerate, the Senate Committee on Aging said today.

title: Music: Up With the Best
description: Not too many orchestras from Eastern European countries tour the United States. On Wednesday night at Carnegie Hall the Budapest Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Gyorgy Lehel, made its first New York appearance. One standard of excellence for orchestral playing has been the visits of the fine Czech Philharmonic. How well would the Budapest group measure up alongside its neighbors from Prague?

title: CASTRO FORESEES AMITY WITH U.S.
description: SANTA CRUZ, Chile, Nov. 25 Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba predicted today an era of true friendship between the United States and Latin America, but not while President Nixon is in the White House.

title: SMITH DEFEATS MAYO AT BUENOS AIRES NET
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 25 (Reuters)Stan Smith of the United States, the favorite to win this year's Pepsi Tennis Grand Prix, reached the third round of the South American open tournament today. Smith beat Joaquin Loy() Mayo of Mexico, 61, 62, 26, 63.

title: japanese Honor Mishima A Year After His Death
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25It was peaceful under the bright autumn sun at Yukio Mishima's tomb on the western edge of Tokyo today as his admirers came quietly to pay their respects to the famous man of Japanese literature, art and culture.

title: Red Smith
description: When Terry Daniels regains consciousness on the evening of Jan. 15, he will awake to a unique distinction. He will be the only artisan skilled at needlepoint to have fought for the heavyweight championship of the world.

title: SUPPORT OF NIXON STEADY IN A POLL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25President Nixon's rating among union members families, while still largely negative, has not changed significantly since the wageprice freeze began, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Screen: 'Deathstyles':It Highlights Program in Whitney Series
description: Richard Myers's "Deathstyles," 60-minutes long, is the main attraction in the current program of the Whitney Museum's New American Filmmakers Series. But it is preceded by three very short films: John Knoop's antiwar "Five O'Clock Rush," Anne Severson's and Shelby Kennedy's nude bodies study, "Riverbody," and James Broughton's creation myth, "This Is It." Knoop's film is actively awful; "Riverbody" features too many boys and too few girls (I know I'm misreading the intention here); but Broughton, who places a 2-year-old Adam and a bright apple-red balloon in a backyard Garden of Eden, works a small miracle of the ordinary. And since that miracle is what his film is all about, he achieves a kind of casual perfection in matching means and ends."Deathstyles" is the second long Richard Myers film to play at the Whitney. Last year there was the highly ambitious "Akran" (after Akron, Ohio), bits of which show up in "Deathstyles" on the various picture screens or in the several windows and doors and other openings available to the projection of secondary images. There are a good many such imagesnot only from "Akran," but of isolated heads, faces monumentally enlarged, lunar landscapesand they significantly condition "Deathstyles." Much of the time, they almost save it from itself.In somewhat unequal proportions, "Deathstyles" deals both in bizarre events of its own making and in the current events that are in part responsible for its having been made. Thus, Richard Nixon on the subject of death, clips of the John Kennedy assassination, the killings at Kent State (where Myers teaches and where sections of the film were shot) all appear as part of the communications mix that is the film's prevailing style.Myers has made several documentaries, and even in a fiction film like "Akran" he tends to become more involved with theme than with story, succeeding in part because he manages to suggest a multiplicity of stories without ever quite actually telling them. "Deathstyles" seems much more fragmented in its intentions, more obligated to whatever passes or is placed in front of its camera, and less committed to the demands of any inner necessityto say nothing of what might have been the inner necessity of its characters.I think this is unfortunate, because Myers has a special and quite mysterious power as a fantasist, whereas his facts are about the same as anybody else'sexcept when he hokes them up by means of a superb technical facility that has been widely praised but that may be the demon he most needs to control. His movies look wonderful (not pretty) and with electronic backgrounds provided by Fred Coulter they sound wonderful, too. But I don't think that they are about much as yetand that is why they begin so insistently in autobiography and close so predictably with the end of the world.

title: ... Even if You Have to Do the Cooking
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe:

title: African Leaders Conclude Their Mission to Egypt and Israel
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 25  A. mediation mission of African leaders ended its visits to Israel and Egypt today and prepared to give the United Nations a new opportunity to reactivate the long dormant peace effort of Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring.

title: Ronald Tuch Weds Gail Marcia Cantor
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Nov. 25Miss Gail Marcia Cantor and Ronald Tuch were married here this afternoon in Temple B'nai Sholom by Rabbi Max Routtenberg.

title: MinorityStudent Program
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 25 (AP)Harvard University said today that it would accept about 50 minority students next year in its health careers summer program. The program is designed to improve the students grasp of basic sciences and encourage careers in the health professions.

title: ALES GAIN PARED AT RETAIL CHAINS
Norman Borlaug, D.D.T.
description: Dr. Norman E. Borlaug, a Nobel Prize plantgeneticist, has missed a chance to bring scientific clarity to the controversy now raging over the use of DDT. Instead, he has brought to the discussion an intemperate denunciation of environmentalists, careless charges and a display of such unrelieved propaganda that, notwithstanding his prominence in other fields, his views on this subject must now be seriously discounted.

title: Talks on Strategic Arms Held Despite Thanksgiving
description: VIENNA, Nov. 25 (AP)Although it was an American holiday, negotiators of the United States and of the Soviet Union held a twohour session here today, the fourth in the current round of talks to limit strategic weapons.

title: KITTIWAKE TAKES FIRENZE BY HEAD
description: Kittiwake, whose Florida antecedents seemed utterly out of place on the windswept tundra that was the Aqueduct Race Track yesterday, showed no concern for her surroundings as she won the $56,800 Firenze Handicap.

title: Arctic Oil Prospects Called Inflated
description: TORONTO, Nov. 25A Carleton University geologist who used to work for the Standard Oil Company of California has accused the oil industry of spawning unjustified optimism about the likelihood of finding huge oil and natural gas fields in the Canadian Arctic and offshore Atlantic.

title: G.I.'s Leave as Saigon's Problems Grow
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 23In the past few weeks cargo ships loaded with American jeeps, trucks, airconditioners, plumbing equipment and bulldozers have sailed for home. Several thousand happy. G.I.'s have passed the heroin tests and flown hack to the world.

title: Black State Colleges Are Found Periled; Integration a Factor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Black state colleges, for a century segregationists alternative to Negro attendance at white universities, are facing extinction.

title: Rangers Now Must Face Pressure of the Pursued
description: There was little opportunity for the Rangers to sit back and admire their record yesterday, following the 8.3 rout of the St. Louis Blues on Wednesday night.

title: A Nut and a Damn Fool Explains
description: Theorem, circa October 1971: Approval of the transportation bond issue is necessary to preserve the 30cent fare.

title: U.S. MAY ASK U.N, TO WEIGH DISPUTE ON EAST PAKISTAN
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 25The United States may ask the United Nations Security Council to consider the dispute between India and Pakistan, or support such a move by another country, the Western White HouSe said today.

title: StockDividend Rises: Shift in Base Is Slated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)Companies wishing to raise stock dividends in 1972 may use calendar year 1971 as a base on which to calculate the rate of increase, the Committee on Interest and Dividends said today.

title: Devaney Calls Cornhuskers Victory an Outside Job
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 25Bob Devaney, coach of college football's No. 1 team, unbeaten Nebraska, termed his defense excellent against Oklahoma today even though it yielded 31 points and 467 yards to the offense.

title: Uruguay's Critical Election
description: The most encouraging thing that can be said about the elections in Uruguay is that they will be held Sunday on schedule. For a country racked by prolonged economic depression and polarized by the urban terrorism of leftwing revolutionaries, that is no small achievement. In this area Uruguay thus continues to set an example for most of Latin America.

title: The King's offer, however
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 25King Hussein of Jordan was quoted as having said in an interview published here today that he would be prepared to meet with Israeli leaders if they would agree to withdraw from occupied territories, as provided in the Security Council resolution for a Middle East settlement, and to return East Jerusalem to Jordan.

title: Paying the Piper
description: He who pays the piper may call the tune. Because there is more than one piper and many are prepared pay, the reciprocal relationship between the politicians and the money men is not so simple as the old saying would imply. But it contains enough truth to suggest that the Senate was meeting a crucial issue of selfgovernment when it voted this week to permit public financing of the 1972 campaign.

title: FIRST HEAVY SNOW BRUSHES BY CITY
description: The first severe storm of the season swept up the North Atlantic coast yesterday, dumping up to two feet of snow on much of eastern New York and stranding thousands of holiday motorists.

title: Test in Nevada Yields Small Radiation Leak
description: YUCCA FLAT, Nev., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Radiation has leaked into the atmosphere from an underground nuclear detonation at the Nevada test site, the Atomic Energy Commission reported today.

title: Parcel on Las Vegas Strip Sold by Hughes Executives
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 25 (AP)Howard Hughes's executives disclosed today that they had sold a narrow piece of land on the Las Vagas Strip, the first property relinquished since the billionaire recluse made his headquarters here in 1966.

title: Maybe Turkey Leftovers Would Be Better...
description: Dil Mahal, 207 Second Avenue at 13th Street, 4739852.

title: FERTILITY STUDY MADE BY CENSUS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25Women of Italian, Polish and RussianJewish origin have had fewer children than white women generally, according to Census Bureau study released today.

title: STATE IS ASSAILED ON CRIME POLICY
description: A committee of the Community Service Society of New York charged yesterday that 1971 was the year the Governor and thte Legislature abdicated their joint responsibility for the burning issues of crime, correction and drug abuse.

title: Advertising:
description: Harper's Magazine is looking for a publisher. William S. Blair, president and publisher since 1968, is ready to share and he's looking for a person in the early to mid30's who has experience in the magazine field or something like it who can serve as the magazine's ambassador.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: 7 Dead in Norway Avalanche
description: ALESUND, Norway, Nov. 25 (AP)  Rescue teams today saved two of the nine men buried by an avalanche of snow yesterday in northwestern Norway. The other seven victims were found dead. The survivors were reported in good condition at a hospital.

title: Filion Has 7 Winners In Day for 483 Total
description: YONKERS, Nov. 25 Herve Fllion, who brought home four winners at Freehold Raceway in New Jersey this afternoon, added three here tonight, increasing his total for the campaign to 483. This left the man from Angers, Quebec, three short of the world record of 486 he set last season.

title: The Day That Mrs. Smith Saw the Light
description: In the Brooklyn household of the Robert Kimmel Smiths, it is mama who leaves the house each morning, paper tucked under her arm, to go off to long day at the office, while papa stays at home and does the marketing, takes the children to the dentist, and often cooks the dinner.

title: The Majority of Americans Are Isolationists
description: WASHINGTONFew, if any, I believe, of our people are isolationists as some of the socalled interventionists or internationalists would like to portray them. Practically all of our people recognize that we cannot ignore the rest of the world, that we cannot stop trading with other nations, that we cannot stop negotiations looking toward the reduction of our military forces and the diminution of the threat of a world conflict. Basically, I would say that the majority of the people of America are isolationists in that they believe it is time to judge every proposal and every program in terms of whether, in the broadest sense, it is in the best interest of our country and not whether it is in the best interest of Egypt or Israel or the political rulers of South Vietnam or Cambodia or Laos or, for that matter, in the best interest of England or France or Germany.

title: Soviet Launches Molnia 2
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 (AP)Ma Soviet Union has launched a new communications satellite, Molnia 2, in a high elliptical orbit, Tass, the government news agency, said today. The satellite was launched yesterday with a high point of 24,435 miles over the Northern Hemisphere and a low point of 2S5 miles over the Southern Hemisphere, Tass reported.

title: Hostage Says Some Prisoners Protected Him From Militants
description: RAHWAY, N.J., Nov. 25One of the hostageS taken in the prison rebellion at the state prison in Woodbridge said tonight that he was treated with care in a cell and protected from some inmates who were speaking of killing the guards.

title: PARLEY OVER BERLIN MAY END NEXT WEEK
description: BONN, Nov. 25  Highly placed sources here said this evening that the German negotiations on filling in the details of the Berlin agreement that was signed in September by the Big Four are expected to be completed next week.

title: Unsuitable Date Cancels Catholic League Contest
description: The Metropolitan Catholic High Schools Football League championship game, schedul ed Sunday at Baker Field, will not be held after all. Iona Prep was to have played Chaminade, but the Gaels judged Sunday as an unsuitable date since it would come three days after their game yesterday With New Rochelle. Iona was the. City Division champion and Charminade, of Mineola, LI., captured the Island Division.

title: Credit Pattern
description: The 10 per cent import sur charge was at least partly re sponsible for producing a record contraction in trade financing during October, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yesterday.

title: White Plains, Erasing Deficit, Beats Archbishop Stepinac, 197
description: White Plains, which completed an undefeated season, and Iona Prep, the City Division champion of the Catholic Schools Football League, scored Westchester County victories yesterday.

title: No Clash of Any Size in the Last 24 Hours, General Reports
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 25Only scattered shelling and harassing attacks were reported today along the East Pakistan border, where Indian and Pakistani soldiers fought major clashes in the last several days, according to a senior Pakistani military commander.

title: Giants'
description: Every professional football fan has heard of Minnesota's Purple Gang and the Fearsome Foursome of Los Angeles. They are defensive stalwarts whose destructive prowess has spread, if not fear, respect throughout the National Football League.

title: Engine Drops Off in Flight
description: DENVER, Nov. 25 (UPI)Frontier Airlines officials confirmed today that one of their passenger planes, Flight 947 from Cheyenne, Wyo., to Denver, lost one of its two engines in flight last night. The 16passenger propeller aircraft with six passengers aboard, landed safely on the remaining engine at Stapleton International Airport here shortly after 7 P.M.

title: U.S. to Give City 26 Acres For School on Staten Island
description: The Federal Government will turn over 2G acres of land on Staten Island to the city for new high school, the General Services Administration announced yesterday.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe world has been having a field day with the reallife thriller story of plots, counterplots, drugs, contraband and other James Bond divertissements apparently unfolding as a consequence of the arrest in New Jersey of a minor French espionage official charged with dope smuggling.

title: M.I.T. to Study Ways to Use Technology to Aid Poor Nations
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 25 Foreign aid experts have seen it happen many a time. A wellmeaning company or government agency builds highly automated factory, to make plastic sandals, for example, in an underdeveloped region. The modern efficient factory might have been expected to bring economic boom to the area, but It doesn't quite work out.

title: 9 Killed as 2 Trucks Crash
description: LONG BEACH, Miss., Nov. 25 (AP)Nine persons were killed today when two pickup trucks collided at an intersection on a rural road near Long Beach. Harrison County sheriff's officers said that the dead persons were five women, two children and two men. Three other children were injured.

title: CURRENCY VIEWS MESH IN EUROPE
description: PARIS, Nov. 25  Even though the world monetary crisis is far from settled, there is a surprising convergence of views in Europe's financial markets over the figures that would be involved in any currency realignment package.

title: Bridge: Field Bunched in the Finals Of Blue Ribbon Pairs Play
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 25The field was tightly bunched going into the final session of the blue ribbon pair championship play at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall National Championships here tonight.

title: Injured Guard Says First Indication of Prison Uprising Occurred During Movie
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Nov. 25The movie for inmates at the Rahway state prison last night was Making It. The prisoners seemed to be enjoying it, so Correction Officer Edward J. O'Beirne did not understand why many of them got up and left shortly after the film started in the auditorium.

title: MillionMile Mark Passed By Mariner in Mars Orbit
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 25 (UPI)Mariner 9 passed its millionth mile in orbit around Mars today, but pictures being returned to the Jet Propulsion Laboratory here from the space craft continued to be obscured by a dust storm on the planet.

title: Texas Wins, 3414, for Cotton Bowl Berth
TV in Ohio Court
description: SANDUSKY, Ohio, Nov. 25 (AP)Trial by television has received its first test in Ohio. The judge who handled the case, James McCrystal of Erie County Common Pleas Court, called it a success beyond my expectation.

title: Sandy Reject Wins Dash
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Nov. 25 (AP)Tom Maeda rode Sandy Reject to victory today in the $3,500 Thanksgiving Day Purse at Narragansett Park. Sandy Reject held the lead for the entire six furlongs and paid $11.60 for $2 to win.

title: Lambert Bowl to Alfred
description: Alfred's unbeaten Saxons won the Lambert Bowl yesterday as the No. 1 small college football team in the East. AlFred was followed by Edinboro State and Wilkes in the voting.

title: Advertising:
description: CableRep, thought to be the first national advertising representative for cable television systems, is almost year old. And while so far it has only managed to pick up one advertiser, great days are acomin'.

title: Half of Carnaby Street Is Sold for $8.5Million
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)Nearly half of Carnaby Street was auctioned off for $8.5million today.

title: Belfast, the English and the I.R.A.
description: ACHILL SOUND, Ireland  The English are wrong in thinking the Irish have no humor. They are the most humorous people aliveunconsciously. A recent example of this was offered by the family of Mr. Cahill, the I.R.A. leader. No sooner was he off to America, to put the bite on absentee patriots there, than Mrs. Cahill, mother of seven, applied for public assistance. In other words, while he was striving to kill the goose and goose is about itshe was claiming a share of the golden eggs. No one appeared to find this strange.

title: U.S. SEEKING WRIT FOR 80DAY HALT IN DOCK WALKOUT
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 25 President Nixon directed Attorney General John N. Mitchell today to seek court orders to send Atlantic and Gulf Coast longshoremen back to work for an 80day coolingoff period.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ALEKSANDR KAREV, SOVIET BAPTIST, 76
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 Aleksandr V. Karev, head of the Soviet Union's Evangelical Baptist Church, has died at the age of 76, the press agency Tass reported today.

title: ERNEST BRANDLI
description: KINNELON, N. J., Nov. 25Ernest Brandli, who retired in 1961 as president of the Swiss Reinsurance Corporation of New York, was killed yesterday in an automobile accident here. He was 75 years old and lived at 44 Fox Ledge Road.

title: India Goal Termed Independent East Bengal
description: News Analysis

title: Stanley M. Tracy Dies at 82; Active in Metal Industries
description: ALLENHURST, N. J., Nov. 25 Stanley M. Tracy, who had been active for many years in the metal industries, died today at the Jersey Shore Medical Center, Neptune, after a long illness. He was 82 years old and made his home with his daughterinlaw, Mrs. Lloyd A. Nelson Jr., at 106 Spier Avenue.

title: Flood Disrupts IRT Service
description: A watermain break at 2:30 A.M. yesterday near a construction site in the vicinity of Grand Army Plaza, Brooklyn, flooded some streets and halted service on two IRT subway lines till 5:15 A.M. No trains were trapped between stops. The police said the break cut pavement hole about four by six feet, just south of the intersection of Grand Army Plaza and Flatbush Avenue in the Park Slope section.

title: U.S.I.A. CHIEF'S BID ON JOBS ASSAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25An association of career diplomats is planning to seek a Federal Court injunction here to bar Frank. J. Shakespeare Jr., director of the United States Infornation Agency, from altering a 25yearold promotion system.

title: Garlepp of Milirose A.A. Wins 30Kilometer Crown
description: John Garlepp led the 32 finishers who competed in the wind, snow and rain in the 30kilometer (18.6 miles) championship of the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union yesterday.

title: Rochester Churches Damaged By Bombs in Early Morning
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 25 (AP) Two churcbec here were extensively damaged 1w bombs early today.

title: Brooklyn Union Plans Gas From Naphtha
description: History is about to repeat itself in the gas industry in Brooklyn.

title: New President Named By Division of Revlon

The victims were identified as Michael F. Klos, 28 years old, the pilot; his wife, Mary, 24, and their daughter, Pam, 5, all of Grapevine, Tex., and his sisterinlaw, Mrs. Edith Klos, 27, of Fort Wayne, Tex.

description: LONDON, Nov. 25Britain's prestigious Booker Prize was awarded today to V. S. Naipaul, the Indian writer, for his latest novel, In Free State.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)Inmates at the Trenton state prison dined quietly on Thanksgiving Day Turkey, dinner today, showing no apparent reaction to the distOrbance at the Rahway prison, 40 miles away.

title: Aggie Coach Dismissed
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Nov. 25 (AP)The Texas A. and M. board of regents Voted tonight to dismiss Coach Gene Stallings shortly after the Aggies had dropped their final football game of the season to Texas.

title: Hooks of The Times
description: The debate that has raged over the implications of ethology for human behavior has not been altogether uplifting. Some of the claims of the ethologistsor at least their popularizershave been both grandiose and reductive; while the reasoning of the opposition has often dipped to subhuman levels. So it is a distinct relief to come across someone like Jane van LawickGoodall, for the task she has set herself has been to observe and describe, and let the implications fall where they may. The results of her work have been extremely valuablethe first major systematic descriptions of chimpanzees in their natural habitat (important, because chimpanzees be man's closest living relatives). But of greater interest to readers: her dedicated work has led her to write a book, In the Shadow of Man, that is charming and relaxed, and ought to be irresistible to everyone but the most confirmed animalhater.

title: 500,000 GERMANS IDLE IN DISPUTE
description: BONN, Nov. 25Half a million West German workers were on strike tonight or locked out of their factories and hundreds of thousands more faced imminent dismissal as a wage dispute in the automobile industry spread to other parts of the country.

title: ' Socrates' Mirrors the Platonic Touch of Rossellini
description: Something more than wordplay is involved when one describes Roberto Rossellini's "Socrates," which opened yesterday at the New Yorker Theater, as the great Italian director's most Socratic film, in his most Platonic style.Although the movie was shot entirely in Spain with lots of correctly costumed extras, who walk around what look to be the freshly painted, spruced-up remains of the sets of Anthony Mann's unfortunate "Fall of the Roman Empire," it concedes no more than it absolutely must to the demands of a popular cinema that seeks access to the intellect through visual grandeur and primal emotions.Like all of Rossellini's recent films, including the fine "The Rise of Louis XIV," "Socrates" was originally made for television (that is, European television, which is apparently a lot more adventurous than our own). Curiously enough, television's limited budgets and circumscribed physical scope, which might diminish the work of any other film director I can think of (except Godard), have given a certain freedom to Rossellini, allowing him to pursue his humanistic concerns unhampered by the temptations to indulge in conventional masquerades.What we are now getting from Rossellini, who so moved us with the neorealism of "Open City" and "Paisan," and then pioneered Antonioni country with films like "Stromboli" and "A Voyage to Italy," is a type of teaching cinema that is not exactly stern, although it is uncompromising. It is the work of a kind of saint, whom I can admire even when I don't find him especially congenial.The passion of "Socrates" is the passion of its subject, which, to say the least, bears very little relation to the sort of melodramatic, window-dressed passion celebrated by something like "Jesus Christ Superstar." Drawing freely from Plato's "Euthyphro," "The Apology," "Crito" and "Phaedo," Rossellini recalls the last years of Socrates's life almost entirely in terms of Socratic dialogues.Socrates (Jean Sylvere) moves about ancient Athens surrounded by a small cloud of followers, deflating the pompus, drawing reason out of the unreasonable, defining things like piety and pity, speculating on the aspects of the souland infuriating the wise who refuse to acknowledge that the first step to wisdom is the acknowledgement that one knows nothing.As the words are Plato's, so is Rossellini's style, which is straightforward, pure and serene. This offers not much opportunity for performances, in any conventional respect, or for drama, even during Socrates's trial and execution. The film is a series of rather proper, spoken tableaus that seldom erupt with spontaneity. (One exception: when Xanthippe laments the fact that Socrates is dying "unjustly," he answers with some impatience: "Would you prefer that I died justly?"Yet there is in this fidelityin this complete refusal to let the film come between the audience and its subjecta kind of beauty and poetry that are all but unknown in the work of any other contemporary filmmaker. Unfortunately, the film is in Italian, translated by English subtitles that don't always make a great deal of sense. However, if the film sends you back to the original texts, as it did me, it will have accomplished exactly what I suspect Rossellini intended it to do."Socrates" employs a minimum of cinematic techniques, and makes no attempt at characterization. We do meet Xanthippe, Crito, Meletus, Anytus and Lycon, in passing, but Plato himself, who was apparently ill during the trial (according to "Phaedo"), remains respectfully off-screenplayed by Rossellini.

title: Optimism and Long Hours: Keys to Franchise Success
description: WATERLOO, Iowa  When Marvin Heideman lived in Duluth, Minn., his next door neighbor was Gordon Roberts. Mr. Roberts was no ordinary neighbor. He was in business, mainly groceries, and Marvin delivered milk to Mr. Roberts's grocery store.

title: A Lonely Meal on Watch Over Sheep in Rockies
description: WOLF CREEK, Mont.High in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains some 35 miles from Helena, the capital of this sprawling farming and ranching state, Wes Baldry, 52 years old, tended his sheep on Thanksgiving Day as he has winter and summer, night and day, weekends and, holidays for the last two years.

title: TV CAMERAS USED IN MICHIGAN COURT
description: MASON, Mich., Nov. 25 The instant replay familiar to football television fans may be near at hand for Michigan appeals court judges reviewing criminal trial convictions.

title: Hikers Rescued in Tasmania
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Nov. 25 (Reuters)A helicopter rescued eight injured members today of a schoolboy hiking expedition trapped in a blizzard on a Tasmanian mountain. It also flew out the body of a 15yearold boy who died when the party was stranded for more than two days.

title: Blacks Offered New Rights
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 25The BritishRhodesian settlement offers new legal rights and economic possibilities to the black majority here, but political power remains a dim and distant hope.

title: Bernstein Leads Philharmonic In Revival of Hoist's Planets
description: Since astrology seems to be enjoying a spurt of popularity these days, the New York Philharmonic could be said to have taken a topical turn Wednesday night in giving its first complete performance of Gustav Hoist's The Planets in 50 years.

title: Wishes for Speedy Recovery
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 25 (UPI)A spokesman for the Western White House said today that we're sorry Mr. Meant feels bad and we hope he has a speedy recovery.

description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. CORPORATIONS ON TAIWAN CALM
description: TAIPEI, TaiwanAmerican business interests on Taiwanbuilt up over the last decade to largescale proportions  are taking the loss of United Nations membership for the Chinese Nationalist Government here with equanimity.

title: Guarantee by Cahill Ends Rahway Prison Uprising
description: N. J., Nov. 25A 24hour rebellion by inmates at the Rahway state prison ended tonight with the release of the warden and the last of five guards who had been held hostage.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Briton, in the Security Council, Defends Accord With Rhodesia
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25Sir Colin Crowe, the British chief delegate, explained to the Security Council today the terms of the Rhodesian agreement.

title: Anxious State Democrats Await Special Session on Redistricting
description: Assemblyman Frank G. Rossetti, the New York County Democratic leader, is likely to have his Assembly seat eliminated when the Legislature meets in special session next month, to reapportion legislative districts according to 1970 Federal census figures.

title: BADILLO ASSAILS PROJECT'S CRITICS
description: Representative Herman Badillo charged yesterday that some public officials involved in the controversy over lowincome housing in Forest Hills were copping out on their responsibilities by opposing the project.

title: FRANKLIN HANNOCH SR.
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 25 Franklin Hannoch Sr., realestate appraiser in northern New Jersey for many years, died of a heart attack yesterday at his office, 17 Academy Street, in Newark. He was 71 years old and lived at 520 Melrose Place.

title: Lynch Rails Speech
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 25  Prime Minister John Lynch said here tonight in a statement that Mr. Wilson's proposals on Ulster were a serious contribution to finding a way forward by political action.

title: Namath to Drill Today After Rain Delays Test
description: Joe Namath's countdown for his possible return to action on Sundayagainst San Francisco at Shea Stadiumwent into a hold pattern yesterday when the Jets practice was canceled.

title: R. H. M'MENAMIN
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Nov. 25Robert H. McMenamin of Mantoloking, president of the Rahway City Council in 1959, 19(30 and 1961, was pronounced dead on arrival Tuesday at Somerset Hospital, Somerville, after collapsing at work. He was 51 years old.

title: Paul Strand at 81: Still a Vital Photographic Artist
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24Paul Strand is one of the legendary names in the history of American photography. His early accomplishments reach back to the era of Alfred Stieglitz, in whose gallery 291 Mr. Strand first showed his work in 1916. Indeed, his career encompasses so much history that we are sometimes in danger of relegating his work to the past. Yet Mr. Strand remains to this day a vital photographic artist, tirelessly adding to his already enormous oeuvre. At the age of 81, he shows no sign of relaxing his energetic course.

title: Economic Uneasiness Fills Uruguay as Election Nears
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 25  Hundreds of times this year small herds of Uruguayan cattle have walked slowly across some deserted stretch of the BrazilUruguay border and turned up the next day as Brazilian beef  worth about three times more on the hoof.

title: BRUINS BEAT FLYERS AS ORR EXCELS,42
PRAGUE IS UNEASY ON ELECTION'S EVE
description: WARSAW, Nov. 25Czechoslovakia holds her first national elections in seven years tomorrow in an apparently uneasy and uncertain mood.

title: C. M. Shumate Weds Nancy Galef
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 25Miss Nancy Leslie Galef and Craig Minard Shumate of Cambridge, Mass., were married here this noon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Gabriel Galef, parents of the bride. Rabbi Samuel Silver performed the ceremony.

title: Seen Any Old Visiting Cards Lately?
description: Who can remember when ladies and gentlemen (the words are used advisedly) would no more have been without a supply of visiting cards than they would have been without shoes?

title: Quarrying Threat Seen In Area Near High Tor
description: HAVERSTRAW, N. Y.The last major privately owned stretch of New YorkNew Jersey Palisades overlooking the Hudson River here is involved in a proposed threeway swap that has stirred the opposition of conservationists and evoked the name of the peak, High Tor, a cherished landmark.

title: Humanitarian Warden Vukasin Savo Vukcevich
description: I just don't like that place, Mrs. Stana Vukcevich said after her son was appointed superintendent of Rahway State Prison last year. Some day he's going to lose his head. On Thanksgiving Eve, the 71yearold widow's son was taken hostage in a rebellion among the convicts at the maximumsecurity prison. The superintendent, who is 43 years old, was not unaware of his mother's uneasiness, but he passed it off lightly. He's just one of these happygolucky guys, an acquaintance said yesterday.

title: Arab Military Chiefs in Accord On Cooperation. Against Israel
description: CAIRO, Nov. 25A meeting of Arab military chiefs of staff was reported today to have achieved startling success in agreeing upon a plan of military and financial cooperation for the struggle against Israel.

title: I.C.I.'s Stock Slumps On ProfitDrop News
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)More than $500million was wiped off the London stock market value of Britain's biggest industrial group, Imperial Chemical Industries, today when it reported reduced profits.

title: U.S.ASKS EASING OF TRADE IN 1973
description: GENEVA, Nov. 25The United States called today on the world trading community to set its sights on another major international assault on trade barriers once the European Economic Community completes its expected expansion in 1973.

J., was granted a patent this week on an instrdinentfor diagnosing ,:. conditions in the heart and lungs without endangering. the patient. Dr. Louis R. M. Del Gueroio received Patent 3,622,784. title: Ned Day, ,60 , Bowling Champion Who Held Many Titles, Is Dead
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 26 (AP) Ned Day, a bowler who won many championships, died in a hospital here today after col lapsing in the bookstore he op erated. He was 60 years old.
