description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 26 (AP)  A group of placard carrying demonstrators, con tending that MexicanAmeri cans do not have equal em ployment opportunity in the Federal Government, picketed outside the Western White House today.

title: Rhodesian Whites Can't Bar Black Majority, British Say
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 26British officials at the United Nations said today, that the achievement of black ma jority rule in Rhodesia would not be subject to an effective white veto as reported in a dispatch from. Salisbury in to day's issues of The New York Times.

title: U.S. Disavows Plan to Send Lance Missiles to Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) The State Department today disavpwed the idea that the United States might soon send Lance groundtoground mis siles to Israel.

title: Antitrust Unit Appeals Bank Acquisition Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 26 (Reu ter)The Justice Department filed today the first Supreme Court appeal dealing with the recent trend of banking orga nizations to achieve near dom inance in their states by acquir ing leading banks in significant market areas.

title: The Retarded and the Volunteer HelpersThey Need Each Other
Text of Rahway Inmates Demands and Grievances
description: Petition Re: Inmate Grievances, Rahway State Prison We, the inmates, who are presently confined at Rahway State Prison, appeal to you, the people of the state of New Jersey. We are desper ately asking that you help us to obtain the right to exist as human beings. We are also desperately seeking outside concern from you, in order that we may present this pe tition to the prison adminis tration and Governor of New Jersey. We are asking for cooperation, by signing the petition. The demands that are listed are brief due to lack of space, but an entire list can be obtained from the above address.

title: Joe Adonis, Underworld Gambling King, Dies
description: ANCONA, Italy, Nov. 26Giuseppe Antonio Doto, also known as Joe Adonis, once a leader of the United States underworld, died here this after noon. Ike was 69 years old.

title: End of the Line for Monster Toys
description: Nabisco, the cracker and cooky maker, has axed the Monster Scene toy kits its Aurora Products subsidiary has been turn ing out by the thousands since last Feb ruary.

title: Namath: I'm Ready Right Now; Ewbank: We Take No Chances
description: To the obvious delight of 100 youngsters  girls as well as boys  who somehow had, managed to filter into sunny Shea Stadium, Joe Namath, proved yesterday hers ready to make his longawaited come back.

title: Peekskill Mother Wins Court Battle; Will Be Sterilized
description: Peekskill Community Hos pital agreed yesterday to steri lize a mother of three after Federal judge said he would order the hospital to do so if it failed to act voluntarily.

title: Javits Seeks to Enroll First Girl in the Naval Academy
AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME FALLS
DR. CARTERET LAWRENCE
description: Dr. Carteret Lawrence, direc tor of the Bishop Eye Research Center of the. SwediSh Hospital in Seattle, died Wednesday of a kidney ailment in Seattle. His age was 47.

title: Hank Mann, 84, Member Of Keystone Kops, Dead
description: SOUTH PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 26 (AP)Hank Mann, member of Mack Sennett's Key stone Kops, died heer Thursday at the Braewood Convalescent Hospital. He was 84 years old.

title: Peron Will Send His Wife On Trip to Argentina Dec. 4
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 26 (AP)Isabel Martinez de Peron, third wife of the former Presi dent, Juan D. Peron, will come to Buenos Aires, from Madrid on Dec. 4 in what is believed to he an important political move by her 76yearold husband.

title: Christmas Cards Spur Warning By F.T.C. on Deceptive Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The Federal Trade Commission has offered buyers of Christ mas cards a timely tip: Beware of big markdowns in prices. They may be phony.

title: Argentine Policy Split Perils Vote Plan
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 25Profound differences over eco nomic policy and political strat egy within Argentina's military Government are weakening plans to restore constitutional rule through elections.

title: B. F. Gayman 2d Weds Miss Carol A. Steinen
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 26In the Community Con gregational Church here this afternoon Miss Carol Ann Steinen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Frederick Stein en, was married to Benjamin Franklin Gayman 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Franklin Gayman of Chambersburg, Pa. The Rev. Kenyon Wild rick performed the ceremony.

title: 13 Units of 3,233 G.I.'s Pulled Out of Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 26 (AP)'the United States command announced today the cutback of 13 more Army units with a total strength of 3,233 soldiers in a continued speedup of pre Christmas withdrawals from Vietnam.

title: $600,000 in Gems Lost On TransAtlantic Flight
description: ANTWERP, Belgium, Nov. 26 (AP)A package contain ing $600,000 worth of rough and cut diamonds vanished after a transAtlantic flight to the United States Novem ber 11, the police said today.

title: G.O.P. Accused on Tickets
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26, (UPI)  The Civil Service Commis sion began an investigation to day of charges that Federal employes were illegally solic ited to buy tickets to the Re publican party's recent $500a plate fundraising affair. The allegations were made by Na than T. Wolkomir, president of the National Federation of Fed eral Employes.

title: Forest Hills Group Opens Drive to Impeach Lindsay
Bankruptcy Petitions Rose 3.6% Over Preceding Year
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 26 (UPI) Bankruptcy proceedings in creased again in the year ended June 30, the Commerce Clear ing House reported today.

title: Pakistan's Presideni Bans a Small Political Party in Move Aimed at Crushing a Source of Opposition
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 26  In a move evi dently aimed at crushing small but potentially dangerous source of opposition to his re gime, President Agha Moham mad Yahya Khan today banned the National Awami party.

title: Apparent Suicide Follows Killing of 4 in California
description: LANCASTER, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)Five persons were killed today in what detectives be lieve was a shooting spree and suicide by a former boy friend of one of the victims.

title: 2 Lithuanian Priests Reported Convicted
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26Two Roman Catholic priests in So viet Lithuania were reported today to have been sentenced to a year's detention for prepar ing children to take their first communion.

title: Negotiations Resume Tomorrow In Strike of Lay Teachers Here
Hospital in Capital, Despite InnerCity Trend, Cuts Costs and Reduces Fees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Amid steadily rising costs, the Washington Hospital Center has cut its prices by 9 per cent this year in a feat ihat not only saves its customers money but also suggests a way to survival for other innercity medical complexes.

title: Albany Policeman Is Killed And Another Man Is Shot
description: An Albany policeman was shot to death today when he and an ambulance attendant arrived at the home of a woman they were going to take to hospital.

title: Reopening the Docks
description: President Nixon's move for national emergency injunc tions to reopen the strikebound ports on the Atlantic and Gulf coasts represents the collapse of an Administra tion attempt to revive the atrophied processes collective bargaining on the waterfront.

title: Melodrama Marks Rock by Emerson, Lake and Palmer
description: If one accepts the premise that rock music is really a form of theater, then Emerson, Lake and Palmer should be ripe for Tony Award nominations. In their Madison Square Garden concert Thursday night, the iconoclastic English rock trio put on a show that would have given pause to a Tom O'Horgan.

title: Enemy Said to Be Building Up Supplies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 26 (AP) South Vietnamese forces continued to look for en emy bases in eastern Cambodia today amid reports ot.:a big North Vietnamese supply, build up on the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos.

title: Opponents Move to Curb Appalachia Strip Mining
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 26The light snow that fell on parts of Appalachia early this week accomplished what en vironmentalists and officials have been unable to doit hid Some of the jagged scars left by coal strip miners..

title: KENNETH HURD, 74, A HEARST OFFICIAL
description: Kenneth $. Hurd, who retired as a vice president of Hearst magazines five years ago, died yesterday in Concord (N.H.) Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 340 East 57th Street and in. Concord.

title: New Drilling Techniques Probe Soviet Baku for Oil
description: BAKU, U.S.S.R., Nov. 19 The hope, of the Bauk oil in dustry, one of the pioneer oil regions of the world and formerly the Soviet Union's main producing area; now depends, on new deepwater drilling techniques for signif icant growth, Soviet special ists here say.

title: CHARGES POSTPONED IN RIOTING AT ATTICA
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 26 (UPI)Attica prison officials agreed in Federal Court today to postpone disciplinary charges against in mates in the Sept. 9to13 riot until after a grand jury brings criminal charges.

title: More News About Mars...
description: Traveling in orbit around Mars, Mariner 9 yesterday turned its cameras on Deimos, one of Mars two Moons, and sent back to earth the first closeup picture of that tiny Martian satellite. Until yesterday, Deimos was merely a point of light in photographs taken by earth bound telescopes or by earlier Mariner vehicles. Yester day's picture showed it to be a highly irregular elliptical body, a huge rock five and a half miles wide and seven miles long that was probably an asteroid in origin.

title: ECONOMY PERILED, GERMANS WARNED
description: BONN, Nov. 26With West Germany deep in a worsening industrial dispute, 62 leading figures in industry and com merce delivered a warning t& the people today that their economy and their jobs were in grave danger.

title: Meany Has Restful Night, May Be Released Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI) George Meany was reported in good spirits today and reg istering normal on all medical tests, one day after he was hospitalized for what was de scribed as severe chest pains.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In the Nov. 10 editorial Bonanzas Come First The Times took upon it self to assert what thoughts were in the mind of Senator Eastland. The Times, through what must be psychic divination, decided: Senator Eastland of Mississippi wants Congress to have a look at the workings of the coun try's environmental protection lawsnot because they lack effectiveness but because in his view they are entirely too effective. What Senator Eastland in fact said was: Everybody is in favor of protecting the environment, but this business of yelling ecology every time we get ready for a new project has got to stop.

title: Doctors Warned on Infections in Intravenous Therapy
description: Documentation of often fatal fungal infections that can re sult from contamination during a particular type of intrave nous treatment has prompted a leading medical journal to urge editorially that more con sumer protection be given to patients needing such therapy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his Nov. 9 letter, Ambassador Sen of India expressed his displeasure at Benjamin Oehlert for daring to ask [letter Nov. 3] why India has refused to accept Pakistan's proposal that forces be withdrawn from both sides of the IndiaPakistan border, a U.N. offer to supervise refugee repatria tion and U Thant's offer of good offices.

title: In Islamabad, Fighting on the Indian Border Seems Far, Far Off
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 25There is a curious ly isolated quality about this citythe capital of Pakistan that seems to place it in an other world from that of the teeming, impoverished and strifetorn IndianPakistani subcontinent. For one thing, Islamabad is more of a dip lomatic enclave than a city and its population of 100,000 is made up largely of Government offi cials and diplomatic families. In common with Australia's Canberra and Brazil's Bra silia, Islamabad has been built in the past few years as a new capital.

title: Junior Asseiribly Held Only One This Year
description: The Grand Ballroom at the Plaza was the setting last night for yet another debu tante party, this time the Junior Assembly, which came hard on the heels of Wednes day's Junior League Ball and last night's Gotham. The Grosvenor Ball there tonight will wind up the Thanksgiv ing holiday debutante season at the hotel.

title: Bank Loan to Malaysia
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (Reu ters)  The World Bank an nounced today it will lend Ma laysia $16million to modernize the country's railways. The loan is for 25 years, including a fiveyear grace period, at 7 per cent.

title: Mariner Snaps CloseUp Of One of Mars's Moons
description: In its 13th day in orbit around Mars, the Mariner 9 spacecraft swung its television camera away from the Martian surface and into the sky yes terday to take the first good picture of Deimos, the smaller of Mars's two tiny moons.

title: Japan Allows Cartel Among Six Makers Of Stainless Steel
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26 (AP)The Fair Trade Commission ap proved today an application by six Japanese stainlesssteel manufacturers to form a cartel to counter the effects of slump in the industry.

title: Most Political Clubs in City Are Losing Their Power
description: The Murray Hill Demo cratic Club was meeting in its musty, secondfloor head quarters at 229 Lexington Avenue, but at first glance the meeting was not much different from that of a civic organization or a stamp club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I was ashamed and revolted when I read your Nov. 19 news story about the near riot in Forest Hills by the angry crowds protesting the plan to build a lowincome housing project in that area.

title: ... and a Tennis Ball Moon
description: But man is daily learning more about his nearest neigh bors in space, as well as those further away. It has recently been discovered that the earth and the moon do not make up an isolated, selfsufficient twobody system as men have believed for centuries. Rather, they are, part of a threebody system whose third member a tiny quasimoon only a mile or two in diameter.

title: GRAIN PRICES UP ON FUTURES LIST
description: Prices of grain and soybean futures on, the Chicago. Board of Trade rose yesterday with the news that the Government had taken action to obtain TaftHartley backtowork in junction in the East and Gulf Coast dock strikes.

title: No Comment in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) The State Department de clined immediate comment to day on the Rhodesian agree ment.

title: Store Sales Up for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The Department of Commerce reported today that retail store sales for the latest week ended Nov. 20 was an estimated $8, 563,000,000, an increase of 14 per cent above the sales of $7, 514,000,000 for the correspond ing week last year. Total de partment store sales for the latest week was an estimated $1,001,000,000, a 12 per cent increase from the sales of $894, 000,000 for the same period last year.

title: Jane Holdsworth Married to Lawyer
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Nov. 26Miss Jane Althea Holdsworth of Stonington, a news reporter with The Day newspaper here, was married this afternoon to Frank Lewis McGuire, a New London law yer.

title: No Dramatic Change
description: SALISBURY, Nov. 26 (AP) Sir Humphrey Gibbs, who was the Governor General when Rhodesia broke from 1Britain on Nov. 11, 1965, said: As far as I can see there will be no dramatic change from our present difficulties. But in the long term, if we all work together, we will make steady progress toward the full devel opment of our country.

title: The Level of Health Care in Municipal Hospitals Is Shocking
description: Mr. Shapiro (or Rivera, Spinelli, Wilkins, Wong, or Ryan) is about to die. His tracheostomy tube, the metal one temporarily placed in his windpipe to help him breathe, is becoming clogged with mucous. He needs to have it suctioned clean, but there is no nurse around right now. Ho will die tonight because of inadequate nursing care. Mr. Shapiro could have avoided this fate in an other hospital, but he is in a New York City municipal hospital. He will die because he is poor or be cause he, is old or because he does not have... a private physician. He is a victim of the twoclass system of medical care in this nation.

title: PAKISTAN REPORTS INDIAN PRESSURE
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 26The Pakistan military command said today that two Indian bat talions launched an attack last night across a peninsula of Pakistan territory in an attempt to isolate Pakistani soldiers near Belonia, southeast of Co milla.

title: Bridgeport Triumphs, 1712, On a Pass in Rockne Bowl
Japan Asks Money Shifts;
description: TOKYO, Saturday, Nov. 27 (Reuters)The Japanese Cabi net Council of Economic Min isters decided today that Japan should strive to solve the in ternational monetary problem by the end of the year by mak ing due contribution to a Multi lateral currency realignment, Cabinet spokesman announced.

title: Shaun Phillips, Guitarist, Singer And Song Writer, Shows Talent
description: There's a fine show at the Bitter End this week. Albert Brooks, a rising young come dian, headlines the evening.

title: COURT ORDER DELAYS MEETING OF PENNSY
description: A temporary restraining or der issued yesterday by United States District Judge Joseph S. Lord 3d in Philadelphia has postponed the annual meeting of the Penn Central Company that was originally set for 11 A.M. on Monday at the Benja min Franklin Hotel in Philadel phia.

title: 76ERS SENT RULE ON CONDITIONS
description: The Philadelphia 76ers, who have been seeking a topnotch center since trading Wilt Chamberlain to the Los Angeles Lakers in the summer of 1968, may have made a move in that direction yesterday when they obtained 6foot9inch Bob Rule from the bench of the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: WAGE GUIDE TOPPED BY BUILDERS'
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) A panel appointed by dent Nixon to hold down wage increases in the construction industry approved today scores of new contracts far exceeding the 5.5 per cent annual increase pat the Pay Board has set as a guideline.

title: Market Place: Executive Wheel Is Kept Rolling
description: When a major conglomer ate went looking for a new president for its aircraft in strument manufacturing divi sion in the hopes of pulling the division out of a deep pool of red ink, several executive search consulting firms were eager to take on the assignment.

title: JOHN S. DAVEY
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 26 John Sherman Davey, who retired as a vIce president of Russell, Burdsall & Ward Bolt & Nut Company of Port Chester, N. Y., in 1961, died here yes terday. He was 70 years old and lived at 1 Echo Lane.

title: The Federal Agencies and Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26In what has now become an an nual ritual, the United States Commission on Civil Rights recently criticized, to no one's surprise, the failure of the Fed eral establishment to enforce existing civil rights laws. But underneath the commission's bulky 240page pointbypoint recital of bureau cratic insensitivity to the rights of mi norities lay two in teresting and over looked truths: First, even the most obscure agencies of Government now have im portant civil rights responsibil ities of which even their man agers are only dimly aware.

title: Antiques: Appeal of Indian Objects
description: Collecting American Indian objects will seem to be much more fun after a trip to the exhibition The Art of the North American Indian at Hofstra University's Emily Lowe Gallery in Hempstead, L. I.

title: RUMSFELD DENIES WAGEPRICE RISES STEP UP INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The Nixon Administration counterattacked critics of its economic stabilization program today, asserting that recent ad vances in wages and prices were not so inflationary as they might appear.

title: Faulkner Rejects Wilson Plan for United Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 26Prime Minister Brian Faulkner today firmly rejected the plan for a united Ireland presented in the British House of Commons yesterday by Harold Wilson, the leader of the Opposition Labor party.

title: Rosewall Captures Tennis Title
description: DALLAS, Nov. 26  Rod Laver became the first tennis millionaire today, but Ken Rosewall won the first World Championship of Tennis and $50,000, the richest single pay off in the sport's history.

title: Lakers Take 13th in Row
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)Wilt Chamberlain scored 31 points and grabbed 31 rebounds tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers won their 13th consecutive game, a 132 113 victory over the Detroit Pistons. Jerry West scored 25 points and contributed 18 as sists.

title: Indians Said to Mine Post
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 25 The Pakistan Press Interna tional news agency said today that the Indian navy has mined approaches to the port of Chalna in East Pakistan as part of the Indian Government's plan to hamper the flow of foodgrains and essential goods to East Pakistan. The agency quoted authoritative sources as having said that the reported mining operation was in total disregard of all canons of inter national laws.

title: Base Reported Destroyed
description: PNOMPENH, Nov. 26, (Reu ter)A Cambodian command spokesman said that United States bombers today destroyed a support base for a large Com munist force that had halted a big Cambodian Army operation on Route 6 in northern Cam bodia. He said that secondary explosions indicated that the bombs had hit ammunition dumps in the Amcar Chandong rubber plantation, about 60 miles from Pnompenh.

title: Pierpont Display Shows Blake as a Visual Artist
description: William Blake was a better poet than visual artist. And yet his followersand there are many of them nowhave indiscriminately admired his pictorial talents as much as they have extolled his lit erary gifts. The current ex hibition of the Mrs. Landon K. Thorne collection at the Pierpont Morgan Library, 36th Street at Madison Ave nue, should help temper some of the overstated enthusiasm for the art of Blake and place the work of the English artist into a less lofty realm.

title: Bridge:
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 26Two unheralded young play ers scored an upset victory in one of the prestige events at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Na tionals here last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Senator Margaret Chase Smith's warning that the balance of military power is shifting against the United States (letter Nov. 20) is a hodgepodge of straw men and paranoid projections left over from the cold war.

title: Russian Craft Nearing Mars
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26The So viet Communist party daily Pravda said today that the two Russian spacecraft headed for Mars were approaching the planet, but gave no arrival date.

title: Susan C. Paull Becomes Bride Of Thomas Neff
description: Miss Susan Culver Paull, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John O. Paull of New Canaan, Conn., was married here yes terday afternoon to Thomas Joseph Neff, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Wallace Neff of Easton, Pa. Msgr. James G. Wilders performed the cere mony and celebrated the nuptial mass at the St. Thomas More Roman Catho lic Church, and a reception was held at the Carlyle.

title: Stock Market Rallies
description: The stock market pro duced a sharp technical rally yesterday in the absence of any concrete news devel opments. The DowJones in dustrial average soared 17.96 points to close at 816.59 on low volume. Details, Page 43.

title: Meeting the Taxi Problem
description: In the fifth and latest in a series of, generally turgid reports, Taxi Commissioner Michael J. Lazar seems be careening around the corner of his problems, failing to meet them headon.

title: Still Time to Intervene
description: In spite of a series of sharp border clashes during which Indian troops have crossed into the rebellious Pakistani state of East Bengal selfdefense, India and Pakistan so far have held back from allout war. International diplomacy still has a chance to intervene for peace on the subcontinent.

title: ULBRICHT AND STOPH REELECTED TO POSTS
description: BERLIN, Nov. 26The East German Volkskammer (parlit ment) today reelected Walter Ulbricht, the 78yearold for mer leader of the Communist party, as the nominal head of state, and reelected Willi Stoph, 57, to the Premiership.

title: Faisal Will Let Moslems From Israel Visit Mecca
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 26For the first time in the 23 years of modern Israel's statehood, Saudi Arabia has agreed to ad mit Israeli Moslems for pilgrim ages to Mecca.

title: Inside and Outside a Smith Sculpture
description: The sculpture of Tony Smith is a sculpture of mono lithic geometric modules. Al though the design of these modules is rationalistic in the extreme, the effect of the sculpture itself is often bi zarre, irrational, even primi tivistic. The cool repetition of a standardized, dumb form acquires, through sheer accretion, an expressive pow er greater than that of the individual parts.

title: Captors Perfect Gentelmen, Warden Says
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Nov. 26Vucasine Vukcevich, the 43yearold superintendent of the New Jersey state prison at Woodbridge Township near here, which wag shaken by a 24hour prisoner revolt that ended last night, said today that the three inmates who guarded him in a cell after he was injured were, if anything, nothing but perfect gentlemen.

title: Sorry, Wrong Delivery
description: Dr. George Garver, Superintendent of Schools in Hous ton, was dismissed last summer by the school board's conservative majority but is expected to be reappointed following the recent election of more liberal members. But he now faces a new controversy because a letter carrier has accused him of being a cardcarrying sub scriber to Playboy magazine.

title: About Those Exiles
description: WASHINGTON,In a recent column on this page, Roger Williams, current ly in exile, stridently demanded as conditions of returning home, first, punishment of American political lead ers and then an official apology to those, like himself, who left this coun try to avoid military service. Mr. Wil liams was among some forty exiles met in Canada in December 1969. thought and said then that we should face up to the problem, controversial and painful as it may be. With the war dragging on, but hopefully closer to an end, I think it even more important to encourage discussion of this tender subject by reasonable men and women.

title: Nuptials in Jersey for JoAnn Kreher
description: UPPER SADDLE RIVER, N. J., Nov. 26Miss JoAnn Cynthia Kreher, a buyer of children's wear with McGree vey Werring & Howell, Inc., New York, and Peter Car roll Earley 3d, who is with the HelmsleySpear Real Es tate and Management Corpo ration in New York, were married here this evening.

title: City Upheld Over Blast Fatal to 11
description: State Supreme Court Jus tice Hyman Korn yesterday upheld the city's revocation of a plumber's license for his alleged failure to supervise work on a building near City, Hall that blew up last Dec. 11, killing 11 persons and in juring 50 others.

title: Charges Against a Rabbi Dismissed by Judge Here
description: Charges against a rabbi and a graduate student, who were arrested last year for allegedly disrupting services at Temple Emanuel have been dismissed in Criminal Court.

title: Prison Negotiator Archibald Stevens Alexander Jr.
description: Overcrowding in New Jer sey's prison system has reached the point where it is impossible to maintain even the pretense of rehabilita tion, Archibald Stevens Alexander Jr. wrote nearly two years ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As an attorney with some experi ence in the area of criminal law, find your stated attitude and criticism about Justice Posters decision to bar the press and public illdirected and less than candid.

title: Heath Takes Lead in New Field
description: LONDON, Nov. 26  Prime Minister Heath once said that if he had chosen music over politics he thought he really could have done well as a conductor. Last night he got the chance to prove it.

title: Henry C. Harrison. Is Dead; Held Patents in Recording
description: Henry C. Harrison, an in ventor in high fidelity phono graph recording, died Thursday in Weybridge, Vt., on a visit to his daughter, Mrs. Ida Wash ington. He was 84 years old and lived in Port Washing ton, L. I.

title: 31 ExEmployes at Ohio Hospital Appear in Court
description: LIMA, Ohio, Nov. 26The fortresslike Lima State Hospi tal for the Criminally Insane here has been describedby inmates, staff members, state officials and Ohio's Governors as a chamber of horrors.

title: Words in Memory of a Young Man
description: When a man dies full of age and honors, it is easy enough to find words of comforts for his funeral. Dale Rich mond had his joys in life. But his life was much too short to give him even a chance to gather his fair share. He died full of youth, full, of hopes, and full of dreams. How can we take comfort when a dream dies?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The controversy over construction of a lowincome housing project in Forest Hills points up the need for greater community control over gov ernment projects in a given neighbor hood.

title: DICK HYMAN QUARTET PLAYS AT ST. REGIS
description: The group that performdd for Jazz Adventures yesterday afternoon in the Maisonette of the St. RegisSheraton Hotel was offically identified as the Dick Hyman Quartet. But de spite Mr. Hyman's accom plished work on the organ, the performance was dominated by the harmonica playing, guitar playing, whistling and playful charm of Toots Thielemans.

title: Spain Gets Cycle Races
description: GENEVA, Nov. 26 (AP)The International Cycling Union awarded the 1973 world cycling championships today to Spain. Canada will be host to the races in 1974.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am gravely disturbed by the activities of big labor.

title: Money Market Bolstered; Floating Prime Rate Cut
Nixon, With Special Regrets, Accepts Resignation of Two
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 26 (AP)President Nixon ac cepted today with special re gret and praise for their gov ernment service the resignations of Philip H. Trezise as Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, and Charles D. Baker as Assistant Secretary of Trans portation for Policy and Inter national Affairs.

title: INDIA SAYS FORCE ENTERED PAKISTAN FOR SECOND TIME
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 26Indian officials said today that Indian troops had crossed the border into East Pakistan second time in what they de scribed as defehsive action against heavy attacks by Pak istani forces.

title: Dance: Holiday Glitter
description: What a very good program for Thanksgiving the New York City Ballet provided at the New York State Theater on Thursday night. First we had Jerome Robbins's Dances at a Gathering, with all its pastoral virtues of harvest and peace, and the program ended with George Balanchine's Stars and Stripes, which, with its Sousa music and Yankee Doodle costumes, is as Amer ican as an old mailorder catalogue.

title: O'Reilly Basketball Starts
description: The second annual Al O'Reilly scholarship basketball tournament gets under way to day at 2 P.M. at the Friends Seminary, 222 East 16th Street, with teams representing WashI ington Heights, Fort Tryon,1 Morris Heights and Woodlawn. The final and consolation games will be played next Saturday at the same place.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Rose to 105.9 in the Week
Crafts, From Wooden Shoes to Bread Angels
U.S. Says Bid to U.N. on India And Pakistan Is Only Possibility
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The State. Department said to day that an appeal to the United Nations Security Coun cil was only one of several methods that might be adopted by the United States in an ef fort to halt hostilities between Indian and Pakistani forces.

title: State to Let U.S. Prosecute Garrison on 2 of 3 Charges
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26 The state dropped bribery and gambling charges today against District Attorney Jim Garrison.

title: Mills Asks Trade Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, a potential contender for the Democratic Presiden tial nomination, says that new foreigntrade legislation is need ed, but that the Nixon Admin istration has made no new pro posals.

title: Big October Trade Deficit Attributed to Dock Strikes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 With the figures distorted by dock strikes, the United States showed the largest trade defi cit in October since World War II, the ,Commerce Department reported today.

title: Key to the Mint Wins Remsen by Half a Length, With Determined Cosmic 2d
description: Key to the Mint took the long way around in the one mile Remsen at Aqueduct yes terday, but he got to the finish line in time just the same. The Rokeby Stable's Virginiabred, with Braulio Baeza riding, scored by half a length over Determined Cosmic, with Traf fic Cop next in the field of 12. The achievement provided an acceptable boon to the favorite players in the crowd of 29,537, who collected $3.60 for $2 straight.

title: Argentine Peso Declines To Low of Under 10 to $1
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 26The Argentine peso has fallen to the lowest level in its his tory, sinking to below 10 new pesos to the dollar on two suc cessive days.

title: Tremor Hits Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 (AP) A small earthquake jarred sections of Los Angeles this morning, causing phone calls to the police but no reported damage, the authorities said.

title: War Critics Conduct Fast
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., Nov. 26 (AP)A group called the Viet nam Veterans Against the War collected $200 for a South Vietnamese children's hospital Thanksgiving Day in an all day fast capped by a 10minute service at Plymouth Rock.

title: ECONOMIC GAUGE UP FOR OCTOBER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The composite index of leading indicators of the economy showed a strong rise in Octo ber on the basis of preliminary figures, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: KNICKS TURN BACK CELTICS BY 10489 FOR SIXTH IN ROW
Rhodesian Blacks Disappointed
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 26 (UPI)A black nationalist leader condemned the settle ment terms for Rhodesian in dependence today as a Brit ish sellout of the African peo ple.

title: Rail TonMileage Declined By 10.6% During the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Nov. 20 was below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: Soviet and China Clash Bitterly in U.N Debate on Disarmament
Hanoi Joins With Peking In Hard Line
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 26China and North Vietnam re stated today a tough, nocoin promise line on the Indochina war in a joint communiqu marking the end of a goodwill visit to Peking by Premier Pham Van Dong of North Viet nam.

title: Panel to Hear Grievances Of. Rahway Prison Inmates
description: WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov. 26Gov. William T. Cahill named a fiveman panel today to meet with five repre sentatives whom inmates at Rahway State Prison will select to discuss their grievances.

title: U.S. Officials Stress Aid to Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 26United States military and civilian officials here have lately begun talking privately about a deeper American com mitment to Cambodia.

title: WideRanging Agenda Seen
description: LONDON, Nov. 26Officials here expect that the world monetary crisis and relations between the United States and an enlarged European Common Market will head a widerang ing agenda during the Heath Nixon discussions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your recent editorial Youth and Age on the Hill appears the follow ing sentence: A mandatory Con gressional retirement age of 75 or 80 is a reform that should go hand in hand with a lowering of the age bar rier at the other end.

title: Africans See Rhodesia Pact as Sellout
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopa, Nov. 26 (UPI)The Organization of African Unity said today that the Rhodesian agreement was an outright sellout by Brit ain and urged Africans to take matters into their own hands to assert their rights.

title: LEO DURBIN
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Ind., Nov. 26 (AP)Leo Durbin, who operated a popular restaurant and fa thered a family of hotel execu tives, died today in an Indian apolis hospital, after a short ill ness. He was 72 years old.

title: Stars Terms Soviet Trip Extremely Successful
description: MOSCOW, Nov, 26Secre tary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said today that his trip to the Soviet Union had been extremely successful and that his talks with Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin and So viet ministers had left him with the feeling that a water shed had been created in rela tions with the Soviet Union.

title: Dave Anderson
description: With the whistling of Sweet Georgia Brown, the Harlem Globetrotters dribble comically throughout the world. Into one arena tonight, into another the next, they're sport's missionaries of laughter.

title: Ford Plant to Close A Week in Dearborn
description: The Ford Motor Company an nounced yesterday that it would close its carassembly plant in Dearborn, Mich., next week for one week. The closing will af fect about 3,200 workers.

title: Jonas Is Player of Year
description: VANCOUVER, Nov. 26 (UPI) Don Jonas, the quarterback of the Winnipeg Blue Bombers, was named today the player of the year in the Canadian Foot ball League.

title: Nathan Rosenstein Dead at 67; Textile Industrialist, Inventor
description: HARTFORA, Nov. 26  Na than Rosenstein, a textile in dustrialist and inventor, died of a heart attack in Mount Sinai Hospital today. He was 67 years old and lived at 66 Foxcroft Road in West Hartford.

title: Books of The Times
description: Although they differ in everything else, these two novels have one trait in common. They show that when it comes to reaching for power, advantage and money the lofti est professional practice can be an exten sion of the lowliest commercial enterprise.

title: Prison Area Is Calm After 24 Hour Riot
description: WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov. 26We talked in here last night about the riot, said Charles Muchanic as he drank a beer and watched a basketball game on the color television set in Bren nan's, a bar on Route 1 where guards at the nearby Rahway state prison often stop after work.

title: School Bus Companies Get New Rate Increases
description: The Price Commission ruled yesterday that the three bus companies that transport. 108, 500 New York City, schoolchil dren daily could increase their rates. The ruling apparently, will mean an end to a conflict that several times since Sep tember has threatened to cause a strike.

title: Close of 2 Metal Refiners Hasa Wide Effect in Utah
description: SALT LAME CITY, Nov. 26The closing of two major mill ing and refinery operations in Utah the last few weeks is having a domino effect in the lead, zinc and silver mines throughout the region. Oldtime operators are already likening the picture to the DepreSsion years, in which a majority of the West's. hardrock mines were shut down: and have not been reoperied.

title: Mrs. Raymond Buckman, Kindergartner for 30 Years
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 26Mrs. Julia Petzen Buckman, a kindergartner for 30 years, died yesterday of cancer in Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre. She was 53 years old and lived at 61 Stratford Road.

title: RISE IN ASIAN FLU FORESEEN OVER U.S.
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 26 (UPI)The Center for Disease Control warned today that outbreaks of Asian or Hong Kong flu were likely this winter in the United States.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: VICTORIA FALLS, RhodesiaIt Is 116 years since David Livingstone found the falls. His statue, arms akimbo, looks out over the incredible sightthe milewide Zambesi falling twice as far as Niagara, the, spray filling the air with rainbows.

title: Weather Hampers Search For Parachuting Hijacker
description: WOODLAND, Wash., Nov. 26 F.B.I. agents and sheriff's dery ties, plagued by low tlouds and fog that hindered ,both helicopter and ground efforts, searched the woods and farmlands near here today for the hijacker they believe parachuted into the area from ,a Northwest Airlines 727 with $200,000 in ransom money.

title: Kent State Defendant Admits He Hampered Firemen
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Nov. 26The first of 25 persons indicted in connection with the disor ders at Kent State University admitted today that he had interfered with firemen in their vain attempt to save the cam pus Reserve Officer Training Corps building from destruc= tion by a mob on May 2, 1970.

title: Democrats'
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 26A taxpayers' suit challenging the legality of the Nassau County budget proposed for next year by, County EXecutive Ralph G. Caso was, filed in State Supreme Court here to day.

title: Thant, His Ulcer Healed, To Leave Hospital Today
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 26Secretary General Thant's office announced today that he would be able to return home tomorrow morning from LeRoy Hospital, where he has been under treatment since Nov. 2 for a bleeding duodenal ulcer.

title: KANSAS REPUBLICAN JOINS FOES OF BUTZ
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) A Republican farm belt Sena tor appealed to President Nixon today to withdraw the nomina tion of Earl L. Butz for Agricul ture Secretary.

title: 5 NATIONS DECLARE ASIAN PEACE ZONE
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 26Five Southeast Asian nations decided today to declare their region a zone of peace, freedom and neutrality, the Malaysian Prime Minister, Ab dul Razak, said.

title: Carolyn S. Ellis John Bulbrook Marry at M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 26Miss Carolyn Sue Ellis, daughter of Christopher Ellis of Springfield and the late Mrs. Ellis, was married here this evening to John Marshall Bulbrook of Boston, a found er and board chairman of Family Funding, Inc., a finan cial services company. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Marshall Bulbrook of Fort Worth, Tex.

title: WITNESS FOR PEACE TO BEGIN TOMORROW
description: A nationwide interreligious movement of witness concern ing the moral issues in the In dochina war will be started tomorrow with prayers for peace and justice in front of the White House and in churches across the country.

title: London Orders End of Caning of Pupils
description: LONDON, Nov. 26Caning was ordered banned today in London's elernentary schools, over the angry objections of head teachers and principals.

title: General Bids Paris Scrap Secret Service
description: PARIS, Nov. 26One of the country's more prestigious fig ures called today for the dis solution of the French secret service, which had been wracked by scandals involving drugs, counterfeiting and treason.

title: The Army's Underground Press
description: STANFORD, Calif.So you're the editor of a G.I. antiwar paper and you want to go overground and distribute on post with the blessing of the brass. It can be done, but gird yourself for an extended conflict.

title: The opening bars d tez Confrers Kitten on the Keys
description: Zez Confrey, the jazz pianist best knoWn for is Kitten the Keys, died Monday of. stroke in the :Paul. Kimball Hos pital in.,LakeWOod, N. J. He was 76 years old and made MS home ,in,Lalsewood.

title: DR. F. H. McKEE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 26 Dr. Frederick H. McKee, who practiced medicine in New York City for almost 40 years, died yesterday. He was 70 years old and lived at 139 Seaton Road.

title: HENRY B. HERMAN, WISCONSIN U. AIDE
description: Henry B. Herman, associate director of the University of Wisconsin Memorial Union, student activities center at the Madison campus, died Thurs day in Madison of a heart ail ment. His age was 57.

title: Colgate and Clarkson Gain In Upstate Hockey Festival
description: POTSDAM, N. Y., Nov. 26Colgate University scored three powerplay goals to defeat St. Lawrence University, 32, to night in the second round of the North Country Thanksgiv ing Hockey Festival.

title: U.S. Power Outlook Better But Shortages Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Electric power brownouts and blackouts are less likely this winter than last but still pos sible, especially in the East Cen tral and Pacific Northwestern areas, the Federal Power Com mission said today.

title: CONNALLY TAX AID STIRS QUESTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The recent disclosure that a pending tax bill that was ap proved by the Treasury Depart ment would primarily benefit, a ,company in which Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally owns a substantial ,amount of stock raised questions in Con gress today about the prospects of the legislation.

title: MEETING OF GATT ENDS WITH SPLIT
description: GENEVA, Nov. 26 Britain and Ireland joined the Euro pean Econdmic Community to day in opposing action called for by the, United States and most of the other leading in dustrial countries for seeking solutions to world trade prob lems next year.

title: 286 FIREMEN FILE CLAIMS OF INJURY
description: Claims of injury after fight ing fires rose yesterday to the highest daily total since fire men began their war of nerves with the city a week and half ago.

title: Boy Dies, a 2d Saved As Rock Salt Pile In Queens Caves In
description: An 11yearold Queens boy playing on a twostoryhigh pile of rock salt in the yard of a Queens Village coal and rock company died yesterday when the huge mound collapsed and buried him. Another boy buried with him was rescued by a worker in the yard.

title: Supreme Soviet Endorses Budget and FiveYear Plan
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 (AP)The Supreme Soviet, or parlia ment, endorsed today the state budget for 1972 and the fiveyear plan for 197175.

title: Most Dock Workers Told To Return to Jobs at Once
description: Federal judges in six of 12 districts covering the *Atlantic and Gulf ports, acting after President Nixon had invoked the TaftHartley Act, ordered longshoremen yesterday to re turn to work for a 10day coolingoff period.

title: 100,000 Uruguay Leftists Hold a Victory Rally Ahead of the Poll
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 26  Uruguay's popular front coalition, which is attempting to follow the Chilean way to power, held a roaring victory rally for well over 100,000 peo ple here Wednesday night, and its presidential candidate de clared, Comrades, the front has already triumphed!

title: Flatbush's HairStyling Hero
description: In between the rapid click click of his scissors and the wise cracks of waiting cus tomers (I've been coming here now for four years and both haircuts were good), the champion men's hair sty ist of the recent 1971 Na tional Barber Show at the Statler Hilton told how he outclipped, combed, brushed, Snipped and sprayed his way to victory against 52 other competitors from around the country.

title: U.S. Delegation Large
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (Reuters) Treasury Secretary John B. Connally will be ac companied by the. Federal Re serve Board chairman, Arthur M. Burns and Treasury Under Secretary Paul A. Volcker when the Secretary leaves here to morrow to attend the Group of 10 meeting in Rome, the Treas ury announced today.

title: Migrant Workers: WorstHoused Group in the Nation
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., Nov. 25  The cherries and apples have all been picked, so the people have moved out of the barn and it is time to move the cattle back in.

title: Betrayal, Zambia Says
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Nov. 26Zambia's two national dailies said today that the Salisbury settlement was a betrayal, of Rhodesia's five million Africans.

title: U.S. Dollar Drops Again
description: PARIS, Nov. 26The dollar was buffeted again today in the major foreignexchange centers, a few days before highlevel meetings in Rome that could bring the monetary crisis a step nearer solution.

title: Film: Portraits of 2 Artists:' Ciao Federico,' 'Two Audiences' Begin Run
description: The temptation to study artists rather than their works is an admission of human weaknessthe desire to know about, rather than to knowthat at one level of sophistication or another has promoted most of the journalistic writing about movies so far and is now beginning to promote actual movies as well. Both Gideon Bachmann's "Ciao Federico" and Mark Woodcock's "Two American Audiences," playing this weekend and next at the Film Forum, are directors' studies and both succeed in revealing something about an artist's mode of being, but nothing much about the meaning of his work."Two American Audiences," which has been seen here before, intercuts a filmed seminar with Jean-Luc Godard and a group of New York Univeresity students, with scenes from 'La Chinoise," the movie under discussion. Godard is polite, patient and articulate (so are the students), and he can say what he felt he was doing, but, of course, not what his movie is.The chopped-up bits of "La Chinoise" say even less about the movie, and the dreadful color reproduction renders it an outright disservice. There is simply no reason for his film, which could as well have been a taped transcript, and the "La Chinoise" anthology looks as if it had been added to provide a reasonas have the cinematics, the insistent and offensive zoom shots into the faces of the student questioners."Ciao Federico" has its share of idiot zooms, and also its own "Ciao Federico" theme song, and certain pretensions to being a piece of moviemaking in its own right. Although there is a lot about it I don't like (including the zooms and the theme song) I think it succeeds as moviemaking. And it offers some quite sinfully fascinating glimpses of life on the location of "Fellini Satyricon" as well.Fellini himself, as the subject of "Ciao Federico," provides a center of attention, but the film is immensely, sometimes too energetically aware of peripheries as well. The very setsTrimalchio's villa, the villa of the suicides, especialy that great imprbable construction, the ship upon which Lichas (Alain Cuny) marries the young hero, Encolpius (Martin Potter)which define a world half clumsy mechanics, half frenzied imagination. And the actors who populate that world, their faces masked, their souls brilliantly displayed, bring it to a life that is never so theatrical as when it is striving for contact with the real.Of course the film means to give some sense of how Fellini works as a director (and it does), but it is at its best in showing what he works throughthe incredible crowded activity that annoys him but ultimately sustains him.Bachmann is not above seeking sensation. Occasionally he is sensationally rewardedas when a little man shows up on the set with a ravishing blonde, and he begins recommending to Fellini the bizarre delights of Disneyland. Suddenly you realize that the little man is Roman Polanski, and the blonde, graceful, cool, quiet and aloof from the prevailing madness, is of course Sharon Tate.I doubt that a taste for sensationalism does much disservice to the Fellini happenings. It gives you something of the man, if nothing of the master. And in this case the man, more than most of his peers and even his betters, seems worth a movie. I should think that in the archives of the film-production branch of the human comedy, there is at least a minor place for the public intimacies of "Ciao Federico."

title: Some Immigrants In Israel Ask Return To Georgia in Soviet
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 26Several dozen immigrant families from the Soviet Republic of Georgia want to go back there, it was reported here today.

title: French Version of S.E.C. Unexpectedly Effective

title: Executive Changes
description: Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corporation, Houston, announced yes terday the appointment of G. Montgomery Mitch ell as president, chief ex ecutive officer, and a director of the major supplier of gas to the Metropolitan New York New Jersey area. Mr. Mitchell, 43 years old, re places James B. Hender son, who has requested an early retirement. Mr. Mitchell, who has been serving as executive vice president since Septem ber, 1971, came to the company from Stone & Webster Management Consultants, Inc., and Stone & Webster Canada, Ltd., where he was a vice president. Also announced was the mandatory re tirement of John F. Burton as senior vice president. He will be succeeded by Francis J. Quinn.

title: Filion Sets a Trot Record Of 487 With 4 Victories
description: YONKERS, Nov. 26At 9:52 tonight, Hervd Filion drove the New Zealandbred Rannach Boy to victory in the fifth race at Yonkers Raceway. That tri umph, by threequarters of length, was the 486th of the season for the man from Angers, Quebec, and it tied his world record for the most firsts in a single season set last year.

title: Libya to Get British Cows

title: Art: Michael Mazur Shifts Direction
description: The Michael Mazur who some years back proved that he is a firstrate printmaker in traditional techniques is difficult to associate with the work in a new exhibition at the Finch College Museum of Art, 62 East 78th Street, not because of any deteriora tion but because of a drastic shift in medium and direc tion. The man who was a master of. the stylus is now a master of the airbrush and is the only artist I can think of, unless you want to in clude advertising art and its bastard offspring, pop, in whose hands the airbrush is anything but a degrading convenience.

title: Tarkenton in Warren Spahn Mold
description: As perhaps the quietest week of the entire season for the New York Giants draws to a closewith no injuries, no new players, no new disappearances and no high drama inherent in tomorrow's matchup with the St. Louis Cardinalsan appro priate mpmtin, occurs to con template the statistical achieve ments of Fran Tarkenton.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 27John G. Ryan, Massachusetts Insurance Commissioner, is expected to announce soon a decrease of up to 30 per cent in basic rates far the state's limited nofault auto insurance.

description: Since the guitarthe classic, acoustic guitar at leastso often encourages a kind of pri vate navelgazing among its practitioners, it was a pleasure to find Carmen Marina com municating with forthright mu sical energy Friday night in Carnegie Recital Hall.

description: To the Editor:

title: The World
description: MONTEVIDEOElections used to mean fun in Uruguay, with noisy rallies and broiled beef and red wine for campaign workers or anyone who stopped by a political clubhouse. The oldstyle happiness of a presidential campaign has lifted a mood of na tional depression in the past two months, but the elections today will be held in a newstyle world full of trouble and few easy choices.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Bill Cunningham scored 23 points tonight in leading the Philadelphia 76ers to a 11693 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 We are going through the old political nonsense here in Washington again. The old men are playing the old theatrical parts. George Meany is scalding President Nixon as if he were Herbert Hoover. John Connally is cuffing the finance ministers of the world as if they were lobbyists in Austin, Texas. It is all very familiar and very much out of date. For the oldboy network is in trouble.

title: Mayo Foundation to Open Medical School Next Fall
description: The trustees of the Mayo Foundation have announced plans for the opening of a fouryear Mayo Medical School in Rochester, Minn., in Septem ber, 1972. Classes are to begin next Sept. 11.

title: Mother of Us All Pays Tribute to Thomson at 75
description: Of all the tributes Virgil Thomson received in the public celebration of his 75th birth day, none, surely, was brighter and more touching than the new production of The Mother of Us All at Saint Peter's Church on West 20th Street. The opera, which he composed in 1946 to Gertrude Stein's text about women's Suffrage, opened on Thanksgiving Day, his birth day, and had three Perfor mances, the last of which, alas, was given last night.

title: MIDDIE BID FAILS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27When Navy midshipmen set the tail end of a papier mache Army mule on fire before the game today, the Philadelphia Fire Department extinguished the blaze. But when the Navy football team stirred some potentially volatile sparks late in the game, the Army defense was able to douse them by itself.

title: Eddie Lopez, Humorist, Is Dead; Columnist for The San Juan Star

title: Weimar Intellectuals in New York
description: Intellectuals, like fish, often move in schools, following a leader. Where he goes, they go; and where he goes wrong, they are often close behind.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISPresident Nixon's yearend consultations with West European leaders are of critical importance. A way out of the current monetary crisis and an escape from serious depression threats depend on the decisions reached. For, at present, there is deepening gulf between the transAtlantic allies and a feeling on this side of the ocean that American protectionism menaces the economic future.

title: Alpine Skiing Starts This Week but Confusion Over Olympics Clouds Outlook
description: GENEVA, Nov. 27The Alpine ski season will begin next weekend, but it is not yet clear whether Gustavo Theoni of Italy and AnneMarie Proell of Austria should be listed as favorites for Olympic gold medals.

title: Sports of The Times
description: John Brodie threw his first touchdown pass for the San Francisco 49ers in 1957, the, same year that Joe Namath entered Beaver Falls High School in Pennsylvania. Each has since achieved recognition as great quarterback and yet their paths have never crossedexcept socially. The possibility exists, though, that they may have such a professional confrontation at Shea Stadium today when the 49ers play the New York Jets for the first time.

title: Local
description: Lincoln completed an undefeated season yesterday by scoring the first three times it had the ball and routing Wingate, 500. The victory was the eighth for the Abes, who lost the Public Schools Athletic League Brooklyn Division championship to Jefferson, the city champions, because the Jeffs scored more points against common opponents.

title: Miss Elizabeth A. Bisso Bride Of Lieut. Frederic H. Morris
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27 Miss Elizabeth Ann Bisso, daughter of Mrs. Joseph Au gust Bisso, 2d and the lete Mr. Bisso, was married here at noon today to Lieut. Fred eric Halsey Morris, U.S.N.R., son of Mr. and. Mrs. Grinnell Morris of Oyster Bay, L. I. The ceremony in the Holy Name of Jesus Roman Catho lic Church was performed by the Rev. Sidney Tonsmeir.

description: Striking New York Telephone Company workers voted yester day to continue their 19week old walkout at a noisy and tu multuous meeting in Madison Square Garden.

title: Gladys Cooper 18891971
description: I ONLY knew Gladys when she was already oldold in years, she was not old in any conventional sense. She was totally enviable her vi tality, her beauty, ner astuteness. If one could grow more like Gladys as one grew older, then growing old would be desirable.

title: Reader's Report
description: Janet Sandison is the fictional heroine of the My Friend series of novels by Jane Duncan. Now the author has struck out on a new tangent under this homegrown pseudonym, in what is announced as the first of a quartet of novels. (The next three are probably just around the corner; Miss Duncan's works hit you as fast as did The Bobbsey Twins.) This one takes the heroine from age 5 to early teens in a workingclass Glasgow suburb, circa 1910. The storytelling is hypnotic; the author, in full cry, is an ebullient romancer, brimming with 110proof enthusiasm.

title: Public to Scrutinize Budget for Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L.I.The proposed Nassau County budget for next year, which calls for record expenditures of $426million, is expected to be the target of criticism from various quarters tomorrow at two public hearings. The proposed budget calls for an increase of $65million.

title: C. Douglas Dillons Fete Granddaughter
description: C. Douglas Dillon, former Secretary of the Treasury and Ambassador to France, and Mrs. Dillon gave a dinner at the St. RegisSheraton Penthouse last night for their debutante granddaugh ter, Miss Joan D. Moseley. Additional guests came in later for the dance that fol lowed in the adjoining St. Regis Roof, where Peter Duchin played and a supper of pancakes and scrambled eggs was served.

But if you've never been to oneseen the pony pulls or walked the dusty midwayyou can still have second best; you can go to the fair at Corgiville.

description: It was no accident that when the first engineer set foot on the site of the planned lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, his most furious adversary was an elderly woman. Though she was small and frail her anger was towering.

title: Music
description: WHEN George London started canceling all his operatic engagements in 1966 and 1967, there was a great deal of speculation about what was wrong. Obviously something had hap pened to his voice, and rumorsmalicious and sympathetic  attributed the cause to everything from a bad vocal method to a hernia of the diaphragm. To anyone who cared about opera, the bassbaritone's in ability to sing was a tragedy, for he was one of the finest artists around. Any role he tookBoris, Don Gio vanni, Amfortas, Scarpia, the Dutchman, Mandryka was richly sung, authoritatively characterized, beauti fully performed.

title: In Vietnam, the Children Paint Images of War and Peace and Love.

They scurried about, dipping little plastic cups and metal trays into a bucket of water in preparation for a twohour competition, Vietnam's fourth annual children's drawing contest.

title: Photography
description: SOME photographs can be looked at singly; others must be seen in groups in order to make sense. The December shows at the Witkin and Un derground galleries contain both kinds.

title: HOBIE CAT REGATTA IS LED BY LOUSEK
description: APOLLO BEACH, Fla., Nov. 27 (AP)  Richard Lousek of Camarillo, Calif., leads a field of 50 skippers in the Hobie Cat14 national sailing regatta after the second day of competition. He posted 14th, first and secondplace finishes today in his 14foot catamaran. LQusek has the leading lowpoint total of 19 points, including one throwaway.

description: An investigation of the Off track Betting Corporation was asked yesterday by City Council President Sanford D. Garelik.

description: TEANECK, N.J., Nov. 27 Mr. and Mrs. Edgar S. Zorn have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Elyse Summer Zorn, to Alan Michael Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Cohen of Winthrop, Mass.

title: Bridge Are your circuits open?

To maintain harmony and an open circuit, heroic measures may be necessary. Keeping a road open was the problem for the defenders on the diagramed deal, played this month in the Keystone Regional Championships in York, Pa.

title: BLAST NEAR ISRAEL KILLS 4 LEBANESE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27 The death of a Lebanese Army officer and three soldiers in an explosion on a mined road near the border with Israel yester day has reopened the issue of the relations between Lebanen and the Palestinian guerrillas.

title: CRIME INSURANCE IS REVISED BY U.S.
description: The administrator of the Federal Government's crime in surance program has warned that unless the sale of policies increases substantially in the next four months the Govern ment will bypass the private insurance industry and sell the insurance itself.

title: JOSEPH M'LEMORE, LAWYER, 72, DEAD
description: Joseph L. McLemore, a law yer and Bronx civic leader, who was said to be the first Negro nominated for Congress by the Democratic party, died Satur day in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 800 Concourse Village West, the Bronx.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONOn the face of it, the Nixon Administration's economic stabilization machine seemed to be sputtering badly last week. Democrats, labor leaders and consumer spokesmen had been suspicious from the start but with Phase Two in only its sec ond week, even some businessmen were grumbling.

title: David Morley Rathbun Marries Anne B. Burke
description: MISQUAMICUT, R.I., Nov. 27  Miss Anne Bridget Burke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs, John S. Burke Jr. of New York and Watch Hill, R.I., was married here this afternoon In St. Clare's Ro man. Catholic Church to David Morley Rathbun of Stonington, Conn., son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert W. Rath bun Jr. of Avondale, R.I. The Rev. Thomas J. Connellan performed the ceremony, as sisted by the Rev. Harold Flynn, after which a recep tion was given at Road's End, the oceanside home of the bride's parents at Watch Hill.

title: Keller Speed Skating Victor
description: INZELL, Germany, Nov. 27 (UPI)An Olympic gold medalist, Erhard Keller of West Germany, won the 500meter race in an Invitation speed skating meet today in 38.8 seconds, the best time in the world this season.

title: The Nation
description: The place a man lives is more than just another commodity, wrote the President's Committee on Urban Hous ing several years ago. It is a symbol of his status, an extension of his per sonality, a part of his identity, a deter minant of many of the benefitsand disadvantages  of society that will come to him and his family: school ing, police protection, municipal serv ices, neighborhood environment, access (or lack of access) to a hundred possi bilities of life and culture.

title: Playboy Intellectuals in Chicago
description: Invitations to be the guests of Playboy magazine at a convocation in Chicago the week of Oct. 5 were accepted by 71 distinguished writers, academicians, journalists, scientists, politicians and opinionmakers. Seldom have so many important literary figures gathered together at one time and seldom has so little been said about it afterwards. One member of the groupwhich will probably go down in literary history as The Chicago 71 agreed to share his thoughts.

title: Fiedler Returns to the Outboard World Title Race
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 27 (AP)Bill Sirois of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., took up where he left off last year and led the 1971 $62,750 Outboard World Championship at the end of the first day in ideal racing weather on the Colorado River today.

title: Soviet and China, Feuding Ideologically at U.N., Are Seen as Asking Rest of World to Choose Sides
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 27The Union and China have carried their ide ological conflict to the United Nations and, in effect, asked the rest of the world to choose sides.

title: Miss Gervais Plans Nuptials
description: Miss MarieClaude Gervais and Frederick J. C. Butler of New York plan to be married Dec. 11 in Paris, where Mrs. Jeanine Acker has announced the engagement of her daugh ter to the son of Mrs. Gilbert Butler of Utica and the late Mr. Butler.

title: ExNavy Man Tends U.N.'s 75,000 Maps
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 27When I got out of the Navy I wanted to be at the hub of the world, said Nathaniel O. Abelson, speak ing in slow rhythms that re called his native Alabama. So I came here. And here I am.

title: Miss Tammis P. Forshay Plans Wedding to Jeffrey L. Greene
description: SETAUKET, L.I., Nov. 27 Miss Tammis Putnam For shay, a research assistant with Yale University, has made plans to be married next July to Jeffrey Latimer Greene.

title: Criminals At Large
description: We have had East Indian detectives, and Red Indian detectives, and Chinese detectives, and mixedbreed detectives. In Martin Smith's GYPSY IN AMBER (Putnam's, $4.95) there is a Gypsy detective. Roman Gry (Anglicized to Grey) is an antique dealer, and a successful one, but under his swarthy skin are 5,000 years of heritage in magic and the arcane arts.

title: The World
description: ISLAMABAD  All week long Pak istan's newspapers and broadcasting stations told the people of war with India.

title: ROBERT K. REDWOOD
description: Robert K. Redwood, treas urer and director of E. W. Axe & Co., of Tarrytown, N. Y., investment counsel and man agement concern for Axe Houghton mutual funds, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home. He was 50 years old and lived at 68 Hampton Oval, New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: ARKANSAS TECH WINS IN N.A.I.A. PLAY, 240
description: RUSSELLVILLE. Ark., Nov. 27 (AP)  Phil Fisher completed nine of 16 passes for 192 yards and threw two touchdown passes to lead Arkansas Tech to a 240 victory over Northern State of South Dakota in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics Division 1 playoff today.

title: Florida Routs Miami
description: MIAMI, Nov. 27 (AP)Florida's John Reaves passed for 348 yards to surpass by 5 yards Jim Plunkett's national record with 7,549 career yards tonight as the Gators walloped Miami, 4516, in the Orange Bowl.

title: Americana, citystyle and countrystyle
description: Nikki Giovanni's poems for children, like her adult works, exhibit a combination of casual energy and sudden wit. No cheekpinching auntie, she explores the contours of childhood with honest affection, sidestepping both nostalgia and condescension. Her poems focus on the experiences of childrennaps and baths and getting bigger, dreams and fears and growing up.

title: Miss Frances C. Edmondson Married to David T. Sargent
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Nov. 27 Miss Frances Cooke Ed mondson, formerly of Scars dale,. N.Y., and David Thom as Sargent of Boston, were married here this afternoon in the chapel of the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. H. L. Wilson of the Colonial Presbyterian Church in Norfolk.

title: Jordan Reports Ambush
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 27 (UPI)A Government spokes man said that Palestinian guer rillas ambushed a Jordanian Army scurity patrol from inside the Syrian border today, killing one officer and wounding a sec ong. The incident was the first reported by Jordan in more than two months.

title: Son to Mrs. Robert Kheel
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Kheel of 175 Riverside Drive on Tuesday in the New York Hospital. Mrs. Kheel is the former Miss Shirley Ann Dungan, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. James O. Dungan of Rochester. The child, who is a grandson also of Theodore W. Kheel, law yer and labor mediator, and Mrs. Kheel of Riverdale, the Bronx, is named Daniel John. His father is a lawyer with Willkie Farr & Gallagher.

title: Packers Start Starr Today
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 27 (UPI) Coach Dan Devine of Green Bay said today that Bart Starr would get the starting call at quarterback tomorrow when the Packers meet the New Orleans Saints. Starr has not seen any action this season after two operations in his throwing arm.

title: Hospital Names 3 Trustees
description: Three new members have been elected trustees of the BronxLebanon Hospital Cen ter. They are Harold S. Gelb, managing partner of the ac counting firm of S. D. Leides dorf & Co.; Erwin L. Klineman, first vice president of Leslie Fay, Inc., a clothing concern, and Mrs. Molly Berns, widow of Charles A. Berns, the late founder and chairman of the board of 21 Brands, Inc., who was vice president of the hospital center when he died last February.

title: Premier Thanom Names New 5Man Thai Cabinet
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Field Marshal Thanom Kittikachorn has named a new fiveman Thai Government to replace the one that was terminated in a blood less military coup on Nov. 17.

These are usually semipostal stamps stamps with a double denom ination, one for prepayment of postage, the other a con tribution to the charity or youth program. The stamps are also usually linked to the Christmas season.

title: McLean Most Valuable
description: Ken McLean, senior middle linebacker from Drayton Plains, has been elected Northern Michigan's most valuable football player.

title: Strangers at the Door By Marcus Bach. 189 pp. Nashville: Abingdon Press. $3.95.
description: Marxists and Darwinians and Freudians have predicted that as science expands, religion will contract. So far, at least in the United States, the evidence is dubious. There have been, in fact, two distinct phases of religious surge since World War II. The first, in the 1940's and early 1950's, was toward the traditional church and synagogue. Then followed a period of statistical decline; the religious impulse, particularly among the young, seemed to find its main outlet in social activism and revolutionmovements.

title: Assessing Talent
description: The City Council of Clear view, Kan., is in session and its six members are debating how to utilize best a Fed eral grant of $1million. In the course of the onehour meeting, each councilman makes a pitch for his pet pro jects and then engages in a ?? of war with the others before a final determination is made as to which facili ties get the municipal nod.

title: Bank Aide Fiance Of Mary Reighley
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 27Mr. and Mrs. H. Ward Reighley of New Canaan and Nantucket, Mass., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Gil lian Reighley to Frank Crouch Brooks Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Brooks of Baltimore. A May wedding is planned.

title: Mideast First Team Wins In Women's Field Hockey
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 27Sue Wilkins scored the goal as the Mideast first team from the New York area defeated the New Atlantic first team from New Jersey, 10, as the 50th anniversary tournament of the United States Women's Field Hockey Association continued in heavy rain today at West Chester State College.

title: SAIGON OFFENSIVE IN CAMBODIA LAGS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27 (AP)A South Viet namese general said today he did not expect to find sizable enemy forces in eastern Cam bodia, raising doubts about the nature of a 25,000Man Vietna mese operation there.

title: News of Camera World
description: A SERIES of instantload cameras (they take No. 126 cartridge film) with builtin electronic flash to permanently eliminate the need for flash bulbS or flash cubes is now available from the Keystone division of Ber key Photo, Inc., Keystone Place, Paramus, N.J. 07652. There are three models: the Everflash 10, the Everflash 20 and the Everflash 30. All three have the same builtin electronic flash that takes pictures for about one cent each (the prorated cost of the batteries), as compared to about 15 cents per shot for flashcubes. All three have indoor/outdoor switches, solid state circuitry and a flash ready light. The Ever flash 10 (suggested price un der $40) has an f/8 lens. The Everflash 20 (suggested price $51.95) and Everflash 30) sug gested price under $65) both have f/5.6 lenses and auto matic electric eye exposure control. The 30 model also has rechargeable nickel cad mium batteries and a charger.

title: Israeli Liqueur In the U.S.
description: A man who was born in France, raised in Germany, and fought in the British and Israeli air forces, is now supervising the worldwide sale of Sabra, the Israeli liqueur.

title: Art
description: BEFORE setting down for the rec ord a flat statement such as Nancy Grossman is the most im pressive young American artist I know of, a critic must look two or three times again at what he is saying, must think about it from various angles (Should it be sculptor instead of the more inclusive artist? Should Ameri can be taken out or left in to indicate, as it is supposed to do, that your ac quaintance with young artists outside America is limited?), should consider the wisdom of modifying his pronounce ment by enlarging that I know of as a loophole, and might even examine the safety factors in a toneddown intro duction such as Nancy Grossman, a young American artist now having a oneman show at Cordier & Ekstrom, 980 Madison Avenue at 76th Street, seems to be on her way to fulfilling the promise that has made her work inter in earlier group showa.

title: Merry Criminals!
description: SCREENWRITERS David Newman and Robert Benton, who did their best by a couple of tricky law breakers of the thirties in Bonnie and Clyde, are going to devote their time and talent to a crew of contempo rary crooks in their next film, Money's Tight. Not only will the thrillerto be shot here in March for Hillard Elkins's Epic Productionsbe penned by New man and Benton, but it will represent the directorial debut of Newman, as well. And Elkins is currently negotiating with George C. Scott to coproduce the movie and to serve as one of its stars.

title: Bergen
description: Mitch Harley of Hackensack finished the season with 92 points yesterday as he led his team to a 146 victory over nonwinning Teaneck. Harley scored both Hackensack touchdowns after Earl Drakeford had given Teaneck a 60 lead with a 20yard sweep.

title: BEALL IS OUSTED AS BAYLOR COACH
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Baylor's athletic director, Jack Patterson, announced today that Bill Beall's contract as head football coach had been terminated by mutual agreement.

title: Campaign Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Former President Lyndon B. Johnson says that he will support the Democratic Pres idential nominee next year, no matter whom the party chooses.

title: IN THE NATION
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Nov. 26This was the kind of day to make city dweller want to chuck it all and move back to nature. Whitecaps played like froth on Nantucket Sound and a fresh cold wind exhilarated the brain. The air was so clear that from the hills behind Dionis Beach a reasonably sharp eye could spot the white lighthouse on Great Point; and brilliant autumn sunlight fell with particular radiance on the browns and golds of the moors.

title: Impresario Braves Odds When His Lyric Opera Company Makes L. I. Debut Dec.11
description: Opera may be a necessity or a luxury, depending on how you look at it, but there is no denying that it is costly. Forming an opera company is about as risky as crossing Niagara Falls on a tightrope, but it doesn't stop people from trying.

title: Picasso Exhibitor Attacked
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  The owner of the Picasso Workshop art gallery, damaged by gasoline bombs five days ago, said he was at tacked and robbed today by three men, The incident was the latest in a series of attacks by rightists aimed at the work of Picasso.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Tiriac in Morocco Net Final
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Francois Jauffert of France and Ion Tiriac of Rumania will meet tomorrow in the men's singles final of the Moroccan international lawn tennis championships.

title: F.D.R. as an Investor
description: Franklin Delano Roose velt took a flier on 2,000 Shares, of Montacal Oil in 1923 at a cost of $4,000, or $2 a share, and by 1928 the investment had turned sour, plunging to 50 cents share, for a pape loss of $3,000.

title: Mrs. Crowe Married to John G. Flint Jr.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 27Mrs. Charlotte Parker Crowe and John Gardiner Flint Jr., an investment coun sellor, both of Greenwich, were married here this after noon in the Round Hill Com munity Church by the Rev. Jesse E. Thomas.

title: Everybody's Favorite Window
