description: Hey, there's one without curtains, said the young woman, tugging on her mate's left arm and pointing toward an apartment not far from Norman Mailer's house. Maybe it's for rent.

title: Dean Wylie Named Episcopal Bishop Of North Michigan
description: The Rev. Dr. Samuel J. Wylie, dean of General Theological Seminary here, has been elected Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Northern Michigan.

title: U.S. STUDENT LEADS IN BOWLING TRIALS
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27 (AP) Roger Dalkin of the United States emerged as the favorite in the World Cup bowling tournament today after he led the roundrobin qualifying by a 173pin margin over Steve Mackie of Australia.

title: CHUSID IS ACCUSED OF FALSE PROMISES
description: One of the country's leading executive counseling concerns, Frederick Chusid & Co., has been accused by the city's De partment of Consumer Affairs of falsely suggesting to its clients that it would find them jobs.

title: Long Island Arena Is Site This Week Of Skating Event
description: With a place on the United States Olympic team the ultimate goal, more than 160 figure skaters will compete in the North Atlantic championships next Thursday, Friday and Saturday at the Long Island Arena in Commack.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 27 (AP) Bill Turner, a reserve forward, scored 13 points in the final period tonight as the Golden State Warriors downed the Buffalo Braves, 11091.

title: Bright Stripes to Mark Boston's Transit Lines
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Boston's buses, trolleys and rapidtransit trains are about to be redecorated in bright, colorcoded stripes.

title: Jim Simons Is Named College Golfer of Year
description: Jim Simons, a senior majoring in physical education at Wake Forest University, has been named the college golfer of the year and will receive a new national award, to be given annually by Golf magazme.

title: Between The Anderson Tapes and The Andromeda Strain
description: Brian Moore wants us to switch images of Canada and to learn about the breeding of revolutionaries as we do it. Begone with redcoated, Rose Marie Canada, skiing in the Laurentians, and the greathearted wilderness of latent Thoreaus and The National Geographic. Insert instead the superghetto of French Quebec with 40 per cent of all Canadian unemployment; gas stations presided over by giant Monsieur Muffler mannequins; and malcontent Frenchspeaking white niggers of America, who invent heroic identities to compensate for the bastardized personality of a land they love but whose riches they cannot own.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Prison Walls Turning A Profit for Inmates
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., Nov. 27 (UPI)Prisoners are tearing down the walls at the Missouri State Prison and selling the pieces to souvenir hunters at 50 cents a chunk.

title: Peter Picked a Pip
description: THE guy's been an actor 20 years, give or take a couple of months; he's got so many awardsOscar nominations, Emmy nominations, Emmy herself he could open a used prize store, but until Thursday, Nov. 11, 1971, Peter Falk had never had a Broadway hit. (In 1964, when he played Stalin in The Passion of Josef D., the whole experience ran about an hour and a half; the audience ran longer.)

title: Real Nice Community Now Historic
description: For 23 years, Mrs. Beulah L. Piggott has looked out her front window at the Tudoresque lines of the Mount Lebanon. Baptist Church, which faces her neat brownstone house in Brooklyn's Stuyvesant Heights neighborhood.

title: CHINA SAYS MAO COMMANDS ARMY
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27Mao Tsetung appears to be exer cising direct command over China's armed forces follow ing what seems to be the fall from power of Defense Minister Lin Piao, Huang Yungsheng, Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces, and other top military leaders linked with Mr. Lin.

title: CALIFORNIA POLL ASSESSES AGNEW
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 Spiro T. Agnew as a running mate in 1972 will help President Nixon pacify critics in the Re publican party, but will be a detriment in his general election campaign, a California polltaker has found.

title: Fresh Air Fund Given $574,763 So Far in '71
description: Contributions from 16,688 donors to the Fresh Air Fund so far this year have totaled $574,763, according to Blancke Noyes, president of the fund. The goal for 1971 is $825,000.

title: MEDICAID IS LOST BY OPTICAL HOUSE
description: One of the city's largest op tical dealers has been suspend ed from participation in the. Medicaid program by the Health Department after in vestigators contended, among other things, that 71.2 per cent of service for 416 patients shied July was unsatisfactory or in volved substitution of materials.

title: Soviet Attempts to Clean Up Caspian to Revive Caviar Industry
description: BAKU, U.S.S.R., Nov. 19Soviet conservationists have just won a partial victory over industrial polluters in their campaign to clean up the Caspian Sea. But they hold out little prospect of restoring this region's famous black caviar industry to its former greatness.

title: Eisenhower Five Bows
description: SENECA FALLS, N. Y., Nov. 27 (AP)Paced by Bill Kennedy with 26 points, Hudson Valley Community College opened its basketball season today with a 9081 victory over Eisenhower College. Neil Kormer of Eisenhower had 36 points.

title: Good Samaritan Slain In East Village Holdup
description: A passerby who went to the aid of a man being robbed in an apartment house lobby was killed last night, the police said.

title: German Employer Solidarity Is Urged
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 27With half a million metal workers on strike or locked out of their factories, West Germany's bankers and manufacturers were asked by their national organization here tonight to stand firm and be prepared to make sacrifices for their longterm good and for the good of the economy.

title: WHAT'S WRONG
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: To Get Texas Cuisine to New York, This Tycoon Opened His Own Restaurant
description: To hear Clinton Williams (Clint) Mur chison Jr. tell it, New York hasn't a proper Texas barbecue and chili par lor, and, although the Dallas tycoon may be the only person to notice this cookery gap, he's doing something about it.

title: TUNA WAR STAND OF NAVY ASSAILED
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 27  The Navy was criticized here this week because the officers and men of a United States subma rine were entertained for three days as the goodwill guests of the Ecuadoran Navy at a time when the latter's gunboats were seizing American tuna boats off that country's coast.

title: Pacers Beat Cougars, 116110
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 27 (AP)George McGinnis left the bench and scored 29 points tonight, leading the Indiana Pacers to a 116110 triumph over the Carolina Cougars.

title: A Pan piping on the city streets
description: During the halcyon days of the Abstract Expressionist and Imaginative Realism movements, Frank O'Hara was the laureate of the New York art scene. From his posts as critic for Art News and curator at the Museum of Modern Art, he moved as a mercurial presence through the galleries and the studios of such painters as DeKooning and Larry Rivers, writing monographs about the new masters, encouraging the young, amusing with his talkand dashing off his poems at odd moments with an insouciance that was legendary. A fascinating amalgam of fan, connoisseur and propagandist, he was considered by his friends, in an excess of enthusiasm, the Apollinaire of his generation, an esthetic courtier who had taste and impudence and prodigious energy.

title: VITAMIN C STUDY REBUTS PAULING
description: A small but wellcontrolled study has yielded no support for the claim that large doses of vitamin C can prevent or re lieve the common cold.

title: R. D. Sipherd Weds Polly Starbuck
description: SANDY HOOK, Conn., Nov. 27Miss Polly Starbuck of New York, director of the Channel 13 Associates, the fund ?? and development group for WNET, was mar ried here this afternoon to Raymond D. Sipherd of New York and Sandy Hook, a writer for television's Ses ame Street. The Rev. Stan ley L. Houston, a Congrega tional Minister, performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's home.

title: Wishbone Is Not Answer to Pro Dreams
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 26The wishbone offense has become the new creative placing in football.

title: Central Islip Takes Crown in Suffolk, Beating East Islip
description: Central Islip, a strong candidate for the Rutgers Cup that goes to the best team in Suffolk County, won the League 3 championship yesterday by defeating East Islip, 166, on the loser's field. It was the sixth victory for oncetied Central Islip.

title: Recordings
description: COLIN DAVIS'S new re cording of The Mar riage of Figaro (Phil lips 6704014) is not studded with superstars, but it sounds like a firstclass live performance in a great repertory house. While lack ing somewhat in charm, it carries the Davis stamp, wedding scrupulous musi cianship, uptodate musicolo gy and unflagging momen tum. (That makes three par ties to the marriage, but in this period of relaxed mores, why not?) Coming on the heels of Otto Klemperer's abominably slow and rhyth mically turgid Figaro, which also came out of Eng land not long ago, the Davis version, with the B.B.C. Sym phony Orchestra playing dashingly and accurately un der his baton, seems particu larly bright and vigorous.

title: The World
description: Why hasn't the United Nations taken steps to prevent war between India and Pakistan?

title: THE ALGERIAN WAR STILL STIRS FRENCH
description: PARIS, Nov. 27Algeria was France's Vietnam, and nine years after the end of the war there, the divisions and moral crises it created are still in evi dence.

title: Theater in Binghamton.
description: BINGHAMTON seems an extremely unlikely place for a world pre miere. One hardly as sociates first nights and im portant literary events with this pleasant city of some 80,000 people in the South ern Tier area of New York, midway between Syracuse and Scranton. Nevertheless, as the AliceinWonderland economic situation of the New York theater causes the production of more and more revivals and musical versions of previously successful straight plays, originality is being pushed ever more out into what used to be called the sticks. Theater pre mieres of important literary works are increasingly tak ing place in university thea ters and in regional play houses.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: If It Worked for the Rich, Why Not for the Poor?
description: The skies were gray, the winds blustery; and the quivering water served as a chilly reminder that it was, indeed, November, when the BedfordStuyvesant Community Swimming Pool reached Phase Two of its ceremonial completionillumination.

title: DEMOCRATS SPLIT IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARDFORD, Nov. 27Con necticut Democrats are battling over party rules that may pro voke a challenge next summer to their delegation to the Democratic National Conven tion in Miami Beach.

title: Miss Mary Gordon Patterson Is Married to Richard Webber
description: Miss Mary Gordon Patter son and Richard Howard Webber of New York were married here yesterday after noon in the First Presby terian Church, where the Rev. John B. Macnab and the Rev. John O. Mellin performed the ceremony.

title: Black Awareness Celebrated at Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.The menu offered such soul food as hominy grits, blackeyed peas, candied yams and barbecued spare ribs. But this was no restaurant in Harlem or the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. It was the cafeteria at the State University at Stony Brook and it had fallen into the spirit of Black Weekend.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Thomas Meehan's article on Carter Burden was quite interesting, but I feel Mr. Meehan was unjustly flippant in his assessment of the Councilman's depth and dedication to public life.

title: Anton Lund to Wed Beatrice Williams
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Nov. 27Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Graddy Williams of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beatrice Barbara Wil liams, to Anton Morten Lund of New York. He is a son of Mrs. Anton Marius Lund of Augusta, Me., and the late Mr. Lund. A spring wedding is planned.

title: TollFree Line Set Up For HousingBias Calls
description: A directdial, tollfree tele phone number for reporting cases of discrimination in renting or buying housing has been set up by the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: ACWORTH, N. H. There was no sunset, only the deepening gray of approaching night and a spit of snow in the air as I watched the dark edge of the forest across the meadow of the abandoned farm.

title: David Cook Fiance Of Miss Crawford
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 27Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Bienvenu Crawford Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cornelia Cockrill Crawford, to David Charles Cook, a senior at Vanderbilt University here. He is the son of Mrs. Brew ster Weed Smith of Bingham ton and Alexandria Bay, Thousand Islands, N. Y., and Charles Marvin Cook of Bing hamton, N. Y. The wedding will take place here Dec, 29.

title: W. W. Graulty Jr. Plans to Marry Miss Mary Bell
description: WALLINGFORD, Pa., Nov. 27Mr. and Mrs. John C. Bell 3d have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Mary Levaun Bell, to William W. Graulty Jr., son of Mrs. Marilyn D. Graulty of South Lyme, Conn., and William W. Graulty of Avon, Conn., an executive vice president of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company in Hartford.

title: Jim French Case Underscores Racing's Embarrassing Identity Crisis
description: Racing's continuing investigation of the Jim French Affair has focused an uncomfortably hot spotlight on the growing problem of hidden horse ownership.

title: James and Jean Kempton Killed; Writers Are Car Crash Victims
description: James Murray Kempton Jr., 27 years old, and his wife; Jean Goldschmidt Kempton, 26, were killed Friday afternoon when their automobile overturned on a highway in Colonial Heights, Va. several miles north of Petersburg. The couple who re sided in New York City, were on their way to Oaxaca, Mexico, for the winter.

title: French Scandal Brings New Rules for Legislators
description: PARIS, Nov. 27The Nation al Assembly has approved a bill tightening the rules governing conflicts of interest between private business and the careers of members of parliament in an attempt to calm a storm over morality in public office.

title: Is That Your Best Offer?;
description: Tucked in here and there in this goodhumored satire of the publishing scene are surrogates for Hermann Hesse, Yevtushenko, Irving Wallace (or Stone), and other culture heroes it might be prudent not to identify. Also noted are youth, age, women's magazines, television drama of The Golden Age, explicit sex, possessive Jewish mothers, political romans  clef, and the business end of popular literature.

title: Garish Strips Stir Hostility, Coast to Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27 Opposition is welling up across the nation to the garish signs, flamboyant buildings, harsh lights, flapping pennants and circus colors of the commercial strips that have seized the busi est traffic arteries in thousands of cities and towns.

title: Japan in Europe
description: PARIS  Japan is no longer the ant assaulting the mountain, but has acquired such dimensions that its in fluence on the world econ omy is anything but negli gible. But the converse is also true. The transforma tion now in process in the world economy is potentially able to wipe out the Japa nese economy.

title: Knicks' Seventh Straight Ties Celtics for the Lead
description: In a splendidly played game, one of the most exciting of the National Basketball Association season, the Knicks were extended to the final buzzer before scoring a 10099 victory over the Chicago Bulls last night at Madison Square Garden before a roaring, capacity crowd of 19,588.

title: Car Pools to Travel Free on Bay Bridge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27  In one more attempt to ease the snarled Commuter. traffic on the San FranciscoOakland Bay Bridge, car pools will be allowed under a 30day experiment to pass without charge and cars in the pools will have their own approach lanes to the bridge.

title: JAPANESE EXPECT CHINA TRADE GAINS
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27A delega tion of leading Japanese businessmen has returned from a visit to Peking with the hope of a gradual improvement in trade between China and Japan but with no great expectations.

title: Vassar and Elmira Men Have a Date at Midcourt
description: ELMIRA, N.Y., Nov. 27Two pioneers in education for women, Elmira and Vassar Colleges, will meet for the first time on the basketball court on Wednesday with men's teams. The game marks the opener of the 197172 season for both schools, which have recently gone coed.

title: Stamps
description: WITH the approach of 1972, postal admin istrations, are an nouncing stampis suing programs for the new year. This nation's prelimi nary plans (column of Nov. 7) outlined by Postmaster Gen eral Winton M. Blount prior to his resignation, listed at least 20 items for 1972, with more than that likely.

title: Frances Adams, Gallery Aide, Is Bride of David F. Eberhart
description: Miss Frances Adams, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus H. Adams 3d of Chicago and San Miguel de Allende, Mex ico, was married here yester day afternoon to David F. Eberhart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Eberhart of New York.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: When you're not the boss but looking at him, said one the other day, you feel a lot of frustration. You have lots of ideas about what he should do and you can't un derstand why he doesn't do them.

title: Red Reality, $27, Wins Race Marred By 3Horse Spill
description: Red Reality completed a profitable encore at Aqueduct yesterday by winning the $60,500 Stuyvesant Handicap.

title: Is Fiddler More DeMille Than Sholem Aleichem?
description: BECAUSE a mean spirit, as well as snob bishness, have been imputed to anyone who doesn't find Fiddler on the Roof the most power ful movie musical ever made, I'd like to say right off in a friendly, humble, popu list sort of waythat I hope the film, now at the Rivoli, will make pots of money for everyone connected with it. Not only is it a wellmeant, if literalized, adaptation of a lovely, stylized show (which can still be seen in some thing like its original Broad way purity at the Broadway Theater, several blocks north of the Rivoli), but business has been so bad this year that any movie that can pos sibly keep the creditors away without insulting its audi encedeserves our support.

title: CITY BALLET GIVES WORK BY ROBBINS
description: A soldout house at the State Theater Friday night, sat in rapt attention during a pure dance ballet that lasted one and a half hours as Bach's The Goldberg Variations was played in its entirety. Surely, there was a message here as Jerome Robbins's complex and ambitious ballet of the same title, was given its first per formance of the season by the New York City Ballet.

title: J. Howard Pew of Sun Oil Dies; Served as Presidentior for 35 Years
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27J. Howard Pew, former president and chairman of the Sun Oil Company, died today at his home in Ardmore. His age was 89.

title: City's LaborOutput Issue Seen as Aid in State Talks
description: The city's effort to get in creased output from its 400, 000 workers has made pro ductivity the current catch word in city labor negotiations.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Women are wearing more men's jeans than ever be fore and have provided men's slacks makers with a lucra tive market. But this has not caused too much concern among Seventh Avenue fash ion manufacturers because jeans are not exactly a dress up item, and if they want to make jeans, they can do so for a substantial number of women who will not fit into a man's garment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Uranium Pact Awarded
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., Nov. 27 (AP)The Atomic Energy Com mission's Oak Ridge office has announced the awarding of a $208,000 contract to the United Nuclear Corporation of New Haven, Conn., to process ura niumbearing scrap to recover enriched uranium.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Economic growth rates, ob ?? and problems vary widely throughout the United States. Mature economic re gions, e.g., New England or sections of the Midwest, pre sent planners, businessmen and officials with a different set of circumstances than are to be found in the South and Far West.

title: A virtuoso's legacy
description: Recipes are the cook's legacy. The late Michael Field, a gifted cooking teacher and kitchen virtuoso, left hundreds. One of them, a cold souffle, was given to us by a longtime assistant who had made detailed notes as Mr. Field developed the recipe. Another, for waffles, will appear in a posthumous series of Michael Field cookbooks, under the Doubleday imprint Both are reminders of his talent and culinary imagination.

title: The World
description: CALCUTTA  India and Pakistan were born 24 years ago in a burst of communal hatred that consumed hundreds of thousands of Hindu and Moslem lives before subsiding, al though never really dying out. The old hatred flared into two wars. And last week the two neighbors of the Indian subcontinent stood on the brink of a third warpotentially the most dan gerous collision of all.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONOn the evening of Nov. 5, while Henry A. Kissinger, the President's foreign policy adviser, was chatting with Ambassador Anato ly Dobrynin at the Soviet Embassy's reception in honor of the 54th anni versary of the Bolshevik revolution, two youthful members of the militant Jewish Defense League handcuffed themselves to a bannister.

title: But Does He Deserve It?;
description: DENVERThe award of the Nobel Peace Prize to Willy Brandt raises the question as to whether the committee that bestowed this coveted recognition has been influenced by political motivations or whether the Chancellor has indeed proved to be the architect of a more lasting peace in Europe. In fact, the actions of statesmen can finally be judged only by history, and it is history which reminds us of another German statesman, Gustav Stresemann, who received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1926.

title: LOUISIANA STATE TOPS TULANE, 367
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 27 (AP)Andy Hamilton dazzled a home crowd for the last time tonight with a passcatching show that led Louisiana State to a 367 victory over Tulane.

title: BARTZ TAKES STAGE WITH MILES DAVIS
description: An audience that filled Phil harmonic Hall waited patiently and good naturedly, for an hour and a half for Miles Davis to begin a concert there on Fri day evening. His group's equip ment, the audience was told, was en route from Kennedy Airport.

title: Communal Living: Adventure in Relating to Others
description: Laurie Assael is a vivacious 20yearold who turned her back on East Meadow, L. I., and college for a job as a receptionist and a home in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The de tails of a possible interim settlement of the world's po tentially dangerous monetary uncertainty are being talked about in official and unof ficial circles here. There is no way of knowing whether the plan is acceptable to Sec retary of the Treasury, John B. Connally, who keeps Unit ed States policy in his own head, but it could apparently, work.

title: Doris Rosenthal, an Art Teacher And Painter of Mexico, Is Dead
description: Doris Rosenthal, a former art teacher at James Monroe High School in the Bronx, who became a prominent painter of Mexico and its people died Fri day in Oaxaca, Mexico, where she had been living. Miss Rosen thal never revealed her age, but probably was in her late 70's. She had been injured in a fall.

title: Nixon Helps Dedicate Eisenhower Medical Center
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)President Nixon helped dedicate today a gleam ing white hospital as a memo rial to President Eisenhower. Mr. Nixon vowed to work to keep the nation physically, eco nomically and morally healthy.

title: JOHN PATTERSON
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  John Patterson, director emer itus of the Hayden Planetarium at the Boston Museum of Sci ence, died yesterday. He was 69 years old.

title: PRINCETON IS URGED TO, GIVE 3YEAR B.A.
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 27 The chairman of a committee studying education at Princeton University, has recommended that the school shorten its normal undergraduate program to three years.

title: Tulsa Wins, 3113
description: WICHITA, Kan., Nov. 27 (AP)  Tulsa University beat Wichita State, 3113, today in the season finale for both schools and finished in a secondplace tie with Louisville in the Missouri Valley Conference.

title: RIGHTS AIDE CALLS REHNQUIST RACIST
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 26 The Rev. George Benjamin Brooks charged today that Wil liam H. Rehnquist, an Assistant Attorney General, who has been nominated to the Supreme Court by President Nixon, was the man principally responsible for harassing blacks who sought to vote here in the gen eral election of Nov. 3, 1964. He called Mr. Rehnquist a racist who would be unable to adjudicate cases impartially.

title: Price Commission Chief Seeks Reports on Voluntary Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The chairman of the Govern ment's Price Commission ap pealed today to 1,500 private companies to let him and the nation know of the extraordi nary and patriotic efforts some of them may be voluntarily making to hold the line on prices.

title: CINCINNATI BEATS LOUISVILLE, 1916
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 27 (AP)Mel Riggins scored the winning touchdown on a 1yard plunge with 1:43 remaining and Jim Henderson made a lastsecond interception as Cincinnati defeated Louisville, 1916, today.

title: Won't You Listen to the Lambs, Bob Dylan?
description: THE setting is Madison Square Garden, Aug. 1, 1971: George Harrison, former Beatle, leads a group of fellow superstars in a Sunday benefit performance to aid citizens of East Pakistan. Twenty thousand fans are at each of two performances and thousands of others in the street hope to crash inside, for this promises to be one of those Events that later become part of larger myth.

title: Squires Down Chaps, 111100
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 27 (AP)Charlie Scott scored 11 of his gamehigh of 41 points in a fourminute span of the fourth quarter tonight as the Virginia Squires stopped the Dallas Chaparrals, 111100.

title: 3 Hartford Companies Ease Commuting
description: Three major insurance companies in Hartford are making life a little easier for those of their employes and executives who have to go to and from New York City on business.

title: THE FREE PLAYS WITH DEEP PURPLE
description: Chaos was in the air at Wednesday night's Academy of Music rock program. Three English groups  Free, Deep Purple and Procol Harum were scheduled.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Television
description: IN his review of Paul Sand's per formance in Story Theater last season on Broadway, Walter Kerr wrote that he is the most accom plished at summoning up, when and as he needs it, the hard, tangible menace of a world that isn't there. In his other New York performances, which began with From the Second City in 1961, critics have compared him with Harpo Marx and England's Jonathan Miller. As a performer, he has a clown's ability to appear at once trusting and terrified, a quality which won him a Tony Award last year for Story Theater and the part of an engaging liar and thief in the movie Hot Rock, which 20th Cen turyFox plans to release in January.

title: Minority Rule in Rhodesia
description: One fact stands out in the proposed settlement between Britain and Rhodesia's white rulers: Rhodesia's blacks, who outnumber the whites twenty to one, would have had far better prospects under the 1961 Constitution. Ironically, British Governments, Tory and Labor alike, rejected that Constitution as the basis for Rhodesian independence on the ground that it did not guarantee sufficiently rapid political advance for the black majority.

title: U.S. Scientists in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (UPI)A group of United States scien tists headed by Dr. Robert R. Gilruth, director of the United States Manned Spacecraft Cen ter in Houston, arrived today for the third round of United StatesSoviet talks on coopera tion in manned space flight.

title: Article 6 -- No Title
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27 (AP)  Favored No Le Hace and a longshot. Feloniously, won their divisions of the Crescent City Handicap today at the Fair Grounds.

title: Indians Invite Newsmen to Border and Display 3 Captured Tanks From aDefensive Action in Pakistan
description: BOYRA, India, Nov. 27Six days ago, fighting between Indian and Pakistani troops was reported three miles south of this sleepy Bengali town. Today, 75 Indian and foreign journalists brought here by Indian military authorities found that the town had gone back to sleep.

title: French Cheese Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The Food and Drug Admin istration says it is examining samples of a French cheese sus pected of causing stomach ail ments, and a New York im porter is recalling 200 cases of the cheese. The agency said yesterday that Anco Cheese Im ports, Inc. had issued a recall order for eightounce packages of Le Roitelet brand Camembert cheese.

title: National Notes
description: Different Approach

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: Memoirs of a DogTired Foreign Correspondent was hilarious. We, too, have flown with Indian Airlines [not to be confused with Air India, the international airline]: on one occasion, on a trip from Agra to New Delhi, the scheduled aircraft never showed up! We drove the 130 miles (car and driver provided by the airline after a great deal of shouting) at night over roads where the trucks carry no taillights. Another experience, in Katmandu, Nepal, unearthed the fact that the city's airfield has no radar or landing aids. When it rains, aircraft must be diverted elsewhere. In our case, it was to a dirt strip at Simra, a village of thatched huts.

title: Eatons Neck,1942: Little Prince Is Born
description: EATONS NECK, L. I.The book The Little Prince and its illustrations of the boy with the golden curls and the flying golden muffler were created by Antoine de SaintExupry while he lived here.

title: WALL STREET
description: After all the discussion that went into the question of whether brokerage houses should be allowed to sell their own stocks to the pub lic, the performance of stocks of firms that have gone pub lic has been somewhat anti climactic. The public appar ently is no more interested in brokerage house stocks than they in any other stocks.

title: Miss Danforth Wed at Home
description: WESTON, Mass., Nov. 27 The marriage of Miss Nancy Danforth to Miguel Andrs GmezIbez took place at The Gateways, home here of Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas W. Danforth, parents of the bride, at noon today. The Unitarian ceremony was per formed by the Rev. Carl Scovel, minister of King's Chapel in Boston, and the Rev. Palfrey Perkins, uncle of the bride and minister emeritus of the chapel.

title: TOLEDO DEBATING CONVENTION ROLE
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 27  The welcome mat that was put out for the American Independ dnt party to hold its first na tional convention here next spring may be withdrawn.

title: 2 Coeds Elected at St. Francis College
description: For the first time two women students have been elected to student government office at St. Francis College in Brooklyn.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: As long as money and television appearances buy the Presidency in this country, Carter Burden will stand a chance of inhabiting the White House. As long as he keeps his weight down and his charisma up, he'll have a future in politics. And if Amanda keeps reading those heavy books like Inside the Third Reich and keeps herself out of Vogue magazine, she'll be his righthand lady.

title: 5TO2 TRIUMPH BY MANCHESTER
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  George Best scored three goals to help Manchester United sink Southampton, 5.2, today and keep a 3point lead in the First Division of the English Soccer League.

title: Decree by Sadat Transfers Ceremonies to His Aide
description: CAIRO, Nov. 27President Anwar Sadat acted today to drop some ceremonial functions at a time when he has taken over direct command of Egypt's armed forces.

title: L. I. Farmers Soon to Lose Good Friend
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I.  For more than 40 years the gray, twostory, vaultlike County Cooperative Extension building here has served Suffolk farmers as a clearinghouse of information on any matters relating to agriculture and rural life.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Nixon to Meet Sato In California Jan. 6
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Nov. 27Premier Eisaku Sato of Japan will meet President Nixon on Jan. 6 and 7 at the Western White House in San Cemente, Calif., for consulta tion on the President's sched uled trips to Peking and Mos cow.

title: Whos Out of Step?
description: Normally, the businessmen anticipate consumer demand, and they structure their or ganizations and their produc tion to meet that, demand, and, in this particular case, I think they have been living out of inventory. I think the drag in the whole economy, very frankly, is the attitude of businessmen. I cannot ex plain it, except that I think they are out of step with consumer demand, and I think they are out of step with what the economy is going to do.

title: Free Honey Only One of L.I. Beekeepers' Rewards
description: EAST NORTHPORT, L. I. Max Riedener, who describes himself as strictly a weekender, walked off with three first places and best of show last Sunday at the Suffolk County Bee Club's 22d annual honey contest.

title: Rideout Deemed Best Senior
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Ed Rideout, Boston College's flanker, was named today winner of the 1971 Harry Agganis Memorial Award as the outstanding senior college football player in New England. Rideout carried 28 times for 196 yards and three touchdowns and caught 27 passes for 430 yards and one score in 10 games.

title: Prison Hearings to Open
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The House Select Committee on Crime will study, recent vio lent disturbances at Attica, N. Y., and Raiford, Fla. state prisons during hearings Monday through Friday. It was not known whether the panel would also investigate the riot at Rahway, N. J., State Prison.

title: Stamps
description: THE Postal Service has a book sale at $300 a copy. Entitled The Sea, it includes many colored pictures, poetry about the sea, colored pic tures of postage stamps and eight actual stamps. There will be only 998 of these hardbound copies avail able. It may be ordered from The Sea, U.S. Postal Serv ice, Washington, D.C. 20036. (Customers are requested not to send personal checks, only money orders or certified bank checks.)

title: Miss Cornelia Spencer Bride of Kenneth Ives Jr.
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., Nov. 27Miss Cornelia Carlisle Spencer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Eldridge Spencer 3d, was married here this afternoon to Kenneth Apple ton Ives Jr. of Boston and Stratton Mountain, Vt., by the Rev. Charles P: Luckey Jr. at the Congregational Church.

title: ISRAEL CONSIDERING NEW JARRING ROLE
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27 (AP) The Israeli state radio said to day that Israel would agree to the reactivation of the mission of Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the special United Nations mediator on the Middle East, providing there were no prior conditions.

title: IRWIN, WITH 209, LEADS HERITAGE
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Nov. 27Hale Irwin regained the lead today in the $110,000 Heritage Golf Classic with a third round of 3underpar 68 for a 54hole aggregate of 209. Bob Lunn and Benson McLendon, were tied for second one stroke behind.

title: Nuptials for Mrs. Susan Turner
description: SWARTHMORE, Pa., Nov. 27  Mrs. Susan Turner, daughter of Howard S. Turner, chairman of the Turner Con struction Company in New York, and Mrs. Turner of the United Nations Plaza Apart ments, New York, was mar ried this afternoon to Dr. Jacob Lokich.

title: Colorado State 3821 Victor As Erickson Shows Way
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Nov. 27 (UPI)Jim Erickson closed out his collegiate career today by running for a touchdown, passing for another and gaining over 100 yards on the ground in quarterbacking Colorado Stale to a 3821 triumph over New Mexico State.

title: Why the Black Travel Agent's Clients Want to Go First Class
description: AMONG the 90 or so black travel agencies in the United States, the most successful, or at least one of the most succesful, is I. G. T. Travel, run by a 47yearold former New York City detective named Earl Jackson. Jackson's agency, which is in Jamaica, Queens, is one of two in this country operated by blacks that gross more than $1million a year.*

title: Cahill Points to Flexibility As the Key to Ending Riot
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 27 Gov. William T. Cahill said to day that both his willingness to consider the complaints of re belling inmates at the Rahway state prison and his willingness to use force If necessary con tributed to the relatively speedy settlement of the disorder there.

title: Stuart K. Eason Marries Dagny L. Boe
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Nov. 27Miss Dagny Louise Boe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carsten F. Boe, was married here this afternoon to Stuart Kirkpatrich Eason, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Walter Eason of New Canaan. The Rev. David Gurniac per formed the ceremony in St. Michael's Episcopal Church.

title: This Family Doesn't Need Model Trains at Christmas
description: MANHASSET, L. I.When it sounds as though a train is going through the McLean family's backyard, a train is going through their backyard.

title: Tribute to Porterfield
description: A memorial tribute to Robert Porterfield, founder of the Bar ter Theatre of Virginia, who died last month at the age of 66, will be held in the Belasco Room in Sardi's on Tuesday at 4 P.M. Gregory Peck, Elizabeth Wilson, Fritz Weaver, Mildred Natwick, Larry. Gates and Dor othy Stickney are some of the guest speakers.

title: MOST IN POLL SIDE WITH DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27A Gallup Poll published today says that if every potential voter 18 years of age and older were now registered, Democrats would outnumber the combined total of Republicans and those who say they are undecided.

title: Scholarship for Athletes
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 27 (UFI)A Greenville newspaper executive has given a $33,000 endowment to establish a per manent scholarship for athletes at Furman University. The en dowment was given by B. H. Peace, senior vice president of the NewsPiedmont Company in memory of his mother, Mrs. Estill Chandler Peace.

title: PassaicHudson
description: Gary Taylor, a senior halfback, won the Passaic County scoring championship yesterday when he scored two touchdowns to lead Clifton to a 2012 victory over Passaic in Clifton.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A Widow Takes Up Law and Beats U.S.
description: He that pleads his own case has a fool for a client.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: GENESCO and C. Itoh & Co. of Japan are exploring mutual activities that may lead to the establishment of a jointly owned textile company in the U.S* The Reading Co., parent of the Reading Railroad, filed a petition for re organization under Section 77 of the Bankruptcy Act.

title: 61st Walking Race Scheduled Today For Coney Island
description: Mark Berger of Brick Township, N. J., a 15yearold, and Dr. Isidore Bloom of the Bronx, 77, are the youngest and oldest competitors, respectively, in today's 61st annual Coney Island walking race. While Berger will be competing for the first Lime, this will be Dr. Bloom's 52d race.

title: Basketball Forecast: A Strong Challenge to U.C.L.A.'s 5Year Title Reign
description: Another college basketball season opens Wednesday night and With it a tendency to write off the champion, the University of California Angeles, since the Bruins have lost four of last season's five starters.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Echoes from abroad indi cate widespread dismay over President Nixon's recent ac tion to restrain imports. This reaction is indeed under standable. The tariff sur charge of 10 per cent was precipitate and inequitable, but necessary to attract the world's attention.

title: BULLETS SUBDUE CELTICS, 125120
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 27 (UPI)Jack Marin capped a 37point effort with a 3point play with a second left tonight as the Baltimore Bullets registered a 125120 victory over the Boston Celtrics in the National Basketball Association.

title: Israel's Poverty Is Decried Here by Labor Leader
description: The head of Israel's onemil lionmember labor federation told American Jewish leaders yesterday that his nation was embarrassed by the persist ence of poverty in our midst, citing lacks in education, hous ing and other benefits.

title: 'They never stop fighting
description: THEY never seem to stop fighting, doctor. It's one of the most common complaints parents make to the child therapist (regardless of the reason for referral).

title: JOSEPH HAGGERTY OF PAVING FIRM
description: REMSENBURG, L. I., Nov. 27 Joseph J. Haggerty, who had been president of the Sicilian Asphalt Company since 1937 and chairman of the board since 1966, died today at his home. He was 71 years old.

title: S. African Marks Beaten
description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa, Nov. 27 (AP)Bruce Simpson of Canada and Aristotle Kathiniotis of Greence set South African records today in the first South African international multiracial track meet. Simpson leaped 16 feet 5 inches in the pole vault and Kathiniotis won the triple jump at 52 feet 2 inches.

title: Connecticut
description: John Darling, Stamford's versatile quarterback, tied a state record with six touchdown passes yesterday as topranked Stamford rolled to its 11th victory, a 537 rout of Fairfield Prep, its traditional rival.

title: Brooklyn College Becoming 6 Schools
description: The Board of Higher Education has approved a reorganization of Brooklyn College into six schools as part of the larger college.

title: Home Improvement
description: RESEMBLING a mechan ical carpet sweeper in appearance, a new rug shampooer recently in troduced has a foot operated control that permits measur ing out the exact amount of liquid shampoo need to pro vide effective cleaning action without saturating the rug. Equipped with rotating roll er brushes (16 separate ones), with sponges between the brushes, the unit is de signed to deposit an even film of foam cleaner over the carpet. As it is pushed back and forth the brushes and rollers scrub the pile and lift out sand, dirt and grit and deposit it in a spe cial tray where it can be disposed of by emptying the tray later on.

title: Workers at Brass Factories In Five States Go on Strike
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Nov. 27 (AP)Union members at the Anaconda American Brass Com pany's plants in five states went on strike today, three days after talks broke down in Chicago.

title: PATRICK J. GUINEE
description: Patrick J. Guinee, formerly of New York, who taught phys ical education at Nova High School in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., died Friday in San Francisco, after having undergone a kid ney transplant. His age was 30.

title: U.S. MOVES TO END BANS ON DRUG ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The Nixon Administration may invoke Federal antitrust laws against organized pharmacists as part of an intensified effort to abolish restrictions on the advertising of prescription drug prices.

title: Education
description: All grownups are paper tigers. If you're bored, you learn only how to be bored, whether the schedule says math, geography or whatever.

title: Margaret F. Kingston Is Wed to M. P. Brady
description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I. Nov. 27  Miss Margaret Frances Kingston and Michael Patrick Brady were married here this morning at Blessed Sacrament Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James Devine.

title: Clashes Continuing in Five Sectors Pakistan Says
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 27  Fighting between Indian and Pakistani forces in East Pakistan is continuing on five fronts, a military Spokesman said here today. However, he said, there have been no sig nificant losses on either side during the last day.

title: MOTHER WINS SUIT OVER PILL ERROR
description: A Michigan mother whose un wnated eighth baby was born because of a pharmacist's error has won what a lawyer writing in a medical journal says is an important legal decision that raises provocative questions.

title: Miami Beach's Strand May Go Public
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 27 The owner of a Miami Beach resort was asked not too long ago about the rights of the public to free access to the beach that was penned in by his large, rococo hotel.

title: Canucks Top Sabres, 52
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 27 (UPI)Dave BaIon's secondperiod goal stood up as the winner as the Vancouver Canucks defeated the Buffalo Sabres, 52, tonight, ruining the N.H.L. coaching debut of Joe Crozier.

title: LAW GROUP IS SET UP FOR PUERTO RICANS
description: A new organization, The Puerto Rican Law Students As sociation, has been formed at New York University to help Puerto Ricans get through law schools and into the commu nity.

title: Federal Land Allotted For Public Park Use
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 27 (AP)  President Nixon has announced the turnover of 412 acres of Federal lands in eight states and Puerto Rico for public recreation and park use. The property is valued at $3.4 million.

title: Miss Melia Bride of Capt. Clark
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., Nov. 27In St. Mat thew's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Deborah Ann Melia, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Dan lel J. Melia, was married to Capt. Bruce Edward Clark, U.S.A.F. son of Mrs. Eliza beth B. Clark of New York. The Rev. Robert Haskins per formed the ceremony.

title: Donald Schaeffer To Wed Miss Behr
description: Dr. and Mrs. Irving S. Behr of Brooklyn have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Carol Behr, to Donald Martin Schaeffer. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Emanuel Schaef fer of Hewlett Harbor, L. I.

title: J. G. Verity to Wed Miss Chainski
description: LAKE BLUFF, Ill., Nov. 27 Dr. and Mrs. Edward L. Chainski of Harbor Lights, Shoreacres, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Victoria Chain ski of New York, to Jonathan G. Verity, also of New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. C. William Verity Jr. of Middletown, Ohio.

title: The mental hospital as the new Siberia
description: Why bother with political trials when we have psychiatric clinics? This cynical observation, attributed to a prominent Russian forensic psychiatrist, sums up a technique currently employed by the Communist regime to deal with dangerous intellectuals. Zhores Medvedev, a prominent Soviet scientist who underwent psychiatric hospitalization last year, describes the progression from Stalin's lawless backroom executions to the more subtle psychiatric violence now in vogue, as follows:

title: The Nation
description: CHICAGO  In the long run, I'm a free price man, Earl L. Butz, President Nixon's nominee for Secretary of Agriculture and a longtime foe of controlled agriculture prices, confided recent ly. But this is not the long run. Right now the house is on fire. The problem for the President and Mr. Butz is that many Midwestern farmers doubt that Mr. Butz will rush out to fight the fire with any real enthusiasm or that he could put it out even if he did.

title: Rutgers Downs Morgan State, 278, as Gasienica Passes for 2 Touchdowns
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 27Leo Gasienica, a junior quarterback, threw two passes for touchdowns and ran for another today in leading Rutgers to a 278 victory over Morgan State. The game, a benefit, was billed as the Urban Classic.

title: Herricks H. S. to Get Counselor On Draft
description: HERRICKS, L. I.A draft counseling service is to be established at Herricks High School soon at the behest of the new president of the ParentTeacherStudent Association, a 17yearold high school senior.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The Next Best Thing to Stealing a car
description: A DARK Frenchman and his blond girl friend with hiking packs on their backs walk into a midtown Manhattan garage and a few minutes later drive out in a new white Cadillac convertible, the rucksacks out of sight in the trunk. The boy holds the Gaulolse he is smoking at a jaunty angle in his mouth as he and the girl mimic expressions of Cadillac hauteur, They scrutinize a city map at a stoplight, trying to find the way west, and then they're tooling along 42d Street toward the Lincoln Tunnel and the vast country beyond. They'll make the West Coast in eight days and it will cost them nothing but the gas and oil. They are among the thousands who travel in driveaway cars all over the United States.

title: Miss Robin Chalk Fiancee of Student
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 27The engagement of Miss Robin Kim Chalk to Charles Austin McDevitt Jr. has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Howard W. Chalk of Kings Point. Mr. McDevitt is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Austin McDevitt of Philadelphia and Sea Isle, N. J.

title: Now Brian Piccolo's Friend Needs Help
description: Gale Sayers needs Brian Piccolo right now, but Brian is not around anymore. Sayers of the Chicago Bears, not long ago the most exciting and possibly the best running back in pro football, is out of action following a slow recovery from a second and a third knee operation and there is some question whether he will ever be able to play again.

title: SADAT IS ASSURED ON U.S. MISSILES
description: CAIRO, Nov. 27  President Anwar elSadat received an assurance from the United States today that it had no commitment to supply Israel with Lance battlefield missiles, according to wellinformed sources.

title: Kerr on Mary Stuart and The Black Terror
description: IT may be that what di rector Jules Irving does best in Schiller's Mary Stuart, now at the Beaumont, is also his bind. What he has done best is to counsel patience in his ac tors, painstaking patience, the kind that isn't fearful of pronouncing a word firmly or taking a long speech at a deliberate rate so that the malicious tangle of motives in it can be unraveled strand by strand.

title: Television
description: THE message was deliv ered indirectly: Bob Hope is what television is all about. It was a television executive's re sponse to some slighting re marks I had written about a couple of Hope shows.

title: Western Montana Gains
description: HELENA, Mont., Nov. 27 (AP) Western Montana College beat Carroll, 9069, today in the Frontier Conference basketball tournament.

title: Gardens
description: GROWING African vio lets? Nothing could be easier if you just fol low the rules.

title: BAHR SAYS PARLEY COULD END IN WEEK
description: BONN, Nov. 27 (AP)Bonn's chief negotiator said today that West Germany and East Ger many could reach agreement next week on ways of carrying out the fourpower Berlin ac cord.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Four City Golf Courses Named for Winter Use
description: The Parks Administration's winter golf season begins tomorrow, with four 18hole courses remaining open and the agency's remaining 11 facilities closing down.

title: PLEA FOR NEEDIEST OPENS IN A WEEK
description: The annual appeal for the New York Times Neediest Cases, which for 60 years has been raising money for the city's poor at Christmas, will open next Sunday.

title: Avon: Chiming True?
description: Avon, one of the alltime glamour girls in Wall Street history, has learned how fickle the market's affections can be during this last trou bled year and a half.

title: MAGNABID TAKES LIBERTY BELL RUN
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 Magnabid, a filly with no particular concern over distance or track conditions, led all the way as she won the $22,900 Mill Race Handicap today in the rain at Liberty Bell Park. A crowd of 15,848 wagered $1,645239 at the track.

title: News of Dogs
description: One of the smallest clubs in the country is staging one of the biggest shows south of the MasonDixon line today. With only 12 members, the Maryland Kennel Club, headed by Harry Z. Isaacs, is holding its 59th allbreed fixture at the Fifth Regiment Armory in Baltimore and it has drawn 2,290 entries.

title: Meany Sitting Up in Bed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) George Meany, president of the American Federation of La bor and Congress of Industrial Organizations was sitting up in George Washington Hospital and reading the newspapers, a spokesman for the federation said today.

title: Nassau Policeman Shoots and Kills L. I. Boy, 16, Fleeing From a Stolen Car
description: ROOSEVELT, L. 1., Nov. 27 A 16yearold boy was fatally shot by aa policeman here early this morning after he and an other youth in a stolen car led four police cars on a chase through five Nassau County communities.

title: Susan Dolan Engaged
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 27Mrs. Michael C. Dolan has annouced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Susan Mary Dolan, to John J. O'Neill Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. O'Neill of New York. Miss Dolan, daughter also of the late Mr. Dolan, a lawyer, is an alumna of Mercy Col lege in Dobbs Ferry. Her fianc, a graduate of Ford ham College, is with Kidder, Peabody & Co., stockbrokers. His father is retired from David Rose Associates, a realty organization.

title: JOHNSON VICTOR IN PRO BOWLING
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP)Don Johnson of Akron, Ohio, won a twoframe, suddendeath rolloff, 3938, over Larry Laub of San Francisco today for first place in the Brunswick world open bowling tournament.

title: Marxists Propose New Election At Divided University of Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 27 After weeks of student vio lence, the Marxist majority on the governing council of the University of Chile today chal lenged the rector, Edgardo Boe ninger, to resign along with the council so that new elections for university officers could be held.

title: Headliners
description: Out of the Mouths

title: THIEU OPPOSITION LYING LOW NOW
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27  Le Van Thai, an Important political adviser of the former Vice President, Ngu yen Cao Ky, seldom dares to go home these days. For near ly two months, he has been closeted with his leader in an enclave of Saigon's Tansonnhut Air Base and when he wants to visit his wife and daughter he has to get in a taxi and sneak home on back streets to avoid police surveillance.

title: Dockmen Here Go Back To Jobs but Find No Work
description: Complying with a temporary Federal Court backtowork order, 200 striking longshoremen showed up on the West Side docks yesterday and were paid for the day without working.

title: Reagan Signs Bill Licensing Coast Auto Repair Dealers
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 27 (AP)Gov. Ronald Reagan has signed a bill to license California auto repair dealers and to put any fraudulent ones out of business. Calling the measure the toughest consum er protection bill of the year in California, Governor Reagan said Monday that it was aimed at cracking, down on a certain irresponsible segment of the auto repair industry which per sists in using dishonest and un ethical operating methods.

title: Miss Simonds Is Betrothed To Peter Cook
description: BELMONT, Mass., Nov. 27  The engagement of Miss Elizabeth McCreary Simonds to Peter James Cook, son of Mrs. Sidney Thomas Cook of Reading, England, and Nai robi, Kenya, and the late Mr. Cook, has been announced by the prospective bride's par ents, Mr. and Mrs. George Henry Simonds of Belmont and Nantucket.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: Your article on wild boars in Tuscany (Travel section, Oct. 17) reminds me that the farmers in the region 65 miles from Paris (betwen Provins and NogentsurSeine) where I have a house are obliged to keep detonators going night and day to frighten wild boars away from their newly planted fields. The choice here is between crops (and the arable land on which they are grown to feed the everexpanding population) and the protection of a damagecausing species which, like the dinosaur, has served its purpose. Isn't the outcome of the overcrowded earth problem going to be one of selection?

title: The Nation
description: Massachusetts drivers, who for years have paid the nation's high est auto insurance rates, had something special to celebrate this Thanksgiving. Their insurance bills, which had climbed steadily over the last decade, will be turn ing sharply downward.

title: If in doubt, do it, was her motto
description: I'm sorry, but it's no use, said 21yearold Marya Mannes to an ardent young man who had run out of gas on a country road near Woodstock, N. Y., one summer night. You see, I'm a hermaphrodite. She was not entirely sure what the word meant, but it had the desired effect. The worldly princeling darted one terrified glance, at me started the motor, and raced me back to lodgings.

title: ICELAND TO CLAIM 50MILE SEA LIMIT
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 21Iceland will extend her off shore fishing rights to 50 Miles next Sept. 1. Her claim is 12 miles now.

title: 3 Soviet Aides Hurt
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Nov. 27 (UPI)The police said that three Soviet diplomats were critically injured today when their car collided with another near Bolu, 120 miles east of Istanbul. The three were iden tified as Aleksandr Trukhtanov, Second Secretary of the em bassy in Ankara, Talat Has manedov of the Soviet trade mission, and Rafkat Sultan bekov, an embassy official.

title: EssexUnion
description: Unbeaten Barringer, winner of its first seven games on an impressive ground attack, went to the air yesterday to defeat East Orange, 357, at Newark Schools Stadium.

title: Miss Kim Conway Is Affianced To Payson Coleman Jr., Student
description: Miss Kim (Catharine Lan ning) Conway and Charles Payson Coleman Jr., who uses Payson, his second name, plan to be married in June.

title: Don't Believe They Didn't Know About Hitler
description: MARCEL OPHULS'SLe Chagrin et la Piti (The Sorrow and the Pity), a documentary film of France under the Nazi occupation, runs four hours and twenty minutes. This was not too long for me and the rapt, racked audience the night I saw it at the New York Film Festival. Though the period the film covers is at most five years, Nazism has so occupied and embit tered our minds  those for whom it has more and more become the central yet most mystifying event of the 20th centurythat it hardly seems 31 years since France was defeated and occupied.

title: TIDE'S 11TH IN ROW
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 27 College football will have its Super Bowl after all this season.

title: 250 Strike Catholic Paper
description: HUNTINGTON, Ind., Nov. 27 (AP)  About 250 pressmen walked off their jobs last night in a pay dispute at the publish ing plant of Our Sunday Visi tor, a national Roman Catholic weekly.

title: Edsel
description: Cocteau tells the story of a poet who attended Debussy's funeral. When asked how the body was laid out, he replied, I didn't see him at all. I see nothing but colors. There is something admirable in this askew sincerity, this splendid fatuousness. It explains why a poet, faced with writing in another genre, can fail so dreadfully. And it brings us to Pulitzer Prizewinning Karl Shapiro's first novel, Edsel.

title: Reader's Report
description: This drylyamusing import from Ireland is built on a foundation of minor petifogging: wills, deeds and the office routine of a firm of Dublin solicitors. Mr. White's humor inclines to be somewhat parochial, but beneath the witticisms about rugby football and other local practices, there are universals enough to engage the alien reader.

title: A Tuscan restoration
description: These austerely modern interiors are the result of a sensitive restoration of an ancient farmhouse (including a 15thcentury watchtower) just outside Florence. Architect Giancarlo Nocentini not only strove to preserve the feeling of the structure but to capture in a modern idiom the spontaneity and homely skills of the artisans, the farmers and laborers, who had added to and adapted building to their needs over the centuries. He saw his changes as yet another phase in the building's evolution. Nocentini, dead set against cubicle rooms a single function, removed walls to gain a fluidity of space and function. Thus, the new balcony bedroom is also a study. Colors reflect the Tuscan landscape sky blue settees against sunbleached walls, slashes of hot red and jet black.

title: Catskill Harness Track and Ski Centers Digging Out
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Nov. 27In the wake of last Wednesday's howling snowstorm that clumped two feet of snow on the southern Catskill mountain area, Herb Cauthers, track superintendent of Monticello Raceway, could not be blamed for suffering mixed emotions.

title: JAMES J. M'MAHON OF STEREOTYPERS
description: James J. McMahon, presi dent of Stereotypers Union No. 1, A.F.L.C.I.O., died yes terday of a heart attack at Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. He was 64 years old and lived at 3883 Orloff Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Suspects Once at Berkeley
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 27 Ralph Goodwin, one of the three suspects, once headed a black community center fi nanced by the University of California in Oakland. He was a former student at the univer sity but dropped out last spring.

title: 50 Trees Given The Right of Way
description: WANTAGH, L.I.Wantagh residents have decided that the preservation of 50 trees is worth three months of inconvenience.

title: Heart and Circulatory Ills Cause Half Canada's Deaths
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27 (Reuters) Diseases of the heart and cir culatory system caused nearly half the 155,961 deaths record ed in Canada last year, Statis tics Canada reported this week.

title: Arizona Sprint to Mr. Exit
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 27 (AP)  Mr. Exit rallied from fourth in the stretch for a threequarterlength victory over Positive Stand today in the 5furlong feature race at Turf Paradise. He paid $21.40 for $2 to his backers in a crowd of 6,300.

title: Profits of Some Importers and Small Concerns Fell in the Freeze
description: A number of businesses, mostly importers and small concerns, have suffered de clines in profits during the first months of the Nixon eco nomic program. Although many of their most serious problems were eased when the wageprice freeze ended at midnight Nov. 13, some dislo cations still exist.

title: Newark Inmates Free Prisoner in Cell
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27Ninety inmates at the Essex County Jail, angered at the placing of an inmate in solitary confine ment because he allegedly took a spoon, ripped open his cell and released him last night in a twohour disturbance.

title: Stamps
description: JAMES CLARKE of San Leandro, Calif., designed the 1972 Christmas Seals multicolored blocks of four of Christmas trees, horntooting youths, angels and a candle. The seals have been distrib uted to thousands of house holds throughout the nation.

title: Queries Total 184,641 Since Start of Phase 2
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Americans have asked the Internal Revenue Service, which is enforcing the eco nomic stabilization program, 184,641 questions since Phase Two began Nov. 14, says Donald Rumsfeld, director of the Cost of Living Council.

title: Kookiness, it Seems, Is Out for Evening, and the Glamorous Dress Is Back
description: The newest way, to dress at night is to wear an old fashioned evening gown.

title: V. A. Names Nursing Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)The Veterans Adminis tration named Virginia B. Long est today as director of nursing service, heading its corps of 16,000 nurses in 165 hospitals and six independent outpatient clinics. She has been assistant director since 1964.

title: 3 Slaying Suspects Hijack Airliner and Crew to Cuba
description: TAMPA,. Fla., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Three men wanted in the murder of a New Mexico po liceman, and armed with auto matic weapons and a knife, seized a Trans World Airlines jetliner in Albuquerque, N. M., early today and hijacked it to Cuba after first stopping here.

title: Houston Routs Utah, 4216
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)Gary Mullins ran for two secondhalf touchdowns and Robert Newhouse became the fourth collegian in history to rush for over 1,700 yards in a season to pace Houston to a 4216 victory over Utah tonight.

title: ROD STEW ART SEEMS A LASTING ROCK STAR
description: At a time when pop music superstars seem to be arriving and disappearing with revolv ing door frequency, Rod Stew art is beginning to look very much like the real thing. The English performer, currently the lead singer With a group called Faces, appeared Friday night before an enthusiastic capacity audience at Madison Squar Garden.

title: Science/Medicine
description: At laboratories at San Francisco State and elsewhere, psychologists call out ethnic namesSwede, Jew, Mexicanat a selected group of subjects and measure the variations in the electrical conductivity of their skin. It changes, they find, not only with the name called but with the loudness of the voice.

title: Evans Gains Stroke Edge In Florida Golf With 68
description: LAKE PLACIDA, Fla., Nov. 27 (AP)  Chick Evans overcame a doublebogey 7 today and posted a 4underpar 68 for a onestroke lead in the first round of the Placid Lakes open on the Florida Professional Golfers' Association winter tour.

title: ANACONDA WORKERS STRIKE IN BUFFALO
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 27 (AP)  About 570 production and maintenance workers struck the Anaconda American Brass Co. plant here today, as workers walked out simultaneously in four other company plants.

title: How the Other Half Lives, updated
description: The roof over the heads of one out of every six Americans is badly leaking or collapsing. The walls are cracking and crumbling. The water when it runs is cold, and the heating system is a sometime affair. Joseph P. Fried calls it a housing crisis, and has so titled his book. After reading his solid, somewhat stolid, survey I think a more accurate title would have been Housing Catastrophe U.S.A.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Music
description: FRAU MINNE will, es werde Nacht, sings Isolde. The Goddess of Love desires that it be night. She extinguishes the torch. Tristan appears, and soon starts the great love duet of the second act of Tristan und Isolde. Even there the symbolism of night and day is ex plored. The day keeps the lovers apart. That is the real world. But at night the lovers can meet, and that is their real world. When Isolde hurls the torch to the ground it is a symbolic gesture that takes the opera out of one plane of existence and it in another.

title: KUNSTLER AT ATTICA
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Golf Writers to Honor Jones for Grand Slam
description: The annual awards of the Metropolitan Golf Writers Association on March 6 will be dedicated to the Grand Slam champion, Robert Tyre Jones Jr.

title: Bloody Sunday Is My Reality
description: DURING my childhood I livedal most literallyon the fantasies the movies provided me for 27 cents and the candy the movie theaters provided for a nickel a bar. Nowadays I am one husband and three children beyond finding it possible to live in the Sherwood Forest Errol Flynn inhabited around 1940 and beyond be ing erotically aroused by Paul Henreid putting that cigarette, moist from his own mouth, between Bette Davis's lips in Now Voyager.

title: Miss Mary Burton Bride Upstate
description: KEENE VALLEY, N.Y., Nov. 27Against a background of wilderness mountains deep in snow, and before a wooden cross carved in 1889 for the altar of the first Episcopal chapel in the Adirondacks, Miss Mary Ward Burton was married today to John A. Mulligan.

title: the traveler's world
description: Even Ecology Has Two Sides

title: Where Else But Hicksville for Country Music?
description: HICKSVILLE, L. I. To some people, it might seem unusually appropriate that the major source of live country music cast of New York City should be situated in a town called Hicksville.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27American Airlines is putting piano bars aboard its 747 jumbo jetliners. This gives it a momentary lead in the fierce competition among airlines to be Number One in sky fun, but the lead will not last long.

title: Religion
description: A year ago, the former secretary of education for the Archdiocese of New York warned that the Catholic school system of the United States could be destroyed from within by the very persons who teach and administer in them. Msgr. George A. Kelly, a professor in contemporary Catholic problems at St. John's University, cited some priests, some Brothers, and some Sisters of Catholic teaching orders, who would pull their religious communities out of Catholic education, to meet new and different challenges.

title: City Sanitation Aide Quits In TicketSelling Inquiry
description: The Sanitation Department official accused of pressuring men who worked for him to sell tickets to a John V. Lindsay Association fundraising dinner has resigned, officials at City Hall announced yesterday.

title: U.S. Skating Group Marks 50th Year With Garden Show
description: To celebrate its 50th anniversary, the United States Figure Skating Association, in conjunction with Madison Square Garden Productions, will offer a single performance of Champions on Ice at the Garden tomorrow night.

title: Cynthia Taylor Wed in Suburb
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Nov. 27 The marriage of Miss Cynthia Rowan Taylor to Peter Francis Kane 3d took place in St. Augustine's Roman Catholic Church here this evening. The Rev. James O'Day, a Roman Catholic priest, and the Rev. Ken neth Mackenzie, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church here, performed the ecumenical ceremony.

title: 5 ASIAN LANDS JOIN IN HANDSOFF PACT
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 27 (UPI)The foreign ministers of five Asian nations signed a declaration today call ing for a neutral Southeast Asia.

title: SIFFORD TRIUMPHS WITH A 71 FOR 278
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 27 (AP)Charles Sifford managed a oneunderpar 71 today and won the satellite Sea Pines Open golf tournament with a 278 total, 10 under par.

title: Winter Color
description: Watch a crow in late November and you will think it is twice as black as it was in August. It isn't, really, though it does have new feathers after the summer molt. What is changed is the background. There is more sky, there are fewer leaves; there is more blue and more gray, less green. Contrasts are sharper now. The crow is no blacker, but it looks so in this setting. When the ground is white with snow the crow will look blacker still.

title: LAUREL CUP WON BY CRACK RULER
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 27Crack Ruler, 7yearold gelding from A.J. Somerville's Buck Ridge Farm, shook off Fresh Alibhai with onesixteenth of a mile to go today for a 1 length victory in the $28,880 Laurel Turf Cup before 13,225 at Laurel Race Course.

title: Jersey Writers Honor Stolz, Dupree, Addie
description: The New Jersey Boxing Writers' Association presented plaques to a former lightweight star, Allie Stolz of Laurence Harbor; a light heavyweight contender, Jimmy Dupree of Jersey City, and a ring announcer, Johnny Addie of New York, at its 14th annual dinner tonight.

title: Chess
description: 0NE of the surest signs that chess. is vastly increasing in popularity all over the world, and in the Englishspeaking, countries partic ularly, is that the appearance of a new publication devoted to the subject is greeted nowadays with expressions of interest and even enthusiasm. Not so long ago they were greeted with smiles and knowing shakes of the headan other poor sucker was going to lose his shirt. Chess magazines used to have the life expectancy of flowers, and the more lavish the blossom, the more quickly it would wither, especially in an American or British climate.

title: Attempt Is Thwarted
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., Nov. 27 (AP)A 23yearold man attempted to board an Eastern Airlines plane today with the intention of hijacking it to Vietnam, the state police said.

title: Former Biafran Capital Is Recovering Fast 22 Months After the End of the Nigerian Civil War
description: ENUGU, Nigeria, Nov. 20 The old colonialstyle Rest House here in the former cap ital of Biafra has changed its name to the Phoenix Hotel. The name is intentionally symbolic.

title: Vermont Democrats Elect
description: RUTLAND, Vt., Nov. 27 (AP) Francis Esposito, a real estate dealer from Rutland, was re elected last nght to his fourth oneyear term as Democratic state chairman.

title: Vikings Activate Warwick
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 27 (UPI)Lonnie Warwick, a middle linebacker who has yet to play while recovering from preseason knee surgery, was activated today by the Minnesota Vikings for tomorrow's game with the Atlanta Falcons.

title: Michael A. Gast to Marry Renee Elkin
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 27Miss Rene Susan Elkin plans to be married here Dec. 18 to Michael Allen Gast, who is with the New Jersey State Office of the Public Defender in New Brunswick, where he also has a private law prac tice.

title: Controls Bog Planning, Connor Says
description: John T. Connor, who left the Johnson Administration nearly five years ago to be come president of the Allied Chemical Corporation, thinks that he is not much different from other executives trying to thread their way through the maze of the Phase Two price and wage regulations.

title: Flannery O'Connor: The Complete Stories 555 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus &
description: The title sums up author, book and life: Flannery O'Connor: The Complete Stories. She died in 1964 at the age of. 39; she published 31 stories, of which 12 have been uncollected until now. Now they are all in one book, arranged in chronological order from the stories she wrote for her master's thesis at the University of Iowa to Judgment Day, a harrowing version of her brilliant early story about an elderly Southerner's exile in New York, The Geranium. Since the stories here include the original openings and other chapters of her two novels Wise Blood and The Violent Bear It Away and since stories were more natural to her than novels, we do have almost all of Flannery O'Connor complete here. Especially when you reflect that the driving characteristic of her style, her mind, her particular faith, was to find people complete in the smallest gesture, or in a moment's involuntary action that could decide a life forever.

title: Coast Bridal for Christine Farrow
description: SAN MARINO, Calif., Nov. 27Miss Christine Farrow of South Pasadena, and James Hancock Blackwell Jr. of Washington, were married here this afternoon in the Southwestern Academy chap el by the Rev. Gordon Hess of La Jolla Presbyterian Church.

title: Frederic Stern Marries Marilyn Levy
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., Nov. 27Miss Marilyn Susan Levy and Frederic M. Stern, who is serving with the Navy in Norfolk, Va., were married here this evening in Sinai Temple by Rabbi Hirschel Jaffe.

title: RATE RISE URGED FOR CON EDISON
description: A state examiner recom mended yesterday that the Con solidated Edison Company be allowed to raise its annual charges for electricity by $3.7 million more, on a permanent basis, than the $52million in crease in rates put into effect temporarily last June.

title: DEMOCRATS SPLIT ON UNITY PANEL
description: The New York City Demo cratic Committee, formed 20 months ago to coordinate the activities of the striferidden party here and help unify it, is getting, mixed reviews from reading Democrats.

title: GRAMBLING ROUTS FULLERTON, 59 TO 26
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 27 (UPI)Herman Christophe ran for 129 yards, scored two touchdowns, and set up two others as Grambling College routed California State University at Fullerton, 5926, before 60,415 fans today,

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Camera on Mariner 9 Finds a Martian Moon
description: Those on earth aiming the telescope camera on Ma riner 9 as it orbits Mars 84 million miles away almost hit a bullseye yesterday on Phobos, the tiny Martian in ner moon.

title: Study Here Assails Pending Relief Bill As Discriminatory
description: The pending Federal welfare reform bill was criticized yes terday in a special analysis by the Community Service Society of New York, despite its en dorsement of the principles, of minimum Federal, aid and eligibility.

title: Mr. Nixon's Economic Summitry
description: President Nixon's plan to meet separately at the summit with President Pompidou and Prime Minister Heath next month initiates long overdue repair work on the country's vital alliances in the Atlantic and Pacific. The fabric of those alliances has been strained by the Administration's unilateral diplomacy and particularly by the international monetary and trade policies pursued since last August.

title: Esther Drury to Be June Bride
description: STANLEY, N. Y., Nov. 27 Miss Esther Fiske Drury and William Perry Vaughan plan to be married in June in Saranac Lake.

title: SHORTER RETAINS A.A.U. RUN CROWN
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Nov. 27 (AP)Frank Shorter won his second straight National Amateur Athletic Union crosscountry title today at the University of California at San Diego's hilly course.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Gather nuts, seed pods, dried grasses, leaves, etc., for making Christmas decorations.  If the lawn has not been limed for several years, late fall a good time to do it. Then clean the lawn spreader and put it away.  Last call to plant bulbs; some tardy gardeners have still not finished; do it promptly before the ground freezes.  Don't forget to keep the bird feeders filled and al ways have a supply of water handy for them.

title: A DISSIDENT PARTY FORMED IN DALLAS
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27Dr. Ben jamin Spock, the pediatrician and antiwar activist, was named somewhat reluctantly tonight as a standin candidate for President by a new fourth party, which is holding its or ganizing convention here in Dallas.

title: Bolling Haxall Jr. to Wed Marcia Anne Ferdinand
description: BASKING RIDGE, N. J., Nov. 27Miss Marcia Anne Ferdinand and Bolling Walker Haxall Jr., a greatgreat greatgrandson of William Early Dodge, who founded the PhelpsDodge Corpora tion, the copper mining com pany, with his fatherinlaw Anson Greene Phelps, plan to be married here next April.

title: Jaradara, $12.20, Triumphs in City of Miami Handicap at Tropical Park
description: MIAMI, Nov. 27  Horseplayers exist on past performances and on that basis Mr. Brogann and Joe Gaylord drew most of the attention in today's $20,000 added City of Miami Handicap at Tropical Park.

title: $115,000 for Preservation
