description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)The New England Natural Resources Center has given $115,000 to design a program for preserv ing more than 1,700 natural areas. The grant was an nounced by the New England Regional Commission.

title: An Eskimo Village in Alaska Uses Television to Gauge the Political Climate
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 27  An Eskimo village 500 miles west of here has turned to television to influence the political processes that af fect the lives of its 500 residents.

title: LEVY NAMED TO HEAD STATE UNIT ON AGING
description: Governor Rockefeller yester day named Gustave L. Levy, the Wall Street investment banker, to head the 126mem ber New York State delegation to the White House. Conference on the Aging, which begins today in Washington.

title: Israeli Aide Resigns
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27 (Reu ters)Gideon Rafael, director general of the Israeli Foreign Ministry, has resigned from his post. He represented Israel at the United Nations during the 1967 war.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 14,000 Deer Shot in'71 In Maine Southern Zone
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 27 (AP)The state fish and game department has estimated that just under 14,000 deer were shot in the southern zone this year.

title: Forgotten Senior Citizens Uniting To Improve Services in Brooklyn
description: There were no shouts of Right on! or Power to the people! but more than 100 elderly persons assembled in Brooklyn's. Borough Hall were angry about what they felt was a serious neglect of the problems of the aged.

title: Army Tops Navy, 2423
description: Army defeated Navy, 2423, yesterday in their traditional football game at Philadelphia on a fourthquarter touch down pass by J. Kingsley Fink. Details in Section 5.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR: As political journalism, your article on Carter Burden rates a D Minus. As described, Carter rates less. Mr. Meehan obsequiously referred to the subject with Hardy Boyish phrases as tall, lean, blond, deeply tanned, and exuding a cool and even an intense, Bobby Kennedy sort of charisma. We are even told, with presumed seriousness, that Carter can manage at the same time to appear totally calm and seethingly angry.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sitting on a white metal stool in front of his green wooden locker, Joe Namath was changing into long thermal underwear yesterday when Weeb Ewbank approached.

title: Leafs Tie Hawks, 33
description: TORONTO, Nov. 27 (UPI)Paul Henderson converted Norm Ullman's rebound at 14:32 of the third period tonight to give the Toronto Maple Leafs a 33 tie with the chicago Black Hawks.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Visits Border
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27 (Reu ters)Prime Minister Gandhi flew today to Rajasthan to ad dress troops and villagers near the border with West Pakistan.

title: CITY TEAM TAKES BRIDGE OPEN LEAD
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 27A New York team took the lead today in the first semifinal of the American Contract Bridge League's Reisinger open team championship.

title: United StatesVietnam Relations, 19454967
description: Historians of modern international relations frequently must rely on documents which, although authentic, were selected and released as political weapons. The Bolsheviks after the Revolution pf 1917 published secret treaties and correspondence from the Czarist archives to discredit the war aims of the Allies. The Germans in 1920 compiled 40 volumes of documents on European diplomacy 18711914 as a defense against the charge that Germany was guilty of starting the war.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONFor the last sev eral months, as India and Pakistan drifted toward war, the United States and the Soviet Union have been exercising the classic superpower function of counseling restraint on their respective clients in the sub continent.

title: Forest Preserve in Adirondacks Is Concern of Environmentalists
description: A railroad that was cut into the Adirondack Mountains as an emergency measure during World War II is raising con cern among environmentalists who see it as a possible open ing wedge for commercial ex ploitation of the Forest Pre serve.

title: White House Decoration Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Lidden Pennock of Philadel phia, who created the setting for the Rose Garden wedding of President and Mrs. Nixon's daughter Tricia, has been chosen to supervise this year's White House Christmas deco rations. The White House also announced this week that Henry Callahan of Saks Fifth Avenue would trim the big Christmas tree in the Blue Room as he did last year. The White House will be closed to visitors from Dec. 9 to 12 for the decorating.

title: Music
description: Americas intellectual his tory is rich in cultism, fad dism and largescaled self deception.

title: 11 Girls Are Presented at Plaza At Grosvenor Debutante Ball
description: Eleven young women were presented at the 29th annual Grosvenor Debutante Ball in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza last night. Mrs. Charles R. Beattie Jr. was chairman for the event, which benefits Grosvenor Neighborhood House. Mrs. Edward T, Chase is president of the beneficiary founded in 1915 as a privately supported settlement house serving a large area of the upper West side.

title: Area's Status Seekers Have the Schedules But Do They Have the Talent?
description: Status to a basketball team is just as important a commodity as good players. It not only gives satisfaction to coach, alumni, administration, students and players but also helps immeasurably in recruiting and in obtaining tournament bids.

title: Rice Triumphs, 23 to 0; Beall, Baylor Coach, Out
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 Mark Williams kicked field goals of 22, 22, and 29 yards today to establish a Southwest Conference season record and led Rice to a 230 victory over Baylor in the final game for the Bears' head coach, Bill Beall.

title: One Astor Plaza 87 Per Cent Rented
description: One Astor Plaza, the 53story star of the Broadway real estate scene rising between Times Square and Shubert Alley, is not quite a soldout house.

title: SO. MISSISSIPPI WINS SEASON FINALE, 350
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss., Nov. 27 (AP)Two seniors considered too small to play college football led Southern Mississippi to a 350 rout of West Texas State today in a seasonending game for both teams.

title: Letters To the Travel Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: Edward Behr, author of Memoirs of a DogTired Foreign Correspondent (Travel section, Nov. 14), is a very funny writer. But his references to India's domestic air carrier, Indian Airlines, are unfair to the point of viciousness. As a frequent air traveler to India and elsewhere, I have found that Indian Airlines' personnel are, by and large, as courteous and helpful as any in the world. Certainly, Indian Airlines suffers from shortcomings and problems; so, however, does the service of almost all airlines around the world, our own not excluded.

title: Do You Need a Plumber For Love Scenes? Natch
description: THE movie lovescene has come a long way over the years. Passion on the screen today is far more graphically depicted than in the time of even Valentino or Garbo. Mod ern directors, as well as more permis sive morals, are probably responsible. But not enough credit has been given to the ingenious film technicians who work behind the scenes. Here are a few recently taped interviews with some lit tleknown specialists who have helped make the movie lovescene what it is.

title: OVATIONS
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Long Passes Help Boston College Top Holy Cross, 217
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Nov. 27 (AP) Ray Rippman, a senior, passed for two touchdowns and set up another with a long strike today as Boston College defeated Holy Cross, 217, in their traditional New England college football windup.

title: Information Director Named
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27 (UPI) Al Kuettner, education writ er for The Cincinnati Post and TimesStar and former national civil rights correspondent for United Press International, has been named director of infor mation at the University of Cincinnati.

title: Melinda Moon Plans Marriage In Paris Dec. 21
description: Mrs. June Blossom of 240 East 82d Street has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Melinda Messmore Moon, to Christian ClmentBayard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Clment Bayard of NeuillySurseine and Pierrefonds, France.

title: Those Old Movie Travelogues, Or, As the Sun Sinks Slowly In the West, We Bid Farewell
description: WHEN I was growing up, in the pretelevision years of the late nineteenthirties and the nineteenforties, coming dazedly of age in Suffern, N. Y., a small town in Rockland County some 25 miles northwest of the George Washington Bridge, I knew almost nothing of the world beyond Suffern other than what I read in books or learned from going to the movies. As far as travel goes, in fact, I rarely traveled any farther than down to the corner store on my bicycle to pick up a loaf of Silvercup bread. And, except for things like the Baseball Joe series, I didn't read many books, either. So, for better or for worse, my youthful conception of places more distant than Spring Valley, the neighboring town, was just about entirely formed by the movies.

title: Condors Stem Comeback
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (AP) The Pittsburgh Condors lost a 31point lead, then came through in the fourth quarter tonight to defeat the Floridians, 110106.

title: Racing Drivers to Demand Improved Fire Precautions
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (AP) The world's top racing drivers will meet here next week to demand steppedup fire precautions after allegations that the 35yearold Swiss ace, Jo Siffert, need not have died.

title: CONNALLY LEAVES FOR ROME TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally left today for Rome, where he will head the United States delegation to a 10nation meeting aimed at ending the world's monetary uncertainty.

title: A monument to subject
description: As biographer of Baudelaire, Rimbaud and Petrus Borel, the late Enid Starkie occupied what was in one respect a middle ground among writers on French artists of the 19th century: Serious critics, though commending her, claimed she tended to scant literary analysis in favor of biographical data; whereas connoisseurs of biography and lovers of literature in general appreciated her sympathetic treatment of her subjects but sometimes found the artistry of her books diluted by overabundant paraphrase and academic explaination.

title: Alioto Trial Date Off
description: SEATTLE, Wash., Nov. 27 (UPI)Uniteed States District Judge William T. Beeks vacated the Jan. 3 date for the start of the Federal criminal trial of Mayor Joseph C. Alioto of San Francisco and three former Washington state officials. Judge Beeks took the action yesterday because of the length and slow pace of a civil trial of three of the defendants in Vancouver.

title: Cyprus Proposal Accepted
description: ATHENS, Nov. 27 (Reuters) Greece and Turkey have ac cepted a proposal by Secretary General Thant for the appoint ment of a United Nations repre sentative to the Cyprus inter communal talks, a Greek Gov ernment spokesman said today. He said that both Governments had also accepted the appoint ment of a Greek adviser and a Turkish adviser in the talks.

title: Music
description: THERE are good reasons why the recent per formances here of Karl heinz Stockhausen's Carr were the first the work has had since its pre miere in Hamburg 11 years agoand they have nothing to do with the intrinsic qual ity of the music.

title: 3 Arrested and 4 Injured In an AntiCastro March
description: Three persons were arrested yesterday and four others in jured as 150 antoCastro dem onstrators marched more than 20 blocks from the United Na tions to the Cuban Mission shouting Cuba si, Russia no and Freedom for Cuba.

title: EyetoEye With a Crocodile, and Other Confrontations in the Amazon Jungle
description: MIREN, un crocodilo, whispered Antonio the witch doctor from the bow of our dugout canoe. Tonight he was acting as guide for Jan and me. I followed the beam of his flashlight across the creek and there, sure enough, were two red eyes staring at us from just above the surface of the inky water. I pointed them out to Jan. She smothered a sound with her hand as Moses, Antonio's young helper, swung the craft around and Antonio gently paddled closer to the steady red beads. Then a soft gurgle and the eyes were gone. Everyone relaxed and we headed upstream.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Nicholas Wyeth Fiance Of Miss Jane A. Gleklen
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 27Mr. and Mrs. Leo Glek len have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Jane Alison Gleklen, to Nicholas Wyeth. He is the son of Andrew Wyeth, the artist, of Chadds Ford, Pa., and Cushing, Me., and Mrs. Wyeth.

title: 4 Blair Students Swim 179 Miles in 96 Hours
description: Four Blair Academy students, David Barow, 17 years old; John Greer, 16; Scott McLean, 16, and Todd Ruppert, 15, initiated the prep school's $750,000 pool at Blairstown, N. J., by setting a scholastic swim marathon record last Tuesday.

title: Perot Lauds U.S.O. Work
description: To the lonely, young serv iceman stationed in a strange city or foreign land, the back home atmosphere and activities provided by the local U.S.O. are a welcomed sight, H. Ross Perot, the business leader says.

title: The World
description: SALISBURYAt 5:30 last Thursday afternoon the Speaker took the chair in the Rhodesian House of Assembly. He wore a fullbottomed wig and before him rested a huge golden mace, both accoutrements that mimicked the British House of Commons.

title: How to improve things south of the Rio Grande
description: Admirers of the judicial talents of Justice William O. Douglas (among whom this reviewer counts himself) will be relieved to learn that the distinguished jurist's most recent literary effort contains nothing that should set the wolves howling. The boisterous pack of Congressmen who have long been urging his ouster from the Supreme Court in counterpoint to President Nixon's more subtle efforts to reduce the Court to mediocritywill find no fresh scent of scandal here.

title: N.A.I.A. FINAL SPOT TO WESTMINSTER
description: KENOSHA, Wis., Nov. 27 (AP)  Carthage, Wis., and Westminster, Pa., played to a 2828 tie today, with Westminster awarded victory in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics Division II football playoff semifinal because it had more penetration inside its opponent's 20yard line.

title: INJUSTICE
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Dance: Les Fleurs du Mal Premiere
description: When the French choreog rapher Maurice Bjart is at his best there is frequently felt a pungent literary sen sibility, an almost aromatic evocation of times and art past and yet now revalued and revered. He has a re markable sense not just for fashion but also for the mood of his day, and occasionally the mood for tomorrow.

title: DISCONCERTING
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Architecture
description: WASHINGTON was enjoying a very early spring last week. The days were languorous with the false warmth that bears false promises of love and life when only December is ahead. In one of those out rageously beautiful corny gestures that the Capital alone can make, the top of the Washington monument was gilded with late after noon sun, and moments later the Lincoln Memorial caught the magic light of the time between day and dusk with an incandescent glow. The city was never lovelier.

title: Dance
description: IT has been an interesting week for dance  City Ballet is back at the New York State Theater, Les Grands Ballets Canadiennes has been filling in between Joffrey and Bjart at the City Center, the Sierra Leone Dance Company (which I un fortunately missed) has fin ished off Brooklyn's ethnic dance extravaganza, Lar Lu bovitch and his company have been playing just off the Bowery and Jennifer Muller has given a couple of concerts at Merce Cunning ham's new Westbeth studios. Where to start?

title: New Shelters Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The Government Accounting Office says that new fallout shelters should be centered in areas most vulnerable to nu clear attack. The report, issued Wednesday, said that the Of fice of Civil Defense had not been realistic in treating all areas of the country the same. It suggested new shelters near United States retaliatory mis sile fields, military and Govern ment command centers, big cities and industrial centers.

title: Pratt (Kan.) Captures Junior College Bowl
description: HUTCHINSON, Kan., Nov. 27 (AP)Rick Hartman's 98yard runback of a 56yard fieldgoal attempt sparked Pratt, Kan., to a 1312 victory over Normandale State of Bloomington, Minn., today in the first MidAmerica Junior College Football Bowl game.

title: TENNESSEE BEATS VANDERBILT, 197
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 27 (AP)Tennessee bunched all its scoring in the fourth quarter and defeated Vanderbilt, 197, today in a Southeastern Conference football game.

title: Television
description: DOES The Electric Company turn kids on? And if it does, will it achieve its goal of helping 7to10yearolds overcome their reading prob lems? The Children's Televi sion Workshop has $7million that says yes on both counts.

title: T.C.U. Beats S.M.U., 1816, on Simmons's 29Yard Field Goal With 0:13 Left
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27 (UPI)Berl Simmons's 29yard field goal with 13 seconds left gave Texas Christian an 1816 victory over Southern Methodist and completed the Frog's best season in six years.

title: THE ARABISTS'  FUNCTION
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Indians Who Seized a Building Are Winning Support to Keep It
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 27In dians who seized control of an abandoned Coast Guard station here last August have won significant Federal support in their efforts to keep the facility.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Prisoner of War Medal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Senator John G. Tower, Re publican of Texas, has intro duced legislation that would create a prisoner of war medal to be awarded to any service man captured in combat since Jan. 1, 1960.

title: Travel Notes: Amtrak's New Metropark, Parks Centennial, Christmas Festival
description: W HAT'S this stop? said the woman by the window. I've never stopped here on the Metroliner before. And she was right. It was Sunday, Nov. 13, and it was the first inservice day of Amtrak's new Metroliner station at Metropark, N. J. There were a few family groups waving on the platform, almost no cars in the vast parking lot, and only a handful of passengers getting on or off. But it was Sunday and the first day. The crowds would come later.

title: V.M.I. BOWS, 340, TO VIRGINIA TECH
description: ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 27 (AP) Don Strock threw two scoring passes today to lead Virginia Tech to a 340 victory over Virginia Military Institute.

title: Miss Lalanne Wed to S. F. Miner
description: SYOSSET, L. I., Nov. 28 Miss Michele Ann Lalanne and Stephen Francis Miner, teachers in Troy, N. Y., sub urbs, were married here this afternoon.

title: IOWA WINS 7 TITLES IN U.S. WRESTLING
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 27 (AP) Iowa and Norhern Iowa dominated the fourteam United States Wrestling Federation quadranglar meet today.

title: CHICAGO REPORTS SEGREGATION IS UP
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27  Chi cago's public schools became even more tightly segregated during the last year as the total number of black pupils increased, and white families continued to move to the sub urbs.

title: Child to the Perlbinders
description: A daughter was born Nov. 13 to Mr. and Mrs. Mark Perlbinder of New York at Mount Sinai Hospital. Mrs. Perlbinder is the former Miss Dare Caplin. Her husband is a partner with his father, Julius Peribinder of Hewlett Bay Park, L. I., in the New York building firm of Perl binder Realty. The child has been named Muffy J.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Tale of Two Goalies
description: With onefourth of the National Hockey League season over, the Rangers entered this weekend's play with Ed Giacomin generally considered the best goalie in the game. The Rangers, however, also have the goaltender with the best averageand it's not Giacomin. It's little Gilles Villemure, nominally the New Yorkers' No. 2 man.

title: LADY FLEMING HERE TO SEEK AID CUTOFF
description: Lady Fleming, expelled from Greece and deprived of her Greek citizenship two weeks ago, arrived in the United States yesterday to seek an end to American aid to the Greek Government.

title: Article 5 -- No Title
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I., Nov. 27 (AP)Favored Northern Pride won the $5,000 Warwick Handicap before 8,484 patrons at Narragansett Park today, covering the mile and 70 yards in 1:45 . He finished a length and a quarter ahead of Flute Boy, with Super Buper third.

title: Italian Neo Fascists Curbed in West Germany
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Nov. 27The first major re cruiting drive by Giorgio Almir ante, the Italian neoFascist, among the hundreds of thou sands of Italians working in Western Europe, ended in fail ure tonight in the face of op position of Belgian and West German authorities.

title: Chiefs Hosts to Pioneers In Roller Derby Tonight
description: Joan Weston, one of the Roller Derby's brightest stars, will make her first New York appearance this year at Madison Square Garden tonight as her Pioneers meet the Garden's team, the Chiefs, at 7:30. Miss Weston has been skating professionally since 1951, spending many years with the Bay Bombers.

title: Guards in Blazers, Led by a 27YearOld, to Patrol Farmingdale Campus
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I.The State University system has adopted a new program under which educated men, with a desire and an ability to understand and respond to student needs, are being hired as campus security guards.

title: Volunteers Needed
description: The Mothers March on Birth Defects is in need of volunteers, Mrs. Shirley Weiner, the Brooklyn chairman of the organization, announced. Funds collected are used in research and work in the fight against birth defects. Interested women should call 5225208 or write to the Brooklyn March of Dimes, 76 Court Street, Brooklyn, N. Y. 11201.

title: St. Lawrence Tops Clarkson In Hockey Tournament, 32
description: CANTON, N. Y., Nov. 27St. Lawrence upset Clarkson, 32, tonight in the final game of the North Country Thanksgiving Hockey Festival. The victory gave the Larries a share of the tournament crown with Clarkson as both teams finished with 21 wonlost records in the threeday roundrobin event.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PALM DESERT, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)The White House re fused to comment today on re ports that President Nixon planned to send diplomatic notes to India and Pakistan urging a peaceful solution to their dispute.

title: Barbara A. Mogg Bride in Capital Of J. S. Guignard
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church in Georgetown was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Barbara Ann Mogg, daughter of Mrs. Biagio Lapenta of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island, and the late Millard E. Mogg of Coral Gables, Fla., to James Sanders Guignard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sanders Richard Guignard Jr. of Columbia, S. C.

title: Farming in Suffolk: Big But Declining
description: The condition of Suffolk County farming is a paradox: The county is the most productive agriculturally in the state, recording gross sales of about $69million in 1970, but even its most enthusiastic proponents concede the future of farming in Suffolk is dark.

title: Foreign Notes
description: Mao and Company

title: NIXON SAID TO PLAN APPEALS ON FIGHTING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  President Nixon is reported ly sending messages to the leaders of India, Pakistan and the Soviet Union this weekend in hopes of heading off a gen eral IndianPakistani war.

title: Phase II of the Capitalist System
description: CONSIDER the following day in the life of a conservativeminded New York businessman we will call Smith:

title: Test for Jets'Defense
description: After a briet sojourn to the land, of the inept, the Jets return to reality today for their third game in four weeks with a first or secondplace team.

title: Maurice J. O'Rourke, 58, Dead; Headed City's Election Board
description: Maurice J. O'Rourke, presi dent of New York City's Board of Elections, died last night of a heart attack at Good Samari tan Hospital in Suffern, N. Y. He was 58 years old and lived at 215 East 60th Street.

title: COMPLAINTS RISE ABOUT LAWYERS
description: Complaints filed against law yers practicing in Manhattan and the Bronx jumped 10 per cent in a year's time  bringing the rate to one complaint for every 12 lawyers  according to a report just released by the grievance committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York.

title: The World
description: CAIROI have come to tell you that the battle is at hand, said President Anwar elSadat a week ago, addressing Egyptian troops stationed along the Suez Canal. There is no longer any hope whatsoever of a peaceful settlement. Our decision is to fight.

title: Connally Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 27 (AP)Sec retary Connally arrived here tonight and was greeted at the airport by the Italian Treasury Minister, Mario Ferrari Ag gradi.

title: Marlu Pride's 1 :57  Defeats Fresh Yankee
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Marlu Pride raced to an upset neck victory over Fresh Yankee last night, setting a track record of 1:57 in the $50,000 Pacific Trot at Hollywood Park.

title: RustColored Tap Water in Queens Is a Reminder of City's New Tunnel System
description: Worried residents of the Flushing and College Point sections of Queens were assured by city officials last week that rusttinted tap water that poured into their sinks one afternoon was a oneshot accident that would not recur.

title: The Nation
description: By this autumn the manage ments of nearly 50 companies with offices in New York City had ac quired property in suburban Westchester County with the idea of moving most or all of their general offices out of congested Manhattan.

title: For Black Africa, Who Is Getting the Good jobs Remains a Painful Question
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  In a large part of Africa one of the most tenacious and emotional public issues is Africaniza tion the replacement of foreigners by blacks in good jobs and in business.

title: Ellen Fein Is Affianced
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 27Dr. and Mrs. Rich ard S. Fein have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Marie Fein, to Thomas Robert Reed, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Reed of Edgewater, Md.

title: Reader's Report
description: If Wilde's prescription that nothing succeeds like excess doesn't work for Peter Ustinov (a fellow dramatist), it isn't for lack of trying. Mr. Ustinov piles Pelion on Ossa in a rambling burlesque of American and British justice, prison riots, culture shock and anything else that occurs to him along the way.

title: This Police Station Is a Nice Place to VisitReally
description: If you really feel you have to get arrested let me suggest the 112th Precinct. It's really got everythingall the modern facilities plus a good address.

title: Donald Piper Jr. to Marry Carolyn Scott
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Nov. 27Mr. and Mrs. Eric Scott of New Rochelle and East Chatham have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carolyn Roberts Scott, to Donald F. Piper Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Piper of Laconia, N.H.

title: Smith, Despite Defeat, Wins Grand Prix Title
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Stan Smith of the United States was defeated by Yugoslavia's Zeljko Franulovic in the semifinals of the South American open tennis tournament today.

title: Sandy Ray Chorus Series
description: The Sandy Ray Chorus of the Cornerstone Baptist Church in Brooklyn will present a pro gram of gospel songs at the New York Shakespeare Festi val Public Theatre's Martinson Hall on Dec. 5 at 3 P.M. It is the first of a series of events that will include films, dance, drama and music.

title: The Last Word: Finally the Wasp
description: The die was cast, experts contend, when the communications industry, with the aid of sociologists and ethnologists, began plumbing the experiences of black Americans in the midsixties. Virtually every aspect of black life was examined, explicated, declaimed and anthologized. Despite its vaunted richness and depth, alas, black culture was exhausted and eclipsed; subsequently, other groups succumbed to the rapacious scrutiny of the ethnic observers. Since the sixties, in quick succession, Indian, Chicano, Puerto Rican, Chinese, Italian, Greek, Irish and Polish American cultures (will we ever forget that sociological classic, Sausage and Significance?) have been dissected. Now, several decades since the trend began, as was inevitable, America's best known and least conspicuous minority, the Wasp, has been thrust into the public eye.

title: Princeton Tops ltalian Five
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 27Brian Taylor, a junior guard, scored 25 points tonight to lead Princeton to an 8458 victory over the Italian national basketball team at Jadwin Gymnasium. The loss was the fourth in five games for the Italian squad against American college teams.

title: FLA. STATE TRIMS PITT TEAM, 3113
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 27 (UPI)Gary Huff threw touchdown passes of 53, 23 and 7 yards tonight in leading Florida State to a 3113 rout of Pittsburgh.

title: Science/Medicine
description: Ever since man first took to the sea, he has dreamed of ways to make his craft fly more swiftly through the water. Modern sailors often hone their hulls with wet sandpaper before a race to make them as slippery as possible. And there are products on the market designed to add several knots to the maximum speed of a hull by reducing water friction. The effectiveness of these measures, however, is a subject of much current debate.

title: Jazz
description: THE Vintage series of reissues, which RCA Victor inaugurated in 1964 and dropped a couple of years ago, is back in business, starting with six LPs which suggest that this new extension of the series may have a slightly different focus than it originally had.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: IN HIS latest comedy, The Prisoner of Second Ave nue, Neil Simon resorts to grimly amusing news casts of disasters to underscore the array of crime, pollution, incivility and other problems bedeviling modern man. In the delicious but grossly exaggerated reports, there doesn't seem to be anything to elicit cheers.

title: Marilyn Agnes Hofmann Bride Of Robert Keith Harrison Jr.
description: Miss Marilyn Agnes Hof mann and Robert Keith Har rison Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon. Both are Duke University graduates.

title: Kauai King Will Be Sent To England for Breeding
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 27 (AP) Kauai King, the Marylandbred winner of the Kentucky Derby and Preakness in 1966, is going to England next month for a season of stud duty. The son of Native Dancer will be bred to 45 British broodmares.

title: Wendy Hale Beach Is Betrothed
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Nov. 27The engagement of Miss Wendy Hale Beach to Bar tholomew Dennis Barry Jr. has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. H. Warren Beach of Edgartown and Essex Fells, N. J., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Barry of Wakefield.

title: Westhampton Isn't Just Summer Place
description: WESTHAMPTON, L. I.A gull wheels and makes a pass at the empty beach like a divebomber gone awry. The surf roars a whitecapped warning and attacks the silken sand in waves, but there is no one to hear.

title: City College Opens DayCare Center, but Financing Clouds Future of Facility
description: A small stone building on the City College campus, formerly called the Gate House, has been opened as a daycare center called the Jacob R. Schiff House by the college's presi dent, Dr. Robert E. Marshak.

title: Books:
description: THE EXECUTIVE AC COUNTING PRIMER. By Rob ert L. Dixon. 327 pages. Mc GrawHill. $9.95.

title: Pakistan and India Continue Fighting, But on Minor Scale
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 27 Seven days after thrusts by Indian armor and infantry into East Pakistan, the opposing armies appear to have settled into a series of border skir mishes short of allout war.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the article about the Jersey Meadowlands development [Jersey Meadowlands Making It  Nov. 7] there was reference to the Hartz Mountain development in Secaucus.

title: The Hunter
description: The hunter of Robert Holland's title is a psychopathic hillbilly, who rides the rods from Georgia to upstate New York, an area to which a cousin has emigrated. Young Billy Oakes never gets around to visiting cousin Daniel until he has stabbed to death seven citizens of Lakeport, N. Y., in the course of petty thievery. The idea is that Billy regards people as a species of game. Mr. Holland makes the chase properly exciting, but is less convincing with subtler human activities.

title: State Loan for L.I. Hospital
description: MANHASSET, L.I.North Shore Hospital has received a mortgageloan commitment of $23million for an expansion project from the State Housing Finance Agency.

title: Boat Safety Council Named From Varied Fields
description: Appointees to the Boating Safety Advisory Council were named last Tuesday by John A. Volpe, Secretary of Transportation. Selected ?? state government, industry and boating organizations and the public sector, these are the persons who, under the recentlypassed Federal Boat Safety Act of 1971, will review the need for new regulations as well as consider existing safety regulations.

title: Clemson Defeats South Carolina, 17 to 7, Before Record Crowd of 57,242
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Nov. 27 (AP)Underdog Clemson struck for 17 points in the second quarter today and then relied on a rugged defense to hold on for a 177 victory over old rival South Carolina.

title: Democrats' Money Woes Expected to Grow Worse
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 27  The Democratic party is so deeply in debt that the Ameri can Telephone and Telegraph Company, with an unpaid bill for $1.5million, is demanding a bonded guarantee of payment for telephone service at next year's Miami Beach convention.

title: Travel Woes of Crippled Stirring National Concern
description: ROSWELL, N. M.  When Ralph Markward booked passage on a Texas International Airlines flight from here to Albuquerque, N. M., recently, the airline told him he had to buy two seatsone for himself and one for an attendant.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Black Profile
description: Near the center of the complex controversy over welfare reform is what might be called a subterranean dispute over the social status of Negroes. The majority of persons living below the poverty line are white. Yet, in percentage terms, the ratio of persons on welfare and in the ranks of the working poor is much higher among the 22 million Americans who are black than it is among whites. One result is that political attitudes on the nature of the welfare problem and what to do about it are often influenced by racial stereotypes, many of them false. Recent research reports have put questions about Negro income, family strength and social mobility in an enlightening factual context.

title: Real Estate Trusts
description: Where do we go from here?

title: Curse Papa, love Papa, be guilty forever
description: I am happy to have written this book, be it good or bad, thus fulfilling my duty to my father to whom I owe everything, Alexandra Tolstoy prefaced her Tolstoy, a Life of My Father, published in 1953. Forty years before that, Ilya Tolstoy published his My Reminiscences. Now it is 1971, and still the giant shadow of UrTolstoy lies over these books, that world, those people. To whom I owe everythingwhen spoken by a Tartuffe with rolling eyes, harmless; when said with a full heart and 500 pages of evidence, terrifying.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: President, Alter 3 Years, Is Still Balked by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 President Nixon and Congress are approaching the end of the third year of their troubled and occasionally turbulent relation ship in much the same way they began itwith the President in command of foreign policy, the field that most engages his energies, but frustrated and on the defensive in domestic mat ters.

title: Art
description: THE Alex Katz retro spective that has now come to the Wads worth Atheneum in Hartford (through Dec. 31) is a large show. It consists of nearly 80 works representing a period of 15 years (1956 71). Many are big pictures. The SelfPortrait With Sun glasses (1969), reproduced on this page, measures 8 by 6 feet, and the painting of the Paul Taylor Dance Com pany called Private Domain (1969), is 19 feet long. Many of the pictures are por traits, and a good many of these are multiple portraits. The show abounds in visual incident and good humor.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: A TOWN IN U MINH BACK IN BUSINESS
description: DONGHUNG, South Vietnam, Nov. 19Until a few months ago Donghung was a ghost town, its substantial houses burned down by the Vietcong in 1965 and its rich rice fields abandoned.

title: NIXON AGAIN FACES FARM OPPOSITION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Po litical ghosts are rising to haunt President Nixon on the farm front.

title: Adriana Smits, Economic Analyst, Wed to Roger Boylan Tennis Pro
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., Nov. 27Miss Adriana War ren Smits and Roger Boylan were married here this even ing in Christ (Episcopal) Church by the Rev. Walter Neds. The Rev. Edward J. Prus of the Roman Catholic Shrine of the Little Flower in Royal Oak, assisted.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: A lady with a lust for living
description: In this second and final volume of the life of Lady Randolph Churchill, Ralph Martin completely succeeds in conveying the beauty and warmth of Sir Winston's mother. Indeed, to understand England's savior, one must read the story of Jennie Jerome. For it was from her that there flowed into him the passion and the life.

title: Red Wings Hand Rangers Third Defeat in 21 Games
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27If something is ailing the Detroit Red Wings, it was not evident tonight in the Olympia. The rebuilt Detroit club defeated the New York Rangers, 31, scoring three times in the final Period.

title: U.S. and Canada Plan A Headlight Glare Test
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 27 (AP)The United States and Canada may conduct a joint experiment aimed at solving the problems of automobile headlight glare, a local research concern has been told.

title: Changes Made in International Offshore Yachting Rule
description: The new International Offshore Rule for oceanracing yachts was made official last week by the North American Yacht Racing Union and will become effective any time between April 1, 1972, and Jan. 1, 1973, the group indicated.

title: Horse Show News
description: The Argentine equestrian team that left for home early this week after competing on the indoor fall horse show circuit won practically nothing but it should get a medal for good sportsmanship.

title: States Grow Wary of CostSharing Aid
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27Irritated by changing regulations and in creased budget pressures, state governments are growing skep tical of Federal costsharing programs, and some states are cutting back on their partici pation in such programs.

title: Cavaliers Win, 10395
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 27 (AP)The Cleveland Cavaliers broke open a close game late in the first half tonight and went on to a 10395 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: FILION IS SHUT OUT IN YONKERS RACES
CHAPOT IS VICTOR IN JERSEY SHOW
description: POTTERSVILLE, N. J., Nov. 27Frank Chapot, who only a week ago led the United States Equestrian Team to victory in the Royal Winter Fair Horse show in Toronto, visited one of the U.S.E.T.'s neighbors and rode Lady Monarch to the reg.ular working hunter championship.

title: Will He Say: Help Me Finish What My Brothers Began?
description: The author believes he has witnessed the commencement of the third Kennedy quest for the Presidency of the United States.

title: Education
description: Criticizing children is an unearned privilege enjoyed by adults. It is the child's fate to listen, or at least pretend to. Now, two editors,  one 50plus and the other a teenager  with the help of a school psychologist, have reversed the roles in a kind of Children's Lib appeal to youngsters, aged 9 to 12. The results of 1,130 questionnaires, in hundreds of selected schools distributed across the country to obtain a regional sample, are the body of a book, What Bothers Us About Grownups  A Report Card on Adults by Children (Stephen Greene Press; $5.95.)

title: Is Mr. Pinter Telling Us Less Than He Knows?
description: AT the end of Harold Pin ter's Old Times, which has come in sil ver silence to the Billy Rose, Rosemary Harris goes about a beach house turning down the lights. She is a guest in the beach house, having come from her own villa in Sicily to visit her old friend, Mary Ure, and Miss Ure's husband, Robert Shaw. The three have spent the evening reminiscing about longago events that may or may not have hap pened  the theft of a bit of lace underwear, the theft of a slow shy smile  while croaking out snatches of song, I Get a Kick Out of You and All the Things You Are, from the time when certain interchanges of personality did or did not take place. We sense that the elisions of time and place and face and name are about done now, that both memory and fantasy are about to fall quiet; the play is ending.

title: GOVERNOR CALLS FISCAL MEETING
description: Governor Rockefeller asked the state's Congressional dele gation yesterday to meet with him here on Dec. 3 to press for relief of the state's dire fiscal emergency.

title: Race to Mexico Was a OneClub Affair
description: For Jack Holiday, a seagoing Orange County (Calif.) dentist, the fourth biennial Long Beach (Calif.)La Paz (Mexico) yacht race was a personal triumph.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ADM. EMORY LAND, LED SHIP AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Vice Adm. Emory S. Land, who served as chairman of the Mari time Commission in World War II, died today in Bethesda (Md.) Naval Hospital. He was 92 years old.

title: INMATES SHIFTED IN RAHWAY RIOT
description: WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP, N.J., Nov. 27Seven inmates who broke out of their cells after the Thanksgiving Day re volt at Rahway State Prison have been transferred to a ward at Trenton Psychiatric Hospital, Dr. Maurice G. Kott, New Jersey's top corrections official said today.

title: TOP SOCCER CLUBS IN ACTION TODAY
description: The GermanHungarians, the GreekAmericans, New York Hota and the Philadelphia Ukrainian Nationals, all contenders for the GermanAmerican Soccer League title, will play league games today.

title: Recordings
description: CAEDMON is, of course, the thinking man's re cording company. Pur veyors of the spoken word, of readings from works of literary and histo ric importance. Like some of its latest releases: Gulliver's Travels: A Voyage to Lilli put; Christopher Columbus: Chronicle of 1492; Stanley and Livingstone: A Portrait of Africa and the Explorers in Their Own Words (all starring Anthony Quayle as reader and the last costar ring Joseph Wiseman as Stan ley); The Pilgrim Saga; and a recording of Waiting for Godot with the original New York cast. Hardly an enter prise to be charged with McLuhanism, with diverting us from the written word an artifact that the more sentimental persist in re garding as the primary trans mitter of our cultural heri tage

title: Canadians Vanquish Penguins, 31, Stretching Unbeaten Streak to 11 Games
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 27 (UPI) Mark Tardif scored his 15th goal of the season and set up another tally tonight as the Montreal Canadiens extended their undefeated streak to 11 games with a 31 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in a National Hockey League game.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27 (AP)Kareem Abdul Jabbar and Oscar Robertson keyed a firsthalf scoring flurry tonight and the Milwaukee Bucks trounced the Cincinnati Royals, 11481.

title: MRS. ARTHUR W. WEIL
description: Mrs. Arthur W. Weil, widow of Arthur W. Weil, a noted motionpicture attorney, who died in 1939, died yesterday. She was 90 years old and lived at 300 East 57th Street.

title: A College Struggles To Recover on L. I.
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I.Long Island's own phoenix, in institutional form, is attempting to rise from the ashes of controversy on the 605acre former Ambrose Clark estate, only minutes from where the Long Island Expressway crosses Jericho Turnpike.

title: Parachuting Hijacker Sought in Wooded Area
description: WOODLAND, Wash., Nov. 27 (UPI)The F.B.I. said to day that a hijacker who para chuted from a plane Wednes day night with $200,000 ransom probably landed in a small wooded area east of here and might still be there, possibly with a broken leg.

title: Mrs. Linda M. Johnson Is Married
description: Mrs. Linda Moffett Johnson and Jay Harry Rossbach Jr. were married yesterday after noon in the Dana Chapel of the Madison Avenue Presby terian Church by the Rev. David H. C. Read, pastor of the church. A reception was given at the Knickerbocker Club.

title: Yen Revaluation Weighed
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27 (UPI)The International Trade Minister, Kakuei Tanaka, said today that Japan was not preparing to re value the yen upward by as much as 15 per cent, as news papers have reported.

title: Housing Unit Reports Progress On ScatterSite Goals for City
description: The City Housing Authority, which has been criticized lately for building both too little and too much scattersite lowrent housing, asserted last week tha it was well under way toward its 1967 pledge to build 4,000 apartments in middleincome neighborhoods.

title: STARS TURN BACK COLONELS, 111106
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 27 (AP) Willie Wise scored 38 points and turned in a crucial steal in the closing seconds tonight to pace the Utah Stars to a 111106 American Basketball Association victory over the Kentucky Colonels.

title: Art
description: I SEE that art is against nature. Art has to do more than nature. These words of Josef Albers, nearly 200 of whose works have been assembled in a beautiful retrospective at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, might be taken as a radical summary of the hu manist position pro modernist art. They aren't the only words that would do, for the sentiment they express has been a popular one in this century. But their peculiar asperitysuggesting an im patient dismissal of philoso phical compunctions, a kind of gruff downtobusiness at titudemakes them supreme ly apt to a discussion of geometrical abstraction, the wing of modernism of which Alb's, 84, is the current master emeritus.

title: Alexander Washburn Fiance Of Miss Sherry J. Blackwell
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, N. J., Nov. 27Miss Sherry J. Blackwell plans to be mar ried in May to Alexander Dillingham Washburn, who is with the State Street Bank and Trust Company in Bos ton.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  Although 1971 proved unripe for the appointment of the first woman Supreme Court justice, women's liberation won a modest consolidation prize last week in the form of the first Supreme Court ruling declaring a law unconstitutional because it discriminated against women. Perhaps the most surprising aspect of the decision was that it had been so long in coming.

title: Cahill Calls Return of Momentum to Army Key to Victory
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27Water was pouring down Tom Cahill's face, oozing through his shirt and dripping off his heavy coat as the smiling Army coach made his first public announcement after his team's victory.

title: Workers Pave Street And Stop the Trolleys
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Street department workers inadvertently settled a twoyear debate on whether buses or trolleys should be used along a downtown transit route.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CHARLES B. M'MANUS
description: Charles B. McManus, a re tired vice president of the New York, Ontario & Western Rail road and of the Louis Gulotta Coal Company of Roslyn Heights, L.I., died Saturday in Good Samaritan Hospital, West Islip, L.I. He was 86 years old and' lived at 15 Lomond Place, New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: Science Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) John B. Walsh has been named special assistant to Ed ward E. David Jr., President Nixon's science adviser. Mr. Walsh, 44 years old, will work in the field of national security affairs and will serve also as a senior staff member for the National Security Council.

title: Power Cut Off in Fairbanks
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Nov. 28 (AP) Fire in a power plant left twothirds of the city with out power since early this morning as temperatures hov ered around minus 20 degrees. The authorities said that many persons were dependent upon electricity for heating. Tele phones and radio stations also were not operating. It was not determined when power would be restored.

title: Slain Jordanian Angered Many Arabs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28 Wasfi Mustafa Tal, the 51year old Jordanian Premier who was assassinated in Cairo today, was one of the Arab world's most controversial political personalities.

title: WORK EXPECTED ON DOCKS TODAY
description: Longshoremen are expected to return in force today to docks from Maine to the Mex ican border, loading and un loading cargo and carrying lug gage for the first time since the Atlantic and Gulf Coast strike started 58 days ago.

title: Hispanic Group Names Head
description: Mrs. Irma Vidal Santaelia, 47 years old, founder of a number of Hispanic organizations and the first Puerto Rican woman admitted to the New York State Bar, has been named chairman of the Ladies Na tional Committee of the Coali Owl of Hispanic American Peoples, Inc. Mrs. Santaella is a member of the State Human Rights Appeal Board, and East ern Regional Chairman for the National Caucus of Spanish Speaking Women, Inc.

title: Miss Henning Ties Mark
description: INNSBRUCK, Austria, Nov. 28 (AP)Anne Henning of the United States achieved a 42.6 second clocking today in the women's 500meter speed skat ing event. She equaled the un official worldrecord time she established in Inzell, West Germany, last week.

title: German Shepherd Best in Show
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 28 Ch. Lakeside's Gilligan's Island, one of the topwinning dogs in America, added to his impres sive record tonight. The German Shepherd was named best in show in a field of 2,290 at the 59th allbreed fixture of the Maryland Kennel Club at the Fifth Regiment Armory.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Joe Namath returned to ac tive duty with the Jets yester day and turned on the sellout Shea Stadium crowd more ef fectively than a ton of sugar cubes laced with LSD.

title: Tom Murray of Tennessee, Served in House 24 Years
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Tom Murray, who served 12 terms in the House of Representatives before his defeat today. He was 77 years old.

title: 99% of Czechs Endorse Single Slate of Candidates
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 28 (Reuters) The Czechoslovak electorate has voted over 99 per cent in favor of official candidates in the first general election here since the 1968 Sovietled in vasion, according to official re sults announced today.

title: 2 Are Killed and 3 Injured In a Jersey Hotel Blaze
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 28 Two men died here early this morning when a fire swept through a threestory hotel on the main street. Two women were treated for smoke inhala tion and a man broke his leg when he jumped from the burning building.

title: Jet Flies Back From Cuba After Hijacking by 3
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 (UPI)A Trans World Airlines jetliner landed safely here today after being hijacked to Cuba by three armed men wanted in the slay ing of a New Mexico state policeman.

title: 2 Russians Die of Injuries
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 28 (AP)Two Soviet representa tives died today of injuries suffered in an auto collision yesterday on the highway con necting Ankara and Istanbul. The embassy identified them as the second secretary, Alek sandr Trukhtanov, and a press attach, Rafkat Soutanbekov. A third, Tahi Hasmenedov, identified as the Ankara cor respondent for Izvestia, was injured seriously.

title: Meavy Reported Just Fine
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)George Meany, 77year old president of the American Federation of Labor and Con gress of Industrial Organiza tions, who was hospitalized Thursday for investigation of chest pains, was reported doing just fine today, but there was no indication when he might be released from George Washington University Hospi tal here.

title: LAKERS ROLL ON FOR 14TH IN ROW
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 28 (AP)Jerry West, held score less in the first period, keyed a secondperiod explosion with 19 points and helped lift the Los Angeles Lakers to their 14th consecutive victory to night, a 138121 rout of Seattle in the National Basketball Association.

title: Wilson Picks Up Giants'
description: The law of averages finally worked out to the advantage of St. Louis against the New York Giants yesterday, and things also fell just right for Larry Wilson, the Cardinals' 6foot, 195pound defensive back.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS MEET WITH UNION
description: Contract negotiations re sumed yesterday in the week old strike of lay teachers against the schools of the Archdiocese of New York. But both sides reported no prog gress on the two key issues raises and pay parity between elementary and high school teachers.

title: OVERHAUL OF A.M.A. URGED BY ITS HEAD
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 (AP)The president of the American Medical ASsociation, saying our house of medicine is in need of major repairs, renewed his call today for a constitutional convention to overhaul the association's or ganizational and governing structure.

title: MRS. ROBERT CARTER
description: Mrs. Gloria Spencer Carter, an assistant manager in the New York City Housing Author ity and wife of Robert Lee Carter, former general counsel of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, died Saturday after a long illness of the nervous sys tem at their home, 100 LaSalle Street. She was 51 years old.

title: RANGERS CONQUER PHILADELPHIA HEX, DOWN FLYERS, 42
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 Ending the most physical week end of their National Hockey League season, the Rangers finally overcame their allergy to this city tonight with a 42 victory over the gritty Flyers.

title: German Industry Uniting in Wage Battle
description: BONN, Nov. 28West Ger man industrialists, alarmed by the prospect of recession, by the deepening strike of metal workers in some parts of the country and the growing mili tancy of workers, are closing ranks to deal with wage de mands.

title: EDWARD GILBERT JR.
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov 28Edward H. Gilbert Jr., who retired last year as a partner in the brokerage firm of Auchin closs Parker & Redpath, died yesterday in a Stamford nurs ing home. He was 79 years old and lived on Woods End Road.

title: AGENCY ASSAILED ON SEATTLE FOOD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28A Senate committee's staff charged today that the Depart ment of Agriculture was violat ing Congressional intent by re fusing to institute a direct, free food distribution program to feed the hungry in Seattle.

title: Nixon and Brandt Will Meet Dec. 28
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 28The White House rounded out a crowded schedule of en gagements for summit talks to day with the announcement that President Nixon and Chan cellor Willy Brandt of West Germany would confer Dec. 28 and 29 in Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: Advertising:
description: A courier recently arrived from Syracuse University brings word that the current big drink on campus is Maxi mus Super Beer.

title: COLONELS DEFEAT NETS IN OVERTIME
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 28The Nets, who had lost their last three games with Rick Barry scoring 28, 31 and 46 points, respectively, tried winning a game tonight with out his offensive might. They almost made it.

title: Doctor Surplus Ahead?
description: Will this country have a surplus of physicians by 1980?

title: Race Awareness Drive Stirs Capital Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Tens of thousands of Federal employes across the country have taken part during the last 18 months in race aware ness meetings aimed at purg ing racial prejudice.

title: Child Development in Danger
description: Two major education bills that enjoy bipartisan sup port in Congress are threatened by the Administration's fiscal meatgrinder. The Child Development Act is on the brink of obliteration; higher education aid faces either postponement or fiscal anemia.

title: Rates Edging Up
description: The credit markets are dem onstrating increased nervous ness about where Phase Two of the Administration's economic policy will lead.

title: UK HELP SOUGHT FOR ELDERLY POOR
description: The city will ask for a state subsidy on rent for the elderly poor to cover increases sched uled to start Jan. 1 in controlled apartments, Albert A. Walsh, city Housing and Development Administrator, said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nader Urges Curb on Use Of Hexachlorophene in Soap
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Ralph Nader urged the Food and Drug Administration today to classify all soaps and deodor ants containing hexachloro phene as drugs, and to limit the products to prescriptiononly sales.

title: Stans Visits Tiflis
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (UPI) Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans visited an industrial exhibition and a metallurgical factory in Tiflis, Soviet Georgia, today, the Soviet press agency Tass said.

title: 100 Western Businessmen Arrive for Moscow Talks
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28  More than a hundred senior execu tives of American and West European corporations gathered here today for a series of meet ings with Soviet Government leaders to explore prospects of increased business with the Soviet Union.

title: Some Who Decided Against Abortion
description: Some young and pregnant girls sat in a semicircle, in a small conference room not far from the delivery room at Lenox Hill Hospital, where each would soon give birth to a childout of wed lock.

title: Stage: Earl Who Wrote Shakespeare
description: It would be a brave man or woman who wrote and produced a new historical play in this day and age. However, Masquerade, which opened at the Theater Four last night, is not just brave, it is ridiculous. The play has been written by Gertrude Gayle, a name new to me, and is produced by the Masquerade Company.

title: SNIPERS IN ULSTER FIRE ON A PATROL
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 28 (UPI)British soldiers exchanged fire with snipers to day at the end of a weekend offensive by Irish Republican Army extremists that left three dead, at least 14 injured and scores of buildings bombed out in Northern Ireland.

title: ACADEMIC RESEARCH RISES 50% IN COSTS
description: A National Science Founda tion study has found that in flation caused an estimated 50 per cent increase in the direct costs of academic research and development over the last de cade.

title: FIREMEN STEP UP SICKNESS TACTICS
description: Accelerating pressure on the city for a new contract, 324 firemen reported themselves sick or injured after return ing from fire calls in the 24 lour period that ended at 8 A.M. Yesterday,

title: MRS. EMANUEL HARRIS
description: Mrs. Estelle Margolin Harris, a member of the New York County Grand Jurors Associa tion and wife of Emanuel Harris, a consultant on sales incentive programs, died Saturday in Doc tors Hospital following a heart attack. She was 68 years old and lived at 930 Fifth Avenue.

title: A History of Decentralization
description: The city was divided into 31 separate community school districts after the Legislature passed the School Decentral ization Abt in 1969. Parents of publicschool children and other registered voters in each district participated in elections in 1970 to select nine members for each of the community school boards.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: SALISBURY, RhodesiaIt is a curi ous experience rereading E. M. Fors ter's A Room With a View in Africa. How remote it all seems in time and place and manner the Ed wardian English ladies seeing Florence, the curates, the English suburbs, the little social ripples. But it connects.

title: STAMPEDERS WIN GREY CUP BY 1411
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Nov. 28 (UPI)The Calgary Stampeders defeated the Toron to Argonauts, 1411, today to win the Grey Cup and the Canadian Football League championship in a game high lighted by an unusual play near the finish.

title: Kosygin Echoes Khrushchev
description: Premier Kosygin's recent speech outlining the new Soviet fiveyear plan recalls one of the late Nikita Khru shchev's favorite themes. Mr. Khrushchev used to boast of the rapidity with which the Communist world in general and the Soviet Union in particular would surpass eco nomically the capitalist world in general and the United States in particular.

title: RAY GIRARDIN, 69, OF DETROIT POLICE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (UPI) Ray Girardin, Detroit's Police Commissioner during the 1967 riot in which 43 persons were killed, died today after suffer ing a heart attack at his home. He was 69 years old.

title: Arts Abroad
description: VIENNA  Vienna's most popular opera figure is not a singer. He is known by people who have never been to the opera, but he himself says he has attended nearly 14,000 opera performances over 45 years, including his emigration years when he was a soldier in the United States Army and went to the Met ropolitan Opera in New York on weekends from Camp Ritchie, Md.

title: Hansen, Stockbroker, Captures Fifth Sports Car Racing Title
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 28 (AP)Jerry Hansen, a Minn eapolis stock broker, survived a fenderbanging duel with Milt Minter of Santa Susann, Calif., and won the Class A sports racing event on the final day of the American Road Race of Champions. With this triumph he became the first driver to win five Sports Car Club of America national titles.

title: Troy Calls for Investigation of Mayor's Clubs
description: City Councilman Matthew J Troy Jr., the Queens Demo cratic leader, suggested yester day that the city's five District Attorneys investigate the John V. Lindsay Association, which he charged, had never filed a financial statement with the New York Secretary of State.

title: Staten Island's One School District is a Lesson in Quiet Isolation
description: Dr. Mary E. Meade, a mem ber of the city's central Board of Education, says that when her fellow Staten Islanders speak of the Board of Educa tion, the chances are they are referring not to the body on which she serves, but to their local community school board.

title: Coast Canals Pose a Threat to Artists
description: VENICE, Calif.The Cali fornia artists, who still make Venice Beach the liveliest creative commune on the West Coast, today find that their life style is seriously threatened by a $24million redevelopment program that would drastically alter the entire colony.

title: Now, Toys From Sesame Street
description: If all of the 8 million young sters between 3 and 5 who are said to view Sesame Street demand and get their own Cooky Monsters, the new line of toys developed by the Children's Television Work shop (C.T.W.), producers of the show, will be off to a flying start. To the bank, that is. And if they also badger their elders for Walking Letters, SpellA Phones, popup Muppets Bert and Ernie and all of the other 38 products, including books and records, that range in price from 39 cents to $9, C.T.W. and the U.S.A. may never be the same again: Production rights have been granted to Random House, Simon & Schuster, Inc., and Western Publishing Company, book publishers. The rec ord album is being produced by Warner Bros. Seven Ants Rec ords, Inc. Playthings are by Colorforms and Educational Toys, Inc., a subsidiary of Top per Corp.

title: Japanese Rally at U.S. Base
description: IWAKUNI, Japan, Nov. 28 (AP)  Nearly 3,000 workers and student radicals demon strated outside a United States military base at Iwakuni in western Japan today demand ing the removal of nuclear weapons that they assert are stored at the base. United States officials have denied the leftist charge and allowed Japanese Defense Agency offi cials to make an onthespot inspection of the base last week.

title: New Leader's Vigor Calms Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28There being no bus ness ready for action upon the docket, this month's meeting of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences at Har vard University was omit ted.

title: Alvin Ailey Dance Troupe Will Present 2 Premieres
description: Two premieres and three re vivals will be presented by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater at the City Center in a twoweek season from Dec. 7 through 19.

title: Bills Win One and Only 27,166 See It
description: The Buffalo Bills, after losing 15 consecutive National Foot ball League games, were begin ning to wonder if victory would ever come again, when fortu nately they met the New Eng land Patriots once more yester day in Buffalo.

title: School Crisis Builds Despite Stable Rolls
description: An era or galloping enroll ments has drawn to a close in America's elementary and sec ondary schools, but school ad ministrators see no end to mounting costs and crowded classrooms.

title: Wilson, in Boston, Describes United Ireland Plan
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28Harold Wilson, former Labor Prime Minister of Britain, today urged a 15year program that would lead to a united Ireland. He spoke at a news conference, which was disrupted by an Irish militant.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canadians'
description: TORONTO, Nov. 28The Gov ernment of Canada admitted last week that the United State's import surcharge will hurt Cana dian industry a lot less than Ottawa first led this country to believe.

title: Warsaw Pact to Hold Talks on Security Parley
description: WARSAW, Nov. 28  The foreign ministers of the War saw Pact nations will meet here this Week, it was announced to day, to discuss the problems concerned with preparations for convening a European se curity and cooperation confer ence.

title: MissileArmed Hydrofoil to Give U.S.Navy Light and Agile Look
description: In one of the first imple mentations of proposals from topranking admirals for a faster, lighterweight Navy, the Defense Department has given the signal for work to begin on a new type of ship  a missilecarrying hydrofoil.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Navy's Seals, SuperSecret Commandos, Are Quitting Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 28The last members of a special group of United States Navy commandos, whose intel ligence operations in the Me kong Delta have included kid nappings of suspected Vietcong agents and many unreported clashes with guerrillas, are be ing pulled out of Vietnam.

title: CUT URGED IN COST OF HEARING AIDS
description: A longsimmering dispute over the high cost of hearing aids and the qualifications of the salesmen who dispense them has led some hearing spe cialists to propose a radical new way of treating the hard of hearing.

title: HAWKS TRIUMPH OVER LEAFS, 42
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28 (UPI) The Chicago Black Hawks wore down a tenacious Toronto Ma ple Leafs' defense in the third period of their National Hockey League game tonight and post ed a 41 victory.

title: Democrats Say Governor Melted State Job Freeze
description: The State Legislature's Dem ocratic leadership asserted yes terday that Governor Rocke feller's administration had au thorized over 3,500 new po sitions and promotions carry ing an annual cost of almost $30million since last April 1, When it supposedly halted all new Jobs and promotions.

title: Francisco Sanchez Canton, 80, ExDirector of Prado, Is Dead
description: PONTEVEDRA, Spain, Nov. 28 (Reuters)Francisco Javier Snchez Cantn, former direc tor of Madrid's Prado Museum and one of Spain's leading art experts, died yesterday at his home. He was 80 years old.

title: Shipments of Steel Spurt as Tinplate Gets Price Increase
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 28Price influences brought a spurt in steel shipments last week.

title: Celtics Conquer Hawks
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP) Three Boston players combined for 68 points tonight as the Celtics easily defeated the Atlanta Hawks, 130108; in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Upper West Side Project Aids All Who Ask
description: In a small overheated room at 321 West 91st Street where Project Pilot makes its offices, the telephones ring constantly and they are answered invari ably in Spanish, French, Eng lish or New Yorkese, depending on who is calling.

title: A Fourth Party Is Organized, But It's Not a Mass Movement
description: DALLAS, Nov. 28  Yester day afternoon in the Cotton Bowl, 18,000 football fans cheered wildly as Berl Sim mons kicked a 29yard field goal with 13 seconds left to give Texas Christian an 1816 victory over Southern Method ist.

title: BAMANEBRASKA CALLER NO.1 BOWL
description: Ernie Seiler, executive vice president of the Orange Bowl, set the tone for advance bill ing of the AlabamaNebraska battle in Miami Jan. 1 when he said, We have the Super Bowl. Nobody but us. We have the superduper game.

title: 2 Men Arrested in Harlem Linked to 20 Queens Crimes
description: The police arrested two men in Harlem yesterday who had allegedly been involved in 20 robberies and muggings in Queens bars and supermarkets in the last year.

title: TOKYO MAY RAISE ITS OFFER ON YEN
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28The Japa nese Government is prepared to make a greater upward revalua tion of the yen than earlier ex pected in an effort to end the international currency crisis be fore the end of the year.

title: Clarity Shapes Recital by Johannesen
description: Grant Johannesen's recital at Hunter College Assembly Hall Sunday afternoon overflowed with the virtues one expects to hear in the pianism of the tall Utahan. Clarity, honesty and deadserious professional ism marked a program whose high point for this listener came in Copland's Piano Vari ations, a 40yearold essay in serial composition whose four note skeletal structure must be clear throughout. Mr. Johan nesen laid it bare with the deftness of a vivisector, but without stopping the musical pulse.

title: Dress Code for Teachers
description: CHELSEA; Mass., Nov. 28 (UPI) The Chelsea school hoard, which rescinded a dress code for students last year, has voted to impose a dress code for teachers.

title: White House Terms Death Of Tal Disturbing News
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 28 (Reuters)  The White House press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, said today that the assassination of the Jordanian Premier, Wasfi Tal, in Cairo was disturbing news.

title: FLEMMING OPENS PARLEY ON AGING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Arthur S. Flemming, chairman of the White House Conference on Aging, opened the fiveday meeting here tonight by urging the 3,500 delegates to make personal commitments to change society's attitudes to ward the elderly.

title: Forest Hills Project Protest Continues
description: Several hundred residents of Forest Hills participated in a peaceful demonstration yes terday morning at the construc tion site of a controversial 840 unit lowincome housing proj ect planned for the middle class Queens neighborhood.

title: Wings Top Canadiens, 42
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (UPI) Alex Delvecchio and Bill Col lins scored goals 33 seconds apart in the first period tonight to lead the Detroit Red Wings past the Montreal Canadi ens, 42.

title: Lottery Defaults Seen Enriching New Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 28The state of New Jersey stands to win as much as $3million by default because 29,000 holders of winning lottery tickets have failed to claim their prizes in the first 45 weeks of the lottery's op eration.

title: Residents Challenge East Side Redevelopment Plan
description: A broad plan for massive, federally assisted redevelop ment of the blighted Lower East Side has been challenged by some community groups that charge they have not been properly consulted and have objections to aspects of the plan.

title: 16YearOld Wins in a Walk in Event at Coney Island
description: Competing in his first race outside of his home state, 16yearold Kevin Ryan of Lowell, Mass., defeated 69 other starters yesterday in the 61st annual Coney Island 10mile walking race.

title: Chaps Win, 10698, as Hill Gets 24 Against Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 28 (UPI) Simmie Hill scored 24 points to lead the Dallas Chaparrals to a 10698 victory over his former teammates, the Florid ians, tonight.

title: Advertising:
description: Although the gross in comes of British agencies showed an increase in 1970, the net profits before taxes continued to drop as they have almost every year since 1964.

title: Bridg e: Reisinger Open Nears Finale With New Yorkers Leading
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 28 New York players fared well in the first of two final rounds of the Reisinger open team championship.

title: G.O.P. Says Meany Shows Bias Against Republicans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)The Republican Nation al Committee said today that George Meany's surliness toward President Nixon was evidence of political bias in fa vor of the Democrats.

title: Orders for Machine Tools Showed a Drop in October
description: Orders, backlogs and ship mehts of machine tools through October ran, behind yearago levels, the National Machine Tool Builders'Association re ported over the weekend.

title: Lynne Roberts and J. F. Proctor, Art Students, Are Married Here
description: Miss Lynne Nancy Roberts and Joseph Ford, Proctor, art students, were married here yesterday afternoon in Tem ple EmanuEl by Rabbi Na than A. Perilman.

title: Personal Finance
description: Congress has unwittingly placed quite a heavy tax bur den on married working couples. In fact, the tax law very definitely favors work ing couples who live together without benefit of matri mony.

title: Happy Every Hour of the Day
description: What does it feel like to be born monstrosity? These days, when everyone complains about being born black, or Jewish, or a female eunuch, it might be instructive to consider the life of John Merrick (18631890), whose appearance was so ghastly that even the police of Victorian England, who were inured to cruel sights, found him too shocking for public exhibit in a sideshow. When he could no longer be shown anywhere in Britain, his man ager took him to the Continent and, after finding him banned in Brussels, robbed his small savings and gave him a ticket to London.

title: PRISONERS FREED IN MEXICAN DEAL
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28 Nine Mexican prisoners who sought asylum in Cuba were flown there today in a Mexican Air Force plane as part of a deal to rescue Dr. Jaime Cas trejon Diez, a millionaire who is rector of the Guerrero state university.

title: Suns Sink Rockets, 116110
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) Dennis Layton scored 25 points to lead the Phoenix Suns to a 116110 victory over the Hous ton Rockets tonight. Layton scored all but 5 of his points in the second half.

title: Caging the Tiger
description: Ruthless, rampant, growing ever more powerful, money has become the tiger of American politics. As the House of Representatives takes up the various proposals for strengthening the laws on political campaign spending, it must not be distracted from the central task or getting this tiger safely into a cage and keeping it there

title: TV: Home, a British Hit, on Channel 13 Tonight
description: One of the best stage pro ductions of the 197071 Broadway season was a British import called Home. The play, by David Storey, was impeccably directed by Lindsay Anderson and it starred Sir Ralph Richardson and Sir John Gielgud.

title: FRANULOVIC DOWNS NASTASE IN NET FINAL
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 28 (Reuters)Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia won the South American open tennis title to day with a straightset victory over Ilie Nastase of Rumania. It was the last tournament on the 1971 Pepsi Grand Prix tour.

title: U.S. Army in Germany Acts to Lift Sagging Morale
description: HEIDELBERG, West Ger manyTormented by racial friction, faltering discipline and a weakened sense of mis sion, troops in the United States Seventh Army in Ger many are being introduced to a radically altered style of life in an effort to lift their morale and improve their effective ness.

title: NEWLEY IS HEARD IN SONG PROGRAM
description: The program that Anthony Newley is offering in the Em pire Room of the WaldorfAs toria Hotel is, as he takes pains to point out, made up entirely of his own songsNewley Sings Newley, he styles it.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It was unconscionable overwriting, but perhaps there was no way of avoiding that. Probably it simply isn't possible to come up with a lowkeyed script for Joe Willie Namath, the quarterback with the purpleandamethyst life styleBroadway Joe of the films and television, lover, manaboutsaloons, he of the black lingerie, the llama rug, the anklelength mink benny.

title: Thomson's 276 Takes Open
description: AUCKLAND, N.Z., Nov. 28 (AP)Peter Thomson of Aus tralia won the New Zealand open golf championship today, carding a 70 for an eightun derpar 276. He was two strokes ahead of Maurice Bem bridge of Britain.

title: Giants' Blunders Enable Cardinals To Win Here, 247
description: Handing the St. Louis Cardi nals 17 points in the first seven minutes, the New York Giants plodded on to a 247 defeat at Yankee Stadium yesterday. Four interceptions, two fumbles, two costly penalties and two crucial defensive lapses helped prevent them from extending their usual domination of the Cardinals, whom they had beaten four straight times.

title: DR. EDGAR C. BAIN, METALLURGIST 80
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 28Dr. Edgar C. Bain, an eminent re search metallurgist who retired in 1957 as assistant executive vice president for operations of the United States Steel Corpo ration, died yesterday at his home in Edgeworth, Sewickley, Pa. He was 80 years old.

title: BODY OF SLAIN YOUTH IS FOUND DOWNTOWN
description: An unidentified 18yearold youth was found slain with four gunshot wounds in lower Manhattan last night. The po lice said they found narcotics paraphernalia on the body and that the victim had been murdered elsewhere and the body abandoned in the East Side.

title: District Offices Provide Data on Rent Exemption
description: Elderly citizens can find out if they are eligible for partial rent exemptions by calling their district rent of fices. Applications for ex emptions must be filed by midnight tomorrow at the offices.

title: 9 in Soviet Ask Help Of Psychiatric Congress
