description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (AP) Nine Soviet citizens appealed today to the International Congress of Psychiatrists for help to put an end to the re ported Soviet practice of de taining sane persons in men tal hospitals because of their political beliefs.

title: CHICANOS SEEKING A NATIONAL ROLE
description: PUEBLO, Colo., Nov. 28At a national conference of the La Raza Unida party today, 400 MexicanAmerican and Puerto Rican activists pledged themselves to work for a Chi cano political movement in dependent of the existing American parties.

title: MAX I. FARBER
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 28 (AP) Max I. Farber, a former associ ate editor of The Hartford Times, died at Hartford Hos pital Friday. He was 78 years old and lived at West Hartford.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Indian Joe Guyon, 79, Dead; Athlete Teamed With Thorpe
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 28 (UPI)Joseph Napoleon (Indian Joe) Guyon, a teammate of Jim Thorpe at the old Carlisle (Pa.) Academy, died yesterday at a hospital here. He was 79 years old.

title: First Toll Road Is Opened On Puerto Rico by Governor
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 28 (AP)Puerto Rico got its first toll road today as Gov. Luis A. Ferr collected the 15cent fare from three island mayors.

title: $10Million Goal Is Set Here To Aid Israeli Labor Causes
description: The National Committee for Labor Israel yesterday adopt ed a goal of raising $10mil lion next year to support the medical, educational and social programs of Histadrut, Israel's labor federation, which num bers more than two million members.

title: Voter Turnout in Uruguay Sets a Record
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28The heaviest voter turnout in Uruguay's history, drawn by a presidential election today that offered choices ranging from socialism through liberal reform to an antiCommunist appeal for law and order, forced officials to extend poll ing throughout this small coun try until midnight.

title: Bacallo, Holmes Win
description: Pedro Bacallao of Forest Hills, Queens, and Joe Holmes of Darien, Conn., retained their national squash tennis doubles title yesterday by defeating Gary Walters of Hempstead, L. I., and Chester LaRoche of Fairfield, Conn., 1510, 15.7, 1015, 1618, 158, in the final at the Heights Casino in Brooklyn.

title: Eban in Britain for Talks
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel arrived today for talks with top British Government officials on the latest Middle Eastern developments, Common Market questions and other major international problems.

title: Irwin Captures Heritage Golf by Stroke
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Nov. 28  Hale Irwin, who is too small for profes sional football, won his first professional golf tournament today by one stroke. With a 27hole aggregate of 279 the 26yearold former All Big Eight safetyman at the University of Colorado carried off the $22, 000 first prize in the $110,000 Heritage Classic. Bob Lunn trailed him by one stroke and Jack Nicklaus tied Frank Beard for third at 281.

title: NDIA SETS RANGE FOR RETALIATIONS IN EAST PAKISTAN
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 28 Foreign Minister Jagjivan Ram said today that Indian troops had been given permission to move as deep into Pakistan as the range of the Pakistani guns shelling them.

title: Screen: 'Yojimbo' Sequel:Mifune Stars in Bloody Drama at the Bijou
description: That stalwart warrior of medieval Japan, Yojimbo, is back in a sequel titled "Zatoichi Meets Yojimbo." Again, Toshiro Mifune shares sword-swinging supremacy with a crafty blind derelict, played by Shintaro Katsu. The prolific Kihachi Okamoto directed and the color photographer is the renowned Kazuo Miyagawa ("Rashomon").Our main reaction to the import that opened on Saturday at the Bijou Theater is this: Save the pieces. Film art it may be, but of an extremely insular kind best savored on home ground. The movie's plot, which has the two men terrorizing a peculiarly passive village, is just as baffling as the English titles underscoring medieval tradition and fatalism.However, interested some American viewers may be in the indigenous aspects of the picture, the bald fact is that an entire village sits around on its haunches until two mysterious arrivals have chopped up the whole place. That's what you'll see in this starkly played drama. It also happens to be the most unrelenting slaughterfest from Japan we have ever seen, and we have seen most of them. Again, save the pieces.

title: Indian Offensive Reported
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 28 (Reuters)The Pakistani ra dio said today that India had launched a largescale new of fensive against East Pakistan, using two divisions, three ar mored regiments and several artillery units.

title: Broker Sees Bull Market If Public Returns
description: Sanford C. Bernstein, 45, started the New York Stock Exchange member firm bear ing his name just four years ago. His firm specializes in discretionary accounts. The other day he talked with Var tanig G. Vartan of The New York Times staff. Excerpts from their conversation fol lows.

title: CHIEFS' LATE RALLY WINS ROLLER DERBY
description: The Chiefs rallied from a 3828 deficit to defeat the Pio neers, 4540, in the Roller Derby last night before a crowd of 9,723 at Madison Square Gar den. The Chiefs, the New York entry in the International Roller Derby League, have won twice in three local appearances.

title: Manuel Tello, Mexico's ExForeign Minister, Dies
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28 (Reu ters)Manuel Tello, former Foreign Minister, died here yes terday at the age of 73 after suffering a heart attack.

title: Billings Wins by 45 Yards In FourMile Harrier Run
description: David Billings of the Falcon Spiked Shoe Club of Rockland County scored a 45yard tri umph in the Metropolitan Ama teur Athletic Union's fourmile crosscountry race yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Schuyler Kudner, 78, Dies; ExAdvertising Executive
description: JACKSONVILLE BEACH, Fla., Nov. 28 (AP)Schuyler Kud ner, a retired New York adver tising executive, died Friday at the age of 78.

title: United Fruit Bypasses City for Albany
description: YONKERS, Nov. 28When Capt. Joseph T. McKay boarded the pilot boat to meet the S.S. Morant in the rising midchan nel mists this morning, he be gan what rivermen hope will be a new era for shipping in the Hudson River Valley.

title: and Higher Education, Too
description: The outlook for effective Federal aid to colleges and universities in time to deal with the worst fiscal depres sion in American higher education history is equally dim. Chances to bridge the ideological differences between the Senate and House measures have substantially improved. But there is a growing feeling among those who have shaped this historic legislation that, while they are building an irrigation system, the budgeteers will keep the dollars from flowing into it.

title: Texas Plane Crash Kills 7 From 2 Colorado Families
description: FOREST, Tex., Nov. 28 (UPI) Seven Colorado residents were killed when their small plane crashed in a national forest today shortly after taking off from a private air strip in a rainstorm.

title: Reaves Case: Defense Rests  Jury Out on Record
description: The University of Florida's defense made no attempt to stop a late Miami of Florida touchdown so that John Reaves, the Gators' quarter back, could get the ball one more time and set a national collegiate passing record Saturday night.

title: 9 Food Prices Cut Here; 13 Raised Despite Freeze
description: Price rises for nine basic food items were rolled back in October in the New York met ropolitan area, according to United States Bureau of Labor Statistics reports, but apparent violations of the 90day price freeze increased substantially above the September total.

title: Hawaii Cleanup Drive Ends
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 28 (AP) More than 217,000 volunteers participated in a nineday cleanup drive that ended this weekend at beaches here and other sections of Oahu, officials said today. They said the volun teers picked up about 3,300 tons of litter.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
MEDICAID CHECKED BY PROFESSIONALS
description: The city's Health Depart ment has been using parttime professionals to review the work of others providing serv ice in the Medicaid program, Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, First Deputy Commissioner, said yesterday.

title: Kosygin Reported Planning Talks With Scandinavians
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePresse) It was announced here today that Premier Aleksei N. Kosy gin of the Soviet Union would visit Denmark and Norway, Thursday through Saturday.

title: AntiCommunist Publisher Of 2 Saigon Papers Slain
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 29 (Reuters) The publisher of two antiCom munist Chineselanguage news papers was shot to death in his home in Saigon today by a woman, thought to be a Viet cong agent, the South Vietnam ese police reported.

title: Statement by Palestine Group
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28 (UPI)The Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, the leftwing guerrilla group that seized and destroyed four inter national airliners more than a year ago, claimed responsibility tonight for the assassination of Premier Tal.

title: 100,000 Join in Italian AntiFascist Rally
description: ROME, Nov. 28 Nearly 100,000 Communists and non Communists marched side by side under a downpour today in a display of unity against neoFascism.

title: Lisbon Reports African Toll
description: LISBON, Monday, Nov. 29 (Agence FrancePresse)  Five Portuguese soldiers were killed in fighting with guerrillas in Portuguese Guinea between Nov. 115, the Portuguese armed forces said last night. Thirty guerrillas were killed in the clashes, it reported.

title: Newark Police Detail to Try To Cut Assaults on Cabbies
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28 (UPI)  In an effort to reduce the number of assaults on Newark cab driv ers, the city's Police Department has began to use a roundthe clock special detaail Of detec tives riding in taxicabs and un marked cars.

title: Vikings Grind Out a 247 Victory Over Falcons in Snow
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 28  The ground crew rolled the tarpaulin off the field 15 minutes before the kickoff as snow blew into the stadium behind a 25knot north wind today. It was Viking weather.

title: Ill Winds Buffet Communal Sect
description: MINGUS, Tex., Nov. 24 Although the boy who calls himself Adonikum was born but 20 years ago, there is a loneliness in his eyes that is older than human history, and when he speaks, his soft words echo the accumulated desperation of the species.

title: Mr. Connally's War:
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.On Aug. 15, Mr. Nixon declared economic war on the rest of the world, So far it's been a phony warthe U.S. has done all the shooting. But if Secretary of the Treasury John Connally does not change course soon, the other side will start shooting back. Control over events will shift to the war parties in all the capitals, and Aug. 15 will be a turning point in postwar Atlantic and U.S.Japan history.

title: Top Officials at Scene
description: The Egyptian Minister of In terior, Mamdouh Salem, and the Minister of War, Gen. Mo hammed Sadek, arrived at the hotel before the body of Pre mier Tal was removed. Military policemen with riot shields formed a shouldertoshoulder cordon around the hotel after the assassination.

title: Sir Grantley Adams Dies at 73; Headed West Indies Federation
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, Nov. 28 (AP)Sir Grantley Adams, former Prime Minister of the defunct West Indies Federation and the first Prime Minister of Barbados, died today. He was 73 years old.

title: Namath:We Didn't Win, I Didn't Play Well at All
description: In the Jets' locker room, his melodrama over, Joe Namath was greeted by his father.

title: Adelbert Wright, 86, Dies; N.Y. Telephone ExOfficer
description: Adelbert G. Wright, a former vice president and director of the New York Telephone Com pany, died yesterday at Devon (Pa.) Manor. He was 86 years old and lived at 60 Berkshire Road, Rockville Centre, L.I.

title: MELANIE LIVENS DE MILLE'S STAGE
description: It was, according to Melanie, the first time a living soul had performed on the stage of the DeMille Theater  since 1928, or something. Even al lowing for a certain amount of license in her chronology, it was indeed a kind of historical event Friday and Saturday nights, when the gentle young singersongwriter brought live music back to the Broadway film house.

title: David Rockefeller Named
description: David Rockefeller, chairman and chief excutive officer of the Chase Manhattan Bank, has been selected to serve during 1972 as a member of the Fed eral Advisory Council of the Federal Reserve System.

title: Florida Developer Sued on Dredging
description: NAPLES, Fla., Nov. 28The Government has filed a $6mil lion damage suit charging a de veloper with illegal dredge and fill operations in building an ex pensive community around manmade canals leading into the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Nicholas F. Cariglia, Head Of Westport, Mass., Schools
description: WESTPORT, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)  Nicholas F. Cariglia, superintendent of schools here since 1967, died yesterday at Roger William Hospital in Provi dence. He was 49 years old.

title: Office Buildings Fail to Please All in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 28In the last two years more than 100 companies most of them in flight from New York Cityhave opened offices and executive head quarters in this elite residen tial community.

title: CHOU NOW LISTED AS NO. 2 IN PEKING
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 28The reshuffling of the top leader ship in China following the dis appearance from official roles of Lin Piao and a number of other military and civilian leaders is bringing new per sonalities into increased promi nence and raising the status of others long at the center of power.

title: Severer Injuries On Artificial Turf Indicated in Study
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 New evidence that some ankle and knee injuries on synthetic turf can be more serious than those incurred on natural grass was presented by a Se attle orthopedic surgeon today.

title: Scheel Talks With Gromyko
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany today began talks with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, on Berlin and the ratification of the Moscow Bonn nonaggression treaty that Mr. Scheel helped to nego tiate last year.

title: WESTBANK ARABS FEAR REPRISALS
description: RAMALLAH, IsraeliOccupied Jordan, Nov. 28Now there'll be another bloodbath, said the man behind the counter at a cafe where some of the town's political elders gather. I have relatives in Amman I hope the King is putting the Bedouin army units in bar racks, said a customer.

title: Miss Yarmish Bride Of Rabbi Levi Meier
description: Miss Marcie Joy Yarmish, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Joseph Yarmish of Los An geles, was married here last evening to Rabbi Levi Meier, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Meier of New York.

title: Fulbright Forces Press Policy Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, admittedly on the defensive in its struggle with the White House, will make a lastditch effort this week to preserve some foreign policy restrictions on the executive branch.

title: PRUDENTIAL EXPECTS SURGE IN U.S. OUTPUT
description: The Prudential Insurance Company predicted yesterday that this nation's total output of goods and services would surge upward next year by more than $100billion to a total of $1,152billion.

title: Gulf Oil Fire Killed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 (AP)Amco Producing Com pany announced today that workmen succeeded yesterday in killing the last oil fire on a platform off the Louisiana coast. However, a small fire fed by natural gas continued to burn on the platform.

title: Seals 53 Victors
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 28 (AP) Wayne Carleton and Bobby Sheehan scored two goals each and led the California Golden Seals to a 53 victory over the Buffalo Sabres tonight.

title: Despite City's Ills, These New York Families Find Life Tolerable
description: Manhattan, like its sister boroughs, breaks down into a series of small neighborhoods held together by tran slent relationships. Cliff dwellers, some one once said, attached to earth by an elevator shaft.

title: SAIGON'S DRIVE GETS HEAVY U.S. SUPPORT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 28 (Reuters)American B52 bombers, helicopter gun ships and 8inch mortars placed along the border lent support to South Vietnam's new incur sion into Cambodia during the weekend, military announce ments here said today.

title: Walter Maynard Is Dead at 65; Leader in Securities Industry
description: Walter Maynard, an invest ment banker who retired last June as vice chairman of Shear son, Hammill & Co., died Sat urday of a heart ailment in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 65 years old and lived at 1 Beekman Place.

title: Absentee Landowners Lose Court Test
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 28A Federal District Court judge has handed down a decision that, if upheld, could break up the holdings of large corpora tions that control nearly two thirds of the irrigated farmlands in Southern California's rich Imperial Valley.

title: Horszowski Plays Early Piano
description: One of the treasures at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is the prestigious Crosby Brown Collection of Musical Instruments of All Nations, and the new Andr Mertens Galleries were opened there recently to display many of the approximately 4,000 items in it.

title: Paul Felzen, Lawyer, Weds Sallie L. Laskin
description: GREENWICH Conn., Nov. 28  The marriage of Miss Sallie L. Laskin, who is studying for a doctorate at the New School for Social Research, to Paul Felzen, a New York lawyer, took place here this afternoon. Rabbi Malcolm Thomson performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Arthur E. Las kin of New York and Green wich.

title: Eurobonds Thrive
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 28The longterm international capital market is retaining its portly look of well being, largely ig noring the latest alarums and excursions on foreign exchange markets.

title: Men in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Onethird of the 3,500 dele gates to the White House Conference on Aging opening today is more than 65 years of age. Twothirds of them are more than 55.

title: Indian Town's Inhabitants Flee Shelling by Pakistan
description: BALURGHAT, India, Nov. 28 The people of this Indian border town have been fleeing their homes to safer places in the interior as Pakistani troops have pounded them for four days with 25pound shells fired from three miles away.

title: Visitors'
description: WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP, N. 1., Nov. 28  State troop ers barred approaches to Rah way state prison today as a massive cleanup of the insti tution was reportedly being completed.

title: Corrections Please, on the Youth Vote
description: WASHINGTONA front page head line proclaims, Young Voters May Change MakeUp of Congress in '72. A more accurate, if somewhat more cumbersome, headline would he, Young Voters Probably Will Make Little' Difference in the MakeUp of Congress in '72.

title: Cairo's Envoy to U.N. Putting In Long Hours on Plans for Debate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 28The lights are burning late in the Manhattan headquarters of Egypt's delegation to the United Nations.

title: Controlling Rent
description: The Phase Two guidelines for restoring national eco nomic stability would hold the general level of wage increases to 5.5 per cent annually and price increases 2.5 per cent. Although there seem to have been more exceptions to than compliance with the rule so far, there are good reasons for the Price Commission to have exempted rents from the guidelines when they are already under state or local controls.

title: JOHN J. KING DIES; TRAFFIC EXPERT
description: John Joseph King, who re tired as assistant Chief In spector in charge of the Safe ty Division (formerly the Traf fic, Division) of the Police De partment in 1966, died Satur clay in Physicians Hospital, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 68 years old and lived at 9405 35th Avenue, Jackson, Heights.

title: Prisoners File Assault Suit
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 28 (AP) A group of 26 inmates at the Maryland Correctional Institu tion in Hagerstown at the time of last May's riot have filed a $309,000 damage suit alleging that they were beaten in a concerted pattern by guards after the disorders ended. The suit was filed in Federal Dis trict Court against Gerald A. Keller, prison superintendent, and 22 members of his staff.

title: Tiriac Captures Final
description: CASABLANCA, Nov. 28 (UPI) Ion Tiriac of Rumania won the Moroccan international ten nis tournament today, beating Francois Jauffret of France, 76, 60, 63, in the final.

title: News Analysis
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 28 The courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson, the high estranking officer to face judgment in the aftermath of the mass slayings at Mylai 4, is drawing to a close here in a redcarpeted courtroom about a world and a half away from the dreary battlefields of Vietnam. Sometime in the next few days, once the lastmin ute legal wran gling is done, a military jury oftwo generals and five colonels will retire to decide whether the former infantry brigade commander did or did not will fully cover up the slaying of more than 100 unarmed civil ians by American troops.

title: 2 TROOPERS SHOT; GUNMAN IS SLAIN
description: WOODBRIDGE, N.J., Nov. 28 A South Carolina man was shot dead and two companions were captured in a gun battle with the police in a high school auditorium here today, an hour after the three had allegedly shot and seriously wounded two state troopers on the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: DR. ARTHUR DARLING, HISTORIAN, 78, DEAD
description: Dr. Arthur Burr Darling, a historian, who had taught at Yale College and Phillips Acad emy, Andover, Mass., died Sat urday in Paris, where he had lived for the last two years. His age was 78.

title: Hope Stirs as Group of 10 Gathers for Meeting
description: ROME, Nov. 28Finance min isters of the big 10 Western in dustrial countries have one more try this week at putting the pieces of the world's frac tured monetary system back to gether.

title: Maritime Parley Opens
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 28 (Reu ters)  An international mari time conference opened here today to negotiate the creation of a $30million fund for extra compensation to cover oil pol lution damage by ships.

title: Mrs. Arthur Howe Dead; Hampton Institute Trustee
description: PLYMOUTH, N. H., Nov. 28  Mrs. Margaret Armstrong Howe, a former trustee of the Hampton Institute, in Virginia, died yesterday at the age of 80.

title: Kennedy School Appointee
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)The appointment of Prof. Ernest R. May as director of the Institute of Politics at the John Fitzgerald Kennedy School of Government in Harvard Uni versity was announced today. Dr. May has been associated with the school since its incep tion in 1966. He is an authority on American diplomatic his tory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GEORGE S. SCOTT
description: George S. Scott, an assistant foreman in the stereotype de partment at The New York Times, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 114 98 229th Street, Cambria Heights, Queens. He was 47 years old.

title: LOCAL TO STAY ON JOB IN ANACONDA STRIKE
description: ANSONIA, Conn., Nov. 28 (AP)Union members of Ana conda American Brass Com pany voted today to remain on the job despite strikes by un ions at five other company plants across the country.

title: G.I.'s Change the Character of a West German Town
description: KAISERSLAUTERN, West GermanyThe German pop ulation here is just over 100,000. There are nearly 50,000 Americans, a n d though they do not con tribute more than their share to the crime rate, it is a conspicuous share.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Can political experience qualify a man for a govern ment job? Some Lindsay ad ministration officials say that the practice of hiring poli ticians is not only traditional but also advantageous since so much government work in volves working with people. Consider the case of DanielJ. Armet, who was campaign manag er for Mayor Ken neth A. Gibson of Newark, in whichcapacity he met several Lind say administration aides who provided campaign support in the form of troops and know how.

title: JORDAN'S PREMIER IS SLAIN IN CAIRO; 3 GUNMEN SEIZED
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28 Premier Wasfi Tal of Jordan was as sassinated here today by three gunmen reported to have en tered Egypt with Syrian pass ports.

title: Sirois Keeps World Title In Outboard Marathon
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 28 (UPI)Bill Sirois of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., the de fending champion, won the $60,000 eighthour world out board championship today, fin ishing first each day in the twoday competition on the Colorado River.

title: Body Flown to Amman
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28 (Reuters) The body of Premier Tal was flown out of Cairo's inter national airport tonight aboard a special Jordanian airliner hound for Amman, the Jor danian capital.

title: Newer Cars Called Biggest Polluters In Check on City Air
description: New model cars, fitted with exhaust pollution controls, fared worse than older cars without the controls in recent pollution tests here during No vember's Clean Air Week, ac cording to Robert N. Rickles, Commissioner of the Depart ment of Air Resources.

title: Transit Plan in Doubt
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28 (AP)A courtordered recount of Fulton County ballots in the Nov. 9 rapid transit tax referendum was completed today, but the results will remain undisclosed until tallies are computed in court. Although the $1.3billion Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority proposal was approved by 461 votes, the number of ballots challenged today is large enough to leave the question in doubt, said John T. Ferguson, attorney for the county.

title: Star Class Title to Bruder
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 (AP)Joerg Bruder of Brazil won the North American Star Class sailing championship today by a point from Read Ruggles of Miami. Bruder finished the fiverace series with 231 points.

title: Chess: Play by Mail Has Appeal For Many Different Groups
description: The idea of chess by mail has long ago proved its at tractiveness to many kinds of people. There are those who play it in addition to their more important activi ties overtheboard. There are those who, for various reasons, can't play overthe hoard; they live in places too remote from centers of chess activity to meet opponents facetoface with any regu larity. Or perhaps they are bedridden, or even in jail.

title: Nixon Back in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) President Nixon arrived back in Washington tonight after spending a long Thanksgiving weekend at the Western White House in San Clemente, Calif.

title: Jackson Is Confident
description: PLANT CITY, Fla., Nov. 28 (AP)Senator Henry M. Jack son said today that he would beat George C. Wallace in Florida's Presidential primary if the Alabama Governor de cided to make the Democratic race. The Washington Demo crat told a news conference that he based his prediction on common sense.

title: SPITZ SPARKS U.S. IN SWIM TRIUMPH
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 28 (AP) Mark Spitz of the United States won two more races against the Japanese today as an American team capured six of 10 events in an informal swimming meet.

title: Miss Gould Trims Mark
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 28 (AP)Shane Gould lopped seventenths of a second off her world 200meter freestyle record at the suburban Drum moyne Olympic Pool last night.

title: Jets and Giants Beaten
description: Joe Namath passed for three touchdowns in his re turn yesterday, but the San Francisco 49ers beat the New York Jets, 2421, before 63, 936 fans at Shea Stadium. The St. Louis Cardinals downed the Giants, 247, be fore 62,878 at Yankee Sta dium. Details on Page 59.

title: Heavy Traffic Ties Up Roads in and Near City
description: Homebound travelers and stu dents returning to school at the close of the fourday Thanksgiving holiday encoun tered extensive and frustrating delays yesterday as hundreds of thousands of automobiles clogged the bridges, tunnels and major arteries of the metropol itan area.

title: One of Two Soviet Craft Reported Nearing Mars
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (UP11) The Soviet Union said today that its Mars 3 spacecraft was approaching Mars but did not mention Mars 2, a craft launched earlier.

title: Cavaliers Roll to No.4
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 28 (UPI)  Austin Carr tossed in 31 points and Bobby Smith added 27 tonight as the Cleveland Cavaliers posted their fourth straight victory by defeating the Philadelphia 76ers, 124120.

title: Key Member of Pay Board Envisions a Long Phase 2
description: The second phase of Presi dent Nixon's economic program I may have to continue for two I or three years, considerably longer than many Administra tion Spokesmen have predicted, if it is to create longterm pay stability, according to Virgil B. Day, chairman of the Pay Board's fiveman business sec tor.

title: China and Peru Sign Accord
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 28 (UPI) China and Peru signed an agreement on economic and technical cooperation in Peking today, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported.

title: A.M.A. Award Goes To City's Dr. Helpern
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 (AP)  Dr. Milton Helpern, 69yearold Chief Medical Ex aminer for New York City and an internationally known expert on pathology and forensic medicine, was named today winner of the Ameri can Medical Association's Distinguished Service Award for 1971.

title: A MOVED HUSSEIN PLEADS FOR UNITY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28 King Hussein of Jordan told his people personally today about the assassination in Cairo of Premier Wasfi Tal.

title: Miss Sue Herman Is Married to Dentist
description: Miss Sue Ellen Herman, daughter of Mrs. Theodore Herman of New York and the late Mr. Herman, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Charles D. Randolph, an instructor of pedodontics at the New York University School of Dentistry.

title: U.S. First Team Still First
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., Nov. 28The United States first team defeated the United States second team, 10, in the final match of the United States Women's Field Hockey Asso ciation tournament today at West Chester State College.

title: Woman Found Dead in Fire Termed a Murder Victim
description: WYANDANCH, L. I., Nov. 28  A 43yearold woman, be lieved to have died early Thurs day during a fire in her home, was actually strangled before the fire started, the Suffolk County police said today.

title: KAREN RANUNG SINGS SCANDINAVIAN SONGS
description: Karen Ranung, a soprano who seems to be under no compulsion to pursue commer cial goals as a singer and is therefore able to sing what she wants to, came to Carnegie Re cital Hall on Saturday after noon with a program consisting entirely of works by Scandina vian composers. Her list in cluded a Kilpinen cycle, Lieder um den Tod, a group of songs by Grieg and an assortment of Ole Bull, Carl Nielsen, Sibelius, Niels Gade, Halfdan and Charles Kjerulf, Sigurd Lie and Agathe Backer$#2010;Grondahl.

title: Castro, in Santiago, Urges Economic Unity on Latins
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 29 (UPI) Premier Fidel Castro urged LatinAmerican nations today to integrate their econo mies to counter the financial power of the United States.

title: Key Conservative and Liberal Senators Concur on Measure to Curb Presidential War Making Powers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Key conservative and liberal Sena tors have reached agreement on compromise legislation to curb the warmaking powers of the Presidency.

title: Reserve Again Postpones Changes in Margin Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reu ters)  The Federal Reserve Board announecd today that it had postponed until March 1 the effective date of proposals under which margin requirments could be waived in providing brokerdealer firms with capital.

title: RAYMOND I. DAWSON
description: Raymond I. Dawson, chair man of MetalLitho Corporation of Brooklyn and a past president of the National Metal Decor, a tors Association, died Sunday night in Nassau Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 67 Hilton Avenue, Garden City, LI., and at Huntington, L.I.

title: Nixon Rebuffed on District Subway Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Nixon was rebuffed today as the House Appropria tions Committee refused to free some $72million for construc tion of a regional subway for the District of Columbia.

title: Nader Study Says du Pont Runs Delaware
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29A group of young investigators working under Ralph Nader charged today that E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. dominates the state of Delaware and pur sues its narrow corporate in terests rather than the public good.

title: Forzano Retained as Coach Of Naval Academy Football
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 29 (AP)Rick Forzano has been retained by the United States Naval Academy as head foot ball coach despite Navy's 2423 loss to Army, the Academy Athletic Association announced today.

title: Shop Talk
description: Saks Fifth Avenue's self contained Carlin Shop on 50th Street has expanded from its original four rooms to nine, one of them a brand new second floor area. By dint of moving walls, usurp ing closets, adding light, bright colors, Lucite dividers and a host of other tricks, the shop has found itself a whole fresh im age. Take the up stairs section op posite the Bridal Shop. Here, Carlin's is packed with color, from exotic fur pillows made from Siberian raccoon or unplucked beaver to customorder bedspreads that are a lesson in decorat ing in themselves. The wares reflect the contrast between classical and contemporary that the shop embodies throughout. The upstairs linen boutique, for example, contains a dazzling array of handembroidered linens in cluding a Christmas cloth from Italy for $800, the most Left: Handmade pillows are taken from antique quilts in oneofakind designs. Priced from $27 to $40, they're at the Carlin Shop, Saks 5th Ave. expensive one on hand and a masterpiece of work.

title: EXECUTIVE RESIGNS AT PAN AM AIRWAYS
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday the resig nation of Richard L. Knight as group vice president in charge of finance and as a board mem ber.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: KENDALL WILL QUIT APPAREL FABRICS
description: The Kendall Company, which recently recommencled that its stockholders turn down acqui sition bids by Textron, Inc., and the ColgatePalmolive Company, said yesterday that it was negotiating to transfer its apparel fabric business to DHJ Industries, Inc., which serves apparel makers.

title: 2 TEACHERS KNIFED AS PUPILS LOOK ON
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29 (UPI)While kindergarten pu pils watched, a mother stabbed two teachers today after invad ing a classroom to complain about how her child had been treated.

title: Pakistani Arms Streaming to Border
description: SIALKOT, Pakistan, Nov. 29Pakistani war equipment was streaming toward the border of India today in fleets of civilian trucks comman deered by the army.

title: Legislators Clash on Fiscal Crisis in Preview of 1972
description: ALBANY, Nov. 29  Repub lican and Democratic Assem blymen met here today on the state's fiscal crisis and gave a preview of the partisan acri mony expected to dominate the 1972 electionyear Legislature that convenes in January.

title: Study Asks: Is Crime Cut or Displaced?
description: A 40 per cent increase in the number of patrolmen as signed experimentally to a West Side Manhattan precinct appears to have resulted in a drop in reported street crimes such as robbery and auto theft, accord ing to a study by the New York City Rand Institute.

title: The Greek Colonels as Bogeymen
description: I spent a month in Greece this autumnat least I think it was Greece, though it bore little resemblance to the fearridden fascist policestate I have been reading about under that name for the past couple of years. The country I went to seemed cheerful, in efficient, impulsive, casual, talkative, and rather anarchic.

title: OPERA BY STROES BOWS IN GERMANY
description: KASSEL, West Germany, Nov. 29In the mediumsized city of Kassel, with one of the most adventurous smaller theaters in the country, the world premiere of Aurel Stroes's first opera, The Nobel Prize Will Not Be Awarded, took place last night.

title: Heat in Moon Found Surprisingly High
description: Data relayed to earth by radio from a hole drilled into the lunar surface last summer by the Apollo 15 astronauts in dicate that the moon is a far richer source of heat than had generally been supposed.

title: Stars of Old Shine Again in Garden
description: They streamed in from out of the past last night, lithe porcelain women, trim and taut men, wearing the daz zling costumes that carried them to world figure skating titles once upon a time.

title: Hunt for Escaped Hijacker In Woodland, Wash., Ends
description: WOODLAND, Wash., Nov. 29 (AP)The active search for a man who bailed out of a hi jacked jet last Wednesday with $200,000 ransom money ended here today, but the Federal Bureau of Investigation said its inquiry would continue.

title: Willie Mays Married
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 29 (UPI) Willie Mays, the star out fielder for the San Francisco Giants, married Mae Louise Allen of San Francisco in a civil ceremony yesterday.

title: Attica Chief Says He Would Have Acted Quicker
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 The superintendent of the Attica Correctional Facility, taking sharp issue with the tactics of his superiors, told a House Committee today that he would not have tried to negoti ate the release of hostages dur ing the inmate rebellion in September, but would have at tempted to retake the prison by force.

title: N.E.A. Study Finds Teacher Age Down, College Degrees Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP) The National Education As sociation said today that teach ers were younger and better educated than in the past, but that they were shunning formal organizations.

title: RAYMOND BOWMAN, LED STATE U. UNIT
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I., Nov. 29 Prof. Raymond C. Bowman, founder and chairman of the photographic technology de partment at the State Univer sity's College of Agriculture and Technology here, died yes terday of a heart attack at St. John's Hospital, Smithtown. He was 64 years old and lived at 10 Dolly Drive, Commack.

title: Now, Remember Rahway
description: Bedsheets hung like ghostly banners from the darkened window bars of Rahway State Prison in New Jersey. Their scrawled message: Remember Attica.

title: Former Illinois Aide Admits Tampering With Records
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Nov. 29 (UPI)William Glenn, a former employe in the office of Wil liam Powell, the late Illinois Secretary of State, changed his plea from not guilty to guilty today on charges of tampering with public records.

title: DIVIDEND RAISED BY FOOD CONCERN
description: The Consolidated Foods Cor poration amended yesterday an increase in the annual dividend rate on its common stock to $1.248, or 31.2 cents a quar ter. The increase was the re sult of the latest adjustments in the guidelines that permit up to a 4 per cent increase in dividends over those paid during the last calendar year.

title: Policeman Is Shot to Death After Stopping Car in Albany
description: ALBANY, Nov. 29A police sergeant here was shot to death early this morning after he had stopped a car for passing a red light.

title: Pay and Pension Raised For Secretary General
description: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 29 (Reuters)  The General As sembly today raised the sal ary of the Secretary General by $12,500 a year to $62,500 dollars, and his pension to $31,250.

title: Nets Sign Baum, ExBull
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 29 (AP)The New York Nets of the American Basket ball Association announced to day the signing of John Baum, a forward released recently by the Chicago Bulls of the Na tional Basketball Association. Baum was the Bulls No. 2 draft choice in 1969 after com pleting his college career at Temple.

title: A Cement for Dentistry Aids Hip Surgery
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 29 A cement long used in dentis try is now enabling bone sur geons to do new operations on diseased hip joints and thereby allow many Americans who were previously crippled by arthritis, injuries, and birth de fects to walk more normally, a Harvard orthopedic surgeon said here today.

title: Rain Closes Roads
description: A total of 1.48 inches of rain fell in the city yester day, forcing the closing of the BrooklynQueens Ex pressway between the Wil liamsburg Bridge and the Humboldt Street exit from 6:35 P.M. to 7:10 P.M. The connecting roadway between the Henry Hudson Parkway and the Mosholu Parkway in the Bronx was also closed because of flooding from 5 P.M. to 7:30 P.M., and again at 8:45 P.M.

title: DOLPHINS SCORE OVER BEARS, 343
description: MIAMI, Nov. 29 (AP)Bob Griese, the leading touchdown tosser in the National Football League, passed for two scores and directed an awesome Mi ami offense that brought the Dolphins an easy 343 victory over the Chicago Bears tonight for their eighth consecutive triumph.

title: Books of The Times
description: ALIENATION AND ECONOMICS. By Walter A. Weisskopf. 202 pages. Dutton. $7.95.

title: AIDE SAYS FEWER WORK FOR STATE
description: The number of state em ployes declind by 9,600 since the state budget year began last April 1, Governor Rocke feller's office reported last night.

title: Suspect in jersey Shootout Is Charged With Killing
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 29Gary L. Owens, one of the two survivors of three Columbia, S. C., men who were involved in a shootout with the police in Woodbridge yes terday, was charged in Middle sex County Court today with the murder of one of his com panions.

title: JAVITS SEES PERIL IN CONSERVATIVES
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits charged last night that conser vatives were trying to capture the political soul of President Nixon by undermining and op posing his attempted rapproach ment with China and the Soviet Union and his domestic econo mic and welfare programs.

title: Lin Aide Reported Ousted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29A oncepowerful Peking associate of Lin Piao was reportedly re moved recently from his sensi tive political posts as part of what sources here described to day as a continuing purge in China following her internal crisis in September.

title: Harvard Gains in Soccer
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 29 Paced by Chris Papahianis's two goals, Harvard's soccer team advanced to the Eastern Regional final of the National Collegiate Athletic Association playoffs today with a 30 vic tory over Brown.

title: Advertising:
description: W. B. Doner & Co., an ad agency with offices in De troit and Baltimore, has just been named by the Calgon Corporation to handle adver tising for its Calgonite Auto matic Dishwasher Detergent, as well as its Fruit Fresh, a preservative.

title: STATE WILL CHECK ON LINDSAY CLUBS
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said last night that he would look into the status of the five county John V. Lind say Associations, the fund raising organization of the Mayor.

title: About Pro Football
description: Add Cincinnati and scratch Atlanta on the list of teams scrapping for pro football's eight postseason playoff po sitions. The Bengals, who have won three straight since Virgil Carter returned from a shoulder separation to play quarterback again, meet the Browns in Cleveland Sunday and it is a big game in the Central Di vision of the American Confer ence. The Browns lead with a 65 wonlost rec ord and the Bengals are 47, two games back with three to play. In between comes Pittsburgh at 56 and fading.

title: Interstate Highway Construction Faces Environmental Challenge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Environmentalists who previ iously challenged new highway programs piece by piece have served notice on the Transpor tation Department that they will take on the overall $5bil lionayear interstate highway system this year.

title: Giants'
description: Only moments after the New York Giants were mathemati cally eliminated from playoff consideration by Sunday's 247 loss to St. Louis, a visiting journalist asked Coach Alex Webster: Will you be taking a longer look at some new people the rest of the season?

title: RUGBY EXHIBITION SLATED TONIGHT
description: In 1920, before The Four Horsemen and Bronko Na gurski became magic names in American football, 20 members of a United States rugby team went off to Antwerp, Belgium, and won an Olympic gold medal, one of the few times rugby appeared on the Olympic pro gram.

title: COUNCILMEN BACK ARBITRATION PLAN
description: A bill that imposes binding compulsory arbitration in dead locked labor disputes involving municipal employes was ap proved unanimously yesterday by the City Council's Com mittee on Civil Service and Labor. The affected unions have a total membership of more than 300,000.

title: Some Inmates of Rahway State Prison Facing Charges Stemming From Riot
description: TRENTON, Nov. 29Inmates of Rahway state prison face criminal prosecution and insti tutional, disciplinary punish ment if they are found to have committed crimes or infractions of prison rules in last week's rebellion, Gov. William T. Cahill said this morning.

title: JOBLESS RATE FALLS IN 5 BIGCITY AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29(UPI) The Labor Department an nounced today that the number of major metropolitan areas with substantial unemployment dropped this month from a 10year high of 65 to 60 while the number of smaller cities rose to an alltime high of 803. The department defines as sub stantial unemployment an area with 6 per cent or more of the work force jobless.

title: Cosmos 458 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29 (Reuters) The Soviet Union, launched today Cosmos 458, the latest in its series of satellites, Tass, the Soviet Press Agency reported.

title: Harris Leads a New Coalition of Opponents of Butz
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 29A coalition of representatives of organized labor, the poor, civil rights groups and conserva tionists emerged today to fight Senate confirmation of Presi dent Nixon's choice of Dr. Earl L. Butz to be Secretary of Ag riculture.

title: Taking a Child's Shame Away
description: There is too much concern in this country with a disad vantaged child's slum envi ronment and not enough con cern with the child himself, says Dr. Martin Wolins, a specialist in child care who was here recently from Jeru salem's Hebrew University where he is director of the University of California's Education Abroad program.

title: 4th Trial Opens for 4 Accused Of '64 Store Murder in Harlem
description: Four young men who have been held in jail without bail for seven and a half years on charges of murder, attempted murder and attempted robbery went on trial in Supreme Court in Manhattan yesterday for the fourth time.

title: Advertising:
description: What, pray, could be more topical, seasonal or timely for the first Monday after Thanksgiving than dropping in on the agency of Mr. Christmas?

title: INDIA SAYS BATTLE IN STRATEGIC AREA IS IN ITS THIRD DAY
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 29In dian officials said tonight that the battle between Indian and Pakistani forces in the strategic Hilli area of East Pakistan is now in its third day and is still going onmaking it the longest clash so far in the grow ing military crisis on the sub continent.

title: Economic Analysis
description: How well are company profits going to do in 1972? Uncertainty about the answer to this question has been a key elementand to many people the most important one in the deep gloom that has enveloped Wall Street lately. True, there are few maladies in the financial community that a 31point rally in the DowJones average in the space of two trading days will not help to assuage. But the underlying doubts are still there  about the profit outlook, coupled, of course, with a gnawing concern over the out come of the delicate negotia tions in Rome for an interim solution to the world's mone tary problems.

title: Bridge: Rapee's Team Triumphs In Reisinger Match play
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 29The allinternationalist team of George Rapee, William Grieve and Edgar Kaplan, all of New York; Norman Kay of Philadelphia and Lew Mathe and Don Krauss, both of Los Angeles, won the Reisinger boardamatch team championship last night in the final event of the American Contract Bridge League's 45th annual Fall Nationals.

title: McDowell Goes to Giants for Perry
National Christmas Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI) A 65foottall fir tree arrived from North Carolina today to become the center of Washing ton's official Christmas cele bration. The national Christ mas tree will be erected to morrow on the Ellipse behind the White House. The official lighting ceremony is scheduled for Dec. 16.

title: COLONEL DEFENDS HIS MYLAI INQUIRY
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 29 Col. Oran K. Henderson told the sevenmember jury of of ficers at his courtmartial today that, had he been told that more than 100 civilians had been killed at Mydai 4, he would have conducted a for mal investigation.

title: Cologne Vocalists, in a Circle, Give Stockhausen Stimmung
description: Karlheinz Stockhausen is not the first composer to at tempt to create new rituals for the postreligious age. The German musician's spiritual godfather, Wagner, tried that in Parsifal, and perhaps in the Ring. But Mr. Stock hausen's Stimmung, which received its first New York performances at Alice Tully Hall Sunday afternoon and evening, gives us in addition a ritual for the postliterate age, perhaps the most suc cessful one yet devised.

title: U.S. Ready to End Surtax If Currencies Go Up 11%
description: ROME, Nov. 29Paul A. Volcker, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, said today the United States would get rid of its 10 per cent import surcharge if other countries revalued their currencies upward by an aver age of 11 per cent against the dollar.

title: HARVESTER RAISES SOME PRICES 3.9%
description: The International Harvester Company said yesterday that it had increased some prices by 3.93 per cent, effective imme diately.

title: Detroit Edison Plant Is Set
description: DETROIT, Nov. 29 (UPI)  The Detroit Edison Company announced today it would build a $160million oilfired electric generating plant near Port Huron, Mich. The first unit will have a capacity of 800,000 kilo watts and will be completed by 1976.

title: Italy's Top Civil Servants Strike In Effort to Streamline System
description: ROME, Nov. 29  Chiefs of Government departments, trea sury inspectors and certain of ficials working in the Foreign Ministry stayed away from their desks or, at the very least, refused to answer phones and sign documents today as Italy's top civil servants went on a strike.

title: EARL KRAMER
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29 (UPI)Earl Kramer, a 60year veteran of the theatrical busi ness and the uncle and adopted father of Stanley Kramer, the producer and director, died to day after a brief illness. He was 76 years old.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss Rhodesia and report of Guinea mission.

title: LEFT'S COALITION LOSES IN URUGUAY
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 29Agriculture Minister Juan M. Bordaberry, the hand picked Presidential candidate of President Jorge Pacheco Areco, appeared today to be headed for victory in yester day's elections.

title: S.E.C. WILL HEAR CHARGES OF FRAUD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today it would hold hearings on staff charges that Butcher & Sher rerd, a major Philadelphia brokerage house, violated the antifraud provisions of securi ties laws in its dealings in stock of the Penn Central Railroad.

title: Activity on Docks Resumes, But the Recovery Is Slow
description: Striking longshoremen went back to work here under a court order yesterday, but the port's awakening from a 59day shutdown was much slower than expected.

title: Carrier Corporation Posts Rise in Profit as Variety of Other Companies Report on Sales and Earnings
Border Treaty With Mexico Is Ratified by U.S. Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reuters)  The Senate today unanimously ratified a treaty with Mexico to settle border differences stemming from the shifting courses of the Rio Grande and the Colorado River.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Environment Is Good Politics
description: When political rivals compete to perform a sound service, a grateful public can afford to give ample credit all around. The country finds itself in this position with respect to the simultaneous efforts of the Nixon Admin istration and a group of Democratic Senators to save Florida's Big Cypress Swamp from private develop ment that would destroy it, as the President said. Destruction of the swamp, as it happens, would also mean destruction of the Everglades National Park, which depends on the Big Cypress watershed, not to mention the loss of much of South Florida's water supply.

title: Navy Starts War Games
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)The Navy opened five days of war games off Southern California today. A task force of 10 warships and a submarine left San Diego to take part. A spokesman for the First Fleet said that new, highly classified electronics equipment would be used to locate and identify enemy vessels.

title: Note of Caution on China Trade
description: United States businessmen in terested in trading with main land China were cautioned yes terday not to expect large out lets for American consumer goods or highly sophisticated technology.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Jersey Assembly Seat Unchanged by Recount
description: NEWARK, Nov. 29 (AP) Peter G. Stewart, a Democrat, was declared the winner over John F. Trezza, a Re publican, today in a recount of ballots in the Nov. 3 State Assembly election.

title: SecuritiesIndustry Group Plans Changes in Training Personnel
description: A major segment of the secu rities industry is planning to undertake a sweeping reorgan ization of its training proced ures for salesmen and other personnel under a program dis closed yesterday by the Na tional Association of Securi ties Dealers.

title: Bayh Concedes Rehnquist Foes Lack Votes to Stop Confirmation
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29 (AP)Senator Birch Bayh said today that he and other op ponents of the nomination of Assistant Attorney General William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court lack sufficient Senate votes, and added that he expected Mr. Rehnquist to win confirmation.

title: How I.M.F.'s Chief Got Aug. 15 News
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 The unusual story of how PierrePaul Schweitzer, the managing director of the In ternational Monetary Fund, learned of the shattering United States monetary moves announced by Presi dent Nixon on Aug. 15 has come to light here.

title: Manson Sentenced
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29 (Reu ters)  A Superior Court jury today gave Charles Manson three sentences of life imprison ment for the murder of Gary Hinman, a musician, and Donald Shea, a Hollywood stuntman.

title: A War, in Tea Figures
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Nov. 29 Ceylon registered a 9 per cent increase in tea production this year, while Pakistan was obliged recently to buy tea from Cey lon and China, due to the in flux of Bengali refugees. Though Indian teas recorded an in crease of 30 per cent in the same period, most of it was offset by higher consumption at home because of the ref ugees.

title: Amex Seat Price Dips
description: The American Stock Ex change said yesterday it had sold a seat for $65,000, off $5, 000 from the previous sale on Nov. 18. The current market is $62,000 bid, $70,000 offered.

title: Mrs. Marc Koven, 63, Dies; Widow of Jewelry Designer
description: Mrs. Miriam Margulies Koven, widow of Marc Koven, the jewelry designer, and long asso ciated with him in his business here and in Paris, died yester day in University Hospital after a fall five weeks ago. She was 63 years old and lived at 160 East 48th Street.

title: News Analysis
description: I would not compare Rah way with Attica, Gov. William T. Cahill remarked the other day. And he may have been right in saying so, because the conditions differed.

title: Court Backs ExConvict in Plea For Hearing on Getting Cafe Job
description: The State Liquor Authority was ordered by the State Su preme Court yesterday to give a full and fair hearing to a former convict who had been barred by the authority from taking a job as a parttime waiter in a restaurant selling alcoholic beverages.

title: KIN OF P.O.W.'S BEAR PLEA FOR AID TO U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 29The families of Amer icans held prisoner in Vietnam came here today with an ap peal for assistance. They de parted 12 hours later with little to comfort them, but vowing to keep trying.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Notes on People
description: Winnie Ruth Judd. con victed of the trunk murder of a friend in 1931 and sen tenced to be hanged, was freed yesterday by the Ari zona Board of Pardons and Paroles.

title: Presidents Elected for Airco and M. Lowenstein
description: Major executive changes were announced yesterday at Airco, Inc., formerly known as the Air Reduction Company, and at M. Lowenstein & Sons, Inc., a leading manufacturer of textiles.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Midway in the 1949 season, Joe DiMaggio left the hospital list after having missed the first 65 games while convalescing from an operation on his heel. In a return action against the onrushing Red Sox, the Yankee Clipper hit four home runs in three games to trigger a Bomber sweep and bolster the sagging fortunes of the Yankees.

title: First Women Seated In Swiss Parliament
description: BERNE, Nov. 29Eleven women were sworn in today as members of Parliament, breaking a male monopoly in the national Government that began with the founding of the Swiss confederation in 1291.

title: U.S. COURT BACKS WAR PAPERS CASE
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29  The United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit ruled to day that a Federal grand jury may resume its investigation of the release of the Pentagon papers under certain restric tions.

title: SCHEEL TALKS FAIL TO BREAK IMPASSE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany ended highlevel dis cussions in Moscow today with out resolving a procedural im passe over the completion of the Berlin accords and ratifica tion of the MoscowBonn treaty of 1970.

title: Troupes Carry On Without Fanfare
description: In a pale zone beyond the lights of Broadway is a branch of the theater that is infrequently heralded yet full of a special zeal. Because it is so little known, it is probably the most neglected opportunity available to theatergoers in the metro politan area.

title: Wood, Field and Stream.
description: ACWORTH, N. H.I had waited without moving for 20 minutes, leaning against a huge boulder on a spruce covered ridge, before the deer moved up through the alders below me.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: SEEKING SUPERIOR LIBERAL ARTS school for son or daughter? Consider ?? College. Write Box 363. Seneen Falls, N. Y, ADVT.

title: Inmate Found Hanged
description: COMMACK, L.I., Nov. 29 An 18yearold inmate of the Suffolk County Jail in River head hanged himself in his cell last night, jail officials said. The prisoner, Vincent Cammarasana of 55 Applegate Drive, Central Islip, had been held in the jail since Oct. 4 on charges of vi olating probation.

title: SECRET ACCORDS REACHED IN CAIRO
description: CAIRO, Tuesday, Nov. 30 The Arab League's Joint De fense Council, convened to discuss cooperative strategy against Israel, adopted secret resolutions during a ninehour meeting that ended at 4:30 this morning.

title: ROY C. ABBOTT
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 29 Roy C. Abbott, former treasurer of Reader's Digest, died today at Stamford Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 23 Fast Lane, Revonnah Woods.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Oil Lease Nominations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reu ters)The Interior Department has asked the oil and gas in dustry to submit nominations for outer continental shelf tracts off the coast of Texas that it would like to see of fered in a possible lease sale late in 1972. The last sale of offshore areas in Texas was in May, 1968.

title: Germany's Trade Surplus Moved Lower in October
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, Nov. 29 (Reuters)West Ger many's trade surplus fell in October to 1,529,000,000 marks from 1,924,000,000 marks in September and 1,712,000,000 marks in October, 1970, the Federal Statistics Office said today.

title: CONTRACT VALUES IN BUILDING RISE
description: Contracts awarded for future construction projects through out the country in October had a total value of $6,567, 695,000, an increase of 20 per cent over the total contract value of $5,457,731,000 a year ago, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Informa tion Systems Company report ed yesterday.

title: Ulster Bank Held Up
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 29 (UPI)Gunmen raided a bank today and a sniper's bullet grazed the head of a British soldier in Belfast in scattered violence in Northern Ireland.

title: Mr. Connally's Opportunity: II
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  It is not enough to suggest, as I did in this space yesterday, that Mr. Nixon's Aug. 15 international moves, and especially Mr. Connally's followup, have brought us to the brink of economic war. The deficit in U.S. payments, and the dollar hemorrhage triggered by divergent monetary policies here and abroad, confronted Washington with a con dition, and one theory too many. Mr. Connally's task has been to treat the condition without taking undue risk. The charge against him is that he has chosen a reckless course, while a safe solution has been ready at hand.

title: Queens Fire Kills Two Boys
description: Two small boys died at noon yesterday when a fire destroyed a building at 13210 Cross Bay Boulevard, in the Ozone Park section of Queens. The victims, 4yearold John Karl and his brother, James, 3, were trapped in a firstfloor rear apartment behind a laundromat, where their mother, Mrs. Margaret Karl, 24, is manager.

title: 400 on Radical Left Gather to Build a National Movement Backed by Workers
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa, Nov. 29 The radical left, divided and isolated during the last few years, took some initial steps this weekend to build a new national movement aimed main ly at winning support from working people.

title: Concert to Honor Dr. Straus
description: A concert in memory of Dr. Oliver Herbert Straus will be held in the Massachusetts Ins titute of Technology in Cam bridge, Mass., Friday at 3:30 P.M, Dr. Straus, whose career in science and business em braced enzyme kinetics, anes thesiology, highaltitude psy chology, physiology, psycho biology, information theory and computer technology, died Oct. 24 in Franconia, N.H., to which he had retired.

title: Nigeria Lawyers in Boycott
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 29 (AP) Nigerian lawyers have voted here not to appear in any courts, starting Dec. 6. They are protesting the jailing by a Government tribunal on a, con tempt charge of Niyi Akintola, a defense lawyer, during the trial of a businessman, Felix Dumeh, and an army lieutenant, Oshiogowerno Usman, accused ??n a payroll robbery.

title: Education of Gifted Held Inadequate
description: A report that the United States Commissioner of Educa tion says confirmed our im pression that schools are pro viding inadequately for the edu cation of America's gifted and talented children has been made public by the Office of Education.

title: Master Kissinger, 10, Annoyed With Ziegler
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)Tenyearold David H. Kissinger, who said that next March was the date for Presi dent Nixon's trip to Peking, is annoyed with the White House press secretary, Ron ald Ziegler, for questioning his credibility.

title: A PoliceEye View Is Seen by Students
description: It was 8:30 P.M. and the patrol car had barely pulled out of the Sixth Precint sta tion when a call to assist a policeman in distress blared over the radio. With the siren wailing, the car sped to the scene. It was a false alarm.

title: Friend Makes Plans in Italy For Adonis Burial Here
description: ANCOMA, Italy, Nov. 29 (AP)Arrangements have been made to have the body of Joe Adonis buried in the United States, which he left 15 years ago to avoid deportation after accusations of being an under world gambling king.

title: 33 ON U.S. COPTER VANISH IN STORM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 30 (AP)A Uni ted States Army helicopter with 33 Americans aboard disap peared over the weekend along the stormswept northern coast of South Vietnam, and a day long air and sea search yester day found no trace of it.

title: Market Place: Wage, Earner's Little Squiggle
description: Albert E. Sindlinger, the grayish, 63yearold opinion sampler who holes up in Swarthmore, Pa., says it's the unsophisticated guy without stockholdings who is best at predicting turns in the mar ket.

title: SILVER FUTURES CLIMB IN PRICE
description: An increase of nearly 2 cents an ounce in the prices of silver futures here yester day in early trading on the Commodity Exchange, Inc., was trimmed by later profit taking.

title: The Agony of the U.S. Army
description: WASHINGTONTo many of our people the Army is a controversial issue. It is not easy to think of that apolitical, proud old body of citizen soldiers in that way. Wars can be controversial and so can generals and weapons, but not the Army.

title: George E. Phillies Dead at 85; GreekAmerican Affairs Expert
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 29George E. Phillies, a leader in Greek American affairs, died Satur day here. He was 85 years old and lived in Eggertsville.

title: PRESIDENT WARNS OF TAX BILL VETO IF ADDITIONS STAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Nixon warned Con gress today that he would veto the tax bill if it contained either the controversial plan to finance Presidential campaigns out of tax funds or what were termed budgetbusting amend ments added by the Senate.

title: SALES ARE VARIED Al 7 CITY STORES
description: The 1971 Christmas shopping season got under way this month on an uncertain note in New York City as seven of the city's largest stores reported widely ranging sales results dur ing November.

title: Fines Aid Paralyzed Player
description: MIAME, Nov. 29 (AP)Larry Csonka and Jim Kiick were fined $200 a day by the Miami Dolphins for a preseason hold out and the money went to night toward an $11,200 dona tion to help a paralyzed high school football star.

title: Attica Jury Picked
description: WARSAW, N. Y., Nov. 29 A 23member grand jury con sisting mostly of farmers and housewives was selected here today to hear the evidence in the Sept. 913 riot at the At tica prison.

title: NURSINGHOME AID FACES U. S. CUTOFF
description: New York State is threat ened with a cutoff in the Fed eral share of Medicaid funds on Dec. 31 for 170 nursing homes, all upstate, on the ground they are not comply ing with regulations issued last year by the Department of Health, Education and Wel fare.

title: GEN. EMIL KIEL, 76, OF AIR FORCE DIES
description: PACIFIC GROVE, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)Brig. Gen. Emil C. Kiel, a retired Air Force officer who in 1947 presided over the United States Military Tribunal in Dachau, West Germany, that sentenced the late Ilse Koch to life imprisonment, died Wednes day at the age of 76.

title: SENATORS SUPPORT AID RISE FOR AGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Senator Russell B. Long, chair man of the Senate Finance Com mittee, told participants in the White House Conference on Aging here today that elderly Americans could already be en joying increased Social Secu rity benefits if it were not for the illadvised welfare expan sion proposed by the President.

title: 18 City HospitalsOrdered To Slash Costs 5% More
description: The city's 18 municipal hos pitals, already hardpressed financially, have been ordered to cut back their programs by 5 per cent.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: WARNING: Ronaid Rabbit Is A Dirty Old Man, a special kind of novel by Lawrence Block, must NOT be read in a waterbed, You'll laugh yourself seasick. $5.95 at Your bkstore.Advt.

title: Tina Turner Sizzles At Beacon Theater In Shift of Mood
description: The thing about Tina Turner is that she knows she's kidding, you know she's kidding, and it doesn't matter.

title: U.S. SEEKS TO END LATIN DRUG FLOW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 John F. Ingersoll, Director of the Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, is visiting Latin America in an attempt to block off major new conduits of heroin and other drugs into the United States.

title: Knight Executives Named
description: AKRON, Ohio, Nov. 29 (UPI) The Knight newspapers an nounced today the appointment of Sam S. McKeel as vice presi dent and general manager of Philadelphia Newspapers, Inc., and William A. Ott as vice president and general manager of The Akron Beacon Journal, succeeding Mr. McKeel, Phila delphia Newspapers publishes The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Philadelphia Daily News.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: THOUGHTFUL GIFT for someone with lim ited vision. The New York Times Large Type Weekly. Call 5561143.

title: A Memorial for Mr. O'Rourke
description: Affable, ebullient, energetic, Maurice J. O'Rourke was more than merely president of the New York City Board of Elections; for many years he was the board, working fulltime at what some considered a parttime job. He could be found from early dawn to late at night during every election period, trying personally to make certain that the local machinery of democracy functioned fairly and smoothly.

title: HOUSE VOTES CURB ON CAMPAIGN COST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The House voted today to impose an $8.4million ceiling on the television and radio spending of each Presidential ticket in the 1972 election.

title: Pancoastal Will Buy Rights To Steam System for Cars
description: Pancoastal, Inc., announced yesterday the acquisition of American manufacturing, mar keting and licensing rights to an Australiandeveloped steam propulsion system for cars,. The company said it had decided to exercise a 1970 option ob tained from Pritchard Steam Power Pty., Ltd., of Melbourne.

title: No Reaction So Far
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 29 An Indian spokesman said to day that there had been no, reaction so far to President Nixon's message. But he added that Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's statement in a speech in Rajasthan state yesterday should be a good indication to all of us.

title: FlyingDrugRunners Reap Big Profits
description: They fly low and slow, by the light of the moon, and make $50,000 a night.

title: Solid South Makes Sullivan Winner
description: Pat Sullivan, the Auburn quarterback who won the Heis man Trophy last week, carried the South by a margin of 391 points over Cornell's Ed Marin aro in the voting for that award, according to figures re leased yesterday by the Down town Athletic Club.

title: Pennsy Deadline Dec. 31, Not Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 29 (AP)The president and board chairman of the Penn Central Company testified today that the company had until Dec. 31 to repay a $55million Swiss loan, although the proxy state ment sent to stockholders said, the note was due tomorrow.

title: BIRMINGHAM ACTION BY E.P.A. IS HAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 An official of the Environmen tal Protection Agency said to day that the agency's inter vention in the recent air pol lution emergency in Birming ham, Ala., set a precedent that will make succeeding ac tions easier and more effective for local authorities.

title: Yablonski Case Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Nov. 29 (UPI)  Mrs. Annette Gilly pleaded not guilty today to charges she was one of five per sons who conspired in the Dec. 31, 1969, slayings of the mine union official Joseph A. Yablon ski, his wife and daughter.

title: Addicts Are Copping Garbage In Face of Drug Shortage Here
description: There's a panic on, said the 19yearold Puerto Rican drug addict. Everyone's cop ping garbage, he told an in terviewer for a Manhattan ad dictrehabilitation program.

title: Court to Expedite Teleprompter Suit
description: The United States Circuit Court of Appeals here agreed yesterday to expedite the ap peal by the Teleprompter Cor poration of a decision by a Fed eral Court judge last week and set Dec. 10 as a date for the hearing. Ordinarily the appeal would take about 90 days.

title: Namath Gets More Treatment
description: Joe Namath received more treatment at Shea Stadium yesterday, but it wasn't quite the same as the beatific treat ment he received from the fans Sunday when he elec trified them with his first ap pearance in 20 games.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company an nounced yesterday the appointment of Darrell D. Eichhoff as executive vice president and Paul H. Knies as senior vice president and controller, effec tive Dec. 1.

title: Hijacker Convicted
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 29 (UPI)  Glen E. Riggs, a 58 yearold unemployed West Vir ginia coal miner, was convicted today in Federal District Court of the June 4 hijacking of United Airlines jet. The plane, on a flight from Charleston, W. Va., to Newark, N. J., landed for refueling at Dulles Interna tional Airport near Washington, where Riggs was overpowered and taken into custody. He faces a minimum of 20 years' imprisonment and a maximum of life in prison.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Those who participated seem happy enough with a preliminary bull session between representatives of the more liberal Democratic Presidential candidates. The meeting last Sunday nevertheless showed how hard it will be to devise any effective cooperative measures in the campaign season to come.

title: COAST COLLEGES TO CHANGE NAME
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 29  California's 19 publicly supported state colleges won the legal right to be called eventually California state universities when Gov. Ronald Reagan signed the bill in his office today.

title: Man in the News
description: Dr. William Gordon Bowen, named yesterday as the next president of Princeton Uni versity, is probably the only provost of an Ivy League in stitution ever to rescue a woman from a pond full of live alligators. It happened last spring on Hilton Head Island off the coast of South Carolina, where the lanky, 38  year  old Dr. Bowen  still as trim as when he played champion ship tennis as a student at Denison Universitywas meeting with the heads of major foundations.

title: Kennedy, Chief of N.B.A., Granted Broader Powers
description: A major increase in authority has been granted Commissioner Walter Kennedy as part of the National Basketball Associa tion's adoption of a new con stitution and bylaws, the league announced yesterday.

title: MAUD PETERSHAM, CHILDREN'S AUTHOR
description: Mrs. Maud Fuller Petersham, writer and illustrator of chil dren's books, died yesterday in Ravenna, Ohio, while on a visit there. She was 82 years old and lived in Woodstock, N.Y.

title: Tekoah, in Interview, Criticizes Egyptian Military Adventurism
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 29With the United Na tions debate on the Middle East approaching, Israel's chief dele gate has grown too busy to take his usual horseback rides in Central Park.

title: 4 Gunmen Invade Yonkers Armory, Flee With Arms
description: YONKERS, Nov. 29Four men dressed in military cloth ing and armed with pistols and rifles invaded the New York State Armory on North Broad way here this afternoon and escaped with eight M16 semi automatic rifles and 3,000 rounds of ammunition.

title: China Condemns the Incursions by India
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 29  Li lisiennien, a Chinese Deputy Premier; condemned India today for incursions into East Paki stan and reaffirmed support for the Pakistanis in their dispute with India over the East Ben gali independence movement.

title: Anniversary for Exchange
description: Frederick C. Lowenfels, president of Hotel Bar Foods, Inc., has been named chairman of the 100th Anniversary Com mittee of the New York Mer cantile Exchange, trader in commodity futures, which will celebrate the anniversary in 1972. Llewellyn Watts Jr., the exchange's chairman, and Rich ard B. Levine, its president, will help Mr. Lowenfels in the coordination of the anniversary arrangements, among other committee members.

title: Price Board Grants Ford Average Increase of 2.9%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 The Price Commission approved today an average price increase of 2.9 per cent for cars, trucks and equipment produced by the Ford Motor Company.

title: HIGH FRENCH OFFICIAL LEAVING POLICE JOB
description: PARIS, Nov. 29 (AP)  The top investigative police officer in France will retire next month in a development that appears directly related to AmericanFrench friction over how to cut off the flow of narcotics from Marseilles to the United States.

title: Charges of Poor Vaccine Regulation Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  A federally appointed scientific committee rejected today charges of inefficiency and in competence made last month against the Government agency regulating vaccines.

title: Whale Doomed, Ecologists Say, But Industry Sees Fear as Myth
description: TOKYOThe 518 crewmen of Kyokuyo Maru No. 3, one of the world's largest whal ing factory ships, were led in a banzai cheer. Then, as the shipas long as two football fieldswas tugged from its berth at Chiba, on Tokyo Bay, colored stream ers stretched between the crewmen and their families, whom they would not see for the six months they will spend in the Antarctic.

title: Chrysler Gets Contract
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reuters)The Chrysler Cor poration is receiving a $47 million Army contract for work on M60A1 and M60A2 tanks, the Pentagon announced today.

title: Collins Radio Executive Cancels His Resignation
description: W. W. Roodhouse, who re signed as executive vice presi dent and a director of the Col lins Radio Company a week ago, has rejoined the company in the same management post. Robert C. Wilson, who became presi dent and chief executive officer last Tuesday, made the an nouncement.

title: Skating and Medicine: Is There a Link?
description: In the beginning, it was like this: Get up at 4 A.M., wolf down a high protein breakfast of steak or chicken, and then drive to the ice rink for a couple hours' practice before school. And then more practice after school, and more practice, and more practice

title: CON EDISON DEFIES POLLUTION ORDER
description: The Consolidated Edison Company has openly defied a city airpollution ruling that ordered a cutback in the use of the utility's coalfired boiler at Arthur Kill on Staten Is land.

title: N.B.C. to Show Kennedy Vietnam Role
