description: The involvement of the Ken nedy Administration in the Vietnamese war is to be ex amined by the National Broad casting Company in a twopart documentary to be seen on the evenings of Dec, 21 and Dec. 22.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AMEX, COUNTER POST SHARP GAINS
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter mar ket made their third consecutive advance yesterday as prices climbed sharply in steppedup trading.

title: Carolina Marchers Seized In Protest Against Slaying
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Nov. 29 (UPI)The police arrested 75 civil rights activists today for defying a local parade ordi nance by setting out on a weeklong march to Raleigh.

title: U.S. in Plea to India, Pakistan and Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 President Nixon has sent per sonal messages to India, Paki stan and the Soviet Union urging an end to the fighting along the IndiaPakistan bor der, the State Department an nounced today.

title: Jurists Ask Data on Mujib
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29The In ternational Commission of Jur ists denounced today what it termed the complete shroud of secrecy surrounding the fate of Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the East Pakistani leader, since the announcement in August that he was being tried by a special military court. The Genevabased private group called on the Pakistani Govern ment to publish details about the trial.

title: TORIES AMENABLE TO IRELAND TALKS
description: LONDON, Nov. 29 The British Government today wel comed the Opposition's pro posals for talks that could lead to a united Ireland.

title: Mechanic on Coast Guilty of Killing 5 In OneMan War
description: REDWOOD, Calif., Nov. 29 An automobile mechanic was convicted today on five counts of first degree murder in the slayings 13 Months ago of a prominent Santa Cruz eye sur geon and four other persons.

title: Thieves Invaded a Bronx School Each Night of Holiday Weekend
description: Parents at Public School 140 in the Southeast Bronx were still working yesterday to re store what they could of the damage done by five succes sive nights of breakins by thieves and vandals over the Thanksgiving weekend.

title: Yahya Seeks U. N. Observers
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Tuesday, Nov. 30 (Agence FrancePresse) President Yahya Khan of Pakistan has proposed to Sec retary General Thant that the United Nations station observ ers on the Pakistani side of the IndiaPakistan border to report on border violations, the Pakistan radio said last night.

title: WESTERNERS SEE KOSYGIN ON TRADE
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29 Soviet American trade remained a fo cus of attention in Moscow to day as more than 100 business executives met with Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin and dis cussions continued between Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stang and Soviet officials.

title: NIXON CHINA VISIT TO START FEB. 21; MAY LAST A WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Nixon's visit to China, the first there by a United States chief of state, will begin on Feb. 21, the White House announced today.

title: SOPRANO AND MEZZO SING OPERATIC DUOS
description: Marjorie Janzen, soprano, and Kathe Schoenberg, mezzo, shared a program Sunday after noon in Carnegie Recital Hall. Both singers rejoice in large, healthy voices that blend lus ciously. They tended to over whelm the Purcell and Mendels sohn duets a bit, but this gener ous approach was eminently suited to the operatic duos by Puccini and Nicolai.

title: U.S. Officials Praise Initiative Of Widow Who Won Own Case
description: The Circuit Court decision in favor of a 69yearold widow who conducted her own case against the Social Security Administration ought to be made up into a plaque to hang on the walls of public agencies trapped in their own rules.

title: Princeton Provost Named President
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 29  William G. Bowen, a 38 yearold economist who has served as provost of Princeton University since 1967, was named president of Princeton today.

title: MERRICK IMPORTS FEYDEAU'S COMEDY
description: David Merrick's first Broad way show of the season will be the Stratford National Theater of Canada's production of There's One in Every Mar riage, the George Feydeau comedy opening Jan. 3 at the Royale Theater.

title: The Theater: Malcolm X
description: Political theater at its most fascinating is now to be found at the Martinique The ater, where last night the AfroAmerican Studio from Harlem brought its intellec tually and emotionally pro vocative production of El Hajj MalikThe Dramatic Life and Death of Mal colm X. It is a great tribute to the assassinated leader America wants to know least about.

title: Adoption Aid Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI) Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, Intro duced legislation today that would allow taxpayers to de duct up to $1,500 for expenses incurred in adopting a child.

title: RACING WILL SIFT OFFTRACK BETTING
description: Offtrack betting will be a major topic here today when members of the Thoroughbred Racing Associations get down to business at the 30th annual convention. However, an offi cial of the Offtrack Betting Corporation of New York said nobody from O.T.B. had been invited.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 Yields on United States Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: McCloskey Charges G.O.P. Backs Influence of Wealth
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 29 (AP)Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr. charged tonight that the Nixon Administration had welcomed and encouraged concentrations of wealth that secretly influenced govern mental decisions and supported political candidates.

title: Garrison Wins Point
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 29 (AP)A special state pros ecutor who tried to charge District Attorney Jim Garrison with malfeasance was over ruled today, leaving Mr. Gar rison facing Federal charges in a longstanding gamblingbri bery case. Judge Malcolm V. O'Hara of Criminal District Court said the special pros ecutor he had appointed, Ben jamin E. Smith, had no author ity to lodge new charges against Mr. Garrison. Mr. Gar rison has not been indicted on the Federal charges, which were lodged last June.

title: BILL RATES POST A SHARP DECLINE
description: Reassured that the Federal Reserve was not intending to cross up the Government securities market, traders bid aggressively for Treasury bills yesterday and forced a sharp decline in rates.

title: MICHAEL RAVIK
description: Michael Ravik, an actor and dramatic coach, who was executive director of the Cell Block Theater Workshop, which strives to rehabilitate convicts through the theater arts, died Thursday of a heart attack in Elmhurst, Queens. He was 4.0 years old and lived in the Bronx,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Assassination in Cairo
description: The assassination of Premier Wasfi Tal of Jordan is a serious blow to King Hussein, whom Mr. Tal had served with extraordinary determination and devotion, if not always with perfect wisdom.

title: Jury Unable to Reach a Verdict In First Kent State Riot Trial
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Nov. 29 The jury deciding the case of the first man to face trial for complicity in the Kent State University riots. Last year was unable to reach a verdict today after more than five hours of deliberation. The jurors were sent home shortly after 5 P.M. and will try again tomorrow.

title: Teamster Official Accused Of Taking Loan Kickbacks
description: A teamster union official was indicted by a Federal grand jury here yesterday on charges of receiving cash kickbacks to ar range mortgage loans from the union's welfare fund to a con struction company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stock Split Is Approved
description: Stockholders of the Westing house Electric Corporation ap proved at a special meeting yesterday in Pittsburgh a two forone split and authorized an increase in the number of com mon shares to make the move possible. As a result of the ac tion, the company will now have 120 million shares author ized of which approximately 100 million will be outstanding.

title: Bus Crash Fatal to 7 L.I Pupils Ascribed Partly to Official Laxity
description: Federal investigators released yesterday a critical 61page re port on the July, 1970, bus ac cident near Allentown, Pa., that killed seven Long Island young sters. They called for sweeping reforms to improve safety in the nation's charter bus indus try.

title: Deadline Extended For Aged on Rent
description: The deadline for elderly persons to file for partial ex emptions to present rents was extended yesterday from midnight tonight until Fri day by Rent and Housing Maintenance Commissioner Benjamin Altman. He acted as thousands of old people thronged district rent offices, despite the rain, to fill out formidable application forms.

title: JFK Ends Its Run
description: JFK, the stage biography based on the public years of John F. Kennedy, closed on Sunday at the Circle in the Square after nine performances. Jeremiah Collins played the late President in the oneman show. Another Off Broadway presen tation, Where Has Tommy Flowers Gone?, by Terence McNally, will end its run at the Eastside Playhouse on Dec. 12 after 78 performances.

title: Treasurer Nominee Denies She Knew Of Illegal Aliens
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI Mrs. Romana Acosta Bantle os, President Nixon's nominee to be Treasurer of the United States, testified today that she had been unaware that her food factory employed illegal Mexican aliens until Federal agents raided it and seized 36 of them Oct. 5.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 0.1% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 27 edged ahead by 0.1 per cent to 1,868, 000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This compared with 1,866,000 tons in the preceding week.

title: MAJOR ACCORD SETS NATURALGAS SWAP
description: The National Chemical Cor poration, a diversified natural gas and oil company, an nounced yesterday in Louisville, Ky., an agreement with the Tennessee Gas Pipeline Com pany, a division of Tenneco, Inc., for a 15year naturalgas exchange contract.

title: Patrolman Who Fought Orders Is Tried for 12 Rule Infractions
description: John Bal, the city patrolman who has battled the depart ment over the length of his hair and the location of his assignments, was back before a departmental trial yesterday this time charged with refusing an order to see a psychiatrist, riding in uniform in a private car and, most seriously, giving a ride to two young women in a police car.

title: Aides Says U.S. Is Ready For Concessions in Panama
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI) The United States said today that it was prepared, in a new Panama Canal treaty, to make some jurisdictional and com mercial concessions to Panama in the United Statesadminis trated Canal Zone, but without affecting American interests there.

title: NASSAU SALES TAX RAISED TO 7 CENTS
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 29 A 1cent increase in the Nassau County sales tax, to become effective March 1, was ap proved unanimously today by the Board of Supervisors.

title: Finance Chief Named Jordan's Premier
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 29 King Hussein appointed a new Premier today with instructions to pursue the same policy as Premier Wasfi Tal, who was assassinated in Cairo yesterday.

title: ObscenityReport Seller Acquitted Here
description: A Criminal Court jury ac quitted the proprietor of a Madison Avenue bookshop yes terday of a charge of promot ing obscenity by selling copies of The Illustrated Presidential Report of the Commission on Obscenity and Pornography.

title: N.H.L. Target of $33Million Trust Suit
description: Charging that the National Hockey League had con nived and conspired to de stroy the rival World Hockey Association's New York fran chise, Neil T. Shayne filed a $33million suit yesterday against the league, its 14 teams and their owners.

title: ARRAU'S PROFUNDITY AT PIANO IMPRESSIVE
description: Very few pianists ever reach the peak of artistry from which Claudio Arrau functions. One has come to take Mr. Arrau's startling virtuosity and bron zen tone for granted over the years, but now the penetrating profundity and serene maturity of his interpretations are posi tively humbling.

title: CITY AND FIREMEN RESUME TALKS
description: Negotiations resumed last night after a fourday holiday recess in an effort to resolve the 11month contract dispute between the city and the Uni formed Firefighters Association.

title: 2 U.S. HELICOPTERS DOWNED IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 30 (AP) The United States command re ported today that two Ameri can observation helicopters had been shot down over the week end during heavy fighting in the Central Highlands of South Vietnam. Four crewmen were reported wounded.

title: ABBOTT HAMILTON OF SOLVENTS FIRM
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Nov. 29 Abbott K. Hamilton, a vice president of Commercial Sol vents Corporation from 1949 to 1954, died today at his home here. He was 71 years old.

title: Stocks Continue to Rally As Dow Climbs by 13.14
description: The stock market rally continued in high gear yesterday as prices swept upward in the heaviest trading since the August surge that was ignited by President Nixon's speech announcing his new economic policy.

title: Bathroom Gifts Packaging Foes Would Adore
description: Fruit salad soap. Apple cologne. Bath tea. If it's back to nature in the kitchen, why not in the bathroom? The Julia Child behind a new array of bath goodies labeled Apothecare is Amelia Bassin, who in her 21 years as Faberge's creative vice presi dent, set the beauty industry agog with startlers such as polkadotted fingernails or perfumes in oil cans. Last year, Mrs. Bassin formed her own agency, Bassinnova, which she describes as a rentabrain service.

title: Richard Baiter Dies at 57; Lever Brothers Executive
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 29 Richard Englis Baiter, a vice president of Lever Brothers of New York City, died Saturday at his home here. He was 57 years old.

title: SURGING KNICKS TO MISS MONROE
description: Earl Monroe, who has been playing less and less for the Knicks in recent games, will not play at all tonight when New York carries its seven game winning streak against the Seattle Supersonics at Madison Square Garden.

title: News Analysis
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 28Most everything they say in Wash ington about Indians they say in New Delhi about Americans: arrogant, undependable, ob sessed with their own problems, shortsighted and not really very clever for such a big country.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Is anyone else tired of hearing about the evils of litter? Litter may be a nuisance. All right. Litter may be bad in a minor way. So what? Who amongst us is not? Should we, for that reason, be reviled on the radio between Mozart and Mahler? Be the object of police warnings beside every highway, great and small? Be denounced on televi sion, in subway and bus, on vast illu minated billboards, in newspaper ads? Be legislated against by state and local governments?

title: Ford Is Licensed To Study the Use Of Wankel Engine
description: DETROIT, Nov. 29 (UPI), The Ford Motor Company, fol lowing the General Motors Cor poration, has signed a license agreement to explore the de velopment of the Wankel ro tary engine, it was announced today.

title: Static on the Phone Line
description: The twentyweek strike of installers, linemen and maintenance employes against the New York Telephone Company has turned into a fight to smash any semblance of wage controls.

title: F. B.I. Operating Computerized Criminal Data Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Federal Bureau of Investigation began operation today of a computerized criminal history data bank that will eventually give the police almost instan taneous access to an individ ual's criminal arrest record front any state and from Fed eral investigative agencies and courts.
